name: Great location.
summary: Great location in Chicago's Wicker Park/Bucktown community. Fully furnished living room, bedroom with queen bed and bathroom.  Internet, central heating/ac, small refrigerator, microwave, cable TV, dvd/Blu-ray, coffee maker.  Small safe.  Private free parking. One block from blue line (Division). From O’Hare via train – 35 min.  10 min to the city via blue line.

name: 1 Private Bedroom 10 minutes away from the beach
summary: You will be sharing this apartment with a young professional. It’s a private room that sleeps two people I also have an air bed. Located on the south side of Chicago less than 15 minutes away from the beach, 5 minutes away from the University of Chicago, 1 block away from the train, and near plenty of restaurants. The bathroom and kitchen are shared spaces that comes with pots pans, and towels. Also, no pets allowed.
space: Guest can use the balcony, kitchen, living room, bathroom, and the private room.
description: You will be sharing this apartment with a young professional. It’s a private room that sleeps two people I also have an air bed. Located on the south side of Chicago less than 15 minutes away from the beach, 5 minutes away from the University of Chicago, 1 block away from the train, and near plenty of restaurants. The bathroom and kitchen are shared spaces that comes with pots pans, and towels. Also, no pets allowed. Guest can use the balcony, kitchen, living room, bathroom, and the private room. I am available to guest as long as we are home (you can also text me through the app or use the number on file). I know a lot about Chicago due to being born and raised here. I love food and spreading knowledge to visitors. I’d recommend the train all day. It’s very simple and cheaper and faster than Uber when you want to go downtown. However, for safety reasons avoid the trains late night. I will be checking I.Ds upon check-in for safety reasons.
notes: I will be checking I.Ds upon check-in for safety reasons.

house_rules: -I expect you will respect my home.  - Picking up after yourself in common areas is important. - I’m FIRM with quiet time after 10PM on weeknights, as I work early in the morning. - No eating meals in the bedroom - snacks/munchies are OK. - Absolutely NO unregistered guests without prior approval.  - Absolutely NO drugs of any kind - alcohol is OK.  - Absolutely NO smoking in the house and if you do smoke outside, please be courteous and clean up your butts/ash.  - Due to severe allergies I do not allow any animals in the house.  - Please always lock the front door when you leave and be courteous to the neighbors.  - If anything breaks, spills, stains, etc. please let me know ASAP.  - Unreturned and/or lost house keys will be charged a $150 replacement fee.  - Any significant damage will result in the loss of security deposit. -No shoes on the area rug
host_about: Super funny young professionals enjoying our lives in the Windy City. If you need help with your itinerary Raheem (the co-host) or myself will be glad to assist you with that.

name: Walk to the Mag Mile from a High-Rise Apartment
summary: Fix breakfast in a classic kitchen with crisp granite countertops and dine at a casual glass table in an open layout. At sunset, step out onto the balcony and enjoy a glass of wine with a friend whilst taking in sweeping views of the city. Our pool is outdoor and is open seasonally from Memorial Day to Labor Day (weather permitting). You must be 25 or older to book this space. Parking is not included in the cost of your stay. There is parking in the garage on the bottom floor but guests are responsible for the cost. A parking pass will need to be purchased.
space: See what city living is all about with a stay at this first-class suite on the 39th floor of Chicago's Grand Plaza. Bursting with superb community amenities, including a heated pool, a state-of-the-art fitness center, and a fully stocked library, this excellent vacation rental also boasts an exquisite view of the city skyline and an unbeatable location right in the heart of the Windy City. Perched on the corner of State Street and Grand Avenue, the Grand Plaza lies just three blocks from Chicago's famous Magnificent Mile. Home to hundreds of name-brand stores, restaurants, and some of the greatest museums in America, you'll have the very best of Chicago right at your fingertips. You'll also be just a few minutes from the Loop district, allowing you to reach that business meeting or important client dinner with minimal stress! After a full day out on the town, retire back to the Grand Plaza to explore its 50,000 square feet of spectacular views and incredible community amenities. Admire
description: Fix breakfast in a classic kitchen with crisp granite countertops and dine at a casual glass table in an open layout. At sunset, step out onto the balcony and enjoy a glass of wine with a friend whilst taking in sweeping views of the city. Our pool is outdoor and is open seasonally from Memorial Day to Labor Day (weather permitting). You must be 25 or older to book this space. Parking is not included in the cost of your stay. There is parking in the garage on the bottom floor but guests are responsible for the cost. A parking pass will need to be purchased.
neighborhood_overview: This dog-friendly apartment is set in a high-rise building in downtown Chicago, a stone's throw away from an array of shopping and dining along the iconic Magnificent Mile. Dozens of historic sites, museums, and attractions are a short walk away.
house_rules: - The responsible renter must be at least 25 years of age to book. Guests under 25 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian for the duration of the reservation. - 2 dog(s) are welcome in this home. No other animals are allowed without specific Vacasa approval. - The property shall not be used by more than the number of adults and children listed in your reservation. - All guests shall abide by Vacasa’s good neighbor policy and shall not engage in illegal activity. Quiet hours are from 10 p.m. to 8 a.m. - If early check-in is available for your reservation, you will be notified by 9am on the morning of your arrival by email. Late check-out is offered whenever possible for a small fee. - No smoking of any kind is permitted anywhere on the premises. - No commercial photography or filming is permitted on the property. Tents or other structures may not be erected. - Renter is liable for any damage to the property and agrees to accept charges to the card on file should damage occur
host_about: Hi, we’re Vacasa, North America’s largest vacation rental management company. Owners of vacation homes around the world trust us to deliver exceptional service throughout your entire vacation. Professional housekeepers clean and stock each home, and our customer care team is available around the clock—with a local property manager ready to show up and help out. We like to think we offer the best of both worlds: you can enjoy a one-of-a-kind vacation experience in a unique property, without compromising on service and convenience. Check out our listings, and get in touch if you have any questions. Your vacation is our full-time job, and we'd love to help you plan your perfect getaway.

name: Sonder | Wrigley Field | Stunning 4BR + Balcony
summary: We want everyone to have a comfortable place to stay. Our digital check-in and the ability to manage your stay from our app, means you won't need to interact with anyone in person. Our staff has been trained in proper disinfection techniques and will deep clean your Sonder before and after your stay. We're here for you during this time of uncertainty and can be reached 24/7 via text or call. Named the most innovative travel company of 2019 by Fast Company, Sonder has hosted a million guests in 5,000+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.   - 24/7 support via text, email, or phone   - Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided   - Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive   - Self check-in

neighborhood_overview: Standing proud as one of Chicago's most vibrant neighborhoods, Wrigleyville is home to Wrigley Field and the Chicago Cubs. The neighborhood is situated in the Lakeview community, an area that caters more toward college students, young professionals and die-hard baseball fans. Because Wrigleyville is bordered by Lake Michigan, the city has far more to offer than just sports-themed bars and eateries. For families who favor grand views, public parks and lakefront activities, a day at Lake Michigan will never disappoint.
notes: There is no elevator.
house_rules: House Rules 1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance. 2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival. 3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses. 4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city. 5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages. 6. Commercial photography/videogr

All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

name: Private Room w/ Bath near U of C
summary: Renovated 2 bed/2 bath condo in Hyde Park Neighborhood.  Very sunny private room with attached private bath.
space: This is a two bedroom two bathroom condo in the Hyde Park neighborhood of Chicago.  This fully renovated condo is located on the third floor with no elevator.  The block is quiet and has plenty of free street parking available.
description: Renovated 2 bed/2 bath condo in Hyde Park Neighborhood.  Very sunny private room with attached private bath. This is a two bedroom two bathroom condo in the Hyde Park neighborhood of Chicago.  This fully renovated condo is located on the third floor with no elevator.  The block is quiet and has plenty of free street parking available. Bedroom Private Bathroom Kitchen/Living Room Free street parking in front of house Both my sister and I currently live in the condo so you may run into us from time to time. We keep to ourselves for the most part but if you have any questions about the condo/city/neighborhood we are happy to help. This Hyde Park condo is located within walking distance of all that Hyde Park has to offer.  On 53rd street you can find restaurants, shopping, and the neighborhood Harper movie theater.  The University of Chicago and U of C Medical Center are only a 13 minute walk.  In this area you will also find the neighborhood ice rink and bowling alley. There is a Walgreen
neighborhood_overview: This Hyde Park condo is located within walking distance of all that Hyde Park has to offer.  On 53rd street you can find restaurants, shopping, and the neighborhood Harper movie theater.  The University of Chicago and U of C Medical Center are only a 13 minute walk.  In this area you will also find the neighborhood ice rink and bowling alley. There is a Walgreens within 3 blocks. For a day at the beach or a walk along Lake Michigan's Lakefront path take a 20 min walk east. Other nearby points of interest include Promotory Point Park, Lakeshore Drive, and the Museum of Science and Industry.
transit: There is a large amount of free parking in front of the house. 13 Minute walk to the University of Chicago. Several bus routes within walking distance (example bus route 4,3, and 15). Fifteen min walk to Metra Hyde Park Orange line station, it is a 20 min ride to Millennium Park from this stop.  Uber also services this area.
access: Bedroom Private Bathroom Kitchen/Living Room Free street parking in front of house
interaction: Both my sister and I currently live in the condo so you may run into us from time to time. We keep to ourselves for the most part but if you have any questions about the condo/city/neighborhood we are happy to help.
house_rules: No smoking No pets Be considerate of our neighbors (volume control especially between 11pm-8am) Please leave shoes at the entrance
host_about: Easy going traveler. Originally from Arizona, currently living in Chicago.

name: Discounted Rates! Charming Logan Square w/Backyard
summary: *Please note our increased safety measures  in "Other things to note"  Stay in the heart of Logan Square! Feel at home in this updated brick rowhouse on a quiet, tree-lined street. You'll be steps away from the California Blue Line, Palmer Square, and trendy bars and restaurants. Enjoy a beautifully landscaped private backyard and spacious kitchen. About us: We've lived in Logan Square for nearly 15 years. We love our neighborhood and look forward to sharing our recommendations with you!
description: *Please note our increased safety measures  in "Other things to note"  Stay in the heart of Logan Square! Feel at home in this updated brick rowhouse on a quiet, tree-lined street. You'll be steps away from the California Blue Line, Palmer Square, and trendy bars and restaurants. Enjoy a beautifully landscaped private backyard and spacious kitchen. About us: We've lived in Logan Square for nearly 15 years. We love our neighborhood and look forward to sharing our recommendations with you! The entire rowhouse is yours to enjoy including a private backyard! Self check-in is super easy with our state of the art digital home locks.  While you are in Chicago, we are available on an as-needed basis, just a quick phone call or text away if anything comes up, or you need a tip on the best place to grab a bite, see a show, or regarding transportation. "Boasting gorgeous boulevards and a constantly expanding selection of restaurants and bars, Logan Square is one of the city's trendiest neighborho
neighborhood_overview: "Boasting gorgeous boulevards and a constantly expanding selection of restaurants and bars, Logan Square is one of the city's trendiest neighborhoods, balancing family-friendly amenities with a thriving nightlife. Walk along Milwaukee Avenue and you'll find cocktail bars and gastropubs as well as dive bars and late night eateries, all packed with young crowds watching local bands or playing vintage arcade games. The variety of diversions present in Logan Square attracts record lovers, musicians, pinball wizards and dining aficionados to this scenic section of Chicago." - TimeOut Chicago
notes: There is no higher priority for us than the health and safety of our guests, staff and co-hosts. During this unique time in travel Open House Hospitality is taking extra precautions to prevent the spread of the Covid 19 virus. We want you to feel confident when inhabiting one of our properties. As a result, we have enhanced some of our cleaning procedures in the interest of everyone's health and safety. In conjunction with the director of our cleaning team we've come up with the following additional measures beyond our standard cleaning to help ensure the safety of everyone who enters our properties. All surfaces are being wiped down with disinfectant after each guest with special attention being paid to door handles, pulls, remote controls and other often touched surfaces, all linens and towels are being washed with both detergent and bleach and we are misting the entire home with Lysol disinfecting spray in between each group of guests to help mitigate any airborne pathogens. Even wi
transit: The California Blue Line provides easy access to O'hare airport, downtown, and the Northwest Metra line. Free street parking is available nearby. Our home is just off the beautiful boulevard system and close to the 606 trail - providing miles of walking, running, and biking paths.
access: The entire rowhouse is yours to enjoy including a private backyard!
interaction: Self check-in is super easy with our state of the art digital home locks. name: Southern Room in McKinley Park guest suite
summary: This is a single room in a guest suite with another tenant in the up and coming McKinley Park neighborhood.
space: You are sharing a 2 bedroom guest suite with another guest. You will have your own room.
description: This is a single room in a guest suite with another tenant in the up and coming McKinley Park neighborhood. You are sharing a 2 bedroom guest suite with another guest. You will have your own room. You will have the 2 bedroom apartment, with a kitchenette, dining nook, and living room. You'll also have access to a back deck where smoking is welcome. You generally won't see me, but I live downstairs and am available to help or answer questions if needed. McKinley Park is a diverse, family oriented neighborhood, convenient to downtown and trendy neighborhoods like Pilsen, Bronzeville, and Bridgeport. There is a Mariano's grocery, a Target, and other amenities within a ten minute walk.  The neighbors are friendly, and most of my neighbors have impressive flower or vegetable gardens (I try to keep up). One City Tap on Archer is the nearest bar, a really neat place with a diverse clientele that opened recently. Great place to watch the Cubs, Sox, or Bears, or Blackhawks and enjoy a cold brew
neighborhood_overview: McKinley Park is a diverse, family oriented neighborhood, convenient to downtown and trendy neighborhoods like Pilsen, Bronzeville, and Bridgeport. There is a Mariano's grocery, a Target, and other amenities within a ten minute walk.  The neighbors are friendly, and most of my neighbors have impressive flower or vegetable gardens (I try to keep up). One City Tap on Archer is the nearest bar, a really neat place with a diverse clientele that opened recently. Great place to watch the Cubs, Sox, or Bears, or Blackhawks and enjoy a cold brew. Lindy's Chili, La Palapa, Huck Finn Diner, are all excellent local fooderies. The famous Maria's Bar in nearby Bridgeport is a 15 minute walk or 5 minute bike ride. AND, we have the best video and DVD store EVER just a few short blocks away, as is the new trendy Marz Taproom. The White Sox stadium is close, and you can get to Wrigley Field by taking the Orange Line to the Red Line (estimated 30-45 minutes depending on how the trains run).
notes: I live in the downstairs apartment.
transit: The Orange Line (Archer or Damen) is a 10 minute walk. The ARcher Bus (62) comes within a 30 second walk and goes downtown and connects quickly to the Orange and Red lines.
access: You will have the 2 bedroom apartment, with a kitchenette, dining nook, and living room. You'll also have access to a back deck where smoking is welcome.
interaction: You generally won't see me, but I live downstairs and am available to help or answer questions if needed.
house_rules: Quiet time between 10PM and 7AM (no noise that escapes your room/suite) Adjust heat or cooling a few degrees as needed, but please don't turn thermostat above 75 degrees in the cold months (October-April) or below 75 in the warm months (April-Sept).
host_about:
I'm a writer and radio producer who travels frequently. Travel and work tend to go together for me, and usually, I like to find a quiet place with a small desk and the internet to catch up on work. I do like to take breaks for conversation, and enjoy knowing a little about the neighborhood I'm staying.  I'm proficient but not fluent in Spanish. 

As a host, I have a cute, quaint apartment in Chicago that I like to rent out if I'm traveling that weekend. I'm conscientious and considerate, and also REALLY appreciate clean and considerate guests.

name: 05c. Twin Futon in Common Space
summary: This is a twin futon in the upstairs Common Room.  There may be up to 5 other people booked in this room. Guests with more than one suitcase or one large backpack should not book this ad. Storage space is extremely limited. Breakfast is included in your stay. We keep the pantry stocked with eggs, bacon, milk, orange juice, jam, bread, fruit, pancake mix, coffee and tea. Any of these items can be used to make yourself breakfast in the morning.
space: This ad is for a twin futon in a shared common room that might have up to 5 other people sharing the room. This room has NO DOOR. The space is a common area where guests can congregate during daylight, and it is adjacent to the kitchen so around 7 to 8 am people DO tend to start cooking. Quiet time is after 10pm so you don't have to stay up waiting for people. There is one small closet in this space. All personal belongings must be stowed during the day.  Require privacy?  Let me know, I have other options for those willing to spend a little more.  The two levels of our home are set up as individual apartments. The bedrooms and living rooms have spaces rented out to guests. Your hosts also live on-site. During the day, the living rooms are common areas. Guests are free to hang out, watch TV or play video games. There are 3 permanent cats (Dresden, Margot, and Tigger). We also occasionally foster cats for the local shelter. Please keep this in mind if you are allergic or have a fear of

Let me know, I have other options for those willing to spend a little more.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is quiet on the far north side of Chicago.  The neighborhood is diverse.  It's one of the lowest crime areas of Chicago.  There are many great restaurants in the area, from Senegalese to Thai to Pizza.  I will happily make recommendations if asked.
notes: This is an AirBnB house. There can be quite a few people here at any given time across listings. If you are not comfortable with communal living, this is not the place for you. In order to provide the best service possible, please note that if you set a check in time, we reserve the right to charge you $3.75 for every 15 minutes you are late. Please help us by sticking to your schedule.
transit: 1.1 miles to nearest train station. 45-75 min to downtown. My house to O’Hare in 60 minutes via bus/train and a single transfer. 35$ from my house to O’Hare by flat rate cab. 6$ from the nearest train stop to my house by cab $2.25 from ANY eL stop in Chicago to the Red Line train stop by my house
access: Guests have access to their own shared sleeping space, as well as the common areas (living rooms, bathrooms, kitchens) on both levels of the building. We have a backyard space for people to hang out and smoke. The basement is off limits to guests.
interaction: We work from home, and are typically around for at least part of the day. We are happy to interact with guests and sometimes make trips downtown with them. We try to be mindful of guests who prefer privacy. The best way to contact your hosts is via Airbnb messaging. The Airbnb messages are received by all the hosts simultaneously, and will allow one of us to assist you more quickly.
house_rules: Luggage Storage and Check In Times must be arranged at least 24 hours in advance. Otherwise, check in times are subject to our schedule and may involve waits up to 4 hours from the time you say you would like to be checked in Luggage Storage and Early Check In are subject to availability.   We meet all new guests personally and do a tour and answer questions.  Due to this, it's important to us that you do not wait for us, and we do not wait for you.  Alterations or arriving late to check in times may be subject to a 15 per hour charge to pay an employee to sit around and wait for you.  In some cases, you may have to wait for a few hours for someone to be free to check you in if you change your time last minute to go explore, eat, drink, or visit friends.    If you have provided your flight/train/bus information and we can confirm it was delayed no charges will apply for being late and we’ll make it work.   Quiet time is after 10pm.  What this means is the upstairs common area is off li
host_about:
Hello!  This is Joe, Alex, and sometimes Rob.  If you stay here we will be your hosts while here in Chicago.   

We are Superhosts not because we have a 5 star luxury property, but because we just about always deliver on what we offer.  The best value in Chicago at this price point doing mostly shared, dorm-style accommodations.  

Please read through our entire ad and offering before asking questions or requesting a stay.  If after that you still have questions feel free to ask.  If you dont and just want to book after reading, I'm positive we will deliver a great stay.  

All of our listings include desks, gigabit internet to share, a full array of breakfast items including bacon, eggs, milk, orange juice, coffee, cereal, tea, oatmeal, at least 2x of fruit, 2x of vegi, cheese, home made bread and jam, and we also take requests for other items that you may enjoy like yogurt, almond milk, or other vegis and fruits we dont already have.  We also often cook for guests and like filling the cookie jar with delicious baked goods throughout the month.  

We have been hosting here for 8 years and absolutely love it.    This is our full time profession but we also dabble in mystery shopping as well as online sales and stained glass.  

We love Airbnb, Chicago, and our guests.   If privacy and being in downtown are not important to you, you'll be hard pressed to find a better Airbnb experience in Chicago at this price point and if you do, we'll probably price match =)

We all look forwarding to meeting those of you who book with us!

summary: Adorable Irving Park bungalow, especially perfect for families and longer term rentals. Free parking! Located 5 minutes from 90/94, close to public transportation, walking distance to bars and restaurants. 3 miles to Wrigley, 4 miles to Lincoln Park, 6 miles to the heart of Michigan Ave., 7 miles to the loop, less than 2 miles to the heart of Logan Square, free permitted street parking. Easy Uber/Lyft rides! It will feel like your home away from home!
space: Guests have the entire home to themselves! It will feel like your home away from home. There is free and easy street parking with the visitor passes that we will give you during your stay. A rare treat in Chicago!

neighborhood_overview: Irving Park is a great family neighborhood but there are still plenty of bars and restaurants you can walk to. The Golden Nugget (diner), Pitchfork (BBQ and Whiskey bar), Leader bar (sports bar, great menu),  Hearth and Crust (great American food and wine), Raisu (high end sushi), Mima’s Taste of Cuba, Twisted Hippo (brew pub), Angelos (Italian), J.T.’s genuine sandwich shop, D’Candela(Peruvian) to name just a few.
notes: No outside noise after 9:30, we want to be respectful to our neighbors who have small children. No parties or underage bookings. We have a outdoor-facing only ring video doorbell to be able to monitor the street and front door while the house is not in use.
transit: Easy and reasonable Ubers and Lyfts. Free permitted street parking (we will give you all the guest passes you need), blue line is a mile away, an easy walk. Only a mile to 90/94. You can also rent bikes through the nearby Divvy stations.
access: Guests have the whole house! There is a separate basement apartment with its own entrance that is not included and not rented.
interaction: Fast responses through the Airbnb app. Happy to answer any questions!
house_rules: Respect our neighbors by keeping the noise down. No loud music or parties. Quiet outside after 9:30pm.
host_about: I’m a Communications professional, originally from St. Louis, but have lived in Chicago for almost 20 years. I have traveled a lot, all over the world, but Chicago is most certainly home. I have a passion for Airbnb hosting and will do everything I can to my my house feel like home to you!

space: There is free street parking (unmetered) that is generally very available directly outside the building on Leavitt St. and for 3+ blocks both north and south on the same street, all of which is residential and not zoned/metered on both sides of the street :)  We’ve reliably found a spot within this during different times of day/evening/weekdays/weekends, but the majority of neighboring streets north of Cermak are also free and not zoned in the off chance that you can't find a parking space on the same block as the building :) Close to public transportation as well if you are not bringing a vehicle, please see "Getting Around" section. -Onsite indoor garage potentially available - please confirm availability prior to booking if you require this (as there are more apartments than there are garage spaces).   -Zinus 8" plush memory foam mattresses and pillows -High-Efficiency LG washer/dryer free for your use (not coin operated) within the apartment -Lighting-quick wifi (250Mbps plan as we

notes: Please note that the entire reservation amount is NOT due at the time of booking :) One month's rent is charged, and then the rest is charged by Airbnb in monthly installments. https://www.airbnb.com/help/article/245/how-do-i-pay-for-my-long-term-reservation The owners of this apartment building invested a significant amount of time, money, and resources into a complete renovation in the summer of 2017. That said, the building is over 75 years old and, though greatly cared for, shows its age in some places. Expect to find some loving wear, quaint aging and minor quirks that you might not find in a brand new high-rise :) We are a monthly stay company only and thus we do not apply a monthly discount on our Airbnb listings: our "nightly" rate reflects the pricing for 30 days or more. Any further discounts to our listed rate need to be approved by owners, and factors that they value include but aren't limited to: -potential stays longer than 3 months -potential guests with 2 or more positi

Sinai Hospital 7 minute commute via CTA to Planet Fitness, or 12 minute walk ~20-23 minute commute via CTA to Jesse Brown VA Hospital, John Stroger Cook County Hospital, Rush University Medical Center,  Jesse Brown VA Hospital, and UIC Hospital The nearest intersection to the apartment building is 23rd St. and Leavitt St. (exact address not disclosed prior to a confirmed booking so as to be sensitive to our curren

neighborhood_overview: Our property is centrally located downtown in a VERY safe area.  We are perfect for group gatherings and family events!  We are literally located right downtown next to all of the high rise buildings and walking distance to everything.     Walking Distance:  We are located around 5 blocks to The Loop and Magnificent Mile/Rush Street (shopping district), 3 blocks from the bar/restaurant scene in River North, 5 blocks to Gold Coast's Viagra Triangle (area filled with bars/restaurants), 6 blocks to Wells Street (party street filled with bars and restaurants), 10 blocks to the Beach.  If something is not within walking distance, Uber is a great option.  As we are centrally located, you can get virtually anywhere cheaply!
notes: We have even MORE of these properties available at this SAME location. Simply ask me if you need more rooms and I will send you the links.
transit: Public Transportation - Brown Line El (Chicago Stop):  We are located 1.5 blocks to the Chicago Brown Line stop.  This train can take you anywhere in the city.  It can get easily get you to and from both Ohare and Midway airports or shoot you up to Wrigley for the baseball game.

name: Private Room in Avondale!
summary: Big and bright private room with comfortable double bed, fresh linens and towels. Quiet neighborhood in a central location with easy access CTA.  Access to kitchen and laundry.  Target is less than a 5 minute walk.  Grocery store in the neighborhood.
space: Big and bright comfortable room with ample closet and drawer space.  There is a window AC unit that you can control as well as a ceiling fan.   Quiet building.  Unit is on the 3rd floor and you should be prepared to take the stairs.
description: Big and bright private room with comfortable double bed, fresh linens and towels. Quiet neighborhood in a central location with easy access CTA.  Access to kitchen and laundry.  Target is less than a 5 minute walk.  Grocery store in the neighborhood. Big and bright comfortable room with ample closet and drawer space.  There is a window AC unit that you can control as well as a ceiling fan.   Quiet building.  Unit is on the 3rd floor and you should be prepared to take the stairs. Guests are welcome to all common areas of the apartment.  You will have full access to the kitchen such as use of the microwave, stove, oven, refrigerator, and coffee maker. Washer and dryer are available and in unit. I do not have regular 9 to 5 hours and I am gone a good bit. But, I do sometimes have big chunks of time when I work at home.  Depending on your arrival time, I will either greet you personally or give you instructions on how to get in and connect with you later.   After that I will be available a
neighborhood_overview: Located in the lovely Avondale neighborhood in Chicago. You will love its central location and super easy and convenient access to every mode of transportation: 5-10 minute walk to the blue line connecting you to O'Hare and downtown (~30 minute train ride from house to O'Hare or downtown loop), 5 minute drive to the 90/94 expressway, minutes walk to major bus routes such as Addison Ave, Belmont Ave and Milwaukee Ave, 15 minute walk to the Irving Park Metra train stop and plentiful street parking for your car. Take the Addison Ave bus right to Wrigley Field and catch a cubs game while you are here! It is a safe and quiet neighborhood.  Chicago is a foodie town and there are a handful of great restaurants to enjoy that are walking distance from your door which includes Chicago's famous Honey Butter Chicken!
notes: I have a sweet, curious kitten who is a little over a year old.  She is very curious so we need to be mindful of open doors and windows.  She does not have access to the room you'll stay in.
transit: The Blue line is a 12 minute walk away. From there it's about 35 minutes from downtown or O'Hare. Wrigleyville, Lakeview and Boystown are about 20 min away by bus. You can also easily access the Red and Brown lines via a short bus ride.  Logan Square is a 15 minute walk away. There is free non-permit street parking.  It is usually fairly easy to park.
access: Guests are welcome to all common areas of the apartment.  You will have full access to the kitchen such as use of the microwave, stove, oven, refrigerator, and coffee maker. Washer and dryer are available and in unit.
interaction: I do not have regular 9 to 5 hours and I am gone a good bit. But, I do sometimes have big chunks of time when I work at home.  Depending on your arrival time, I will either greet you personally or give you instructions on how to get in and connect with you later.   After that I will be available as needed.
house_rules: 1. Quiet time after 11pm. If you plan to be out late please let us know.  2. No smoking, no drugs.  3. No additional guests 4. The general courtesy of cleaning up behind yourself in the bathroom and kitchen are expected.
host_about: I am a dancer, teacher and choreographer who has lived in Chicago for more than 25 years.  I am a creative, people oriented person who enjoys travel and making new friends.    I have lived and worked in the city for more than 25 years.  I know my way around pretty well, can share the major tourist attractions,  share some things with you that are off the beaten path and be a good resource to you about the arts community.  I am the founder of a small dance company that is in its 20th year.  I value long term relationships, collaboration and mentorship.

neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is a historical neighborhood located on the northwest side of the City of Chicago.  The area is characterized by the prominent historical boulevards, stately greystones and large bungalow-style homes.  It's a central location in the city with access to various public transportation (busses and trains), major highways, and DIVVY bike rentals.  Easily accessible from many other parts of the city. 15min drive to Downtown Chicago, and about 15min to many other major city areas.  The central locale is a great starting point to get just about anywhere in a relatively short time, whether driving, using cabs-Uber-Lyft, or public transportation.

It's literally two blocks from the North Park University and half a mile from Northeastern University. Three blocks from the Brown line CTA train station with bus stops all around and easy access to highways. The space has a dining area as well as a family room, in addition to a work space. It's carpeted and very cozy.

notes: Parking is free street parking.  Parking in the city is not always the easiest, but there is available street parking.

Bus stops are available on Foster Ave, Kedzie Ave, and Kimball Ave.   The freeway is 10 minutes away. Lakeshore drive is also 10 minutes away.   Downtown is a 15-minute drive where Grand Park, Millennium Park, Michigan Avenue, Museums, and many other landmarks are located.

name: Luxury Apt in Wicker Park Minutes to Downtown
summary: Enjoy our spacious, luxury apartment in the popular Wicker Park/East Village neighborhood known for its local hipster culture, art community, nightlife, and food scene. The apartment is in a brand new building with a private balcony, in addition there is a common rooftop with amazing downtown views.  Professionally designed interior finish with wide planked flooring, stainless appliances, spa-level bath and fixtures, and tasteful furniture and decor.

Professionally designed interior finish with wide planked flooring, stainless appliances, spa-level bath and fixtures, and tasteful furniture and decor. Just a short walk to the train (the Blue line L) and only minutes from the expressway/downtown by car. This thriving Wicker Park/East Village neighborhood boasts many unique restaurants, bars & boutique shopping. Dine at some of our local favorites like Beatnik, Roots Pizza, Forbidden Root or many of the others that are short walking distance away. To the north, a short walk or drive to Division St. or Milwaukee Ave will provide countless dining and nightlife options. This is the perfect home base for experiencing all Chicago has to offer!

summary: This is a comfortable room  located within a working arts collective in the heart of the historic Wicker Park neighborhood in Chicago, we offer a thriving community right outside your door!
space: Greetings friends, fellow artists and travelers! This is a beautiful room with access to 1,325 sq.ft. (123 sq.m) gallery/exhibition space. Located within a working arts collective in the heart of Wicker Park, we offer a thriving, supportive community right outside your door!  -Great central location in the city of chicago -15 minutes train ride to the loop/downtown -24 hour public transportation at less than half a block (Blue line Damen train stop) -12ft tall ceilings, huge loft, red floors, art on walls -Respectful atmosphere -Clean  The room is malleable to specific visions, the dimensions are: 15'x7' (457cm x 213cm), with a ceiling of 12 ft., aka 3. 66m high. neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park is a major hub for art and entertainment. The streets are bustling with a diverse community, especially artist folk, day and night. The weekends are bumping. You shouldn't be bored.
transit: We're right next to a 24 hour subway train, the CTA blue line Damen stop takes you home. Plus, we live at a 3 street intersection, that's North, Damen & Milwaukee. They've all got buses moving in both directions :)
access: -Free house WI-FI -Full kitchen -In houseWasher dryer -Blender, microwave, Further amenities include roof patio (work outdoors in the summertime and wave to the El passengers!), two restrooms, one shower, and a kitchen. The Damen Blue Line is less than a block away, as are bus stops and numerous last minute corporate lifesavers (24hr Kinkos and Walgreens, Bank, K-Mart).
interaction: We're friendly dedicated artists looking for openminded individuals to share our space with. We thrive off our work & inspiration from one another.
house_rules: 1. Respect the space & its inhabitants. 2. Clean up after yourself=dishes, bedroom, trash, kitchen (counters, cut ware, etc.), messes, etc. 3. Ask before bringing extra guests. 4. Return keys before final departure.
host_about:
Hello! My name is William.

I am a self-employed artist living & directing a gallery in Wicker Park. Last year I completed a Masters degree in Fine Arts at the School Of The Art Institute of Chicago where I studied Video, Performance, Photography and Film.

Important things to me are dream recording, writing, correspondence art, experimental film, movement practices, reading & traveling. I try to travel as often as possible, even if it's just a driving trip of two hours to camp somewhere for a night or two.

I want to provide an environment for artists & other creative, passionate individuals to have a voice & present their work. Sharing stories, ideas, experiences & realities are what we're in it for. We at the gallery are holding the torch in the neighborhood to provide a space for what might be unsayable elsewhere. We are daily developing our intentional space here to create an inspiring atmosphere for all who step foot inside, whether it's for a project proposal or a short visit. It's an older building, lovingly-worn, rooms with character surrounding an open gallery space.

As an airbnb guest, you can expect that we'll be curious about you. Our roommates & us all get along really well: It is an easy going dynamic here at the house. We are an eclectic variety!

Looking forward to meeting you)

name: Renovated 3BR Duplex in Logan Square
summary: Our three bedroom duplex in Logan Square is tastefully decorated and ideally located for traveling families or groups who want to experience everything Chicago has to offer! We're a quick walk to the Logan Square blue line station and close to some of the best restaurants and bars in the city. - Book today!
space: You'll enter into an open living/dining space, with large bay windows that overlook the street. There are original built-ins throughout, and other vintage touches. At the rear of the main floor is the kitchen, with a breakfast bar, and beyond that is an enclosed porch with access to the shared patio and backyard. Also on the main floor are two bedrooms with full beds, and a large bathroom. On the lower floor is an additional living space with a sectional couch, desk, and table with two chairs. There's a king bedroom and bathroom as well. At the rear of this level is the laundry room, shared with the upstairs unit.

neighborhood_overview: Cheap eats and bike-friendly streets. Gourmet coffee, scruffy dive bars and artisanal cocktail lounges. Some may say it's a recipe for a hipster haven but there's a proud, working-class sensibility that keeps this Northwest Side neighborhood grounded. In Logan Square, the strong neighborly connection is evident all around, from active preservation groups to community gardens and a locally-run farmers market. "Local" being the key word when describing many aspects of the scene: ingredients are sourced locally at their buzz-worthy restaurants; corner taps tout local, craft brews; galleries showcase local artists; and concerts and street fests promote local, upstart bands.
transit: We're less than a 10 minute walk to the Logan Square blue line station, and near several bus routes. You won't have any trouble getting around from here!
access: You will have complete and private access to my home.
house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee.  3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property. 6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence.  Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per key fee.
host_about:
Born in Brisbane Australia but moved to Chicago as a young boy.  I love the Cubs and so many of Chicago's fantastic neighborhoods.

Check out Lula Cafe, you won't be disappointed!

The Chicago Architectural tour is a favorite of locals and visitors.

name: Modern and Spacious
space: Our gorgeous apartment located in the heart of Pilsen is available for up to 3 guests. We rehabbed this unit ourselves so everything has been carefully selected and customized. We are looking for the right people to rent to that will take care of our space as if it were their own.  The apartment is an open concept space with 9 foot high ceilings. The bedroom has a queen bed and spacious closet. We also have a queen size air mattress. The bathroom is adjacent to the bedroom. We have a fully stocked kitchen (all stainless steel appliances and granite countertops), Wi-Fi,  large-screen 42 inch TV, sectional couch, washer/dryer in the unit and small deck with a grill. name: Comfortable, unique  space in Lakeview area.
summary: Our cozy house is on a quiet tree lined street with very easy access to all transportation.  We are a quick ride to downtown and very close to Wrigley Field and music venues.  It is perfect for a couple or singles.  Restaurants, music, night life, grocery store, and coffee shops are all just around the corner. Chicago registration #  R (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
space: Our house is a vintage workers cottage that is quiet and very convenient to just about everything the town has to offer. You will have the two rooms in front for yourself with a private entrance.  Your private bathroom is directly across the hall from where you sleep.  Although our block is very peaceful, you can step just down the street to experience some lively night life.

neighborhood_overview: Lakeview is a thriving, safe and garden loving area with ready access to transportation and fun.  Bikes are available to rent and it is a quick ride to the lake or downtown.  Or, you could rent a canoe or paddle boat!   Our house  is just steps away from one of the best music venues in the City and a fun night life scene.  There is a grocery store at the end of the block as well as a dry cleaners.  You can find many coffee shops and interesting restaurants within a three to ten minute walk.  If you like baseball you will be in walking distance to Wrigley Field.
notes: Ambrose is our lovely  dog who will be happy to meet you.  He is a Standard Poodle, a breed that does not generally trigger allergies.
transit: Trains are just a five minute walk away and it is an easy trip to both airports and to downtown activities.  You can walk  a couple of minutes to catch the Brown line and can transfer quickly to all the other train lines.  A north/south bus is a few steps from the door, and bikes are available for rental at the end of the block.  Walking around the neighborhood is a pleasure.  Car rental and taxi service are plentiful.
access: You will receive the door code for your personal front entrance.  You may feel free to relax or drink your tea in our back garden.  In the kitchen you may use the electric hot water pot or microwave, and if you need a spot in the refrigerator I can provide that.  Street parking is available.
interaction: I always like to meet my guests at the door and get them settled, but If you need self check in for a late night we can arrange that.  After that, you may have as much or little contact as you wish.   I will be happy to help you with getting oriented and will provide any information that I can about the neighborhood, transportation, museums etc. if you would like.
house_rules: Feel free to sit in the kitchen or garden, but we ask that you respect the rest of the house as our private living space.   Please ask if you need anything and I will do my best to accommodate you so there is no need to search for things.  I will provide each guest with a towel and washcloth.  If you need additional towels, please ask.  Damp towels should be hung in the bathroom to dry.   My cell number will be provided so that you can call or text.    Thanks!
host_about: I am an artist and I teach art at DePaul University in Chicago.  I love learning about and seeing new places and getting a feel for the people who live there.  Nature, animals, landscape and culture are all on my list of favorites.  There are many many places in this world I have yet to see!  I love being an Airbnb host because I get to meet so many interesting people, even when I am not traveling!

name: The Bird's Nest, Quick & Easy to O'Hare, Downtown
summary: Floating in the treetops, our peaceful 3rd floor apartment offers lots of light and simple charm and space to relax (inside and out) in its 120 year old frame. Guests often comment, “This place just keeps going, doesn’t it?” With its 1,000 sq. ft. floor plan, yes, it does.  You'll be within walking distance (or Uber ride) to craft cocktails, culinary delights, pastries, and coffee. Public transportation is close and convenient. The Bird's nest is your oasis in the city, with free street parking!
space: If you like to be in the city while you're out and feel as if you are in a private getaway when you're in, The Bird's Nest is for you. Walk through the gate into a garden of hydrangeas, trees, birds, twinkling lights and a patio set up for dining or relaxing. Up the stairs is your home away from home. Bright and spacious, with plenty of areas to spread out. Guests repeatedly comment on how unexpectedly large the apartment is. Enjoy! Kitchen The fully equipped kitchen allows you to cook a meal, order out and dine in, or simply brew a cup (or pot) of coffee or cup of tea. Coffee pot and single brew coffee maker, pots, pans, blender, electric tea pot, microwave, toaster, fridge, stove, dishwasher and a full set of serve ware are here for your use. Complimentary coffee, coffee pods and tea are on hand to make you feel at home. We recycle (bin available) and attempt to cut down on plastics with Brita filtered water. neighborhood_overview: There are so many things to do in Logan Square, depending on what interests you. Spring through fall, visit the Sunday Farmer's Market. The 606 Bike and Walking Trail is available year round. Numerous bars and restaurants, coffee shops, arcades, movie theatre, art exhibits, live music, and parks will keep you when you aren't downtown checking out the city.
notes: We are a family friendly space, be sure to note if you are bringing kids so I can put out a toy, game or book for them. The thermostat is located in our unit. If you need an adjustment, let Libby know. Early (10:00am) baggage drop-off and storage is always available free of charge on the day you are checking in or out so you can go out for a meal or go exploring without lugging your bags around. Early check-in and late check-out will be considered if available and with prior approval. You will be notified within 24 hours of arrival or departure, when payment will be requested. Fees: $20 fee to check in as early as 1:00pm  $40 fee to check in as early as 10:00am $20 fee to stay as late as noon $40 fee to check out by 3:00pm If you need a guarantee earlier than 24 hours of your stay or departure, or an earlier check-in or later check-out, I can offer you 15% off the cost of the day proceeding or following your booked days, based on availability. If you choose to do this, earliest check-i
transit: Public transportation is really easy and close by. The bus is half a block away and will take you all the way to Navy Pier, with numerous points in between, including the Lincoln Park Zoo and the DePaul el stop where you can transfer as needed. The Logan Square Blue Line will get you here from O'Hare and take you downtown and beyond. It is a 10 to 15 minute walk depending on your pace. Of course there are always Zip Cars, Uber, Lyft and car rentals. You can park for free on most streets surrounding our place, with no permit parking.
access: You will have full and private access to the entire third floor apartment. Street parking is free and usually available, no permit is needed on our street or surrounding residential streets. There tends to be less available parking in later evening hours. You are welcome to enjoy the yard and take advantage of the outdoor seating and dining areas. The first floor deck attached to the house is our personal space, but feel free to utilize the yard and second deck. Outdoor string lights will be on from dusk to dawn. If you are staying a week or longer, you may use the basement laundry room. It is kept locked, so I will need to let you in.
interaction: We live in the building and are here if you need us. It is important to me that you enjoy your stay. Please let me know if there is anything I can help you with or something that will make your stay more comfortable.
house_rules: - Quiet hours 10:00 pm to 8:00 am - Please leave shoes at the door.
host_about: Libby and Dana are longtime Logan Square residents who have raised their family in this friendly Chicago neighborhood. Libby is a metal worker and designer who loves going for a run on the 606. Dana works in the video and film industry and enjoys a cold brew while he's flipping some burgers on the bbq. We're excited to meet travelers coming to Chicago and point out some spots not to be missed while here. We also get that your vacation time is precious and privacy might be what you are looking for. We're available if you need us.

neighborhood_overview: WICKER PARK!  The apartment is located right on Milwaukee Avenue, the center of Chicago's hipster haven! This awesome neighborhood has so many bars, restaurants, independent coffee joints and quirky shops you'll have no idea where to start - until you check out our curated guidebook! We'll give you a taste for starters. CHEESIES, a casual bar up the street, has killer grilled cheese. The Popper is the best choice on the menu. We've only been after a few drinks, but we see people there all day. Good sign.  EMPORIUM ARCADE BAR WICKER PARK is great for games and drinks. The cocktails are a little pricey, but you can play pinball for hours.   PIECE PIZZA AND BREWERY has the best New Haven style pizza outside of Connecticut, and even better, it's not from New York! Their Hefeweizen is top notch, and they have live music all the time. And at PODHALANKA you'll experience a Polish grandmother's welcome by stuffing you with blintzes, pierogies, and roast beef - and not taking 'please, no more'
notes: This is a third-floor walk-up apartment. You will climb two flights of stairs to the apartment. This is a renovated apartment in a vintage building. The hallways have not been renovated. Guests do not have access to the mailbox. There is no storage area for packages.  Please do not mail or ship any items to the address.  Please mail any items to either the FedEx Office and Ship Center or UPS Store nearby. Unit may be accessed by maintenance for repairs during stays. We do not accept instant bookings from residents of the Chicago metropolitan area as identified by profile city or phone number area code. If you live near Chicago and would like to book a stay, please send us a message with a little more information about your plans. Immediately after booking, we will send you a few questions about your arrival time, contact info, number of guests/visitors, and to name our favorite restaurant, which is listed at the bottom of the house rules. Guests will not be allowed to check in without
transit: There's no need for a car here! - You're a 1 minute walk from the Division Blue Line L train!  7 minutes to downtown! - INSTANTLY get an Uber or Lyft! This neighborhood has no waiting. Take the CTA and go from front door to Chicago's...  SELFIE SPOTS - Millennium Park, the Bean (Cloud Gate), Maggie Daley Park: 18 min - Riverwalk: 18 min - Sears Tower / Willis Tower (Skydeck Chicago): 20 min - Magnificent Mile / Michigan Avenue shopping, Hancock Center (360 Chicago), Water Tower: 29 min - Lake Michigan, Oak Street Beach (terrific skyline view): 20 min WORLD-CLASS CULTURAL INSTITUTIONS - Art Institute of Chicago: 17 min - Grant Park, Buckingham Fountain, Chicago Marathon start: 23 min - Lincoln Park Zoo: 28 min (best free zoo in the world!) - Museum Campus, Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium: 31 min - Chicago Symphony Orchestra: 17 min - Gene Siskel Film Center: 10 min - Museum of Contemporary Art: 18 min - Museum of Science and Industry (MSI): 20 min Uber BIGGEST THEATER SC
access: The entire apartment is yours during your stay!  Book for one person or NINE, it doesn't matter - you WILL NOT share this apartment with anyone outside of your own group!  The building does not have any common amenities.
interaction: We love our guests! We are available to our guests!  We text our guests most of what they need!  ...WE NEED A NUMBER TO REACH YOU AT!  Please confirm your phone number and email address upon booking. IF YOU WILL NOT HAVE A US PHONE NUMBER, please download the Whats App phone texting app! We also have We Chat - please provide your ID!
house_rules: 1) The entire property is smoke and vapor free. We have marijuana and tobacco chemical sensors on the property. They know it's not cooking smoke, They react to airborne particulate, not the smell on your clothes. The PolySens® technology works, so exit the building if you want to smoke/vape or you'll be fined $1000 and asked to leave. 2) Your reservation has paid for a specific number of guests on it. Anyone over this number, whether visiting or sleeping, you must have written permission from us. We have a hallway camera to verify. We're going to be totally fine with 95% of requests, but we do require you to clear it with us first. 3) Quiet hours are 10PM-8AM. Noise should not be heard coming from your apartment. This is a quiet residential building. 95% of our guests have no issues, and never hear from us. We will be sure to send you at least 2 warnings prior to asking anyone to leave, but one way or another, the apartment must be quiet. 4) Parties, events, and commercial activity are
host_about:
Rent Local Homes.  Real Homes; made for living with great kitchens, big living rooms, in awesome neighborhoods! We are Chicago locals with a passion for elevating the guest experience.

Everything you need is already stocked.  Cream and sweeteners for your coffee,  body wash and shampoo for the shower, and the right type of detergent for dishwashers and washing machines; we think of and stock ahead of time everything you need so you don’t have to.

A team of professionals are at your service before, during, and after your stay; we are always here if you have any questions.  Read our reviews.   Browse our photos.  Rent a local home with us.

name: Edgewater escape, charming 2 BR
summary: Charming two bedroom plus living/dining room, private entrance garden apartment, close to public transportation (red line to downtown), the lake, theater, restaurants, and parks. Edgewater is known for tree-lined streets and is a quiet, safe, diverse, and friendly neighborhood.  We provide breakfast foods (coffee, tea, fresh fruit, cereal, bread and homemade jam).  There is a microwave, small fridge, and double burner electric appliance for light cooking.

name: Guest Suite an Easy Swing From Wrigley Field
summary: Sleep steps away from Wrigley Field in a retro brass bedstead with high-thread-count linen. The private bathroom has a tub, while the shared living room features a fireplace and recliner chair, set under tall ceilings. For quiet time, head for the backyard patio. When you are ready to explore Chicago the 2 block proximity to Red Line CTA stations and DIVVY bike-sharing make exploring the city easy.  *Please note: Household has two friendly dogs that are kept out of guests' way*
space: The guest room and guest bath give a good deal of privacy, as both are located on the lower level of the town home. Guests will also have access to a shared living room, kitchen, and outdoor patio to enjoy during the summer months.
description: Sleep steps away from Wrigley Field in a retro brass bedstead with high-thread-count linen. The private bathroom has a tub, while the shared living room features a fireplace and recliner chair, set under tall ceilings. For quiet time, head for the backyard patio. When you are ready to explore Chicago the 2 block proximity to Red Line CTA stations and DIVVY bike-sharing make exploring the city easy.  *Please note: Household has two friendly dogs that are kept out of guests' way*
neighborhood_overview: The setting is between the Wrigleyville and Boystown neighborhoods of Lakeview, a single block from the iconic Wrigley Field, and also near Lake Michigan and parks. Choose from plenty of restaurants and bars on Clark, Addison, and Sheffield Avenues.
transit: The condo is located just two blocks away from the Addison and Sheridan Red Line CTA stations. It takes approximately 20 minutes to ride to the Loop. "DIVVY" bike-sharing stations are located just one block south. Residential parking permits  are available to guests with advanced notice.
access: Hosts will meet guests upon arrival. For access after initial greeting, guests will be given a personal key code for the main entrance.
interaction: Hosts are generally available in the morning or evenings to answer any of our guest's questions or concerns.
host_about:
My husband (Jason) and I are from San Diego, California but we are huge fans of our new home-- Chicago.  I'm all about the arts and culture, while Jason is the big sports and craft beer fan. We keep busy exploring our neighborhood of Wrigleyville and all the great sites Chicago has to offer.  Meanwhile our spoiled dogs, Blue and Emmy, are thoroughly enjoying their lakefront runs on Lake Michigan.

We are looking forward to sharing our new city with our guests.

summary: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this beautiful West Loop furnished studio apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and cozy living room with great  views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Chicago has to offer! (#CHI263)
space: Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this studio apartment. Ideally located in Chicago, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. neighborhood_overview: Located in West Loop, this furnished rental invites you to explore the edges of downtown Chicago. From endless dining and bar options to art galleries and stylish shops, West Loop has emerged with so much to offer daily. During weekends, residents savor trips to the Chicago French Market and the vibrant strip of Randolph Street. The latter is known as “Restaurant Row” and is lined with some of the city’s best eateries. Fulton Market, one of the hippest and fastest-growing neighborhoods, is ideal for dinner and drinks. Union Station is only a 5 to 10 minute walk away.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $250 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Cutest Wicker Park 1-BDRM - Social Distancing HQ
summary: Our 1-BDRM Airbnb is great for social distancing, having an office to work from if your kids are too distracting at home, or overflow space for family visitors.  Cute & cozy 1-bedroom apartment in Chicago's Wicker Park neighnorhood. Open layout kitchen and living room. All of the amenities you need to be comfortable away from home, a comfy queen size bed, Netflix, Wifi!
space: Hip and modern with a touch of vintage charm. As comfortable as it is cool! This unit comfortably sleeps 4. Two in the bedroom and two on the sleeper sofa. Great porch for relaxing in the Chicago summers.  Bedroom features queen size beds with beautyrest mattress, down pillows and blankets, soft cotton sheets. *If you are allergic to down it is imperative you let us know before your arrival so you are comfortable for your stay.* The bathroom is modern and minimal.  Towels and hair dryer included.  The kitchen has all of your basic cooking needs covered. Coffee machine, French press, tea kettle. We have a large pullout couch in the living room and a nice flat screen tv with Netflix and a roku so you can sign in with your personal subscriptions.  Please notify us if you will be using the pull-out before your arrival. Bedding is not left in the apartment.  Check out our (Hidden by Airbnb) to get a closer look! @goldinnchicagoairbnb

neighborhood_overview: Centrally located between the hip restaurants, bars and cafés on Division St. and the six corners in Wicker Park.  Thrillest called Wicker Park "one of the coolest neighborhoods in America" Forbes ranked Wicker Park "4th hippest neighborhood in the country"
notes: This 1 bed coach house unit shares a small yard with two other rentals. Get two or three for larger groups or events! Front units comfortably sleep  four to six. Our units feature a digital lock. We will send you the code a few days before check-in.  Find us on (Hidden by Airbnb) !  @goldinnchicagoairbnb
transit: One block from the division blue line which runs between downtown and O'Hare Airport. And just 1 block to the Milwaukee, Ashland and Division buses. Will happily provide directions to attractions, neighborhoods, good food, coffee, nightlife.
access: Guests have full access to the apartment. Keyless access makes check-in a breeze. Coin laundry shared with tenants.
interaction: You will enjoy full privacy and minimal to no interaction with us, depending on the needs of our guest.
house_rules: -No children under 7.  -All children 7 and older must be included in the occupancy count.  - Unless otherwise discussed do not arrive before 2pm or leave after 10am.  - A late checkout fee will be assessed after 10  - No smoking in unit. - No parties. -No outside guests. -If a guest brings more people than were booked, the reservation will be cancelled with no refund. - Remove shoes at door. - Please respect our neighbors. - Please be sure apartment is secure when you leave and that lights are off. -Please conserve energy and turn the heat or ac down when you are out of the apartment. If you want to place warmed up or cooled down before you get back let us know and we can adjust it while you are out.  - Please be respectful towards the space. If something breaks let us know. - Use coasters.  - Please note that we keep the nest locked at 72 in the winter and 71 in the summer. If your heating or AC needs diverge greatly from that please discuss prior to booking.  - Do not let food waste
host_about: I love art, design and fashion. I love reading about things that interest me. My favorite place so far is the Greek Islands. If I could only eat village Greek salads and fresh bread for the rest of my life I would. David and I love to travel, try new restaurants, go sailing and fall asleep watching netflix. When all my work is done, we love to spend a few hours sitting outdoors with coffee or tea, visiting with a friend or people watching.

name: A modern space blocks from public transportation
summary: Stay in the green room of my modern 3 bed 2 bath on Chicago's West Side. Amenities include close proximity to the blue line, 125" projector TV, wifi, in unit laundry, modern kitchen and bathroom, plenty of space/privacy, and a fully functional DJ booth.
space: I am a touring DJ and this is where I live whenever I'm in town. I also occasionally work out of it, use it to throw afterparties, livestream music events, and host other touring DJ's when they are in town.
description: Stay in the green room of my modern 3 bed 2 bath on Chicago's West Side. Amenities include close proximity to the blue line, 125" projector TV, wifi, in unit laundry, modern kitchen and bathroom, plenty of space/privacy, and a fully functional DJ booth. I am a touring DJ and this is where I live whenever I'm in town. I also occasionally work out of it, use it to throw afterparties, livestream music events, and host other touring DJ's when they are in town. You'll have free reign of your room, the living room, kitchen, main bathroom, and the back porch. When I'm in town you'll be sharing the apartment with me (I have the master bedroom in the back of the unit); whenever I'm touring or out of town, you'll have free reign of the place though I do lock my bedroom when I'm gone. On weekends I'm usually out partying but I have been known to have a quiet night in from time to time. If you need a party liason for the weekend, contact me in advance and I will be happy to point you in the right
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is on Chicago's west side. There is a gyro restaurant across the street along with a convenience store. If you walk a block south towards Taylor St. There are a number of shops and restaurants. There's also a Pete's Fresh Market 4 blocks north if you intend to grocery shop & cook during your stay.
notes: The room you'll be staying in is my Green Room. Its main function is to host other touring DJ's when they are in town, however if the room is available on a weekend, it means that I am probably not throwing parties while you're staying here. If in doubt, inquire before booking. The listing says no smoking, however you can smoke on the back deck on the condition that you close the sliding door behind you and use the ashtrays outside for cigarette butts. From a security standpoint: Generally speaking, neighborhood is relatively safe. I've lived here for 2 years and have hosted roughly 300 guests; none of whom have ever had any issues. The house uses smart locks, has a security system featuring intrusion detection and CCTV cameras facing the street outside as well in the the common areas of the unit (kitchen area, the DJ booth, and my office). While I do my best to keep the unit safe and secure, it is always advised to be vigilant in any urban area. Also note: Freshly washed linens are ch
transit: From a public transit standpoint, the place is ideally situated a block and a half away from the blue line and/or can easily catch the western bus. Uber and Lyft are also viable options and this particular part of the city is very drive-able with parking easy to find. There is ample parking on the street and I do have a private garage space as well. The Garage only has one opener, however, so I will typically only offer the parking space during extenuating circumstances
access: You'll have free reign of your room, the living room, kitchen, main bathroom, and the back porch. When I'm in town you'll be sharing the apartment with me (I have the master bedroom in the back of the unit); whenever I'm touring or out of town, you'll have free reign of the place though I do lock my bedroom when I'm gone.
interaction: On weekends I'm usually out partying but I have been known to have a quiet night in from time to time. If you need a party liason for the weekend, contact me in advance and I will be happy to point you in the right direction. I have a big kid job during the week so I'm usually pretty busy. You're more than welcome to come home hammered during the week, just don't break anything and try to keep it down while I'm sleeping. If you're looking to have a quiet/tame experience in Chicago, I have a pretty good grasp on all of the touristy things to do and will happily point you in the right direction. Or if you're just looking for a place to crash and don't need any help/interaction from me, that's fine too.
house_rules: My room and the equipment in the DJ booth is off limits as is my desk/computer/file cabinets in my office. $300 fine for lost keys.
host_about: I am an outgoing 30 year old adventurer. I own a small software company and like to spend my free time on impromptu trips.

name: + Private Bathroom-Very Safe Area-Friendly Dog +
summary: Enjoy privacy on the upstairs floor of my single family home: 3 Bedrooms with 4 beds and private bath (King bed, 2 queen & double). I live in the house with my friendly dog Ebony in the safest neighborhood in Chicago, so the rest of the house is shared. Walk to restaurants, grocery, forest preserve, community pool... 10 min drive to O'Hare Airport, Rosemont, Stephens Convention Center, Allstate Arena, and more. 20 minute drive to downtown Chicago. We are also steps from public transportation.
space: 3 Bedrooms (1 king bed, 2 queens, 1 double) and private bath available upstairs in my single family home. All rooms have desk and Wifi access. Largest room has 2 queen beds and 2 closets. King Bed Room has smart TV (with YouTube, Amazon Prime Video, and access to your Netflix account). Laundry available upon request. You are welcome to use the rest of the house and yard... it is shared with me and Ebony (the friendliest dog you will ever meet!)

neighborhood_overview: The safest neighborhoods in Chicago. Free street parking everywhere and no permit required. Walking distance to restaurants, grocery, drug stores, forest preserve, community pool, and more.  10 minute drive to O'Hare Airport, Rivers Casino, Donald E. Stephens Convention Center, Alstate Arena, Fashion Outlets of Chicago, Rosemont Theater, Zanies Comedy Club, iFly Indoor Skydiving, King Bowling and Billiards and other entertainment.  20 minute drive to downtown Chicago.
notes: I live in the house with my dog Ebony. We do not accept 3rd-party reservations. Per Airbnb policy, please make sure that the person who makes the reservation checks in at the property first. We may also require IDs from all guests in advance. You are welcome to make light use of the kitchen / stove / refrigerator. (Oven does not work.) Please clean up in the kitchen after you use it.  Children are welcome, but we do not have any special accommodations (child-proofing, etc.) NO SMOKING AND NO PARTIES. Please observe quiet hours after 10:00 PM.
transit: There is free parking on the street in front of the house, no permit required. Uber and Lyft are the best way to get around in the city if you do not have a car. There is also a bus stop just a few steps from my house that can take you anywhere in the city.  The blue line is a short bus ride away. If you are planning to take the bus from my house, please make sure you get a Ventra card first. You can also take an Uber or Lyft (or the bus) to the train station if you need to get a Ventra card to ride and transfer. Buses and trains cost $2.25 per ride if you pay cash. The Ventra card allows you to pay less for travel costs and can be obtained at any train station (including at the airport).
access: Access to main floor, upstairs, and back yard: living room, kitchen, dining room, 1.5 bathrooms, back yard. Bedrooms and bath upstairs are private. Rest of house is shared with Joey and Ebony.
interaction: I am a very casual, hands-off guy, and my dog Ebony is very friendly. I work from home, so I will be around. You are welcome to make yourself at home.
house_rules: 1. NO PARTIES OR EVENTS at the house without prior host approval. All guests must be approved before having them. Additional overnight guests may incur an extra charge. The violation of this rule may lead to the removal of all guests without refund. 2. We do not accept 3rd-party reservations. Per Airbnb policy, please make sure that the person who makes the reservation checks in at the property first. We may also require IDs from all guests in advance. 3. Please observe quiet hours on the property after 10:00 PM. The house is shared with Joey and Ebony, and we have neighbors close by. 4. NO smoking in the house or in front of the house. If you need to smoke, please do so in the backyard or in the alley and dispose of cigarettes in the trash properly. Any damages from smoking, or the lingering smell of smoke, will be taken from the security deposit for cleaning, defumigation, or replacement. 5. You may come and go as you please. If you come in late, please be aware that Ebony will wake
host_about:
Hi, my name is Joey, and the black beauty next to me is Ebony. We love to walk through the forest preserve every day and enjoy life.

I am a real estate investor, working from home. After 45 years in the business, I have turned my attention to helping others succeed in real estate also.

I am a vegan and love to live a healthy lifestyle.

I love my home... it is my paradise!
