name: Private Coach House in the Heart of Northcenter
summary: This nice coach house is located in the heart of NorthCenter, a quiet neighborhood but with a 5 minute walk to many incredible restaurants,  breweries, supermarkets and Brown Line Trains to downtown. This place is perfect for extended Chicago stays whether for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, or families (with a kid).
space: This is a private house with its own private door,  with no upstairs or downstairs neighbors and a small shared garden (Private Deck). It includes a kitchen, a bathroom, a living room, a bedroom and Cable TV , Wi-Fi, in-unit laundry and central air conditioning and heating. It is perfect for extended stays. I live here while in Chicago but travel a lot so I am making it  available for airbnb guests while away. The unit is very clean and not filled with personal items since my main house is abroad. Street parking is free and really easy. Walking distance from Wrigley Field for Cubs Fans!

name: Ideal Loop Studio w/ Pool, Gym, nr. L by Blueground
summary: Show up and start living from day one in Chicago with this stylish studio Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped West Loop home with stunning  views over the city. (#CHI266)
space: As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this studio property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Chicago vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry. Amenities Building amenities unique to this studio apartment include an on-site:    - Doorman - 24/7 Security - Pet Friendly - Dog Park/Run - Swimming Pool - Gym - Indoor Parking - Roof Deck - Bike Storage - Elevator

neighborhood_overview: Located in West Loop, this furnished rental invites you to explore the edges of downtown Chicago. From endless dining and bar options to art galleries and stylish shops, West Loop has emerged with so much to offer daily. During weekends, residents savor trips to the Chicago French Market and the vibrant strip of Randolph Street. The latter is known as “Restaurant Row” and is lined with some of the city’s best eateries. Fulton Market, one of the hippest and fastest-growing neighborhoods, is ideal for dinner and drinks. Union Station is only a 5 to 10 minute walk away.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $250 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Luxurious 3-bedroom, 2-bath in Lincoln Park
summary: Luxurious, spacious, and well-appointed three-bedroom, two bath  apartment in landmark limestone building on one of Lincoln Park's most prestigious streets. Walk to dozens of restaurants and shops, not to mention  Lincoln Park and the gorgeous lakefront, Lincoln Park Zoo, the Conservatory, and Wrigley Field. While you don't need a car here, free street parking is available. Located across the street from a historic church, one of the special treats is hearing the bells ring throughout the day.

name: Suite w/ balcony & lake views! Shared pool, gym, saunas, more! Family friendly!
summary: The health and safety of our guests, homeowners, and employees is our number one priority. Many of our vacation rentals minimize person-to-person contact with private amenities and entry via smart locks or lockboxes. Plus, each reservation is backed by 24/7 customer support and expert cleaning in line with current CDC guidelines.
space: Soak in skyline and lake views from the 45th floor at this two-bedroom Chicago suite, a modern Grand Plaza escape with a large balcony, an ideal River North location, and fantastic building amenities that include a pool, saunas, a running track, and a fitness center. This 1,210-square-foot retreat sits on the 45th floor of the Grand Plaza, an upscale high-rise on State Street and Grand Avenue in the heart of River North. Find endless shopping opportunities on Michigan Avenue's Magnificent Mile three blocks east, conduct a bit of business in The Loop five blocks south, and unwind with a long walk or a sunset boat tour on the Chicago River four blocks south. With 24-hour building security and 50,000 square feet of shared recreational space, this suite offers a comfortable getaway for business travelers or a group of friends exploring Chicago for the first time. Come home from a day out on the town to browse the free WiFi, watch a DVD or a bit of cable TV, or fix a few snacks in the kitch

host_about: Hi, we’re Vacasa, North America’s largest vacation rental management company. Owners of vacation homes around the world trust us to deliver exceptional service throughout your entire vacation. Professional housekeepers clean and stock each home, and our customer care team is available around the clock—with a local property manager ready to show up and help out. We like to think we offer the best of both worlds: you can enjoy a one-of-a-kind vacation experience in a unique property, without compromising on service and convenience. Check out our listings, and get in touch if you have any questions. Your vacation is our full-time job, and we'd love to help you plan your perfect getaway.

name: 4-Need a room? Spacious, near trains, great price!
summary: Are you looking for a five-star hotel? Unfortunately this isn't it. If you are looking for a simple/spacious place to sleep as you explore Chicago with easy access to the bus/train, you've found the place!  20 min Uber/Lyft/cab from O'Hare.  Quick 81 Lawrence bus to the Blue Line train to access downtown or O'Hare airport. 8 min walk to the Brown Line train.  35 mins from the Loop during rush hour to see the world famous Chicago Bean, Sears Tower and all types of restaurants.  Book today!
space: Is this room all booked for your dates? Book one of our other rooms in the same apartment by clicking on my photo (above "Warren" by the title of this listing) and looking at our availability in one of the other bedrooms! This listing is for bedroom 4 (queen bed) in a 5 bedroom apartment. Easy access to transportation, easy check in.  Chicago is a terrific place for all types of restaurants, great food, easy transportation. 10 min Uber/Lyft/bus/train rides in any direction will take you to Indian, Japanese, Ethiopian, Mexican and any other type of food you can think of. Don't want to go to far? We have all of those great restaurants in our Albany Park neighborhood as our neighborhood is SUPER diverse and I absolutely love it. You can easily get to our place by 81 Lawrence bus which takes you directly to the Jefferson Park Blue Line (easy access to O'Hare airport). You can also take a quick Brown Line train downtown from Kimball and see all types of touristy destinations our great city

notes: Hello!  We'd absolutely love to have you stay with us! We've been blessed in our short time to have travelers from all over the world stay with us from France, to Malaysia to the U.S. We've had casual travelers to people here on work trips. The happiest stays guests have had here are the people that understand what we're offering. You're basically in a hostel / shared space. A very low priced room with a lock, on average from $19-$24 USD per night depending on demand, that gives you a simple place to sleep and amenities to use. It is our guests that understand that this is NOT the Hilton or Marriott that have enjoyed this extremely low priced stay. This is my parents home, and we come through and clean often but ultimately there's daily wear and tear as on any given day our five rooms can be occupied with around 1-2 people each that you might see in passing. Our bathrooms will often look used, our floors will often be scuffed, our kitchen will look like someone actually uses it because
transit: Blue Line Brown Line 81 Lawrence Bus 82 Kimball Bus
access: All common areas on the second floor (living room, kitchen, bathroom) as well as your own room. The back porch is not included in the experience and thus has not been fixed up. While we certainly have the back area for emergency exiting in the case of fire, please ONLY exit regularly through the front door. You won't be able to lock the back apartment door but you CAN automatically lock the front apartment door by pressing the Yale logo while holding the door shut.
interaction: Message us on the app for questions! We're working folks so obviously if we don't respond we're probably in a meeting, but once we get the chance to reply we will!
house_rules: Please wash your dishes after each use. Please keep relatively quiet throughout your stay, especially after 10 p.m. We have long-term tenants that rent downstairs (and of course us upstairs) but they also would love to interact with you if you see them! Feel free to say hi! They're all working folks/grad school students. Please help us save on the electric bill by turning off the air-conditioning / bedroom lights whenever you leave the apartment. We'd really appreciate it.

name: Allegro - Gorgeous One Bed in Uptown by Short Stay
summary: Hang out on the spacious rooftop lounge complete with day beds, grills, and sweeping lake and city views. Gleaming brass and gold taps stand out against the glazed concrete flooring and dramatic black feature walls at this ultramodern pad.
space: The space is fully equipped with everything need in your home. If you need it, WE GOT IT. The home features an eat-in kitchen with granite island, custom cabinetry & SMEG refrigerator, glazed concrete flooring throughout, in unit washer & dryer combo and spa-like bath with glass enclosed rain shower.  Enjoy direct access to the spacious roof-top lounge & deck complete with day beds, grills and lake + city views! You are also free to enjoy a common space for residents and the community that blends historic art deco features with modern decor. Plug in your laptop and get to work at the co-working tables. Enjoy a coffee from Heritage Outpost or a drink from Larry’s Bar. A full-service ATM and vending machine are also available! Take a seat at 3 Squares Diner or order from their limited bar menu at Larry’s.
description: Hang out on the spacious rooftop lounge complete with day beds, grills, and sweeping lake and city views. Gleaming brass and gold taps stand out against the glazed concrete flooring and dramatic black feature walls at this ultramodern pad.
neighborhood_overview: Uptown combines historic architecture, culture, and entertainment. Catch some jazz at the 100-year-old Green Mill, grab some delicious dim sum and pho on Argyle Street, and admire historic landmarks and architecture in Uptown Square.
notes: Check In / Check Out Check in starts at 3 PM Check out time is 11 AM Luggage Hold If your travel arrangements have you arriving earlier or leaving later than our designated check in / check out times, we can offer a luggage hold at the building for a flat fee of $25.  Early Check In Luggage Holds begin at 12pm. Late Check Out Luggage Holds end at 2:45pm. this time has the possibility of being extended to 8pm if there is not another check in directly after your stay. We will not be able to confirm an 8pm luggage hold until 24hrs prior to your departure. Pets There is a $25/pet per booking fee.  We know that all dogs are good dogs but the building's breed restrictions are listed below. There are no weight restrictions, but if your buddy falls under one of these categories unfortunately we wouldn't be able to host them. Pit Bull, American Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier, Shaffordshire Bull Terrier, Rottweiler, Doberman Pinscher, Chow Chow, Akita, Presa Canario and /or Wol
transit: Whether you got a set a wheels, using public transportation  or your just old fashioned walking, the neighborhood works for any transportation needs. There is easily accessible "Pay to Park" street parking. Additionally, there is loads of public transportation! Just a few blocks from the redline for getting in and out of the loop/downtown. There are also buses on every street corner. The neighborhood is all completely walkable for anything you can possibly need on the fly.
access: You will have access to all of the building's beautiful and unique amenities. All of which include a gorgeous gym and boxing ring,  stunning pool, and beautiful outdoor area with fire pit.
interaction: We are off-site but available when needed. The best way to reach us is by emailing (Email hidden by Airbnb)  In case of maintenance emergency, the in-unit home guide will detail phone numbers of who to call immediately.
house_rules: General Rules -Absolutely no smoking is permitted anywhere inside the home or any outdoor areas. There will be a $500 fee imposed if we receive a complaint or find evidence of smoking in the home. -Please treat the home as if it is your own. -Please respect our guest limit capacity of 4 people. -Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property. -If you accidentally damage anything during your stay, please contact the host for your safety and the future safety of the next guest. -We pride ourselves on being green and would appreciate you turning off the TV and lights when you check-out. -Please remember to sign out of any ROKU apps you utilized via your personal accounts before departing. Quiet Hours Quiet hours are between 10p-8a.  This is a residential building and ask that for the respect of permanent tenants basic courtesies of being mindful of your noise levels and not congregating in hallways outside of the unit be observed.  Please be advised that this home is equippe
host_about: Hello! Thanks for checking out our homes in beautiful Chicago! Livly Short Stay has a few hosts that will be communicating with you and we can’t wait to get to know you and welcome you to the city. Hosting as a team makes communicating with us even faster and we're looking forward to taking care of curating a perfect stay for you. Talk to you soon!

name: ❤️ 20% Off! Bright Boho Themed 3BR near IIT & UIC!
summary: A fully furnished home for your longer stay, complete with WiFi and everything you need to live. AFFORDABLE MONTHLY RATES ARE AVAILABLE!!! MARCH - $2320 APRIL - $2320 Welcome to Chicago, home of the World Series Champs, the Cubs. Our spacious 3BR condo is a perfect place to stay on any Chicago getaway, whether business or vacation. It is professionally designed with a full kitchen, living room, and modern decor.
space: Illuminated by sunny natural light, our 3BR apartment features Queen-size bed, premium linens, and plenty of closet space so you can unpack and forget about your suitcase for a while. Enjoy the privacy of your own room, with doors that close and independently controlled air-conditioning units. The apartment includes two full bathroom, with a shower, sink, and toilet. We’re all about helping you look (and smell) your best, so we provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in addition to hand soap and fluffy towels. Trust us when we say there’s no better way to warm up after a Windy City walk than a hot shower! There’s ample space for guests to relax on the sofa and watch on a large flat-screen TV. Like the rest of the unit, you’ll live it up in luxury among hardwood floors and contemporary decor. The entire place has free, fast WiFi and Chicago sunshine streaming in through the windows.

neighborhood_overview: Living up to Chicago's vibe, you will definitely not want to miss this side.  It's accessible and bordered by the lake and gorgeous parks and top museums like the Chicago Museum Campus that has the view of Lake Michigan and the skyline on the other. You can explore by taking the water taxi lake route that takes you to Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium and the monumental Field Museum that is home to Maximo The Titanosaur, SUE T.rex and more 40 million other artifacts. For most, this is a place where adventurous travellers flock to fine dining restaurants to the best of South Loop's good eats like Acadia, Cafecito, Devil Dogs South. Diverse nightlife choices from dive bars, cocktails, blues joints and cafe bars and hole in the wall finds. Retails shops and parks conveniently situated and fast becoming a neighborhood fave spots. Truly at South Loop, there is always something for everyone worth exploring.
notes: -Train passes nearby the building so potential noise from it can be heard in the unit. -There are many units inside this building. -All guest need to be attentive with the house rules during their stay as there are other tenants at the property. -Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay -Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request. -We have duvet covers on our bedding  (no top sheets). -Security Deposit maybe required on the following bookings: 1) Last minute bookings 2) Short weekend stays 3) Large groups  4) Guests with no reviews 5) Guests with incomplete profile 6) Instant Bookings  7) Some properties may not allow locals for short term reservations. -Please be aware that if you lose the key and/or entry fob which is your access to the unit, it cannot be replaced for you immediately and you may lose access to the apartment and all amenities until another o

interaction: We are available by phone throughout your stay. You can simply call or text if you have any questions.
house_rules: Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking: -No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250). -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. - The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am. -Lost key fee - $300 -Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc. -Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc. -Smoking - $300 -Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300 **-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat, an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in Streeterville, only a 5 minute walk from The Loop. One of the fastest-developing neighborhoods in Chicago, Streeterville extends out into Lake Michigan and attracts a blend of young professionals, students, and tourists. A plethora of amenities and activities exist for every lifestyle. From Navy Pier activities to luxury shopping on Michigan Avenue, it is a walkable community with easy access to entertainment.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $350 monthly fee. Parking offered may be on or off-site, and may be covered or open. Spaces are designed for compact vehicles. Please provide us with your car details min. 1 business day in advance to avoid the chance of erroneous towing - Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance - Please contact us for details
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Luxurious City Living In The Heart River North!
summary: The breathtaking views of the city through your big bay windows will have you eager to get out and explore! Located less than a mile from Millenium Park, Willis Tower and some of the best shopping around on Michigan Ave - You won't struggle filling up your day! You have access to all the first-class features our building has to offer including rooftop sundeck with GORGEOUS city views, outdoor pool and Al fresco fire pits and grilling stations just to name a few! Welcome to the Windy City!
space: Our community is packed with luxury, convenience, comfort, and style. With amenities like a stunning rooftop sundeck (breathtaking city views included), beautiful outdoor pool with trellised shade areas, indoor Whirlpool spa, sauna, and steam rooms you will never want to leave. After all, everyone can use a little rest and relaxation in their life, right?   Don't let traveling interrupt your fitness goals. We have a top of the line fitness center and yoga studio. No excuses not to burn a few calories. Maybe working out isn't your thing. No worries! We have a wonderful entertainment lounge with a Billiard table and a deluxe private theater with surround sound. We have something for everyone and it is planted in the heart of The Windy City!

No excuses not to burn a few calories.
neighborhood_overview: Chicago sits on the bold, beautiful coast of Lake Michigan and our property is just a mile east of it. Mix a little lake life with city life and you are in a great location! Staying at our property gives you amazing access to the hottest Chicago landmarks that you can get to in minutes! Do a little shopping at Magnificent Mile and take in the picturesque views of the Chicago River.  The city is full of history and there are several tours you can take to get its background. The Chicago River Architecture Cruise is a must-do!  If you visit during the warmer months you should definitely swing by Wrigley Field for a Cubs game, take a walk through Lincoln Park Zoo (it's free) and don't forget Navy Pier. If it's the chilly season, dress warm, really warm, and don't let that stop you. Go out and explore! Get a taste of Chicago with any of the numerous authentic restaurants, cafes, and pubs. There are so many to choose from! Fill your belly, wet your whistle and dance the night away. The night
transit: You will be staying in the heart of Chicago. It is a Walker's Paradise, Rider's Paradise and very bikable area! No car necessary!  If you do bring one public parking is available and not included in any rental. There is public parking available next to the building. The entrance is off Hubbard Street. Additional public parking available at 414 N. Orleans.  If you need to find parking throughout the city while you are out and about, download the app Spot Hero! It will give you locations as well as pricing.  You are just 0.5 miles from both Olgilvie and Union Station.   Trains - Union: Metro, Amtrak  - Olgilvie: Metra - The Ventra and Metra Apps are great tools CTA - Train and Bus - Several stops within 0.2 mi  - The Chicago Transit - CTA App is a great tool The App Transit will give you the best way to get to your destination using public transportation. It will also include any ridesharing options available.  Local Airports O'Hare International Airport (ORD) 11mi Chicago Midway Interna
access: * Stunning rooftop sundeck with breathtaking city  * Beautiful outdoor pool * Al fresco fire pits and grilling stations * Fitness center and Yoga Studio * Indoor Whirlpool Spa, Sauna and Steam Rooms * Extensive entertainment lounge with gourmet kitchen * Premiere business suite * Deluxe private theater with surround sound * Enjoy complimentary Starbucks in our lounge * Round the clock concierge services * Private dog walk and pet wash * Short Term Lease is required
interaction: 24 hour Concierge available.

A short-term renters insurance policy is also created for all guests. There are no additional fees for the background check or insurance policy.

name: Blue Line Luxury w/ GYM & SKYLINE ROOF (H)
summary: Luxury is going above and beyond what you need. Luxury is a massive, stunning condominium in Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood: the West Loop! Luxury is more square feet, a custom rain shower, high end appliances, custom cabinetry, marble counters, oak plank floors and more! Not just coffee, but coffee options. Not just a private patio, but a skyline view roof deck. Skip the cheap apartments with good photos and fake finishes; this ultra luxurious condo is the real deal!
space: Flooded with natural light and ceilings that soar to 11 feet, the feeling is airy, spacious, modern, ultra luxury.  This is a brand new building from the ground up in 2018! Not just a bathtub, but a deep soaking tub big enough for boobs and knees.  Not just a shower, but a custom glass rain shower large enough to spin around.  Enjoy a private patio with actual privacy, a public skyline view roof deck that isn't a sales pitch or a party, a 24 hour gym with lots of equipment and space to move around, blazingly fast WiFi, a wealth of coffee options/equipment, this space goes so far above and beyond what you'll find in a hotel.  Prepare to be shocked, then amazed, and then just happy.   Want advice?  Looking for that local knowledge? We've got a guidebook telling you all the secrets! We're from Chicago. We live here. We know the place, and we have an opinion!  MASTER BEDROOM - King over king bunk beds - Walk-in closet - Balcony view (En suite bath) - 32" HDTV with local channels, plus Netf

neighborhood_overview: - THE WEST LOOP! The definition of industrial chic, this neighborhood has exploded as the city’s trendiest neighborhood! Converted factories and warehouses have transformed into hip restaurants and unique drinking spaces.  - RANDOLPH STREET, the center of Chicago’s food scene and home to world-renowned spots such as Girl and the Goat, Next, and Au Cheval, is just a short walk! The FULTON MARKET district is a just a bit further, or a quick Uber! - Five minutes from the nearest BLUE LINE L stop, ILLINOIS MEDICAL DISTRICT. Get downtown in 11 minutes! Or continue out to O'Hare, direct, in 49 minutes.  - Closest place to stay to the UNITED CENTER, period. Three blocks away, you can the UC from the front door! - Short walk from the UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS AT CHICAGO (UIC), Chicago’s only public research university, as well as the surrounding LITTLE ITALY neighborhood. - Two blocks directly north of RUSH UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL. notes: Parking is subject to availability - I have more condos than spots. We do not accept instant bookings from residents of the Chicago metropolitan area as identified by profile city or phone number area code. If you live near Chicago and would like to book a stay, please send us a message with a little more information about your plans Immediately after booking, we will send you a few questions about your arrival time, contact info, number of guests/visitors, and to name our favorite restaurant, which is listed at the bottom of the house rules. Guests will not be allowed to check in without providing complete answers

Take the train direct from O'Hare! Service runs (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) BLOCK to the Jackson Bus or Madison Bus (get downtown in 10 minutes) - Easy walking distance to the Ashland/Lake Green Line stop! Take the CTA and go from front door to Chicago's...  LARGEST INDOOR ARENA - United Center, Blackhawks Hockey, Bulls basketball: 6 min WALK (.3 miles!) SELFIE SPOTS - Millennium Park, the Bean (Cloud Gate), Maggie Daley Park: 22 min - Riverwalk: 19 min - Sears Tower / Willis Tower (Skydeck Chicago): 18 min  - Magnificent Mile / Michigan Avenue shopping, Hancock Center (360 Chicago), Water Tower: 33 min - Lake Michigan, Oak Street Beach (terrific skyline view): 36 min WORLD-CLASS CULTURAL INSTITUTIONS - Art Institute of Chicago: 26 min - Grant Park, Buckingham Fountain, Chicago Marathon start: 26 min - Museum
access: The entire condo is yours during your stay! You will not share this condo with anyone outside of your own group! The roof deck, the gym, the garage, and the lobby are shared spaces and you should be respectful of that.   Guests may drop off their bags as early as 12PM (noon), after which time we ask that you leave the condo until 4PM to let the cleaners finish cleaning. It's hard to wash the sheets with someone taking a nap! After 4PM, the place is all yours!
interaction: I love my guests! I am available to my guests! I text my guests most of what they need! I need a number to reach you at! Please confirm your phone number and email address. IF YOU WILL NOT HAVE A US PHONE NUMBER, please download the (Hidden by Airbnb) phone texting app! I also have (Hidden by Airbnb) - please provide your ID!
house_rules: 1) Smoking and vaping are only allowed on your private balcony with the balcony door shut. The rest of the property is smoke and vapor free. We have marijuana and tobacco chemical sensors on the property. They know it's not cooking smoke, They react to airborne particulate, not the smell on your clothes. The PolySens® technology works, so exit the building if you want to smoke/vape or you'll be fined $1000 and asked to leave. 2) Your reservation has paid for a specific number of guests on it. Anyone over this number, whether visiting or sleeping, you must have written permission from us. We have a hallway camera to verify. We're going to be totally fine with 95% of requests, but we do require you to clear it with us first. 3) Quiet hours are 10PM-8AM. Noise should not be heard coming from your apartment. This is a quiet residential building. 95% of our guests have no issues, and never hear from us. We will be sure to send you at least 2 warnings prior to asking anyone to leave, but one
host_about:
Rent Local Homes.  Real Homes; made for living with great kitchens, big living rooms, in awesome neighborhoods! We are Chicago locals with a passion for elevating the guest experience.

Everything you need is already stocked.  Cream and sweeteners for your coffee,  body wash and shampoo for the shower, and the right type of detergent for dishwashers and washing machines; we think of and stock ahead of time everything you need so you don’t have to.

A team of professionals are at your service before, during, and after your stay; we are always here if you have any questions.  Read our reviews.   Browse our photos.  Rent a local home with us.

name: West side close to El public trans
host_about:
About me and AirBnB, I have a great home, that feels, like home. I also think people could benefit by saving money using this great tool, AirBnB, over the cost of hotels, parking and all the other "little things", that make people's trip to Chicago so expensive. I'm also the president of the condo association so stay with complete confidence knowing you're welcome here.

About me, a single Dad, work in a Engineering sales role that involves traveling overnight. I've also slowly started a real estate and packaging consulting business for my long term career goals to work for myself. For fun, I spend as much time as I can being a Dad and raising my daughter. When I take a break from that (every other weekend), I'll get out with some like minded friends for fun in the city or a weekend getaway trip.

name: Large House for your Family City Break
summary: THE perfect spot for a family holiday,  and still available Thanksgiving and a week in January.  Prime location in Lincoln Park, only minutes walk to restaurants and boutique shopping and close to downtown. 5 Star rated. Huge 3900sf historic house + basement + secluded garden with a canopy of grown trees and string lights, a very cosy, lived in family feel, clean, and lots of quirky and historic details (hidden doors, Tiki Bar)comfy seating areas, historic features. So many toys and a ball pit!
space: A cosy sunny coffee sitting room overlooking garden, breakfast bar, dining table for 8, play room, formal sitting TV room, 3 bathroom + 1 basement bathroom, ironing room. Roof deck, front porch, side garden and back garden.  Across the road from large park with splash pad. Front and back of house staircases for even more privacy with groups. High ceilings and large windows, beautiful original period details, modern kitchen and master bathroom with rain shower.  High quality linens and pillows, BBQ outdoor seating for 8.

host_about: Our little (Australian, British, Canadian and an American) family love to travel, but also love to come home to, Chicago our favorite city in the world. name: Hyde Park Loft
summary: The Loft is on the second floor (12 steps) of a 125 year old Brown-Stone Row House close to: The University of Chicago, The Museum of Science and Industry,  The Smart Museum, The Oriental Institute and home of our 44th president Barak Obama.   Historic  Hyde Park, is just 20 minutes on an express Bus to Downtown or the Gold Coast. The second floor loft is  1100 sq ft, bright and sunny with nice views and a rich and diverse culture. My place is good for couples or three good friends.
space: There is alot of open loft type space with a large teak table  and a smaller one in the kitchen.  It's a unique space perfect for artists, writers, and free spirits. A sky light provides great natural light and the shower in the bath is wonderful.  The kitchen area has a small fridge & deep black industrial sink. Out the back window across the alley is cute “Bessie Coleman” playground.  And the paved back yard is private and great on sunny days and comfortable evenings.

And the paved back yard is private and great on sunny days and comfortable evenings. There is a washer and dryer in the ba
neighborhood_overview: The Loft is in a quiet, safe and tree lined neighborhood. We are across from the athletic center and a bowling alley, pool hall and restaurant across 55th street.  Starbucks is two blocks away and Whole Foods is less than a mile.  Wonderful places to visit within walking distance: Everything University of Chicago. The Home of our 44th President,  DuSable Museum of African American History and Culture, Smart Museum & Gallery, Court Theatre, Museum of Science and Industry, Oriental Institute, Frank Lloyd Wright’s Robie House and more.
notes: During the warm months it's a good idea to close the kitchen-work area door.  When the sun sets it can get really warm in the back of the second floor. But there are two air conditioners and four ceiling fans.  Conversely, in the winter, open the back door and that extra heat from the sun, along with the radiators, will keep you toasty.
transit: There is convenient public transportation.
access: There is a washer and dryer in the basement.  Codes for the basement lock are provided at booking.
interaction: There is a push button code locking system on the doors so guests can come and go at their  leisure.   There is a folder on the table with maps of the area and other suggested places to visit and eat. I can always be reached by phone or by text if needed.  I also have a guest co-host who lives around the corner if an emergency arises.
house_rules: Please be respectful of the neighbors.
host_about: I am an Artist, Curator and College Professor in the Department of Art -   Can't live without: good healthy plant based food - (I am a vegan/vegetarian), Love  to visit Museums, Art Galleries, Shopping and International Travel.  I like quiet, neat, clean spaces and engaging conversation with people from everywhere in the world. I was born and raised in Chicago's Hyde Park and consider it my home.  I travel to England, France and Italy regularly and still have some places I want to see.

name: Mellow Melody - Gorgeous Loft Studio by Short Stay
summary: Welcome to MELLOW MELODY in the historic Uptown neighborhood, less than four blocks from the lake in a full amenities building! Whether you're looking for a night in with your sweetheart, or a night out with your friends – Uptown has historic architecture, music, nightlife, and unique multi-cultural cuisine to enjoy! After a day out exploring, head back to the home and visit the boxing gym, indoor pool, and full bar, right inside the building! Business or pleasure, you've found the perfect spot!
space: Sleeping Arrangements  Living Room - pull out sleeper sofa (queen)  Loft - 1 Queen bed  The sleeping area of the home is lofted and accessed only via ladder. We recommend that children under the age of 13 and people with mobility concerns sleep on the pullout sofa. Also note the ceiling height from the bed in the photos of the loft.  Kitchen   The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pants, utensils, silverware, plates, bowls, cups, knives, a cutting board, salt and pepper, a coffee maker, and cream and sugar – for however you take it.     Cleaning Supplies   You’re supplied with dish soap, a sponge, dish detergent and paper towels. Washer/Dryer  There is a washer/dryer in unit. We provide you with detergent for your stay! TV The Roku guide is posted next to the TV. There is also a digital antenna for local channels. Please remember to sign out of any of any Roku apps you’ve utilize duringyour stay. neighborhood_overview: For live music and nightlife, sit back for some jazz at the Green Mill, a 100-year-old classic where the swanky atmosphere harkens back to prohibition's heyday. Or for a lively mix, go for either indie rock, salsa concerts, world-class boxing or colorful wrestling matches at the Riviera or Aragon. Historical landmarks districts in Uptown Square are just some of the architectural highlights. Immerse yourself in the present while experiencing history,  just have a sample of the ethnic cuisines that have found a home in the neighborhood. On Argyle Street and the surrounding blocks, you can take a tour of Asia with destination restaurants serving up Beijing duck, sushi, traditional Chinese dim sum and Vietnamese specialties like banh mi and pho. Adding to the variety are ethnic grocers mixed among Ethiopian, Lebanese, Indian cuisine and SO much more.
notes: Check In / Check Out Check in starts at 4 PM CT Check out time is 11 AM CT We do not offer early Check In or late Check Out.  Luggage Hold  If your travel arrangements have you arriving earlier or leaving later than our designated check in / check out times, we recommend using Wait Here Chicago. We have a partnership with them and can offer you discounted rates on their luggage hold options throughout the city. Pets There is a $25/pet per booking fee.  We know that all dogs are good dogs but the building's breed restrictions are listed below. There are no weight restrictions, but if your buddy falls under one of these categories unfortunately we wouldn't be able to host them: Pit Bull, American Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier, Shaffordshire Bull Terrier, Rottweiler, Doberman Pinscher, Chow Chow, Akita, Presa Canario and /or Wolf Hybrids. While we trust that your pet plays well with others, we know that accidents happen. In the event of an issue involving your pet, you
transit: There is no dedicated parking space for the home. We recommend using apps like SpotHero to locate discounted street or garage spots nearby.  Additionally, there is loads of public transportation! Just a few blocks from the red line for getting in and out of the loop/downtown. There are also buses on every street corner. The neighborhood is all completely walkable for anything you can possibly need on the fly.
access: You will have access to all of the building's beautiful and unique amenities. All of which include a gorgeous gym,  stunning pool, and beautiful outdoor area with fire pit.
interaction: We are off-site but available when needed. The best way to reach us is by emailing (Email hidden by Airbnb)  In case of maintenance emergency, the in-unit home guide will detail phone numbers of who to call immediately.
house_rules: General Rules -Absolutely no smoking is permitted anywhere inside the home or any outdoor areas. There will be a $500 fee imposed if we receive a complaint or find evidence of smoking in the home. -Please treat the home as if it is your own. -Please respect our guest limit capacity of 4 people. -Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property. -If you accidentally damage anything during your stay, please contact the host for your safety and the future safety of the next guest. -We pride ourselves on being green and would appreciate you turning off the TV and lights when you check-out. -Please remember to sign out of any ROKU apps you utilized via your personal accounts before departing. Quiet Hours Quiet hours are between 10p-8a.  This is a residential building and ask that for the respect of permanent tenants basic courtesies of being mindful of your noise levels and not congregating in hallways outside of the unit be observed.  Receiving a noise complaint from the buildi
host_about: Hello! Thanks for checking out our homes in beautiful Chicago! Livly Short Stay has a few hosts that will be communicating with you and we can’t wait to get to know you and welcome you to the city. Hosting as a team makes communicating with us even faster and we're looking forward to taking care of curating a perfect stay for you. Talk to you soon!

name: Just Rosy Room in Boho Artist Home
summary: Welcome to my home. I offer a clean place to rest your head, and bathe, in an alternative to a sterile expensive hotel. There are four guest rooms total. You get a Private Room in a  Victorian 2 flat. Trees and gardens surround this urban diverse neighborhood. Free street parking, CTA bus at the front door. Real bed, shared full bath, individual air con unit, or heat unit as well as central heat. West of downtown by 10 minutes drive, 3 miles, or 20 min by public transit. By United Center.
space: The building stands alone with community gardens all around. Light comes in from all directions here on the second floor. I have the whole floor! Warm homey Victorian 2 flat, dark wood floors and clean new fixtures. Free street parking. I have three other guest rooms. I mentioned "smoking allowed" but only outdoors please, the apartment is smoke free.

Warm homey Victorian 2 flat, dark wood floors and clean new fixtures. Free street parking. I have three other guest rooms. I mentioned "smoking allowed" but only outdoors please, the apartment is smoke free. First of all, Welcome! Feel free to use the living room in front of the bedroom. Coffee or tea anytime, self serve. I have hair dryer, shampoo, razors a
neighborhood_overview: When choosing and rating my location, please understand this about my neighborhood: it is not a suburb, not an upscale neighborhood, but my street is very nice with a few run down looking places in the mix. I see myself as part of the solution. I love it here because it is not crowded, and it is so close to downtown. I walk around at night, but I am sensible about it. The train station area is crummy looking, let's admit it. Don't judge me or my street by that! most train stations are a little run down. My area is adjacent to so much. Garfield Park Conservatory is near, United Center, Humboldt Park, Ukrainian Village are about a mile or so away. There are great spots to eat all along Chicago Avenue, California and Division both have lots of neighborhood eateries and bars, funky boutiques. Logan Square is a short ride away, with all it's hot spots. And of course access to downtown with all it's high end shopping, attractions, and the Lake! is just east of me easily accessible by train.
notes: Our neighborhood is on the edge of what used to be an industrial corridor, now transitioning to being used for artsy offices and band practice lofts, breweries and artsy places to have weddings and such. Houses up and down the street are being cleaned up fixed up daily. Whereas it is not a POSH upscale neighborhood, a new private school across the street a couple years ago gave the whole area an upswing, but we can still park free!
transit: CTA Route 94 South California stops at the front door.  Southward, (towards 95th and Damen) 2 stops, it goes right to the Green Line train, at the California station.  Northward (toward Kedzie) 2 stops, it connects to CTA Bus Route 66 Chicago Ave bus and the 52 North California bus route. Very easy.  Uber and Lyft both come here happily, and I have a good relationship with the drivers that I get often.  There is a bike rental (Divvy) right by the California train stop, and one a block north of me at a green center. I have my own bike so I haven't used Divvy, but there are racks all over the city to rent it or return it. You can also take a bike on the bus, loaded on the front rack, or on the train if it is not rush hour.
access: First of all, Welcome! Feel free to use the living room in front of the bedroom. Coffee or tea anytime, self serve. I have hair dryer, shampoo, razors and tooth brushes if you need. Use the kitchen if you like, but tidy up after. PLEASE DON'T COOK MEAT HERE.
interaction: I can help you find stuff if you like, navigate transportation if needed. We can chat or not, whatever your style is.
house_rules: Smoking section is out on the porch.  Responsible enjoyment of alcohol. No other pets please.  Please lock the doors behind you when entering and exiting. If I am not home when you check out, you may leave the keys in the mailbox on the front gate. Do not leave the air conditioning on in your room when you are not home. Please respect our neighbors and keep it down some.  Do not cook meat here. Eat it if you want, but cook it elsewhere. Please leave things tidy. If your shoes are wet or muddy please take them off. Otherwise, do as you would at home.
host_about:
I am an artist in textile, costume, theater and fashion. I do much of my work at home;  in my studio.
 I spend as much time out on the porch as possible, doing writing and some stitching, tending flowers and a veggie garden out in the surrounding yards. I have my own little happy zone right here in the middle of a major metropolitan city, including friendly neighbors.
My little rat terrier Mayzee is my constant companion. 
Things I like to do...  Indie Films usually turn out to be my faves.  I go to some live theater, as well as help make it here in town. Books, got to have books always. And Bike Riding!.  I probably would love yoga if I would think to do it more Ha! 
Veggie food for me, sometimes I like to cook. Former foodie, did my time in the restaurant biz. 
If you would stay over here with me, you are welcome to make yourself at home.  Have your privacy or hang out, I leave it to you. My dog may like to have a cuddle, if you are up for that. You might want to hang by the electric fireplace heh, very mod, and toasty. I have lots of books to peruse for such an evening.
I know in traveling I look for the food of the people! I can tell you my spots or help you find what you might be looking for. Or bring take out, eat in the living room, or back porch if you like al fresco. 
But maybe you just want to  crash someplace tidy and less sterile than a hotel, that's cool. The building is old, maybe a hundred years? but it has all new plumbing and such, so I feel it is the best of both worlds. 
I don't know that I have a life motto, but I firmly believe in doing what makes me happy!
I look forward to meeting interesting people on their travels; feeds the brain!

name: Ultimate King Bed and En Suite Bath Guest Room
summary: This private king sized bedroom and en suite  bathroom are located in a rehabilitated Victorian style mansion three bedroom guest unit. Just steps away from the Damen blue line stop, we designed this one of a kind space with your ultimate comfort in mind. Attached to a large centralized shared space that features a kitchen, pantry, laundry room and loft, this room is perfect for couples, small families, and jet setters alike here on a quiet street in Chicago's hottest neighborhood!
space: In addition to the other amenities listed, this bedroom comes equipped with its own Apple TV, Netflix, Amazon Echo Dot, luggage rack, mini-fridge, electric tea kettle, white noise machine, humidifier, iron, and ironing board. The closet space is ample enough for a queen size air mattress or a pack and play.
description: This private king sized bedroom and en suite  bathroom are located in a rehabilitated Victorian style mansion three bedroom guest unit. Just steps away from the Damen blue line stop, we designed this one of a kind space with your ultimate comfort in mind. Attached to a large centralized shared space that features a kitchen, pantry, laundry room and loft, this room is perfect for couples, small families, and jet setters alike here on a quiet street in Chicago's hottest neighborhood! In addition to the other amenities listed, this bedroom comes equipped with its own Apple TV, Netflix, Amazon Echo Dot, luggage rack, mini-fridge, electric tea kettle, white noise machine, humidifier, iron, and ironing board. The closet space is ample enough for a queen size air mattress or a pack and play. As this is our home, we'll be around during your stay on the first and second floor, but completely out of your way and respectful of your privacy. Need anything? Contact me and I will do my best to help!
neighborhood_overview: There's no neighborhood quite like ours where Wicker Park and Bucktown meet. Incredibly walkable, our location is steps from historic beer baron mansions, the stunning Robey and Flat Iron buildings, all the shopping, eating, and night life fun of North, Damen, and Milwaukee avenues, and public parks like Wicker Park and the 606: the Bloomingdale Trail.
transit: Public transportation couldn't be easier. The Blue Line train runs right by our house and is often the best way to get to and from O'Hare Airport. The Damen Blue Line stop can be seen from our backyard, and is only a five minute ride to the heart of downtown and access to the rest of Chicago. Three bus lines all intersect at the Wicker Park Bucktown six corners and make getting anywhere in the city a breeze. For a more scenic experience, rent a Divvy bike from the station fifty feet away!
interaction: As this is our home, we'll be around during your stay on the first and second floor, but completely out of your way and respectful of your privacy. Need anything? Contact me and I will do my best to help!
house_rules: Please be respectful to us and other guests. Please keep noise to a minimum after 10pm and before 8am. Please ask before inviting a non resident over. Please remove make up with the dark towels or cotton pads. Please do your best not to track in mud or wet shoes and do not leave shoes on the entrance mat. There's a mat in your room for wet shoes.
host_about:
I'm an actor and creative professional living with my partner, Tyler, in the city. We're easy going and social guys, and enjoy hosting our friends and family so much that we want to extend an invitation to share our space to you!

My epitaph will read: Always leave them wanting more.

name: Discounted Rates! Huge Victorian -- United Center!
summary: *Please note our increased safety measures  in "Other things to note"  Imagine yourself spending the weekend in a beautiful New Orleans style maison dropped into the heart of the Windy City. Huge gorgeous Victorian lovingly restored to its' original glory. Approximately 4000 square feet, this house does not disappoint.  Pool table parlor, speakers throughout, roof deck. This three story home (plus basement) is great for larger groups, modest events, etc. 5 minute walk to the United Center!
space: The entire home is yours for the duration of your stay.  This massive gorgeous corner home just a couple blocks west of the United Center has been painstakingly restored with attention to detail and just a bit of southern flair.  Explore three full floors featuring six fireplaces, multiple parlors, dining room, light filled atrium, backyard with fire pit, pool table, music lover dream lounge (over 20 signed guitars!), 3 good sized bedrooms and a huge master suite on the third floor with private roof deck. You will love staying here.

notes: There is no higher priority for us than the health and safety of our guests, staff and co-hosts. During this unique time in travel Open House Hospitality is taking extra precautions to prevent the spread of the Covid 19 virus. We want you to feel confident when inhabiting one of our properties. As a result, we have enhanced some of our cleaning procedures in the interest of everyone's health and safety. In conjunction with the director of our cleaning team we've come up with the following additional measures beyond our standard cleaning to help ensure the safety of everyone who enters our properties. All surfaces are being wiped down with disinfectant after each guest with special attention being paid to door handles, pulls, remote controls and other often touched surfaces, all linens and towels are being washed with both detergent and bleach and we are misting the entire home with Lysol disinfecting spray in between each group of guests to help mitigate any airborne pathogens. Even wi
transit: Blue line is just two blocks away!
access: The entire home is yours for the duration of your stay!
interaction: Our property manager is always available!
house_rules: House Rules: 1.	Check in is at 4 p.m. Check out is at 11 a.m. Early check in or late check out may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated check out time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses. 2.	Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you are booking within your city.  3.	Smoking and vaping are not allowed on the property, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages. 4.	No parties/events without prior authorization. Seriously. Event fees do apply.  This includes any form of bachelor/bachelorette party. Please inquire with specific event requests.   5.	Quiet hours are 11:00 p.m. to 8:00 a.m. on weeknights, and 12:30 a.m. to 8:00 a.m. on weekends. This is a quiet neighborhood and we have close neighbors. We kindly ask that you be considerate of our neighbors at all

name: Ukrainian Village, CUTE FLAT, close to Wicker Park
summary: Industrial chic large-windowed, bright flat overlooking the brownstones of Ukrainian Village. 700 ft from Mariano's, in between High Dive and Tuman's Bar and Tap, and across from the Rookery. 10-15 minute walk from Wicker Park action on Division St. Safe, quiet neighborhood.
description: Industrial chic large-windowed, bright flat overlooking the brownstones of Ukrainian Village. 700 ft from Mariano's, in between High Dive and Tuman's Bar and Tap, and across from the Rookery. 10-15 minute walk from Wicker Park action on Division St. Safe, quiet neighborhood. Living room, bathroom, and kitchen available for use. Welcome to stream TV or play PS4/Wii. I will likely be home but working. The neighborhood really is beautiful. Personally, I walk to Wicker Park for a wild night and feel safe walking back down Damen. For a more relaxed night, I go to any of the bars on Chicago Ave. Parking on the street is usually available, but be wary of street cleaning/construction notices. Chicago Ave bus stop right across the street, which can take you closer to a blue line station. You can also take the Western bus down to the Western Metra stop.

name: Vintage charmer at Kedzie and Armitage
summary: This adorable garden unit is perfect for visitors looking for a hip, neighborhood experience. Steps from an amazing, yet low key cocktail bar (Scofflaw), one of Chicago's ten best restaurants (Giant), a cozy dive bar (Best Intentions) and a lively blues club (Rosa's Lounge) you may never leave the block! Ideal for business travelers, couples, friends or small families. Happy to have you for any length of time - a few days to a few months!  Pets welcome.
space: The unit has a funky, fun look and hopefully feels like a home away from home.
description: This adorable garden unit is perfect for visitors looking for a hip, neighborhood experience. Steps from an amazing, yet low key cocktail bar (Scofflaw), one of Chicago's ten best restaurants (Giant), a cozy dive bar (Best Intentions) and a lively blues club (Rosa's Lounge) you may never leave the block! Ideal for business travelers, couples, friends or small families. Happy to have you for any length of time - a few days to a few months!  Pets welcome. The unit has a funky, fun look and hopefully feels like a home away from home. Aside from the unit itself, you will have access to a shared laundry room (free), secure bike storage, and shared backyard patio. I live on the top floor of the building and can be available as needed. I love Chicago and sharing what I know about the City and things to do. The property is located in between the Logan Square and Humboldt Park neighborhoods, just two blocks from the 606 elevated pedestrian, bike and running trail. You will also be steps from Ke
neighborhood_overview: The property is located in between the Logan Square and Humboldt Park neighborhoods, just two blocks from the 606 elevated pedestrian, bike and running trail. You will also be steps from Kedzie and Humboldt Boulevards (as well as 3 blocks from Palmer Square and Humboldt Park itself) providing ample green space to enjoy. Both neighborhoods offer a lot of action including a movie theater, farmer's market, and the creative food and beverage Chicago is known for.
notes: An air mattress for additional guests can be provided upon request. The unit has a very well stocked kitchen in terms of utensils and cookware. You should have everything you need if you'd like to cook at home.
transit: Located one block from a CTA bus stop (Armitage #73) that will take you directly to the Western station of the CTA Blue Line (this is especially useful in winter months). Other Blue Line stations (Logan and California) are each a 15 minute walk away. Divvy bike share stations are also within walking distance.

name: Monthly rent avail 1/1 entire place near Downtwn
summary: You will love the location of my place, it is in the middle of a vibrant neighborhood and next to the beautiful OZ park and only a few blocks away from the Lake and the Chicago Lincoln Park ZOO which is free. You’ll love my place because of the coziness and the location which is only a couple of blocks from the Fullerton train station (the L) and with the Bus station going to downtown right in the corner. My place is good for couples / small family, solo adventurers, and furry friends (pets).
space: This is a cozy apartment very spacious with a very nice open living/dining area and it is easily accessible in the first floor of my building (no climbing stairs). You will have access to your room, your own bath and an ample open space with an ample kitchen with stainless steel appliances a huge bar with a wine cooler and a cozy living room with a wood burning fire place. A laundry room is conveniently located next door and it is coin operated (Quarters only) and it is very affordable to wash only $1 for wash and 50c to Dry and I usually provide some laundry detergent to get you started. In my place you will find great amenities such as plush bedding, down pillows, rain showers, toiletries, hair dryers, Iron / board, cooking essentials, facial tissue, hand sanitizer etc.  Baby / Toddler necessities such as a high chair and pack and play can be provided FREE of charge upon request.

neighborhood_overview: Lincoln Park is one of the most popular and vibrant neighborhood in Chicago. Very near to DePaul University we have numerous great restaurants and bars on the same block as the apartment right on lincoln Avenue, plus a variety of fast food options, including Potbelly, Jimmy John's, Domino's, Chipotle, and more. There is a Starbucks not even half block away for your morning fix. There is a huge, beautiful public park (Oz Park) on the same block, and Lincoln Park Zoo is about a half mile east.
notes: 24 Hour Check in available and also I love Pets and they can stay at the apartment for a small fee and previously arrangements made with me. This apartment is also available as a 2 bedroom apartment for a slightly higher rate and can accommodate a couple more guests. Baby / Toddler necessities such as a high chair and pack and play can be provided FREE of charge upon request.  Please note there is a motion sensor security camera in the livingroom used ONLY for security purpose.
transit: Walking distance to red, brown, purple line CTA trains at the Fullerton train station and can take you straight into downtown ´the loop´ in less than 15 minutes or Wrigley field a couple of stations north. In addition there are multiple bus stops and a Divvy bike (Chicago´s bike sharing service) a block away. Taxis can usually be flagged easily on Lincoln Avenue although I prefer UBER and LYFT and they are always available as this is a popular neighborhood.
access: Guest can arrive at any time. I have an intercom system where I can be called from and then grant you access to the building and the apartment. And I am near by and available by cell phone to assist if needed. I can also lend you a couple of bikes FREE if you like that method of transportation.
interaction: I will most likely greet you in person and I can definitely provide lots of recommendations on places to go and things to do. And although I wont be staying at the apartment with you I will be near by and available for any needs. If you are new to Chicago and would like me to take show you around and take you to some of my favorite places I would be happy to do so and I can try to accommodate depending on my work schedule. If you are traveling internationally and need a local cell phone with internet access I can provide that for a small flat rate fee.
house_rules: Just no loud Music and no Smoking inside the building Please. There is a $110 fee replacement if keys are lost (imposed by association) as front door is a high security lock. Please Note there is a motion sensor security camera in the Livingroom only which is mostly off and ONLY sends alerts for security purposes.
host_about: I love outdoor and water sports, and since moving to Miami I have picked up Kayaking, Paddle boarding and Kite boarding.  I am a Professional systems engineer and consultant and constantly travel for work or leisure so my place is often available and has everything you will need for a pleasure or business trip and if there is anything I can do to make your trip more enjoyable just ask and I will be do my best to make it happen. I know Miami and Chicago pretty well so I can provide any recommendations from Best restaurants, cheap eats or things to do just hit me up :)

name: Cozy 2BR-2BA a block away from Millenium Park
summary: Enjoy this amazing and renovated 2BR 2BTH  apartment located in the heart of Chicago's Loop.  This spacious and naturally lit apartment is just one block away from Michigan Ave and Millennium Park, the famous Chicago Theatre on State St and two blocks away from the Chicago River and its beautiful riverwalk.  In addition, all CTA lines are just within one or two blocks away, making this the perfect location for travelers visiting our amazing city!
space: Modern and chic corner unit in Downtown Chicago with pretty views of the city. Big windows in every room allow plenty of natural light to come into the space. Equipped with a fully stocked kitchen including a toaster, coffee maker and everything you need to enjoy a nice breakfast. One master bedroom with two comfy queen-size beds, a smaller bedroom with another queen size bed and two fully equipped bathrooms compose the apartment. For larger parties, our sofa bed can be turned into an additional queen size bed so that everyone in the group can comfortably rest after a long day. D1AATAGGM3 G0GPDJ11PP PARKING There is no parking available in the building, however there are many Parkings nearby!What I recommend is searching online for "BestParking Chicago" and booking in advance.  This way you get the best deals in the area, as parkings tend to be quite pricey in the city.  We are on Washington & Wabash!

neighborhood_overview: You will be in downtown Chicago. There are endless activities all year round. Walking distance from the Art Institute of Chicago, the Cloud Gate, Millenium Park, Grant Park, Buckingham Fountain, etc. There are plenty of fancy restaurants nearby as well as shopping available in State street and the Magnificent Mile in Michigan Ave. The Chicago River is 3 blocks away.
transit: You will be in 'The Loop'. This means you will be connected to all CTA train lines, walking distance from the Blue Line that will take you to-from the airport in less time than it takes to drive. There are hundreds of bus lines that pass through within a block that will take you anywhere in the Chicago area.
interaction: Highly available at any time of the day. Please feel free to reach me with any question, issue or concern you may have!  Communication through the Airbnb platform is preferred.
house_rules: Smoking and use of drugs are strictly prohibited in this unit. Guests that fail to comply with these rules will accept losing 100% of the security deposit. Parties are not allowed No smoking is allowed Please do not use shoes on the carpet

name: Modern Apartment in Wicker Park / West Town
summary: Modern Apartment in bustling Wicker Park / West Town 21% Discount for 7+ days.  Available all last week of March.
space: My place is still coming together, as I only make purchases that I'm in love with, and am letting it grow into itself.  The photos are mostly up to date although the second room desk has been swapped out for something more minimal. I am pretty confident that anyone fond of modern design will enjoy it.  It has a decent sound system and plenty of space to relax in.  When I bought this space, it was the only one I actually saw in person.  Most Chicago condos have somewhat small living rooms, but mine is substantially bigger.  I knew it's what I wanted and went for it.

name: Cozy Room in Recently Renovated Apartment
summary: A cozy bedroom in a friendly shared 3-bedroom apartment in a recently renovated building. The bedroom has two windows facing north, and is fully furnished with a double bed, a nightstand, a small dresser, and a walk-in closet. The apartment is conveniently located in the heart of the lovely Hyde Park neighborhood, between the University of Chicago campus, Lake Michigan (Promontory Point), and the commercial district on the 53rd Street.
space: The bedroom is fully furnished with a double bed, a nightstand, a small dresser, a walk-in closet, a nightstand and a bed lamp. Suitable for one person or a couple. The shared area of the apartment includes a living room with sofas, TV, and a fine collection of books (poetry, fiction, and philosophy), a beautiful dining room with a wooden table for 6 people, a kitchen with a refrigerator, a dish washer, and an oven, two bathrooms with shower and bathtub. Two sun rooms at the front and back of the apartment are perfect spot for sitting down and having a sip of coffee, chilling out or doing work. There is also a newly purchased treadmill which you are welcome to use for daily exercise.
description: A cozy bedroom in a friendly shared 3-bedroom apartment in a recently renovated building. The bedroom is fully furnished with a double bed, a nightstand, a small dresser, a walk-in closet, a nightstand and a bed lamp. Suitable for one person or a couple. The shared area of the apartment includes a living room with sofas, TV, and a fine collection of books (poetry, fiction, and philosophy), a beautiful dining room with a wooden table for 6 people, a kitchen with a refrigerator, a dish washer, and an oven, two bathrooms with shower and bathtub. Two sun rooms at the front and back of the apartment are perfect spot for sitting down and having a s
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is conveniently located in a recently renovated building in the heart of the Hyde Park neighborhood, close to the University of Chicago campus, Lake Michigan (Promontory Point), the commercial district on the 53rd Street (with shops and restaurants), and the famous Museum of Science and Industry. All of these within walking distance! There are two very nice bakery cafes (Fabiana's, Sip and Savor) on the same street one block away. Ten-minute walk to Target, Whole Foods Market and Hyde Park Shopping Center (with Walgreens, Office Depot, Elston Ace Hardware, and US Post Office). One block away from lake front, where you can swim in the summer and enjoy the view of the lake and the city!
transit: Convenient access to public transportation. The bus stop 54th St/S Hyde Park Blvd is right in front of the house. From there Bus 6 takes you to downtown Chicago (the Loop) in less than 30 minutes. Bus 171 takes you to the University of Chicago main campus in less than 10 minutes. The 51st/53rd Street Metra Station is located two blocks away.
access: All shared areas (all areas other than personal bedrooms, including kitchen, living room, and dining room) are accessible to you.
interaction: You can always reach me by mobile phone, email, and airbnb message function. In general, you will be sharing the apartment with three roommates (each has their own bedroom). We are friendly, sociable graduate students at the University of Chicago in various disciplines. We love hosting guests and are willing to help if there is anything you need.
host_about: Graduate student at the University of Chicago

name: Beautiful Arty Bucktown Haven
summary: Creative, peaceful 2 bedroom apartment in a great neighborhood, just a few blocks from all the local action, a beautiful park, and great restaurants and shops. A fine stroll in every direction. Welcoming.
space: The space Space This is an entire 2nd floor flat in a 100 year old 2 flat building. It has tons of character and sunshine. Set up with a cozy, traditional Chicago living room as you enter. There are 2 bedrooms - one off the living room - my own - and one off the kitchen with a Queen-sized bed, a hutch and and closet (with hangers) for folding or hanging clothes. There is 1 spacious bathroom with a tub and shower. This bathroom has everything you need, including fresh towels, toothpaste, soap and shampoo for your convenience. Down the hall is a great kitchen with a small breakfast counter and a great wood block island in the center, if you like to cook. You are welcome to enjoy a hot beverage in the morning breeze, as coffee, tea, cream & sugar will be provided for you. Grab any book off the shelf, relax and read in a sunny spot, or kick your feet up and be entertained by the Apple TV or Netflix. Major stations are available by internet only. neighborhood_overview: Bucktown is Old Chicago with a neighborhood feel and centrally located. There is an historic park with a public pool a block away (Holstein Park). We are a walk away from boutiques, coffee shops and great restaurants. A bustling area with multiple music venues, the 606 (elevated walk/bikeway), and of course, great spots for people watching. Less than 1 mile from Wrigleyville, Lincoln Park & and a few blocks away from Wicker Park. Downtown is just 5 miles; Millennium Park (the Bean) Navy Pier or walk the museum campus. Take advantage of what Chicago has to offer!
transit: Getting around. Easy street parking. Transportation is a breeze, in Chicago and in this neighborhood specifically! The apartment is a 10 minute walk to the CTA Blue Line train, to downtown. The Blue line goes to O'hare Airport, as well (in the opposite direction). The apartment is between the Loop (downtown) and O'hare. CTA also boasts a great bussing system, or you can find Divvy bikes throughout city. Ride share services like Uber and Lyft are also super convenient and very active, in Chicago. You should have no problem getting around while you enjoy your time in our city!
interaction: I will be your dependable contact person via text/tele during your stay.  In the event that you need anything or have questions, please be in touch. I work much of the day, although my schedule varies.  I also have a co-host in the neighborhood, in the event that I am not readily available, you will be able to reach out to her. I do hope you enjoy your stay. I'm always looking to improve guest experiences, so don't be shy about giving me feedback :)
host_about:
Originally from upstate NY now a Midwesterner I've been living in Chicago for 20 years working as a sign language interpreter.  I worked with the Dalai Llama and it seems to be the story everyone likes. Who wouldn't!

Generally quiet, always clean and interested to know more about where I am. Thanks in advance for providing a place to stay.  

Lissa

name: Beautiful & Inspiring Three Bedroom Home in Roscoe Village
summary: Dim the lights and kick back on the couch, in the evening after a day’s adventures, leaving all cares behind. The stunning apartment located in a historic 1895 Chicago building, has a modern, ultra-cool feel, with an inspiring vibe and sensational light fixtures. Roscoe Village is a charming, laidback “village within the city” filled with taverns, independent shops, and cute cafes. Being only a short walk to the train and a 15-minute cab ride to Chicago's downtown landmarks, this home has the perfect combination of convenience, comfort, and cool.

neighborhood_overview: Just 5 miles from downtown, Roscoe Village is a charming, laidback “village within the city” filled with casual taverns, independent shops, and cute cafes that spill out onto the sidewalks during the warm weather months. This cozy little pocket is an eclectic mix of unique boutiques, classic frame and brick homes, and locally owned eateries.
notes: No parties and no drugs of any kind. We appreciate you respecting our neighbors. Pets are subject to breed restrictions. Pet fees: 1st pet: $125 per reservation for up to 2 nights and $45 per night after.  2nd pet: $50 per reservation for up to 2 nights and $45 per night after.

Whether you're in Chicago on business, having fun with friends, visiting family, and vacationing with your children, you'll find this universal home to have every desired amenity. Business travelers can enjoy awesome high speed internet and a creative office space with great natural light. For groups of friends, the bedrooms feature a ton of closet space, giant dining / living room for catching up over a drink, and a full brand new kitchen to cook in. For traveling families and little ones, the office transforms into a kids room with a travel crib and changing mat.

Hello All and Welcome!

I’m super excited to be a part of this community and be able to help people feel right at home. Real estate and hospitality are my two passions and I absolutely love the world of Air BNB. My goal is to provide 5-STAR experience to every guest and I do whatever it takes to deliver it!

name: 2 Bedroom Apartment in the ❤️ Of Pilsen!
summary: Cozy 2 Bedroom Apartment, with open living, dining and kitchen area. Stainless steel appliances, gas stove and hardwood floors. Lots of natural sun light. Each Bedroom has a FULL SIZE  bed, closet, chair and luggage rack for your convenience. Bathroom with bathtub, sink, Bath room heater, granite tiles. We provide fresh towels after 3rd day of stay. Kitchen has a 5 piece dining set. Ideal for students, interns, consultants! Long term stay available.
space: Each Bedroom has a FULL SIZE bed, night stand, closet and luggage racks.  Living room has a Futon. Could sleep up to 5 people. 5th person no extra charge but a $20 housekeeping fee will be added. Granite tile full bathroom with heater. Linen, towels, shampoo, conditioner and body wash provided. Each Bedroom has a FULL SIZE  bed, closet, chair and luggage rack for your convenience. Bathroom with bathtub, sink, Bath room heater, granite tiles. We provide fresh towels after 3rd day of stay. Kitchen has a 5 piece dining set. Ideal for students, interns, consultants! Long term stay available. Each Bedroom has a FULL SIZE bed, night stand, closet and luggage racks.
