neighborhood_overview: Quiet Neighborhood, Perfect location for medical students. ( long term stay available). Medical District is less then 2 miles away.  Close to downtown Chicago, express ways, shopping and major tourist attractions. Chicago is the hub for foodies, and we have "frozen in time" Italian family owned restaurants around the corner, as well as amazing Mexican cuisine.  "Lagunitas" the famous Chicago brewery is a lively taproom offering beer tastings, great food and life music in the neighborhood.
notes: Attention Drivers!  Please let us know, if you arrive by car.  Street Parking on Western Ave. only! First comes first serves.  We provide a designated parking space for $20 per day upon availability.
transit: CTA and the Pink Line are all within 7min. walking distance.  Uber and lyft are always available. No need for rental cars. We have great public transportation in and around the city. 15/20 min with pink line train to downtown Chicago.
access: You access the apartment with a key. Keyless entry, code will be provided before check in.
interaction: If you need a ride from the airport, please ask.  Complimentary coffee, tea and fruits. Knowing that traveling to another city or country could challenge check in times, with notice we can hold your luggage! No pets on the premises, we love them, but allergic.
house_rules: Fun, fun and more fun... your in Chicago! Zero tolerance drug policy on the premises! We are trying to keep the prices reasonable for our guests, but we need your help, please be mindful of our neighbors. For safety and security: Please make sure at all times, the entrance door by the gang way is completely closed when you enter and exit the building. No parties.  Please notify if you bring friends over, no one is permitted, who is NOT listed on this booking, unless we have made prior arrangement. Trash cans are in the back of the house for recycle and regular. No smoking in the house No candles. Please don't use towels for make up removal. 21 and older For minors (students) prior arrangements with parents necessary. Carpe Diem
host_about:
Hey there, welcome to Chicago, great city to explore.  Relocated to Chicago from Miami 2 years ago.  I enjoy entertaining & hosting hence I worked in the hospitality industry for 18 years. Thats why Airbnb is fantastic. From Germany living in the US since the 90s. 
Cooking at home is my preference, but I love a good Thai or Sushi place.
Reading, travels and work out some of my hobbies.
I am an independent contractor for an International Courier Service and travel for work. I also drive Select and Premier for ride share companies.  Enjoy life to the fullest, aging is a privilege. Sooo travel lot's ,make friends and drink some bubbly!

name: Big & Bright Wicker Park Apartment
summary: This bright, plant-filled apartment welcomes you to the artsy and lively neighborhood of Wicker Park. The fourth floor unit is steps from coffee shops, bars, restaurants and more.  An elevator opens directly into the space and the loft-style layout offers plenty of room for 4 people (3 couches, 1 futon). The historic building is over 100 years old!
space: There is a large display monitor in the bedroom with cords to hookup your laptop,  perfect to get some work done!

There is a large display monitor in the bedroom with cords to hookup your laptop,  perfect to get some work done! name: Corporate Room near Downtown (by Lake/Beach)
summary: Located in Chicago's Oakland Historic Landmark District directly across from the Lake/Beach Front in Chicago.  Minutes from the McCormick Place Only 4 minutes drive to Soldier's Field, and Museum Park: Shedd Aquarium, Adler's Planetarium.  Oakland has been preserved in Chicago's History to rebuild after the Great Chicago Fire of October 1871.  Later hosting the Columbian Exposition known as the World's Fair of 1893.  Breath-taking architectural structures and statutes throughout the area.
space: 3 bdrm/2 bath unit, Room #1 located on 1st Floor features full size bed.  Front Room Feature couch, executive desk with chair, rocker, table and more.   ONLY SUITABLE for single (couple or parent and child acceptable with full knowledge of cozy bed arrangement).  NOT SUITABLE FOR 2 Guests desiring separate sleeping arrangements. The entire unit is reserved for 2-4 bnb guests (and 1 bnb boarder).  No sleeping accommodations for the common front living room area allowed. The unit is fully decorated with a modern decor.    Features a fully equipped kitchen.  2 bathrooms  (1 shared shower bathroom; bathroom has a toilet and vanity featuring shower curtains and liners).   For private room w/adjoining bathroom see Description:  1880's Victorian Greystone (Private Skyline view). Inquire about booking both bnb rooms.  Accommodations 2-4 guests. Private side/rear entrance/exit. No smoking allowed indoors at all.  Thanks.

neighborhood_overview: Oakland is one of Chicago's oldest historic districts featuring 1880 Architectural structures, various Statutes, water fountains and historic Landmarks throughout.  My home is a Historic Landmark and registered with the City of Chicago and the Illinois Preservation Agency.  Due to limitations and restrictions regarding this being a landmark property I am not allowed to mount on the North masonry wall.  Therefore there is no light affixed outside the gate.  I have tried several solutions but due to the trees blocking the sunlight the solar solutions are not feasible.  I leave the front and rear porch light on after dusk.  Former President Barak Obama's Home is but 10 blocks South of my home.  There is a shock absorbent track but 1/2 block south.  Mariano's is 5 blocks West (Groceries, light dining and music)  Please check online for schedules music and mixers.  Please Note:  Piano Bar within establishment.
notes: For long-term booking please request towel and linen service (a fee required if available).  Complimentary welcome package consists of 1 sheet set, 1 quilt, 1 blanket, 2-4 pillows, 2 -4 bath towels and 2-4 face towel (as a set), a bath rug and bath mat, starter toiletries (shampoo, body wash and hand soap) and select cleaning supplies.  Please return linen in 1 week not washed.  Please do not wash bnb linen, towels or quilts.  Please inquire to request towel and bed linen service at time of booking [inquire about fee and availability]. Linen service not included.   Please inquire regarding the prospect of securing a month-to-month stay at an even greater discount.  Month-to-month will include some of the bnb amenities like gas/electric, but will not include bed linen and towel service (negotiable for add'l $$ if available).  Smart tv/programming included (stick /Netflix compatible). WiFi included. Please DO NOT LOCK, exit or enter Front Entry Foyer door except for emergency.  Considere
transit: Very close vicinity to downtown by South loop approximately 12 -20 minute bus ride or 7 minute Uber ride.  Even closer to the McCormick Place (to the North) and University of Chicago and Hospital (to the South) both are approx. 8 minute bus ride or a 5 minute UBER ride.  CTA bus, train and Metra are all within walking, biking and convenient distance.  Cottage Grove bus  #4 bus stop location 1 block West of my property takes you direct all the way to downtown in about 15-22 minutes.   Divvy bike docking stations are located throughout the neighborhood.  Please inquire of the Bnb Assistant or Host for any transportation guidance.  Thanks.   Nearby locations easily accessible via public transportation, driving, biking or walking: University of Chicago Columbia College Downtown at South Loop McCormick Place   IIT ( Illinois Institute of Technology ) Mercy Hospital (to North) Jackson Park Hospital (to South) Nearby downtown universities:  Roosevelt University, SAIC, Northwestern University
access: Guests have access to their bedroom, common kitchen and the common front living room area.  No personal items are to be placed or left in the common area.  PLEASE KEEP ALL PERSONAL BELONGINGS INSIDE YOUR BOOKED ROOM.  Each room features a sturdy dead bolt lock.  Note:  None of the 3 bedroom doors features doorknobs.  Prevents doors from being left unlocked by accident.  Door has locking mechanism from the outside and has a swivel lock accessible from the inside of the room.  Guests are allowed access to use the yard for multi-purposes.  No hosting events/parties without express permission (yard nor unit).  Any and all company/guests of booking guests must be introduced to owner (me) for safety reasons.  Please request approval to entertain more than 1 person NON-OVERNIGHT visitor inside the unit or back yard.  [simple courtesy, privacy of others and safety precaution].  All visiting guests must leave by stated time [time will be discussed during approving visit]
interaction: I live on the 2nd/3rd floor duplex up.  So, I am around managing the grounds.  I have my life and you have yours.  That being said please enjoy your stay.  My hope is that your stay  is longer and longer....
house_rules: - Smoking allowed outdoors (rear/front.  Allergies are accommodating regarding allowing/not allowing pet based on 1st guest(s) to book criteria - Check-in is negotiable/flexible upon Host Approval.  Please disclose estimated time of arrival/check-in.  For Instant bookings please contact Host immediately after booking to discuss check-in time - Encourage 30+ day bookings.  Negotiable discount for Month-to-Month.  Inquire regarding a monthly rate for 3+ months or more guaranteed stay.   Significant discount!!!
host_about: I am  an honest fun loving person with a great sense of humor.  Great business aptitude.  Honest to a fault.  My favorite travel destination is Playa Del Carmen Mexico.  I am unapologetically living my life with no excuses for pursuing happiness.  My Life motto is 'Live life as though its rigged for me to succeed'.

name: Domio | South Loop | Luxe 2 BR + Sauna and Fitness Center
summary: Upgrade your Chicago experience and stay in this modern Domio apartment. Walking distance from some of Chicago's best attractions, this stylish space was professionally designed to delight our guest at every corner. There are also restaurants and bars just about 10 min walk. Whether traveling solo, with friends, or with family, see the best of history, architecture, and bites that Chicago has to offer.
space: This space exemplifies the Domio standard: uncompromising style and maximum comfort. This 2 bedroom and 2 bath home boasts a premium living room, premium furniture, and bright finishes. In addition to a fully stocked kitchen with professional-grade appliances, guests will be pleased to find hand-picked decor and artwork throughout the home. This Domio has the following bedroom layout:    Bedroom 1:  Queen Bed    Bedroom 2:  Queen Bed    Living Room:  Sofa Bed   Air Mattress    Additionally, there is a washer/dryer in-unit. Cleanliness is always our top priority. Domio cleans and sanitizes every property between each reservation—following a 100 point checklist. We clean and disinfect all hard surfaces and high touch areas using products approved by public health authorities.

My name is Elena, I live in Chicago and work as Mobile Software Engineer. Beside my job I enjoy traveling, photography and meeting new people.

I love meeting new people and sharing our travel experiences.

name: Wicker Park Condo with Roof Deck & Parking!
summary: Wicker Park condo perfect for your stay! On a quiet side street, shared roof deck, and quick walk to the Blue line. Queen-sized beds make it ideal for traveling with colleagues, friends, and family alike.  Nearby you'll find great restaurants, bars, and shopping, and it's 10 minutes on the Blue line to the Loop for work or sight-seeing (or a 10 minute drive to the West Loop for more of Chicago's famous restaurants!) - book today!
space: You'll walk upstairs and into an open living room / dining room. Around the corner, in its own area (but still in conversation-range!) is the kitchen. Down the hall is the condo's bathroom, and two bedrooms. There's a door at the rear of the condo leading outside - that's where you'll find the stairs up to the roofdeck!

Bucktown and Wicker Park are practically inseparable—the districts bleed into each other so seamlessly, it’s hard to know where one ends and the other begins. The neig
neighborhood_overview: Bucktown and Wicker Park are practically inseparable—the districts bleed into each other so seamlessly, it’s hard to know where one ends and the other begins. The neighborhoods have been the focus of two decades of steady development, and even as they become more accessible to young families and professionals, the neighborhoods maintain an innovative vibe. Thanks to established cultural institutions, walkable strips of galleries, boutiques, bars, and restaurants, Wicker Park and Bucktown continue to be a destination for creative types - and anyone looking for a nice time.
notes: This is a classic Wicker Park walk-up apartment, meaning there is no elevator.
transit: My place is 5 minutes' walk away from the Division Blue line train station, and equally convenient to the Ashland and Division buses - it's almost more convenient to not have a car here! If you do bring your car, however, there's one parking spot right behind the building, and plenty of street parking if you have a second car.
access: You'll have full access to my two-bedroom condo, parking spot, and roofdeck.
house_rules: - House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.   1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.  2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee.  3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 5.) Pets are not allowed at the property. 6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per ke
host_about:
I am originally from Houston, Texas and returned home to start a new position in 2018 after 5+ years in Chicago. 

Chicago will always hold a place in my heart, and I am excited to share my place with visitors to this great city.

My recommendation is to explore as many neighborhoods as possible, each part of the city has a distinctive charm and amazing food!

name: 01. Private Room in Shared Apartment - 3 Mi to NWU
summary: This is for a private room in our apartment. The room contains a full bed and a twin bed. There are two closets for guests to use to store their belongings. The room has a mini fridge for storing personal food items. Breakfast is included in your stay. We keep the pantry stocked with eggs, bacon, milk, orange juice, jam, bread, fruit, pancake mix, coffee and tea. Any of these items can be used to make yourself breakfast in the morning.
space: We run dorm-style listings here with 2 beds per bedroom.  We have and enforce quiet hours from 10pm until 8am in sleeping areas.  We maintain a 24 hour common space that can be used during quiet hours.  We have two bathrooms and two kitchens.  We have gigabit internet shared among everyone.    We have two cats.
description: This is for a private room in our apartment. The room contains a full bed and a twin bed. There are two closets for guests to use to store their belongings. The room has a mini fridge for storing personal food items. Breakfast is included in your stay. We keep the pantry stocked with eggs, bacon, milk, orange juice, jam, bread, fruit, pancake mix, coffee and tea. Any of these items can be used to make yourself breakfast in the morning. We run dorm-style listings here with 2 beds per bedroom.  We have and enforce quiet hours from 10pm until 8am in sleeping areas.  We maintain a 24 hour common space that can be used during quiet hours.  We have two bathrooms and two kitchens.  We have gigabit internet shared among everyone.    We have two cats. Guests have access to their sleeping rooms at any time.  During the evening the upstairs living room is off limits from 10pm until 8am as it is used for sleeping.  We maintain a downstairs kitchen and 24 hour common area on the first floor for use
neighborhood_overview: We are in the far north neighborhood of Chicago almost as far as you can be from downtown while still being in Chicago.  We are the largest concentration of sub-saharan african in the city and as such have an assortment of amazing ethnic food from Jerk Chicken to Senegals national dish.   The Red line that is exactly 1.1 mile walking from our front door run 24 hours a day.  You will encounter homeless people on and around the red line.   Based off the recorded crime statistics from prior years, of 77 neighborhoods in chicago, we are ranked in the lowest 10 neighborhoods for crime.
notes: We run this property as an Airbnb property. It is most similar to a dorm or hostel setup, but cleaner and better amenities than your typical hostel or dorm.   We do not have a lot of privacy here unless you book a private room and on any given day there will be between 10 and 15 people among all three floors and two bathrooms.  If communal living and sharing spaces with other people is a problem for you, please seek out alternative accommodations. If you DO find anything out of place or needing replacement like food, toilet paper or similar, we are very responsive through messaging.  We do twice daily walk throughs but it only takes one guest to mess something up and unless you tell us we wont catch it until our next scheduled walk through.   We schedule by appointment between 2pm and midnight.  If you do not set an appointment, you agree and understand that you may have to wait up to 4 hours past the time you wish to check in due to letting us know within 24 hours of your check in.
transit: 1.1 miles to nearest train station. 45-75 min to Downtown via Public Transit  My house to O’Hare in 60 minutes via bus/train and a single transfer. $35 from My house to O’Hare by flat rate cab. $6 from the nearest train stop to my house by cab  $2.25 from ANY eL stop in Chicago to the Red/Purple Line train stop by my house (Howard)
access: Guests have access to their sleeping rooms at any time.  During the evening the upstairs living room is off limits from 10pm until 8am as it is used for sleeping.  We maintain a downstairs kitchen and 24 hour common area on the first floor for use during quiet hours.  Do keep cooking noises to a minimum during that time.  We have a backyard with fire pit, chairs, and garden that can be enjoyed.  That is the approved smoking area for cigarettes and marijuana.   Guests do not have access to the basement, laundry facilities, or any bedroom they have not booked personally.  Guests may not open or close windows without permission and may not adjust the thermostat.
interaction: We generally work from home and will normally be around.  If we are not, you can always reach us for non-emergencies from about 9am until midnight 7 days a week via Airbnb messaging.  If there is an emergency then please call or bang on our door.   We prefer most questions to be sent via messaging as we have 3 sets of people who monitor those messages and you're likely to get a faster response.  Do not knock on our door for any reason when it's closed unless there is an emergency.   We are happy to give any guest their space, but also have no trouble socializing and interacting with you.  Just make your preferences known!
house_rules: Luggage Storage and Check In Times must be arranged at least 24 hours in advance. Otherwise, check in times are subject to our schedule and may involve waits up to 4 hours from the time you say you would like to be checked in Luggage Storage and Early Check In are subject to availability.   We meet all new guests personally and do a tour and answer questions.  Due to this, it's important to us that you do not wait for us, and we do not wait for you.  Alterations or arriving late to check in times may be subject to a 15 per hour charge to pay an employee to sit around and wait for you.  In some cases, you may have to wait for a few hours for someone to be free to check you in if you change your time last minute to go explore, eat, drink, or visit friends.    If you have provided your flight/train/bus information and we can confirm it was delayed no charges will apply for being late and we’ll make it work.   Quiet time is after 10pm.  What this means is the upstairs common area is off li
host_about:
Hello!  This is Joe, Alex, and sometimes Rob.  If you stay here we will be your hosts while here in Chicago.   

We are Superhosts not because we have a 5 star luxury property, but because we just about always deliver on what we offer.  The best value in Chicago at this price point doing mostly shared, dorm-style accommodations.  

Please read through our entire ad and offering before asking questions or requesting a stay.  If after that you still have questions feel free to ask.  If you dont and just want to book after reading, I'm positive we will deliver a great stay.  

All of our listings include desks, gigabit internet to share, a full array of breakfast items including bacon, eggs, milk, orange juice, coffee, cereal, tea, oatmeal, at least 2x of fruit, 2x of vegi, cheese, home made bread and jam, and we also take requests for other items that you may enjoy like yogurt, almond milk, or other vegis and fruits we dont already have.  We also often cook for guests and like filling the cookie jar with delicious baked goods throughout the month.  

We have been hosting here for 8 years and absolutely love it.    This is our full time profession but we also dabble in mystery shopping as well as online sales and stained glass.  

We love Airbnb, Chicago, and our guests.   If privacy and being in downtown are not important to you, you'll be hard pressed to find a better Airbnb experience in Chicago at this price point and if you do, we'll probably price match =)

We all look forwarding to meeting those of you who book with us!

name: Full Apartment, 3 minute walk from Medical School
summary: The apartment is located next to the University of Chicago's Department of Safety and Security and  the Logan Center for the Arts. The University of Chicago's School of Medicine is a four minute walk, as is the Law School and Social Service Adminstration building. There is also a Jewel Osco across the street. Our apartment is on a well-lit street. Walk to the lake, campus, or any café. Plenty of free parking on the street, too!
space: We are on the third floor of the apartment building. You can access the building's shared laundry room through the patio connected to the kitchen.

neighborhood_overview: There are several places next to and around our apartment. The 61st Street Farmers market sets up every Saturday on our street. There are several bookstores, particularly the Seminary Co-op, and cafés that host book talks. You can catch a free play or movie screening at the Logan Center (behind our building). The CTA green line is also a five minute walk away.  You will have a brand new Jewel Osco next to your stay - with Whole Foods being a 5 minute drive away.
transit: You can get by on the University shuttle (with a visitor identification card), the CTA buses, and the CTA green line - all within a five minute walk.
interaction: We will be available to communicate by e-mail.
house_rules: - No shoes in the house. - No alcohol in the house. - No pork in the house.
host_about: I am a doctoral student at the University of Chicago. I spend the majority of my time reading books. I also enjoy watching (and playing) soccer.

house_rules: -SHOES OFF AT THE DOOR!!!!! Check-in anytime after 3pm. -As an environmentally friendly home, please limit plastic bottle and bag use. We have a reverse osmosis water filter system, bring your reusable bottle! -Please use the drink coaster on your nightstand (Shared Beds). -Lock the doors at all times! Hold door shut and press the “Schlage” button to lock door from outside. Hold door until the motor sound is finished. -No smoking inside. Smoking is allowed outside in the backyard. Do not throw butts on the ground, discard properly in the garbage outside.  -Quiet hours indoors from 11pm-9am, be respectful of other guests in the house. When watching TV, listening to music, etc. please wear headphones during quiet hours. -Quiet hours outdoors 9pm, be respectful of neighbors and the neighborhood! -Do not be rowdy (includes running, stomping, jumping, etc.).  -Absolutely no unauthorized guests are allowed.  -Do not steal; do not touch foods, drinks, and belongings that are not yours.  -Clea

name: Swanky Gold Coast Boutique Hotel - King Bed
summary: Swanky Gold Coast digs in a historic Art Deco tower, an easy stroll to the shop-lined Michigan Avenue and Lake Michigan beachfront.  This private room with a King bed will include: Free WiFi  Flat-screen TV Nespresso coffeemaker Rainfall shower Bath amenities by ROIL and Natura Bisse 24/7 room service Please note that a $20 Urban Fee will be charged upon check-in and collected by the hotel.
space: Classic 120-year-old building with its original brick and terra cotta façade, and posh reimagined interiors which offer a nod to the past while remaining fully in the present. Restful rooms treat you to city or lake views. And Somerset, the onsite restaurant, has Michelin-starred Chef Lee Wolen at the helm. Don’t miss the year-round rooftop bar and seasonal pool overlooking Lake Michigan. The space offers: Devereaux rooftop bar  Somerset Restaurant Morning coffee/tea in lobby Afternoon refreshment beverage in lobby Seasonal rooftop pool Seasonal patio Fitness center House bikes House Tesla Model X Custom pet program

name: Rogue Philanthropy Manor
summary: Our Humboldt Park home features 1.5 bathrooms & a queen size bedroom with air conditioning.  Close to the north ave (72) bus & minutes from the hippest neighborhoods in the city- Wicker Park and Logan Square.
space: Old 120-year-old farm house appeal.  Not a typical city dwelling.  We have an ongoing exhibition of local, outsider artwork throughout our space.
description: Our Humboldt Park home features 1.5 bathrooms & a queen size bedroom with air conditioning.  Close to the north ave (72) bus & minutes from the hippest neighborhoods in the city- Wicker Park and Logan Square. Old 120-year-old farm house appeal.  Not a typical city dwelling.  We have an ongoing exhibition of local, outsider artwork throughout our space. Aside from the bedroom, guests are welcome to use the kitchen, dining room, and porch areas of the house.  Cold and hot coffee are available and our fridge is available for your use/ storage. We'd love to help you navigate the city and give you our feedback as well as share what we love about Chicago. Humboldt Park is an emerging Chicago neighborhood on the near west side.  It's close enough to Wicker Park, Bucktown, and Logan Square that you can easily get to these neighborhoods by bus or lyft/uber but far enough away that it's quiet when you want it to be.   The park is BEAUTIFUL and offers swimming, fishing, tennis, baseball, and socc
neighborhood_overview: Humboldt Park is an emerging Chicago neighborhood on the near west side.  It's close enough to Wicker Park, Bucktown, and Logan Square that you can easily get to these neighborhoods by bus or lyft/uber but far enough away that it's quiet when you want it to be.   The park is BEAUTIFUL and offers swimming, fishing, tennis, baseball, and soccer.  We are also a 5-minute walk to the 606 bike/walk path that enters on either Drake or Lawndale.  This bike path will take you to the Wicker Park, south Logan Square, and Bucktown neighborhoods.
notes: My husband, Dave, is a local Chicago chef and is available for a private tasting menu at our house if you'd like to book that with your stay (not included in Airbnb fees).
transit: We are right by the North Ave  (72) bus that will take you to the Blue L line in 15 minutes and the Red L line in a half hour. Also a short distance from the Chicago (66) bus that will take you to the Red L line.  Lyft/Uber are your best bets in our neighborhood because we are a little ways from city action.
access: Aside from the bedroom, guests are welcome to use the kitchen, dining room, and porch areas of the house.  Cold and hot coffee are available and our fridge is available for your use/ storage.
interaction: We'd love to help you navigate the city and give you our feedback as well as share what we love about Chicago.
house_rules: Smoking outside, please.  We have an old Chocolate lab who is friendly and gets along great with FEMALE dogs.   If you are interested in bringing your dog, please let us know.
host_about:
I'm a Chicago transplant via the Quad Cities and have lived in the city since 1993.  I've lived in several neighborhoods and my husband and I settled in Humboldt park for the diversity of the neighborhood and the beauty of the actual park.  

I'm the founder and executive director of The Arts of Life- a professional arts' studio that supports artists who have developmental/ intellectual disabilities.  We have two studios (Chicago and Glenview) and we'd love to show you around if you are interested in intuitive art and a unique not-for-profit. 

I'm also involved in my husband's not-for-profit, Rogue Philanthropy- a restaurant concept that gives our profits back to local not-for-profits.  

We have a chocolate lab, Tucker,  who loves new people and looks forward to our guests.  We spend most of our free time with him at the park or other forest preserves.  

Favorites:
     Movie- Fight Club// Funny Girl
     Book- Pride & Prejudice// There Eye's were watching God
     Band- The Replacements//Wilco// The Flaming Lips
     TV Show- The Wire
     Bar- Scofflaw
     Restaurant (affordable)- Bite Cafe// Antique Taco
     Restaurant (middle)- Owen & Engine// Cumin 
     Restaurant (expensive)- Green Zebra// Mirai Sushi
     Food- Sushi// Indian

name: Spacious Split-Level - Great for Groups!
summary: This spacious 3 bedroom 3 bath split-level apartment has been carefully furnished and appointed with our guests' comfort in mind. With 2 living rooms and an office area, there is tons of living space. There is easy access to the nearby train station which makes it great for people looking to use public transportation into the city.  This home is a great option for families and large groups looking for a place with plenty of room.
space: **Need to stay long term? Inquire for great discounts by messaging us!** Guests will enjoy all the room and space that our 3 bedroom 3 bath duplex provides. The first floor features a fully stocked kitchen, a large sectional couch and a dining room table which is a great place to share a home-cooked meal. The TV in the living room gives access to streaming services so the whole family can gather round and enjoy Netflix together. The master bedroom has a king bed and en suite bathroom. The smaller bedroom on the first floor has a full sized bed and there's another full bathroom which is shared. Moving downstairs, guests will find a large living space with another couch, futon, and TV. We've also set up a small desk area for our guests that need a place to work. Larger groups can make use of the downstairs bedroom and another full bathroom. There are also laundry machines available for our guests to use.

neighborhood_overview: Lincoln Square is a quiet, safe, residential area in the northwest of the city. Our home is very close to the L station so getting downtown is a breeze. Nearby there are many restaurants and bars which makes having a good time easy, while still being away from the hustle and bustle of downtown.
notes: Please provide an accurate guest count prior to booking. Rates vary throughout the week and season and by number of guests. It's important that your guest count is accurate so we can be sure the home is adequately prepared and stocked for your stay.
transit: The nearest L station is just about a 5-10 minute walk away so getting around is simple. There are also buses that run nearby so you can get practically anywhere in the city.
access: Guests will have access to the entire apartment. There is a tenant in the upstairs apartment, but no spaces are shared. Guests will have access to a 1 car garage. Large SUVs and trucks will not fit.
interaction: We don't live on site but we are always nearby if we need to help in any way.
house_rules: PLEASE NOTE THAT WE CHARGE PER GUEST AFTER A SET NUMBER. PLEASE PROVIDE THE ENTIRE GROUP COUNT IN YOUR RESERVATION REQUEST. IF AN UPDATE TO THE GROUP COUNT IS NEEDED AFTER CONFIRMING THE RESERVATION, THE RESERVATION COST MAY INCREASE. - Quiet hours between 10pm - 7am - Smoking Penalty: $500 + damages - Pet Penalty: $500 + damages - Late Check Out Fee: $25/half hour
host_about:
Hi, Thanks for taking a look at our special homes.

My name is Noah. A few years ago, my family and I got together to create an amazing experience for tourists and guests like you.

We are Chicagoans who love sharing our city with the world and strive to make your stay as comfortable as possible so you can enjoy the city like a local. 

We're passionate about travel. As experienced travelers, we've learned what creates a top notch experience and we're committed to sharing that experience with you. It's something we call "Sweet Home Chicago" and we hope you carry it back with you to where ever you call home! :)

You can find us hanging by the lake, catching a game at Wrigley, grabbing a drink in Wicker Park, enjoying the many concerts going on on any given night, or at any of the amazing local coffee shops across the city.

transit: NEARBY TRANSIT LOCATION: You wont have to go far!  The apartment is located ON a bus line.  Directly across the street you have several options as well. CTA Pass price:  $2.50 per ride; $10 (unlimited Day pass); $20 (3-day); $28 (week) and $100 Monthly rate. METRA: The metra train is also directly across the street and will take you downtown in 20 minutes or towards University Park. name: Lincoln Park Duplex
summary: Great location in Lincoln Park with easy access to all the attractions of downtown, including Lincoln Park Zoo, Conservatory, museums, cafes and Lake Michigan waterfront. Enjoy walking, biking, boating or swimming along the 18-mile Lakefront. Also, weekend neighborhood festivals, music and art festivals, farmers markets, Chicago River and Lakefront cruises, as well as architectural and nature walking tours. The perfect location for a fun-filled break for friends or families!
space: Tastefully furnished 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom duplex with hardwood floors and wall-to-wall carpeting in the bedrooms. The upper floor houses a cozy front room living room with stylish and comfy corner sofas and a flat-screen TV. A corridor connects the living room to a spacious and fully equipped kitchen and dining area for six. The two fully furnished bedrooms are on the ground floor and are equipped with queen size beds and plenty of closet space. There are two full bathrooms with a washer and dryer.

neighborhood_overview: The duplex is located on a beautiful, tree-lined residential street in the Lincoln Park neighborhood of Chicago. What really sets Lincoln Park apart is the area’s namesake park. That’s where you’ll find lushly landscaped grounds, the Lakefront Trail, Lincoln Park Zoo, Lincoln Park Conservatory, North Avenue Beach, Peggy Notebaert Nature Museum, Chicago History Museum, Nature Boardwalk, Farm in the Zoo and theTheater on the Lake. Lincoln Park is also a shopper’s paradise. The charming area around Armitage and Halsted is where you’ll find tons of beautiful boutiques lined up in historic row homes.
transit: The nearest subway station is Armitage, just a four-minute walk from the property, from which you can  take the Brown or Purple Line.  Chicago Transit Authority operates eight elevated train lines and 129 bus routes. They connect the city via above-ground, street-level, and subway trains, and serve 145 rail stations all over town. Two lines operate 24/7: the Blue Line, which connects Chicago O’Hare International Airport and downtown, and the Red Line, with service between the North and South Sides via downtown. Convenient CTA bus routes travel throughout the city, with stops every few blocks. Several lines offer Night Owl service, running until 2 a.m. or later.  Chicago Water Taxis also offer fast, affordable, and fun connections between Chicago’s top tourist destinations, and are the perfect combination of sightseeing and transport. Destinations include Chinatown, Museum Campus, Willis Tower, Michigan Avenue, Union Station, and Navy Pier. Chicago is a city made for cycling. There are

summary: 2 Bedroom, 1 Bath, 2nd Floor Condo unit in a well maintained Brick Complex. To reduce extra costs for you, we expect all gar
neighborhood_overview: Perfect for visiting Chicago all year round. Located close to shopping centers (5-minute walk to Jewel Osco Grocery Store) and a 3-minute walk to Jackson Park Hospital with quick access to public transportation (bus and Metra), Lakeshore Drive, and Hyde Park, and the Museum of Science & Technology. Less than 10 miles away, or a quick 15 minute drive to Downtown Chicago.  Other amenities include a gas station, dollar store, KFC, Popeyes, Burger King, Subway, Starbucks, Dunkin donuts and many more local places within a 1.5 mile radius. The condo is located on the same street as Jackson Park Hospital. There is plenty to do in the neighborhood from walks on the beach at the lakeshore to urban exploration in Hyde Park and of course sightseeing in downtown Chicago. This house is perfect for any visitor coming to Chicago.
transit: Walking distance to CTA public bus service as well as Metra train which will get you directly to the downtown area.
interaction: I will be available through message and upon confirmation of booking you will receive contact information for myself as well as the property manager. The property is managed by a local Airbnb company and a manager will be available throughout your stay to assist with any questions or concerns during your time in Chicago. The contact information will be provided upon booking.
house_rules: No Shoes in the house

name: Brownstone Condo One-Minute Walk to Wrigley Field
summary: Spend time with friends on a shaded deck only steps from Wrigley Field. Situated on the second floor of a 3-flat Brownstone building, this is the ideal place for baseball fans. Other highlights include a full, modern kitchen and jetted tub.
space: A great place to spend the weekend, or a week! A memorable stay for Cubs games, mag mile shopping, concerts, and to enjoy a weekend in Chicago!  You can have an incredibly designed apartment in Wrigleyville with easy access to bars restaurants, shopping, the Red Line (CTA), parking, Zipcar rental, and lakeshore beaches. Enjoy yourself in the newly decorated interior or on the sun drenched patio. Easy access to downtown Chicago, steps from the Lakeview establishments on Clark, and be sure to visit Southport Ave.  Spoil yourself with pillow top queen beds, beverage refrigerator, 2 bathrooms with rainshowers, a jetted tub, walk-in closets, lots of light, great deck space, a short 600 foot walk to Wrigley, Starbucks, dining, and much more! Long term stay discounts and special requests can be accommodated, e.g. drinks, liquor, and food package awaiting your arrival, grill use, etc.  Contact us for details or to inquire about long term stay and discounts.      Enjoy all that makes Chicago gr
description: Spend time with friends on a shaded deck only steps from Wrigley Field. Situated on the second floor of a 3-flat Brownstone building, this is the ideal place for baseball fans. Other highlights include a full, modern kitchen and jetted tub.
neighborhood_overview: Close to Wrigley Field but removed from crowds and traffic. The street is closed for games and concerts, and the unit is far above ground level to avoid noise. The back deck looks onto the Cubs players' parking lot—a fun view before and after games.
notes: A great idea is to bring your own K Cups for the Kuerig.  A few are provided but coffee lovers can have their own.  Also, bring your own Apple TV and plug it in to our TV and connect it to our WiFi.  You will have all of your subscriptions and apps.  HDMI cord provided.
transit: The El Train is 2-3 blocks for Addison or Sheridan stops.  Zipcar rental is at the end of the block.  Hertz rental is 2 blocks away.  Street parking passes are available.  Uber and Cabs are plentiful.
access: Guest has entire apartment and unit-exclusive deck.  Maximum occupancy is 4.  No additional guests, sorry.
interaction: We are available for detail or immediate needs, not so much for recommendations, reviews, ideas, etc.  Please contact us via text or Airbnb app.
house_rules: Please leave the premises as you found it.  Also, be respective of our neighbors as it is a standalone building with a lot of shared common spaces.   Maximum occupancy is 4.  Quiet hours are reasonably set to maintain an adult setting and still enjoy the atmosphere.  We want you to enjoy your stay and most importantly, return to stay again.   We do have a web-based home monitoring system in place, Samsung Smarthings.  There is not a recording or video device inside the unit.  The City of Chicago requires cameras at entrances and common space of the building.  Inside the unit we have door monitors and motion detectors to help us with security when it's vacant.  Please raise up any questions if needed. Thanks!
host_about:
My wife and I love to travel and have a knack for putting together interesting spaces- more her than I.  Airbnb has allowed us to combine these passions, strangely enough.  We strive to deliver a great experience and want to share our space.  We understand what makes travel enjoyable and want to deliver that experience with every stay.  

Lakeview is a great neighborhood and the Cubs definitely help make it great, but the off season is very enjoyable due to the neighborhood, ease of transportation, and people!  Remember when the Cubs threatened to move to Rosemont- most of the neighborhood didn't mind them moving!  Southport is a great area, North Sheridan, Buena Park are all places to be seen!

My wife designed and decorated the entire space, except for the beverage refrigerator- my idea.  There are still some loose ends but we are getting great feedback.  We hope you love it and get the chance to enjoy city living next to Wrigley Field.

summary: Welcome to our cozy, 4 bedroom apartment just steps the Wicker Park! We are looking for long term guests only at this time. Please inquire to find out about great discounts on our furnished rentals. It comes with a fully stocked kitchen and comfy memory foam beds ready for you to relax! -Flexible terms and rates! -No move-in fee! -Landlord pays water/trash. Tenants pays electric and gas. -Background/credit check required -Application required. $35/person
space: Welcome to our home! This home is a part of an apartment building, but separated as a coach house. A coach house is a separate building that was used to house relatives or grandparents back in the 1900's in Chicago!  You have your own private entrance and no tenants live in the coach house building. The apartment is spread out over three floors with plenty of space for groups of 12. The main floor of the apartment has a fully stocked kitchen with everything guests need to prepare a meal. There are four seats at a small table in the kitchen. The family room is located off of the kitchen and it has a mounted flat screen TV and a queen size sleeper sofa. The main floor also has two bedrooms -- one is full sized and other is queen sized bed. There is also one bathroom with a large walk-in shower. The upstairs has one bedroom with two full beds and an en suite bathroom with a shower/tub. Please note, the upstairs bedroom has slanted ceilings and it can be difficult for tall guests to naviga

neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park and Bucktown are one of Chicago's creative epicenters and they lie just outside of downtown. These synonymous neighborhoods are famous for live music, nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails, an affinity for coffee, enjoy sifting through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area than Bucktown and Wicker Park! The area has become a prevailing influence on Chicago's Michelin-rated, James Beard Award-winning dining scene, and boasts some of the city's most sought after tables. Wicker Park and Bucktown are also known for their palate pleasing nightcaps, like renowned brewery Piece and mixology tour de force The Violet Hour. Along North, Division, Milwaukee and Damen Avenues you will find an unbelievable blend of vintage shops and independently-owned boutiques touting fashions for both men and women, and luxury home goods and beauty products. On th
notes: Please be aware that ceilings in some areas of the home are low. If you are tall it may be uncomfortable to walk around upstairs and downstairs! If you are traveling with a car we recommend using SpotHero to help you find a parking space. Parking is extremely limited in this area. There is some free parking just east of the house towards Ashland Ave., but most of Beach Avenue is permit parking only. Please be extremely careful to avoid racking up expensive tickets! Please provide an accurate guest count prior to booking. Rates vary throughout the week and season and by number of guests. It's important that your guest count is accurate so we can be sure the home is adequately prepared and stocked for your stay. We have noise sensors in the unit to monitor sounds levels to ensure guests adhere to the quiet hour rules. The sensors do not record sound and ensure everyone's safety. Thank you for understanding!
transit: This apartment has a great location and you are a 5-10 minute walk from most of the attractions in the neighborhood. If you want to venture beyond Wicker Park and Bucktown the most convenient way is the train. The Division stop on the Blue Line train is 0.3 miles (about a 5 minute walk) from the apartment. The Blue Line runs from O'Hare International Airport to downtown Chicago. For guests bringing a car, please note that this apartment does not include parking and we recommend using SpotHero parking app to find a parking spot. There are also plenty of Uber/Lyfts and taxis if needed!
access: Guests will have full access to the coach house. Guests will receive detailed check-in instructions a few days before their arrival through the booking platforms app or email.
interaction: We are off site but available when needed. Please message us through the app or platform for quickest response!
house_rules: Please note that we charge per guest after a set number. Please provide the entire group count in your reservation request. If an update to guest count is needed after confirming the reservation, the reservation cost may increase. Quiet hours between 10pm - 8am Smoking Penalty: $500 + damages Pet Penalty: $500 + damages Late Check Out Fee: $25/half hour
host_about:
Hi, Thanks for taking a look at our special homes.

My name is Noah. A few years ago, my family and I got together to create an amazing experience for tourists and guests like you.

We are Chicagoans who love sharing our city with the world and strive to make your stay as comfortable as possible so you can enjoy the city like a local. 

We're passionate about travel. As experienced travelers, we've learned what creates a top notch experience and we're committed to sharing that experience with you. It's something we call "Sweet Home Chicago" and we hope you carry it back with you to where ever you call home! :)

You can find us hanging by the lake, catching a game at Wrigley, grabbing a drink in Wicker Park, enjoying the many concerts going on on any given night, or at any of the amazing local coffee shops across the city.

name: Heart of Wicker Park Bright 1st Story Walk-Up!
summary: GREAT location right in the heart of Wicker Park. Bars, restaurants, coffee shops, gyms, shops galore all within a super quick walk. 5-10 min walk to Blue Line (Division) with direct access to O'hare and 3 stops from Downtown! Good for singles/couples (1 bed available). Apt. is the 1st floor of a walk-up. LUGGAGE DROP AVAILABLE! As well as flexible check-in/check-out times by request. Also, we do own a dog who you are welcome to play with :) He is a sweet German Shepherd mix.
space: My partner Greg and live together in this apartment. We both work 8-5 jobs and I travel for work during the week, so there will typically be at least one person there a lot of the time. On weekends our schedules vary. Within the guest room, there is a bed and a TV. The bathroom is shared. This room is ideal for a solo traveler or a couple who wants to do a lot of sightseeing and fun activities while visiting Chicago!

neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park was once known (and still sometimes referred to) as the "hipster" neighborhood. However, times have changed and this is no longer particularly true. Wicker Park is only 3 train stops from downtown, is clean and vibrant, home to many young professionals as well as young families, has an AMAZING food scene, bars for every mood, more coffee shops than you can count on both hands, interesting boutiques and shopping, and yet maintains a closeknit neighborhood-y feel. It's truly one of the best spots to live and stay in Chicago. In addition to a quick trip to downtown, you can also take the train 4 stops north to Logan Square (which really does have a more hipster vibe!) or a 10 minute Uber to Lincoln Park.
transit: Quick walk to the Division Blue Line train stop. If you prefer to Uber, they are always close by. An Uber to downtown will cost anywhere from $10-$25 depending on the time of day. There is a lot of street parking on the side streets in the area, however we do not have a reserved spot and there is no guarantee you'll get a spot right outside the apt. (we are typically able to find one within 5 blocks).
access: In addition to the private guest room, guests will be able to use the following shared spaces: bathroom, kitchen, dining room, and living room when we are not home.
interaction: In-person availability varies! We will provide cell phone numbers for convenient messaging and will be available 24/7 for questions, recommendations, etc.
house_rules: If it’s rainy or snowy or generally gross outside, please take shoes off before walking around apartment. Also, feel free to use any dishes/silverware/etc. which you can leave in the drying rack once clean if you don’t have time to put away.
host_about: Young professional living and hosting in the Chicago area!

name: Relax in a Midcentury Two Bedroom Condominium in Wrigleyville
summary: Relax in a quiet Mid Century style two bedroom garden unit in a busy, bright, and eclectic part of Chicago just two blocks from Wrigley Field.
space: Modeled after midcentury modern design style, the space is well appointed.  The kitchen has a full Calphalon stainless cookset with every cooking utensil under the sun. We provide a full size blender, automatic pour-over coffee machine with freshly ground local beans. The sheets are Italian 100% long-staple Egyptian cotton percale at 500 thread-count. They'll keep your temperature perfectly regulated. Towels and bathrobes are the softest on the market from Snowe. The TV is setup with DirectTV Now and most TV apps and has a Chromecast to stream anything you want from your phone.
description: Relax in a quiet Mid Century style two bedroom garden unit in a busy, bright, and eclectic part of Chicago just two blocks from Wrigley Field.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet street with a residential feel, but only 2 blocks to everything you could need including a Whole Foods and about 35 restaurants.
notes: Street parking is next to impossible at night. Use the SpotHero app to book a spot nearby for usually around $10 a night.
transit: Best by foot and train. Parking is hard due to zone restrictions. You can park a few blocks away using the Spot Hero app for $10 a day with in and out.
access: The whole place is yours. Treat it like a home and it'll feel like one.
interaction: We stay out of your way unless you need us, then we're there in a hurry.
house_rules: - Please remove shoes in the house. - No parties of any kind. - Bath products are for use during your stay and are not to be taken with you. - No smoking anywhere on the property. Ever. Minimum Fine: $500
host_about: We are Collier House, a collection of boutique away homes providing consistent comfort and amenities.

FREE PERKS INCLUDE: - FREE pickup from 87th & Jeffrey  (From 10p.m.- midnight).; NO SHUTTLE if weather is below 35 degrees) - FREE TRIP TO H
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a quiet residential area.  I am 10 minutes by car from the beach; less than 5 miles from University of Chicago and 10 minutes from the Horseshoe Casino; 30 minutes by bus to Jackson Park Hospital
transit: NEARBY TRANSIT LOCATION: You have a couple of options to reach my home to downtown:  Option 1 -   The '87th Street' bus stop is located at the corner of my block.  This bus will connect you to the Jeffrey bus.  The Jeffrey bus will arrive to downtown within 35 minutes.  From downtown you can catch the Jeffrey bus on Michigan Avenue.  Option 2 - Take the 87th bus to the Red line train. Option 3 - The metra train is a 10 min walk away.  It will bring you to the loop in 20 minutes. DISTANCE TO CITY CENTER/DOWNTOWN LOOP. My home is located approximately 11 miles from downtown/Loop area. It is a 45 minute ride to downtown loop by bus; or a 20 minutes drive by car.   I am less than 5 miles away from President Obama's Home and the University of Chicago.
access: A key code will be given prior to arrival for flexible entry time (even tho your beds will not be available until after 6 pm.)  Please review your airbnb confirmation page for instructions, directions and more.
interaction: Arrivals Monday - Friday - Checkin is officially after 6 p.m.  However, you may arrive as earlier and wait in the lower level.  The lower level is NOT where you will be staying and therefore there are no photos listed to reflect this area.  This is a WAITING AREA ONLY.  I will have someone to meet up with you.  Please let me know at least the day before approximately what time you will be arriving.
house_rules: - Smoking allowed outside in the yard
host_about: Hi Airbnb Community.  My name is Ms. Vee.  I am very excited to become a part of the Airbnb family.  I love travelers, meet new people, experience different cultural foods and bargain hunting.   This is all new to me but I am eager to help make your stay a memorable one.

name: Social Distance Suite, Private Bathroom, by Grocer
summary: Perfect space to socially distance - sanitized garden suite w/ private bedroom, bathroom & living space in shared unit (entrance & main kitchen are shared). If seeking a longer term stay or for more than 6, submit an inquiry by clicking "Contact Host" for rates and to ensure I can host you Short walk to L & short distance from hip dining, shopping & nightlife. Straight shot from airport & only 5 stops from Downtown If booking w/ less than 24 hrs notice, please be flexible with check-in times
space: I have a sanitized garden suite, perfect for social distancing, that includes a private bedroom, private bathroom and personal living space available to rent in a shared unit.  If seeking a longer term stay or for a larger group, please submit an inquiry by clicking "Contact Host" to get an accurate rate quote. The bedroom comes with a closet, nightstand, lamp and a full size platform bed with built in drawers for storage. There is also a futon sofa that can sleep 2 people and space for an air mattress that can sleep 2 more. The space also has a microwave, wet bar and mini refrigerator. Only the main entrance and main kitchen are shared with other guests. There is a set of stairs that leads down into your space from the main living room. The space will accommodate up to 6 people maximum. If you have a group larger than 6, there are other rooms available in the unit to rent for an additional cost. Please let me know what rooms you would like. This is a self check-in property and for sec

neighborhood_overview: There are LOTS of great restaurants, coffee shops, bars, stores, music venues, parks and other attractions in the neighborhood. Bustling and trendy Wicker Park & Bucktown and Logan Square areas are both a 10-minute walk or just 1 stop on the train. A definite area to visit. I already mentioned the coffee shop Ipsento. It's considered one of the best coffee shops in town. If you want to have food delivered, GrubHub is a great site to find a variety of quality restaurants that deliver
notes: Please be aware there may be other guests staying here in as well as the unit above, so you may hear them walking above you around occasionally. Please honor quiet hours after 11 p.m. so as not to disturb neighbors, guests or others that live in the building. Please also be smart about your water and energy use as I try to conserve as best I can.
transit: There is free parking on the streets nearby. Permit parking is available on my street but I can get you parking passes for $2 each with enough notice. If you are flying into the city, the Blue Line will bring you directly from O'Hare airport. Five more stops on the train will take you to the loop for business or recreation in about 15-20 minutes. If you are arriving from Midway airport on the Orange Line, it will take you around 45 minutes to arrive to get here. Besides the train, there are buses that can help take you anywhere you need. And of course, there are also taxis galore if you don't wish to use public transit.
access: There's an amazing coffee shop named Ipsento down the street if you want coffee or other breakfast items.  You'll have access to the main living room and fully stocked kitchen as well as exclusive use of your bedroom, private bathroom, personal living space and wet bar. The garden space also has a wet bar, mini fridge and microwave. I'll have towels, soap, shampoo & conditioner, and a hairdryer. There's also a Walgreens around the corner in case you need to get anything.  I have high-speed Wifi as well as Netflix and apps accessible via the smart TV (no cable) if you want to spend some time indoors. Free laundry facilities are also available in the basement in case you need.  Please note there may be other guests that stay in the unit so please be respectful of common areas and noise levels.
interaction: I am available as needed via phone and text.
house_rules: I will summarize the house rules in one phrase: “Be respectful." I put a lot of time and effort and take pride in offering the best stay and experience that I can, but over the course of time, there have been some less than stellar experiences with guests who have behaved poorly. Most guests have been great, so these rules will likely just be common sense for you. (I really don’t think that you’re an 8-year-old.)  - First and foremost, you gotta be nice to stay here or we just aren’t a match. Bad attitudes and disrespect to me, neighbors or other guests in the building will not be tolerated whatsoever and are grounds for denying or cancelling a reservation. Sorry! (Not sorry) - I really do want you to enjoy your stay! I put a lot of time and effort in, and I want this to be a five-star experience for you. If there's anything missing, broken, or just not right, you agree to let me know ASAP. Communication is key. If you don’t communicate that something does not meet your standards or ex
host_about:
I'm a super chill guy that has been hosting Airbnb for more than 6 years. I love meeting new people and helping people enjoy the city of Chicago. In fact, I now do this full time after leaving my day job in public relations, but still keep my foot in the water with freelance work. I love fitness, dining out and trying new places to eat and drink, Netflix, quality music (all types), street fests, traveling, and creating amazing experiences and memories. 

My intention is that my guests have the best possible stay and experience in my homes. I look forward to hosting you :-)

name: Boutique Design Condo with Rooftop Terrace
summary: Take in the sights of the Chicago skyline from this bright, inviting condo. Recharge in a modern apartment with a sprawling open-plan living area, an array of eclectic furnishings, and a private balcony walkout. Safe and secure home away from home.
space: Everything is up-to-date and modern. Hardwood floors and granite counter tops in your bathroom and kitchen. The elevator opens up into the unit on the fourth floor. There is a view of downtown Chicago from the living room and an amazing 360 degree view of Chicago from the rooftop deck.
description: Take in the sights of the Chicago skyline from this bright, inviting condo. Recharge in a modern apartment with a sprawling open-plan living area, an array of eclectic furnishings, and a private balcony walkout. Safe and secure home away from home.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in a lively and inviting area surrounded by iconic Chicago greystone and brownstone architectural homes, Wrigley Field, Boystown, restaurants, fashion outlets, Chicago's off-Loop theaters, wine boutiques, and independent shops.
notes: This is a solid, secure, brick, quiet building. Please let me know if you have any questions.
transit: Only a five-minute walk to the red-line train that will take you downtown or to neighborhoods up-town. Also there is a bus stop right at the corner. Street parking is available.
access: The condo is 1,800 sq. ft. You'll have access to All bedrooms, bathrooms, living room, balcony, kitchen and rooftop deck.  You'll love the rooftop deck!
interaction: I will be a phone call or text away from anything you need.
house_rules: No smoking.  No parties.  Only the people who are on the reservation are allowed in the house. Please be respectful of my place as I am trusting you with my home.  I do everything possible to make sure you have a quality place to stay while in Chicago.  If you are looking for a place to host a party there are many other options in Chicago.  Thank you.
host_about: Hello! I'm originally from Fairbanks, Alaska and lived in Anchorage, Alaska before moving to Chicago in 2011 where I own a spacious condo in East Lakeview.   I look forward to meeting you and helping you enjoy your Chicago experience.  I’m impeccably clean, friendly and responsible.  My goal is to make you feel right at home... in your home away from home.

summary: We want everyone to have a comfortable place to stay. Our digital check-in and the ability to manage your stay from our app, means you won't need to interact with anyone in person. Our staff has been trained in proper disinfection techniques and will deep clean your Sonder before and after your stay. We're here for you during this time of uncertainty and can be reached 24/7 via text or call. Named the most innovative travel company of 2019 by Fast Company, Sonder has hosted a million guests in 5,000+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.   - 24/7 support via text, email, or phone   - Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided   - Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive   - Self check-in

Picnic in the charming green space surrounding Museum Campus, or attend one of the many events at Grant Park such as The Taste of Chicago. Spend the day exploring the countless museums, or journey to the top of the 108-story Willis Tower for breathtaking views of the city.
notes: This is a central location and prone to noise. Two bedrooms have one wall that does not fully extend to the ceiling.

Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival. 3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses. 4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city. 5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages. 6. Commercial photography/videogr

name: Peaceful King Room in Boutique Wicker Park B&B
summary: Beautifully designed, modern guest room located just a block away from great dining, vintage and boutique shopping, art galleries, cool cafes and vibrant nightlife.
space: The Schiller King guest room is one of 9 rooms within the Wicker Park Inn, a newly renovated, boutique Bed and Breakfast offering high quality yet affordable accommodations in a hip & trendy neighborhood. Schiller King is on the main level featuring a king-sized bed, ensuite bathroom and exposed brick wall.   Each room has free WiFi, DirecTV, and breakfast is included in the rate. The Schiller King accommodates a maximum of two people.
description: Beautifully designed, modern guest room located just a block away from great dining, vintage and boutique shopping, art galleries, cool cafes and vibrant nightlife. The Schiller King guest room is one of 9 rooms within the Wicker Park Inn, a newly renovated, boutique Bed and Breakfast offering high quality yet affordable accommodations in a hip & trendy neighborhood. Schiller King is on the main level featuring a king-sized bed, ensuite bathroom and exposed brick wall.   Each room has free WiFi, DirecTV, and breakfast is included in the rate. The Schiller King accommodates a maximum of two people. Enjoy free wi-fi, satellite TV, and breakfast served in our gourmet kitchen. We are a fully staffed Bed & Breakfast. Our office is open 7am - 9pm, Mon - Fri and 8am - 8pm, Sat & Sun. Wicker Park is a diverse, thriving community full of vintage boutiques, coffee shops, highly-rated restaurants, and trendy bars.  Tree-lined residential streets are beautifully lined with a vibrant mix of histori
neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park is a diverse, thriving community full of vintage boutiques, coffee shops, highly-rated restaurants, and trendy bars.  Tree-lined residential streets are beautifully lined with a vibrant mix of historic and modern homes.
notes: We’re just minutes away from downtown Chicago, where you can enjoy popular Chicago attractions such as the Magnificent Mile, Museum Campus, Millennium Park, Navy Pier, and Chicago Theaters. With all the amenities of a hotel and the warmth of home, the Wicker Park Inn Bed and Breakfast is a rewarding lodging experience that allows you to live like a local!
transit: The Wicker Park Inn is nestled a convenient walking distance from two Blue Line el stops as well as several buses to both downtown and north side Chicago! On-site garage and permit parking is available for $25/night, with free parking available within a few blocks of our location.
access: Enjoy free wi-fi, satellite TV, and breakfast served in our gourmet kitchen.
interaction: We are a fully staffed Bed & Breakfast. Our office is open 7am - 9pm, Mon - Fri and 8am - 8pm, Sat & Sun.
house_rules: Since we are in a residential area, we ask our guests to to respect our neighbors and other guests.  We kindly request that quiet hours be observed between the hours of 10:00pm and 6:00am.
host_about:
Thank you for your interest in the Wicker Park Inn!  We've enjoyed hosting many guests from all over the world, and we're always excited to share our wonderful city and neighborhood with new visitors.  We are honored to be considered a second home for many visiting family and friends in the neighborhood.

I've lived in the Wicker Park/Bucktown neighborhood over 15 years and have seen a lot of amazing changes.  There is always a new restaurant opening while old favorites just get better with time.

I grew up in Chicago and returned home in 1996 after earning an Urban Studies degree from Brown University.  I started running the Wicker Park Inn in 2004.  Over the years, we've updated and expanded the Wicker Park Inn which now includes four guestrooms and three apartments.  We are staffed with amazing innkeepers, Robin and Emily, and our impeccable cleaning staff.

We look forward to hosting your stay!

house_rules: - The responsible renter must be at least 25 years of age to book. Guests under 25 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian for the duration of the reservation. - 2 dog(s) are welcome in this home. host_about: Hi, we’re Vacasa, North America’s largest vacation rental management company. Owners of vacation homes around the world trust us to deliver exceptional service throughout your entire vacation. Professional housekeepers clean and stock each home, and our customer care team is available around the clock—with a local property manager ready to show up and help out. We like to think we offer the best of both worlds: you can enjoy a one-of-a-kind vacation experience in a unique property, without compromising on service and convenience. Check out our listings, and get in touch if you have any questions. Your vacation is our full-time job, and we'd love to help you plan your perfect getaway.

name: BUNK BED / FREE WIFI and More...
summary: This AD is for a twin size or full size Bunk bed, in a shared room(s) with other guests. For each person, I provide linen, blankets and pillows. No sharing beds. This is NOT a private room.
space: You will be staying in EITHER of the TWO (2) SHARED ROOMS! One room sleeps 5-7, the other room sleeps 4.  The location of the space will be based on availability at the time of your arrival. The two rooms listed are in the 2nd floor apartment.   (The monthly rate is $350 per month per person.) You will have access to a full kitchen equipped with utensils, pots and more.  The kitchen in the apartment is closed from 10 pm. until 9 a.m.  However, there is another kitchen (and bathroom) on the lower level that is available 24 hours.  The kitchen in the lower level is equipped with a  microwave and refrigerator. FREE PERKS INCLUDE: - FREE pickup from 87th & Jeffrey  (From 10p.m.-2 a.m.; NO SHUTTLE on Friday or if weather is below 35 degrees) - FREE TRIP TO HORSESHOE CASINO (Fri-Sun) - FREE Parking - FREE Wifi Internet - FREE Food - cereal, milk, and other staples - FREE Coffee and Tea - FREE Linen & Towels - FREE Use of Kitchen appliances, pots, utensil - FREE Museum tips - Shedd, Art, Fiel

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a quiet residential area.  I am 10 minutes by car from the beach; less than 5 miles from University of Chicago and 10 minutes from the Horseshoe Casino; 30 minutes by bus to Jackson Park Hospital
transit: NEARBY TRANSIT LOCATION: You have a couple of options to reach my home to downtown:  Option 1 -   The '87th Street' bus stop is located at the corner of my block.  This bus will connect you to the Jeffrey bus.  The Jeffrey bus will arrive to downtown within 35 minutes.  From downtown you can catch the Jeffrey bus on Michigan Avenue.  Option 2 - Take the 87th bus to the Red line train. Option 3 - The metra train is a 10 min walk away.  It will bring you to the loop in 20 minutes. DISTANCE TO CITY CENTER/DOWNTOWN LOOP. My home is located approximately 11 miles from downtown/Loop area. It is a 45 minute ride to downtown loop by bus; or a 20 minutes drive by car.   I am less than 5 miles away from President Obama's Home and the University of Chicago.
access: A key code will be given prior to arrival for flexible entry time (even tho your beds will not be available until after 6 pm.)  Please review your airbnb confirmation page for instructions, directions and more.
interaction: Arrivals Monday - Friday - Checkin is officially after 6 p.m.  However, you may arrive as earlier and wait in the lower level.  I will have someone to meet up with you.  Please let me know at least the day before approximately what time you will be arriving.
house_rules: No smoking in the house.  There is plenty of yard space.
host_about: Hi Airbnb Community.  My name is Ms. Vee.  I am very excited to become a part of the Airbnb family.  I love travelers, meet new people, experience different cultural foods and bargain hunting.   This is all new to me but I am eager to help make your stay a memorable one.

name: 2bed/1bath Lincoln Park Gem with Rooftop.
summary: This Lincoln Park condo is in the heart of Lincoln Park, near downtown, the lake/beach, tons of shopping and restaurants, Steppenwolf theater, DePaul University, and much more. Gorgeous view of the skyline from private rooftop.
space: The condo is the well decorated second home of the owners and they love to share it when they are out of town. Make this your home away from home also.
description: This Lincoln Park condo is in the heart of Lincoln Park, near downtown, the lake/beach, tons of shopping and restaurants, Steppenwolf theater, DePaul University, and much more. Gorgeous view of the skyline from private rooftop. The condo is the well decorated second home of the owners and they love to share it when they are out of town. Make this your home away from home also. Enjoy a large private rooftop and get plenty of selfies with the entire Chicago skyline! The unit is a self check in and check out. Luis and JP (John) are readily available via text or call and have support system in place in case of any issues. We encourage you to read the house manual on the app. The neighborhood has so much shopping.   There are tons of home decor stores including Crate&Barrel (across the street), West Elm, Pottery Barn, William Sonoma, Ethan Allen, Design within Reach, and many more.  The Apple store is on the corner and if you’re looking for some bargain shopping, Off 5th and Nordstrom Rack

There are tons of home decor stores including Crate&Barrel (across the street), West Elm, Pottery Barn, William Sonoma, Ethan Allen, Design within Reach, and many more.  The Apple store is on the corner and if you’re looking for some bargain shopping, Off 5th and Nordstrom Rack are a block away!
transit: The North/Clybourn (Red Line) stop is 1/2 a block away and takes you anywhere you want to go.. Cubs games, Sox games,  Bears games, Downtown, the Loop, etc!  You can also easily order a Lyft/ Uber. Interstate 90/94 is 3 mins away if you have a car with you.  There is a  Dvvy (rental) bike station 1/2 block away too! Take it easily to the lake and enjoy a great bike ride along the gorgeous lakefront!

name: Cozy Private Bed & Bath: Wicker Park (1-2 guests)
summary: Private bedroom with a full-sized bed, fits 1-2 people.  The bedroom has plenty of closet space and you will have a private bathroom with a shower and toiletries.   Scandinavian & minimalist: neutral colors, tidy, cozy. This is my home and I’m happy to share it with you! Shared kitchen, living room, and wifi. Located just off of Milwaukee Ave. It’s a 5 min walk to the Damen Blue Line (CTA train). This location is perfect for exploring Wicker Park! LGBTQ+ travelers welcome.
space: My place is cozy, tidy, and simple. I have a sweet miniature schnauzer so if you like dogs this will be a plus.

Happy to provide recommendations!
notes: My friendly dog will be in the shared spaces. Coffee and tea will be readily available in the kitchen.

name: Navy Pier Experience at Ellis Place
summary: One block to the Lakefront and beaches.  Close to public transit, museums, stadiums & McCormick Place.  Free parking.  Be Downtown or Hyde Park in minutes. Close to University of Chicago, IIT, UIC and Loop campuses. #
space: We offer a completely remodeled, furnished one bedroom in a large, luxurious town home located near the Chicago Loop.  Includes free parking, WiFi, cable and washer/dryer access. You'll enjoy the privacy and comfort of your own bedroom, a fully-equipped modern kitchen and full access to the dining and living rooms. Long-term stays are available as well.  There may be additional guests staying in the other bedrooms during your stay which is great for meeting new people and networking.  Essentially, we offer guests the convenience of a boutique hotel while providing the comfort of home.  We're just a few blocks away from Chicago's lakefront, providing great bike trails, running paths, beaches and gardens, not to mention views of one of the world's most scenic waterfront skylines. We're also close to McCormick Place, University of Chicago, Hyde Park, UIC, IIT and many downtown universities, as well many local attractions and historical sites.  Getting around is easy as we're only a block
