neighborhood_overview: Experience the city like a true, native Chicagoan.   Close to several parks and restaurants. Only a block away from the beautiful Chicago Lakefront and Beaches!  Plenty of trails for biking, walking and jogging.  Enjoy water sports at the nearby harbor: - Jet skis - Kayaks - Flyboards - Paddleboards Plus spectacular views of Chicago's magnificent skyline.
notes: DIRECTIONS FROM O'HARE INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT Travel Time: Approximately 1 hour 22 mins  1. Take Blue Line towardsForest Park. 2. Exit Blue Line at Clark/Lake stop. 3. Transfer to Green Line towards Cottage Grove or Ashland/63rd. 4. Exit at 35-Bronzeville-IIT stop. 5. Transfer to 35 bus eastbound. 6. Exit 35 bus at Cottage Grove and 35th. 7. Walk 1 block south to 36th and 1 block east to Ellis (Townhouse is on this block). DIRECTIONS FROM CHICAGO MIDWAY AIRPORT Travel Time: Approximately 59 minutes  1. Take Orange Line toward Loop. 2. Exit Orange Line at 35th/Archer stop. 3. Transfer to 35 bus eastbound.  4. Exit 35 bus at Cottage Grove and 35th. 5. Walk 1 block south to 36th and 1 block east to Ellis (Townhouse is on this block).
transit: Nearest public transit is less than one block away, arriving every 5-10 minutes.  Bike shares are available nearby.  Just download Acehopper for iPhone and Android for public transit times, bike sharing availability and info for local events and attractions, including maps and tickets for purchase direct from your phone or tablet.
access: Our guests will have complete access to our modern, fully-equipped kitchen so long as it's kept clean after each use.
interaction: We'll provide city guides and public transit info via Acehopper, the "front desk concierge" app, available for iPhone, iPad and Android devices, for tickets, guides and tips on local places to visit.  If we're around, we also like to entertain. We'll definitely make your stay a comfortable and memorable visit to the area.  Sometimes we're busy, but we'll do our best to accommodate your needs.
house_rules: All shoes must be taken off at the door. Feel free to bring house slippers. No pets. Please be energy conscious and turn off lights and electronics when leaving.
host_about:
Greetings!

We're Divvytrekkers, proud members of the Airbnb community and DivvyTrek (follow us on (Hidden by Airbnb) ), which is at the intersection of travel and real estate, committed to balanced and healthy living—mind, body and soul.  

We love to see the world and interact with interesting people from everywhere given that travel is our passion, having savored the rich aroma of stew in Ilorin, Nigeria.  Taken in the sunset with St. Lucia's Piton Mountains in the background. Climbed the steps of a Mayan Temple in Central America. Feasted on freshly caught lobster along Maine's southern coast.  Gazed upon the faraway valleys high up in the Andes from the heights of Manchu Picchu. 

These are only a few of the amazing places we've enjoyed together. 

We also take delight in great music and experiencing cuisines from around the world, in addition to hosting.  Of course, providing a unique guest experience takes a lot of work. For this reason, we have the help of DivvyTrek's Valorwings app which makes hosting fun and easy.  With Valorwings we believe it's possible that everyone can be a host.  

By the way, we highly recommend downloading Acehopper, the “front desk concierge" app, to explore the area. Available for iPhone, iPad and Android devices, Acehopper has tickets, guides and tips on must-see places to visit. 

While our exciting careers keep us highly engaged and quite busy, we always find time to enjoy life and share experiences with the amazing people who choose to stay with us when we're at home. 

Thus far, we've had the privilege of hosting guests from Afghanistan, Argentina, Australia, Austria, Azerbaijan, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, China, Denmark, France, Germany, Hungary, India, Indonesia, Iran, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Japan, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Nigeria, Philippines, Qatar, Russia, South Korea, Spain, Switzerland, Taiwan, Thailand, Ukraine, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, and from all over the United States.  The list keeps growing! 

See you soon!

Becky & John

house_rules: Our House Rules that you hereby agree to when you book a reservation.   Please read carefully and do not book with us if you do not agree to them.  We enforce them!     - Friday & Saturday require minimum 2 night say     - Maximum Occupancy is 4 registered guests     - Please add all guests to the reservation so we can communicate via the app.     - No entertaining, no parties, no visitors, and no additional guests for any reason.     - Any person over 2 years old is counted as a guest     - No animals of any kind please unless you have a certified service animal (prior notice required).     - Light cooking only, no pungent/powerful smells are not permitted.     - No smoking, vaping, or candle burning of any kind.     - We have no special accommodations for infants.   Contact us with questions  about the rules if you have an unusual circumstance and we can usually accommodate you in advance.
host_about: I am recently retired law enforcement, living here in this house last 40 years. Married with one son, Chicagoan love this city and this neighborhood. Northsider , Cubs, fan and enjoying some relax time before going back to the work force.

We're new hosts on Airbnb and super excited to begin having guests stay at our recently furnished guest space.  We live in the main, separable part of the property and are excited for you to use our space as a home base for which to decompress or explore the city!

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood itself is somewhat quiet for Chicago, especially being just minutes from downtown! If you venture several blocks in any direction, you'll find busy streets bustling with nightlife, shopping and much more! Centrally located and close to the United Center, Fulton Market, the West Loop and River North night life, come relax here while nearly all of Chicago is at your fingertips!
notes: We live on the property and do our best to keep noise at a minimum, but you may hear some noise from time to time. We abide by the moderate cancellation policy for Airbnb. Unfortunately, we do not allow pets.

interaction: I am available by call or text (or a holler when I'm home), and would be happy to assist in anyway possible! If you like dogs, feel free to come meet my husky Jameson "Jamo" who will be your neighbor. If not, that's ok. He doesn't bark, so he won't bother you.
host_about:

name: Colorful and Comfortable 2BDR with Free Parking
summary: Welcome to our beautiful, light-filled, 2-bedroom apartment on the west side of Chicago's Wicker Park neighborhood. Guests will love our comfy memory foam beds, our open living spaces, and travelers with a vehicle will love the free parking spot in the back. We'd love to host you for your upcoming stay! Our home is great for solo travelers, business trips, family vacations, urban explorers, or groups of friends looking to discover all of what Chicago has to offer.
space: **Need to stay long term? Inquire for great discounts by messaging us!** Upon entering our 3rd floor apartment, guests will be greeted by tons of natural light and classic Chicago wood floors and trim. The front of the apartment serves as one large common area. There is an entertainment area with access to a smart TV so guests can access all of their favorite streaming services and a couch which is a great place to plop down after a long day.  Business travelers can take refuge at our desk area which boasts lots of natural light and plenty of space to work. Larger groups will love the additional seating and sleeping space that the daybed and trundle offers. We've also added some basic board games and a dartboard for our guests' entertainment.  In the rear of the apartment, we have a small but practical kitchen. It's stocked with the basics for cooking a simple meal, which can be enjoyed at our kitchen table. Be sure to make use of our coffee station to get you going in the morning! Bot

Guests will love our comfy memory foam beds, our open living spaces, and travelers with a vehicle will love the free parking spot in the back. We'd love to host you for your upcoming stay! Our home is great for solo travelers, business trips, family vacations, urban explorers, or groups of friends looking to discover all of what Chicago has to offer. **Need to stay long term? Inquire for great discounts by messaging us!** Upon entering our 3rd floor apartment, guests will be greeted by tons of natural light and classic Chicago wood floors and trim. The front of the apartment serves as one large common area. There is an entertainment area with access to a smart TV so guests can access all of their favorite streaming services and a couch which is a great place to plop down after a long day.  Business travelers can take refuge at our desk area which boasts lots of natural li
neighborhood_overview: Chicago's Wicker Park neighborhood is one of our absolute favorites. Bustling nightlife, cafes, and boutique shopping are the defining characteristics of this young and thriving part of town. Just a short walk to the west, guests can enjoy a day in beautiful Humboldt Park which features a walking trail and lagoon.  Guests will love the good eats, good drinks, and classic Chicago architecture. There are also nearby grocery stores for those travelers looking to save some money by cooking in.  We are 20 minutes to downtown, 20 minutes to Wrigley field, and 15 minutes to the United Center.
notes: Please provide an accurate guest count prior to booking. Rates vary throughout the week and season and by number of guests. It's important that your guest count is accurate so we can be sure the home is adequately prepared and stocked for your stay.
transit: It's about a 20 minute walk to the nearest blue line station. It's a very manageable walk on nice days but we wouldn't recommend it during the winter. Alternatively, there are bus stops just a few minutes away.
access: Our home is a 3rd floor apartment in a 6 unit apartment building. Guests will have access to our entire apartment and the shared laundry space. Since there are other long term tenants in the building, we ask that our guests are courteous regarding noise. If your group is on the louder side of the scale, this might not be the best fit.
interaction: Our apartment has self check-in so guests are free to come and go as they please. However, we are always nearby to address any issues or questions.
house_rules: PLEASE NOTE THAT WE CHARGE PER GUEST AFTER A SET NUMBER. PLEASE PROVIDE THE ENTIRE GROUP COUNT IN YOUR RESERVATION REQUEST. IF AN UPDATE TO THE GROUP COUNT IS NEEDED AFTER CONFIRMING THE RESERVATION, THE RESERVATION COST MAY INCREASE. - Quiet hours between 10pm - 7am - Smoking Penalty: $500 + damages - Pet Penalty: $500 + damages - Late Check Out Fee: $25/half hour
host_about:
Hi, Thanks for taking a look at our special homes.

My name is Noah. A few years ago, my family and I got together to create an amazing experience for tourists and guests like you.

We are Chicagoans who love sharing our city with the world and strive to make your stay as comfortable as possible so you can enjoy the city like a local. 

We're passionate about travel. As experienced travelers, we've learned what creates a top notch experience and we're committed to sharing that experience with you. It's something we call "Sweet Home Chicago" and we hope you carry it back with you to where ever you call home! :)

You can find us hanging by the lake, catching a game at Wrigley, grabbing a drink in Wicker Park, enjoying the many concerts going on on any given night, or at any of the amazing local coffee shops across the city.

name: Free Parking, rehabbed and Close to Downtown!
summary: Our newly remodeled apartment with free parking is located in Little Village-the mecca of the authentic Mexican food and Culture.  The California Pink Line Station is nearby allowing our guest to explore the nightlife that the city of Chicago has to offer in downtown and nearby neighborhoods like the West loop, University Village, Wicker Park, Wrigleyville and Pilsen.
space: The Space: Your Chicago home offers 3 bedrooms, one closet, and 1 bathroom. We also have an optional air mattress for additional guest if needed. We also offer Internet, smart TV, and AC unit for the summer months in order to make your stay as comfortable as possible. The kitchen has all your cooking and eating essentials: pot, pans, plates, cups/mugs, basic spices, coffee and coffee maker. Brand new stainless steel appliances (fridge, stove/oven, microwave/range), granite counter tops and plenty of cabinet space for those who are staying longer.

All guests have access to the entire first floor unit and one parking spot i
neighborhood_overview: "Bienvenidos a Little Village!” Your home is located on a quiet corner in the predominantly Hispanic neighborhood of little village. Little village is home to many working class families and some young college students but is not as gentrified as its neighbor to the east (Pilsen neighborhood). Meaning you can’t walk down the street to many bars or coffee shops. Instead, you will be staying between the neighborhoods two main commercial streets: 26th Street and Cermak Rd. Here you will find some unique mom & pop shops that have been in business for years! They sell everything from jewelry, clothes, cowboy gear and many items from Mexico. I would recommend all guest visit the “Discount mall” on 26th street!
notes: We do not charge a cleaning fee if you leave the apartment as you found it with exception to the beds! We change the sheets and blankets after every visit.
transit: There are many great restaurants in the neighborhood such as: ·      Mi Tierra en la Villit (Website hidden by Airbnb) Taqueria El Milagro ·      La Villita Restaurant ·      La Casa de Samuel, ·      Taqueria Los Comales. Also nearb (Website hidden by Airbnb) Laguanitas Brewery ·      Dulcelandia (Mexican culture candy store) ·      Pete’s Fresh Market (grocery store (Website hidden by Airbnb) Walmar (Website hidden by Airbnb) Panda Express,   Explore everything the city has to offer within 30 mins! ·      Millennium park (The Bean)- about 15- 20 mins via Uber or 30 min bus ride CTA 60 Blue island /26th street ($2.25 per person). ·      Downtown (General)-15- 20 mins ·      Pilsen Bars- 8-10 min drive ·      Midway Airport -15-20 min Drive/ Uber ride. ·      Ohare International Airport- 30 min drive (without traffic!) ·      Wrigley field (Cubs game)- 30 min drive ·      Guaranteed Rate Field (Sox game)- 15 mins ·      United Center (Bulls/Blackhawk games)- 12 min drive ·      Univers
access: All guests have access to the entire first floor unit and one parking spot in the driveway. (Additional parking spots may be available if needed.) Closet with a lock in the middle rooms is for the cleaning crew. Please do not try to open. It is very important that if you park on the drive way you DO NOT block the sidewalk. You will receive a citation. Please be mindful of the other tenants that live in the building complex.
interaction: We can provide guest with recommendations of our favorite restaurants, bar, clubs, shopping centers, bike trails and more! Guest will have complete privacy ,but we will be available to answer any questions or help out in anyway.
house_rules: Please clean up after yourself as we do not charge a cleaning fee.

name: Explore the West Loop from an Artist's Loft
summary: Kick back in this airy and bright private 1,250 sq-ft loft on the third floor of an artist building. The exposed brick walls of this industrial chic loft contrast with ironwork elements to create a simple yet impressive. This custom-designed space has 16’ bow trussed ceilings with ample amounts of natural sunlight pouring into large north and west facing windows. -- Due to the Covid-19 Pandemic, we’re taking extra care to disinfect frequently touched surfaces between each reservation. Providing safe and clean environments for our guests is always our top priority. --
space: Bed/Bath: - 1 King (bedroom 1) - 1 Bunk Bed (1 Twin & 1 Full) (Bedroom 2) - 1.5 Bathrooms - Towels, extra bed linens, shampoo/conditioner and body wash are provided - Hair Dryer - Ironing Board *The Loft is designed as open concept, the bedrooms are semi-private with walls do not reach full height to ceiling* Kitchen/Living Room: - Small refridgerator - Oven & Electric Range - Toaster - Microwave - Kitchen cooking essentials (pots, pans, dishes, cutlery) Other Amenities: - 3 Televisions with streaming Roku devices connected to Netflix and Amazon - High-speed WiFi - Jacuzzi in main bathroom - International power strips available - Prime location for food lovers (Randolph Street) and sports and concert goers (United Center)

neighborhood_overview: The West Loop is the most happening neighborhood in Chicago. This former industrial area is a foodie’s mecca, with famous restaurants within walking distance. Visit the National Hellenic Museum to learn more about the city’s own Greek community.
notes: We can only accommodate people who have no problem using stairs, since there are stairs both to get to the 3rd floor, and within the unit.
transit: The best way to explore Chicago is by foot, public transport CTA "L" train or bus, or ride share services like Lyft or Uber. Street parking and paid parking is available, but please make sure to read posted signs before parking.
interaction: We respect our guests privacy, but make ourselves available for assistance 24/7 should you need anything.
house_rules: 1. All bookings require a security deposit. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 3. Please limit wearing shoes in the house as much as possible. 4. We do not allow smoking of any kind; breaking this rule will incur a loss of security deposit. 5. No pets of any kind unless registered service/assistance animal with certification. 6. Parties or excessive noise are not allowed. Please be respectful of our neighbors and observe quiet hours from 10PM-9AM. Violations after our initial warning may result in your removal from the property. 7. Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises or its facilities. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arisin

space: This is a penthouse unit. Top floor, baby! Skylights and big windows in the kitchen/dining/living room make this a bright, comfy urban space. Large bedroom with queen bed, desk and tv down a hallway offers privacy.

Top floor, baby! Skylights and big windows in the kitchen/dining/living room make this a bright, comfy urban space. Large bedroom with queen bed, desk and tv down a hallway offers privacy. Enjoy watching the neighborhood go by in the front yard or on the front porch. Fold up bag chairs inside the front foyer. Please call, text or email with any questions, anytime. Just 4 blocks south of Wrigley Field, home of the Chicago Cubs and Winterwonderland, this Lakeview apartment was recently featured on Chicago Architecture Center's (Hidden by Airbnb) and is walking
neighborhood_overview: Just 4 blocks south of Wrigley Field, home of the Chicago Cubs and Winterwonderland, this Lakeview apartment was recently featured on Chicago Architecture Center's (Hidden by Airbnb) and is walking distance to restaurants, shopping and all Belmont district theaters including the Vic Theatre and Briar Street Theatre. The Belmont L train (Red, Brown and Purple lines) station is a 2 minute walk, providing easy access to the rest of the Windy City. Find out why Money Magazine named our neighborhood as number 3 of its top 10 big city neighborhoods for best places to live
notes: This home is inhabited by a happy healthy pup when not on Airbnb. He is The Mayor of Sheffield Avenue. This is a third-floor unit, accessed by 2 1/2 flights of stairs. There is no elevator in the building but the good news is that you can enjoy extra dessert while you stay here. Exterior cameras are in place for the safety of our full time tenants and guests. Must be 21 years of age or older to book. Checkin between 4:00pm-8:00pm or later with host confirmation.
transit: Parking is available, in private lot in rear of building for $5-30/night (varies per event) with reservation, please request so it can be reserved. You really don’t need a car to get around the city via foot, train, bus or bike. Just one block walk to the L trains-red, brown and purple lines. Sheffield Avenue is easy to get a cab, Lyft or Uber. Public share bikes by Divvy are also easily accessed by two stations close to the house.
access: Enjoy watching the neighborhood go by in the front yard or on the front porch. Fold up bag chairs inside the front foyer.
interaction: Please call, text or email with any questions, anytime.
house_rules: Only the registered guests are allowed in the apartment. Absolutely no unauthorized guests or visitors. Parties are not permitted. Please keep all doors locked at all times. Do not exit via rear door unless there is an emergency.  Grill is not available for use by guests. Please feel free to use the kitchen, just clean dishes or fill the dishwasher before leaving. Reservations must be by guest of 25 years of age or older. This is a non-smoking building. Smoking or vaping is not allowed in the apartment or any areas of the building. If you need to smoke, please do so outdoors away from doors and windows and dispose of cigarette butts appropriately. Fines and forfeiture of security deposit for butts found and smell of smoke or cannibus left in the apartment. Reserved parking must be paid 7 days before check-in. Makeup: use tissues to remove makeup. Any towels destroyed by makeup will be charged at $10 per towel.
host_about: Just here eating and Drinking Upstream from the Herd. Come walk with me, I give architecture and food tours.

The free street parking is first-come, first-served and distance from unit cannot be guaranteed.  For parking closest to the property, there are daily sticker parking passes available for a nominal convenience fee.  CLOSEST STOPS o Sedgwick brown train stop:  0.6miles, trains go uptown/downtown o (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) buses Stations all have machines that sell Ventra passes (name of provider). You can also purchase Ventra cards at Walgreens. You can either purchase a single ride ticket or a re-loadable Ventra card (one-time $5 fee). Multiple people may share a Ventra card and fares will be deducted for each person; however, the 1, 3, and 7 day passes can not be shared.
access: KEYS We will provide 2 sets of keys for your stay. In case keys are lost, there is a $15 replacement fee. neighborhood_overview: Just off the newly renovated Wilson Red/Purple line stop is a multicultural neighborhood with many restaurants, coffee shops in walking distance.   Just at the end of our street is Ka'Lish Vegan voted best vegan restaurant will surprise you!   Also...Chicago's first Vegan Jewish Deli - Sam & Gerties will delight you with NY house made bagels, sandwiches, cookies and pastries. Heritage Outpost Coffe with convenient walk-up window. Argyle Street, a few blocks north of the apartment, is the place to go for pho, bahn mi, and all other delicious Vietnamese eats.   Ravenswood neighborhood just to the west has more restaurants including Anna Maria Pasteria, Glenn’s Dinner, and Chicago’s famous Margie’s Candies and Ice cream parlor.  Several new restaurants recently opened up steps from our door and more coming in the future!   Carol’s Pub recently re-opened with Live Country music and budget friendly beer and shot menu also serves food and is open ‘till 4 and 5 a.m. on weekends. UpTown is gro
notes: We always provide bottled water and snacks and usually some "Extra surprises" for larger groups or special occasions.   The apartment can come with 1 to 3 parking spots directly behind the building INCLUDED if you are driving. (Please let us know in advance).  Parking around Wrigley for cubs game is around $50 for the game!   When you choose to stay here you are also helping someone with ALS or Lou Gehrig’s Disease.  We Participate with Les Turner ALS Foundation and North Western Hospital with regular fundraising efforts. ALS (Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis) is a rapidly progressive, terminal disease that causes muscle weakness, difficulty speaking and swallowing and, generally, complete paralysis.
transit: The apartment can come with 1 to 3 parking spots directly behind the building if you are driving. (Arranged in advance).  We are Located two blocks from the Wilson Red/Purple Line stop with close access to express buses to downtown, visitors can easily get around the city quickly and cheaply.  Wrigley Field is two quick stops away on the Red Line train or 10 mins. On the #22 clark street bus. Divvy bike stations are close by so park your car and take advantage of the city's great public transportation.  Only $5-$7 Lyft/Uber ride to Wrigley Field.
access: Guests will have access to the entire unit.  All closets are empty with hangers and bedrooms have luggage racks for suit cases.
interaction: Super Hosts Jeff and Jennifer are no stranger to Airbnb.  Having run several since 2013 with a 5 star rating know exactly is what is expected of them and provide excellent response and welcoming charm and personality to each experience. Click Co-Host link below (About the home) for detailed reviews and references.
house_rules: If you care to strip the beds it is always appreciated.  If you have parked in back and can take garbage with you we would be very grateful.  None of this is required. Airbnb is an honor system and we are so very happy to host you but please do not invite additional people to sleep over night unless you let us know and change the number of people in the reservation. Over (Website hidden by Airbnb) unto others as you would have them do unto you.  Make sense?
host_about:
Chris and Todd have worked in the hospitality industry our whole lives.  Both serving as Captain's or Head waiters at Spiaggia have a passion and understanding of the finest Italian food and wine in the country.  Seasoned Airbnb hosts with great reviews, we feel we have created a clean, calm retreat which can serve as an urban get away for 4 - 7 or accommodate 2 families with children traveling together.

We have lived in and loved Hyde Park for over fifteen years. We would be delighted to share something about the history and people that populate our beloved neighborhood
neighborhood_overview: Hyde Park is home to many faculty members and has a rich history. It is  home to the world-famous Museum of Science and Industry and the Frank Lloyd Wright Robie House, as well as many ethnic restaurants, family parks, bookstores, coffee shops, and more. It is best known for the University of Chicago and as home to President Barack Obama. It is a short bike ride to the unparalleled 50 mile lake front bike path.  Hyde Park is the heart of Culture Coast, a collection of thriving arts and cultural communities spanning the South Side. Experience historic museums and live dance, music, and theater performances, while exploring some of the most vibrant neighborhoods Chicago has to offer. Hyde Park is filled with international cuisines and a wide variety of walkable shops.
notes: The Mansion: Hamlin House was built in 1905 for Chicago opera singer George Hamlin by James Gamble Rogers. Rogers attended Yale University, where he contributed to The Yale Record and was a member of the senior society Scroll and Key,[2] whose membership included several other notable architects. He is responsible for many of the gothic revival structures at Yale University built in the 1910s through the mid-1930s, as well as the university's master plan in 1924.[2] He designed for other universities as well, such as the Butler Library at Columbia University, many of the original buildings at the Columbia-Presbyterian Medical Center (now the New York-Presbyterian/Columbia University Irving Medical Center), and several buildings at Northwestern University, notably Deering Library.[2] Rogers was philanthropist Edward Harkness's favorite architect, and Harkness would often condition a gift for a new academic or medical building upon the institution's agreement to hire Rogers for the proje
transit: There is a lot of public transport 1. The metra train station is ten minutes walk from our house. It takes fifteen minutes to get to the loop. 2. There are several buses that stop half a block from the house that will take you to the CTA red and green line trains.
interaction: Philippe works as a University of Chicago Professor and we are both Resident Deans in one of the student residences. We have lived in and loved Hyde Park for over fifteen years. We would be delighted to share something about the history and people that populate our beloved neighborhood. Hyde Park has a very special history.
house_rules: Room will be cleaned on your arrival and after you depart, but not during your stay.
host_about: Philippe is a Prof of physics and chemistry at the University  of Chicago. Caryl and Philippe are Resident Deans in GGRC West dorm. In addition Caryl has a small business in the city and is on the board of the Hyde Park Youth Symphony. Our grown boys, now 20 and 26, went to the Lab School and we LOVE the history and wonderful, interesting residents of Hyde Park We have lived here for fifteen years. Philippe is originally from Paris and Caryl was born in South Africa. Philippe is a keen triathlete, we enjoy playing board games with our students and in summer we like to cycle on the beautiful Chicago lakefront, a stone's throw from our house.

transit: "UIC Halsted" is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking).  -Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 5 minutes to downtown. -O'Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 40 minutes to O’Hare. -Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC-Halsted." About 45 minutes to Midway. -Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)

host_about:
Hello! My name is Marina, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an auditor downtown.  

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

Our staff has been trained in proper disinfection techniques and will deep clean your Sonder before and after your stay. We're here for you during this time of uncertainty and can be reached 24/7 via text or call. neighborhood_overview: Boasting a youthful energy and trendy dining and shopping scenes, Wicker Park puts endless possibilities at your fingertips. Walkable streets are littered with boutique shops, cafes, and art galleries. Craft cocktail bars and performance venues make it one of the city's most popular nightlife destinations, while the Bloomingdale Trail and Park offer joggers and bikers a welcome respite from bustling streets.
notes: This Sonder has cathedral-style ceilings and prone to noise. There is no elevator. There is basic cable. Additionally, we've provided a ROKU streaming device.
house_rules: House Rules 1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance. 2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival. 3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses. 4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city. 5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages. 6. Commercial photography/videogr
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

name: Juniper Mist - Modern + Safe 1BDR in Downtown!
summary: Welcome to our chic 1-bedroom apartment in Chicago's West Loop neighborhood!  Thoughtfully appointed and centrally located, we are sure that our guests will find it easy to make themselves at home. Guests tell us that they love the modern amenities, the proximity to public transportation, and our comfy memory foam beds.  We welcome business travelers, urban explorers, students, small families, and everything in between!
space: **Need to stay long term? Inquire for great discounts by messaging us!** This apartment is on the third floor of the building, which we share with other long term tenants. We don't have an elevator, so you'll have a chance to work off some of that famous Chicago deep dish pizza! Guests will have be able to make use of our fully equipped kitchen, in-unit washer and dryer, and can enjoy an evening watching TV and hearing the faint sounds of the city.

neighborhood_overview: Chicago's West Loop is one of the fastest growing sectors of the city. Home to Millennials, Baby Boomers, business people, students, hipsters, and everything in between, you are sure to find something that suits your tastes in the West Loop.
notes: Please provide an accurate guest count prior to booking. Rates vary throughout the week and season and by number of guests. It's important that your guest count is accurate so we can be sure the home is adequately prepared and stocked for your stay. There is no parking available unfortunately, we recommend using parking apps like SpotHero. We are near the train but have white noise machines to drown out any noise! There are 3 flights of stairs to get to the apartment and no elevator
transit: Public transportation is a breeze! There is an L stop just a short walk away, or you can catch a bus and get a little more off the beaten path.
access: Guests have access to the entire apartment!
interaction: We don't live on-site but we are always nearby to answer questions or give recommendations.
house_rules: PLEASE NOTE THAT WE CHARGE PER GUEST AFTER A SET NUMBER. PLEASE PROVIDE THE ENTIRE GROUP COUNT IN YOUR RESERVATION REQUEST. IF AN UPDATE TO THE GROUP COUNT IS NEEDED AFTER CONFIRMING THE RESERVATION, THE RESERVATION COST MAY INCREASE. - Quiet hours between 10pm - 7am - Smoking Penalty: $500 + damages - Pet Penalty: $500 + damages - Late Check Out Fee: $25/half hour
host_about:
Hi, Thanks for taking a look at our special homes.

My name is Noah. A few years ago, my family and I got together to create an amazing experience for tourists and guests like you.

We are Chicagoans who love sharing our city with the world and strive to make your stay as comfortable as possible so you can enjoy the city like a local. 

We're passionate about travel. As experienced travelers, we've learned what creates a top notch experience and we're committed to sharing that experience with you. It's something we call "Sweet Home Chicago" and we hope you carry it back with you to where ever you call home! :)

You can find us hanging by the lake, catching a game at Wrigley, grabbing a drink in Wicker Park, enjoying the many concerts going on on any given night, or at any of the amazing local coffee shops across the city.

name: Wicker Park eclectic 1 BD near Blue Line
summary: 4 time Super Host! 1- bedroom with 4-poster bed + private bath in epicenter of hip Wicker Park, blocks from Damen Blue Line (easy transport to O'Hare/Midway/downtown). Landmarks building, art-filled with eclectic vibe and access to beautifully decorated home-Living Room; Dining Room; Kitchen; Deck-all blocks from park+shops+art+live music+food+drink+606 Trail+public transport. Roomy private room; desk area; private bath. Fab yard/deck in season. Easy street parking. Check out our Pez collection!
space: Spacious private bedroom with four-poster bed and desk/chair working area. A landmarks building, this 100-year old former parsonage of St. Paul's church features leaded glass windows in front room; lovely arts & crafts "bones" with a colorful combo of antique-meets-eclectic decor, and art in abundance. Updated kitchen with stainless steel appliances; updated baths. Located on busy North Avenue, blocks from the Blue Line elevated train (O'Hare/Downtown line),  and all the adventures that Wicker Park has to offer.

neighborhood_overview: Down the block: Super cool noshes at Big Star (cheap, but fab, tacos and margaritas that know how to do business, served up with a scenester crowd). Other options include: sushi; noodles; pizza; ramen; empanadas; Italian; French, Middle Eastern, you name it-Wicker Park/Bucktown dining is right down the street. Thirsty? Try Violet Hour for killer, cool ambiance and house-crafted cocktails. Loads of bars and restaurants are nearby on Damen/North/Milwaukee Avenues. Cuppa 'joe? Try Filter, Crossroads, Ipsento, La Colombe-unique, independently-owned coffee shops abound! (Sure, there's a Starbucks down the block, but....) Feeling like the great (urban) outdoors? The 606 Walking Trail is a sight-filled, 5-minute walk away, complete with bike/running/walking trails. Ditto: Wicker Park (the actual park) is blocks away, and complete with lovely gardens; a fountain; sunbathers; hoops; swings, and a Sunday Farmers' Market (in season). Shoppers' delight: unique boutiques & shops range from oh-so-fa
notes: We are located on busy North Avenue, close to the ultra hip six corners intersection of Milwaukee/Damen/North Avenues--location, location, location if you want to be in the heart of what's happening in Chicago’s Wicker Park/Bucktown neighborhood. That said: if you're looking for a "North Woods" experience, keep looking...and enjoy!
transit: Excellent access to Chicago Transit options: The North Avenue bus stop is steps from the front door; The Blue Line train (Damen Stop) to downtown or O'Hare Airport is blocks away. Street Parking is pretty decent and parking rental at the home is available (brick garage with electronic opener) for $35 per 24 hour stay. Lots of taxis circling at the nearby "six corners" intersection at North/Milwaukee/Damen, and there's always the Uber/Lyft option.
access: Private one bedroom with 4-poster bed and desk. Shared access to: full bath; first floor powder room, living room, dining room & kitchen. In season (mid-May to mid/late October): Lovely outdoor space with flower garden and retro tin sign decor,  wrought iron furniture and fire pit; off-kitchen deck features retro metal furniture and teak 4-person dining table with stools.
interaction: We are a Chicago family, born and raised, and would love to share the inside scoop on all things Chicago! Our 'hood is hopping with things to do, and we know loads about the various city neighborhoods outside of Wicker Park. Owner has a copywriting/graphic & web design studio that she works in at the home, so we are generally around for any questions you may have.  That said, we make it a point to give our guests as much privacy as possible.  We are available for any information you might need, but if you prefer to explore on your own, or relax with a book on your four-poster bed, we'll keep the peace...your call!
house_rules: -We are pretty chill, but no pets, parties or crazy wildness, please!  We prefer a "no shoes inside" lifestyle--you'll be able to tell by how clean the house is! -No smoking inside, but smokers can use the yard/kitchen deck/front stoop for smoke breaks. - Overall, we look forward to a mutually respectful--and fun!--experience.

name: Private Bedroom. Private bath. Hyde Park / Kenwood
space: Nice place to start out in Chicago. High-quality furnished. Just bring your suitcase, I have everything else. Medical student, foreign student, out-of-town intern, relocated professional welcome. Full-size bed with high quality bed linen, pillow, blanket. Study desk and chair. Bedroom is on 2nd floor. Private bathroom is on 1st floor.  Flat-screen smart TV in living room. High speed WIFI (50mbps). Free use of washer/dryer in basement during 10am-6pm. Free bikes available during your stay - please inquire. Bring your own helmet. Kitchen is well equipped for light cooking with basic dinner wares and utensils, as well as toaster, cooking pan, kettle, microwave, refrigerator, range/oven. The townhouse is an end-unit at the front, facing beautiful tree-line Drexel boulevard.  HOUSEMATES You will have 3-4 housemates. LOCATED IN HYDE PARK University of Chicago, UC hospital (walking/biking distance),  Provident Hospital (walking/biking distance),  La Rabida Children's Hospital (2 miles) Jackso

notes: Our floor coverings are hardwood and tile. We have small accent rugs but no carpet. We minimize the use of chemical cleaning agents . If you are sensitive to allergens, this townhouse might work well. We have filtered tap water in the kitchen. No need to buy bottle water.
house_rules: No shoes inside the house. Light cooking only. No splashy, oily, stong smell cooking. Guest to clean up right after meal. No unauthorized overnight guest.
host_about:
Hi! I am a friendly and easy-going host. My background is in graphic design,  interior design, and computer programming. My goal is make sure you enjoy the stay as much as i can. We are courteous, well-organized, responsive to your requests, and clean.  

Originally from Thailand but have lived in Chicago for over 20 years. In my free time, i enjoy gardening, biking, hiking, and exploring new restaurants. It is always my pleasure to recommend my local-favorite spots that are not in travel guide books, or to provide info on transportations, shopping, etc.  

I travel often. I usually pick up new tips from other airbnb hosts to enhance my guest experiences. I greatly appreciate your support. You may expect that i will go extra miles to ensure that you enjoy your stay.

name: Cozy Apartment Steps from Wrigley Field!
summary: Unwind and enjoy the city in our cozy basement apartment! We're new hosts on Airbnb and just moved into the area. We are super excited to begin hosting guests at our recently furnished space and can’t wait to meet you!  We live in the main, upstairs part of the property and are excited for you to use our space as a home base for which to decompress and enjoy all the city has to offer! We hope you love staying with us and enjoy the beauty of Chicago and comfort of our home!
space: Our apartment was originally a first floor duplex and we decided to open an Airbnb apartment in the downstairs portion of our apartment. The space is interesting but is very cozy. There is a private guest entrance around back with a keypad to unlock the door which leads you down to Airbnb apartment. You will need to walk around the house to the backyard in order to access the back door. Walking into the apartment will bring you down a set of stairs (be careful, they’re steep) to the main hallway which leads off to the bedrooms, bathroom, and the living room/kitchenette. Toss your coat onto the couch on your way in to explore the house!  Being a duplex, there is no kitchen, however, there is a kitchenette available for use. The carpeted stairs lead up to our apartment, which is inaccessible for guests. There are three cozy bedrooms, one directly off the main hallway and two off of the living room. In the bathroom you will find all the toiletries needed to enjoy your stay. If you notice

Walking into the apartment will bring you down a set of stairs (be careful, they’re steep) to the main hallway which leads off to th
neighborhood_overview: Wrigleyville is home to the historic Wrigley Field, the second oldest ballpark in the country. Whether or not you’re a sports fan, you can’t help catching a little Cubs fever while you’re here. The area around Wrigley Field is known as Wrigleyville and is bursting at the seams with sports bars, souvenir stalls, and die-hard Cubs fans. Walking up and down Clark Street you will find many locals in restaurants and bars—even when it’s not baseball season. Here, Wrigley isn’t just a ballpark. It’s a culture. You’ll see locals and visitors alike sporting the red and blue Cubs “C” in season and out. Right outside the stadium, you’ll find the open-air Gallagher Way. It’s a popular gathering spot for neighbors, fans, and visitors all year long. A slew of events go on here, including farmers markets, an outdoor concert series, film screenings, and a holiday winter wonderland.  But there is also entertainment beyond the sports world, featuring an array of tantalizing food spots and engaging activ
notes: We live on the property and do our best to keep noise at a minimum, but you may hear some noise from time to time. We abide by the moderate cancellation policy for Airbnb. Unfortunately, we do not allow pets.
transit: There are several ways to get around the city: -The CTA (Chicago Transit Authority) which features both bus and train, both of which are within walking distance from the apartment.  The 22 bus on Clark will take you both north to the edge of the suburbs and south to the loop. The Red Line “L” (elevated train) will take you north to the edge of the suburbs or deep into the South Side of Chicago, making stops downtown and China town and running through 18 different neighborhoods. -Uber/Lyft is an easy (though can be expensive) way to get around, without having to deal with the one-way streets yourself! -There is permitted street parking in front of the house (and all around the neighborhood). We are more than happy to sell you a daily parking permit if you need it while staying with us.
access: Feel free to use anything unlocked in the basement. There are two closets downstairs that we use for personal storage and Airbnb storage which will remain locked. The upstairs is where we live, so please give us some space and respect the locked door. The garage-top porch is available to use, but please leave the first and second story back decks alone (ours is the first and the second floor is our neighbors).
interaction: We will give you the space you want but would love to meet you when we are around. Please don’t hesitate to reach out via email or text but be understanding that we do have jobs and a life outside of Airbnb, so we may be slow in responding. We will do our best to keep prompt communication up.
house_rules: Please no smoking, drinking, or drugs on the premises. No unapproved or unbooked guests. No unapproved parties or outside guests. Please follow Chicago noise ordinance guidelines for noise levels. Follow all posted signage around the apartment. Please keep your shoes off inside.
host_about:
Stay where it counts. When you book a Loftium, you're contributing to the local community. Each Loftium is home to a local resident who hosts and lives right on-site, making sure your experience is a delightful one. All spaces are designed with your comfort in mind! We've made check-in and communication a breeze, and each home provides a beautiful and cozy place to rest your head during your travels. Every Loftium home and host is unique, and you'll always get a true neighborhood experience during your stay.

Visit a new community and book a Loftium in any of our cities: Seattle, Portland, Denver, San Diego, Phoenix, Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas, Charlotte, or Orlando. We can't wait for you to visit!

Very close to public transit, stores/restaurants, and Hollywood beach! Only 7 stops / 12 min to Wrigley on the red line, which is a 3 min walk from the apartment. **To read more, EXPAND the below section**

neighborhood_overview: This multi-unit building is right near the lake, with easy access to Hollywood Beach and the lakefront trail & parks for running/biking. Restaurants of all cuisines, lively bars, and unique stores abound in the Edgewater neighborhood. Only 10-min walk to Andersonville neighborhood with more cute stores and restaurants.
notes: CHECK-IN Check-in is at 4pm or later. You will be sent detailed entry info for self check-in.  Luggage storage may be available from 10:30am-4pm if arranged in advance. PARKING Please note that the free parking is street parking, so you will need to look for a spot once you arrive. The free street parking is first-come, first-served and distance from unit cannot be guaranteed.   STAIRS Please note this is a 3rd floor unit, and this building does NOT have an elevator. COURTESY Please note this unit is on a quiet residential street. We respect our neighbors and keep quiet hours from 10pm-8am. Therefore, if your group is looking for more of a party environment, please allow us  to recommend another unit that would be better suited for that noise level. CHECK-OUT  Check-out is by 10am.  If you check out late or do not follow the check-out steps, you may be charged an additional cleaning fee. Luggage storage may be available from 10am-3pm if arranged in advance. - Dirty linens can be left a
transit: lf you have a car, there is free street parking in the area (no permit required). Public transportation is an easy and convenient way to get around the city. It's .2 mi to the Thorndale red-line stop. In addition, there are multiple bus options, including the 146 express bus and 151. I am happy to provide additional detail about our public transit system, as well as directions. The bus is $2/person, while the train is $2.25/person; there are also unlimited 3-day passes for $21 and 7-day passes for $28.
access: KEYS We will provide 2 sets of keys for your stay. In case keys are lost, there is a $15 replacement fee.  HEAT/AC The unit has central heat plus window AC in the living room and bedroom. WASHER/DRYER Coin-operated washers and dryers are located in the building’s basement and shared with other apartments. Detergent is available in the kitchen for your use. CRIB Pack-and-play crib may be rented for $5/day with 2+ day advance arrangements. Please mention this during booking, and it will be inside unit waiting for you. Note that you must supply your own sheets and blankets for the crib.
interaction: Our team is available to answer your questions and make your stay pleasant. We are just a phone call away.
house_rules: - - REQUESTS:  1) Please treat the home with respect.   2) Please be courteous of others in building and neighbors. All socializing must be kept indoors after 9pm, and we request quiet time indoors from 9pm-8am.   3) The only guests allowed in the building are those on the reservation.   4) $500 fine for smoking inside the apt.  CHECK IN/OUT: Standard check-in time is 4pm (or later). Standard check-out time is by 10am. If unit is not vacated by check-out time or notes are not followed, additional cleaning charges may apply.
host_about:
I began using Airbnb as a traveler in the fall of 2013, and I'm hooked! Staying in someone's home allows you to experience the area in a truly authentic way - no more hotels for me! As of May 2014, I began hosting in Chicago and have since hosted thousands of guests from around the world. I love helping others make the most of their visits. 

As a host, I am personable, responsive, and detail-oriented. I take great pride in the comfort and cleanliness of each apartment. You can trust that when staying in any one of our properties, you will feel at home.

name: Lakeview/Lincoln Park 2BR/clean, cozy, convenient
summary: One block to Jewel/Osco (grocery/pharmacy), neighborhood restaurants, bars, and coffee shops.  7-11, Chipotle, Honey Baked Ham, Jet’s Pizza, McDonald’s, and Starbucks are all within a one block radius. Theatre on the Lake, Peggy Notebaert Museum, and Lincoln Park Zoo are East along the lakefront.  Business travelers: an Office Depot and dry cleaning are a block and a half away! We are on the border of two of the safest neighborhoods in Chicago; we hope you will consider us for your stay!
space: Our neighborhood is among the safest in the city, and our location is quiet and relaxing.  A short walk to two parks, three Divvy bike rental stations, and a hot spot for Uber driver activity. PLEASE NOTE: The living room futon was damaged beyond repair, guests 5 & 6 have the living room sofas made into beds.

neighborhood_overview: Located in Lakeview on the border of Lincoln Park, our AirBnB is a blend of convenience, nightlife, safety, and comfort.  We are 1/2 block from public transportation and easy access to downtown Chicago. Street parking is free and Target, Whole Foods, Mariano’s, and Costco are less than a five minute drive away.  Please contact us with any questions, and thank you for considering us for your stay in Chicago! Rosa & NJRS
notes: Whether you are staying here for business or pleasure, chances are you will not spend TOO much time at home, but I hope to make that time as convenient and comfortable as possible.   Cheers!!!
transit: Less than a block from the E-W Diversey and N-S Ashland and Ashland express busses. A 12 minute walk to the Diversey Purple/Brown El (train to downtown Chicago) and less than a 10 minute walk North to Paulina Brown El station. 15-25 minute walk to either Wrigley Field (NE) or DePaul Lincoln Park campus (SE). Ashland will take you directly to UIC and Rush medical campuses / University Village. For more information about Chicago's public transportation services please visit:   (Website hidden by Airbnb)
access: Overhead storage in the bedroom closets and a pantry off the kitchen are reserved for cleaning supplies and extra linens, other than that please feel free to make yourself at home. Don't worry - you will have more than enough space to be comfortable!
interaction: I live on site and will be available to help you in any way I can.
house_rules: Please respect our neighbors; keep noise down from 2200 to 0600 Your shoes should be left in the entrance or along the floor under the living room TV  Unless it is expressly stated in the listing, do not expect additional items to be supplied in your Airbnb. If you need any additional supplies please send a message through the AirBnB site and I will do my best to have it/them ready for you

name: Edgewater, private, charming coach house 1 ( of 2)
summary: Our Edgewater coach house is a haven in the city. A ten minute walk to Hollywood Beach, a fifteen minute walk to fun Andersonville and a five minute walk to the 'L' train for direct downtown access, it is near to everything but feels far away from the busy city. Great restaurants are right around the corner, and Wholefoods is three blocks away. Managed 100% for guests, two independent units are superbly comfortable/ pristine. All essentials and more provided. Enjoy the city and relax at once.
space: The apartment is completely private and feels like a haven in the city. We want you to sleep well while you're not at home, so the mattress, linens and sofa bed are all high quality and comfortable. The kitchen is fully equipped and we provide unlimited pods for the Keurig coffee machine, unlimited bottled water, tea, creamer etc. We are kid friendly, so whether you're a family, or coming to see the sights, or a business person who wants a change of scene, we provide a relaxing and highly functional environment. Excellent reviews on other travel sites. If this is unavailable we also have another Coach House apartment. https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/22398218 We also have a flat which can accommodate larger groups. https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/10542967

neighborhood_overview: Whatever brings you to Chicago, work, family visit or sightseeing, everything is accessible from Magnolia Studios. If you want to go downtown to the main attractions, or to Wrigley Field, just walk five minutes to the nearest L stop (Bryn Mawr) and the red line will take you there directly.  There’s no need to go downtown if you fancy a more relaxed pace. Chicago is a mix of wonderful, eclectic neighborhoods, and we sit in two of them, Edgewater and Andersonville. Andersonville, originally inhabited by Swedish farmers is now a super fun, highly diverse community that hosts a variety of local shops and restaurants. There are no chain stores to be found, rather an array of interesting independent stores. You can buy hand crafted items and clothes as well as wonderful artwork on Clark St, and the ‘restaurant strip’ (also on Clark St) offers all types of delicious food.  Within walking distance of the heart of Andersonville, we’re also situated right in Edgewater, so can take advantage of
notes: Please see identical listing if this one not available: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/22398218
transit: We are a five minute walk from the L train which takes you directly downtown on the red line. Our nearest stop is Bryn Mawr. The L train goes 24 hours a day. You can also catch a bus downtown from Broadway Ave which is right behind us. Parking on street is free and unlimited, so if you find a space, you're good to go. Sometimes it's easy to find a space and sometimes a little more difficult. Usually it fills up more at the end of the day when people return from work. You can rent a garage space on site for an additional $15 a night. If you're coming for the weekend, there is also a small municipal parking lot around the corner from us ( half a minute away) at the end of Early Ave, which is free on Saturday and Sunday. Please just note the posted times after which to park on Friday evening and the time by which to leave on Monday morning.
access: The Studio has it's own entrance from our beautiful back garden and is situated in a beautiful Coach House. We have a keyless entry code system which you receive once you have made your booking.
interaction: Just give me a call, send me a text, or knock on the door and I'll be happy to help with anything to make your stay more enjoyable.
host_about: Originally from the south coast of England, I moved to Chicago in 1998 with my husband Ashley. We loved the City on arrival, and partifcularly liked Andersonville/ Edgewater where we bought and renovated an old colonial house in 2002. The neighborhood is fun, convenient and friendly, and we now feel very much at home within a warm and eclectic circle of friends. After years of working and traveling, I had baby Edwin in 2007, followed by twins, Vivienne and Oliver in 2010.  Staying at home held much appeal with the new babes, and so we switched gears and set up Magnolia Studios with a view to making it a relaxing haven for the travel weary. Whether you're here to visit family, experience a great Chicago neighborhood, or see downtown Chicago, we want you to feel better when you leave than when you arrived.

host_about:
Current bio: Myself and Sean are hosting guests at our coach house apartment in Old Town, Chicago. Ask me if you have any questions about the place and I am happy to help!

Bio from a few years ago :) "My name is Rebecca, and I will be living in Buenos Aires starting mid November. I am enrolled in an English teaching certification course and will be teaching full time after completing the course. I love Spanish and hope to use it frequently while living here. I lived in Granada, Spain for five months a few years ago (I will have to get a hang of the differences in Spanish and have been reading about it!) I fell in love with traveling and am so excited to learn about the culture of Buenos Aires and those who live here. I enjoy meeting new people and am a very open minded, passionate person. I believe that seeing the world can open one's eyes, and I am grateful to have this experience to do so. I cannot wait to soak in the city of Buenos Aires and see many other cities in South America. My plans regarding housing are tentative, so this is a great resource I would love to use!"

name: IL Med District- 3 bed 2 bath w/ parking & laundry
summary: Our light-filled 3 bedroom apartment was thoughtfully decorated, & makes for a perfectly comfortable space for your group - best of all, it's walkable to the United Center! With 2 full bathrooms, it's ideal for groups traveling together, & since we recently rehabbed the building, it's practically brand new! We're just a half-mile west of the West Loop, too, so it's an easy walk to some of the city's best restaurants, bars, & shops!
space: This a spacious unit that has been completely remodeled. It has 3 beds and 2 bathrooms, updated kitchen, free street parking, and access to a common laundry room. Extremely close to the United Center and a Blue Line stop. Be downtown in less than 10 min.

neighborhood_overview: The condo is located in the Near West Side, steps away from the United Center and just minutes from Chicago’s hottest neighborhood - the West Loop. Other West Side neighborhoods, such as Wicker Park, Logan Square, Ukrainian Village and West Town are also just minutes away and well worth a visit during your visit in Chicago!
notes: In addition to our proximity to the United Center, we also enjoy easy access to and from O'Hare Airport, and conveniently located near Malcolm X Community College, Rush, and UIC. It's a 15 minute walk to Union Park and Randolph Street Market, and a 10 minute drive to (Hidden by Airbnb) 's Chicago Office, as well as McDonald's HQ. And, since we're so close to downtown, all of Chicago's sights - the Art Institute, the Bean, Maggie Daley Park - are just a quick bus ride away!
transit: Approximately 5 min walk to the Illinois Medical District Blue Line station which goes straight to downtown and O'Hare Airport. Also located next to the 126/Jackson bus route which takes you right to Michigan Ave., and the 50/Damen bus, which takes you right into Wicker Park. It's easy to get around town without a car from here!

name: Clean, Garden Floor on Little Village Boulevard
summary: This is an old house that we are repairing. Our daughter lives in the top apartment, and there is a neighbor living in the first floor. We've lived in this neighborhood for over 20 years and would love to share our space with people traveling to Chicago. It is a basic set-up, with what you need for a comfortable and simple stay. The apartment is located in Little Village, one of Chicago's largest Mexican neighborhoods, and surrounded by local restaurants and cafes.
space: This is a three bedroom, garden-floor, apartment. There is one main room, with two individual rooms with single beds, and two convertible couches. The apartment is facing Marshall Boulevard, a historic boulevard in Chicago that provides grass and trees to relax under in the summer. It is located half a block away from the bus and two blocks from the pink line trainstation.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in Little Village, one of Chicago's largest Mexican neighborhoods, and surrounded by local restaurants and cafes. There are local street vendors with tamales and fresh fruit just half a block during winter, as well as local restaurants. We are also two blocks away from Douglas Park, a large park where summer activities and concerts are held. The apartment is facing Marshall Boulevard, a historic boulevard in Chicago that provides grass and trees to relax under in the summer. It is located half a block away from the bus and two blocks from the pink line trainstation.
notes: Check-in is preferred any time after 3 pm to give us some time to get the apartment ready. Although somewhat flexible, we ask for an extra $20 for early check-in, particularly if it is before noon. There is an extra $30 per guest per night after 4 guests. Please make sure you mark the appropriate number of people who will be staying at the appartment.  Please note that some city noises can be heard from the apartment, including music from neighbors during summer time and a neighbor's dog once in a while. The apartment is one and a half blocks up the stairs.
transit: Parking is available on the street and side streets. Chicago Transit Authority has a bus that stops half a block away, and the train is two blocks away.
access: Guests will have access to the entire apartment. There is a door that leads to the back, but that will be kept locked, providing guests a key for emergencies.
interaction: I live two houses away, but like to give guests their independence.
house_rules: - Quiet hours after 11 pm

Newly renovated and professionally decorated space with brand new furniture including memory foam mattresses by Casper and luxury linens.  Very well stocked kitchen for the chef in you.  Excellent tech package with blazing fast internet and streaming channels for 4K TV.  Premium modern building with modern amenities like Full Gym, Sky Deck with Pool and Club Lounge with Billiards. Very safe and secure building with 24 hour doorman.  If you are accustomed to luxury or just want to experience it for a short time, this is the lifestyle you deserve:  this is what luxury living is all about. ENVITAE has partnered with Oakwood, the nation's leading corporate housing company, to bring you this exquisite suite in one of Chicago's premier buildings.  We are changing the way short-stays are done and warmly invite you to be a part of it.

Surround yourself each day with a warm blend of upscale minimalist design and premium finishes.Then step outside to explore your new neighborhood, a district offering the city’s highest concentration of art galleries, restaurants and nightlife. neighborhood_overview: Everything you need is right outside your doorstep! Downtown Chicago is a city with an appetite—for food, of course, but also for design, history, and culture. Come here to marvel at the cutting-edge architecture or take in the gorgeous views of Lake Michigan; to spend a day cheering with baseball fans and a night laughing at a comedy show; to shop; to visit renowned institutions like the Field Museum, The Art Institute and the Adler Planetarium, and to experience the legendary blues scene. To do all this, you'll need nourishment: taste deep-dish pizza, piled-high hot dogs, Italian beef sandwiches, and more.
notes: This unit is currently being renovated, photos are from a similar unit in the same building. Please be advised that all guests will be asked to sign a rental usage agreement that governs the terms of your stay.  For the protection of all parties, the booking party will also be required to provide a copy of a valid government issued ID and matching credit card prior to check in. This information is collected for verification purposes only and is not stored or otherwise used for any other purpose By completing the reservation you agree to the following: - I agree to be bound by our rental terms and conditions. - I acknowledge that I will be required to provide a copy of a valid government issued ID and matching credit card prior to check in. - I acknowledge that I may be required to undergo a background check if mandated by the property management company or the building, as stated in accordance by my rental agreement and condition of the booking.
transit: You are minutes away from bus and train stops.   We find our guests prefer to use Uber, which is a very convenient and cheap way to get around the city. If you are arriving at the airport, inquire into our ENVITAE Life Plus and Elite plans for premium transport upon arrival and departure.
access: As an ENVITAE Guest, you will have full access to building amenities. This includes the common rooms, billiard tables, swimming pool and gym.
interaction: While staying with ENVITAE, you'll have 24/7 access to our concierge desk for an inquiries or requests you may have. Your personal Guest Relations Manager will meet you upon arrival, get you settled in and answer any building or neighbourhood questions for you.
host_about: Hi, my name is Jim and I love being an Airbnb host in Chicago! I take great pride in hosting people from around the world in my luxurious homes and welcome you to the wonderful city of Big Shoulders. I look forward to hosting you!

description: Two bedrooms available for short term rentals. Both beds can sleep one or two, bathroom is shared. There is a third bedroom in the unit that is occupied by the primary resident. The place is well appointed with great woodwork, natural light, plants and art. Window a/c units and fans available as needed, can install prior to arrival. Kitchen and bathroom are very nice. Very close to downtown via the Green Line train. About 1.5 miles to Union Park music festivals, closer to the United Center, about 3 miles from Michigan Avenue. The immediate area does have a full service grocery store and a couple take-away places for food, but not much else. Street parking is fairly easy, train runs until about 1:30am, uber trips to Michigan Avenue, Wicker Park or Logan Square are about 15 minutes.

host_about: Frequent traveler, often to tropical locales. I am a yogi, a writer and a builder of spaces.

summary: Located on a peaceful street in a lively neighborhood with world-class culture at your fingertips. Our thoughtfully designed interiors will accommodate couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids), and large groups. PLEASE NOTE: We also have a coachhouse available on the same property that is available to rent. This consists of 2-2 bedroom one bathroom units that can be rented together or separate. Please see this link: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/14631349
space: This suite is a three bedroom furnished apartment, which provides a perfect solution for corporate relocation services, business and vacation rental, or short term home displacements. Eclectic sophistication meets all the comforts of home at Bucktown House Suite No. 3. In anticipating our guests' every need, we designed this suite with accommodations that will satisfy all types of travelers. In the front room, guests can choose between a full or twin sized bed, with or without a desk. In the middle room, guests can use this space as a bedroom with a twin-sized bed or it can be converted into an office, a personal work space, or a play room for the kids. SUITE FEATURES: Bright eat-in kitchen with original pine built-in and custom maple cabinetry. Dishwasher, gas range, frost-free refrigerator, and microwave. Maple hardwood floors throughout. Custom designed Italian glass mosaic tile bathroom with (MALIN+GOETZ) toiletries, plush towels, and bath robes. Queen-sized bed with reading lamps

neighborhood_overview: Bucktown is not just a peaceful residential enclave, it’s also full of incredible arts, dining, and activities. Bucktown House is within walking distance of Holstein Park and The 606 Bloomingdale Trail, a walking/biking trail surrounded by installation art and creative urban landscaping. The surrounding neighborhood has no shortage of dining options, from single-barrel bourbon and pork belly tacos on the outside patio at Big Star to nine-course menus at Schwa, an upscale BYOB. Or if it's nightlife you're after, try Bangers & Lace for a hunting lodge vibe or work your way through the Chop Shop's cocktail program. And if you tire of the local scene, just take the blue line and in 20 minutes you’ll be near Navy Pier. Bucktown is a locus of Chicago’s beauty, entertainment, and culture - book now to stay in the heart of it all.
transit: The CTA blue line is .6 miles away, or a 10-15 minute walk. Street parking is easy on this block. No Chicago parking zone pass is required.  Interstate 90/94 is only a few blocks away, so getting to the loop only takes 10 minutes via an Uber or Lyft.
access: Once you find your free street parking, you’ll enter the unit on the ground floor with the keys provided. The building is secured with a monitored alarm system that you will use a remote to arm and disarm when coming and going.
host_about: About: Jean Alan's career in design began 30 years ago as a professional set decorator for motion pictures in Chicago and Los Angeles. In the intense atmosphere of the film industry, Alan's knowledge of periods and styles grew exponentially through the scope and depth of each project. The deadline driven, budget conscious environment further sharpened Alan's creativity, leading her to become an exquisitely resourceful designer, finely attuned to detail. Highlights from her career as a set decorator include The Blues Brothers, About Last Night, Midnight Run and The Untouchables.

name: Boutique Retreat- Bucktown/ Logan Square
summary: Sink into the gray wood-framed sofa and admire city views from the wide grid windows at a cozy, city abode with modern lighting, leafy plants, and pearlescent tiles. Stop off at ‪Ipsento‬ Coffee downstairs before heading downtown for the day.
space: Our newly designed living space is a reflection of our unique style.  Our sunny Chicago retreat features a fresh and modern vibe, with furnishing and design elements thoughtfully chosen.  Make yourself at home Contemporary open layout kitchen and common area is perfect for for lounging and enjoying downtime or a nap. Comfortable, modern living room complete with smart tv and Netflix for your ultimate home away from home experience.  Kitchen Enjoy a fully equipped kitchen, brand new appliances ( fridge, stove, oven, microwave and dishwasher) and better then basic cooking tools and essentials Bar/Island seating table for 2.  Bedroom  Comfortable queen size bed with dresser, desk and large walk in closet.  Bathroom  Beautifully tiled bathroom with full tub and shower with glass door. Complimentary  toiletries, and clean towels provided.  Other features include: Iron, ironing board,hair dryer, hangers, self controlled A/C and heat.  Washer/Dryer, shared with tenants, please be respectful.
description: Sink into the gray wood-framed sofa and admire city views from the wide grid windows at a cozy, city abode with modern lighting, leafy plants, and pearlescent tiles. Stop off at ‪Ipsento‬ Coffee downstairs before heading downtown for the day.
neighborhood_overview: Bucktown is a blend of new families and longtime residents. There are a couple of parks within walking distance and the 606 trail is a short ride or walk away. Restaurants, shopping, and nightlife in both Bucktown and Logan Square are nearby.
notes: This apartment is ideal for 2 people. Sleeping arrangements for additional guests include a couch and air mattress available upon request.  Parents with small children: We also have 2 small folding strollers and a pack and play available upon request.
transit: Centrally located near CTA blue line train, 606 trail, and Milwaukee Avenue.  Within a mile from expressway exits.
access: Guest enter though Western Ave.  apartment entrance and walk up flight of stairs to access apartment unit. Common hallway has free washer and dryer that is shared with other tenants.
interaction: Meet and greet is not necessary but always encouraged. We have a retail store that you can pick up and drop off your key during hours of operation. There is also a lock box option. The code will be sent 24 hours before your visit. Available to answer questions via email or text preferred. Property management only minutes away from the Airbnb to assist if needed.
house_rules: Quite hours after 10pm, with respect to our other tenants. No parties or events. No smoking. No pets.
host_about: We have a light filled modern apartment to host your visit. Our Airbnb is a reflection of the store below style in a great neighborhood.

name: Beautiful, bright, art-filled loft.
summary: Spacious loft with high timber ceiling, balcony & large windows. Airy & bright with easy street parking.  5-min walk to the Blue line that takes you to the Loop (downtown) in 20 min. Elevated park & bike path (606) is across the street.
space: I moved to Chicago from NYC for a Job and have been living in both cities ever-since which makes my home in chicago available quite often .  This loft is just that, a home, it is not a corporate rental.  we live here and the atmosphere of the apartment is reflective of our life.  I love art, antiques and unique items which you will find all around the apartment.   Our neighborhood is quite a trendy area with great small and unique shops, restaurants and bars.  I have been exchanging and renting for the many years and couldn't have had better experiences each and every time. I look forward to meeting you should you decide to stay at my home while in Chicago!

The apartment is just that, a home, it is not a corporate rental.  We live here and the atmosphere of the apartment is reflective of our life.  I love of arts, antiques and unique items which you will find all around the apartment.  
We have been exchanging homes for the past 3 years and couldn't have had better experiences each and every time. I look forward to meeting you and make your stay a more pleasant one,  should you decide to stay at our home while in Chicago!

name: Magnificent Mile Private Deluxe King Room
summary: $60 parking extra at check in.  Home of the neon sign visitors and locals know so well, the historic Inn of Chicago Magnificent Mile hotel first opened in 1928 hosting celebs like Bob Hope, Judy Garland, Roy Rogers and showgirls from the Chez Paree supper club. This spacious room features a king sized bed, flat-screen TV and luxurious bath products. Price does not include parking, breakfast or fees.  Note that a facility fee of $17.88 will be collected by the hotel upon check-in.
space: The hotel offers comfortably modern rooms in a spot-on location for exploring Chicago’s museums, lakefront and parks. Plus the world-famous Magnificent Mile is right outside your door. Unwind after a day of conquering the sights with a cocktail in the lobby INNbar. Or if the weather’s cooperating, head up the the 22nd floor Skyline Terrace for enviable city views. Your room will include: WiFi Flat-screen TV Bath amenities Hairdryer The space offers: INNbar 22nd floor Skyline Terrace Fitness center Concierge services Valet Parking Available for $59/night Breakfast Available for an Additional Cost
