name: Logan Square Gem
summary: Steps from the O'Hare to downtown Blue Line train and in the middle of the excitement of Logan Square's entertainment, our charming, vintage home awaits you. Our home features three bedrooms on three levels (one of them is mine :)), a large kitchen, dining room, living room area, back porch/backyard, one bathroom. All is fully furnished and stocked so you can feel at home and stay a while.
space: This is our primary residence but we travel a lot and stay with friends very often. So, basically, you will have the house to yourself. That being said, we are always there for you via text message, and if you need anything don't hesitate to ask.

neighborhood_overview: Logan Square's Milwaukee Avenue is packed with restaurants, bars, coffee shops, galleries, and more. All of which are only a couple of blocks away. Lots to discover and enjoy. If you'd like to branch out, the Blue Line (a 5 min. walk) takes you to Bucktown/Wicker Park, downtown and beyond.
transit: CTA Blue Line is one long block away; a 5 minute walk. So are the Milwaukee, California, and Fullerton buses.
access: The house is yours! Living room with the TV, the washer/dryer in the basement, you name it.
interaction: If I'm not at home you can always get a hold of me.  I will provide my cell number.
host_about:
fun loving, adventurous, but quiet, intelligent, reliable, considerate. My life's passion is travelling in a way in which i can connect with local cultures. I love to read, swim, bicycle, do yoga.
"Live the life you love, love the life you live."

name: Updated 3Br Loft Lakeview Condo w/ Garage Parking
summary: Our fully-rehabbed Lakeview loft is a stunning place for your family to stay - it's ideally located for everything you have planned while you're in Chicago, and has all the amenities of home. We're close to Wrigley Field and have garage parking available for 2 cars if you'll be driving - book today!
space: You enter our condo via a private entrance into an expansive living room and kitchen with exposed beams and modern finishes. A hallway leads to an updated bathroom and two bedrooms, finally ending in a master suite that comprises the entire back half of our home. Total square footage of living space is 2,400 sqft with a 2 car tandem garage.

Lakeview is a lively neighborhood full of old Chicago charm. This apartment is perfect for groups who want to get away from the hustle and bustle of downtown while still having quick and convenient access to everything Chicago has to offer. The apartment is walki
neighborhood_overview: Lakeview is a lively neighborhood full of old Chicago charm. This apartment is perfect for groups who want to get away from the hustle and bustle of downtown while still having quick and convenient access to everything Chicago has to offer. The apartment is walking distance to the shops, restaurants and bars in the neighborhood. Guests can also easily explore the Roscoe Village and Lincoln Park neighborhoods.  In general, Chicagoans are super nice, talkative, and helpful. Chicago is home, and you’ll feel always like one of our own. Lakeview is the perfect location in Chicago. So enjoy!
transit: 5 minute walk from the nearest bus stop then to the subway that will take you all over the city (downtown and Wrigley). Otherwise, you’re a 10-15 minute Uber ride to downtown and a 21 minute Uber to O’Hare airport (no traffic). Everything is near you: Bucktown, WrigleyVille, Downtown, BoysTown, River North, etc.
access: You will have complete and private access to our condo, including the attached 2 car garage.
house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee.  3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. Smoking in the unit will result in a $500 fine and your reservation will be canceled. 4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet
host_about:
My wife and I have lived in Chicago since 2006 (with a 4 year pit stop in NYC). We love that Chicago is a true city with a neighborhood feeling wherever you go. 

Visitors should make sure to take an architectural boat tour, grab a bite at Roister, and a drink at Violet Hour.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is transforming and there’s no time like the summer to be not only in Chicago, but in Humboldt Park.  Don’t want to go to the lakefront? There’s a beach at the park.  There are some really good Puerto Rican restaurants nearby, and whether it’s Wicker Park or Logan Square this unit is close to the places visitors and residents alike flock to.
notes: Don’t be bashful if anything is needed just ask, I live in the building just across the hall from your space.
transit: There is a bus stop less than half a block away (#70 Division). However, if you feel like getting some exercise there is also a Divvy bike ride and share dock at the same bus stop on Division, less than a block away.   An Uber or Lyft is also very to get if you don’t have your own vehicle.
interaction: If I have a baby sitter I am free for the night, if not I am always available via text or phone.  I do check my email but not as frequently as my phone.
house_rules: - Smoking allowed on back deck  - Please keep knowledge of the entry codes limited to people sleeping in the apartment

summary: 1BR/1BA in center of Boystown. Private entrance/exit from the bedroom as well. Just 4-5 blocks from all Halsted/Broadway bars/clubs, Belmont Red Line Station (15 min to Downtown/Loop) and Lake Michigan. 13min walk to Wrigley. Endless food and entertainment options.
space: Living Room is open and spacious. Kitchen is open into the living room. There are dining areas both in the dining section of the living room as well as a brunch high-top table at the turret with great views onto the bubbling street scene below.

neighborhood_overview: We live in the thriving, nerve center of Boystown. You'll find a dozen restaurants within a block either way on Broadway (many quick eats) but also great dine-in options like Wilde (American), Little Wok (Chinese), Eggsperience (Breakfast), Mortar and Pestle (Brunch), Lark (Brunch/Lunch) and DryHop (Brewery-restaurant).  Just 4 blocks over on Halsted St. are all the entertainment options including Sidetrack, DS Tequila, Progress Bar, Minibar, Hydrate and numerous others.
transit: Our corner (literally right outside the door) has stops for: 77 Bus (East to the Lake, West towards the Belmont El Stop) 36 Bus (North towards Andersonville, South towards the Loop) Just 4 blocks west is the CTA Red, Brown and Purple Lines that can take you down into the Loop (12-15 min) or anywhere else in the city. If you're driving, there is a daily parking facility right down the block (to the South - look for the giant yellow "PARK" sign). Easy Access to and from Airports via CTA  O'Hare (ORD): Blue Line to Belmont (Blue) Station. Pick up 77 Bus (East towards Lakeshore or use Uber to Belmont and Broadway - approx 8 bucks). Exit at Belmont and Broadway. 45min-1hr. total commute time. Midway (MDW): Orange Line to Roosevelt Station. Transfer to Red Line train towards Howard. Exit Red Line train at Belmont Station. Use 77 East Bus or walk 4 blocks to Belmont and Broadway. 50-70 minutes total commute time.
access: Very secure because access is controlled from within. Separate keys are needed both to get into the building and to get into the apartment.
interaction: My level of interaction varies depending on my availability and the level of guest comfort. I can be present, but I can also disappear. The way this apartment is set ip makes for a very private experience - no interaction at all is necessary unless using the kitchen. (Bathroom and back exit are private)/
house_rules: No smoking inside and no pets, please. Feel free to use the in-unit washer and dryer (located in the back bedroom), but please be mindful of property. Kitchen is available for use to share with the homeowners. We expect that all the guests staying at our property will be named on the reservation.
host_about: Two mid-30s professionals living in the heart of Boystown, Lakeview, Chicago.

name: Private Room in Wrigley/Boystown
summary: Come get the full Chicago experience! Steps away from Wrigley Field, Boystown, and the Red Line which goes right into downtown. Lots of food nearby. Easy access to all things Chicago in a fun and exciting neighborhood.
space: Your private room comes with a very comfortable full-sized bed, complete with extra blankets/bedding/pillows for colder weather. You also get 2 towel sets, toiletries, shampoo/body wash, and even some mints! A personalized greeting on the white-board in the room, which you can also use to provide messages of your own/advice and critiques. Also storage for your clothes, and a hamper for any dirty laundry you might want to wash (I can happily provide detergent).

Easy access to all things Chicago in a fun and exciting neighborhood. Your private room comes with a very comfortable full-sized bed, complete with extra blankets/bedding/pillows for colder weather. You also get 2 towel sets, toiletries, shampoo/body wash, and even some mints! A personalized greeting on the white-board in the room, which you can also use to provide messages of your own/advice and critiques. Also storage for your clothes, and a hamper for any dirty laundry you might want to wash (I can happily provide detergent). You are allowed access to the entire house, save my private room. This includes the bathroom (obviously), the living room complete with a TV and X-Box, the kitchen, with all the appropriate cooking and food storage devices you can imagine, plus a dishwasher! Laundry is downstairs, and only $0.75 a machine. I'm usua
neighborhood_overview: We're at the cusp of Wrigleyville (the very active and exciting area near Wrigley Field) and Boystown (a friendly and safe neighborhood with plenty of shops and restaurants). You are mere SECONDS away from Wrigley Field, if you wanna watch a baseball game, and plenty of nightlife just around the corner. However, if you need to just stay in for a night, the building is pretty sound-proof, and far away enough that you are able to get a good night's sleep without being disturbed.
transit: STEPS AWAY FROM THE CTA RED LINE!! This train is one of the essential ones in Chicago, allowing you to reach downtown in less than 20 minutes! Also near the 8 bus (also headed downtown) and the 152 (headed west on Addison). You are also just a few blocks away from the water's edge if you want a great view of the lake :-) I recommend traveling exclusively via CTA here, just because parking can be tricky when so close to Wrigley Field. It's cheap, and so close-by. There are also taxis everywhere, and you usually don't have to wait more than 5 minutes for an Uber or Lyft driver. It's a very popular area, so it's a breeze getting to and from here.
access: You are allowed access to the entire house, save my private room. This includes the bathroom (obviously), the living room complete with a TV and X-Box, the kitchen, with all the appropriate cooking and food storage devices you can imagine, plus a dishwasher! Laundry is downstairs, and only $0.75 a machine.
interaction: I'm usually pretty busy with work/rehearsals/performances, so I will mostly be out of your hair. However, I am always available via call or text to answer any questions or for any recommendations for your travels! When I am home, if you need anything, don't hesitate to ask.
house_rules: ***SORRY, NO SAME-DAY BOOKINGS*** Only a few house-keeping rules: - No Smoking - No other guests aside from who is on the reservation (subject to fine for unauthorized guests) - No breaking things - No stealing things - Please clean up after yourself in common areas (kitchen, living room, bathroom) And that's it!
host_about:
I moved to Chicago to be in a place full of life, art, culture, and history. This is a place where anything can be happening at any time of year and I love being a part of it!
I'm a huge fan of music, especially classic rock and vocal music. I'm a singer, so I love to listen to music that I can recreate myself. If you love making/experiencing music, I think we'll get along fine.
Theater and acting is my main passion, and I enjoy watching it as much as doing it. Thank the Lord for Netflix! But nothing compares to watching live theater, and Chicago has some of the best.

If you like your privacy, I can fully appreciate that, but just say the word and I can also be good company. There may even be breakfast/a cold drink involved. Your choice, I'm happy to provide.

summary: Newly renovated and spacious 2Bed/2Bath brownstone. Uptown Gem condo w/ 2 FREE PARKING spots. Only 2 blocks to "L" Lawrence Red Line train. This gives you cheap and easy transit to downtown Chicago, Andersonville, Wrigley, and walkable to the gorgeous Lakefront, beaches, restaurants and bars. Access to the entire condo w/HDTV, Wi-Fi, Free parking if requested and street parking is free with use of permit. Use of lush back deck, grill, gorgeous oversized kitchen & hardwood floors throughout.

Extra large kitchen with new appliances and granite counter tops.  Gorgeous hardwood throughout.  Dimmable lighting.  Lush outdoor space with access to grill/deck/couch. neighborhood_overview: A vibrant blend of old and new, Uptown is an intriguing neighborhood where Chicago's rich history and ethnic diversity intersect. This was a booming entertainment district for shopping and revelry in the 1920s and 1930s — though the area has weathered multiple changes over time. Most recently, a renaissance has been underway in the Uptown neighborhood and that faded glory is sparkling once again in the form of restored movie palaces and Art Deco beauties. For live music and nightlife, sit back for some jazz at the Green Mill, a 100-year-old classic where the swanky atmosphere harks back to prohibition's heyday. Or for a lively mix, go for either indie rock, salsa concerts at the Riviera or Aragon.
notes: Thor and Sasha, our 2 friendly low maintenance cats are here to welcome and be your friend!
transit: Street parking is plentiful and free on Magnolia Ave.  If needed, we have a secure parking lot behind our condo for your use.  We are two blocks form the "EL" Lawrence Red Line Train.  This train gets you downtown in 25 minutes.  Very easy to use!
access: One parking spot is provided in a gated lot and street parking is free.  WIFI and Hulu, Netflix, HBO GO television are available on a 55 in HDTV. Guests are provided with use of the in-unit washer and dryer, as well as towels and Spa toiletries.  Gas fireplace in living room, Over-sized modern kitchen with dishwasher, along with all kitchen necessities such as dishes, pots, pans, and silverware, stemware. Additionally, vita-mix, toaster, and outdoor grill, along with patio furniture on the lush back deck.
interaction: At anytime, please feel free to contact me with questions or ways to make your stay more comfortable at Uptown Gem!
house_rules: No parties, no smoking, no drugs No other guests besides you, the number stated in your reservation, unless I approve.  No rowdy, loud behavior.  Please clean up after your messes.  People live above and below this unit. We ask that you please respect our home as you would your own and be respectful of neighbors. Smoking on the back patio area is just fine with use of ashtray.   Our two cats must remain inside at all times. Use of livingroom Denon stereo with in-wall speakers is strickly prohibited
host_about: With a passion for travel and a background in luxury hospitality management, Airbnb is a natural way I can share my own version of hospitality.  My partner, Gus, and I love to explore different places, try new foods/wine and spend time with our friends and family. As an Airbnb Superhost, rest assured you will have a comfortable and memorable stay in our “Uptown Gem” Chicago condo.

neighborhood_overview: The Southport Corridor of Lakeview’s neighborhood has so much within walking distance, you won't want to leave! There are numerous bakeries, boutique stores, theaters, and lively bars and restaurants. If you do feel like venturing out of the neighborhood, Lakeview is very centrally located. Head south to visit Lincoln Park, River North, and the Loop, or west to visit Buck Town or Logan square. Within minutes in a cab, you can be in any of these places.
notes: COURTESY  Please note this unit is on a quiet residential street. We respect our neighbors, and for that reason the building's outdoor space is not for socializing, and instead we request guests socialize indoors only. We request quiet hours from 9pm-8am.  UNIT  Only those on the reservation are permitted in the unit/room.  CLEANING  We expect guests to clean up after themselves in shared spaces. For example, throw away any trash, place used kitchen items in dishwasher, wipe down bathroom sink / kitchen counters after use, etc. We also request that personal bathroom items are kept in your bedroom when not in use (a shower caddy is provided for your convenience). This keeps the shared spaces clean for all guests. BEDROOM LOCKS Both bedrooms may be locked from the inside but do not have keys to be locked from the outside. All guests trust each other to respect the privacy and personal belongings of others.
transit: PARKING There is free, public street parking in the area with no permit required. Please note that this means you may have to circle the block a few times to find a spot. There is also metered parking on a nearby street, and that becomes free from 6pm-9am daily. If you prefer paid parking for your additional vehicles, I recommend using Spot-Hero to find nearby options that work for you. Once you're here, public transportation and/or Uber are the easiest ways to get around the city. CLOSEST STOPS o Southport brown train stop: .4 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o Belmont red/purple/brown trains: .7 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o 77 bus: across Belmont Stations all have machines that sell Ventra passes (name of card provider). You can also purchase Ventra cards at Walgreens. You can either purchase a single ride ticket or a re-loadable Ventra card (one-time $5 fee). Multiple people may share a Ventra card and fares will be deducted for each person; however, the 1, 3, and 7 day passes can n
access: You'll have a PRIVATE bedroom, then SHARE the kitchen, living room, and 1 bathroom (all within your unit). All linens and towels are included. KEYS There is self-entry anytime from 4pm on. You will be given 1 set of keys for your stay. If keys are lost, there is a $15 replacement fee. CENTRAL HEAT/AC The unit has central heat/AC with a thermostat within the unit. The temperature is on a pre-set schedule for the comfort of all guests.
interaction: My goal is to ensure you have the most enjoyable and comfortable stay in Chicago. I send detailed notes in advance about entry and the unit to ensure smooth logistics; in addition, before and during your stay, I'm more than happy to help with any suggestions or guidance. Depending on my work travel schedule, I may or may not be in town; however, I'm always accessible via phone or email for any questions that arise.
house_rules: REQUESTS:  1) Please treat the home with respect.  There is a $250 fee for smoking, and the reservation will be terminated at your expense. 2) Please be courteous of others in building and neighbors. All socializing must be kept indoors after 9pm, and we request quiet time indoors from 9pm-8am.  3) The only guests allowed in the building are those on the reservation.   4) Personal bathroom items must be kept in your room. If you use common spaces, we request you tidy up after yourself to keep the spaces clean for everyone (for example, kitchen items in dishwasher, wipe counters, throw out trash, etc).   CHECK IN/OUT: Standard check-in time is 4pm (or later). Standard check-out time is by 10am. If unit is not vacated by check-out time or notes are not followed, additional cleaning charges may apply.   For check out, I ask that you:   - turn off lights in your room/common spaces   - ensure your used kitchen items are in dishwasher  - dispose of any of your food/drink from fridge and any
host_about:
I began using Airbnb as a traveler in the fall of 2013, and I'm hooked! Staying in someone's home allows you to experience the area in a truly authentic way - no more hotels for me! As of May 2014, I began hosting in Chicago and have since hosted thousands of guests from around the world. I love helping others make the most of their visits. 

As a host, I am personable, responsive, and detail-oriented. I take great pride in the comfort and cleanliness of each apartment. You can trust that when staying in any one of our properties, you will feel at home.

neighborhood_overview: There is a reason this neighborhood is rated one of the best in the country. Only about half a square mile, Ukrainian Village manages to serve as a shopping hub, hipster haven, cozy neighborhood for the stroller set, and, yes, outpost for immigrants from Ukraine. As you wander along Chicago Avenue, you’ll see storefront signs in Ukrainian, no English in sight, even though the original population has dwindled to a couple of thousand from its one-time high of around 30,000. Indeed, the rest of the city has discovered the well-maintained housing stock and double-wide sidewalks of Division Street—welcoming features that in 1983 prompted Mayor Jane Byrne to designate Ukrainian Village an official neighborhood, the first in Chicago.
notes: Please note that there are tenants that live in the same building. After 10 PM please respect their peace by not being too loud. Please note that there is an additional cleaning charge of $25 for leaving dirty dishes behind for the cleaning crew. Also, if you do not follow the 11AM checkout rule and the cleaning crew has to wait for you to vacate there will be a $25 fee. If there is a prenegotiated late check out this will not apply.
transit: We are a short ride via the Milwaukee North Metra line non-stop to Downtown. The Metra is a 2 minute walk from the front door. There is also a Divvy Bike rental located at the Metra stop and there is a new electric scooter program in the City. Plenty of street parking abounds and Uber and Lyft will typically be at the front door in 2-3 Minutes. If Navy Pier is your destination you can catch the 65 Grand Bus right out front direct, with no changes.
access: The entire apartment is there for use. Additionally, there is an outdoor common area courtyard out the back with table and chairs as well as a grill for BBQ. Please see the attached full list of amenities.
interaction: Hosts Brad and Darin are very easy to reach and knowledgeable on the City. Both live in the area and are great guides for local restaurants, bars, amusements, and shops. They are happy to show you around personally, or leave you to explore the awesome neighborhood and city on your own. Both always available by phone 24/7.
house_rules: Please note that there are tenants that live in the same building. After 10 PM please respect their peace by not being too loud.   Large parties and Smoking will not be tolerated at the property. If this rule is not followed you will forfiet you security deposit.  Please note that there is an additional cleaning charge of $25 for leaving dirty dishes behind for the cleaning crew.  Also, if you do not follow the 11AM checkout rule and the cleaning crew has to wait for you to vacate there will be a $25 fee. If there is a pre-negotiated late check out this will not apply.
host_about: Travel and Food enthusiast and Airbnb Superhost

neighborhood_overview: We’re located on the north side of Chicago in Lincoln Park, one of Chicago’s trendiest and safest neighborhoods. Our neighborhood is a wonderful mix of bustling streets packed with local restaurants and shops, as well as quiet tree-lined streets full of historic buildings. We’re also minutes away from many of Chicago’s most popular spots.
notes: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS 1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?” Directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. We're around the corner from the Wrightwood 659 art gallery. Search for “Wrightwood 659 Gallery Chicago” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest. 2. When is check-in/check-out? Check-in is 3 p.m. or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room. Check-out is at 11 a.m. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11 a.m., but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up by 2:30 p.m. at the latest. 3. “Can a third person stay in the room with me?” We allow a maximum of two guests per room. We have additional rooms available if you need accommodations for more than two people. Send us a message for more info. 4. Will I have my own private bathroom? The apartment has two share
transit: Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber. ￫ The Fullerton Red/Brown/Purple Line 'L' train station is a 10-minute walk away. ￫ O'Hare is 55 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber. ￫ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.
access: In addition to your room, you'll have shared access to the kitchen, living room, dining room, bathrooms, and washer/dryer.
house_rules: 1) Only the reservation holder and guests added to the reservation via Airbnb may have access to the apartment.   2) As a courtesy to any other guests who you might be sharing the apartment with, please clean up after yourself immediately in the common areas. 3) As a courtesy to your fellow guests and to your neighbors, please keep noise to a minimum, especially between 9 pm - 9 am. 4) This is a non-smoking apartment. If smoke is detected, a cleaning fee of $150 will be charged. 5) No late check-outs. Check-out is at 11 am.  In order to compensate our cleaning assistants for lost time, additional charges will be sent if they're unable to begin their job at 11 am. One hour or less - $25 Each additional hour - $40 6) Damaged/stained/missing towels, bedding, and/or furnishings will incur additional fees. The per-item fees are as follows: Bedsheet- $12 Towel - $12 Pillow - $30 Pillowcase: $10 Comforter - $50 Clothes hangers - $3 Furnishings - Dependant on item

neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is close to the beach. The beach offers a great running and biking trail. Additionally, it is very close to Mariano's (a fantastic grocery store) and Little Saigon if you love Vietnamese food. Due to the multitude of bus stops and nearby train stations, it has easy access to numerous areas of the city. We love that it is less than 10 min walk to the beach. (The closest you can get to the beach in the city) Also, you can jump on the 147 bus and be at the Magnificent Mile & Hancock building in less than 20 min.
transit: Bus Stops: ~5 or less min walk to bus stops ~5 min walk to 81 Bus Stop Rail Stations: ~3 min walk to the Argyle Red Line ~20-25 min via public transit to Wrigley Field ~20 min to Michigan & Oak (The Start of the Magnificent Mile) via Bus 147 ~35 min to the Art Institute of Chicago via Bus 147 Rental Car: ~10 min walk to Enterprise Rental Car

host_about:
My name is Elena, I live in Chicago and work as Mobile Software Engineer. Beside my job I enjoy traveling, photography and meeting new people. 

I am originally from Russia , but lived all over the world (e.g. Japan, Czech Republic, Germany, USA). I have traveled to 30+ countries. 
I love meeting new people and sharing our travel experiences.

name: Six Stylish Beds in Noble Square!
summary: When you book here, you're renting three individual apartments all under one roof! They're easily accessible to one another via a shared hallway but everyone gets privacy when it's needed - plus you get separate kitchens and living rooms / TVs.  You'll also love the location - close to the West Loop, River North, and Wicker Park, and just a short ride on the Blue or Green Line to the Loop. And the neighborhood itself is full of bars, restaurants, and shops - you'll love staying here! Book today!
space: There are three apartments included in this listing: two have two bedrooms with one bathroom, and another has one bedroom, a day bed, and a bathroom. They each have a full kitchen and living room.

The team will otherwise be your point of contact for any questions o
neighborhood_overview: Noble Square is a growing community filled with artists, musicians and young urban professionals. Due to its lower cost and lower density, urban dwellers are rediscovering the character of the area. It's very near Wicker Park and River North for a night out, and the neighborhood itself has many family-owned restaurants and shops that often reflect its European heritage.
transit: I'm a 12 or so minute walk to the Chicago Ave Blue line station and the Ashland Green/Pink line station, and steps to the Chicago Ave and Ashland buses - it's easy to navigate the city without a car from here! If you do bring a car, however, you'll find street parking in the neighborhood.
access: You'll have full access to my three apartments, and the deck in the backyard.
interaction: A local management team handles my listing while I'm out of town - they'll ensure you get the information and service you need to make your stay enjoyable! The team will otherwise be your point of contact for any questions or requests you have related to your stay.
house_rules: - House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 5.) Pets are not allowed at the property  6.) Stan's doughnuts right next door 7-11 next door Lou Malnatti's takeout and delivery infamous Chicago pizza place next door Estelle's and Flat Iron late night 4am bars down the street and around the corner Walgreens open 24 hours Bonci, etta, Paradise Park, Dove’s and Cafe Robey, all brand new delicious restaurants for you to enjoy! interaction: I am available anytime via text message and messenger through airbnb.
house_rules: No parties under any circumstances. No events unless Hannah authorizes them before booking the event, additional fees may apply.
host_about:
I love what I do here in Chicago and I have over 7 years of experience in acting, filmmaking, and event production. I recently acquired a job with a digital marketing agency where I spend my time making websites, brand strategies, and creating content such as photos and blog articles for clients!  Let me know if you have an interest in any of the above!

I graduated from Northwestern University in 2013 and never left the city of Chicago because I had a desire to explore and learn and build my creative career here. Chicago is an absolutely wonderful place to live and grow.

I put together MaiTri Chicago in early 2017 because I wanted a space where people can teach others and learn and connect from other people who are like minded, mindful, and creative people. MaiTri is a community full of artists and healers. We co-create workshops, yoga classes, and politically mindful artist showcases to the mindful community. 

The desire to connect and give others a way to connect never went away since my study abroad experiences in London and Prague and my work experience with the creative artists here in Chicago. I enjoy it more than ever and I frequently travel overseas to major world cities to open my mind and have new experiences .... ~ I love what we do . 
 
~Hannah

neighborhood_overview: 100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.
house_rules: Please read your check-in instructions carefully Please no overstaying past your checkout time
host_about:
Hello! My name is Natalia, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, Marina, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an investment banker in the loop. 

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

name: Lovely 2 BR in Safe Neighborhood
summary: Explore Chicago from the comfort of a bright and neat apartment in one of the safest parts of the city! Feel at home with your own private living area and kitchenette. We love to have guests and strive to exceed expectations! Free Wi-Fi and parking.
space: Located in a very safe and quiet neighborhood, the basement apartment is well lit and comfortable.  There are two bedrooms with two twin beds in each. If you make a booking for 2 guests, I will assume that you are only using one bedroom unless you tell me otherwise. If you need both bedrooms for a 2 person reservation you must tell me beforehand so that I can prepare both rooms.  We can set up an Air Mattress in the living room and/or a Pack in Play for babies or toddlers in any of the rooms.  WiFi is provided. Basic kitchen utensils and plastic-ware are provided. Kitchenette consists of fridge/freezer, electric oven, microwave oven, stove, coffee maker and hot water kettle and sink in laundry area.  It is basic but fully functional.

Kitchenette consists of fridge/freezer, electric oven, microwave oven, stove, coffee maker and hot water kettle and sink in laundry area.  It is basic but fully functional. Separa
neighborhood_overview: Great park just one block away. The apartment is located in Peterson Park area at the northern edge of the city, known as a quiet and safe neighborhood. The Lincoln Cafe is close by and provides delicious kosher breakfast choices to go.
notes: I have young children who wake up at 7AM. They sometimes go to our main floor and run around. If you are a light sleeper, this may wake you up.
transit: This apartment is ideal for people with cars but can also be used without one. Plenty of free parking available in front of the house and right nearby. Close to mass transit. You can get to most places in the city in around an hour via public transportation. The closest cta train stop is accessible by a 8 minute walk plus a 7 minute bus ride. We are just 20 to 30 minutes by car from O'Hare airport and downtown and by Uber it can be 20 to 26 dollars.
access: Separate side entrance to the apartment provides privacy and comfort. Washer Dryer is shared by us and someone may come down between 12pm and 5pm Monday to Thursday and 9am and 5pm on Friday to use it. Otherwise the entire apartment is exclusively for guests. We have two storage rooms located near the apartment and on rare occasions need to access. We communicate with guests before going to the storage rooms.
interaction: I'd be happy to share with you any information you need. I would be happy to tell you about my favorite places to hang out, tour and eat.
house_rules: No loud noise, smoking or pets allowed. No stepping on the neighbors grass or loud noises outside the home. Only airbnb guests allowed on premises. No guests of guests allowed. Only the number of guests specified in the reservation allowed, unless otherwise agreed upon.
host_about:
I am a young Rabbi trying to change the world by making quality education more available. My wife and I love it when our home is full of guests. We have two young children who are just adorable. In June 2014 I asked a friend in New York if I could stay at his place. He had no extra space but suggested that I use Airbnb. That gave me an idea. Many of our guests had commented on how much they loved staying in our basement apartment. It is clean and comfy. Why not rent it on Airbnb when we have no guests? 
And here we are today. I hope that it works for you!

Shmuel

name: Skydeck Experience at Indiana Place
summary: The Skydeck Experience by DivvyTrek features a private guest room in a modern condo unit one-half block to the Chicago Transit Authority (CTA) Green Line stop at Indiana that’s a 20 minute ride to major downtown attractions such as The Skydeck at Willis Tower.  The McCormick Place Convention Center is just 20 minutes by train. Close to lakefront, beaches, stadiums and Hyde Park. University of Chicago, IIT, UIC and Loop campuses are nearby.
space: We offer a one bedroom in a large, luxurious condo located in a hip, up-and-coming neighborhood with culture and soul near the Chicago Loop. Includes free parking, WiFi and washer/dryer access. You'll enjoy the privacy and comfort of your own bedroom, a fully-equipped modern kitchen and full access to the dining and living rooms. Long-term stays are available as well.  There may be additional guests staying in the other bedrooms during your stay which is great for meeting new people and networking. Essentially, we offer guests the convenience of a boutique hotel while providing the comfort of home.  We're just a mile away from Chicago's lakefront, providing great bike trails, running paths, beaches and gardens, not to mention views of one of the world's most scenic waterfront skylines. Of course, we're conveniently situated for business travelers attending conventions at McCormick Place or meetings with major corporations downtown, as well as institutions of higher learning, such as II

We offer a one bedroom in a large, luxurious condo located in a hip, up-and-coming neighborhood with culture and soul near the Chicago Loop. Includes free parking, WiFi and washer/dryer access. There may be additional guests staying in the other bedrooms during your stay which is great for meeting new people and networking. Essentially, we offer guests the convenience of a bo
neighborhood_overview: Experience the city like a true, native Chicagoan. Close to several parks and restaurants. Only a mile away from the beautiful Chicago Lakefront and Beaches! Plenty of trails for biking, walking and jogging.       Enjoy water sports at the nearby harbor:    * Jet skis   * Kayaks   * Flyboards   * Paddleboards    Plus spectacular views of Chicago's magnificent skyline.
transit: Nearest public transit is less than one block away, arriving every 5-10 minutes. Bike shares are available at the station. Just download Acehopper for iPhone and Android for public transit times, bike sharing availability and info for local events and attractions, including maps and tickets for purchase direct from your phone or tablet. Of course, we also recommend rideshare services such as Uber and Lyft to navigate around the city.
access: Guests have complete access to our modern, fully-equipped kitchen so long as it's kept clean after each use.
interaction: Guests are provided city guides and public transit info via Acehopper, "Airbnb's front desk concierge", available for iPhone, iPad and Android devices, for tickets, guides and tips on local places to visit.  When I’m around, I like to entertain. I’ll definitely make your stay a comfortable and memorable visit to the area.  Sometimes I’m busy, but I’ll do my best to accommodate your needs.
house_rules: • Check-in is anytime after 3PM • No parties or events • No pets • No smoking All shoes must be taken off at the door. Feel free to bring house slippers. No pets. Please be energy conscious and turn off lights and electronics when leaving. Please also clean up after use the common areas such as the kitchen (especially dishes and appliances), hallway bathroom, living and dining rooms.
host_about: Greetings!  I'm part of the Divvytrek community which is centered around homesharing focused on making the world a better place through cultural exchange and technology innovation.

name: Clean and cozy Northside retreat
summary: Located in a unique Chicago neighborhood, my condo is a great getaway in the city. Close to public transportation to visit downtown or Wrigley Field. Local eats & drinks within walking distance, 50 minutes to downtown via public transportation. 20-30 minute drive to O'Hare airport* or 45 minutes on public transportation. Free street parking. Sunny corner unit with security gate/buzzer system.
space: Your home-away-from-home is on the SE corner of a 16-unit walk-up vintage condo building on the 2nd floor, so you'll get tons of space and natural light. There is a comfy queen size pillow-top bed in your bedroom with new memory foam pillows, 800 thread-count sheets and luxurious bedding, along with a dresser and empty closet for your use.  There is central A/C & heat, a ceiling fan, large southern exposure window for plenty of natural light, blackout curtains, plus extra linens and pillows in the closet.  This condo building was gut-rehabbed in 2006 and features hardwood floors, granite counters and stainless steel appliances. My entire unit was professionally repainted in December 2018.
description: Located in a unique Chicago neighborhood, my condo is a great getaway in the city. Close to public transportation to visit downtown or Wrigley Field. Local eats & drinks within walking distance, 50 minutes to downtown via public transportation. 20-30 minute drive to O'Hare airport* or 45 minutes on public transportation. Free street parking. Sunny corner unit with security gate/buzzer system. Your home-away-from-home is on the SE corner of a 16-unit walk-up vintage condo building on the 2nd floor, so you'll get tons of space and natural light. There is a comfy queen size pillow-top bed in your bedroom with new memory foam pillows, 800 thread-count sheets and luxurious bedding, along with a dresser and empty closet for your use.  There is central A/C & heat, a ceiling fan, large southern exposure window for plenty of natural light, blackout curtains, plus extra linens and pillows in the closet.  This condo building was gut-rehabbed in 2006 and features hardwood floors, granite counters
neighborhood_overview: Located in a quiet, tree-lined neighborhood of Irving Park (on the border of Albany Park). Albany Park is one of the most culturally diverse neighborhoods in the U.S. It offers many ethnic restaurants, with acclaimed Mexican, Lebanese and Persian all within walking distance. There are also several watering holes nearby, where you can enjoy local brews and live music. It's very easy to get anywhere in the city from here via CTA bus or L train, and the I-90/94 expressway is nearby.  In case you run out of anything, there is a CVS, Walgreens and 7-11 within walking distance. Starbucks too!
notes: I’ve received comments in the past that the upstairs neighbors walking around can be pretty loud, so if communal space noises are bothersome to you, my unit may not be the one for you. I provide a white noise machine and ear plugs for sensitive sleepers.
transit: O'HARE AIRPORT: 20-30* minutes driving/40-50 minutes via transit MIDWAY AIRPORT: 45-60* minutes driving/1.25-1.5 hours via transit DOWNTOWN: 25-35* minutes driving/45-50 minutes via transit  *travel times can be significantly longer during high traffic The #78 Montrose bus is on the corner of my street. It's a 4 block walk to the Kedzie brown line "L" stop, and a 5 block walk to the #80 Irving Park bus. All 3 are great options to get you to Wrigley Field within 20-30 minutes or downtown/Millennium Park in 45-50 minutes. Also, the Montrose blue line "L" stop is not far if you're coming from O'Hare. Approximately a 30 minute drive to O'Hare or downtown, and a 15 minute drive to Wrigley Field. Uber/Lyft always arrive within 5 minutes. There's a Divvy bike station 4 blocks away on Kedzie/Sunnyside, and it's a quick 20 minute ride to beautiful Montrose beach (or take the #78 bus 3.5 miles east). G00gle maps does a great job of including Chicago public transportation and biking on their rout
access: In addition to your Queen bedroom, there is in-unit laundry, back porch, large kitchen, dining area, 42" TV in living room with basic cable, Netflix and Amazon Prime.  We'll share the bathroom, living room (my office is also in the living room so I'm there most weekdays), kitchen, and back porch. Kitchen is stocked with all the basic appliances you need to cook, a coffee maker, blender, juicer, toaster oven and water filter on tap. Help yourself to several teas to choose from.
interaction: I'm friendly, outgoing and a great host (If I do say so myself!).  I'll let you do your own thing, but I can offer tips for getting around and things to do in the neighborhood/city if you'd like. I work from home, so I'm in my living room office during the day. I've got a busy social calendar, so I'm usually out at night, but I'm assuming you will be too! You're on your own for food, but the fridge and kitchen are yours to use.
house_rules: •Building quiet hours are 10pm-6am.  •Renters over 25 years old.  •No parties.  •No additional overnight guests. •No smoking inside the house (outside is ok). •Please eat in dining areas only. •AirBnB rule: We require Airbnb reservations booked for personal travel to be booked by the person who's going to stay at the listing. This is my home, so please just treat it like you'd treat your own. This is a 16-unit building and the usual communal-living noises are to be expected, but I try to keep it pretty quiet. I just ask that you give my neighbors the same respect you'd give your own.
host_about:
I am a graphic designer, living on the north side of Chicago. Sports fan, dog lover, enjoyer of fine (and not-so-fine!) wine. Well-traveled, fun-loving, Reiki master. I love to enjoy nature on a long walk or bike ride. I practice yoga, volunteer and am very involved with the Irish community in Chicago.

I look forward to meeting you!

name: Spacious King Room in Boutique Wicker Park B&B
summary: Spacious, bright and modern guest room located is just a block away from great dining, vintage and boutique shopping, art galleries, cool cafes and vibrant nightlife.  The Damen King guest room is one of 9 rooms within the Wicker Park Inn, a newly renovated, boutique Bed and Breakfast offering high quality yet affordable accommodations in a hip & trendy neighborhood.
space: Damen King has a king-size bed with an en suite bathroom.  This room is located on the second floor with a skylight for additional lighting. Each room has free WiFi, DirecTV, and breakfast is included in the rate. Damen King comfortably accommodates 2 guests, but also includes a rollaway cot for a third guest for an additional rate of $25/night + tax.
description: Spacious, bright and modern guest room located is just a block away from great dining, vintage and boutique shopping, art galleries, cool cafes and vibrant nightlife.  The Damen King guest room is one of 9 rooms within the Wicker Park Inn, a newly renovated, boutique Bed and Breakfast offering high quality yet affordable accommodations in a hip & trendy neighborhood. Damen King has a king-size bed with an en suite bathroom.  This room is located on the second floor with a skylight for additional lighting. Each room has free WiFi, DirecTV, and breakfast is included in the rate. Damen King comfortably accommodates 2 guests, but also includes a rollaway cot for a third guest for an additional rate of $25/night + tax. Enjoy free wi-fi, satellite TV, and breakfast. We are a fully staffed Bed & Breakfast. Our office is open 7am - 9pm, Mon - Fri and 8am - 8pm, Sat & Sun. Wicker Park is a diverse, thriving community full of vintage boutiques, coffee shops, highly-rated restaurants, and trendy
neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park is a diverse, thriving community full of vintage boutiques, coffee shops, highly-rated restaurants, and trendy bars.  Tree-lined residential streets are beautifully lined with a vibrant mix of historic and modern homes.
notes: We’re just minutes away from downtown Chicago, where you can enjoy popular Chicago attractions such as the Magnificent Mile, Museum Campus, Millennium Park, Navy Pier, and Chicago Theaters. With all the amenities of a hotel and the warmth of home, the Wicker Park Inn Bed and Breakfast is a rewarding lodging experience that allows you to live like a local!
transit: The Wicker Park Inn is nestled a convenient walking distance from two Blue Line el stops as well as several buses to both downtown and north side Chicago! On-site garage and permit parking is available for $25/night, with free parking available within a few blocks of our location.
access: Enjoy free wi-fi, satellite TV, and breakfast.
interaction: We are a fully staffed Bed & Breakfast. Our office is open 7am - 9pm, Mon - Fri and 8am - 8pm, Sat & Sun.
house_rules: Since we are in a residential area, we ask our guests to to respect our neighbors and other guests.  We kindly request that quiet hours be observed between the hours of 10:00pm and 6:00am.
host_about:
Thank you for your interest in the Wicker Park Inn!  We've enjoyed hosting many guests from all over the world, and we're always excited to share our wonderful city and neighborhood with new visitors.  We are honored to be considered a second home for many visiting family and friends in the neighborhood.

I've lived in the Wicker Park/Bucktown neighborhood over 15 years and have seen a lot of amazing changes.  There is always a new restaurant opening while old favorites just get better with time.

I grew up in Chicago and returned home in 1996 after earning an Urban Studies degree from Brown University.  I started running the Wicker Park Inn in 2004.  Over the years, we've updated and expanded the Wicker Park Inn which now includes four guestrooms and three apartments.  We are staffed with amazing innkeepers, Robin and Emily, and our impeccable cleaning staff.

We look forward to hosting your stay!

name: Irving Park Private Tree-lined Room
summary: Live like a local, live with a local. This is my beautiful, colorful, charming abode.  Irving Park is a quiet city neighborhood that offers large walkways lined with big trees with new eateries popping up. You'll be staying with me, a pretty laid back individual that likes to cook and chill out at home.  Chicago is a BIG city and the neighborhoods are its gems. This place is central to trendy areas Logan Square, Lincoln Square and Wrigleyville just a 15-20min bus ride away, Downtown 45min.
space: Twin size bed. Cozy reading chair by the window. 24" monitor w/ speakers - plug in your laptop or phone for a movie or music. Tree eye view, so the unit requires you to take a few flight of stairs.  (Heavy luggage warning)

neighborhood_overview: Irving Park is a residential neighborhood set with large trees and very narrow streets. It is located conveniently by the 90/94 expressway. Easy driving to/from the city and suburbs.  Street parking is available, but will get increasingly difficult to find a nearby spot after 8pm. Meters are free 10pm-8am and Sundays.
notes: I prefers to keep my home clean and orderly. Hopefully, you will find it a tranquil and calming place to rest from all your travels. Please have a completed and verified profile ready along with an an intro in your booking request.
transit: Public Transit: Get a Ventra card and ride CTA buses/trains for under $2.50 to get anywhere in the city.  Outbound from O'Hare airport blue line station is $5. Time to downtown from my place: 45 minutes - 1 hour. Nearest bus stops are 2-5 min walk. Commuter Rail: Metra Pacific Northwest Line (Irving Park). My Uber code: kqaz8 (Free Ride for new users)
access: Just ask first.
interaction: Hi I'm Jackie and I'm a born and raised Chicagoan so I know my way around the city. Feel free to join me in coffee or wine and share with me your travel plans and stories!
house_rules: No outside shoes in the condo.  It's not needed, but my personal travel tip is flip-flops!! Cheap, lite, pack flat and keeps your foot clean.  Clean up after yourself like shower drain, bathroom sink by properly removing and disposing debris in to trash can (not drain).  Please do not bring unregistered guests. Quiet hours after 9:30pm on weekdays - my work day starts at 6am, please be respectful of the hours the night before. I'm mostly likely in bed around 10pm, so I ask my guests to be mindful when booking. Thanks for reading and with your cooperation, I make a good effort as the homeowner to make it comfortable so we both can share a positive and peaceful experience.
host_about:
Food enthusiast: Street food to Michelin 3, if food falls into the delicious, unique or interesting category, I will give it a go.

Avid traveler: I've been all over the US (45 states) and world (+30 countries). I am a Airbnb user as both host and guest.  I enjoy meeting folks from all parts of the world, whether they come to my place or I stay at their's. The comforts of home and friends is something I seek wherever I go. 

My day job is working in automotive infotainment - translation, I make all the fun stuff in the car that works with a phone.

name: PARKING IN Building | 2BR Executive Suite w/ Rooftop Pool, Gym and Balcony by ENVITAE
summary: Ask about our free trip insurance for April and May bookings.  We offer parking with IN/OUT privileges and elevators directly to your suite.  Newly renovated and professionally decorated space with brand new furniture including memory foam mattresses by Casper and luxury linens.  Very well stocked kitchen for the chef in you.  Excellent tech package with blazing fast internet and streaming channels for 4K TV.  Premium modern building with modern amenities like Full Gym, Sky Deck with Pool and Club Lounge with Billiards. Very safe and secure building with 24 hour doorman.  If you are accustomed to luxury or just want to experience it for a short time, this is the lifestyle you deserve:  this is what luxury living is all about. ENVITAE has partnered with Oakwood, the nation's leading corporate housing company, to bring you this exquisite suite in one of Chicago's premier buildings.  We are changing the way short-stays are done and warmly invite you to be a part of it.
space: Enjoy your stay in this ENVITAE at Oakwood apartment. In partnership with Oakwood, ENVITAE now combines the same luxury interior and exemplary guest experience in Oakwood’s world-class modern buildings.  Surround yourself each day with a warm blend of upscale minimalist design and premium finishes.Then step outside to explore your new neighborhood, a district offering the city’s highest concentration of art galleries, restaurants and nightlife. neighborhood_overview: Everything you need is right outside your doorstep! Downtown Chicago is a city with an appetite—for food, of course, but also for design, history, and culture. Come here to marvel at the cutting-edge architecture or take in the gorgeous views of Lake Michigan; to spend a day cheering with baseball fans and a night laughing at a comedy show; to shop; to visit renowned institutions like the Field Museum, The Art Institute and the Adler Planetarium, and to experience the legendary blues scene. To do all this, you'll need nourishment: taste deep-dish pizza, piled-high hot dogs, Italian beef sandwiches, and more.
notes: This unit is currently being renovated, photos are from a similar unit in the same building. This information is collected for verification purposes only and is not stored or otherwise used for any other purpose By completing the reservation you agree to the following: - I agree to be bound by our rental terms and conditions. - I acknowledge that I will be required to provide a copy of a valid government issued ID and matching credit card prior to check in. - I acknowledge that I may be required to undergo a background check if mandated by the property management company or the building, as stated in accordance by my rental agreement and condition of the booking.

neighborhood_overview: Wrigleyville is the lively little pocket in the Lakeview neighborhood that sits in the shadows of historic Wrigley Field, the second oldest stadium in baseball and home to the beloved Chicago Cubs. It has become a magnet for sports fans and young professionals alike, and particularly singles who hop from bar to bar along Clark, Addison and Sheffield Avenues. Rather tame by day, the neighborhood's souvenir shops and casual eateries are open but quiet. For late night entertainment, a boisterous after-hours crowd heads to Wrigleyville for everything from live music to sketch comedy. But if there's a day game or a night game letting out at "The Friendly Confines" then look out: the streets swell with the masses of fans looking to celebrate a Cubs win... or lament their lovable losers.
notes: There is one spot included. If you have more than one car, we recommend using SpotHero to find a spot to park as it can be difficult! This is a apartment building, so although you will have your own private, 2 bedroom apartment, you do have neighbors. Please be respectful! Lastly, there are train tracks nearby, so we've provided a white noise machine and also earplugs to help quiet down the noise. Please provide an accurate guest count prior to booking. Rates vary throughout the week and season and by number of guests. It's important that your guest count is accurate so we can be sure the home is adequately prepared and stocked for your stay. We have noise sensors in the unit to monitor sounds levels to ensure guests adhere to the quiet hour rules. The sensors do not record sound and ensure everyone's safety. Thank you for understanding!
transit: The closest L stop is Addison on the red line and it is a two minute walk from the apartment. You can access the best Chicago has to offer on the L transit system.  There are plenty of Uber/Lyfts and taxis throughout the neighborhood as well.
access: You will have access to the entire home and one parking space. The shared laundry room is coin operated and located in the basement of the building.
interaction: We are off-site but nearby and available when needed!
house_rules: PLEASE NOTE THAT WE CHARGE PER GUEST AFTER A SET NUMBER. PLEASE PROVIDE THE ENTIRE GROUP COUNT IN YOUR RESERVATION REQUEST. IF AN UPDATE TO THE GROUP COUNT IS NEEDED AFTER CONFIRMING THE RESERVATION, THE RESERVATION COST MAY INCREASE. - Quiet hours between 10pm - 7am - Smoking Penalty: $500 + damages - Pet Penalty: $500 + damages - Late Check Out Fee: $25/half hour
host_about:
Hi, Thanks for taking a look at our special homes.

My name is Noah. A few years ago, my family and I got together to create an amazing experience for tourists and guests like you.

We are Chicagoans who love sharing our city with the world and strive to make your stay as comfortable as possible so you can enjoy the city like a local. 

We're passionate about travel. As experienced travelers, we've learned what creates a top notch experience and we're committed to sharing that experience with you. It's something we call "Sweet Home Chicago" and we hope you carry it back with you to where ever you call home! :)

You can find us hanging by the lake, catching a game at Wrigley, grabbing a drink in Wicker Park, enjoying the many concerts going on on any given night, or at any of the amazing local coffee shops across the city.

notes: Athough we do not offer laundry on site, there is a local laundromat within walking distance. We also kindly request that all smoking be done outside or on the balcony. No smoking inside.

The beach, Andersonville, Whole Foods, local shops, bars and restaurants are all very walkable, or rent a Divy bike for the day. There's also plenty of street parking available on our scenic side street if you are driving!

We are longtime Chicago residents, born and raised in the city and have a lot of recommendations for things to do both in the neighborhood and around the city.

neighborhood_overview: Very cool and safe location, close to everything. This neighborhood is awesome with a great walking score its filled with many working class families and med students. Its a residential building so please be considerate of the neighbors and keep quiet after 10pm. My building has a secure front door & surveillance cameras around the property for added protection.
notes: The lockbox will be located on the black metal gate left of the actual building door. I may not update the lockbox code on the app so be sure to use the code I send you directly with the welcome email. Please respect my personal items in my apartment. If you find clothes or an AC unit in the closets please just leave it be as this is my personal space. Thanks.
transit: Please note this apartment is located on the 3rd floor, so park in front to bring your luggage up as there is no elevator. Uber, Metra and public transportation are also always within a block or two.

Since this is my personal apartment there may be some of my personal items such as clothes or fans located in the closets. Please do not remove any of these items.
interaction: I’m available when needed feel free to call or text me with any questions.

host_about: I own a cleaning business with several clients in the loop area and I rent several properties in the chicagoland area. I love to travel and I believe laughter is good for the soul so laugh as often as you can.  World Traveler and lover of all living things!

name: QUIET & CLEAN PLACE 5 MIN TO DOWNTOWN FREE PARKING
summary: Very clean, professionally designed private room in the heart of Chicago with a PRIVATE bathroom & shower, FREE parking, and an EARLY CHECK-IN, 12 pm! You will have your own door code and may arrive as late as you wish, EASY self check-in guaranteed.  I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like. The neighborhood is very QUIET & SAFE!
space: Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 6 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!) The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock the door.  > PRIVATE bathroom & shower > EARLY check-in! (12 pm) > 5 MIN to DOWNTOWN > Free parking provided: park BEFORE your check-in and stay parked AFTER your check-out if you would like > Apartment is NEWLY renovated and PROFESSIONALLY designed by an interior designer > GREEN TEA & ALOE memory foam mattress > Full-sized mirror inside your room > Restaurants and bars are 5 MIN away walking distance  > 5 MIN walk to PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION/METRO > 5 MIN walk to UIC (University of Illinois at Chicago)  > 15 MIN walk to Rush University & H

neighborhood_overview: 100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.
transit: "Racine" blue line is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking).  -Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 5 minutes to downtown. -O'Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 40 minutes to O’Hare. -Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 45 minutes to Midway. -Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)
house_rules: Please read your check-in instructions carefully Please no overstaying past your checkout time
host_about:
Hello! My name is Natalia, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, Marina, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an investment banker in the loop. 

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

name: Modern, Open, Loft in Chicago's Logan Square
summary: Welcome to our open concept studio loft. Located in the heart of Logan Square, we are walking distance to Palmer Square Park, plus some of the cities best coffee shops, restaurants, galleries and summer festivals.  This space is airy, naturally lit, and comfortable with a 15' floor to ceiling main atrium, full height windows and custom architectural light screen plus all the amenities to make your stay comfortable. Easy access to public transportation makes getting around the city a breeze
space: This space was designed with the intention of creating a well lit, airy open canvas for others to enjoy. It features a full height sleeping loft with queen size bed and a writing desk. We provide a custom builtin efficiency kitchen perfect for someone on the go, complete with a gas cook top and small fridge, and all that you could need to prepare a meal. Owners are coffee lovers, so if you are like us, we've left you some of our favorite coffee and mugs to enjoy under the dappled light of our large east facing windows. The bathroom is simple, clean and modern. There is a small private deck looking out onto our tree lined street in Logan Square. WIFI and Cable included. *Please note, we have done some redesign to the space, furniture and bedding updates, etc.  (we think for the better) Photos soon to be posted*

This space is airy, naturally lit, and comfortable with a 15' floor to ceiling main atrium, full height windows and custom architectural light screen plus all the amenities to make your stay comfortable. Easy access to public transportation makes getting around the city a breeze This space was designed with the intention of creating a well lit, airy open canvas for others to enjoy. It features a full height sleeping loft with queen size bed and a writing desk. Owners are coffee lovers, so if you are like us, we've left you some of our favorite coffee and mugs to enjoy under the dappled light of our large e
neighborhood_overview: The leafy streets of Logan Square are lined with bungalows and regal Greystone buildings. North Milwaukee Avenue is the main commercial strip and features cool restaurants, cocktail bars and craft beer taverns. There are also quirky coffee shops and delis, as well as art galleries and music venues.  Just south, the newly established 606 elevated park and walking trail is just blocks from the apartment. Opposite north is the historic "Square" of Logan Square , the cultural center of the neighborhood, which also houses one of the cites best year round farmers markets. Established in 1915, the Logan Theater shows movies and has a vintage bar.
notes: If you don't like heights, the ships ladder style stair up to the full height sleeping loft may not be for you--it's sturdy with a handrail and does have an incline (more stair than traditional ladder), and our 3 year old thinks its more fun than the park, but its about what YOU are comfortable with. We are happy to answer any questions on the topic.
transit: Close to bus, train and bike stations. Milwaukee/Logan Blue Line and California/Milwaukee Blue stops nearby (10 minute walk) Bus and Divvy Bikes also within 1-2 blocks. Street Parking is available and easily accessed.
access: Guests will have access to a common area stairwell and the entire loft apartment.
interaction: We can interact as much or little with our guests as desired, we are a warm friendly family, who values and understands autonomy, but also likes meeting and talking with anyone and everyone!
house_rules: - Quiet Hours after 10pm
host_about: Working Mom (and Wife) living life in the City of Chicago. We love getting out and exploring the city with our 5 year old, we also love domestic and international travel and finding new adventures. Live music and the movies is something I can't live with out. Love the food and culture in our city and happy to share any tips with our visitors. There is so much to choose form it is almost impossible to go wrong. One of our favorite things about living in Logan Square is taking a Sunday morning stroll to the local Farmers Market which is year round and has so much to offer. We are a pretty laid back, but on the go, family happy to meet and get to know anyone, but also value a persons privacy. There are no strangers in our home, and all are welcome.

name: Private Entrance >> Urban Retreat @ Fulton House!
summary: Our three-bedroom Fulton House escape is ideal for traveling groups - four beds means it can comfortably sleep 8, and we're close to the Garfield Park Conservatory and the Green Line. We offer parking and it's a 20 minute train ride to the Loop and centrally located - ideal for any Chicago adventure you have in mind. Book today!
space: You enter our condo into an open living/dining space - which also includes an arcade version of Big Buck! Just off the dining area is a secluded office with a desk and shelving. Down the hallway are three bedrooms: two with queens, one with two queens, and a bathroom. At the rear of our condo is a large kitchen with a door to the back deck, shared backyard, and parking pad.

You enter our condo into an open living/dining space - which also includes an arcade version of Big Buck! Just off the dining area is a secluded office with a desk and shelving. Down the hallway are three bedrooms: two with queens, one with two queens, and a bathroom. At the rear of our condo is a large kitchen with a door to the back deck, shared backyard, and parking pad. With streets that are decorated in vibrant murals and air that smells of carne guisada, Humboldt Park is a Caribbean escape shrouded in urban charm. We're less than a 5 minute walk to the Kedzie green line station, and offer parking onsite.

Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check out/lost key penalty  3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid. 6.) Please keep all entrance doors to th
host_about: Hi I'm Lara, and I am very proud to be an Airbnb Superhost! I am a Chicago native, and studied hospitality management at Boston University, and decided to follow my passion in trying to provide an amazing travel experience through AirBnB!  My husband and I love trying new places to eat, and have a real passion for traveling to exciting parts of the world.  I put a lot of work into getting my spaces ready, and I know you will enjoy your stay with me! Welcome to Chicago!

notes: The apartment is super conveniently located within walking distance to literally everything you might need or may have forgotten to bring in your trip so just ask me if there's anything you need

name: Pilsen garden unit with modern amenities!
summary: Relax and unwind in our comfortable and clean garden guest suite located in Chicago’s thriving Pilsen neighborhood. We’re new hosts on AirBNB and are excited to share our recently furnished guest space with travelers looking to enjoy the great city of Chicago. We live in the main part of the property located on the first floor and are excited for you to use our garden space as a home away from home.
space: Come stay in our cozy, clean, and private garden suite! This is a two bedroom, two full, private bathroom unit that can fit 4 comfortably in the bedrooms and 1 comfortably in the living room. We are providing guests with an assortment of amenities, which includes an in-unit washer and dryer, complimentary coffee and tea, a Chromecast to stream your favorite shows, and much more. The kitchenette area located in the living room contains many of your kitchen needs including plates, bowls, mugs, utensils, a microwave, a mini-fridge, and a washing bin to clean all dishes after usage. The location is in one of Chicago’s oldest and most diverse neighborhoods. Our home is a 5-minute walk from the Chicago Pink Line, which will get you from Pilsen to downtown in 20 minutes.

host_about:
Stay where it counts. When you book a Loftium, you're contributing to the local community. Each Loftium is home to a local resident who hosts and lives right on-site, making sure your experience is a delightful one. All spaces are designed with your comfort in mind! We've made check-in and communication a breeze, and each home provides a beautiful and cozy place to rest your head during your travels. Every Loftium home and host is unique, and you'll always get a true neighborhood experience during your stay.

Visit a new community and book a Loftium in any of our cities: Seattle, Portland, Denver, San Diego, Phoenix, Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas, Charlotte, or Orlando. We can't wait for you to visit!

name: Private Room/Bath Wicker Park, Free Street Parking
summary: Welcome to my home in West Wicker Park-near the bus & blue line for easy access to all of Chicago & airports. Wicker Park has lots of great restaurants, coffee, and shopping. You will have your own private bedroom and bathroom in my home, with access to the other shared spaces. I live here and only accept 1 Airbnb reservation at a time. My place is particularly suited for the budget minded person looking for a cozy, quiet and clean flat. Free street parking.
space: Private Bedroom - Twin-size day bed with comfy mattress and pillows. Second person bed is available and is an air mattress. Private Bathroom - Shower with jetted bathtub. Supplied-soap, shampoo, conditioner, hair-dryer. Kitchen- modern with quartz counters, new dishwasher, gas stove, garbage disposal, coffee maker and all the items that you might need. Living Room- Leather sofa, large screen TV, cable, Netflix, wifi. Wood floors throughout the flat. Parking- easy and free street parking. *Bedroom and bathroom have locks that can be locked from the inside. The bedroom does not have a keyed lock on it. The bedroom and bathroom are for guest use only - no one will enter while you are visiting. My home is your home while you are staying here.

neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park, Humboldt Park, Bucktown and Logan Square all are within easy walking distance. Wicker Park is just north and west of the Loop. There's great music, nightlife, restaurants, art galleries, vintage shops and more.
notes: This is a 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom flat and is my personal home. The building is made up of 4 flats. Mine is on the 1st floor, but is higher up and more like a 2nd floor. I only accept one Airbnb reservation at a time so you will be the only guest(s). Quiet time expected from 11pm-9am.
transit: 10-12 minute walk to the Blue Line's Western or Damen stop. 5-minutes away from numerous bus lines. There is easy street parking or a gated parking spot, if needed. Several city parks are within walking distance.
access: You will have access to all kitchen supplies, coffee maker, toaster, oven, etc. The kitchen, living room, bathroom, bedroom and back deck are all yours to enjoy.
interaction: I am happy to help with recommendations or any needs during your stay. I can interact as much or as little as you like. This is my home and I want you to be comfortable.

name: 3RF Attached Priv Bath/Priv Room Steps from S Loop
summary: Please make sure to review "Getting Around" details within the "Neighborhood" section. Nearest building intersection is 28th Place & Canal St to map transit options Newly remodeled private room with attached private bath with modern finishes, smart tech & security, in a hip, central neighborhood minutes from downtown Chicago and steps from all that trendy Bridgeport has to offer Per the City of Chicago ordinances, 31 night minimum on all stays
space: There is free street parking (unmetered) that is generally very available directly outside the building on 28th Pl and for all 2 blocks west on the same street, all of which is residential and not zoned/metered on both sides of the street :)  Additionally, the nearest intersecting street Canal St. has very available parking as there are no properties on the East side of that street (and is also not zoned/metered on both sides of the street.)  We’ve very reliably found a spot within a 1 minute walk during different times of day/evening/weekdays/weekends, and almost always have been able to secure parking directly outside the building. The majority of neighboring streets are also not zoned/metered in the off chance that you can't find a parking space on the same block as the building :) Close to public transportation as well if you are not bringing a vehicle, please see "Getting Around" section. -Private suite with private attached bath -Zinus 8" plush memory foam mattress and memory foa
