neighborhood_overview: Bridgeport is the quintessential Chicago neighborhood.  Widely considered among the safest of Chicago neighborhoods with a close proximity to downtown, it features popular dining options, culture, Chicago sports and other points of interest just steps away.  Downtown is minutes away via public transportation as well as numerous business districts, hospital systems, & universities.
notes: Please note that the entire reservation amount is NOT due at the time of booking :) One month's rent is charged, and then the rest is charged by Airbnb in monthly installments. https://www.airbnb.com/help/article/245/how-do-i-pay-for-my-long-term-reservation The owners of this apartment building invested a significant amount of time, money, and resources into a complete renovation in the summer of 2019. That said, the building is over 90 years old and, though greatly cared for, shows its age in some places. Expect to find some loving wear, quaint aging and minor quirks that you might not find in a brand new high-rise :) We are a monthly stay company only and thus we do not apply a monthly discount on our Airbnb listings: our "nightly" rate reflects the pricing for 30 days or more. Any further discounts to our listed rate need to be approved by owners, and factors that they value include but aren't limited to: -potential stays longer than 3 months -potential guests with 2 or more positi
transit: The nearest intersection to the apartment building is 28th Place and Canal Street (exact address not disclosed prior to a confirmed booking so as to be sensitive to our current residents' safety and security.)  We are happy to help with questions regarding proximity to your work/school in communications prior to booking however please note that we too use likely the same online map search that you would use as well :) in order to make sure we are describing it accurately. 4 minute walk to the CTA 44 bus 4 minute walk to Divvy (city-wide bike sharing) 8 minute walk to the CTA 24 bus 9 minute walk to the CTA 8 bus 15 minute walk to the CTA Train (Halsted station, Orange Line) 18 minute walk to the CTA Train (35th station, Red Line) 12 minute walk to grocery store Cermak Fresh Market 13 minute walk to CVS pharmacy 21 minute walk to Mercy Hospital & Medical Center 12 minute drive/uber to Rush/Cook County/UIC Hospital systems 14 minute drive/uber to Mt. Sinai Hospital 14 minute drive/uber t
access: Full, private access to bedroom & bath.  Kitchen & dining area shared with neighboring full suite.  3RF is a private bed/bath suite within a 2bed/2bath apartment unit, and shares the kitchen & dining area with 3RR, which is linked here - https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/37283529 Laundry room shared with other building residents -Viewing all the pictures, descriptions, and reviews of this listing as well as others in the area is a great way to familiarize yourself with the property, location, and living experience. -Link to other listings we manage -  (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Because most of our guests stay for more than 2 months, we likely have fewer reviews than other listings in our area. As many of our listings within the same buildings do offer a similar experience, we encourage potential guests to look at reviews from other of our listings as well get a better feel. The listings clustered close together as shown on the map are likely ones within the same building -Permission to ent
interaction: We give our guests space but are available when needed :)   More info included within "Guest Access" section
house_rules: - Quiet hours between 10pm and 8am, 7 days a week.  Please use headphones and quiet voices during these hours. - To be considerate to other residents and to ensure they have a peaceful, enjoyable stay, please do not use laundry machines after 10pm or before 8am.  Last load can be put in the washer before 8:15pm. - Please remove shoes at door and do not wear in the apartment. - No more than 1 overnight guest for over 7 days in any 30 day period - 2 or more simultaneous overnight guests not allowed unless previously authorized
host_about: We are part of a team of property managers for Monthly MD Suites and love what we do!  As a physical therapist and associate with a global logistics firm, we've experienced and understand the needs of traveling professionals & students and seek to minimize the worries that oftentimes accompany out of town stays.

name: UChicago, Lake, Sci Museum | Gym + W&D | Zencity
summary: Luxury, mystery, and drama: you’ll find it all here when you stay at this classic Hyde Park apartment. In shades of grayscale, this art deco-inspired design draws heavily from the history of the building. Once a hotspot for celebrities such as Al Capone and Amelia Earhart, this apartment features a spacious living room, a modern kitchen with granite countertops, and a roomy master bedroom. This is guaranteed to be a stay to remember.
space: Situated just off Lake Shore Drive in East Hyde Park, this home is a perfect base from which to explore this iconic neighborhood, with Lake Michigan, several public parks and beaches, and the Museum of Science and Industry all within walking distance.

Hyde Park, home to the prestigious University of Chicago and the Museum of Science and Industry, is a culturally rich nei
neighborhood_overview: Hyde Park, home to the prestigious University of Chicago and the Museum of Science and Industry, is a culturally rich neighborhood full of eclectic shops, restaurants, and small businesses. Enjoy a stroll in one of the area’s many parks—or explore Chicago by bike when you hop on the Lakefront Trail and cruise for miles.
notes: For the safety and comfort of all our guests, Zencity is following CDC guidance to ensure every guest has a clean place to stay. Some of the steps we are taking include (Website hidden by Airbnb)   (Website hidden by Airbnb) Thoroughly disinfecting each suite between stays including counter tops, door knobs, faucets, light switches, among other (Website hidden by Airbnb) Stocking-up on extra supplies such as soaps and cleaning products in case you need it (yes, including toilet paper (Website hidden by Airbnb) Minimizing in-person contact with our guests whenever possible by using smart tools like our digital check-in proces (Website hidden by Airbnb)   (Website hidden by Airbnb) We are not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered. If anything is not to your liking, please notify us, and we will correct the situation as soon as possible.
transit: Cab/Uber service is readily available in this location and is our preferred method of transportation downtown. The unit is three blocks to the nearest Metra station that takes you directly to the Loop and is also near several major bus routes.
access: Access is available to the entire apartment.
interaction: We will be available throughout your stay to recommend local attractions, dining, nightlife, or any other concierge services that interest you.
house_rules: 1. No onsite parking 2. No late checkout past 11am 3. Quiet time after 10pm 4. ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises 5. Lost or misplaced keys will be charged at cost (up to $100) 6. We are not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered We look forward to hosting you!  If you are unable to abide by house rules, please consider another listing as we reserve the right to end your stay early for serious violations.  We take pride in our home and are excited to welcome you, but please respect the space and others who live in the building.
host_about: Modern travel means you deserve the most out of your stay – complete with amenities that matter to you. Zencity offers every guest convenient locations, kitchen essentials, and several great entertainment options for you to enjoy. All coupled with insider knowledge and access to the best the city has to offer.

name: Unique Tri-level Townhome
summary: Converted from an old theater the unique style and finishes will catch your eye around every turn. Features include, garage parking, three floors of living space, large custom kitchen,  abundant sunlight, roof deck with skyline views, marble baths, the Lincoln Park location is a prime spot!
space: Kitchen and living area on main floor, two bedrooms and two full baths on second floor, third bedroom and roof deck on third floor.
description: Converted from an old theater the unique style and finishes will catch your eye around every turn. Features include, garage parking, three floors of living space, large custom kitchen,  abundant sunlight, roof deck with skyline views, marble baths, the Lincoln Park location is a prime spot! Kitchen and living area on main floor, two bedrooms and two full baths on second floor, third bedroom and roof deck on third floor. The entire apartment, private roof deck, and below ground parking garage.  Large vehicles will not fit in the garage.  We can provide parking permits for street parking. One of Chicago's most premier neighborhoods, Lincoln Park is a wonderful place filled with parks, tourist attractions, cafes, shopping, fine dining, nightlife, and the lake shore. Very walkable central location close to El train, Metra train, and buses.  Also easy to catch an uber or cab. This is a quiet building with long term tenants.  Fantastic for lodging but not suitable for parties.

host_about: As a life-long Chicagoan I've always been amazed by its architecture and neighborhood culture.  It's my sincere pleasure to help guests find the same amazement as they explore Chicago!  AirBnB allows me to combine this hospitality with my passion for real estate.  Just a win/win all around!

name: Clean & Serene - Quiet Northside Room
summary: I live in a small condo on the northwest side of the city. I love my peaceful home. I'm on a top floor -- so it's quiet (except for Brown line train nearby!) and very sunny! I'm just west of the lovely Ravenswood Manor neighborhood--one of the most charming and special in the city. We are right on the river and it can feel more rural than urban!
space: Small, yet bright and open top floor condo apartment. Organized and clean space.  The guest room is a very small office with a very comfy (firm) full-size futon.  I typically prefer 1 solo guest.  IF you are a light sleeper, you may hear the train go by at night (it's one block away, but it doesn't run all night). So far all guests said it didn't bother them at all, but I want to let you know. I have a fan to drown it out or ear plugs. I use a white noise machine and it works perfectly.  I have a cat who is super friendly and very soft. :)
description: I live in a small condo on the northwest side of the city. I love my peaceful home. I'm on a top floor -- so it's quiet (except for Brown line train nearby!) and very sunny! I'm just west of the lovely Ravenswood Manor neighborhood--one of the most charming and special in the city. We are right on the river and it can feel more rural than urban! I have a fan to drown it out or ear plugs. I use a white noise machine and it works perfectly.  I have a cat who is super friendly and very soft. :) I know a lot about the city and am happy to help and offer suggestions...especially on food! :) I live on
neighborhood_overview: I live on the northwest side of the city in the area of Ravenswood Manor in the neighborhood of Albany Park. I love it here! On one side it's very quaint--like a small town or village with bungalow homes, families, and lots of folks walking their dogs! West of me is a very diverse area and great restaurants including Mexican, Persian, Korean, etc. Just 1 mile (20 min. walk or 2 Brown Line stops) east of me over the river is charming Lincoln Square, a great neighborhood full of bars, cafes, restaurants, a movie theater, shopping, and a music venue.
transit: The Brown Line is one block away (Francisco/Sacramento Stop). Head downtown in about 30 minutes (change to Red Line at Belmont for faster journey/less stops).  Blue Line to O'Hare isn't too far west from here, you can take a bus to the train.  Bike lanes all around and Divvy rental bike stops nearby.
interaction: I know a lot about the city and am happy to help and offer suggestions...especially on food! :)
house_rules: - --Prefer no shoes in house--for cleanliness and niceness to neighbors below. - --PLEASE be extra careful at all times to not let cat out!!  - --Just treat it like your home and leave how you found it! - Quiet hours after 10p.
host_about:
Hi there!! Nice to "meet" you!
I am a world traveler. I am also a writer, photographer, TV producer, & video consultant. I recently traveled for 2 1/2 years solo around the world. It was amazing. I've now been to 61 countries. 

I work from home...or wherever I am in the world. :)
I love food of all kinds, animals, and laughter. 
I am organized, neat and clean and like to meet interesting people and learn new things. I also like my quiet, alone time. 

I've both hosted and been a guest on airbnb. 

I grew up in the suburbs of New Jersey and have lived in Chicago for 21 years and love it.

name: Family friendly, luxury suite w/ resort amenities- pool, sauna, & gym! Dogs ok!
summary: The health and safety of our guests, homeowners, and employees is our number one priority. Many of our vacation rentals minimize person-to-person contact with private amenities and entry via smart locks or lockboxes. Plus, each reservation is backed by 24/7 customer support and expert cleaning in line with current CDC guidelines.
space: Live life in the big city at this spacious, luxurious, two-bedroom suite on the 38th floor featuring a large, private balcony with spectacular views of the Chicago skyline, top-of-the-line amenities, and room for up to six guests. The family dog is also welcome to join you for an additional nightly fee. Your building is also within walking distance of several high-end shops and five-star restaurants. This vacation rental is located in the heart of the River North neighborhood, just three blocks from Michigan Avenue and the world-famous Magnificent Mile, home of stores like H&M, Nordstrom, Ralph Lauren, Saks, Tiffany, and many, many more. If you're feeling hungry, there are numerous restaurants throughout the area offering everything from Chicago-style pizza to five-course, candlelit dinners. If you're in town for a special event, Navy Pier is only a mile east, while McCormick Place is just a short, three-mile cab ride south. Share updates with friends and family back home using the fre

transit: On-Site parking.Parking.Private parking.
house_rules: By booking this reservation, you agree to the additional policies, terms, and conditions below. UNIT SPECIFIC TERMS - Due to local laws or HOA requirements, guests must be at least 25 years of age to book. Guests under 25 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian for the duration of the reservation. - 2 dog(s) are welcome in this home. No other animals are allowed without specific Vacasa approval. - The property shall not be used by more than the number of adults and children listed in your reservation. - All guests shall abide by Vacasa’s good neighbor policy and shall not engage in illegal activity. Quiet hours are from 10 p.m. to 8 a.m. - If early check-in is available for your reservation, you will be notified by 9am on the morning of your arrival by email. Late check-out is offered whenever possible for a small fee. - No smoking of any kind is permitted anywhere on the premises. - No commercial photography or filming is permitted on the property. Tents or other structures
host_about: Hi, we’re Vacasa, North America’s largest vacation rental management company. Owners of vacation homes around the world trust us to deliver exceptional service throughout your entire vacation. Professional housekeepers clean and stock each home, and our customer care team is available around the clock—with a local property manager ready to show up and help out. We like to think we offer the best of both worlds: you can enjoy a one-of-a-kind vacation experience in a unique property, without compromising on service and convenience. Check out our listings, and get in touch if you have any questions. Your vacation is our full-time job, and we'd love to help you plan your perfect getaway.

summary: A fully furnished home for your longer stay, complete with WiFi and everything you need to live. AFFORDABLE MONTHLY RATES ARE AVAILABLE!!! MARCH - $2710 APRIL - $2710 Whatever brings you to town, our bright and modern two-bedroom apartment in the heart of Bucktown is the perfect jump-off for your artsy adventures in this side of Chicago. Enjoy a budget-friendly stay without compromising your comfort and privacy.

neighborhood_overview: Bucktown is among the trendiest towns in Chicago that boasts a myriad of dining options and entertainment spots. With its chill vibe and friendly neighborhood, exploring is definitely an easy feat, so we encourage you to leave your cars at home.  	 Looking to do more than seeing art? Drop by  Team vs Time and enter and escape room with your pals. If being pressed for time is not your thing, go bowling while chugging beers at Diversey River Bowl, or play lacrosse in bumper cars at WhirlyBall.  In case you want to stay relaxed and just explore Bucktown’s foodie spots, the town has something for all kinds of craving. American? The Bristol, Mable’s Table, and Emerald Loop are your go-to for hearty meals. The Bento Box, Coast Sushi, and En Hakkore are your best bets for affordable Asian grub. Craving something Latin? Try tacos and more at Lazo’s Tacos, Irazu, or Estrella Negra. Cap off the night with some drinks from the Map Room or Cortland’s Garage.
notes: -All guests need to be attentive to the house rules during their stay as there are other tenants at the property. -Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay -Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request. -We have duvet covers on our bedding  (no top sheets). -A Security Deposit may be required on some bookings.  -If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away. COVID-19 Safety Concerns As always, the health and safety of our guests is our top priority. We would like to make you aware of the precautions and preventative practices our team are implementing in response to the current challenges of COVID-19.  To mitigate the spread of the corona virus, we will use higher medical grade sanitizer for cleaning solutions. We’re also updating our cleaning protocols with guidance from ISSA about COVID- 19 and undertaking ta
access: Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours
interaction: We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.
house_rules: Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking: -No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250). -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. - The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am. -Lost key fee - $300 -Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc. -Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc. -Smoking - $300 -Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300 -No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat,  an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.
host_about:
We are a young couple, both seniors at DePaul University and we love traveling around the world.

We very much enjoy meeting new people and making friends as we travel and love helping guests get the most out of their stay as we have been on our own travels.

Our apartments are very special homes that offer comfort and convenient locations. 

We hope to welcome you here!

name: King Bed, Huge Spa and Steam Shower, Dining Destination
summary: This home was designed with love! Inspired by our favorite boutique hotels - nestled on a tree-lined street in Logan Square, a locals-only destination for brunch, coffee, craft beer and cocktails. Relax in the massive custom steam shower or catch up on HBO on the 50” WiFi TV. Luxurious details throughout -premium espresso, memory foam beds and upgraded linens, fully-equipped kitchen. BOTH bedrooms have private baths, huge walk-in closets, and easy reach USB outlets. Super central location- Quick walk to Blue Line Train (DIRECT to ORD) - Ten minutes to Downtown, Wicker Park, and Lincoln Park.
space: We have tried to attend to every detail- I love boutique hotels and I wanted our Airbnb to reflect that experience. This is a two-bedroom, two-bath private apartment and the garden level of our historic greystone, a classic Chicago property type.  The space was newly renovated for friends and family - a luxurious city getaway surrounded by our favorite restaurants. It is warm and cozy with in-floor heat. Truly easy street parking, a rarity in the city.  Five minute walk to train at Logan Square Blue Line (20 min direct connection to O’Hare Airport/ORD) and around the corner from top-rated restaurants-blocks to Fat Rice, Longman & Eagle, and Lula, all Michelin rated. Don’t miss brunch at Jam, pozole at Quiote and tiki drinks at Lost Lake, ranked one of the fifty best bars in the world- all walkable. The master has a king-size memory foam bed, individual reading lights with dimmers, and an ensuite bath with massive walk-in steam / rain shower. Second bedroom has a cozy memory foam double
description: This home was designed with love! Inspired by our favorite boutique hotels - nestled on a tree-lined street in Logan Square, a locals-only destination for brunch, coffee, craft beer and cocktails. Relax in the massive custom steam shower or catch up on HBO on the 50” WiFi TV. Luxurious details throughout -premium espresso, memory foam beds and upgraded linens, fully-equipped kitchen. BOTH bedrooms have private baths, huge walk-in closets, and easy reach USB outlets. Super central location- Quick walk to Blue Line Train (DIRECT to ORD) - Ten minutes to Downtown, Wicker Park, and Lincoln Park. We have tried to attend to every detail- I love boutique hotels and I wanted our Airbnb to reflect that experience. This is a two-bedroom, two-bath private apartment and the garden level of our historic greystone, a classic Chicago property type.  The space was newly renovated for friends and family - a luxurious city getaway surrounded by our favorite restaurants. It is warm and cozy with in-floor
neighborhood_overview: Diner’s paradise! Four blocks to Blue Line- This cozy garden retreat is a half block to the neighborhood’s famous Logan Boulevard, lined with park space and historic mansions. Steps to coffee and cocktails, Logan Square is a diner’s paradise. Walk to Fat Rice, Lost Lake, Longman and Eagle and Lula. You’re also an easy eight minute walk to the Logan Square Blue Line. Easy street parking.
notes: This is the garden (ground) level of a two-flat- You will hear occasional footsteps above but residents are respectful and polite- they are two professional women and not early risers! Based on my personal spent time in the unit, this will not impact your experience in a significant way. Although we have honored historic details wherever possible, this is a brand new apartment with great insulation. We offer a white noise machine just in case. Ceilings are over 7 ft and while not soaring, tall guests have been comfortable. The unit has radiant in-floor heating (no cold feet!) controlled in your unit with a traditional thermostat. Because it is an English garden and partially below grade, the temperature is very stable. We have window air conditioners for summer.
transit: Logan Square is extremely central. We are a four block walk to Blue Line Train (which connects directly to ORD/O’Hare Airport!) and joins all trains with a 15 minute ride South toward the Loop.  The Blue Line runs underground and does not share tracks- it is by far the fastest city train line.  This neighborhood is particularly easy for cabs as you are only 2 minutes from the 90/94 Expressway:       - 10 minutes to Wicker Park      - 10 minutes to Lincoln Park      - 8 min to West Loop/Fulton Market       -15/20 min to Magnificent Mile/Wrigley
access: You're welcome to enjoy the backyard (we have great neighbors). Trash / recycling through gate behind yard. Shared free laundry.
interaction: I'll meet you at check-in if possible and make some recommendations. I have lived in Chicago since 2001 and love to share tips about my favorite city in the world. I'm a real estate agent and easy to reach, but otherwise, the home is yours to enjoy!
house_rules: - Make yourself at home - Unit should be left "broom clean" - Please do the dishes and start dishwasher before leaving. Piles of dirty dishes will be charged a $50 additional cleaning fee. Please text Kristin if there are any dishwasher questions.   - Do not worry about used sheets and towels - we will handle.  However, if you stain the sheets and towels with make-up, blood, etc... you will be charged for the price of the item. Please simply rinse off stains if they accidentally get on our linens.  This is an easy step that will help me enormously. We also have OxyClean in our laundry room. -Please no smoking inside. Guests who smoke will be billed full security deposit plus damages.  -Please shut gates to walkway behind you- We share this path with our neighbor and she is sensitive to security issues.  -*Please do not talk loudly outside in the walkway by the front door, especially at night.* This is right below our neighbor’s bedroom!  Feel free to enjoy the backyard (accessible thro
host_about: I am originally from Nashville TN although my family's roots are in Chicago - Following in my dad and grandfather's footsteps, I came to Chicago for college and never wanted to leave - it's the best city in the world! I've been a Realtor since 2010 and I am a Northwestern alum. Love historic homes - a full-time passion - travel, trying new spas (which inspired my Air Bnb’s master bath !! will recommend several in Chicago!), binge watching TV, and reading. My favorite destinations are Mexico, Portugal, London, New York (cheap flights!), and Japan. I got married in New Orleans last year and would love to buy a home there someday. I've put my heart and soul into creating what I hope will be a luxurious and welcoming Air BnB experience for my guests!

notes: You are staying within a residential neighborhood. We ask that you are respectful of the other tenants and neighbors and do not be loud or disruptive inside or outside of the building. No parties or late night socializing in any of the outdoor spaces. Absolutely no smoking within the building or within close proximity of building entrances/exits. The guest renting the unit must occupy the space for the full duration of the reservation. Under no circumstances can a guest rent the unit or any of its rooms out.
transit: If you’re driving, there’s free street parking on the streets surrounding the building and numerous others near by. You are staying in a city and you WILL have to parallel park. Be sure to read all signs so you don’t park on a stretch that requires a permit or is a day for street sweeping. Uber/Lyft arrive within minutes so leave your car parked and enjoy the city. If you’re in for work or downtown events, take the Milwaukee District North Metra train line, just a short walk away. Be sure to go online for rates and check schedules as schedules change on weekends, holidays, and special events.

name: Chicago Spanish Villa - 4 Level Custom Home for 12
summary: This gorgeous Spanish-style villa is perfect for the whole family! With 9 beds across 6 bedrooms, 4 full bathrooms, & an enormous kitchen, there's plenty of room for everyone. Curl up with a good book from the library, enjoy the sunshine & grill on the back patio, watch a movie on the projector, or mix up a few drinks at the bar– there are plenty of ways to relax in this spacious home! Enjoy the comfortable Lakeview location, on a tree-lined street just a short walk from the Brown Line "L".
space: When you enter our villa, on the main level of the home you'll find the library/sitting room complete with working fireplace– perfect for a cozy evening in!– as well as the dining room with seating for 8. On the way to the spacious kitchen you'll find a powder room on one side and a butler's pantry (wine fridge included) on the other. The custom kitchen comes with a breakfast nook with bench seating, and there is additional counter seating at the island. From the kitchen you have an open sightline to the bright main living room, equipped with comfortable couches and a smart TV. There's also a cute little patio off of the living room that's a perfect spot to enjoy your morning coffee! Head upstairs and you'll find the master bedroom (check out the gorgeous domed ceiling!) and master en suite with a large glassed-in steam shower, separate soaker tub, and dual vanity sinks. You can also enjoy the spacious walk-in closet with custom shelves! Down the hall you'll find three more bedrooms an

neighborhood_overview: Anchored by a beautiful stretch of shoreline to the east and dotted with train stops from two ‘L' lines, Lakeview is one of Chicago's liveliest and most accessible neighborhoods. Several distinct areas — East Lakeview, Central Lakeview, Boystown and Wrigleyville — meld together to form a lakefront community that celebrates diversity and boasts something for every type of visitor.
access: You will have full and private access to my home.
house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.  2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty.  3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.  6.) Only the front fireplace on the main level
host_about: We are longtime Chicago residents who love to travel. Maria is originally from Spain and Joe from California, but we landed in Chicago and have made it our home for more than 15 years. Lakeview is a wonderful neighborhood, and our family house is on a quiet residential block but just walking distance to some of our favorite Chicago's restaurants, parks, Wrigley Field, theaters, nightlife, and the CTA brown, purple, and red lines. We hope you enjoy it as much as we do!

name: Logan Square Oasis
summary: This cute and stylish 1000 square foot, two bedroom garden apartment is the perfect place to call home while you explore Chicago's hippest neighborhood, Logan Square.  Enjoy comfortable furniture, plenty of amenities and cute vintage touches.  Try our state-of-the-art 58 inch Smart TV with Roku speakers and gigabit internet, easy to stream your personal media.  Sleep in our two bedrooms with new queen size beds, or try the beautiful pull-out sofa that converts into a super comfortable third bed.
space: As a lifelong Chicagoan, my home offers you the most authentic Chicago experience.  Situated on a picturesque block filled with the real artists and families that make Logan Square unique, this space offers the perfect combination of creature comforts, convenience and adventure.  Come have a beer in our secret garden patio and take refuge in the quiet haven of our apartment.  Our beautiful 1909 building is a quick walk to some of the best bars and restaurants in the city.  We also offer kid swag for families and easy access to on-site coin laundry.

neighborhood_overview: Located in the heart of Logan just steps off of Chicago's "Emerald Necklace" otherwise known as Logan Boulevard, you are in Chicago's most popular neighborhood with the absolute best access to everything the scene has to offer!  Come enjoy our renowned cocktails and dining, Farmer's Market or one of the many live music shows around the neighborhood.
transit: Just two blocks from the Kennedy 90/94 expressway.  Good public transit access with a quick walk to the California and Logan Square "L" blue line train stops and one block walk to the Diversey and California buses.  Very walkable to the gym, shops, coffee, bars, and restaurants.  Extremely convenient!
access: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy!  You'll also have access to common areas such as the laundry room and the back patio.
interaction: Self check-in is super easy with our state of the art digital home locks.  While you are in Chicago, we are available on an as-needed basis, just a quick phone call or text away if anything comes up, or you need a tip on the best place to grab a bite, see a show, or regarding transportation.
host_about: Hi there, I'm Erin, a proud Chicagoan and fellow traveler.  A good friend once introduced me at a party as "the most Chicago Chicagoan I know" and I took it as a tremendous compliment.  I'm a teacher, a mom, a dedicated foodie and a lover of books and wine.  If you want to experience real city living, our Logan Square Oasis is for you.

name: Sweet, colorful studio in diverse Old Irving Park
summary: I love my little studio apartment: great light coming in through the windows, adorable breakfast nook with lots of plants, & a sweet little kitchen with lots of pots & pans if you feel like cooking. I also love my neighborhood: lots of delicious/ cheap middle eastern & north African restaurants (plus a fashion hijab store) right below my place, a divey diner & bar across the street, & the blue line (which goes to Logan Square, Wicker Park, & the loop) less than a mile away. Free street parking!
space: My apartment is very warm in the winter. Past guests have also enjoyed the unique collection of art  showcased in the breakfast nook, as well as the many plants and stones around the apartment.

neighborhood_overview: Very pedestrian-friendly neighborhood with inexpensive and delicious mediterranean food served in restaurants on the same block as my apartment. All the neighbors are friendly and respectful, and many of them have cute dogs. There are also several pharmacies and dollar stores nearby, in case you've forgotten any travel essentials!
transit: My apartment is about a ten minute walk from a blue-line train stop (this train line gets you to and from O'Hare airport, down town, Logan Square, Wicker Park, River West, and River North (in other words, many of Chicago's most popular and lively neighborhoods!). Additionally, there is plenty of free, unrestricted street parking on Cullom ave., which runs right behind my apartment building.
access: The whole apartment is yours to use!
interaction: Guests can always reach me by phone, but I'll be staying elsewhere.
house_rules: - My apartment is on the second floor, and is not wheelchair accessible. - I've set out breakfast bars, tea, and oatmeal for your morning.  - my radiator can be noisy at times, so there are earplugs by the bed. -I've set clean towels for you on the shelf in the living area. -feel free to use the available hanger on the clothes rack. -please wash any dishes you use
host_about: I work in a children's hospital as a Poet-in-Residence. (I visit the kids and help them write poems or stories and then type the details of our workshops into a database to help them get school credit.) My first book of poems is coming out next fall. I like stand-up comedy/ comedy podcasts, working out, dancing, hip-hop music, and Cuban food.

name: ICONIC LUX 1BR Convertible in LakeShore East!
summary: This building takes the cake in terms of style and architectural prowess.  93 stores of steel, concrete and glass, this building towers over the city and commands impressive views of the downtown area. Unit is furnished with modern accommodations, one queen bed and one queen couch bed. Amazing balcony with little dining set Galley kitchen.  This unit is a convertible, and does not have a door between bedroom and living room (it’s open-concept space)! We request 30 days or longer please.

neighborhood_overview: Set near Museum Campus and including historic Printers Row, the large South Loop is a lively hub of classic bars and diverse restaurants, plus longtime clubs Jazz Showcase and Buddy Guy's Legends. Students and creative types frequent the Museum of Contemporary Photography, while blues label Chess Records offers tours of its recording studio. Prairie Avenue Historic District is lined with 19th-century mansions.
notes: Check In / Check Out Check in starts at 4 PM CT Check out time is 11 AM CT We do not offer early Check In or late Check Out.  Luggage Hold  If your travel arrangements have you arriving earlier or leaving later than our designated check in / check out times, we recommend using Wait Here Chicago. We have a partnership with them and can offer you discounted rates on their luggage hold options throughout the city.
transit: There is an "L" train stop just around the corner. The space is very easily accessible by train. There are parking garages all around for drivers and you can use the spot hero app to find affordable parking!
access: The entire home is yours to enjoy for the duration of your stay. You will also have access to all of the building's beautiful and unique amenities.

name: Can't Beat the Location: Wicker Park 2 Bedroom
summary: Two bedroom flat in Wicker Park - the area to be in!  Big flat with lots of natural light, newly remolded space and huge deck.  Stocked kitchen for cooking and W/D.  Spacious living room.  Easy access to downtown Chicago on blue line (4 min).  Bars, cafes, grocery and transit at your doorstep.   Wicker Park is the place in Chicago for the urban-neighborhood experience.  Great galleries, cafes and restaurants all within just a two minute walk and very close to the main attractions of Chicago.
space: Large windows create a very open atmosphere that has great views of the neighborhood and the Chicago city scape. Wood floors and brick finishing create a cozy winter retreat that ensures everyone is warm. The space has everything you need if you want to stay in or if you want to explore. Two bedrooms with foam mattresses. An additional inflatable bed does create a third bed if needed. There is also a 60 inch 4K tv with Amazon, HBO and all the cable channels one could need.  WiFi is quick. Th bathroom has two sinks and the shower has two shower heads that provides hot water from different angles.

summary: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this comfortable South Loop furnished one-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and sophisticated living room with great high floor views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Chicago has to offer! (#CHI156)
space: Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this one-bedroom apartment. Ideally located in Chicago, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in South Loop. A dynamic neighborhood with a unique mix of attractions, shopping and history. Take a stroll along South Michigan Avenue and the nearby Prairie Avenue district to see "Millionaire's Row", an area lined with mansions belonging to Chicago's wealthiest elite. For shopping, visit the Roosevelt Collection, an open-air plaza, home to a cinema as well as premium local and national retailers. Along the southern edge, you will find Soldier Field, the Chicago Bears football stadium. Don’t miss the Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum and Grant Park, all adjacent to one another and huge attractions in South Loop.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $450 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Sonder | The Western | Bright 1BR + Rooftop
summary: We want everyone to have a comfortable place to stay. Our digital check-in and the ability to manage your stay from our app, means you won't need to interact with anyone in person. Our staff has been trained in proper disinfection techniques and will deep clean your Sonder before and after your stay. We're here for you during this time of uncertainty and can be reached 24/7 via text or call. Named the most innovative travel company of 2019 by Fast Company, Sonder has hosted a million guests in 5,000+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.   - 24/7 support via text, email, or phone   - Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided   - Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive   - Self check-in

name: A Sunny 2BR in Wicker Park - Perfect Location! ❤️
summary: Elegantly decorated and spacious 2-bedroom/1.5 bathroom apartment in Lakeview. ✔ Close to transit, dining, bars, shops, groceries, and Chicago landmarks. ✔ Free access to members-only club in the Willis Tower (details below). ✔ Experienced hosts with 2,000+ reviews on-call to answer your questions. ✔ Safe and vibrant neighborhood. ✔ Convenient parking options nearby. ✔ Easy self-check-in & keyless entry. ✔ 12-min train ride to downtown via the nearby Damen 'L' train stop.
space: "This apartment was perfect. Very clean, great location (walking distance to so many things), and big. It was beyond what I expected and I’ll definitely be booking it every time I come to Chicago." -Aly The perfect blend of modern styling and classic charm that can only be found in an updated vintage unit like this. This apartment comfortably sleeps four.  ￫ Room 1 (queen bed)  ￫ Room 2 (queen bed) APARTMENT HIGHLIGHTS ✔ High-speed internet ✔ Fully equipped kitchen ✔ Keyless entry ✔ In-unit washer/dryer ✔ 40" Smart TV w/ Netflix (no cable TV) ✔ Keurig coffee maker ️LOCATION️ Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber. ￫ The Damen Blue line 'L' train station is a 4-minute walk away. ￫  O'Hare is 40 minutes away via public transit and 25-45 minutes away via Uber. ￫  Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 30-60 minutes away via Uber. PARKING Parking in Chicago
description: Elegantly decorated and spacious 2-bedroom/1.5 bathroom apartment in Lakeview. ✔ Close to transit, dining, bars, shops, groceries, and Chicago landmarks. ✔ Free access to members-only club in the Willis Tower (details below). ✔ Experienced hosts with 2,000+ reviews on-call to answer your questions. ✔ Safe and vibrant neighborhood. ✔ Convenient parking options nearby. ✔ Easy self-check-in & keyless entry. ✔ 12-min train ride to downtown via the nearby Damen 'L' train stop. "This apartment was perfect. Very clean, great location (walking distance to so many things), and big. It was beyond what I expected and I’ll definitely be booking it every time I come to Chicago." -Aly The perfect blend of modern styling and classic charm that can only be found in an updated vintage unit like this. This apartment comfortably sleeps four.  ￫ Room 1 (queen bed)  ￫ Room 2 (queen bed) APARTMENT HIGHLIGHTS ✔ High-speed internet ✔ Fully equipped kitchen ✔ Keyless entry ✔ In-unit washer/dryer ✔ 40" Smart TV
neighborhood_overview: We’re located on the north side of Chicago in Wicker Park, one of Chicago’s trendiest and safest neighborhoods. Our neighborhood is a wonderful mix of bustling streets packed with local restaurants and shops, as well as quiet tree-lined streets full of historic buildings. We’re also minutes away from many of Chicago’s most popular spots.
notes: ❓FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS❓ 1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?” Excellent public transit directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. Our building is just a short walk from the Damen “L” train station. Search for “Damen blue line station” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest. 2. “Is there parking nearby?” Parking in Chicago is always difficult, especially in the evening and during special events. We highly recommend using an app called SpotHero to reserve a nearby paid parking spot. We love SpotHero because it allows you to reserve a parking spot in advance so that you don’t have to worry about finding one when you arrive. 3. When is check-in/check-out? Check-in: Your reservation and access to the apartment both begin at 3 p.m. As a courtesy, you can stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room. Check-out: Your reservation and access to
transit: Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. access: The entire apartment is yours to use during your stay. The apartment includes: ✔ Two bedrooms with queen-size beds. ✔ One full bathroom. ✔ Sunny and spacious living room with smart TV (no cable). ✔ Dining area. ✔ Fully-stocked kitchen.

neighborhood_overview: Humboldt Park offers kayaking, paddle boating and beach. Weegee's Lounge is a popular bar just an 15 min walk from our home. Also a 20 minute walk to Rosa's Jazz and Blues Lounge which host some of the industry's hottest names. Don't miss dessert at Xurro - Churro Factory for made to order churros, ice cream and coffee just a 13 minute walk (to name a few places).
transit: Walkable to everything via the 606 trail which is about a 12-minute walk. If you are looking to venture a bit further into different neighborhoods or even downtown, we are just a 3 min walk to the North avenue bus (72) that will get you to Wicker Park and the Damen blue line stop. The North Ave bus takes you directly to the red line. If you take the North bus to the end, you will be dropped off at North Ave beach and the lake front.  If you are looking to head to some hot restaurants in Logan Square we are an 10 min walk to the Armitage bus (73). This bus will also take you directly to the Lincoln Park Zoo.  We have free street parking available on Wabansia. If you bring a car your options are endless and convenient.  Uber/Lyft is also a great option and very accessible.

name: Kick Back in the Egg Chair at a Vintage-Inspired Oasis
summary: Hop on the El train for a trip to the Art Institute or Millennium Park, then return to grab a snack at the diner-style table in a homey haven that combines designer pieces with antique oak and marble nightstands.
space: Unlike many Air Bnb setups with "just the basics" this 1,000 sq. ft. two-bedroom apartment has been been lovingly furnished with details galore.  You'll find original artwork on the walls, glowing night-table lamps, a HEPA air purifier, and plenty of board games and coffee table books to pass the time. The furniture has a vintage feel, consisting of a few designer pieces such as the Egg chair as well as antique oak and marble nightstands. The kitchen is equipped with a dishwasher and plenty of cookware. In the master bedroom there's a Simmons Beautyrest mattress, and all sheets and towels are freshly laundered cotton. Sliding glass doors open to a private porch with a cafe table, perfect for coffee and the paper in the morning. The television has Roku, with free and open access to Netflix. Speedy Wifi service is included. Full List of Amenities * 1,100 sq. ft. with two huge private bedrooms * Free and readily available street parking * Keypad access (24/7 check-in) * Queen air mattress
description: Hop on the El train for a trip to the Art Institute or Millennium Park, then return to grab a snack at the diner-style table in a homey haven that combines designer pieces with antique oak and marble nightstands.
neighborhood_overview: A former rough-and-tumble area, Bridgeport is now one of the most ethnically-diverse and vibrant neighborhoods in the city. Famous deep-dish pizzerias share the 'hood with taco joints, specialty Northern Chinese restaurants, and great coffee shops.
notes: * There are directions to the nearest bus and train stop in the room. No messing around with (Hidden by Airbnb) maps and trying to identify stops and stations. * Ten minutes to downtown attractions such as the Art Institute, Bean, Mag Mile, State St., and Millennium Park.  * The apartment has central heat and air conditioning. You can adjust the thermostat to your preference. * Pots and pans are provided, but please clean up after yourself thoroughly if you do cook. * Park anywhere on this street or neighboring streets with no special permit. * Easy access from the highway if you're driving into town. On 55, exit at Ashland/Damen and you'll be here in just a minute or two. From 90/94 it's five minutes or less. * Smokers, feel free to smoke on the back porch, although smoking is not allowed anywhere inside the building. * There is a huge grocery store (Mariano's) less than a five minute walk away. * Some of the best coffee in the city (Bridgeport Coffee) is a ten minute walk, and there
transit: At the end of the block is the Archer bus. This will take you northeast to Chinatown in about 5 minutes or all the way downtown in about 10 minutes. A block away is the Ashland Orange Line El stop. The El will take you northeast to downtown in about 10 minutes or south to Midway in about 15 minutes. A block away is the Ashland bus, which will take you directly to Pilsen, Wicker Park, and Lakeview.
access: This is an entire 2-bedroom apartment. You will have the entire space to yourself (1,100 S.F.) in addition to a back porch. There is ample street parking in front of the building and on surrounding streets that does not require a special permit. Checkin is easy and available 24/7 with keypad access.
interaction: Text any time. I can recommend neighborhood restaurants and bars, and we can help you figure out how to get around and do what you want in the city. I am not available to meet in person.
house_rules: - Check Out At Noon: Check-out time is 12 p.m. I cannot adjust check-in or check-out times because of the time it takes to clean between guests. If you need a later check-out time or an earlier check-in, your only option is to book an extra night. If you remain in the apartment past check-out time, you will be charged for an additional night. - Lock All Doors: The front door of the building does not automatically lock. Always lock the apartment door and the front door after yourself. - Do Not Lose The Keys: There will be a $75 fee for losing the keys or failing to return them. - No Smoking: No smoking anything inside the building. Everyone in the building can smell the smoke. If I get a complaint from someone else in the building or any detectable odor remains after you are gone there will be a $200 smoke cleaning charge.  - Be Considerate of Noise & Sound (Quiet time begins at 11 p.m.): This is a first-floor apartment in an older building with an apartment above and below it. The hard
host_about:
You can pronounce my name the English way, the French way, or just call me Gv. I host this space with my husband John. We live in the apartment on the second floor of the building. We're both lifetime Chicago residents and have lived across the city, in Rogers Park, Pilsen, Roscoe Village, Logan Square, Wicker Park, and Humboldt Park. A few years ago we settled in Bridgeport. It’s a heck of a neighborhood, and we hope you’ll discover it during your stay.

As admirers of vintage furniture and curios, we went nuts decorating for our guests. You'll find recycled tour cases sharing the space with antique trunks, a Milo Baughman original, and a 50s chrome kitchen set. We took care to include details that matter to us when we travel, such as a coffee machine, a private outdoor space, and cotton bedding as opposed to polyester. 

When we’re not scouring thrift shops, we write fiction. We’ve published a few books on our own and a few together. Our favorite authors are Beckett, Céline, and Limonov.

name: 3BR Classic Chicago Graystone in Humboldt Park
summary: Our home is close to Humboldt Park and just a short drive/ride from great dining options in Ukrainian Village. You’ll love our place because of there's lots of space for a family gathering as you explore Chicago. We open our home for guests while we are out of town traveling. If you are looking for a retreat with friends in Chicago- our cozy place would be perfect.
space: Our home was newly renovated after we moved in during 2015. When we first bought this home, it was vacant and in MUCH need of some TLC and it's transformation is pretty incredible! We have two young boys so some of our house has marks on of our little ones- we welcome travelers with children- but many other guests of all ages have felt very welcome in our home.
description: Our home is close to Humboldt Park and just a short drive/ride from great dining options in Ukrainian Village. You’ll love our place because of there's lots of space for a family gathering as you explore Chicago. We open our home for guests while we are out of town traveling. If you are looking for a retreat with friends in Chicago- our cozy place would be perfect. Our home was newly renovated after we moved in during 2015. When we first bought this home, it was vacant and in MUCH need of some TLC and it's transformation is pretty incredible! We have two young boys so some of our house has marks on of our little ones- we welcome travelers with children- but many other guests of all ages have felt very welcome in our home. You will be given access to our first floor which has living, dining, bathroom, kitchen and three bedrooms: master, our boys room and our guest room. We do have a basement which will be off limits and locked to guests. We also have tenants living in the unit upstairs
neighborhood_overview: Our home is a classic brick/stone two-flat on a Chicago West Side block. The area can be considered rough around the edges to some, but we have lived here since 2015 without incident and love our home, our neighbors and Humboldt Park as a whole. During the summer months our block is often quite lively with many people out on the streets or spending time on their front porches- this may feel very different for folks who aren't used to urban neighborhoods. Here are some of my favorite things to do in our neighborhood:  1. Walk or ride to the Garfield Park Conservatory- it's AMAZING. Our boys love it- it's fantastic for a quiet retreat, or play time with the kiddos. There's a great free parking lot also.  2. Enjoy Humboldt Park- it's within walking distance or hop on the bus/car. Within the park there's a free city pool just around the corner from our house and the lagoon is always a beautiful place to take a nice evening stroll- also a free parking lot right by the boathouse. 3. Just a b
transit: We are very close to public transit with a stop for the Chicago Ave. bus just a half block away, and a stop for the Kedzie bus just 2 blocks away. We are walk-able to the Greenline stops at Kedzie or the Conservatory- although many not used to urban neighborhoods will find this uncomfortable. It's also not difficult to drive to a train stop and park nearby. Uber and Lyft are also easy and affordable options. Many of our guests have used their own cars as well, there's always an open spot on the street. Also, we are usually able to offer a spot in our garage or parking pad.
access: You will be given access to our first floor which has living, dining, bathroom, kitchen and three bedrooms: master, our boys room and our guest room. We do have a basement which will be off limits and locked to guests. We also have tenants living in the unit upstairs who are wonderful, but the second floor is all theirs and not available to AirBnB guests. Our backyard is small, but nice for kids playing (there's a sandbox) or adults (there is a small fire pit.)
interaction: If we are not in the Chicago area during your stay, we will designate a local on call person- you'll be able to call us with any issues, and whatever we can't help with because we're traveling, we'll send over our "on call" friend.
house_rules: - House will be empty while we travel- please leave our home as you found it.  - Garbage and recycling are in the blue and black bins in the back driveway. - Basement will locked.
host_about: My husband and I work for a non profit in our community called River City Community Development Center, running a job training program for teens called Harambee. We love Humboldt Park and see so much beauty in our neighborhood and the people who call this place home. We have two young kids. We love opening our home to folks visiting Chicago.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in River North, Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood. The bridges combined with the riverwalk offer incredible views. Nearby on Michigan Avenue is the city’s premier shopping area. One of the neighborhood’s biggest assets is the walk-to-work appeal. Young professionals, who live and work in the area, can quickly get to the office in the morning and just as easily enjoy an after-work drink, as the area is considered a premier entertainment center. Don’t miss a stroll on Kinzie and Hubbard streets. Merchandise Mart, the iconic building with showrooms, shops, and office space, is only a 5 minute walk. The Loop is just across the bridge and is about 5 minute walk.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $400 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

description: My sunny 1 bedroom, 1 bath unit is located steps from Lincoln Park / Old Town and has vintage touches throughout.  The apartment is great for 2 guests but can accommodate up to 4 using the queen size pull out couch.  I look forward to hosting you soon and click Instant Book to the right -> The apartment has a living area with windows looking out over Lincoln Park and a small patio with table and chairs to take in the breeze off of Lake Michigan, less than a quarter mile away.  The galley kitchen is great for preparing a quick meal and is complete with a coffee maker for your morning fix.  The bathroom, located between the living area and bedroom, has a tub/shower combo.  The bedroom has a queen bed, vintage stained glass built into the windows and a spacious closet.  You'll love this apartment as an ideal home base for your trip to Chicago. You will have complete and private access to my condo. I travel often so I use and trust an off-site management team to help guests get the informa
neighborhood_overview: In Lincoln Park, Chicago's motto urbs in horto—or "City in a Garden"—truly comes to life. Historic churches and handsome brick row houses nestled within landmark districts sit next to peaceful parks, while quiet, tree-lined residential areas give way to bustling business corridors.
access: You will have complete and private access to my condo.
interaction: I travel often so I use and trust an off-site management team to help guests get the information and service they need to make their stay enjoyable! They will be your contact for all communication leading up to and during your stay.
house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty. 3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid. 6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurr
host_about:
Hello Airbnb! My family and I love being hosts to the community and lucky to have acquired a beautiful building in a prime location that we are excited to share with you! 
5 Facts About Me:
1)I'm from Chicago! 
2)Love Sailing
3)Can't live without a good Chicago dog.
4) Favorite Summertime Activity: Rooftop beverages at JParker and visiting Green City Local Farmers Market both just across the street from the property.
5) Favorite Wintertime Activity: Lincoln Park Zoo lights & dinner at Chicago Oven and Pizza Grinder...also just steps away from the unit!

Our staff has been trained in proper disinfection techniques and will deep clean your Sonder before and after your stay. neighborhood_overview: The South Loop is a vibrant blend of notable attractions, beautiful parks, and stunning Lake Michigan views. Picnic in the charming green space surrounding Museum Campus, or attend one of the many events at Grant Park such as The Taste of Chicago. Spend the day exploring the countless museums, or journey to the top of the 108-story Willis Tower for breathtaking views of the city.
notes: Exact views from the apartment are not guaranteed, the views could vary from the pictures listed. There’s no cable. We’ve provided a Chromecast for streaming.

name: Living Room by the Lake
summary: You will have the living room to yourself which is right next tot the bathroom and kitchen. There living room gets lots of light and is decorated with crystals and plants. There is a 50 inch TV in the living room with Cable and Netflix.  The Red line train station is less than a block away and there is a really nice coffee shop right downstairs. There is a washer and dryer on the bottom floor of the building for $1.00 for each wash and/or dry.
space: The space has wood floors and lots of light with blinds. There are plants that decorate the window seal in a quiet and safe area.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is the most diverse neighborhood in Chicago and one of the most divers neighborhoods in the country. There are trains and buses everywhere along with coffee shops and food. Expect to see lots of pretty flowers and bunnies hopping around and the beach is just a couple blocks away. The neighborhood is quiet and safe.

name: Queen Suite with Balcony near Wrigley - Sleeps 4!
summary: Our 230 SqFt Queen’s Terrace Suite features a private 100 SqFt walk-out terrace where you can hear sounds of the vibrant Wrigley neighborhood, along with bespoke millwork and local art to add brightness to your stay. Get cozy in our plush queen bed and twin bunk bed outfitted with crisp white sheets and feel refreshed with our custom-tiled bathrooms complete with contemporary finishes.

neighborhood_overview: Nestled in between Chicago’s boisterous restaurants and lively bars, The Wheelhouse Hotel is walking distance from the Addison El stop on the red line and a quick one block walk from historic Wrigley Field. Whether you’re in town for a baseball game or looking to explore the city on a more local level, let our luxe accommodations, unexpected surprises, attentive service, and delightful design be the backdrop to your Windy City stay.
transit: The Wheelhouse Hotel is two blocks from the Addison stop of the CTA Red Line, three blocks from the Belmont stop of the CTA Brown Line and steps away from the Clark & Cornelia stop of the #22 Bus. If driving, your bestparking options are the enclosed garage at 3511 N Clark ($45/night) the surface lot at 1013 W Roscoe, and a handful of street parking spots.
access: All public space
interaction: 24 hour reception desk
host_about: Welcome to the Wheelhouse Hotel. Rooted in history, with an eye towards the future and an ever present atmosphere of playful celebration, our spunky hotel brings intimate, unpretentious, luxury lodging to Chicago’s spirited Wrigleyville neighborhood. Just steps away from all the action yet miles away from ordinary, you’ll have a front row seat to a hyper-local experience.

name: Sweet Home Chicago 4 Bedroom/2 Bath
summary: This Noble Square coach house is newly carpeted, painted, and new kitchen appliances - perfect for a large family or group. Entire house will be reserved for your group's use. Free street parking! Also a quick walk to the CTA Blue line or CTA bus stop.
space: Visiting Chicago? This Noble Square coach house is perfect for a family or large group.  The property listed is an independent two story coach house that has four large private bedrooms, huge kitchen stocked with appliances and cooking utensils, spacious living room with large couch, sleeper sofa and television, private outdoor patio with a dining table and chairs, two full size bathroom that include all bath essentials, massive jacuzzi tub, and finally a laundry room with a washer and dryer.  In total the sleeping options consist of three private bedrooms that have one bed each (a king bed, a queen bed, and a sleeper sofa). The 4th private bedroom has a full size bed and another sleeper sofa. In additional to the 4 private bedrooms there is additional sleeping options available in the living room which has a large couch, queen size sleeper sofa, and inflatable mattress.  The listing is considered to be in the "Noble Square" area which is located in West Town (Community Area #24; one o

The 4th private bedroom has a full size bed and another sleeper sofa. In additional to the 4 private bedrooms ther
neighborhood_overview: Some people have called West Town the best-located Community Area in the city. The reason? It's 3 miles or less from some of Chicago's most popular destinations, such as: Chicago's Lakefront - multiple beaches and outdoor activities Grant Park - large urban park that is the location Millennium Park, Buckingham Fountain, the Art Institute of Chicago, and Lollapalooza Millennium Park - home of the famous Chicago Bean, Waterfall Towers,   and Pritzker Pavilion Buckingham Fountain - this memorial fountain is located in the center of Grant Park and is one of the largest memorial fountains in the world Art Institute of Chicago - world renowned art institute which houses more than 30,000 works of art Lincoln Park Zoo - spend an enjoyable day visiting a leader in animal conservation and care at no cost  Shedd Aquarium - largest indoor aquarium in the world Field Museum of Natural History - regarded as a premier natural history museum because of its size and quality of educational and scientifi
notes: If you're looking for a variety of possibilities you will love West Town with its restaurants, art galleries, boutiques, neighborhood bars, farmers markets, food trucks parked on corners, independent coffee shops, indie bands playing on small stages, and sports bars. The neighborhoods listed below are also part of West Town, the Community Area where Noble Square is located: Ukrainian Village — "where the smart locals go" according to Chicago Magazine Wicker Park — "The Midwest Mecca of hipsterdom," according to Forbes (the northern part of Noble Square is often listed by realtors as part of Wicker Park)
transit: This listing is within walking distance (less than a mile) from the CTA Blue Line Chicago Stop and the CTA Grant Bus Stop. It is also easily accessible for Uber and taxi pick ups. Withnall these options it makes it very easy to travel to any community in Chicago effortlessly.
access: Guests will have access to the entire house except for the utility control room.
house_rules: The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement. Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The Tenants shall not sublet the property. No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises. No groups that exceed 6 without written consent. If breached a $80 charge will be accessed per guest per night. No smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted on the patio, but Tenant will be charged if any damage is caused to the property. No firearms, fireworks or other hazardous material shall be in or on property. Tenants shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, etc shall cause termination of this agreement. The tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting that rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall p
host_about: I was born and raised in the Chicagoland area which has made me an avid Chicago sports fan. I love to attend Cubs, Blackhawks, Bulls and Bears games and coach local youth sports teams in my free time. I also enjoy good food and craft beer and will gladly travel out of my way to go a highly regarded restaurant or a coveted beer release. I am currently studying for the CPA test which takes up a good portion of my free time, but I hope to be able to travel and see more of the world once I have completed all portions of the testing. I strive to provide my guests with the best possible lodging experience and my goal is to make their trip a memorable one. I have done a fair share of traveling myself so I know how important the little thing are, and try to accommodate any groups specific needs.

name: G-HOUSE 2
summary: Welcome to my humble abode. My little slice of heaven is located in an early 1900’s Chicago Graystone that has retained MOST of it’s vintage charm, and acquired the rest from me ;) +*+*+*You are urged to do your own research on the area, and make a decision on whether this area is appropriate for your stay.+*+*+*   This property is located on the South Side of Chicago in a neighborhood by the name of New City.
space: This is the larger of the two bedrooms in my apartment that are available.  This room is equipped with: Television Antenna  HDMI CABLE  Remote Lamp Alarm clock Luggage Rack Stereo System with DVD player and FM/AM Radio Air Conditioner w/Remote Ceiling Fan Air Purifier   There is plenty of coffee, tea, and  an assortment of snacks and breakfast items complimentary to you. There’s also complimentary soda, water, and  breakfast items in the fridge.  If I happen to be cooking, feel free to join me for any meal!  If you’re not sure if something is off-limits, just ask.  You also have access to the living room television where you can access AMAZON PRIME, HULU AND NETFLIX.  While this room does not have a window air-conditioner, it is located directly in front of the main air conditioner for the entire apartment and can get quite cool.   You do not have access to the laundry area. However, I will be happy to discuss assisting with laundry for a small additional fee. Laundering of Sheets, bed

neighborhood_overview: This property is located: -14 minutes from downtown in light traffic. -12 minutes from Hyde Park in light traffic.  -17 minutes from Midway International Airport in light traffic. -35 minutes in light traffic from O’Hare International Airport -Drive to 57th Street Beach in 15 minutes, or a 35 minutes CTA ride. Nearby parks include: -Sherman Park (Fishing,swimming,playground) -Washington Park -Jackson Park  Nearby Stores/Food: All Guests will receive a full list of nearby stores and restaurants in their guest binder! -Checkers 1.3 mi. (Open Until 4A.M. weekdays, 5 A.M. weekends) -Wendy’s 1.0 mi.   -White Castle 0.9 mi. -Harold’s Chicken 0.8 mi. -Subway 0.8 mi. -Starbucks 1.4 mi. -Chipotle 1.4 mi.  -Wingstop 1.4 mi. notes: CITY OF CHICAGO REGISTRATION NUMBER: R (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
transit: A car is recommended. Uber and Lyft are recommended for late night travel. Public transportation is convenient and easy to navigate during the day.
access: Living Room, Dining Room, Kitchen, Back Porch, Rear Patio
interaction: I will keep my socialization to a minimum when requested. I do live in this apartment, but will make it a priority to respect your personal space, and quiet enjoyment. If I am not in the unit, I am always reachable through text, or phone. Do not hesitate to contact me, or knock on my door if you have questions or concerns.
house_rules: Quiet Hours: 10P.M.-10A.M. SUNDAY-THURSDAY 1A.M.-9A.M. FRIDAY & SATURDAY -Please note that while quiet hours are taken very seriously, non quiet hours are taken just as seriously. Music is allowed (at respectable levels) and frolicking is encouraged. Chicago is one of the best cities in the world, and you should enjoy yourself at all times, even at home! If you are in town on business, or are a student in need of a quiet place to study, please make this clear before booking. This gives me a chance to inform any other guests of your needs, and come to an agreement as to how to accommodate you both :).  Cleanliness -Guests are more than welcome to use anything within reach in the kitchen and bathrooms. Be aware that there is NO DISHWASHER at this time (coming soon). Please do your part to ensure that we are keeping our space as clean as possible. If you use it, wash it. I will be cleaning ALL COMMON AREAS daily, if not every other day (usually between the hours of NOON-3PM) while guests
host_about: Hello! I am a young professional (Real Estate) from Chicago! I am a free spirit that loves to meet new people, and create new and exciting experiences for myself. I am inquisitive, curious, and outgoing. My hobbies include enjoying the superb Chicago underground nightlife, eating delicious food, camping, wine tasting (novice), and being a couch burrito in my down-time. I LOVE dogs, cats usually allow me to live after meeting me, and I’m open to loving other animals as well. I am partial to sports, but I will usually try any outdoor activity once! My perfect night? Wine, house music, and Chinese food. I look forward to meeting you!
