name: Chicago private apt near Wrigley Field & Logan
summary: Chicago house with 2 levels, with all the amenities that you need. Sleeps 6 with tight accommodations for 8  if needed. We are located in a safe, and wonderful neighborhood. You have everything you need here from Pubs, to Restaurants, Wrigley Field and more..
space: Hotel costs are getting out of hand, I totally get it. So save some money and come stay in our 2 bedroom Flat/Apartment. Our large spacious house is for you to take some time off and enjoy the Beautiful city of Chicago. We are on the border of 6 neighborhoods, Logan Square, Avondale, Roscoe Village, Lakeview, Bucktown, Wicker Park and an easy train ride downtown. We are an easy walk, bus ride, Divvy Bike Ride, train to get anywhere you want.  I know our listing says 2 night minimum for the weekend, but don't ever be afraid to ask for 1 night.  Welcome!! We are so happy to have you stay in our flat.  There's a lot of room, and can comfortably sleep 6 people, and we can accommodate 8 with a queen size air mattress as well if needed. We have 2 bedrooms and the couch in the living room turns into a full size bed.  We provide fresh linens and towels for each guest.  We have a coffee machine for your coffee needs. We have all the amenities that you can get at a hotel and more. I am a big spi
description: Chicago house with 2 levels, with all the amenities that you need. Sleeps 6 with tight accommodations for 8  if needed. We are located in a safe, and wonderful neighborhood. You have everything you need here from Pubs, to Restaurants, Wrigley Field and more.. Hotel costs are getting out of hand, I totally get it. So save some money and come stay in our 2 bedroom Flat/Apartment. Our large spacious house is for you to take some time off and enjoy the Beautiful city of Chicago. We are on the border of 6 neighborhoods, Logan Square, Avondale, Roscoe Village, Lakeview, Bucktown, Wicker Park and an easy train ride downtown. We are an easy walk, bus ride, Divvy Bike Ride, train to get anywhere you want.  I know our listing says 2 night minimum for the weekend, but don't ever be afraid to ask for 1 night.  Welcome!! We are so happy to have you stay in our flat.  There's a lot of room, and can comfortably sleep 6 people, and we can accommodate 8 with a queen size air mattress as well if needed.
neighborhood_overview: We are in a city residential neighborhood which is Avondale/Logan Square/Roscoe Village/Bucktown area.  I say a few neighborhoods because we literally sit on the border lines of all of them. The neighborhood is fantastic, with great families, singles, and professionals with access to everything you can want. 3 blocks down is the park. If you want to go out for some cocktails, we have our local dive bar a block away, or trendy bars within walking distance. If you want good food, some of Chicago's best restaurants are in the area.  If you want one of America's best burgers, head over to Kuma's Corner. If you want good pizza, we have a Giordano's, Lou Malnati's, Pequads Pizza, D'agostinos, and many more because we are Chicago.  If you want to try a native Chicago Italian Beef, we are down the street from Al's Beef, here you can also find a delicious Chicago Style Hot Dog, and you won't be disappointed. If you want to try some good Gyros, then go to Chop Society, trust me they are deliciou
notes: No local rentals ** Because we have a family, no big parties during the stay, and please respect that.  I don't care if you and the guests are hanging out, having drinks, and having a good time, just be courteous of us and the neighbors. We want you to have a wonderful time and the best time you possibly can in Chicago.  Also there is absolutely no smoking of any kind in the house or close to the entrance. Must be 15 feet away from any entrance.(there will be a $250 cleaning fee for any smell of smoke in the house).  Again if you have any questions, or don't have something, or there is an issue, we are just a phone call or text message away.  I know Chicago like the back of my hand, so if you are looking for a really unique experience please just ask! =)
transit: Train – 10-15 minute walk to the blue line, which goes to and from O'hare and downtown. You can also take the bus down the brown line if you so wish, that would connect to red line as well.  Bus – The Diversey bus picks up at the end of the block at Rockwell and Campbell streets, and we are in between both of those streets. The Western Bus picks up at the corner of George and Western or Diversey and Western which is a 3 minute walk.  Divvy Bikes – Pick up a city bike from the bike station and you pay as you go.  You can pick them up all around the area, but I think the closest one is at the corner of Elston and Logan Square Boulevard Car – Free Street parking is right around the corner, and spots are always available. Like any big city, this isn't necessarily the best way to travel. Although if you are looking to get around, I am right off of the expressway.  Uber - Download the app if you don't have it. One of my favorite ways to travel inexpensively around the city. If you don't have
access: The Whole unit is yours!  Our backyard is open for you to use and is communal, but please no pets going to bathroom out there because we like to keep it clean for anyone who wants to bring their kids and play.  We also provide a propane grill(you may have to fill it, or you get lucky and it's already full), and a large patio set to sit outside on sunny days. Quiet hours start at 10pm and the backyard and deck is off limits after 9pm, because the neighbor's house is only 3 feet away, and this is all of Chicago.  If we receive any noise complaints after these hours, you will be asked to leave.
interaction: We rent the upstairs on the top floor of the building.  Our neighbors are fantastic and we are friends with all of them. We spend a lot of time with friends in the backyard over the summer grilling out. Join us for a meal, glass of wine, or have a beer with us if we are out and about.  Just know that you will have as much privacy as you need. Never be afraid to ask any questions because being born and raised in the city, I know all the ins and outs, and all the hot places to go.
house_rules: Please be respectful of us and our neighbors, as we want this to be a classy place for all people that come and visit us.  No Parties and no smoking in the home and must be 10ft away from entrance. This is a safe place to stay and we would like to keep it that way for everyone. =)  No local rentals, within 150mi.
host_about:
My wife and I absolutely love to travel, we go anywhere we can.  One of our favorite parts about traveling is making life long friendships with people from around the world.  To this day we have friends, in Fiji, London, Ireland, India, Belgium, Costa Rica, and so many more.  Now we have two babies, and makes it a little more difficult to get out and travel as much as we want to.  So we thought to ourselves, let's bring the world to us.  Let us meet fantastic people, and share the stories of what their part of the world has to offer.  We love adventure, discovering new things, The Chicago Cubs, Chicago Foods, music, dancing, Improv Comedy and we love a good happy hour.  I like to think of us as the ultimate Chicago host, because we know all the little secrets this city has to offer. 
My life motto: To Dream as if you'll live forever, but live as if you'll die today. - James Dean

neighborhood_overview: Really convienent area that is close to great neighborhoods like Wicker Park, Logan Square, Humboldt Park and downtown. Cute little corner store (that carries craft beer! The store has a better selection than some of the big liquor stores!) and great restaurants around the corner. 4 miles to Gold Coast/mag mile 5 miles to downtown proper 1.5  miles to Wicker Park 1 mile to Humboldt Park 5 miles to Wrigley Field 7.5 miles to McCormick Place
notes: PARKING: Please let me know ahead of time if you will need temporary parking permits. Just place them inside the passenger side windshield. transit: You can get around by car, Uber and  public transportation.

I am always more than happy to help put together an itinerary.  .....Also PLEASE, PLEASE let me address any issues that would warrant ANYTHING LESS THAN A 5 STAR RATING. Loud neighbor, broken appliance etc. (Anything less than 5 stars - even 4 stars is considered "bad" on airbnb and takes multiple 5 star ratings to make up). If a host's average falls below 80% "5 star rating" we may lose certain distinctions on the website or be pulled off entirely. Thank you.)
house_rules: ****bookings without reviews will have to provide an ID via the Airbnb messaging system or at check in. LOCAL, one night stays must provide IDS of all guests via messaging system PRIOR to check in and still must be PRE APPROVED PRIOR TO BOOKING. NO UNAUTHORIZED GUESTS ALLOWED**** NO SMOKING IN THE UNIT. $200 fine + cleaning fees. NO SHOES in the apartment (its a Japanese thing). We have provided slippers for you. It keeps the place cleaner. If you have a pet we can consider it based on a case to case basis but please contact me first.  Please no one under 21 yrs old without a parent or guardian. Thank you. Please wash any dishes you use. There will be a $25 extra cleaning fee for anything more than a few dishes left behind. Please BE HONEST about extra guests. Additional guests without prior approval will be charged DOUBLE the original guest rate per night. Thank you. ABSOLUTELY NO PARTIES! Any parties will immediately forfeit your stay with NO refund. host_about:
Chicago, IL I love to travel! I have 2 rescued pit bulls. I am married to a Chicago police officer who occasionally helps me with hosting our Airbnbs.
My philosophy on life: I believe that EVERYONE has the right to pursue their dreams and passions and NOone has a right to tell you what to do as long as you aren't hurting anyone. I believe in diversity and learning about other's cultures and viewpoints. That's why I love to travel!

name: Heart of Downtown Chicago
summary: Heart of Downtown High rise Condo
space: Style and comfort are yours!  With our art-lined halls with over 100 pieces of fine art including a mixture of originals, reproduction lithographs, serigraphs and oil paintings, A boutique apartment building fits right in to the swanky River North neighborhood. Our designer floor plans fit every lifestyle boasting incredible city views and the latest in modern conveniences. description: Heart of Downtown High rise Condo Style and comfort are yours!  With our art-lined halls with over 100 pieces of fine art including a mixture of originals, reproduction lithographs, serigraphs and oil paintings, A boutique apartment building fits right in to the swanky River North neighborhood. Our designer floor plans fit every lifestyle boasting incredible city views and the latest in modern conveniences. When not relaxing in your home, come enjoy our numerous amenities including pool, spa, resident clubroom, and more. Surround yourself with eclectic art and vibrant color, in one of Chicago's most fashionable neighborhoods, River North. We are brimming with cafés, boutiques, clubs, shops, and restaurants, and it's all right outside your doorstep. Walk to Chicago's prominent Magnificent Mile or stroll along Lake Michigan... all just steps away. Should you need to get around town, CTA trains, buses and quick access to the I-90/94 make it easy and convenient.

name: Beautiful Treehouse Apartment in Andersonville
summary: Welcome to our treehouse apartment! Located on the third floor, our spacious and sunny Andersonville home is a five minute walk from the many shops and restaurants on Clark and has free street parking. We're happy to go over must-see spots and restaurants and let you know the best way to get around. If you let her, our dog Lea will be your best friend during your stay; she loves making new friends! We look forward to hosting you! Chelsea and Jason
space: We're located in Andersonville, a traditionally Swedish neighborhood that is full of antique shops, coffee houses, boutiques, an independent bookstore, and many restaurants. (Really, we have everything - Italian, Irish, Swedish, Middle Eastern, Mediterranean, Mexican, Japanese, lots of spots to grab a cocktail... you get the idea.) Our apartment is located a five-minute walk from near the top of Andersonville. The building has retained a lot of the old Chicago character, with a big bay window in the living room and a brick fireplace (non-working). While we are very close to the heart of Andersonville, being just two blocks away and on the third floor means it's generally very quiet and peaceful. In the early morning, sunlight floods the living and dining rooms, and in spring, we generally wake up to birdsong. Essentially, it's gorgeous and green in summer, yellow and orange in fall, and when it snows in the winter, the snow sitting on the tree branches is gorgeous. Please note that Jas

Located on the third floor, our spacious and sunny Andersonville home is a five minute walk from the many shops and restaurants on Clark and has free street parking. We're happy to go over must-see spots and restaurants and let you know the best way to get around. If you let her, our dog Lea will be your best friend during your stay; she loves making new friends! We look forward to hosting you! Chelsea and Jason We're located in Andersonville, a traditionally Swedish neighborhood that is full of antique shops, coffee houses, boutiques, an independent bookstore, and many restaurants. (Really, we have everything - Italian, Irish, Swedish, Middle Eastern, Mediterranean, Mexican, Japanese, lots of spots to grab a cocktail... you get the idea.) The building has retained a lot of the old Chicago character, with a big bay window in the living room and a brick fireplace (non-work
neighborhood_overview: Andersonville is an historically Swedish neighborhood full of restaurants. In our neighborhood (mainly on Clark Street) you will find: - One of the best burgers in Chicago at Little Bad Wolf - Amazing sushi at Tanoshii (Also try their udon noodle soup!) - One of the best Italian dinners of your life at Anteprima - Coffee at Coffee Studio, La Colombe, Colective, or Kopi - Fantastic brunch at M. Henry or The Bongo Room - A summertime patio perfect for a drink at HopLeaf - Truly phenomenal pie at First Slice Cafe Wonderful shops you'll find include a lot of antique stores and furniture stores. Also included on the strip is the Swedish American Museum and Women and Children First bookstore. If you venture through the beautiful residential neighborhood to the train (Bryn Mawr stop), you'll have even more fantastic food options. Our favorites are: - Ben's Noodles and Rice for the most amazing pineapple fried rice for $10 - The best croissants in Chicago at Phlour - Amazing and comforting Pho
notes: For the amenities please note: - To keep down on clutter, the straightener, hair dryer, and ironing board are put away. If you need them, please let us know and we are happy to get them for you.  - Shower soap, shampoo, and conditioner are located in the shower. - Our coffee machine is a French press (we also have a kettle). Please note we do not provide coffee.
transit: - There is free parking on and around my block. Parking is very easy; we have rarely needed to park as far as the opposite end of the block. - You can catch the 22 bus east two blocks from our apartment to downtown and Wrigley Field. Note that you must either have a transit card or cash to board. Bus rides are $2.25 cash and they do not give change. - The 24-hour Red Line train is a lovely .8 mile walk and will take you directly downtown. Train tickets are $3 for a single ride.   (Insider's note- If you buy a card, it's only $0.25 to transfer from one mode of transportation to the other if you transfer within 2 hours of your original boarding time. But if you plan on riding a lot while you're here, just get a 3-day pass.)
access: You are welcome to any part of the apartment except our bedroom. Feel free to cook, work at my desk or the dining table, or watch a movie on the couch. Just please note I do work from home, so if you are here on a weekday, I will need general quiet from 9-5.
house_rules: - PLEASE NOTE: If you book with us from April 2 - May 20, only Jason will be home to host you. - Basic cleanliness - Relative quiet in the afternoons (I work from home) and after 10pm - No additional guests. Guests who bring additional people back to the apartment without the knowledge and permission of the hosts is subject to a $30 surcharge. - Please do not book if you yourself are not one of the guests. No booking on behalf of others.

Guests will have access to all areas in the house with the exception of a locked closet in one bedroom and a small restricted area in the basement. You will have privacy, but we are happy to answer any questions that you have and will be available if needed. Just 20 minutes away from O'Hare Airport, 1.5 miles away from the Blue Line, and a 10 minute walk to the Metra -- this house is the perfect venue for tourists and locals alike! name: Lakeview Getaway - Experience Chicago in Comfort 1
summary: Welcome to Chicago and Lakeview! From this apartment, you’re a 10-15 minute walk from Wrigley field, 15-20 minutes from the Lakefront, Lincoln Park, and all the Lakefront trails, and have major transportation access including trains and buses within a 7 minute walk so you can access Chicago Museums and explore the city. We're in the heart of the Belmont Theatre district and Walking distance to the hospital and countless restaurants, shopping, and nightlife attractions. Street Parking Available.
space: My recently updated apartment is in one of Chicago's hottest neighborhoods (Lakeview). The building was built in 1884, before this area was formally annexed into Chicago (in 1889)! While records no longer exist, the building has been converted several times since then. You'll see from the photos that it's been updated quite a bit boasting modern furniture and amenities. While refreshing this space, we kept an eye on preserving original details to give you a unique blend of historical charm with modern conveniences. We look forward to hosting you and your group! Bedroom 1: 8.5 x 9.5, Queen Bed, window AC Bedroom 2: 8.5 x 13.5, Queen Bed, radiator Dining Room: Table for 6, desk, radiator Kitchen: 12.5 x 14.5, high-top table with 4 stools, stove, refrigerator/freezer, microwave Bathroom: Shower/tub, vanity, toilet, radiator Living Room: 17 x 12.5, window AC, radiator, TV, sofa.

neighborhood_overview: There's so much to Lakeview that makes it one of Chicago's most sought after neighborhoods for residents. You'll be walking distance to major attractions like Wrigley Field, Lincoln Park, Lincoln Park Zoo, and the Lakefront. With mass transit within a short walk, you've got access to all of Chicago's attractions and museums and sports venues. In the heart of the Belmont Theatre district you've got great local plays, music and shows. We're a short walk to the hospital as well as amazing restaurants, cafes, shopping, nightlife, and entertainment. You'll also have easy access to the Loop and all the hustle and bustle of the city and attractions whenever you need them, or you can unplug and relax in the quietness of the apartment. This neighborhood, and the home itself, was built by and for by industrial workers which provided a foundation for the nearby expanding city in the late 1800's. The area has since become one of the most sought after locations by young and old. Many Chicago athlet
notes: There may be other tenants or guests within the building so we ask that you keep volume levels to a minimum especially between 10pm - 8am. The unit is located on the 1st floor of a 3 floor building. There are some stairs to get in the front door however. Also, since this building is a bit older, noise can carry between the floors.
transit: We're within minutes of bus stops and our mass transit trains (The L). We're located conveniently off major highways and Lake Shore Drive, which makes getting to and from the apartment easy. While we don't have any parking spots, street parking is available (for a fee) and there are convenient public garages within minutes walk. When you're staying with us, we recommend walking, public transit, and uber/lyft for getting around quickly and easily as parking and traffic can be a bit of a pain.
access: You'll be given access to the full apartment. The common spaces that are shared with other guests/tenants of the building include a utility space with laundry in the building. There is also a small backyard space. Easy permit parking is available on the street (usually right out front) and passes can be provided for a small fee.
interaction: You're in good hands with my Co-Host Nicole. I wouldn't know which way is up without her! Nicole and the team monitors the airbnb inbox 24/7. The best and fastest way to reach us is by sending an airbnb message. We're happy to provide any and all assistance when you need us and are happy to answer any questions prior to bookings!

neighborhood_overview: Located in West Loop, this furnished rental invites you to explore the edges of downtown Chicago. From endless dining and bar options to art galleries and stylish shops, West Loop has emerged with so much to offer daily. During weekends, residents savor trips to the Chicago French Market and the vibrant strip of Randolph Street. The latter is known as “Restaurant Row” and is lined with some of the city’s best eateries. Fulton Market, one of the hippest and fastest-growing neighborhoods, is ideal for dinner and drinks. Union Station is only a 5 to 10 minute walk away.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Perfect 1BR in Lincoln Park - Steps to DePaul!
summary: This charming garden unit in Lincoln Park is ideally situated for any type of traveler! There are plenty of parks, dining, nightlife, and shops nearby. The main DePaul campus is just a quick walk away as well, perfect for families coming to visit their students or tour the school! You can easily take the 'El' train downtown to see all of Chicago's iconic sights. After a long day out and about in the city, come back to this cozy gem on a quiet, tree-lined street and unwind.
space: Upon entering the unit, you are met with a warm and inviting living area, complete with full-sized sleeper sofa and TV with Roku. On one wall is the kitchenette, down the hall is the full-sized bathroom with stand-up shower, and on the other end of the hall is the bedroom with a queen-sized bed. I want to ensure everyone who stays at my place feels like they are at home and can settle right in, so I provide the following amenities free of charge to all my guests!   - High speed wireless internet is always available - TV with Roku device - Fresh towels and linens which are professionally laundered in between guests. - Kitchen appliances including a microwave, coffee pot with a reusable filter, tea kettle, and toaster   - I provide artisanal coffee from a local roaster and a variety of gourmet teas. - Hair dryer - Ironing board and Iron - Luggage racks and hangers - My place is FULLY STOCKED with all the amenities of home like eco friendly shampoo, conditioner, and body wash, paper towel

neighborhood_overview: In Lincoln Park, Chicago's motto urbs in horto—or "City in a Garden"—truly comes to life. Historic churches and handsome brick row houses nestled within landmark districts sit next to peaceful parks, while quiet, tree-lined residential areas give way to bustling business corridors.
notes: There is only a kitchenette, not a full-sized kitchen.
house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty. 3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance. 4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.
host_about:
I'm a native Chicago gal and wouldn't have it any other way! I love to enjoy Lake
Michigan with my family in the summer and explore Chicago's amazing food scene year round.
Can't live without: LaColombe coffee, Sweet Mandy B's cupcakes and my Uber app.
Visitors to Chicago shouldn't miss: Pequods Pizza, the water taxi or architecture boat tour, a drink at the Langham Hotel or some beach time at the Lake!

neighborhood_overview: Just north of downtown Chicago, and nestled against the Lake Michigan shoreline, is the Gold Coast. As the name would imply, the area is one of the country's most affluent neighborhoods. With streets that are lined with historic mansions and specialty boutiques, the Gold Coast is an intensely popular area for residents and visitors. Branching off of The Magnificent Mile is Oak Street, an upscale shopper's dream. The retail revelry includes internationally recognized stores, swanky boutiques and rare, designer fashions.  A day of shopping becomes a night of revelry on the neighborhood's fabled Rush Street. Amongst the prestigious hotels and celebrated eateries, you will find a trove of booming nightlife hot spots and high-energy events. Treat yourself to the Gold Coast, you deserve it.
notes: A sofa bed for extra person.
transit: Taxis are always driving around,busses, uber,lift, Red line CTA train station few blocks away too. UBER: This is a personal-driver service that is approx 20% cheaper than a taxi. It's an easy-to-download app where you can enter the pick-up address and a driver will pick you up in 10 mins or less.

name: Bright, modern, & secure in East Rogers Park
summary: Brightly lit and secure, 1 bedroom, 1 bath apartment in the heart of East Rogers Park.  Modern decor meets vintage charm in this recently renovated space.  The perfect place to call your home during your stay on the north side of Chicago.  Check out the beautiful beaches just a few blocks away, Loyola University, some of the many restaurants and bars nearby.  Near train and bus routes as well as Sheridan Rd. and Lake Shore Drive.  I live nearby and can easily be reached.
space: Rules:  No parties, no smoking, or any other illegal activities.  The building is secure and neighbors are vigilant.  They will inform myself and authorities if they suspect anything.

Just a short walk from Loyola University, Target, Starbucks, Giordano's, 7-11 and plenty of other great local restaurants. Rogers Park Social is also a notable bar nearby that offers a great drink menu and a chance to mingle with the locals.

name: Warm, Spacious, Industrial West Loop Loft
summary: Welcome to Chicago's West Loop! And welcome to my loft. Here you'll stay in high ceilings, adjustable lighting, spacious bedrooms with a professional culinary kitchen. This loft is perfect for city adventurers, bean admirers, Bull/Bears tailgaters and those who enjoy the warmth of a city condo. Did I mention the rooftop with a direct line of site to the willis tower...and a private patio :)! Enjoy the stay, its my pleasure to host you.

neighborhood_overview: Walking distance to Chicago's greektown, west loop coridor, river north neighorhoods! 5 min drive to the United Center and Michigan avenue! 10 min drive to Wicker Park and Wrigleyvill where the cubs play. There are several top restaurants,grocery stores and local shops all within walking distance. Honestly I find it hard to leave sometimes :)Art museums are also all in close proximity. summary: Comfortable, spacious, relaxing well lit.

description: Comfortable, spacious, relaxing well lit. This comfortable bedroom has an adjoining bathroom The common areas that quest can use and access are, dining room, living room, kithchen, breakfast nook, basement not including bathroom, laundry room in basement, backyard and front yard and porch. This is a quiet neighborhood. On street parking. Close proximitry to a few neighborhood restaurants, stores, night club and churches. Within about 4 blocks walking there is public transportation that takes you into the heart of downtown Chicago along scenic Lake Shore Drive, with sites of the historic neighborhoods, Lake Michigan, boat house, La Rabida Children's Hospital, museums, Soldier Field, McCormick Place and museum campus, Buckingham Fountain and Grant Park.

host_about:
My wife and I are empty nesters, and believe that true Love and Romance can happen, young  or old, if you just believe and let it flow. 

We also enjoy a little traveling and meeting new people in our travels or meeting them while hosting at our airbnb.  Two places that we really enjoyed together are Savannah and Colorado Springs. 

My wife loves to crochet, sew and knit and is a fiber artist, mainly using yarns.  She has showcased her goods at several events over the years and is very talented.  I hold fifth degree Black belt in Afrikan martial art of Asa Ki-niun and Master level in Filipino martial art of Tacosa Escrima. 
My total martial arts experience being over 30 years.

We also love watching old martial arts movies, live plays, live blues,  gardening and just hanging out at home.

summary: This is a beautifully updated three-bedroom, two bathroom apartment in the heart of Wicker Park. One bedroom is a master suite with its own private bathroom. neighborhood_overview: We’re located on the north side of Chicago in Wicker Park, one of Chicago’s trendiest and safest neighborhoods. Our neighborhood is a wonderful mix of bustling streets packed with local restaurants and shops, as well as quiet tree-lined streets full of historic buildings. We’re also minutes away from many of Chicago’s most popular spots.
notes: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS 1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?” Excellent public transit directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. Our building is just a short walk from the Damen “L” train station. Search for “Damen blue line station” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest. 2. “Is there parking nearby?” We have a parking spot behind the building that you can reserve separately through a service called SpotHero. We'll send you info on how to reserve it when you confirm your reservation. 3. When is check-in/check-out? Check-in is 3pm or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30am to drop off your bags in the living room (just note that our staff will have your room ready by 3pm). Check-out is at 11am. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11am, but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up by 2:30pm at the la
transit: Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber. ￫ The Damen Blue Line 'L' train station is a 3-minute walk away. ￫ O'Hare is 40 minutes away via public transit and 25-40 minutes away via Uber. ￫ Midway is 65 minutes away via public transit and 25-40minutes away via Uber.
interaction: WHY STAY WITH TROVE? ⭐ Fast Communication We’re always on call to answer your questions, typically within 30 minutes. ⭐ Experienced Hosts We’ve hosted thousands of guests over five years. ⭐ Exclusive Perks Trove Guests have access to the Metropolitan Club, located in the Willis Tower. ⭐ Central Location You’ll never be far from local spots to check out, sights to see, and public transit.
house_rules: 1) Only the reservation holder and guests added to the reservation via Airbnb may stay overnight.   2) As a courtesy to your neighbors, please keep noise to a minimum, especially between 9 pm - 9 am. 3) This is a non-smoking apartment. If smoke is detected, a cleaning fee of $150 will be charged. 4) No late check-outs. Check-out is at 11 am.  In order to compensate our cleaning assistants for lost time, additional charges will be sent if they're unable to begin their job at 11 am. One hour or less - $25 Each additional hour - $40 5) Damaged/stained/missing towels, bedding, and/or furnishings will incur additional fees. The per-item fees are as follows: Bedsheet- $12 Towel - $12 Pillow - $30 Pillowcase: $10 Comforter - $50 Clothes hangers - $3 Furnishings - Dependant on item

name: Beautiful Luxury Loft in Fulton Market, Sleeps 12
summary: Newly renovated designer 2,500 square foot brick-and-timber loft with 15 foot ceilings located in the heart of the vibrant West Loop neighborhood. This huge 2 bedroom / 2 bath apartment is perfect for groups looking for a stylish city escape surrounded by Chicago's best dining and nightlife. The central location is an ideal base for everything you want to see in Chicago!
space: Located on the 2nd floor of a historic 1920’s building overlooking Fulton Market. Once inside, you’re greeted by a huge open living space with soaring windows, polished concrete floors, and exposed brick-and-timber details. The upscale furnishings and designer touches are sure to create an unforgettable stay. The kitchen and living room are open and great for entertaining. The fully equipped kitchen is stocked with all the tools you need to stay in and cook a great meal. We have a 6 person dining table and a kitchen island with 4 counter stools -- plenty of room for all guests. In the living room, you’ll find comfortable furniture to lounge on and a smart TV with Roku.  Our beds have crisp linens and the bathrooms are stocked with fresh towels and bath products. We also provide essentials like a hair dryer, clothes iron, etc. and you have full access to the in-unit washer and dryer.  Sleeping arrangements include: Bedroom 1: Two queen beds Bedroom 2: Two full-over-queen bunk bed sets L
description: Newly renovated designer 2,500 square foot brick-and-timber loft with 15 foot ceilings located in the heart of the vibrant West Loop neighborhood. This huge 2 bedroom / 2 bath apartment is perfect for groups looking for a stylish city escape surrounded by Chicago's best dining and nightlife. The central location is an ideal base for everything you want to see in Chicago! Located on the 2nd floor of a historic 1920’s building overlooking Fulton Market. Once inside, you’re greeted by a huge open living space with soaring windows, polished concrete floors, and exposed brick-and-timber details. The upscale furnishings and designer touches are sure to create an unforgettable stay. The kitchen and living room are open and great for entertaining. The fully equipped kitchen is stocked with all the tools you need to stay in and cook a great meal. We have a 6 person dining table and a kitchen island with 4 counter stools -- plenty of room for all guests. In the living room, you’ll find comfortab
neighborhood_overview: You’re in the center of Fulton Market in the West Loop -- a lively neighborhood that is home to many of Chicago’s finest restaurants, coffee shops, breweries, cocktail bars, and outdoor patios. This former warehouse district has transformed in recent years and is now a favorite of locals and visitors alike. Within a 5 minute walk outside your door, you’ll find dozens of hangout spots and places to explore for all ages and budgets. You’re truly in the heart of one of Chicago’s coolest neighborhoods!
transit: Our place is very central for exploring all of Chicago -- less than 1 mile from the Loop and River North, and a 10-15 minute trip to other areas like the Magnificent Mile, Wicker Park, Lincoln Park, Old Town, Gold Coast, and McCormick Place.  You’re a 1 min walk from the Morgan train stop (Green/Pink Line) and a 10 min walk from the Grand train stop (Blue Line), allowing you to quickly access all areas of the city and O’Hare/Midway Airports. Uber and Lyft is also available 24/7. You’ll have no trouble getting around without a car. Parking: We do not have parking in our building, but there are very convenient options nearby. The nearest parking garage is the 1K Fulton Parking garage at 1029 W. Carroll Ave, one block from from the apartment. For 24 hours of parking, rates are $26 on the weekend and $50 during the week. We also recommend two parking apps/websites that allow you to book discounted parking in garages and neighborhood parking lots. You can typically find overnight parking fo
interaction: We are always available to give recommendations and promptly address questions during your stay.
house_rules: 1.No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable and subject to a $250 fine. 2.Please ensure that you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty. 3.Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance. 4.Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid. 6.Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $150 per key fee.
host_about: Discover Chicago with a stay at one of our distinctive neighborhood properties. Staywell's concierge team is dedicated to ensuring that you have an exceptional and memorable experience. We love hosting guests and are available for questions about the city and anything else you might need during your stay!

name: Vintage Suite, Modern Comfort by Park/Sox/Transit
summary: Huge newly-renovated bedroom in an 1890 workman's house.  This quiet neighborhood is a respite from city buzz, but only 20 min from the Loop. Your room features two comfy beds, a large dressing area, a seating area to get work done or share a meal, plus your own fridge & microwave. You can use the main kitchen for more serious cooking.  Free parking! Get downtown in 4 stops on the L or one of 5 nearby buses.  Drop bags early or leave them late, no worries.  LGBT friendly.  Se habla español.
space: This is a mother-in-law suite- it’s not fully independent because we share a bathroom, but your space is separated enough from the rest of the house to have real privacy. Two friendly cats would love to play with you.  If cats aren’t your thing, closing the door to the stairs will keep them out of your space.  Traveling with small children? Let me know and I’ll make room for the pack and play.

neighborhood_overview: We are walking distance to 2 grocery stores, Target, CVS, CTA orange line, 5 bus lines, a coffee shop, several restaurants, funky thrift stores, and one of the largest parks in Chicago.  McKinley Park is a quiet, tree-lined  neighborhood with a lot of young families.  It was the first planned manufacturing district in the US, and has some pretty cool historical buildings if you're into architecture.  We're also 10 min from the White Sox stadium.  The park itself is worth a visit.  Besides playground equipment, running trails, soccer fields, and a fish pond, it has a free Olympic-size pool in summer and an ice rink in winter.
notes: You will walk through the laundry area to get to your room.  The sink there is an active work area, not intended for guest use. Things are clean, but you may see tools, paint brushes drying, etc.  An old house takes elbow grease!
transit: The best way to get downtown is by public transit (CTA) or bicycle.  The nearest train stop is the 35th/Archer Orange Line, which goes to/from Midway Airport and the Loop.   The nearest bus stop is at the end of the block.   Divvy bike sharing is available, with the nearest station 3 blocks away.  If you choose to drive,  street parking is available near the house.  Please understand that anywhere in Chicago, a parking spot within 2-3 blocks of your destination is a good spot. Driving or Lyft/Uber may make sense for certain tourist attractions like the Museum of Science and Industry in Hyde Park, but is  not recommended for destinations downtown.
access: Kitchen and bathroom are shared spaces
interaction: I love company and I love to show off my adopted hometown!  I sometimes work from home and need to focus my attention on the job, but I can always make time for a quick question. Feel free to contact me by phone/text/app for needs or recommendations at anytime during your stay.  If I’m not working, let’s talk.
house_rules: Treat this house like you are staying with friends: Clean up after yourself Be quiet when people are sleeping Don’t invite extra people over without consulting your host Ask if you don’t know how something works  Etc No smoking whatsoever on the property. Bringing kids?  Please let us know so we can childproof outlets, etc.  Small pets are welcome with pre-approval prior to booking.  Showing up with an unannounced pet will void your booking.
host_about: I'm a professional classical musician, small business owner, and frequent traveler for work and for fun. I love exploring and figuring out how each new place works, so bring it on!

summary: We know the difficulties of deciding where to eat and what to do in one of the world’s most happening cities. But with the posh comfort and convenience of the Staypineapple in central Chicago, choosing where to stay will be easy.  An amenity fee with tax ($17.61 per day) will be charged upon arrival.
space: The rooms feature a blend of contemporary design with original elegant details and modern furnishings. Large windows allow scenic views of the city, while duvet beds with luxury towels and robes provide maximum comfort. All units include high speed Wi-Fi and complimentary Kuerig coffee and tea. Staypineapple is conveniently located within steps to many of Chicago’s top attractions including Millennium Park, the Art Institute of Chicago, and the Magnificent Mile. The Theater District is also just minutes away, and with hundreds of options for world-renown bars and restaurants, you’ll have no trouble finding a great place to hang before and after the show. name: Spacious Wrigleyville 1 BR with Back Deck
summary: Your space will be just a block south of Wrigley Field! You'll have your own bedroom and bathroom with access to the living room, kitchen, back deck, and the yard. Great place to stay after a Cubs game or just to explore the city!
space: My space is a one-bedroom apartment in the heart of Wrigleyville, close to all the action! The bedroom has a full size bed for two and a closet with hangers. I have a guestbook and an information card with recommendations for restaurants and nightlife in the neighborhood. The living room has a couch for a third person and two comfy chairs and a large tv with surround sound. The tv has Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu, Spotify, Pandora, and Chromecast. Wifi is available throughout the apartment. There's a (Hidden by Airbnb) Home and an Amazon Echo for use for music. Feel free to use the air conditioner if it gets hot. A smaller living room down the hall has plenty of floor space for storage or a fourth person if they bring an air mattress. Blanket and pillows will be provided. Feel free to make use of my kitchen and fridge. I have a full set of plates, silverware, pots & pans, etc. A coffee machine is available for use. I ask that you clean up whatever items you use. Adjacent to the kitchen

neighborhood_overview: My space is a block south of Wrigley Field which is known the world over for the 2016 World Series Champions Chicago Cubs. There's many bars and restaurants within walking distance in the neighborhood, known as Wrigleyville. The Southport Corridor is a few blocks west which has a lot of great restaurants and brewpubs. Belmont Ave. is a couple blocks south which has a thriving theater scene and the Vic Theater and Schubas for live music. In short, Lakeview has everything you're looking for to experience Chicago. If there's anything you're looking for in particular, don't hesitate to contact me for recommendations!
transit: My space is a 5 minute walk to the Addison Red Line which will get you downtown in 20 minutes as well as the 22 bus at Clark & Roscoe. It's a 10 minute walk to the Belmont Red/Brown/Purple line as well. Street parking is usually not too difficult except during Cubs games. You can park in my neighborhood from 6pm-6am if you use a guest parking pass. I'll have a booklet of these passes you can use which you can fill out (date and time) and then place on your car's dashboard. There's also the Divvy biking service if you're the adventurous biking type, or uber/lyft/taxi.
access: You'll have access to the entire apartment, the back deck, and the yard.
interaction: I won't be staying at my place while you are here, but I'll be available via text or the airbnb app to answer any questions you have about my place and the neighborhood.
host_about: Cleveland -> Chicago. Avid explorer, lover of local history, music, and adventures.

summary: If looking for a home base for a stay in Chicago this will be great for you. It's not in a touristy neighborhood, but it's very close to downtown(2.5 miles to loop). McDs, Wendys, and Subway on the corner. UberX cost to go to places is about $7-10 each way. UberPOOL is less. Bus: $2.25. Medical District.
space: MB2: This is a 3 bedroom and 2 bathroom apartment. All rooms are subject to Airbnb. 2 bedrooms are standard Chicago size with closets, and they share a bathroom that is located near the kitchen. The middle room is a master bedroom, and it has it's own bathroom inside (This listing is  for this master bedroom).  All guests are welcome to use the kitchen and living room mindfully. Be mindful of your own cleanliness in the common areas as this is something I am unable to control on an hourly basis or daily basis. You will have to do and put away your dishes.

neighborhood_overview: The Near West Side , one of the 77 community areas of Chicago, is on the West Side, west of the Chicago River and adjacent to the Loop and West Loop. The history of the Near West Side of Chicago includes the founding of Hull House, a prominent settlement house. The Great Chicago Fire started in the Near West Side. The area is home to the University of Illinois at Chicago (UIC), the United Center and the Illinois Medical not a very walkable neighborhood, but bigger streets such as Madison and Western are more interesting to walk through but only after 1 mile you will hit the posh neighborhoods. Listing is on Western and Madison intersection.
transit: My listings are very close to public transportation. The bus stop is right on the intersection and my house is 5th from a major intersection with 2 buses.  The way chicago works is that each bus goes in a straight line. Madison bus goes to downtown, loop, Sears (Willis) tower and Millennium Park, and Western bus goes to different neighborhoods such as Bucktown and Wicker Park and Medical District.  Blue line is about 8 minute walk, and also goes to downtown, loop and the airport.  Also if you get Uber and use UberPool, its only about $2.50-3$ to get around which is not that much different sometimes from public transportation prices ($2.25).
access: You are able to use the kitchen and living room. There is a laundry room with a washer and a dryer that is free. It is located through the back door and through the back stairs on the first floor near the garage. If you are staying for a longer than a few weeks, I could appreciate if you bought your own detergent. Petes Market has small sizes.
interaction: I am available to help most of the time and I tend to respond quickly if I am not in a mid flight. I do enjoy privacy and alone time.
house_rules: Please do not wear shoes in the house.  Please do or put in dishwasher and put away own dishes.  Please keep house doors locked.  Note that I like to keep house temperature at about 23C/73F at all seasons.  If you like 18C/65F in the summertime with the A/C, we will probably fight.  Only booked guests are allowed on the property unless you’ve agreed with me otherwise. Thank you!!:)
host_about:
I love to travel, so I am home very little. Hopefully it stays this way:)
I am originally from Lithuania, but moved to the states in 1998. I usually keep to myself and mind my own business in the apartment. 

Thanks for reading:)

name: Heart of Lakeview - 2 bedrooms
summary: Guests stay in two adjacent spacious bedrooms, each with a double bed. There is a 52-inch HDMI-ready TV screen in bedroom 1. You can power it with your laptop. A shared bath is adjacent to the bedrooms. Bedroom 1 has a balcony and a private entrance. Street parking is available on our block and we will provide you with parking permits at no charge.
space: Our home is on a quiet tree-lined street in Chicago's Lakeview neighborhood where you will find dozens of restaurants within a short walk, offering food from many lands. The area is popular among young adults with its numerous comedy and other clubs as well as theaters and cinema. The Briar Street theater, home of Blue Man Group, is a 5-minute walk from our front door.

neighborhood_overview: Wide variety of restaurants (Swedish-American, Italian, Korean, Mexican, Middle Eastern, etc.) 1 block from Briar Street Theater (Blue Man Group), 8 minute jog to lakefront park with 20 miles of running and biking trails.
transit: The CTA Rapid Transit ('El') station is less than 4 minutes walk away and it gets you to the center of town in about 15 minutes. There are also three major bus routes that pass within 2 blocks of our front door. If you prefer a ride-hailing service, the neighborhood is crawling with Ubers and Lyfts.
access: Guests are welcome to use the washer and drier as well as the kitchen, which is shared with other guests and with the hosts (when we are in town).
host_about: I am a pediatrician in my 70s, as is my wife. We are both retired recently and often travel together.  None of our adult sons live in Chicago now. We both enjoy physical activity, cooking, going to (and in her case, writing) plays. We speak a few languages between us, although not too well. I work in Xi'an China a few weeks each year, teaching in a  NICU there. (My Mandarin is still pretty rudimentary.) We generally prefer interesting and unusual things to expensive things. Hence, airbnb,

house_rules: No shoes in the house. No dirty dishes, please. Light cooking only - no oily, splashy, smoky, smelly, or fried cooking. guest agrees to clean up cooking area right after use.
host_about:
Hi! I am a friendly and easy-going host. My background is in graphic design,  interior design, and computer programming. My goal is make sure you enjoy the stay as much as i can. We are courteous, well-organized, responsive to your requests, and clean.  

Originally from Thailand but have lived in Chicago for over 20 years. In my free time, i enjoy gardening, biking, hiking, and exploring new restaurants. It is always my pleasure to recommend my local-favorite spots that are not in travel guide books, or to provide info on transportations, shopping, etc.  

I travel often. I usually pick up new tips from other airbnb hosts to enhance my guest experiences. I greatly appreciate your support. You may expect that i will go extra miles to ensure that you enjoy your stay.

name: BR4: Serene Priv Room; Heart of Wrigley/Boystown
summary: **Common spaces professionally-cleaned twice/week** **April/May - big weekly and monthly discounts!** Clean, professionally-run airbnb apartment with 4 private rooms. House is at the back of the property and features 3 floors. It's a modern design with natural lighting and an open kitchen / living room. Prime location with easy access to Wrigley, theaters, restaurants/bars, as well as lots of public transportation options.
space: NEW!  1GB wifi mesh network for great connectivity throughout apt plus Roku TV. APARTMENT This is a PRIVATE ROOM rental in a professionally-run airbnb house. There are 4 bedrooms in total across the 3-stories. Each space is fully dedicated to our guests. Our cleaning team will have everything ready to go for you, and we provide lots of amenities to make your stay comfortable. Please see below for more info!   YOUR BEDROOM 10' x 10' Features queen bed, closet, reading chair, and two nightstands.  Located in above-ground carpeted basement with good natural light. Linens and 2 towels / 2 face cloths included. All bedroom doors lock from inside but can not be locked from outside (the same is true of all bedrooms). KITCHEN:  11' x 10'. Located on 1st floor. Renovated kitchen with stainless steel appliances. Includes cookware, dining ware, coffee pot. SHARED with guests in 3 other rooms. Each guest has labeled cabinets and shelves for easy personal storage. We provide coffee, filters, powder
description: **Common spaces professionally-cleaned twice/week** **April/May - big weekly and monthly discounts!** Clean, professionally-run airbnb apartment with 4 private rooms. House is at the back of the property and features 3 floors. It's a modern design with natural lighting and an open kitchen / living room. Prime location with easy access to Wrigley, theaters, restaurants/bars, as well as lots of public transportation options. NEW!  1GB wifi mesh network for great connectivity throughout apt plus Roku TV. APARTMENT This is a PRIVATE ROOM rental in a professionally-run airbnb house. There are 4 bedrooms in total across the 3-stories. Each space is fully dedicated to our guests. Our cleaning team will have everything ready to go for you, and we provide lots of amenities to make your stay comfortable. Please see below for more info!   YOUR BEDROOM 10' x 10' Features queen bed, closet, reading chair, and two nightstands.  Located in above-ground carpeted basement with good natural light. Linen
neighborhood_overview: The Lakeview neighborhood and Wrigleyville / Boystown areas have so much within walking distance, you won't want to leave! There are numerous bakeries, boutique stores, theaters, and lively bars and restaurants. If you do feel like venturing out of the neighborhood, Lakeview is very centrally located. Head south to visit Lincoln Park, River North, and the Loop, or west to visit Buck Town or Logan square. Both public transit and Uber/Lyft are great ways to get around.
notes: GUESTS Only those on the reservation are permitted in the unit/room. BEDROOM LOCKS All 4 bedrooms may be locked from the inside but do not have keys to be locked from the outside (Website hidden by Airbnb) COURTESY  Please note this unit is on a quiet residential street. We respect our neighbors, and for that reason the building's outdoor space is not for socializing, and instead we request guests socialize indoors only. We request quiet hours from 9pm-8am. CLEANING  We expect guests to clean up after themselves in shared spaces. For example, throw away any trash, rinse coffee maker after use, wipe down bathroom sink/kitchen counter after use, etc. We also request that personal bathroom items are kept in your bedroom when not in use. This keeps the shared spaces clean for all guests.
transit: PARKING Free, public street parking is available in the area. Some streets require a permit, and others do not. We offer permits at the unit for a small fee. Please note you may have to circle the block a few times to find a spot. If you prefer paid parking with a designated spot, I recommend using Spot-Hero to find nearby options that work for you. Once you're here, public transportation and/or Uber are the easiest ways to get around the city. CLOSEST STOPS o Addison red train: .3 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o Belmont purple/brown train stop: .6 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o 77, 8, 36 bus and more to go up/downtown or east/west Stations all have machines that sell Ventra passes (name of provider). You can also purchase Ventra cards at Walgreens. You can either purchase a single ride ticket, a re-loadable Ventra card, or an unlimited pass (1, 3, or 7 days). Multiple people may share a re-loadable card and fares will be deducted for each person; however, the unlimited passes can not
access: In addition to your PRIVATE ROOM, you have use of the kitchen, living room,  bathroom, and front building's basement laundry room (all SHARED spaces). KEYS  There is self-entry with key pad anytime from 4pm on. There are no keys. CENTRAL HEAT/AC The unit has central heat/AC with a thermostat within the unit. The temperature is kept between 65-70 degrees for the comfort of all guests. LAUNDRY The building has a washer and dryer in the basement that's shared by all apartments. Each costs $1.50 and accepts quarters. PUBLIC TRANSIT The closet train stop is the Addison red line. There are also many bus stops. We provide additional info about public transit upon booking. PARKING Free, public street parking is available in the area. Some streets require a permit, and others do not. We offer permits at the unit for a small fee. Please note you may have to circle the block a few times to find a spot. If you prefer paid parking with a designated spot, we can offer additional guidance upon bookin
interaction: My goal is to ensure you have the most enjoyable and comfortable stay in Chicago. I have a detailed guest guidebook (emailed in advance and printed in unit) that includes info about the apt, neighborhood, and city to help maximize your time in the city. If you'd like additional assistance with anything, I'm more than happy to help! Depending on my work travel schedule, I may or may not be in town; however, I'm always accessible via phone or email for any questions that arise.
house_rules: REQUESTS:  1) Please treat the home with respect.  There is a $250 fee for smoking, and the reservation will be terminated at your expense. 2) Please be courteous of others in building and neighbors. All socializing must be kept indoors after 9pm, and we request quiet time indoors from 9pm-8am.  3) The only guests allowed in the building are those on the reservation.   4) Personal bathroom items must be kept in your room. If you use common spaces, we request you tidy up after yourself to keep the spaces clean for everyone (for example, kitchen items in dishwasher, wipe counters, throw out trash, etc).   CHECK IN/OUT: Standard check-in time is 4pm (or later). Standard check-out time is by 10am. If unit is not vacated by check-out time or notes are not followed, additional cleaning charges may apply.   For check out, I ask that you:   - turn off lights in your room/common spaces   - ensure your used kitchen items are in dishwasher  - dispose of any of your food/drink from fridge and any
host_about:
I began using Airbnb as a traveler in the fall of 2013, and I'm hooked! Staying in someone's home allows you to experience the area in a truly authentic way - no more hotels for me! As of May 2014, I began hosting in Chicago and have since hosted thousands of guests from around the world. I love helping others make the most of their visits. 

As a host, I am personable, responsive, and detail-oriented. I take great pride in the comfort and cleanliness of each apartment. You can trust that when staying in any one of our properties, you will feel at home.

summary: A fully furnished home for your longer stay, complete with WiFi and everything you need to live. AFFORDABLE MONTHLY RATES ARE AVAILABLE!!! MARCH - $ APRIL - $ Welcome to Chicago! We're located 15 minutes from downtown Chicago, located in Uptown neighborhood, near to food, super market and a couple of blocks from the CTA Red Line train.
space: Our apartment is specially designed for your comfort with all the amenities you would need during your stay along with one free parking spot located in outdoor parking pad! Perfect for a business trip, mini getaway, family vacation to relax and feel at home! -The entire apartment is for your own use. -It is located on the third floor. There are other apartments in the building -One outdoor Parking spot is included in your stay.  -Professional designed space with modern furniture. -Flat Screen TV in the living room  -Brand new stainless steel appliances in the kitchen, including Fridge, Microwave, & Stove/Oven Range, Dishwasher, Coffee maker and Toaster. -3 Bedrooms available! Bedrooms have large King/Queen size beds. Sleeps up to 6 people comfortably! -Bed linens are cleaned after each stay by professional cleaning services Master Bedroom - King bed with Master Bathroom Guest Bedroom - King Bed 2nd Guest Bedroom - Queen Bed, this bedroom is located across the hallway and offers privacy

There are other apartments in the building -One outdoor Parking spot is included in your stay.  -Professional designed space with modern furniture. -Flat Screen TV in the living room  -Brand new stainless steel appliances in the kitchen, including Fridge, Microwave, & Stove/Oven Range, Dishwasher, Coffee maker and Toaster.
neighborhood_overview: Located in Uptown Neighborhood in Chicago- easily accessible by the CTA Red line Train (2 blocks walk to Lawrence subway station) and one block walk to Lawrence and Kenmore bus stop. Uptown offers a unique blend of history and ethnic diversity. The Green Mill is a classic Jazz club that used to be a hangout spot for Al Capone, it is still popular to this day. This entertainment district is anchored by the Aragon Ballroom and Riviera Theatre which are bustling with shows through the weekend.  Argyle is one block away. If you believe in eating where the locals eat, Argyle is most certainly the place to go; this is authentic cooking, with no tourist traps to be found. Vietnamese restaurants and bakeries are the most plentiful, with various disciplines of Chinese food a respectable second, and Thai restaurants. There are even Ethiopian, Lebanese, Indian cuisine options.
notes: -CTA Red Line Train nearby, you may hear the train from the unit. -All guests need to be attentive to the house rules during their stay, as they are other tenants at the property. -Guest should be mindful to not run or walk hard in the apartment to not disturb tenants below. -Neighbors have called and will call the police for any guests who do any illegal activities, including smoking Marijuana on the premise. -All guest need to be attentive with the house rules during their stay as there are other tenants at the property. -Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay -Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request. -We have duvet covers on our bedding  (no top sheets). -Security Deposit maybe required on the following bookings: 1) Last minute bookings 2) Short weekend stays 3) Large groups  4) Guests with no reviews 5) Guests with incomplete profile 6) Instant Booki
transit: The train station is located 2 blocks away and the location is next to Lake Shore Drive There is one outdoor parking pad spot for you to use during your stay as well if you have a car. You can use Uber / Lyft to travel around the city.
access: -It will be self check in. -We have in-unit laundry. You may use it at your convenience.  Detergent is not provided by host.
interaction: We are available by phone throughout your stay. You can simply call or text if you have any questions. Please note that there maybe delayed response times during after hours between 10pm-8am.
house_rules: HOUSE RULES Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking: -No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250). -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. - The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am. -Lost key fee - $300 -Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc. -Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc. -Smoking - $300 -Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300 **-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat,  an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.
host_about: Sonia & Syed are Chicago Natives. We can give you recommendations for food and fun! Mother to my beautiful baby Sofia

summary: PLEASE READ house rules, additional rules & listing in its ENTIRETY so you will know all rules, what's shared, what is & isn't included, and what to expect without being shocked & dismayed. Also, please have a clear photo of yourself, no photo = cancelled/no booking.  Private room is spotless & full of positive energies, as is my entire condo unit. space: It is extremely clean and very peaceful. Downstairs neighbors can be a little loud due to cute little children running around - But nothing overly excessive in loudness.  It's hardwood floors and not so thick walls - So the normal TV sounds and conversations you can slightly hear. It currently has queen sized mattress that is very comfortable. neighborhood_overview: South Shore is a up and coming neighborhood that is becoming very diverse. I live directly behind the lovely Lake Michigan, rainbow beach, and the South Shore lakefront.  There is so much to do that is near, all in walking distance: If you are a golfer, am located near the South Shore Cultural Center where there is a lush green, full golf course that is also a part of Jackson Park golf course. That is only a 5 minute drive or a 10 to 15 minute walk. There is also a gated basketball court and tennis court that is behind my condo that is only a 2 to 5 minute walk which is also where the beautiful lakefront and rainbow beach is located - There is a racquetball area as well. Plenty of walk,  jog and bike path as well in the same area. I do not mind walking around with you to show you around if I am available to.
transit: There are plenty of buses on the main Street directly behind my condo building. 1 bus, the #6 South Shore bus, literally takes you to the beautiful downtown Chicago and back within 45 minutes.  Taking the #26 express bus, which only runs on a certain schedule, will take you to downtown Chicago and back in only 25 minutes.  If you are driving, it only takes 20 minutes to get to downtown Chicago and back. I am also near the Indiana borderline; So if you wanted to drive to the casino in Hammond, Indiana. It would only be a 15 to 25 minute drive. Driving to and from O'Hare airport is 45 minutes.  On public transportation it is 1HR & 45 minutes
house_rules: Shoes must be taken off upon entering unit, and kindly clean behind yourself. No food or beverages of any kind allowed in any areas except kitchen. My home is a music lovers home, so you may enjoy your music as you wish in the room. No excessive loud noise or vulgar language please and thank you; My home is a very clean, positive, peaceful and spiritual household.  Treat it as you would want someone to take care of your own home. Do not ramble, if anything is needed please don't hesitate to ask host or co-host. Photo I.D./Passport will be scanned by host of 1st time guest. No firearms allowed except by law enforcement personnel, active military or armed security guard with valid perc and/or foid. Please let host or co-host know of any firearms prior to booking. I am former military and government law enforcement, so safety of all is a priority.
host_about:
Good day, my name is Mr Phillips. I am a Command Master Chief, Persian Gulf war veteran and semiretired government law enforcement agent from the United States Department of Homeland Security.

I love reading and expanding my knowledge. I love a multitude of animé, comics and music. I am a gigantic music lover that loves listening to music from abroad and have a very extensive & multicultural music library. I definitely love to wrestle and have an overall good sparring match no matter how big, young, old or experienced my opponent is.

I am the type of person who thinks beyond outside the box. My thinking and mindset is on a whole other level, astral plane and dimension, so you can be laid back, comfortable and overall be yourself in my home without being in fear of being looked @ differently nor judged for being not "Normal" by other's standards. 

I'm not weird or normal, I am unique and magical unicorn wizard that poops rainbows, Lol. So yea, I believe you will feel comfortable in my home when I am present.

I am a very overprotective father and friend when it comes to the people I love and care deeply about. I'm a bit of a antisocial introvert, but strike up a conversation that interests my medulla oblongata and I can converse for hours. 

As you can tell, I love to be detailed and thorough and give as much information as possible instead of the usual "Bits & pieces" that people do nowadays.

I am extremely clean & organised. I can be a bit strict and rough around the edges, but I'm overall loyal, loving, kind hearted and a overall true person.

P.S. I love cats, Lol.

name: Huge Victorian near Loyola, Lake #2
space: GUEST ROOM #2 Hey there!  We have available THREE BEDROOMS and a  2-BEDROOM APARTMENT on the third floor of our home.  Follow these links to our other listings: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/979841 https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/979942 https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/983640 Please message us before making your reservation, thanks!  ¡HABLAMOS ESPANOL! We (Lois & Eduardo, and our puppy, Leo Messi) live in a beautiful old Victorian in Chicago's Rogers Park neighborhood. Wood floors, lots of natural light, and a full double living room, family room & updated kitchen are all at your disposal. We are on a 1 1/2 lot, so we have a nice side yard adjacent to the house, a big back patio with a basketball hoop, and a large wooden deck w a lovely pergola. description: GUEST ROOM #2 Hey there!  We have available THREE BEDROOMS and a  2-BEDROOM APARTMENT on the third floor of our home.  Follow these links to our other listings: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/979841 https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/979942 https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/983640 Please message us before making your reservation, thanks!  ¡HABLAMOS ESPANOL! We (Lois & Eduardo, and our puppy, Leo Messi) live in a beautiful old Victorian in Chicago's Rogers Park neighborhood. Wood floors, lots of natural light, and a full double living room, family room & updated kitchen are all at your disposal. We are on a 1 1/2 lot, so we have a nice side yard adjacent to the house, a big back patio with a basketball hoop, and a large wooden deck w a lovely pergola. We're hosts by nature and would love to share our home! Our cute labradoodle puppy (Leo) will be sure to greet you and we guarantee you'll love your stay with us! My office (Eduardo’s) is in the home and I can help with anything you might need, or stay
house_rules: ** Please don't smoke indoors or feed the dog. ** Please leave things the way you found them, especially in the kitchen     and bathrooms, out of respect for others. ** Please do not keep food in your bedroom.  You are welcome to store food items in the kitchen. ** Keep your bedroom door closed, for the sake of everyone's privacy. ** Lock house front door whenever you are coming and going.
host_about:
Hi there!  We're Lois and Eduardo! She's from Kansas, I'm from Argentina, we met in Spain, and now we live in Chicago!  (¡Hablamos español, por supuesto!)  We've been Chicagoans for over 35 years, love the city, and love our home. Our kids Evan and Gina, our kids-in-law Lindsey and Mark, and our gorgeous grandkids, Enzo and Uma, are around often, and our Labradoodle, Leo, is a sweetie. (He is hypo-allergenic, doesn't shed, and loves people.)

You will note that our kitchen is the focal point of our daily lives, both for conversation and for enjoying Eduardo's delicious, Italian-inspired home cooking.  You might say that our philosophy of life is to work hard, play hard, and enjoy the people around us all the time. One of our favorite things has always been to host our diverse friends and family in our home - sometimes for a day, sometimes for a year.  Now, with AirBnB, we're making it official!  We're happy to say our home feels like an urban oasis and we look forward to hosting you!

Downtown Chicago is one of the fastest growing neighborhoods in the city. You’ll find a wide variety of restaurants and pubs that will satisfy even the pickiest palette. Choose from upscale comfort food, boutique beers, four-star dining, Italian sophistication, or reliable American, served in venues that range from refined to bustling.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is situated in the most dynamic and convenient place to live in Chicago, The Loop. With its endless shopping, fine dining, stunning park, river and lake views, and entertainment opportunities, everything is possible at a moment’s notice. The area is a cultural getaway for professionals and students, who can combine work with pleasure. Discover landmark buildings like the Willis Tower and The Art Institute of Chicago. Millenium Park, near Lake Michigan, is always worth a visit. The Loop is within reach of accessible transportation, offering non-stop public transit, buses, and taxis. Union Station is approximately a 10 minute train ride.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $300 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

Cancellations:: Full refund for cancellations made within 48 hours of booking, if Check-in date is at least 14 days away. 50% refund for cancellations made at least 7 days before Check-in. *No refunds for cancellations made within 7 days of Check-in*  4. Check-in:: any time after 4 PM.  Check-out:: any time before 11 AM.  *If an earlier Check-in or later Check-out time is desired, please send a request. We can only confirm 24 hours in advance. transit: Parking: •	Street parking is free and not too difficult before 8pm.  •	If it is after 8pm you may end up parking 2 blocks away. We would recommend trying to park on Ellis Ave north of Hyde Park Blvd. It is a little bit of a walk but it is free.  •	Please pay attention to street signs especially those taped to trees. If you don’t see anyone else parking on the street it’s a good indication that you should not either. host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.
