neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the heart of Boystown (the gay district) and is half a mile from Wrigley Field. Great location for going out in Boystown or Wrigleyville. Located at the corner of Roscoe & Halsted.
notes: Caveat: As it is at the corner of Roscoe & Halsted, with windows on both it can be loud at night. Bars in Boystown are open until 2am Sun-Fri and 3am on Sat. Boystown is usually quiet in the mornings and afternoons so sleeping in isn't a problem. Cat Allergy Notice: There are two short haired kittens do live here.
transit: Parking: 1 day parking permit for each day of the stay to park on the resident streets will be provided. As with most of Chicago, parking is easier during the day. Halsted & Clark are metered. There are parking garages in the area; rates vary greatly. access: Guests will have access to the full apartment and patio, excluding closets.
interaction: We will not be staying at the apartment during the weekend, but we may  stop by to check on things.  If we will stop by we will do our best to notify you ahead of time and respect your privacy and space. On some weekends we will be in Chicago if there are any complications and will be available. On others will will let you know we are out of town and trusted family or friends will be able to assist.
house_rules: Smoking: Permitted on back porch only; $250 penalty for smoking anything inside. The kitchen (dishes, silverware, appliances) are all free to use. Please do clean up after yourself. You are welcome to any of the pop/soda in the fridge or bar. Unless discussed & agreed to before hand, booked Guests should not have more than 2 other people in the home/patio for more than an hour or so; ie no parties. Any guest additional guest staying over than the number booked  must be approved. Quiet Hours 1:30am-10:00am Guest should be mindful of noise & not disturb neighbors.  This is a fairly noisy area, so it takes an abnormal amount of noise to cause a problem. Towels should be hung up when not in use so to not get moldy.

name: Charming Vintage Apt in the heart of Logan Square
summary: Charming 2 bedrooms apt in the heart of  Logan Square (located right between California and Western train stations).  This cozy place can accommodate 4 people, is baby and pet friendly; and is ideally located: 10 minutes walking from vibrant nightlife of California or Wicker Park, and 1 block away from historic Bucktown. It is the perfect place to enjoy a week-end among friends during Chicago festivals or for a week-long discovery trip for adventurous travelers. Supermarket is 1 block away.
space: The apartment is the entire basement floor of a typical Chicago Family Home. Located in a quiet street of Logan Square, the apartment is totally independent from the rest of the house, with its own entrance. Please note that there is no TV and no AC in the unit.  Also, the house is old - and we are living upstairs with our 2 young kids. Be aware that you might hear us walking around the house.

neighborhood_overview: From "Time Out": Boasting gorgeous boulevards and a constantly expanding selection of restaurants and bars, Logan Square is one of the city's trendiest neighborhoods, balancing family-friendly amenities with a thriving nightlife. Walk along Milwaukee Avenue and you'll find cocktail bars and gastropubs as well as dive bars and late night eateries, all packed with young crowds watching local bands or playing vintage arcade games. The variety of diversions present in Logan Square attracts record lovers, musicians, pinball wizards and dining aficionados to this scenic section of Chicago
transit: You're 1 block away from Milwaukee avenue,  the Western and the California blue line CTA train station. (Direct commute to O'Hare airport and the Loop).
access: Guests have access to: - The home laundry room, with washing machine and dryers. - The front yard of the house where they can gather, sit and enjoy some fresh air during summer. - The home car parking - Can fit a SUV - but not a pickup truck.
interaction: Guests should feel independent, and can come and go as they want. We live in the upper floors of the house, and stay fully available for guests to answer any question they may have, or assist them with tips and advice on best restaurants, places to visits and things to do during their stay in Chicago
host_about:
Hello, we are Charles & Sarah. We are a French couple living in Chicago since september 2013. We are please to welcome you in our place!! We speak French, Spanish and English so do not hesitate to contact us..
A cozy place to stay in the heart of Logan square.

name: Huge Bedroom with pvt marble bath
space: Italian style beautiful  apartment filled with art (paintings and sculptures) in Chicago Uptown. The room is part of a stunning 2 bedrooms 2 baths apartment, includes a very large master bedroom with huge walking closet and marble baths with double vanity and jacuzzi tub and a big guest bedroom with private marble bathroom with tub. Exceptionally big full kitchen with french doors to patio and large living room with fireplace. Washer and dryer in the unit.     Walking distance (3 blocks) to redline subway trains take you straight to downtown or the North portion of Chicago and Evanston.     The eclectic neighborhood has all you need within walking distance, including coffee shops (Starbucks), artisan bakeries, and food reflecting the area (African, Vietnamese, Pizza, Chinese, Japanese as well as upscale nouvelle cuisine, e.g., Magnolia Caffe). Shopping areas and a big Target and gym (World Gym) are minutes away.      The uptown entertainment district since Al Capone era, including

summary: Take an indulgent soak in the statement round bathtub, then dress up for a night watching a local band or take it easy and spin some records. This upscale home features four private decks with incredible views and high-end hardwood and marble floors.
space: *Newly renovated and modern *Large open floor plan with beautiful hardwood and marble floors *Brand new, modern kitchen with professional-grade appliances and breakfast bar *Huge master suite with Stearns & Foster king-sized bed and en-suite bathroom with double vanities, water closet, soaking tub and spa shower, and sliding doors opening to second floor private deck *Main level guest bedroom with Westin Heavenly queen-sized bed and sliding door to back patio, which is furnished and has a gas grill  *In unit front loading washer and dryer, available for guest use *Loft space functions as third bedroom with queen-sized bed *Living room features 52" 4K flat screen tv and large windows and doors opening on to private front deck *Private rooftop deck, outdoor HD TV, gas grill, refrigerator, nugget ice maker and wet bar *Two additional air mattresses can accommodate up to four additional guests **You won’t find any other listings with this many PRIVATE OUTDOOR SPACES!

neighborhood_overview: The sought-after neighborhood is within a 10-minute walk of incredible restaurants, cafes, clothing boutiques, killer taco joints, bars, and live music venues. The Blue Line train is a five-minute walk away and a ride share bike station is nearby.
notes: *Small dogs (under 12 pounds) may be considered on a case-by-case basis. *No parties unless pre-approved by host. (Parties may require a deposit.) *dogs live on this property
transit: *On foot: you can walk to pretty much anything you would need: grocery store, pharmacy, hundreds of restaurants, liquor stores, coffee houses (Starbucks and locals), bars, music venues, you name it. *Train: The Division St Blue Line stop is a 5 min walk down the street. This will take you pretty much anywhere you need to go in the city. It's also the line that takes you directly to/from the airport. (Download one of the many CTA apps for easy train schedules.) *Bus: There are busses all around. Division street bus is about 2 blocks away and the closest major intersection, Ashland and Division (2 artery streets in the city) has tons of busses that will link to all parts of the city and even parts of the suburbs. That intersection is a 5 min walk. (Download one of the many CTA apps for easy bus schedules.) *Car: If you're driving, the 90/94 Expressway is a 3 minute drive, the 290 expressway is a 7 min drive and the 55 is about 15 minutes away. *Ride share: Uber and Lyft rides are less th

interaction: *Guests will be able to reach hosts via text, phone or email throughout their stay.  *Hosts will remotely check guests in and out.

Bucktown Chic II is a brand new modern masterpiece w/ loads up upgrades including a huge shower,  heated bath floors, fireplace, high end appliances, private washer/dryer, 3 enormous BR's, 2.1 baths, private balcony &  garage parking.  Steps from brand new Midtown Athletic Club and endless shopping.

neighborhood_overview: Bucktown Chic II is right on the edge of Bucktown, less than 1/3 mile from Logan Square and steps from Lincoln Park. Getting around Chicago's neighborhoods couldn't be any easier. When heading west, you exit at Damen Avenue and the property is two blocks away and when heading east, you exit at Fullerton. This property also sits at a very vibrant intersection of Damen, Elston and Fullerton. Midtown Athletic Club's brand new state of the art fitness center and hotel is a block away. If you're looking for entertainment, dining and shopping - you can look no further. You can walk to Bucktown's infamous Damen Avenue or Lincoln Park's Clybourn Avenue corridor. You are two blocks from Target, Fresh Thyme grocery store, TJ Max, Marshall's, Jewel Osco and so much more.
notes: Please note that this property is completely private. We do have a property manager who has installed cameras at the front of the building and in the stairwells on the outside of the apartment. This service is to prevent guests from having parties and making reservations that are falsely represented. Please note that we charge a fee of $35/person initially. If you make a reservation for less people that are actually staying, we will require a $50 per person fee. If you have a party, we will immediately cancel the reservation, mandate that you leave the property immediately with no refund and a loss of security deposit.
transit: Street parking is very easy and free. Guests also have access to one attached garage parking space.
access: You will have access to the entire apartment, this is NOT a shared apartment. You will also have access to private balcony's.
interaction: I'm available 24/7 and  I'm available as much or as little as you need. Gaining access is easy as you'll receive a private access code with very simple access instructions.
house_rules: - Quiet Hours are Monday - Thursday, 11:00 PM - 7:00 AM - Quiet Hours are Friday and Saturday, 12:00 AM - 7:00 AM - Absolutely no house parties - Additional Guests must be accounted for and additional fees apply if you didn't book with the correct amount of guest staying  - Absolutely no smoking inside the apartment
host_about: Work Hard Play Hard- Enjoy life!

neighborhood_overview: The Rogers Park neighborhood holds another distinction: it is considered one of the most diverse in Chicago. As a home to people from all over the world, there is no single dominant ethnicity but rather its residents speak nearly 40 different languages and hail from over 80 countries. This rich tapestry has a dynamic edge to it and as a community, there has been a visible effort to work together to revitalize public spaces and support local businesses.
notes: This is a residential building so we do ask that you respect the privacy and noise level so as not to disturb our residents. We offer daily, weekly and monthly rentals. If you need the space for an extended period, we can work within your budget.
transit: Red Line 'L' The Red Line provides 24-hour train service between Howard on the North Side and 95th/Dan Ryan on the South Side via subway through downtown Chicago, with some weekday rush-period service between Howard and Ashland/63rd (also via subway through downtown).  The Red Line is a 15 min walk from Beach House Chicago.
access: The entire apartment is available to guest of Beach House Chicago, as well as, the large outdoor area.  Since the unit is on the first floor, it's convenient for anyone with issues getting up stairs.
interaction: We want to be sure your stay is exceptional. We are available by phone/text any time should you need anything or have questions.

name: Bright and Cozy Apt in Irving Park / Albany Park!
summary: Sunny, cozy 2-bedroom apartment located in Irving Park/Albany Park. Comfortably furnished and conveniently located, close to many ethnic restaurants and popular brewpubs on the north side of Chicago. Explore the nearby neighborhoods or hop on a bus, L train or Uber to Wrigley Field, Logan Square, Lincoln Square, downtown and the lakefront. Easy access to both the Blue and Brown lines via Kimball bus, 1/2 block away.  Pet friendly, and pet care can be provided for an additional fee.
space: The apartment has been recently renovated with attention to preserving its lovely vintage details. Fully furnished with everything you need for a comfortable stay. Living room features a sleeper sofa, cozy electric fireplace, and chess and checker game table. Bedrooms have Beautyrest luxury mattresses, EcoTech certified organic sheets and comforters with linen duvets. Kitchen is fully equipped and features a coffee/tea bar that is also stocked with some snack items. There is also a nice selection of games and coloring books for both adults and the little ones! Apartment is located on the 1st floor, and also has a small furnished outdoor deck space.

neighborhood_overview: Apartment is located on a quiet, tree lined street, in Irving Park. There are many great ethnic restaurants in nearby Albany Park and many popular brewpubs in the area. It is also close to North Park University and Northeastern University. It is two blocks from Arun’s Thai Restaurant, a destination for fine Thai dining. Cermak Produce grocery store is within walking distance, along with Surge Coffee & Billiards and seasonally, Miko’s Italian Ice is two block away. The apartment is very centrally located to many other northside Chicago neighborhoods, including Logan Square, Lincoln Square, Ravenswood, Wrigleyville, Roscoe Village and a quick bus ride to Montrose Beach and the lakefront. The Blue and Brown L lines are easily accessed by the Kimball or Irving Park bus, and can take you downtown or to O’hare Airport.
notes: Quiet, well-behaved pets are welcome.
transit: Street parking is available, but gets tight late in the evening. Uber and Lyft rides are plentiful as are Grubhub food deliveries. The Kimball bus stops right at the corner will take you to the Blue and Brown L train lines. The Irving Park and Montrose bus lines are a short walk.
access: Apartment is located on the 1st floor of quiet, 4-unit building. Lockbox access available. Host lives on premises.
interaction: Host lives on premises and is available via text, phone or email.
house_rules: Quiet, well behaved pets are welcome. Additional $50 cleaning fee.

name: Dog-Friendly Urban Escape in Downtown Chicago
summary: Wake up to views of the Chicago skyline and Lake Michigan from the balcony of this 28th floor Grand Plaza suite. The light-filled apartment boasts colorful accents, including a funky blue Vitrola record player. There's access to a shared pool, gym, and business center. Our pool is outdoor and is open seasonally from Memorial Day to Labor Day (weather permitting). You must be 25 or older to book this space. Parking is not included in the cost of your stay. There is parking in the garage on the bottom floor but guests are responsible for the cost. A parking pass will need to be purchased.
space: Wake up to views of the Chicago skyline and Lake Michigan at this two-bedroom 28th floor Grand Plaza suite, a perfectly located urban escape with a private balcony and incredible building amenities that include a swimming pool, a fitness center, a game room, a grilling area, and a running track. You'll find this polished, single-level suite at the Grand Plaza, a refined high-rise residence four blocks from the Chicago River in the River North neighborhood. Spend your days cruising the river on an architectural boat tour, wandering three blocks east to shop the elegant boutiques on Michigan Avenue's Magnificent Mile, attending business meetings in The Loop five blocks south, and picnicking in Millennium Park one mile southeast. Whether you're visiting the Windy City for business or pleasure, you'll find everything you need here at the intersection of State Street and Grand Avenue. Come home from an afternoon Cubs game to relax in the central AC, toss your jersey in the private washer/dr

house_rules: - The responsible renter must be at least 25 years of age to book. Guests under 25 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian for the duration of the reservation. - 2 dog(s) are welcome in this home. No other animals are allowed without specific Vacasa approval. - The property shall not be used by more than the number of adults and children listed in your reservation. - All guests shall abide by Vacasa’s good neighbor policy and shall not engage in illegal activity. Quiet hours are from 10 p.m. to 8 a.m. - If early check-in is available for your reservation, you will be notified by 9am on the morning of your arrival by email. Late check-out is offered whenever possible for a small fee. - No smoking of any kind is permitted anywhere on the premises. - No commercial photography or filming is permitted on the property. Tents or other structures may not be erected. - Renter is liable for any damage to the property and agrees to accept charges to the card on file should damage occur
host_about: Hi, we’re Vacasa, North America’s largest vacation rental management company. Owners of vacation homes around the world trust us to deliver exceptional service throughout your entire vacation. Professional housekeepers clean and stock each home, and our customer care team is available around the clock—with a local property manager ready to show up and help out. We like to think we offer the best of both worlds: you can enjoy a one-of-a-kind vacation experience in a unique property, without compromising on service and convenience. Check out our listings, and get in touch if you have any questions. Your vacation is our full-time job, and we'd love to help you plan your perfect getaway.

name: Spacious, Cozy 5BR/2BA Near Metra & Jackson Park
summary: Cozy and spacious 5 BR/2BR Victorian home, perfect for a getaway with a large group.  Great location close to Hyde Park, Jackson Park, and the Museum of Science and Industry.   Steps away from a Metra line, providing quick access to downtown Chicago and Millennium Park.
space: This beautiful three-story house is the perfect accommodation for your travel group.  The home will comfortably sleep 12. The  five large bedrooms are furnished with queen sized beds and the first floor den offers a full size futon.  There are two full bathrooms, each stocked with towels.  The kitchen is fully equipped with stainless steel appliances and all of the dishes you need to prepare your meals.   The formal living room seats six and the additional eating space between the kitchen and back patio seats four. There is a cozy family room with plenty of seating and a widescreen tv to watch cable and stream movies.  The additional den includes a desk and futon and can be turned into a playroom or workspace.  You also have access to a full, fenced-in back yard with a patio.

summary: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this pretty The Loop furnished studio apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and bright living room with great high floor views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Chicago has to offer! (#CHI240)
space: Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your lovely living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this The Loop apartment has to offer.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry. neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is situated in the most dynamic and convenient place to live in Chicago, The Loop. With its endless shopping, fine dining, stunning park, river and lake views, and entertainment opportunities, everything is possible at a moment’s notice. The area is a cultural getaway for professionals and students, who can combine work with pleasure. Discover landmark buildings like the Willis Tower and The Art Institute of Chicago. Millenium Park, near Lake Michigan, is always worth a visit. The Loop is within reach of accessible transportation, offering non-stop public transit, buses, and taxis. Union Station is approximately a 10 minute train ride.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $325 monthly fe

host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in South Loop. A dynamic neighborhood with a unique mix of attractions, shopping and history. Take a stroll along South Michigan Avenue and the nearby Prairie Avenue district to see "Millionaire's Row", an area lined with mansions belonging to Chicago's wealthiest elite. For shopping, visit the Roosevelt Collection, an open-air plaza, home to a cinema as well as premium local and national retailers. Along the southern edge, you will find Soldier Field, the Chicago Bears football stadium. Don’t miss the Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum and Grant Park, all adjacent to one another and huge attractions in South Loop.

host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

It hosts some of the best cocktail bars alongside your classic dive bars, with diners and restaurants to please the pickiest foodies. Neighborhood: Zill***, Airbnb, and natives call this Logan Square.  Goog*** maps and transplants to the area call this Avondale.
notes: I ask that guests please take off their shoes to preserve its hardwood floors and rugs. Pets must be potty trained, be at least 1 year old, and not disturb neighbors.  This is a tobacco-free property.  Thank you for understanding!

name: Godfrey Hotel Lifestyle Rooftop 4.5*-KingExecutive
summary: Striking, Cubist-style façade makes a statement in Chicago’s vibrant River North district. The rooftop lounge is one of the city’s best and operates year round (covered portion). Note: we do not charge any cleaning fees, however we do charge a $13 urban fee daily (plus taxes). This fee is not included into the price you paid to Airbnb and will be due upon check out. Description of this fee is available on hotel website. Must be at least 21 years old and have valid id and credit card to check-in.
space: Classy rooms are done up in a neutral palette with jewel tone accents. Adults-only rooftop lounge is definitely a highlight – done up in all white, facing south for views over the most spectacular part of Chicago’s skyline. Design details include shimmering water features, a video wall, retractable roof and a fire pit. Your room will include: Free WiFi Flat-screen TV Wet bar Luxe linens and bathrobe L’Occitane bath amenities Coffeemaker Hairdryer In-room safe The space offers: Rooftop bar (indoor/outdoor) Brunch room 24/7 fitness room SpaValet and self-parking (extra)

name: North Side Chicago Home Entire Guest Suite
summary: Entire PRIVATE Guest Suite of a Home, separate PRIVATE entrance, 2 PRIVATE LARGE Bedrooms, 1 PRIVATE Full Bathroom.  The PRIVATE Guest Suite is partially built sub-grade and partially built above-grade.  The SHARED level has 1 Shared Full Bath, Shared Kitchen&Living Room, Shared Patio & Yard.    Parking available for an optional $5 per night per vehicle.  This is the NorthSide of Chicago, close to Wrigley Field, a quick ride to Downtown Chicago, & close to Evanston & the  University's.
space: The home is still being upgraded and some of the walls are dry-walled but not painted.  We will continue to upgrade the property so you may see some unfinished areas during your stay.  Our goal is to be able to provide a clean, trustworthy, and safe space for a value.  We like to  keep our rates low so that guests can travel to Chicago and experience this amazing city.    In this listing you will have 2 LARGE PRIVATE bedrooms.  In the pictures you will see 3 beds.  Beds will have linens for every 2 guests in the reservation.  If you have 2 guests, you will have one bed with linens.  If you have 3 or 4 guests, you will have 2 beds with linens.  If you want more beds to have linens, you must let us know, there is an additional charge for the extra bed linens of $15 per set.  You will have a PRIVATE full bathroom for yourselves. summary: If you like a unique vibe, good energy, cool experience, eat or learn how to make Sushi or European food, wine, smoothies, fun activities, and tours or just relax in the front of the tv our home is for you! Historical cozy apartment with good energy and charm.  Free breakfast and a historical tour of Pullman. Property professionally managed by Ran Fridman - Airbnb Superhost with more than 15 years of experience in the Hospitality Industry worldwide.
space: This listing is for one bunk bed inside of  shared room with other 3 guests. You will be sharing bathroom, dining area & kitchen, we have downstairs TV and relaxation room with working space, books, Netflix, Amazon Prime, Youtube, games, laundry  and more for public use + FREE parking. All our locks digital so you would not need keys.  If you can spend a little extra you can get a private room or an apartment to yourself with private bathroom, please check other Fridman properties listings. name: Modern, Cozy 2BR Getaway in heart of Wicker Park
summary: **We acknowledge that building has low water pressure. We take very good care of this apartment and believe our prices are quite fair for what we provide!** Steps away from everything the trendy Wicker Park neighborhood has to offer, but tucked away on a cozy side street, this apartment can't be beat!  A perfect space for a long stay or weekend getaway! *Expand for more info*
space: The unit features 10 ft ceilings and has all the comforts of home. We provide all the towels, linens, toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, body wash, lotion, etc.) and coffee/tea to get you going in the morning! TV has Netflix and Amazon Prime for you to enjoy! LIVING ROOM: 11’ x 11’ featuring non-pull out sectional couch, television, coffee table, full length mirror and reading chair. KITCHEN: Full Kitchen, Table & 4 Chairs, Paper towels, sponge, dish soap, dishwasher detergent, trash bags, coffee, sugar, creamer, cookware/dining ware, and kitchen towels are provided.   BEDROOM 1:  7' 9' featuring Double Bed. Linens, pillows, and blanket are provided.  Hooks on wall to hang clothes and hangers provided.  BEDROOM 2: 7’ X 7’ Featuring Bunk Beds. Linens, pillows, and blankets are provided.   BATHROOM:  7’ x 6’ Featuring full shower with shower stall, vanity & toilet.  Shampoo, conditioner, body wash, hand soap, trash bags, bath towels, hair dryer, and bath mat are provided...
description: **We acknowledge that building has low water pressure. We take very good care of this apartment and believe our prices are quite fair for what we provide!** Steps away from everything the trendy Wicker Park neighborhood has to offer, but tucked away on a cozy side street, this apartment can't be beat!  A perfect space for a long stay or weekend getaway! *Expand for more info* The unit features 10 ft ceilings and has all the comforts of home. We provide all the towels, linens, toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, body wash, lotion, etc.) and coffee/tea to get you going in the morning! TV has Netflix and Amazon Prime for you to enjoy! LIVING ROOM: 11’ x 11’ featuring non-pull out sectional couch, television, coffee table, full length mirror and reading chair. KITCHEN: Full Kitchen, Table & 4 Chairs, Paper towels, sponge, dish soap, dishwasher detergent, trash bags, coffee, sugar, creamer, cookware/dining ware, and kitchen towels are provided.   BEDROOM 1:  7' 9' featuring Double Bed. Linens
neighborhood_overview: You will be a few blocks from the hottest restaurants, bars and clubs in Chicago.  Wicker Park is, simply put, one of the best neighborhoods in the city. Think Brooklyn, Austen, or Madison.  Michelin star restaurants like Schwa co-exist with some of the world's best dive bars.  The nightlife in the summertime is can't miss.
notes: CHECK-IN Check-in is self-entry at 4pm or later. Luggage storage may be available from 10:30am on if arranged in advance. PARKING Please note that the free parking is street parking, so you will need to look for a spot once you arrive. The free street parking is first-come, first-served and distance from unit cannot be guaranteed.  For parking closest to the property, there are daily sticker parking passes available for a nominal convenience fee.  COURTESY Please note this unit is on a quiet residential street. We respect our neighbors and keep quiet hours from 10pm-8am. Therefore, if your group is looking for more of a party environment, please allow us to recommend another unit that would be better suited for that noise level. CHECK-OUT  Check-out is by 10am.  If you check out late or do not follow the check-out steps, you may be charged an additional cleaning fee. Luggage storage may be available from 10am-4pm on departure day if arranged in advance. - Dirty linens can be left as is
transit: You'll be about 2 blocks from the Division Blue line, which will take you to "The Loop" in about 5 minutes.  You are a short walk to a wide range of restaurants and bars.
access: ENTRY A custom keypad code is provided for your stay. HEAT/AC The unit has central heat/AC for your convenience with a thermostat within the unit. CRIB Pack-and-play crib may be rented for $5/day with 2+ day advance arrangements. Please mention this during booking, and it will be inside unit waiting for you. Note that you must supply your own sheets and blankets for the crib.
interaction: Our team is available to answer your questions and make your stay pleasant. We are just a phone call away.
host_about:
I began using Airbnb as a traveler in the fall of 2013, and I'm hooked! Staying in someone's home allows you to experience the area in a truly authentic way - no more hotels for me! As of May 2014, I began hosting in Chicago and have since hosted thousands of guests from around the world. I love helping others make the most of their visits. 

As a host, I am personable, responsive, and detail-oriented. I take great pride in the comfort and cleanliness of each apartment. You can trust that when staying in any one of our properties, you will feel at home.

name: 3 BR - 2.5 BA Brick & Timber Loft with Roof Deck
summary: Our unique three-bedroom in Lakeview has expansive common areas and cozy bedrooms that make it a delight for groups or families traveling together.  The massive patio provides even more area for socializing, and it's easily accessible to everything that Lakeview offers. Our place is a short 20 minutes to the Loop. We hope you'll love it - book today!
space: You walk up a private set of stairs with an open entrance to the living, dining, and kitchen space. The entire condo has 20 ft timber ceilings and exposed ductwork. You'll love our comfortable couch and vintage dining set! Just past the living and dining room are the floor-to-ceiling sliding glass doors to the patio. Opposite that is the galley kitchen, and beyond the kitchen is a hallway that leads to the bedrooms. Total square footage of living space is 1,975 sqft with a 1,000 sqft deck.

This apartment is perfect for groups who want to get away from the hustle and bustle of downtown while still having quick and convenient access to everything Chicago has to offer. The apartment is walking distance to the shops, restaurants and bars in the neighborhood. Guests can also easily explore the Roscoe Village and Lincoln Park neighborhoods.  In general, Chicagoans are super nice, talkative, and helpful. Chicago is home, and you’ll feel always like one of our own. Lakeview is the perfect location in Chicago. So enjoy!
transit: 5 minute walk from the nearest bus stop then to the subway that will take you all over the city (downtown and Wrigley). host_about:
Valentino, a chef, and John, a marketing professional, live and work between Chicago and Watseka, IL. Most of the time we are in Chicago, which means our lovely, restored 1868 Victorian Italianate home sits empty and alone in Watseka. 

Valentino moved to the US from MIlan, Italy, in 2019, which is why some of the reviews in his profile are in Italian and reference MIlan. His partner, John, is from Watseka and has spent the last 15 years restoring this home back to the way it looked when it was built in 1868.

neighborhood_overview: As Chicago's official downtown area, the Loop is one of the most important central business districts on the globe. In addition to its dynamic architecture and buzzing atmosphere, the area has an incredible concentration of cultural institutions, urban park spaces, award-winning restaurants and a shopper's paradise on State Street. Famous for its striking architecture, the Loop vaunts signature buildings by Ludwig Mies van der Rohe and Louis Henri Sullivan, as well as Aqua by modern day prodigy Jeanne Gang. The area hangout, Millennium Park, complements its surrounding with stunning architectural marvels of its own. The park's crown jewels include a Frank Gehry-designed amphitheater and Cloud Gate, the landmark "Bean" that's become an iconic symbol of Chicago. Nearby Maggie Daley Park and the Chicago Riverwalk are two new engaging outdoor spaces that embrace design — and fun!
notes: You are in the heart of downtown and right next to the train! Although our windows are as soundproof as possible, please be aware that you may notice the normal sounds of city life.   There is parking for one car in our underground parking garage. If you have more than one car, please know that parking is limited around the area. We recommend walking, taking the train or traveling via Uber/Lyft or taxi. If you absolutely need more parking, you can try using one of the many parking spot apps such as SpotHero.  Please provide an accurate guest count prior to booking. Rates vary throughout the week and season and by number of guests. It's important that your guest count is accurate so we can be sure the home is adequately prepared and stocked for your stay.
transit: Getting around is easy when you're near everything! Since you're nearby all amenities, you can walk to anything you may need. The Clark/Lake train stop is just a 2 min walk away. This will lead you anywhere in the city. The highway is also nearby if you are driving. Otherwise, there are plenty of Uber/Lyfts and taxis in this area.
access: Guests have access to the entire unit, it is not shared with anyone else.
interaction: We are off site but available when needed. The best way to reach us is by messaging us through the app!

IF AN UPDATE TO THE GROUP COUNT IS NEEDED AFTER CONFIRMING THE RESERVATION, THE RESERVATION COST MAY INCREASE. - Quiet hours between 10pm - 7am - Smoking Penalty: $500 + damages - Pet Penalty: $500 + damages
host_about:
Hi, Thanks for taking a look at our special homes.

My name is Noah. A few years ago, my family and I got together to create an amazing experience for tourists and guests like you.

We are Chicagoans who love sharing our city with the world and strive to make your stay as comfortable as possible so you can enjoy the city like a local. 

We're passionate about travel. As experienced travelers, we've learned what creates a top notch experience and we're committed to sharing that experience with you. It's something we call "Sweet Home Chicago" and we hope you carry it back with you to where ever you call home! :)

You can find us hanging by the lake, catching a game at Wrigley, grabbing a drink in Wicker Park, enjoying the many concerts going on on any given night, or at any of the amazing local coffee shops across the city.

neighborhood_overview: Cheap eats and bike-friendly streets. Gourmet coffee, scruffy dive bars and artisanal cocktail lounges. Some may say it's a recipe for a hipster haven but there's a proud, working-class sensibility that keeps this Northwest Side neighborhood grounded. In Logan Square, the strong neighborly connection is evident all around, from active preservation groups to community gardens and a locally-run farmers market. "Local" being the key word when describing many aspects of the scene: ingredients are sourced locally at their buzz-worthy restaurants; corner taps tout local, craft brews; galleries showcase local artists; and concerts and street fests promote local, upstart bands.
notes: Please provide an accurate guest count prior to booking. Rates vary throughout the week and season and by number of guests. It's important that your guest count is accurate so we can be sure the home is adequately prepared and stocked for your stay. Parking is included in the back for 1 car, please use it if needed! Other than our free parking spot, parking is limited around the area. We recommend walking, taking the train or traveling via Uber/Lyft or taxi. If you absolutely need more parking, you can try using one of the many parking spot apps such as SpotHero. Lastly, please be respectful of all neighbors, you are in a quiet residential neighborhood.
transit: You are a 7-10 min walk from the California Blue Line Train stop giving you access to downtown and O'Hare. If you are driving, Highway 90/94E is a quick 5 min drive as well. Otherwise, we recommend taking an Uber/Lyft to get around as they are plenty roaming around!

Included with your membership: ✔ Upscale co-working space, dining, and bars ✔ Stunning views of Chicago and Lake Michigan ✔ Discounted express tickets to the Willis Tower Skydeck Metropolitan Club Hours: Monday–Friday: 7am – 10pm Saturday: 5pm – 10pm Sunday: Closed HAVE A
neighborhood_overview: We’re located on the north side of Chicago in Lincoln Park, one of Chicago’s trendiest and safest neighborhoods. Our neighborhood is a wonderful mix of bustling streets packed with local restaurants and shops, as well as quiet tree-lined streets full of historic buildings. We’re also minutes away from many of Chicago’s most popular spots.
notes: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS 1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?” Excellent public transit directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. Our apartment is a 10-minute walk from the Fullerton “L” train station. Search for “Fullerton red line station” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest. 2. “Is there parking nearby?” We recommend using an app called SpotHero to reserve a nearby paid parking spot. We love SpotHero because it allows you to reserve a parking spot in advance so that you don’t have to worry about finding one the day you arrive. 3. When is check-in/check-out? Check-in is 3pm or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30am to drop off your bags in the living room (just note that our staff will have your room ready by 3pm). Check-out is at 11am. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11am, but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the
transit: Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber. ￫ The Fullerton Red Line 'L' train station is a 10-minute walk away. ￫ O'Hare is 60 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber. ￫ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.
interaction: WHY STAY WITH TROVE? ⭐ Fast Communication We’re always on call to answer your questions, typically within 30 minutes. ⭐ Experienced Hosts We’ve hosted thousands of guests over five years. ⭐ Exclusive Perks Trove Guests have access to the Metropolitan Club, located in the Willis Tower. ⭐ Easy Self-Check-In Keyless access means no keys for you manage during your stay! ⭐ Central Location You’ll never be far from local spots to check out, sights to see, and public transit.
house_rules: 1) Only the reservation holder and guests added to the reservation via Airbnb may stay overnight.   2) As a courtesy to your neighbors, please keep noise to a minimum, especially between 9 pm - 9 am. 3) This is a non-smoking apartment. If smoke is detected, a cleaning fee of $150 will be charged. 4) No late check-outs. Check-out is at 11 am.  In order to compensate our cleaning assistants for lost time, additional charges will be sent if they're unable to begin their job at 11 am. One hour or less - $25 Each additional hour - $40 5) Damaged/stained/missing towels, bedding, and/or furnishings will incur additional fees. neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park is famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails or an affinity for coffee, plus want to sift through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area to sip and shop in the country. The area has become a prevailing influence on Chicago's Michelin-rated, James Beard Award-winning dining scene, boasting some of the city's most sought after tables. Wicker Park and Bucktown are also known for their palate pleasing nightcaps, like renowned brewery Piece and mixology tour de force The Violet Hour. Along North, Division, Milwaukee and Damen Avenues, you will find an unbelievable blend of vintage shops amid independently-owned boutiques touting fashions for both men and women, and luxury home goods and beauty products. On the same blocks are nationally-recognized names in fashion, and a mix of major retail chains that have also set up sh
notes: Unfortunately, the apartment is not handicap accessible.
transit: The apartment is located just 0.4 mile from the Blue Line Damen Station (connecting to O’Hare airport) which travels through much of the city. The “9” Ashland Street Bus Stop is one block away - running north and south. Additionally, six blocks away is the Kennedy Expressway Division Street Exit. It is only three miles to downtown Chicago (10 minute Uber ride).

I’m always looking for another adventure...

name: Logan Square Nook - 2BR just steps from Blue  Line
summary: Please read the DISCLAIMER below before booking. Located in the heart of the historic and trendy Logan Square neighborhood, this newly renovated garden unit is the perfect place to stay while visiting Chicago.  This apartment is a three minute walk to the Logan Square Blue Line and steps away from some of the areas most popular bars, restaurants, coffee shops, and theaters (Hopewell Brewery, The Walk-In, Lost Lake, Fat Rice, Intelligentsia Coffee, Logan Square Theater).
space: DISCLAIMER:  This apartment is a garden unit which means two things:  1) it can run on the cooler side since it's partially below ground level so packing a sweatshirt never hurts (space heaters also available in the apartment) and  2) it has lower ceilings.  I am 6'3 (190.5cm) and can stand up fine in the kitchen, living area, and bathroom but I do need to duck going into the bedrooms.  Please take these into consideration when booking the apartment. This apartment comes equipped with everything you need for your stay in Chicago.  The kitchen has all of your basic cooking utensils and spices/olive oil if you choose to pick up groceries at The Dill Pickle (1.5 blocks away) and cook a meal.  For the those who rely on caffeine in the morning, there is a coffee & tea bar complete with options for pour-over, French press, or traditional drip coffee.  The living area has a 50in flat screen TV with a Roku, a pull-out couch, and a desk complete with monitor (VGA hook-up only - not a computer),

neighborhood_overview: This building is nestled on a quiet, tree-lined street in the heart of Logan Square with a three minute walk to the Logan Square Blue Line stop (Spaulding Ave entrance). Enjoy this premium location which is only 1.5 blocks from Milwaukee Ave and some of the areas best bars, restaurants, coffee shops, and grocery stores (Harding Tavern, Hopewell Brewery, Dill Pickle Grocery Store, Fat Rice, Lost Lake).
transit: Train: Only a three minute walk to the Logan Square Blue Line (Spaulding Ave entrance), you can access much of the city via Chicago's train systems called 'the L'.   Driving: If you are driving into Chicago, the streets will vary with free parking, paid parking, and permit parking.  Unfortunately there is no parking included with the apartment so please be aware of the options when visiting. Walking: Logan Square is one of my favorite neighborhoods to walk around as it has some of Chicago's most historic homes and boulevards (Logan Boulevard, Kedzie Boulevard, Palmer Square Park, and Humboldt Boulevard).  Take a morning stroll, visit one of the areas many 'hip' coffee shops, and enjoy the beautiful Logan Square neighborhood!
access: Guests will have access to the garden unit apartment.  The backyard is NOT for Airbnb guests.
interaction: The apartment is set up for self check-in using a keypad to enter the building and another keypad to enter the apartment.  I am reachable via phone or text but prefer to give guests their privacy unless otherwise mentioned.
house_rules: I ask that you treat my place with the same respect as your own. Please be sure to take your shoes off when in the apartment and keep your noise level to an acceptable level as there are other tenants in the building. Thanks!
host_about: I am a working professional who has been living in Chicago for four years and enjoying all the city has to offer. Whether that's strolling the boulevards of Logan Square, working on projects around the house, or biking the path along Lake Michigan, I'm all about taking advantage of everything the city has to offer!

name: Classic Rowhouse by U. Chicago
summary: Our two story row-house offers an open concept with a large living room, open kitchen, powder room and separate sun room opening onto a large patio with BBQ and garden. Warm colors, high ceilings, fresh finishes throughout - truly calming! We are steps away from the University of Chicago, easy access to downtown via public transportation, and a short walk to downtown Hyde Park. Three bedrooms upstairs sleep up to six adults. Please know that the basement is occupied with trustworthy tenant.
space: FIRST FLOOR Living room has a 50" TV equipped with (Hidden by Airbnb) Chromecast that includes local tv and streaming capabilities. Kitchen includes custom built reclaimed wood island with raised breakfast bar. Open access makes cooking and socializing easy. In the rear, a cute sunroom space with books and toys make for a comfy play space for the kiddos (or adults). From there, sliding doors open out onto a patio with charcoal BBQ, lawn and garden, serving as a wonderful oasis away from the city after a busy day!  SECOND FLOOR The second floor includes three  bedrooms, two bathrooms and a laundry room. -Master suite Features large glass sliding doors opening onto a Juliet balcony,  a warm, fluffy area rug, and full closet for storage. Your bath features a large, open shower and reclaimed wood vanity with a huge sink, all features that are consistent with a relaxing, uplifting vibe. Your bed is a full and sleeps two. Flat screen TV includes local channels. -Bedroom 2 The front bedroom f

neighborhood_overview: Parks galore in Hyde Park! Walk 15 minutes east and you hit the Lake Shore trail which can make for a very relaxing morning. Stroll over to historic Jackson Park, home of the 1896 World's Fair. There are also numerous coffee shops and a wide variety of restaurants. Enjoy close proximity to the University of Chicago and all of its unique cultural offerings including the Oriental Institute Museum, the Smart Museum of Art, the Renaissance Museum, and of course, the beautiful architecture in and around campus. Also within walking distance are the Museum of Science and Industry and the Dusables Museum of African American History.  Hyde Park is a great place for those who want to explore the city but step away from the chaos at night and see one of the few remaining diverse neighborhoods of Chicago.
notes: - Please know that the basement of the home is occupied and not for guest use. Basement and your space separated by locked barn door.
transit: There is plenty of free parking in front of our house, so if you are renting a car or driving your own, our place is very convenient.  TO/FROM AIRPORTS:  From Midway Airport: Take the 55 bus straight west to University stop. From there, walk about 2 minutes north and you have arrived!  From O'Hare: Take the Blue Line to Jackson and transfer to the Red Line. Take Red Line south to the Garfield stop. Cross the street and catch the 55 bus eastbound. Get off at University Ave. Walk 2 minutes north and you are here!  OPTIONS FOR GETTING DOWNTOWN: 1) Walk 10 minutes east on 55th St. to catch the 6 express bus which will take you up to Michigan Avenue and Millenium Park, Art Museum, etc. 2) Walk 15 minutes to 53rd and Lake Park to catch the METRA running north to the Museum campus that includes the Aquarium, Planetarium, and Field Museum. GETTING TO FAR NORTH SIDE: Take 55th St. bus west to the Red Line to catch the Red Line north to the Zoo, Wrigley and all other subway connections.
access: Your space includes the first and second floors along with use of the porch, patio and garden area.  It does not include the basement. Please do not go into the basement. Our home is your home. Please treat it as such.
interaction: Please contact us through the app with any questions. We are happy to help!
house_rules: - Absolutely no smoking, pets or guests outside of those specified in the reservation -If using the patio, please keep noise level low, particularly in the evening hours.
host_about:
This is now our eighth year living in Chicago and we love it! My wife, Jolin and I originally met when I was living in Taiwan and now we are a family of four. I teach Mandarin Chinese in the Chicago Public Schools and my wife has the more daunting task of managing her own private tutoring along with raising our little ones, Baea and Kylin (6 years old and  3 years old respectfully). When we are able, we love to travel and have had the most wonderful experiences here on Airbnb. Can't wait to meet you!

We look forward to meeting you!

neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is one of the city's vibrant neighborhoods, balancing family-friendly activities and a thriving community of Chicago's aspiring artists, musicians independent spirited folks. The vintage charm of Logan Theater hosts the annual Chicago Underground Film Festival for those cinephiles. It is also the home of the historical Illinois Centennial Memorial that commemorates Illinois statehood designed by the same architect who created the Lincoln Memorial in Washington DC.restored arcade machines. Make your afternoon stroll or even a bike tour at Humboldt Park and Logan Square , as the community is graced with tree line boulevard and parks. After the strolling, satisfy your taste buds in Logan Square's top dining destinations. A "must try" is a visit to Dos Urban Cantina, Diana Dávila's authentic Mexican fare at Mi Tocaya Antojería to Abe Conlon's Macanese-influenced menu at Fat Rice and make that reservation ASAP at GIANT, Nightwood chef Jason Vincent's Logan Square restaurant. summary: Discover the best of Chicago, with this studio Lincoln Park apartment with  views over the sea. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this modernly Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, lovely living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (#CHI121)

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in the neighborhood of Lincoln Park. It is full of historic churches and brick row houses. Tree-lined residential areas give way to bustling businesses. Armitage Avenue is lined with independent boutiques and high-end retailers; Clark Street is packed with casual cafes, ethnic restaurants, and sweet shops. In addition to shopping and dining, Lincoln Park is a diverse art and entertainment destination. There is a plethora of museums, top theaters, and live music clubs to pick from. Also, there is plenty of natural beauty and outdoor scenery to enjoy. The neighborhood's namesake park is a sprawling 1,208 acres of green space with a zoo, nature museum, and conservatory. Head over to the lakefront beaches, where sand and surf are set against a backdrop of downtown skyscrapers. Being a 15 minute train ride from the Loop, Lincoln Park is a very close commute to the city’s primary business district.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $350 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Bright and spacious. Heart of Little Village. 3BR
summary: You're sure to enjoy your stay in Little Village, one of Chicago's hidden gem neighborhoods with authentic Mexican flare. This beautiful, spacious 3 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment is located in the heart of Little Village. Great for families or small groups. The space is clean with hardwood floors, high ceilings and huge bay windows that let in tons of natural light.
space: The building is a tall, beautiful brick building with historic chicago charm.
description: You're sure to enjoy your stay in Little Village, one of Chicago's hidden gem neighborhoods with authentic Mexican flare. This beautiful, spacious 3 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment is located in the heart of Little Village. Great for families or small groups. The space is clean with hardwood floors, high ceilings and huge bay windows that let in tons of natural light. The building is a tall, beautiful brick building with historic chicago charm. You will have access to the entire apartment 3br, 1ba, kitchen, dining room and living room. There is a fully enclosed back porch which can be used by guests as well. A free garage parking spot (1) is available. Please request the garage access code if you'd like to use the parking. I live upstairs so I can assist if you need anything. Little village is one of chicago's hidden gem neighborhoods with a lot of authentic Mexican flare. The apartment is located in the heart of Little Village near restaurants, bars, taquerias, grocery stores, local bre
neighborhood_overview: Little village is one of chicago's hidden gem neighborhoods with a lot of authentic Mexican flare. The apartment is located in the heart of Little Village near restaurants, bars, taquerias, grocery stores, local breweries and coffee shops. Check out my guide book for my favorite local spots within walking distance from the house. For nightlife, Pilsen is just a 5 minute uber ride or 4 train stops away.
notes: Free wifi is available. Guests will also have access to Hulu TV.
transit: Little Village is easily accessible by both car and public transportation. Just 15 minutes from Midway airport by car. The building is located just 3 blocks to the nearest "L" station on the pink line with direct access to downtown. Douglas Park is one of Chicago's most beautiful parks located within walking distance just 5 blocks away. Pilsen is Chicago's trendiest neighborhood great for food, shopping and nightlife, located just 4 train stops away or 5 minutes by car. Downtown chicago is easily accessible by train or a 10 minute uber/car ride.
access: You will have access to the entire apartment 3br, 1ba, kitchen, dining room and living room. There is a fully enclosed back porch which can be used by guests as well. A free garage parking spot (1) is available. Please request the garage access code if you'd like to use the parking.
interaction: I live upstairs so I can assist if you need anything.
house_rules: No loud noise or music after 10pm.

name: BIG LOFT WITH PRIVATE ENTRANCE AND FREE PARKING
summary: Huge, loft-style room with PRIVATE ENTRANCE in the heart of Chicago. FREE parking included! You will have your own door code and may arrive as late as you wish, EASY self check-in guaranteed. I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like. The neighborhood is extremely safe even at night :)
space: Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 6 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!) The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. host_about:
Hello! My name is Marina, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an auditor downtown.  

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

name: Wrigley Hostel - 10 Bed Shared Room
summary: Wrigley Hostel is an excellent hostel located in the heart of Wrigleyville, one of the most fun and exciting neighborhoods in Chicago. We offer a dorm room for up to 10 guests with free breakfast.
space: Wrigley Hostel offers you a shared 10-bed room for up to 10 guests at our guest house just outside Wrigley Field. The room comes with 5 bunk bed and fresh, clean linens. There are shared bathrooms throughout.
description: Wrigley Hostel is an excellent hostel located in the heart of Wrigleyville, one of the most fun and exciting neighborhoods in Chicago. We offer a dorm room for up to 10 guests with free breakfast. Wrigley Hostel offers you a shared 10-bed room for up to 10 guests at our guest house just outside Wrigley Field. The room comes with 5 bunk bed and fresh, clean linens. There are shared bathrooms throughout. Guests have access to the hostel's kitchen facilities and social spaces, including an outdoor patio and a common room complete with a TV, bar, and laptops that are free to use. Come socialize in our common room and meet guests from all over the world. Enjoy spontaneous hostel-run activities during the week. Wrigley Hostel is located in the heart of Wrigleyville -- in the shadow of Wrigley Field -- steps from all the fun and excitement of the neighborhood's famous Clark Street bars. The CTA 'L' Red Line Addison stop is around the corner and it only takes 15 minutes to get downtown. We are
neighborhood_overview: Wrigley Hostel is located in the heart of Wrigleyville -- in the shadow of Wrigley Field -- steps from all the fun and excitement of the neighborhood's famous Clark Street bars.
notes: Guests may check in any time after 2PM on their day of arrival. Guests must check out prior to 11AM on their day of departure.
transit: The CTA 'L' Red Line Addison stop is around the corner and it only takes 15 minutes to get downtown. We are also less than 5 minutes away from late-night and all-night bus services that make getting to and from the lake, the loop, and the airport a breeze!
access: Guests have access to the hostel's kitchen facilities and social spaces, including an outdoor patio and a common room complete with a TV, bar, and laptops that are free to use.
interaction: Come socialize in our common room and meet guests from all over the world. Enjoy spontaneous hostel-run activities during the week.
house_rules: All guests who stay must have a State ID or Drivers License and guests with a Illinois ID with a 606 zip code are not able to stay at Wrigley Hostel. Wrigley Hostel does not provide parking on site, however guests who contact us via email 48 hours before check-in time can request a Free Street Parking Pass, which will allow guests to park on the surrounding streets for free. These passes are not guaranteed and are based on availability. If we do not confirm with you directly that your parking pass is reserved, we will not have one for you when you check-in.

name: Cozy room steps from the Subway
summary: Basic, comfy air bed and night table.
space: This is a small, sunny room in beautiful Douglas Park. It has a comfortable air bed, night stand, lap and closet. It's a basic, no-frills stay in a large, vintage house. The property is steps from the Pink Line subway (bus stop across street) taking you to hipster central West Loop/downtown/Sears Tower/Bean/Museums in 10-15 minutes and Lakeview/Boystown in 25m-ish. The area is predominantly Mexican with lots of great eateries. I am very friendly and available for any tourism information you may need! I do have an adorable and very friendly Bull Terrier $40 cleaning charge for long-term stays over 15 days.

neighborhood_overview: Historic Bronzeville where homes date back to the 1800s, known for high ceilings, large  & spacious living quarters, and architecture that will never be repeated. Up and coming area, the properties are well-maintained and conveniently located near everything in the City whether you travel by bus, train, Uber or your own vehicle, it is but a short distance away.
notes: 1. TVs are RoKu equipped! 2. You can sleep on top of the two couches in the living room.  3. The $1,000.00 security only applies if you damage or steal anything during your stay. Even then, it’s up to that amount after the claim is filed. Your card does not get debited period (not prior to and not after if no claims are filed).
transit: Within walking distance, about .5 - 4 blocks to public transportation, 10mins to beautiful downtown Chicago, 10mins to Soldier Field, 10mins to United Center, 10mins from US Cellular Field, President Obama's house 5 minutes away, Museum of Science and Industry 10mins, Shedd Aquarium 10mins, Ms. Biscuit 3mins, Chicago Chicken & Waffles 10mins, Harold Washington Cultural Center 6mins, Chinatown 6mins, and much more.
access: A lockbox has been set up so guests can feel free to come at their leisure anytime after the 3p check-in. You'll have access to the entire apartment and there’s free street parking.
interaction: I’m usually not present for every check-in, but at some point I will come up and introduce myself and welcome you aboard.  However, I’m always available to answer questions and address missing items, concerns or comments.
house_rules: Be respectful of tenants living in the building- LOCK ALL ENTRY DOORS AT ALL TIMES.  No loud music, No parties, No incense or candle burning, No running or stomping down the hallway.  Please treat the place better than your own. Also, be mindful that tenants live beneath you, so your most respectful behavior would be much appreciated. Towels should only be used for bathing. *Only number of guests on reservation are allowed in the unit!
host_about: Nice, friendly, very welcoming, love to travel and explore new things!

name: Sweet Logan Square Suite, easy walk to Blue Line!
summary: Unwind and enjoy the city in our Cozy and Clean Guest Suite!  We're new hosts on Airbnb and super excited to begin having guests stay at our recently furnished guest space.  We live in the main, separable part of the property and are excited for you to use our space as a home base for which to decompress or explore the city! I am new to Chicago, and my pastimes include video games, music, learning new things. My girlfriend, Emma and I are excited to have you in our home!
space: We have set up our master bedroom (garden unit) in an isolated part of the house just for you! You'll have your own private bathroom, mini fridge, and kitchenette to go along with your queen-sized sleeping accomodations and spatious closet. We hope you enjoy your stay!

neighborhood_overview: WELCOME TO THE CITY THAT FEELS LIKE HOME! Chicago is a city unlike any other. We’ve got the architectural marvels, world-class museums, dynamic entertainment, and award-winning dining scene you’d expect from one of the world’s greatest cities. But we’re more than just another big city — our welcoming residents, inclusive neighborhoods, and Midwestern soul truly make Chicago the city that feels like home. We are happy to help provide more information about our neighborhood! Just drop us a quick note :)
notes: Please be respectful of your neighbors upstairs and next door.  if you use any dishes, please wash any residual food off of them into the garbage and sink, and place them in the dish bin. The thermostat controls won't be accessible from within your Airbnb, but I can adjust the temperature from my phone. Please let me know if you need me to adjust the thermostat.
transit: Please feel free to reach out if you need some transportation tips or resources! The Blue Line train that can take you to O'Hair airport or downtown is only a 10-minute walk away, on California and Palmer. Tickets can be purchased at the station if need be.
access: You'll have the entire master bedroom, bathroom, and closet all to yourself. You are welcome to use the ground-level outdoor patio and bench, but please leave  the upper areas for your neighbors.
interaction: You can send us a message if you need to reach us. If it is urgent and you need immediate assistance, you may call, but please try to message us first.  We are happy to socialize with you too if we are available; just send us a message if you'd like that.
house_rules: Please avoid wearing shoes inside. You can leave them in the entranceway to your room.  If you use any dishes, please wash them in the sink and return them to the used-dishes bin. Dish soap can be found near the bin.  There is absolutely no smoking inside the house. Vaping outside is OK. Please do not do anything that is illegal in the state of Illinois while staying in our home.
host_about:
Stay where it counts. When you book a Loftium, you're contributing to the local community. Each Loftium is home to a local resident who hosts and lives right on-site, making sure your experience is a delightful one. All spaces are designed with your comfort in mind! We've made check-in and communication a breeze, and each home provides a beautiful and cozy place to rest your head during your travels. Every Loftium home and host is unique, and you'll always get a true neighborhood experience during your stay.

Visit a new community and book a Loftium in any of our cities: Seattle, Portland, Denver, San Diego, Phoenix, Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas, Charlotte, or Orlando. We can't wait for you to visit!

Nearby attractions include: Chicago Riverwalk (.2 miles) Tribune Tower (.6 miles) Millennium Park (.9 miles) Navy Pier (1.3 miles) Museum Campus (2 miles)
notes: Chicago Registration: PendingPlease note that we do not allow bookings from residents of Chicago and surrounding areas. For stays over 30 days, we require additional personal information and a signed License Agreement in order to accommodate the stay. All guests will be required to verify their information which includes a 3rd-party background check. This is to ensure your safety as well as the safety and well being of our neighbors and our homes. All information is confidential and will not be shared with anyone for any purposes outside of your reservation. Once all information is verified, we will be able to confirm your reservation. However, we reserve the right to cancel a reservation if you fail to comply or there is a failed background check. Please be aware that an additional deposit of $100 per reservation will be held during the period of your stay and released back within 7 days after check-out to cover any incidentals that may occur at the property. Please reach out to our t
transit: Easily traverse Chicago via the popular subway system. The Clark/Lake station is a 3 minute walk from this Domio and you can access the Blue/Brown/Green/Orange/Pink/Purple lines. You can take the Blue Line to ORD airport and the Brown Line to MDW airport. Additionally, Uber and Lyfts are readily available in Chicago.
access: Guests have exclusive access to the apartment. Additionally, guests have access to the following building amenities: Indoor Pool Gym  Two levels of sun decks Billiards Room Yoga Room Clubroom
interaction: We do our best to tailor each experience to our guests preferences. Want advice, suggestions, or a shoulder to lean on? We are always available at your disposal. Need a place to stay but don't feel like chatting? That's okay too, we won't be offended.

name: H. MANSION SHARED BEDROOM H_TOP BUNK BED
summary: This is a COED room which means it is occupied by both men and women. We are in an upper-middle class neighborhood. We are just a 4 minute walk to public transportation. One bus ride to Soldier Field. THIS SPACE IS PERFECT FOR BACKPACKERS as it can hold from one to eight more people. Fast food restaurants just minutes away. We constantly host Uber and Lyft drivers in order to make your travel around the city more convenient.

Renting with us means that you have read and accepted that fact that common areas are being surveyed and/or recorded for the safety and security of our home, ourselves and our guests. In the case of a guest forgetting to leave his key or if a key is lost, there will be an additional fee of $20.00 to replace said key. This covers the cost of replacing the lock and is non negotiable.
host_about: I am Brazilian. I moved to the United States in February of 2018 to be with my now husband who is American. I’m from a very small place in Brazil called Pombal which is located in the state of Paraiba. I am a very simple person who enjoys Airbnb as a way to make new friends.

name: Beautiful guest suite in charming neighborhood
summary: Hi!  We're Paul & Kindra.  We hope you enjoy your stay!  Enjoy Chicago with our beautifully renovated guest floor (1250sq ft).   Two spacious bedrooms, private bathroom, cable TV, wifi, laundry, and many nearby shops & restaurants. This floor is the third level of our home, and is very peaceful and quiet.  Headed to MSI?  Hop on the expressway to arrive in 25 minutes.  Get from door to downtown Chicago in just under 30 min. by Metra train.
space: Our third level is our guest suite with two bedrooms, full bathroom, mini kitchenette, and living room.  There’s a TV set-up with Netflix, Amazon, etc.  Our family does not go on this floor, making is nice and quiet for our guests.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in South Loop. A dynamic neighborhood with a unique mix of attractions, shopping and history. Take a stroll along South Michigan Avenue and the nearby Prairie Avenue district to see "Millionaire's Row", an area lined with mansions belonging to Chicago's wealthiest elite. For shopping, visit the Roosevelt Collection, an open-air plaza, home to a cinema as well as premium local and national retailers. Along the southern edge, you will find Soldier Field, the Chicago Bears football stadium. Don’t miss the Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum and Grant Park, all adjacent to one another and huge attractions in South Loop.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.
