name: Magnolia Airbnb
summary: Sunny, large bedroom with en-suite shower/bathroom in a warm, comfortable home on a quiet, tree-lined street in Edgewater neighborhood. Conveniently located with just short walk to two Red Line train stations and four short blocks from the beaches of Lake Michigan.
space: Chicago style Arts and Crafts house, built at the turn of 20th century in Edgewater.  My home is roomy and comfortable with ample privacy and lots of eclectic art work.  Quiet, large bedroom with a king-sized Tempurpedic bed and en-suite bathroom with a shower.  Behind the plain exterior of the house is a peaceful and spacious sanctuary to renew and refresh yourself.  Access to wireless internet, back yard and the bbq grill. In the summer, you can pick organic arugula, basil and other vegetables from the backyard for a delicious salad or sandwich.     Get a taste of real Chicago, while staying in a quiet, tree-lined neighborhood! Although, the official check-in is 4 p.m., and check-out at noon, I am pretty flexible as schedule permits.   I'd like to know about the guests with whom I will be sharing my home.  So, please let me know who you are, what your routine will be like and what you'd like to do while in town.
description: Sunny, large bedroom with en-suite shower/bathroom in a warm, comfortable home on a quiet, tree-lined street in Edgewater neighborhood. Conveniently located with just short walk to two Red Line train stations and four short blocks from the beaches of Lake Michigan. Chicago style Arts and Crafts house, built at the turn of 20th century in Edgewater.  My home is roomy and comfortable with ample privacy and lots of eclectic art work.  Quiet, large bedroom with a king-sized Tempurpedic bed and en-suite bathroom with a shower.  Behind the plain exterior of the house is a peaceful and spacious sanctuary to renew and refresh yourself.  Access to wireless internet, back yard and the bbq grill. In the summer, you can pick organic arugula, basil and other vegetables from the backyard for a delicious salad or sandwich.     Get a taste of real Chicago, while staying in a quiet, tree-lined neighborhood! Although, the official check-in is 4 p.m., and check-out at noon, I am pretty flexible as schedu
neighborhood_overview: Location, location, location, as the saying goes!  It's the Edgewater neighborhood.  Edgewater, as the name suggests, is at the edge of beautiful Lake Michigan.  Just blocks away from the beautiful Lake Michigan, you will love walking to the lakefront to watch the sunrise (if you are an early morning person, like me), jogging, walking or just about anything at the lake.   Magnolia B & C is within short walking distance to many restaurants and shops in Edgewater and Andersonville.  New Chinatown on Argyle Street and Indian food on Devon Avenue are very close.  Anywhere from upscale Italian eateries to family diners are all nearby.  The variety and choice of restaurants will meet any budget.  Closest grocery store, Wholefoods, is just a short walk from the house.  It is only two elevated train stops away from Loyola University.  Easy access to Northwestern downtown and Evanston campuses.
notes: Although, the official check-in is 4 p.m., and check-out at noon, I am pretty flexible as schedule permits.   I'd like to know a bit about the guests with whom I will be sharing my home.  So, please let me know who you are, what your daily routine will be like, and what you'd like to do while in town. As citizens of this planet, let's be mindful about our natural resources.  Please turn off lights when not in use and turn off faucets while brushing teeth or doing dishes.  I thank you, Mother Earth thanks you as well as future generations!  Thank you for your care.
transit: A Hop, skip and a jump away from two Red Line train stations (Bryn Mawr and Thorndale stations) which will take you to downtown Chicago in 25 minutes; or north to Evanston in 15 minutes.  Broadway bus (#36) to downtown is one block walk and Lakeshore express buses to downtown or to Rogers Park are only three blocks away.  Lake Shore Drive is only a few blocks away for access to major interstates in and around Chicago.
access: You will have access to the great updated, fully equipped kitchen with a big island, excellent stove and a double oven.  Washer and dryer are available for use.  Hang out in the back yard.  Spacious private bathroom with a walk-in shower and a separate tub.  Permit-free street parking.     Also, on the Redline, you can get to Loyola University which is just two stops away, and to Evanston and Northwestern University.   Divvy bike rental spots are all around - including two stations nearby.  You can ride the bike along the beautiful lakefront all the way downtown and to museum campus and beyond.
interaction: Flexible and accommodating.  I've been called a culture vulture.  I love Chicago and all it has to offer.  I enjoy meeting new people from other places.  I can point you to all kinds of fun and cultural places to suit your budget and make your stay memorable.    On those rare occasions when I do cook, guests are welcome to share a meal with me.   If you prefer quiet, private time, the house is spacious enough so that you can have your space.   I work during the day, but am available for any questions or suggestions via telephone or e-mail.
house_rules: House Motto:  Reduce, Reuse, Recycle! Please turn off lights and water if not using.   House Rule #1:  Make yourself comfortable!   House Rule #2:  Have fun in Chicago! I do expect the guests to pick up after themselves and wash own dishes.  Pets, as long as they are friendly, house broken (and not too vocal) are okay.
host_about:
Lover of the arts, travel, books and hiking.  I enjoy music of all kinds and of course yummy food.  I love meeting people from different cultures and learning about them.   

As a citizen of this planet, I am mindful of our tendency for overconsumption and try to do my part to make sure that this planet sustains itself for another few millennia.

neighborhood_overview: We're located in Lakeview, one of Chicago's safest and most popular neighborhoods. Most of the area's restaurants, bars, and shops are concentrated on Belmont Ave,  Sheffield Ave, Clark St, Broadway St, and Halsted St. There are also plenty of hidden gems and tucked-away spots to discover for those who like to wander. THINGS TO DO NEARBY ✔ Walk to Wrigleyville and catch a Cub's game. ✔ Admire the Chicago skyline from the Lakefront Trail. ✔ Catch a live show at the Vic Theatre. ✔ Choose from over 300 beers at Beermiscuous.
notes: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS 1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?” Excellent public transit directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. Our building is just a short walk from the Belmont “L” train station. Search for “Belmont red line station” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest. 2. “Is there parking nearby?” Parking in Chicago is always difficult and even more so in the evening and during special events. We recommend using an app called SpotHero to reserve a nearby paid parking spot. We love SpotHero because it allows you to reserve a parking spot in advance so that you don’t have to worry about finding one the day you arrive. 3. When is check-in/check-out? Check-in is 3pm or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30am to drop off your bags in the living room (just note that our staff will have your room ready by 3pm). Check-out is at 11am. Our cleaning
transit: Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber. ￫ The Belmont Red/Brown Line 'L' train station is a 5-minute walk away. ￫ O'Hare is 55 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber. ￫ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.
interaction: WHY STAY WITH TROVE? ✔ Fast Communication We’re always on call to answer your questions, typically within 30 minutes. ✔ Experienced Hosts We’ve hosted thousands of guests over five years. ✔ Exclusive Perks Trove Guests have access to the Metropolitan Club, located in the Willis Tower. ✔ Easy Self-Check-In Keyless access means no keys for you to manage during your stay! ✔ Central Location You’ll never be far from local spots to check out, sights to see, and public transit.
house_rules: 1) Only the reservation holder and guests added to the reservation via Airbnb may have access to the apartment.   2) As a courtesy to any other guests who you might be sharing the apartment with, please clean up after yourself immediately in the common areas. 3) As a courtesy to your fellow guests and to your neighbors, please keep noise to a minimum, especially between 9 pm - 9 am. 4) This is a non-smoking apartment. If smoke is detected, a cleaning fee of $150 will be charged. 5) No late check-outs. Check-out is at 11 am.  In order to compensate our cleaning assistants for lost time, additional charges will be sent if they're unable to begin their job at 11 am. One hour or less - $25 Each additional hour - $40 6) Damaged/stained/missing towels, bedding, and/or furnishings will incur additional fees. The per-item fees are as follows: Bedsheet- $12 Towel - $12 Pillow - $30 Pillowcase: $10 Comforter - $50 Clothes hangers - $3 Furnishings - Dependant on item

name: Z 5 month min, Remodeled Condo Incredible Location
summary: Per the City of Chicago and the condo building HOA bylaws, 5 month stay minimum.  Truly incredible location in the Fulton Market/West Town neighborhood with amazing restaurants and local shops, steps to public transportation and minutes to downtown/loop via walking.  Professionally managed by a seasoned team specializing in monthly furnished rentals.
space: •Unmetered street parking directly outside the building that is generally very available as this is a zone-specific street that requires a permit - upon booking, we will provide you necessary documentation to obtain the permit from the City of Chicago and will reimburse the cost. •Thick, comfortable mattress and memory foam pillows •High thread count bedding & linens; deluxe terry rug towels •Lightning-quick wifi (50 Mbps) •24” & 32” LED televisions  •Unit is on the 2nd floor (1 short flight of stairs up) within a small, homely 6-unit condominium association •Detailed instructional video tours on how to access the home are sent in advance of your stay and helpful written guides are displayed throughout the home.
description: Per the City of Chicago and the condo building HOA bylaws, 5 month stay minimum.  Truly incredible location in the Fulton Market/West Town neighborhood with amazing restaurants and local shops, steps to public transportation and minutes to downtown/loop via walking. neighborhood_overview: One of the most exciting and trendiest neighborhoods, you will find everything in Fulton Market - eclectic mix of new, modern construction hotels and restaurants mixed in with centuries old Chicago must-trys.  Quiet, safe, tree-lined, well-lit street.
notes: Please note that the entire reservation amount is NOT due at the time of booking :) One month's rent is charged, and then the rest is charged by Airbnb in monthly installments. https://www.airbnb.com/help/article/245/how-do-i-pay-for-my-long-term-reservation
transit: -8 minute walk to the CTA blue line train -1 minute walk to the Grand Ave 65 CTA bus line -6 minute walk to G&O Cleaners -9 minute walk to Green Grocer, 12 minute walk to Jewel-Osco Grocery Store -9 minute walk to CVS Pharmacy -Crazy Fit Physical Fitness, Wattage gym, and Sana Vita Pilates/Yoga studio all within a 10 minute walk
access: Full, private access to everything pictured.
interaction: Prior to booking, an in-person viewing can be scheduled only if there is not a current resident living in the property - please check the listing's calendar on your proposed viewing date to confirm that it might be possible. Should you book the property, please note that you will be the beneficiary of this policy as well, and we will never inconvenience you with showing requests during your stay.  Viewing all the pictures, descriptions, and reviews of this listing as well as others in the area is a great way to familiarize yourself with the property, location, and living experience.
house_rules: - Please be respectful of others in the condo complex regarding noise, trash, etc.  Just please be a good neighbor :)
host_about: We are part of a team of property managers for Monthly MD Suites and love what we do!  As a physical therapist and associate with a global logistics firm, we've experienced and understand the needs of traveling professionals & students and seek to minimize the worries that oftentimes accompany out of town stays.

We offer all the amenities you might need. My cohost runs over 40 rooms around the city. We have a whole team to help you anytime and to make sure everything is perfect! Place is clean every single day.

notes: The room is private and has a private bathroom. but you will share common areas ( kitchen , living room, etc) with other Airbnb guests. Usually none of this get crowd because most of Airbnb guests are most of the time outside the house knowing the city, in concerts, interviews, etc, and they don’t spend much time in the house. A private apartment for 2 people in the area usually cost over 120$ p/night plus taxes and fees which is in total almost 200$ p/night ! If you want save some money and being close to downtown, surrounding great public transportation and with free street parking this could be a great option for you!  The room has one full size bed. If you want to add 3rd or 4th guest in the reservation I could add 1 extra air mattress with no extra fee if the reservation is set for 3 or 4. If the reservation is for 2 and you’d like to have an extra air mattress we charge $15p/night and we provide air mattress and linens for it. the room will become smaller for luggage becase you w

Right in front of the building it’s free but you’re not supposed to park there when there is events in United Center. But on the two other street of each corner of the street where the building is you can park for free as well
house_rules: No smoking( any kind) No parties allowed at all. Respect other Airbnb guests, belongings and other rooms. After 9pm the place has to be quiet so people can rest.  Checkout is by 10am. No screaming at anytime. There is video recording in common areas for your own security. booking for somebody else is not allowed unless agreed before booking Breaking any rule or doing any illegal activity will end up in a immediate cancellation of your reservation and you will have to leave the place immediately. Our top one priority is our guests’ security! There will be security cameras ON in shared spaces only( living room, kitchen, hallways, entrance of the apartment, exits of the apartment).

name: Artist's Home Studio Next to Train
summary: Eclectic 2 bedroom/1 bath in Albany Park close to the Kedzie Brown Line stop and many neighborhood amenities.
space: Eclectic 2 bedroom/1 bath in Albany Park 1/2 a block from the brown line and many neighborhood amenities. +Master bedroom with new queen size bed. +Guest bedroom with very comfortable double.  +Window A/Cs +Bathroom with tub/shower +Living/dining area off the kitchen +Small, but very functional kitchen with all the    essentials. The owner is a great cook! (Please note: no toaster or microwave, french press coffee maker) There are plenty of restaurants and shopping within a 5 block radius. Very convenient location. Please note: A working artist studio is in the front of the apartment. Though it is closed off with a curtain and should be off limits, there are dangerous things for children in there, such as paint/supplies, exacto knives, scissors, tools etc.  Even the most well-mannered kids can be curious!  Please take this into consideration before making a booking request.  No Pets.

neighborhood_overview: There are plenty of restaurants and shopping within a 5 block radius. Very convenient location
notes: + Secure Wifi + Window a/c in each bedroom, but no central air   + Ceiling fan and nice cross breeze in living/dining room.
transit: Very convenient to public transportation.  The Kedzie brown line stop is a block away and the Montrose, Lawrence, Kedzie and Kimball buses all run within a few block radius.  Street parking in front without a permit. Easy to get downtown on the el and quick and easy to get to the Lawrence or Montrose beaches on the bus.
access: Guests have full access, except for the painting studio at the front of the apartment. Guests will not be double booked so no one else will be staying with you or working in the painting studio.   Please take a moment to check what amenities are provided with this apartment.
interaction: Someone will be able to meet you with the keys and give you a tour.  We'll also check in during your stay to make sure everything is good and answer any questions
house_rules: + No smoking indoors + No Pets + Please be respectful of the apartment and the neighbors + Please do not explore the painting studio + EVERY TIME you leave - please be sure to lock back door, close living room window next to bookcase and turn of air conditioners, fans and lights.
host_about:
Perpetual Traveler. 

I have always had a love of traveling and took my first flight when I was six months old.  I love the airbnb concept and think staying in local neighborhoods with local people is the key to getting to know a place. For me, traveling is not about knowing exactly what is going to happen throughout my trips, but following the experience wherever it might take me. Usually, it's when things don't work out as planned that you meet the most interesting people!

neighborhood_overview: Lakeview Share this post: Why we love it Lakeview’s laidback atmosphere and picture-perfect shoreline make it a favorite hang out among locals. And spots like lively Wrigleyville and the Belmont Theater District make it a major entertainment hub, too. Insider tips Anchored by a beautiful stretch of shoreline to the east, Lakeview melds several distinct areas — East Lakeview, Central Lakeview, Boystown, and Wrigleyville. Each spot has its own unique character, but they’re all pulled together by Lakeview’s casual, welcoming feel. Hit the bustling shopping districts along Broadway in East Lakeview, along Belmont near Boystown, and the bustling Southport Corridor for local boutiques, record shops, and vintage treasure hunting. Or live it up with the locals at the seemingly endless array of bars and pubs, and the dozens of much-loved neighborhood restaurants that lie in between. Lakeview is also known as a go-to for arts and culture — you’ll find live music venues, summer street festivals,

name: Garden studio apartment in Irving Park
summary: Large basement studio apartment that is tiled, includes private bath, small kitchenette, wireless internet.  Private entrance. Great for somebody looking for a home base to explore the city.  Access to fenced-in backyard with covered patio.  On Addison bus line, 15 minute walk to Addison Blue Line train, 22 min walk to Addison Brown Line, 30 min walk to Wrigley Field. Shopping and restaurants within walking distance. Parks with Divvy bikes also available. Washer and dryer just outside entrance.
space: This is a small, cool spot about 2 miles straight west of Wrigley Field. It has a kitchenette, bathroom with shower, double bed and loveseat hideabed. WiFi is included as well as washer and dryer in common space just outside door. There is a fenced backyard for any four-legged guests. This is also the designated smoking area and gas barbecue grill. Short walk to Target Shopping Center and public transit.

neighborhood_overview: This is a working class neighborhood where many people go off to work each morning. It is very walkable with shopping 1 block away and bus lines to CTA lines
notes: Free street parking is almost always available in front of house or around corner. Heating and cooling is controlled by unit above, but electric fireplace takes the chill off!
transit: CTA red and blue lines are a bus ride away on Addison. There is also a Divvy bike rack a couple of blocks away. Of course, taxi and Uber rides are available as well.
access: The main entry is the walkout basement entrance in rear of house. This is also where you will find the fenced backyard.
interaction: I usually don’t interact with guests in person but can if you desire. Most communications are by text, so you can come and go as you please.
host_about: I am a 64 year old widower and I work for a risk management consulting firm in Chicago. I travel often, both domestically and internationally for days and sometimes weeks at a time. I am an engineer by degree but my field of work is in fire protection and safety. I like all kinds of music and am a big fan of old movies. TCM is my favorite television station, although I don't watch much TV other than local sports. I enjoy working with wood and am collecting a fair amount of tools, but since I work a lot, I don't have much free time. I hope to do more when I retire in 5 or 10 years. I live in an upstairs of an old house that was extensively remodeled a few years back. The owners of the unit are my daughter, son-in-law who used to live downstairs so I also spent free time with them until they moved to a larger house. They introduced me to Airbnb as they have been doing it for a few months and really seem to like it. If I have a life motto, it would be something I heard a while back, "that someday you realize you regret the things you didn't do more than those you do"!

name: Private Apartment in Humboldt Park/Logan Square
summary: You’ll feel like you’re at home in this comfy in-law suite that’s perfect for couples, families, individuals or small groups. The space has a private entrance, free and easy street parking, and is equipped with a king-sized bed, full kitchen and bath, TV with Roku, and WiFi. You’ll find tons of great restaurants in Humboldt Park and Logan Square, and you’re only steps away from the North Avenue bus if you’d like to go further into the city.
space: The space has 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom, and a kitchenette. There's a king bed in the bedroom and the futon (in the main living space) converts to a queen bed. WiFi is provided, as well a TV complete with Roku.  My husband and I live right above the unit, so you may hear some footsteps during your stay.

neighborhood_overview: We live on the border of Humboldt Park and Logan Square. There are tons of restaurants, bars, and other things to do. Armitage Ave, referred to as "Chicago's Other Restaurant Row" by Crain's Business, is less than a mile away (check out Table, Donkey, and Stick; Parson's Chicken and Fish; Osteria Langhe; Scofflaw; Sink Swim; Dos Urban Cantina; Giant; and many more...).  We live steps away from the park, which is a great place to hang out in the summer time. There are plenty of trails, playgrounds for the kids, and a lagoon with a beach!
transit: It's pretty easy to find street parking by our place - just ask us where to park so you avoid being ticketed!  If you don't have a car, we're right across the street from the North Avenue bus which will take you right into the heart of Wicker Park (or to the blue line if you need to go to O'Hare).  Also, Uber and Lyft are really affordable - often times more affordable than public transit.
interaction: We like to make sure we give our guests privacy, but my husband and I live right upstairs if a guest needs something.  We are happy to make any recommendations on restaurants, bars, or other things to do during your stay. Just ask!
house_rules: - Other folks live right upstairs, so please be respectful with the amount of noise you make.

Short walk to Wrigley Field, train to downtown, Lake Michigan, Vic Theater, Divvy Bikes and a bus stop right at the corner. neighborhood_overview: East Lakeview is known for its colorful, lively & inviting atmosphere.  It includes some of Chicago's off-Loop theater, Wrigley Field (home of the Chicago Cubs), Boystown, specialty restaurants, trendy fashion outlets, wine boutiques, chain stores and independent ships,  greystone and brownstone walk-up buildings and other historic architecture.  My condo is in the center of it all... you will enjoy your stay and safe surroundings!
notes: This is a safe, solid, secure, brick, quiet building.  Please let me know if you have any questions.  Thank you.
transit: Only a five-minute walk to the red, brown and purple line trains that will take you all around Chicago.  There is a CTA bus stop at the corner of my block.  I will give you a free parking permit for street parking.  Public transportation and Uber/Lyft are the best way to get around Chicago.  When the weather is nice walking and bikes are a perfect way to explore the neighborhoods.
access: The condo is 1,800 sq. ft.  You'll have access to your private room, private bathroom, living room, balcony, kitchen and rooftop deck.
interaction: I will be available if you have any questions, need directions or recommendations for entertainment/dining options.  You'll have my phone number so you have access to me at anytime.
house_rules: Please be respectful as I will be respectful of you.  No smoking inside and no pets please.
host_about: Hello! I'm originally from Fairbanks, Alaska and lived in Anchorage, Alaska before moving to Chicago in 2011 where I own a spacious condo in East Lakeview.   I look forward to meeting you and helping you enjoy your Chicago experience.  I’m impeccably clean, friendly and responsible. summary: This private, professionally designed room features a PRIVATE BATHROOM inside the room, private hot tub, huge room, FREE PARKING and an EARLY check-in time (11 am!)  You will have your own door code and may arrive and as late as you wish, EASY check-in guaranteed! I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! The neighborhood is very safe, even at night :)
space: Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 6 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!) The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock the door.  > Private bathroom with 100% newly renovated SHOWER & HOT TUB! > 600 sq feet private room with lock on the door > Can host up to 3 people, 3rd person can sleep on reasonably-sized couch > Large closet space > EARLY check-in time! summary: Contemporary 1 bedroom in the Wicker Park. Brand new kitchen and minimalistic decor.  A perfect space for a long stay or weekend getaway! The unit has all the comforts of home. space: The unit can sleep 4. Two in a queen bed with mattress topper in first bedroom (note bed frame is new as of Sept 2019) and two on the pull out sofa in the living room. Steps from top bars, restaurants, grocery store and public transit! The location is perfect - 2/3 blocks to everything, while tucked away on a quiet street. Steps from top bars, restaurants, grocery store and public transit! *SPECIAL NOTES* This unit is a garden level unit and there can be some noise from upstairs guests, so this unit may not be the best for light sleepers. We do provide two white noise machines for bedroom and living room sleeping! * Laundry is available, but we request you avoid using it between 10am-4pm if possible as that is when our cleaning team uses it for turnovers. * Parking passes available for $10 a day**.

The unit comfortably fits a family/group trip of 8 and has authentic unit architecture to make for a true Chicago experience. neighborhood_overview: Lincoln Park is a lovely neighborhood on the north side of Chicago that allows travelers the opportunity to experience all of what Chicago has to offer! The restaurants, boutique coffee shops, art gatherings, and live music venues are all a walk away!
transit: The Brown Line (Armitage) L stop is 5 minutes walking which gets you to Wrigleyville and the Financial district of Chicago!

host_about: Hey there! I'm Luke and welcome to one of the best cities in the world!  Chicago has so much to offer with its food, music, art, parks, and of course beautiful Lake Michigan, guests are sure to have a great time here.  As a Chicago native I enjoy sharing the treasures of this city with as many people as possible, and what better way to do that than Airbnb!  As your host, I will provide you with all the knowledge you need to make Chicago feel like home. While at the same time, providing you with a simple, first class, and cost effective service.  Please do not hesitate to contact me with any questions.  I look forward to meeting you and wish you the best of times in Chicago!

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is fairly quiet. However, we are in a major city, so expect some road noise, train, occasional siren, etc. Not an overly dangerous area, just use your travel common sense, be polite, and don't wander about during ridiculous hours and you’ll be just be fine here, ima. Group, pair, solo or with children !
notes: We do have furry friends in our home, two dogs and a cat! Guests can have as much or as little interaction with pets as they’d like (i.e. if dogs make you uncomfortable we’ll keep them confined to our personal space on the top floor for your stay). HOWEVER, those who are definitely allergic to dogs and/or cats may want to reconsider staying here if it will affect their health!
transit: We are steps from Red and Green Line stops, as well as a Divvy (rental bike) rack, and you can catch the water taxi about a block away.  Bring your car and park on the street for free and without a permit. Alternatively, utilize Uber and/or Lyft for a no-hassle ride. There is also lots (including soldier field) within walking distance!

interaction: Need help, recommendations, maps, etc? Just ask! Contact us ahead of time for special requests. THERE ARE LOTS OF EXTRAS AVAILABLE HERE...Let us know what we can do to help make your stay a great one!
house_rules: - Generally, we observe quiet hours between 10 pm and 8 am (it's ok to shower and make your breakfast, but no TV, loud conversations, etc.). If you need to come in late, not a problem with advanced notice so we don't hit you with a baseball bat ;)  Feel free to utilize the kitchen to prepare meals. However, please clean up your dishes etc. Let us know of any special requests ahead of time. We can accomodate a family, if children etc. are willing to sleep on an air mattress or cot during their visit. Pets MAY be welcome with prior authorization from your host.  Common spaces are available for use, but all areas above the second floor are off limits to guests without host’s permission. Laundry room is available for use, drop $1 in the jar per wash/dry (honor system) to offset supplies/utilities. A PHOTOGRAPH OF THE BOOKING GUEST'S GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID CARD WILL BE TAKEN AT CHECK-IN IN EXCHANGE FOR KEYS TO ACCESS THE PROPERTY.  We're pretty easy going, if you're not sure...just ask!
host_about: Hello, we are a laid-back, family of five.  Having lived abroad ourselves, we are very social, and enjoy meeting new people.  We truly enjoy living in Chicago, and love to share our favorite spots and tourist tips with visitors!

name: Private suite in Lincoln Square
summary: Our basement apartment is brightly decorated, has its own entrance. We have a fridge, microwave, coffee maker, mini-oven to make quick meals. We have a queen size bed, a sofa sleeper, big screen TV and a full bathroom.
space: Our space is perfect for people who want to explore downtown yet get a feel for a true Chicago neighborhood. It feels more like your own apartment than a hotel room. There is no need for a car as we are close to the Brown Line stop. Our rental space has its own entrance and is separate from the rest of our house so you can have as much privacy as you want. The rooms are located in our fully finished basement, they are heated and cooled but we have extra blankets in the closet and heaters in our laundry room if needed. We have a sofa sleeper with a memory foam mattress if you want to share the space with friends or family. The main room where bed, TV and bookcases are is carpeted. There is a DVD player and XBOX. You will be given your own log-in and password for internet access. The sofa sleeper besides the eat-in area has a new queen memory foam mattress. The bathroom has a double sink and shower, we provide towels as well as a hairdryer. We also have soap, lotion, shaving needs in the
description: Our basement apartment is brightly decorated, has its own entrance. We have a fridge, microwave, coffee maker, mini-oven to make quick meals. We have a queen size bed, a sofa sleeper, big screen TV and a full bathroom. Our space is perfect for people who want to explore downtown yet get a feel for a true Chicago neighborhood. It feels more like your own apartment than a hotel room. There is no need for a car as we are close to the Brown Line stop. Our rental space has its own entrance and is separate from the rest of our house so you can have as much privacy as you want. The rooms are located in our fully finished basement, they are heated and cooled but we have extra blankets in the closet and heaters in our laundry room if needed. We have a sofa sleeper with a memory foam mattress if you want to share the space with friends or family. The main room where bed, TV and bookcases are is carpeted. There is a DVD player and XBOX. You will be given your own log-in and password for internet
neighborhood_overview: We are in the heart of Lincoln Square within a mile we have over 20 restaurants.  You will find lots of great restaurants and bars along Lincoln Avenue and Rockwell Street. You will find jogging and biking trails along the river and an outdoor pool in the summer in River Park, less than a mile from our house. We are 3 miles from the lake (there is a bike lane on Lawrence Avenue all the way to the lake), 2 miles from Andersonville another great Chicago neighborhood with lots of great shops and restaurants (a 10-minute-bike-ride), 2 miles from Wrigleyville if you are a Cubs fan (a 10-minute-train-ride), 1 mile from North Park College (a 10-minute-walk). Lincoln Square is a very family-oriented neighborhood with lots of parks and small family-owned businesses, we have a grocery store within a few blocks of our house as well as a great gym.
notes: We have a 5-year-old Labrador named Sammy who you will meet. He is extremely friendly and loves to meet new friends. Our neighbors have a chicken coop (no rooster).
transit: We are a few blocks from the Lawrence bus stop and the Rockwell stop for the EL train, there is plenty of parking on our street and there is a Hertz rental company on Lincoln Avenue (less than a 10-minute-walk from our house). The El train takes you downtown in 30 minutes, you can also take the Metra Train if you want to make less stops and get downtown in 15 minutes.
access: You will be able to sit and relax in our backyard as we have chairs available. You will also have access to our laundry room that is located in our basement near your eat-in area. We also have 2 bikes with a lock if you wish to use them.
interaction: I will make sure to be home when you arrive and give you as much details about our neighborhood, such as where to go out for breakfast, dinner, how to get to the bus, train, where to go for bike rides. You can text me anytime if you need directions, recommendations or have any request.
house_rules: No pets allowed. No smoking allowed. Please take off your shoes.
host_about:
Love traveling, discovering new places, finding great places to eat.
Decided to be a host at the end of May 2015 after having such great experiences being a guest through Airbnb.
My happy place is Austin, Texas. Great outdoors, great food, great people. Plus wonderful yoga studios.
Love helping people out as a host and help them discover our neighborhood.
My motto is keep on smiling no matter what happens.

name: Stylish Room in Chic Apt - Near Wrigley & DePaul
summary: This is a private room in a 3BR apartment (all 3 rooms are available on Airbnb). Restaurants, shops, bars, and Wrigley Field are all within walking distance. Downtown is a 12-minute train ride away via the nearby Belmont Red/Brown/Purple Line station. Trove guests have exclusive FREE access to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower. Check "Exclusive Trove Perks" in the listing description for details.
space: THIS TROVE HAS ✔ Queen-size bed ✔ Fully-Equipped Kitchen ✔ Turkish cotton bath and hand towels ✔ 44" HDTV w/ Netflix (no cable TV) ✔ Keurig coffee maker ✔ Body wash and shampoo ✔ Iron and ironing board ✔ Dishwasher --and more! EXCLUSIVE TROVE PERKS During your stay as a Trove guest, you receive a free membership to The Metropolitan, a members-only club and co-working space located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower (for reservations <14 days).  Included with your membership: ✔ Upscale co-working space, dining, and bars ✔ Stunning views of Chicago and Lake Michigan ✔ Discounted express tickets to the Willis Tower Skydeck Metropolitan Club Hours: Monday–Friday: 7am – 10pm Saturday: 5pm – 10pm Sunday: Closed HAVE A QUESTION? neighborhood_overview: We're located in Lakeview, one of Chicago's safest and most popular neighborhoods. Most of the area's restaurants, bars, and shops are concentrated on Belmont Ave,  Sheffield Ave, Clark St, Broadway St, and Halsted St. There are also plenty of hidden gems and tucked-away spots to discover for those who like to wander. THINGS TO DO NEARBY ✔ Walk to Wrigleyville and catch a Cub's game. ✔ Admire the Chicago skyline from the Lakefront Trail. ✔ Catch a live show at the Vic Theatre. ✔ Choose from over 300 beers at Beermiscuous.
notes: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS 1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?” Directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. We're a short walk from the Belmont 'L' train station. Search for “Belmont Red Line station Chicago” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest. 2. “Is there parking nearby?” Parking in Chicago is often difficult and even more so in the evening and during special events. We recommend using a service called SpotHero because it allows you to reserve a nearby paid parking spot in advance so that you don’t have to worry about finding parking when you arrive. 3. When is check-in/check-out? Check-in is 3 p.m. or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room. Check-out is at 11 a.m. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11 a.m., but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up
transit: Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber. ￫ The Belmont Red/Brown Line 'L' train station is a 5-minute walk away. ￫ O'Hare is 55 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber. ￫ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.
access: Your room is your own private space and the rest of the apartment is shared.
interaction: WHY STAY WITH TROVE? ⭐ Fast Communication We’re always on call to answer your questions, typically within 30 minutes. ⭐ Experienced Hosts We’ve hosted thousands of guests over five years. ⭐ Exclusive Perks Trove Guests have access to the Metropolitan Club, located in the Willis Tower. ⭐ Easy Self-Check-In Keyless access means no keys for you manage during your stay! ⭐ Central Location You’ll never be far from local spots to check out, sights to see, and public transit.
house_rules: 1) Only the reservation holder and guests added to the reservation via Airbnb may have access to the apartment.   2) As a courtesy to any other guests who you might be sharing the apartment with, please clean up after yourself immediately in the common areas. 3) As a courtesy to your fellow guests and to your neighbors, please keep noise to a minimum, especially between 9 pm - 9 am. 4) This is a non-smoking apartment. If smoke is detected, a cleaning fee of $150 will be charged. 5) No late check-outs. Check-out is at 11 am.  In order to compensate our cleaning assistants for lost time, additional charges will be sent if they're unable to begin their job at 11 am. One hour or less - $25 Each additional hour - $40 6) Damaged/stained/missing towels, bedding, and/or furnishings will incur additional fees. The per-item fees are as follows: Bedsheet- $12 Towel - $12 Pillow - $30 Pillowcase: $10 Comforter - $50 Clothes hangers - $3 Furnishings - Dependant on item
host_about: We're excited to join the Airbnb community! Our children have been using it for years and we recently started hosting.  I'm an attorney and my wife Patricia is an accountant. We love cooking, grilling in the summer, and spending time with our children and grandchildren.

name: Queen Size Bedroom on Top Level in Charming 2-Flat
summary: This well-kept updated home overlooks a spacious private garden. A 10-15 minute walk (or very short bus ride) to the Logan Square train station makes it convenient to O'Hare Airport. The property is securely gated and uniquely set back from the street, providing extra comfort and quiet. Guests will enjoy the modern remodeled kitchen and bathroom, a TV with Netflix, as well as a covered balcony directly outside. Please acknowledge the house rules with additional details before booking. Thank you!
space: Guests can relax in the spa-like bathroom with over-sized jetted tub and separate shower. The kitchen offers granite counters with top-of-the-line stainless steel appliances and cookware. A laundry washer/dryer is also available inside the unit.   The guest room features 2 east-facing windows, wood floors, a desk work-space, closet space, and a queen size handmade organic cotton mattress.  Only eco-friendly cleaning products are used in the home. The space is well suited for those who prefer a chemical-free space and for those with allergy sensitivities. The house itself is a 2-flat containing only 2 separate apartments- one downstairs as well as this listing upstairs. There is a nice sense of calm comfort here, away from the hustle of a typical city hotel or a crowded apartment building.

neighborhood_overview: Logan Square and Avondale have so much to offer, you can expect a wide variety of top-notch entertainment and restaurant options- even a few in the immediate vicinity of the house within 5-10 minutes walk. Logan Square is best known for the large community farmer's market held every weekend.
notes: There are no pets living in the apartment, however the neighbors do have dogs which you might encounter once you are inside the gated property. Please be aware that dogs may be present outside, downstairs.
transit: The apartment location is very desirable and convenient to many public transit (CTA) options. In less than 5 minutes you can walk to a major bus stop where- along with many other choices- you can catch a bus directly to the lake-front. Or, you can walk less than 15 minutes to the "L" and hop on the blue-line at the Logan Square stop. The blue line takes you directly to or from the O-Hare Airport in one direction, or further into the city in the opposite direction. It is also very easy to hire a ride-share at any time such as Lyft or Uber.
access: Guests are encouraged to make themselves at home at all times! Feel free to take a bath, cook a meal, or watch TV at any time.
interaction: **PLEASE NOTE: DURING THIS TIME GUESTS WILL HAVE THE ENTIRE APARTMENT ALONE, AND YOU WILL NOT HAVE ANY MEETING OR PHYSICAL INTERACTION WITH THE HOST OR OTHER GUESTS. DON'T WORRY, CLEANING IS TAKEN EXTRA SERIOUSLY DUE TO COVID-19.**  The guest bedroom is one of 2 private bedrooms in the apartment. The other bedroom belongs to (me) the host. Yes, I live here! As an experienced Airbnb host I'm happy to share my home with guests, while also offering you privacy during your stay. Even though I might not see you every day at the apartment, I am always available to answer questions and provide suggestions or recommendations if asked.
house_rules: 1) No extra visitors. Only registered guests on your Airbnb reservation will be allowed to access the property during your stay. 2) Quiet hours are respected between 12am-9am. Please plan to account for any potential conflicts with this schedule. 3) Smoking of any kind is NOT allowed inside. Smoking is okay on the balcony outside. 4)  NO excessive drinking, NO drugs of any kind, NO late night party-goers returning long after normal bar closing of 2am. 5)  Eating and drinking is allowed only in the kitchen and not in the guest room or common areas. 6)  All personal items must be kept in the guest room except food/drink and bath items. 7)  Please be animal-friendly to the neighbors' dogs.

name: Stylish Chicago Apartment near Public Transit
summary: Discover true escape in this tastefully appointed home. The space features contrasting textures and motifs, mid-century modern revivalist furnishings and decor, neutral tones, wood flooring throughout, and flowing living areas.
space: -Professionally designed space with modern furniture that is equally relaxing and comfortable. This unit is large and spacious with tall ceilings.   -The entire unit is for your own use.  The 50" Flat Screen TV in the living room has Cable TV and Netflix. -Brand new stainless steel appliances in the kitchen, including Fridge, Microwave,& Gas Stove/Oven Range, Toaster, and Kuerig Coffee Machine.  -3 Bedrooms and 1 Bathrooms available! Sleep in a comfortable 12" Gel Infused Memory Foam Mattresses. All Bedrooms have queen size beds, sound machines, tower fans, and extra blankets.   Sleeps up to 6 people comfortably!  -Basic Dinnerware, Cutlery, Drinking Glasses, and Pots & Pans provided. -We provide complimentary snacks, coffee, & water bottles.  -We provide towels, toilet paper, toothpaste,  shampoo, conditioner, and body wash for your use.  -We have a washer and dryer in-unit. You may use it at your convenience. Detergent is not provided by host.
description: Discover true escape in this tastefully appointed home. The space features contrasting textures and motifs, mid-century modern revivalist furnishings and decor, neutral tones, wood flooring throughout, and flowing living areas.
neighborhood_overview: Irving Park neighborhood is located on the Northwest Side of Chicago. The property boasts access to several other Chicago areas such as Wrigleyville, Logan Square, North Center, Albany Park, Lincoln Square, and much more.
notes: -There is additional street parking on adjacent blocks, but please consult all street signs before parking.  Host is not responsible for any parking citations or tows during your stay.  -All guests need to be attentive to the house rules during their stay, as we have other tenants at the property.  -Neighbors have called and will call the police for any guests who do any illegal activities, including smoking Marijuana on the premise.  -Any guests caught smoking inside the unit will have their reservation canceled as well as be fined $200 for damages for cleaning and restoring the unit.  -We have STRICT rules against noise, music, and/or partying and have cancelled reservations due to complaints in the past.

access: Unit Access is through the front of the property. Guests will access their unit through a private entrance. Instructions will be sent after confirmation of reservation and 3 days prior to your stay.
interaction: I am available by Airbnb App Messaging & Phone throughout your stay. You can simply call or text if you have any questions.  Please note there will be delayed response during after hours of 10pm-8am.

Also No smoking in the yard, please step outside of the gates. •	If caught smoking inside the unit, the host will charge guest $200 cleaning fee to restore the unit •	No Drugs allowed on the property (including Marijuana). •	Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property.  •	Do not download anything ILLEGAL or any COPYRIGHTED material using the internet we provide.  The cable company notifies us immediately and any guest caught in violation of this will have their reservation cancelled immediately and fined for the damages associated by the cable company. •	No Parties, No outside visitors, and No overnight guests without previous approval from me. •	Any approved additional overnight guests must pay the extra pers

No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty.  3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises unless you are in a designated smoking area. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid. 6.) Please do not use the
host_about: Avid traveler for work and pleasure. Have been to almost every continent with significant time spent in NYC, China, SE Asia, India and Brazil. I am proud to have been awarded the Airbnb Superhost Badge and enjoy making guests feel as at home in my place as I do!

My younger brother will say that I am too laid back, yet surprisingly entrepreneur minded. My younger sister will tell you that I always need an excuse to laugh. My friends will say that Jide is ambitious, funny, outgoing & addicted to personal growth. My coworkers perceive me as a team player, innocent, efficient; they call me hustle B. I would say.. I LOVE , LOVE SALSA dancing... AND potlucks!


Books: The Four agreements, Think & Grow Rich, Calling in the One, Rich Dad Poor dad, A New Earth, The Power of the Subconscious Mind, A Return to Love, Angels & Demons, 21 Irrefutable laws of leadership, Never Eat Alone ............The greatest networker in the world. TEDTalks

You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like.  The neighborhood is extremely safe even at night :)
space: Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 5 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!) The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. neighborhood_overview: 100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.
transit: "UIC Halsted" is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking).  Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 5 minutes to downtown. O'Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 40 minutes to O’Hare. Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC-Halsted." About 45 minutes to Midway. Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than10 minutes for about $6 :)
house_rules: Please read your check-in instructions carefully Please no overstaying past your checkout time
host_about:
Hello! My name is Natalia, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, Marina, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an investment banker in the loop. 

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

name: Bill Murray Suite in Trendy Hood! NEW Mini-fridge!
summary: Welcome to the Bill Murray Suite! We live in the historic neighborhood of Ukrainian Village in a third story walk up. You get a private room to relax on a quiet street just blocks away from buzzing shops & restaurants in Wicker Park. AND we have a brand new mini-fridge! We have been hosting Airbnb guests for over SIX years and like to treat our guests like friends are visiting. If you have any questions please let us know.
space: A wonderfully amazing space on the third floor of a historic 1908 three flat walk-up building - free exercise! Our dining room, living room, and kitchen have views of the Willis tower out the window. The room can comfortably sleep two people and has a full-sized bed. Starting January 1, 2020 recreational marijuana is legal in the state of Illinois! We have a few smoke spots for you to enjoy. There are a couple of dispensaries not too far from our home. You will have the largest room in our flat (14 feet by 9 feet), with a desk so you can get any work done or plan your adventures in Chicago. Located in the heart of Ukrainian Village/ West Town, we are on a quiet neighborhood street just blocks away from restaurants, live music, bars, and anything else you could dream of. Let us know if you need any recommendations. We also have ample comfy seating in our living and dining rooms.  Whether you are traveling for enjoyment, or business- our space is much more relaxing than a stuffy hotel ro
description: Welcome to the Bill Murray Suite! We live in the historic neighborhood of Ukrainian Village in a third story walk up. You get a private room to relax on a quiet street just blocks away from buzzing shops & restaurants in Wicker Park. AND we have a brand new mini-fridge! We have been hosting Airbnb guests for over SIX years and like to treat our guests like friends are visiting. If you have any questions please let us know. A wonderfully amazing space on the third floor of a historic 1908 three flat walk-up building - free exercise! Our dining room, living room, and kitchen have views of the Willis tower out the window. The room can comfortably sleep two people and has a full-sized bed. Starting January 1, 2020 recreational marijuana is legal in the state of Illinois! We have a few smoke spots for you to enjoy. There are a couple of dispensaries not too far from our home. You will have the largest room in our flat (14 feet by 9 feet), with a desk so you can get any work done or plan you
neighborhood_overview: Ukrainian Village is a historic neighborhood centrally located to just about everything in Chicago. The area is VERY safe and safe to park your car. We are only a mile or two from the freeways and a convenient public transit ride away from other neighborhoods (though, there's so much to do within walking distance!) The Empty Bottle is just down the street from us! You will probably also hear us recommending Bite cafe- they are delicious and we love them. (and they're 1.5 blocks away!) While our street may be quiet, it is close to all the restaurants, coffee shops, bars, concert venues, and more.
notes: Watch your head when you're coming up the stairs. The ceiling is low and were originally made for tiny Ukrainians (people were shorter 100+ years ago) at one spot and we wouldn't want you to bump your head :) Our little dogs Charlie and Franklin are super friendly. They are hypo-allergenic Miniature Poodle, so if you hang out in the living room with us, he might just become your best friend. They loves being loved, but also will respect your private space as well.
transit: We are located near a number of bus lines, Divvy bike share stations, as well are the CTA Blue Line (the train that goes straight to O'hare Airport). You can walk to a multitude of places as well! NEW!! We have electric scooters in our neighborhood now! You can use an app like Uber or Lyft to see where they’re at, reserve one, and zip around the city.  If you are driving, there is plenty of free non permit street parking.
access: Mi casa es su casa (my house is your house) while you stay here. On a side note, we are huge fans of coffee so there is always a fresh pot (or french press around). Feel free to use our kitchen if you want to cook anything!
interaction: We work mainly from home and you will share the space with us (hi new roommate!), other guests in the Spacious Private Room, and our doggies. We are around and available if you need anything or have any questions. Let us know if you have any questions about fun things to do or great restaurants to check out. There are so many in the area, we also have maps and other resources you may need.
house_rules: Please take off your shoes upon entering enter our home. There is positively no smoking of cigarettes allowed in our home whatsoever.  Please do not ring the bell for other apartments in our building. It takes us a second to come down from the third floor. You will of course have your own set of keys as well. You can store your luggage here after checkout for an extra $20, please make this arrangement prior to checkout so we can make sure that we are available.
host_about:
From Chicago, photographer, lover of travel, my wife and dogs.

I love the “Last Week Tonight” and I secretly still aspire to host my own talk show. I love NPR, The Young Turks, and reading books on my iPad/iPhone.

I love our city apartment- it allows me to moderate my bazillion hobbies from beer brewing on the back porch 5 gallons at a time to keeping a vertical herb garden with a shoe organizer. It's kind of like cooking, but with baby potatoes you know? Plus, it's an excellent excuse to have a cigar collection... because they're small.

I'm a collection of different things- in high school I was on the football team, but also a band geek.

I still could eat pizza for every meal and continuously watch Arrested Development on a loop if you let me.

Dana Gould is my favorite comedian.

My key to life is if you're not having fun, then you're not doing it right.

Whenever I can make Ela laugh consider my day made.

NO SMOKING: Smoking is strictly prohibited ANYWHERE inside the building, front porches or enclosed back porches or within 15' of any entry door, window or ventilation intake. Disposing of cigar/cigarette butts on the property (lawns, flowerbeds, flower pots, driveways, parkways, etc.) WILL NOT be tolerated. Ashtrays are provided for guests. interaction: I'm always available.
house_rules: SAMPLE: CHICAGO GUEST HOUSE RENTAL AGREEMENT BE ASSURED WHEN WRITING the POLICIES; MY #1 GOAL is CUSTOMER SATISFACTION for ALL MY GUESTS.  All Guest will be required to agree to the stipulation/terms of this rental agreement (SAMPLE BELOW) prior to your stay. It will be emailed to you for signature through Docusign®. Please review CAREFULLY so as not to have any misunderstandings. In the event you as the signer of this rental agreement feel you cannot vouch for ALL MEMBERS of YOUR party (support as being true, certain, reliable); I would suggest you consider alternative accommodations. These are multi-unit buildings, I do my BEST to make sure the buildings are booked with groups having ‘LIKE DYNAMICS’---families with children with other families with children. Young adults with other young adults, seniors with other seniors, etc. This policy helps to better insure that everyone staying in the home will have a positive enjoyable experience. SUMMARY: •	AGE RESTRICTIONS: 35 ---We are a FA
host_about:
Someone once told me, "Find a Job You Love and Never Work a Day In Your Life!" Well, in 2005, that is exactly what I did when I opened the doors to Chicago Guest House.  So, if you're the type of person looking for a unique & memorable experience --someone who appreciates spaces with a 'personal touch' then you've come to the right place. This business is my passion and I think it shows!

neighborhood_overview: The studio is perfect for visiting scholars, conference attendees, business travelers or students externing at the medical center----it is fully furnished with everything you’ll need. The kitchen counter has counter-high chairs with backs for your use if work space is needed. Located on a  tree-lined street, it is just five minutes to University of Chicago campus and ten minutes to the Medical Center, Lutheran School of Theology, and McCormick Seminary. The apartment is on campus bus route, near the library, fitness center and just five minutes from Court Theatre. The lakefront, Frank Lloyd Wright Robie House, Museum of Science & Industry, and site of the Obama Presidential Center are within two miles. It is close to DuSable, Oriental and Smart Museums, Divvy bikes and bowling too.  Hyde Park is one of the city’s gems with easy access to downtown Chicago via bus or train in about 30 minutes. You’ll find a variety of restaurants, supermarkets, shopping, a movie theatre, and live music -
notes: I provide the coffee maker, coffee and tea to get your day started. The space is easily accessible with a private entrance directly into studio.  You'll love the convenience and privacy of the studio with a  private entrance.   One of the airport shuttles even makes a stop just 5 minutes away on the U of C campus. Go Airport Shuttle (Website hidden by Airbnb) or (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
transit: On-street parking and close to public transportation options. Easy public transportation via bus or train will take you there. Added bonus, one of the Shared Shuttles to Midway or O'Hare airport will make a pick-up/drop-off just 5 minutes away (on campus) when you reserve in advance. I'll be glad to share details well in advance of your Check-In date.
access: You'll enjoy the entire studio with a Private Entrance. It is furnished and the kitchen is equipped with the cookware, dishes, & utensils.  You’ll find fresh bed linens, generous towels, and a coffeemaker that will wake you to the aroma of fresh coffee. If you need access to coin-operated washer & dryer, just let me know.
interaction: I am here to greet you when you arrive and show you the studio.  If you have questions, need suggestions or directions, I am just a phone call or text away. I'll be glad to share info that may be helpful for an enjoyable stay in the city.
house_rules: -Unit will accomodate two adults. Nominal fee ($15) charged for Guest+One  - No drugs or firearms on premises. - Please be considerate of residents in the building. -No candles - No smoking -Guests should wash their dishes. Dish drain rack and dish detergent stored under kitchen sink. -Accidents can happen; if you break something, please say something to ensure the safety of the next guest.  -If you adjust the heat, please turn it off before checking out. -Please DO NOT discard personal hygiene items in the toilet.
host_about: Hi I’m Charla a food enthusiast, blogger and, a former food editor.  I’ve  stirred a few pots in my career including a stint as a Concierge in the heart of the city’s magnificent mile shopping district.  I’ve lived in Philly and Birmingham, Alabama, but there is no place like my hometown of Chicago. I’m always delighted to share info on food, restaurants, and other attractions in the city.  I love great bookstores, good pizza, and keep my phone handy shooting food photos.

name: Goose and Fox Hostel Lincoln Park South
summary: A private basement available in Lincoln Park 2 flat, a nice neighborhood near downtown. The basement will accommodate two people very comfortably with 2 seperate beds, wireless internet, private bathroom with a BASIC/MINIMALIST set up.
space: The layout allows for a lot of privacy as your rooms and bathroom are located in the basement area of my home. I work from home and occupy the upstairs. I operate an Organic Catering Company called "Goose & Fox", as well as a recording studio. The building itself is over 100 years old and located in awesome part of town.
description: A private basement available in Lincoln Park 2 flat, a nice neighborhood near downtown. The basement will accommodate two people very comfortably with 2 seperate beds, wireless internet, private bathroom with a BASIC/MINIMALIST set up. The layout allows for a lot of privacy as your rooms and bathroom are located in the basement area of my home. I work from home and occupy the upstairs. I operate an Organic Catering Company called "Goose & Fox", as well as a recording studio. The building itself is over 100 years old and located in awesome part of town. We have a shared lounge, bathroom and table space available to guests. The upstairs is my personal apartment. I try to give my guests as much space as I think they want or need. If I am around, I am accessible but not in your space, meaning I am working in my office with the door slightly cracked or doing something upstairs while you are downstairs in your bedroom or bathroom. I also operate a recording studio so sometimes I am upstairs
neighborhood_overview: The place is located in the heart of Historic Lincoln Park with easy access to the Armitage Brown Line stop and the "el".  We are in the best possible location if you need access to downtown we are literally a 5-10 minute train ride away. Lincoln Park is home to DePaul University and boasts tree-lined lakefront paths for biking/jogging, a vibrant shopping district, beach, dozens of ethnically diverse restaurants, live music venues, movie theaters and more. north avenue beach, and the lakefront, are less than 10 minutes from our home. Breakfast is offered at an additional charge with your stay but you must verify the time  you want prior to your arrival or the day before when you arrive. Breakfast can be served at any time and is cooked to order so you can sleep in if you need to, but you must arrange it with the host so we can make sure we have everything we need to give you a great breakfast.  -full cooked to order breakfast (omelettes, frittattas, potatoes, french toast, pancakes, lo
notes: Hostels provide budget-oriented, sociable accommodation where guests can rent a bed, usually a bunk bed, in a dormitory and share a bathroom, lounge and sometimes a kitchen. There are several differences between hostels and hotels, including: Hostels tend to be budget-oriented; rates are considerably lower. For those who prefer an informal environment, hostels do not usually have the same level of formality as hotels. For those who prefer to socialize with their fellow guests, hostels usually have more common areas and opportunities to socialize. The dormitory aspect of hostels also increases the social factor. Hostels are generally self-catering. PLEASE DO NOT - Do anything illegal - Smoke inside (Thank You) - Invite guests over without prior written approval -ask me about parking (do the research, (Hidden by Airbnb) directions) Valid IDs will be required upon checking in. I can be very flexible with move in and move out times as long as I can get the apartment cleaned for the next ai
transit: I DO NOT PROVIDE PARKING. STOP ASKING ME ABOUT PARKING. WE ARE LOCATED IN A LARGE CITY. PARKING IS DIFFICULT. Public transit is a much better option. Buses and trains are literally ride outside my front door and about a minute walk from the apartment (train ride downtown is then only a 10 minute ride) Cabs: No more than a moments wait to flag a cab directly out front of my place day and night. This is a safe area where you can walk around at night as well. Parking: We are about 5 minutes from downtown so Parking is limited, random and mostly based on luck like any populated urban area. research the neighborhood and plan ahead. I do not provide parking and due to the popularity of the area my recommendations will only go so far. Our location is great for public transit, which we recommend you use. Here are some tips:  (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Or reserve your spot with Spot Hero:
access: We have a shared lounge, bathroom and table space available to guests. The upstairs is my personal apartment.
interaction: I try to give my guests as much space as I think they want or need. If I am around, I am accessible but not in your space, meaning I am working in my office with the door slightly cracked or doing something upstairs while you are downstairs in your bedroom or bathroom. I also operate a recording studio so sometimes I am upstairs recording stuff. I also have two friendly dogs who generally hang with me in the office. They sometimes bark when people arrive but are super friendly after a couple minutes. They do not have access to the basement. On the other hand, if you need answers or just want to talk, I always enjoy this part of the host experience. I try to let the guest set the pace when it comes to how much interaction we have.
host_about:
Thank you for your interest in the Goose & Fox Hostel! We've enjoyed hosting many guests from all over the world , and we're always excited to share our wonderful city and neighborhood with new visitors. 

I've lived in the Lincoln Park neighborhood for almost 10 years and have seen a lot of amazing changes. There is always a new bar or restaurant opening. As a Chef and Musician I am tapped into some great scenes here in Chicago. We are lucky to have such vibrant Art, Music and Dining in the Second City.

I grew up in Chicago and returned home in 2006 after earning an Communications degree from Carthage College. After many years working in the Hospitality Industry I started Goose & Fox Supper Club in 2013. Over the years, we've updated and expanded our space to include the Goose & Fox Hostel, A laid back environment with access to a great city.

summary: Private room in the heart of Wicker Park/Bucktown area! My husband Kevin and I live in the condo and rent out our second bedroom part-time for extra money while we are finishing our degrees. Currently we are only accepting shorter reservations of 2 weeks or less. Our condo is very clean, comfortable, and in a great neighborhood within a few minutes walking distance to the Damen blue line stop, lots of shopping, bars, and restaurants. Please feel free to send a message if you have any questions.
space: We try to make our guests feel as comfortable as possible and provide you with as many amenities as we can, and help you with any information you may need for getting around, good restaurants, shopping places, etc.. We use airbnb when I travel so I know what I look for and try to accommodate my guests to provide as much comfort as I possibly can. The room has a full size comfortable bed with a desk and a chair and a closet with hangers. Just to keep in mind if you have trouble with stairs, there is a flight and a half of stairs to get up to my condo with no elevator.

neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park/Bucktown is an awesome area of Chicago. Very close to downtown with lots of cool restaurants, theaters, shopping, and bars, but still has a neighborhood feel. Our condo is very close to the main intersection but on a residential tree lined street that is a bit quieter.
notes: We do have 2 indoor cats so you just need to watch for them and make sure not to leave doors to the outside open. They are both very sweet and friendly with people though so they may beg for some attention now and then. Also, currently we are only accepting shorter stays of no more than two weeks.
transit: Very close to the Damen Blue Line stop (about 5 minute walk). Also right between the North Ave. bus and the Milwaukee bus lines and near the Damen bus line.
access: Our guests are free to help themselves to any areas of the condo except for our bedroom and office. Other than that feel free to use anything in the kitchen, laundry room, relax in the living room and watch T.V. or hang out on our large back deck. We have space set aside in the refrigerator and pantry if you want to buy any groceries or cook while you are here. We basically view our airbnb guests as short term roommates, so make yourself at home :)
interaction: We are absolutely happy to help you with any information you may need. From good breweries and restaurants to transportation and shopping, We will help you as best as we can if you need it.
host_about: I am a 31 year old graduate student in archaeology studying at the University of Illinois at Chicago.  I am very laid back, like to travel, hike, swim, have some drinks with friends, and meet new people.

name: Spacious condo with open floor plan and fireplace
summary: Residence on the Avenue is a beautiful Art Deco 4 flat located on the north shore of Chicago. The condo has been completely rehabbed and features hard wood floors, granite counter tops, custom cabinetry and an open floor plan. It is great for families and of course friends reconnecting.  We have been in the vacation rental business since 2003. Our first vacation rental is in County Kerry, Ireland. This condo is new to Air how ever it has been a vacation rental since 2009.
description: Residence on the Avenue is a beautiful Art Deco 4 flat located on the north shore of Chicago. The condo has been completely rehabbed and features hard wood floors, granite counter tops, custom cabinetry and an open floor plan. It is great for families and of course friends reconnecting.  We have been in the vacation rental business since 2003. Our first vacation rental is in County Kerry, Ireland. This condo is new to Air how ever it has been a vacation rental since 2009.
house_rules: We do offer garage/off street parking for a cost of $10. per night. We are pet friendly. The pet fee is $135. This includes service animals and ESP as well. We need to know prior to arriving if you would like to bring your pet. Pre approval is mandatory.
host_about:
I love to travel and explore different places and countries. I have been to most of the European countries. Ireland is my favorite and have a thatched cottage in County Kerry that has been a labor of love. Animals are a big passion of mine and I have 4 dogs. They are all rescue dogs and 2 of them are from Ireland. I support Young at Heart which is a No Kill senior animal rescue. My family is a big part of my life. I have a a son who has been a big part of working on the cottage since he was 7. Blessed to come from a very loving family. I have 3 sisters and 1 brother. My beautiful mother Mary Rose who is 92 works 5 days a week for our 63 year old family business. 
I was a member of the Guardsmen Drum and Bugle Corps from Schaumburg Il. I marched for 10 years and directed and taught this group for 17 (Website hidden by Airbnb) younger brother and sister also marched in the group. My parents and sisters were involved in some way or another. In 2012 the Harty Family was inducted in to the Heartland Drum Corps Association Hall of Fame. The Guardsmen made the DCI World Championship Finals 4 times. The indoor winter colorguard made the WGI World finals 10 times and won a Bronze medal in 1981. I was one of the founders of the WGI organization. 
We love Chicago and County Kerry. They are 2 amazing places to live and visit!

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is known for its  rapid growing selection of restaurants and bars. Logan Square is known to be one of the city's most trendiest communities, while also being the perfect place to host family friendly amenities encompassed by an exhilarating night life scene. Logan Square is an expansive neighborhood with sweeping boulevards on Chicago's West Side. It shares a wealth of dive bars and cheap rock venues with Bucktown, which becomes a high-fashion destination when close to Wicker Park.
notes: The building is 3 stories, the front of the building, 1st Floor Storefront, 3nd Floor are rented out thru Airbnb.  The apartment has 2 bedrooms, (1 queen bed / 2 twin beds) 1 bathroom, livingroom and  kitchenette (NO stove or oven). The back part of the building are rented apartments.  Our place is  located close to the Blue Line, the I 94 Kennedy Expressway, Downtown, Logan Square, Bucktown, Wicker Park, Humbolt Park,  and Lincoln Park. We are in a central location, free parking on the main street, delicious local restaurants, and an easy commute to anywhere in the city. 606 Trail The 606 brings together arts, history, design, trails for bikers, runners, and walkers, event spaces, alternative transportation avenues, and green, open space for neighbors, Chicagoans, and the world. We look forward to sharing The 606 with you and your family. Divvy Bike Station: Campbell Ave & Fullerton Ave
transit: Easy access to public transportation:  CTA Bus and Blue Line (Train) Bus routes along Milwaukee, Armitage and Western Ave Blue Line (Train): Western Station Western is a station on the Chicago Transit Authority's 'L' system, serving the Blue Line, on North Western Avenue near West Armitage Avenue. The station is located within the Bucktown neighborhood in the larger Logan Square community area. From Western, trains run at intervals of 2-7 minutes during rush-hour periods, and take 10 minutes to reach the Loop.
