neighborhood_overview: West Town is a quiet residential neighborhood just a few miles west of downtown Chicago. This condo is perfect for groups who want to get away from the hustle and bustle of downtown while still having quick and convenient access to everything Chicago has to offer. The house is 10 minutes away from Wicker Park, the United Center, River North, and the Loop.
notes: The balconies outside each of the bedrooms are your to use freely but please do not use the patio down the stairs in the back. That space is not ours, thank you for understanding! Please note that there is an extra guest fee of $20 per guest after 6 guests. This help cover the cost of larger groups while making our home affordable for smaller groups. Please be sure that your guest count is accurate when booking so we can be sure that the space is adequately prepared! We have equipped the home with a NoiseAware decibel monitoring system. No specific conversations will be heard or recorded, just the overall sound level. This is only to prevent any potential disturbances to neighbors, not to infringe on our guest's privacy.
transit: There's a Blue Line subway station about a 10 minute walk away, at the intersection of Milwaukee and Chicago Ave. The Blue Line runs all the way from O'Hare Airport to downtown so guests without a vehicle can rely on public transportation. If you choose to bring a vehicle with you, we're just a few minutes from the interstate. We also have a garage spot available in the rear of the building for our guests to use.
access: Guests will have full access to the condo, the private balconies, and one parking space. You will receive detailed check-in instructions a few days before your arrival through the booking platforms app or email. Please note that due to insurance liabilities, the fireplaces are not functional.
interaction: We are available as much or as little as you would like. We live nearby so we keep a pretty close eye on the property but we respect our guests' privacy.
house_rules: Please provide an accurate guest count prior to booking. Rates vary throughout the week and season and by number of guests. It's important that your guest count is accurate so we can be sure the home is adequately prepared and stocked for your stay. - Quiet hours between 10pm - 7am - Smoking Penalty: $500 + damages - Pet Penalty: $500 + damages - Late Check Out Fee: $25/half hour
host_about:
Hi, Thanks for taking a look at our special homes.

My name is Noah. A few years ago, my family and I got together to create an amazing experience for tourists and guests like you.

We are Chicagoans who love sharing our city with the world and strive to make your stay as comfortable as possible so you can enjoy the city like a local. 

We're passionate about travel. As experienced travelers, we've learned what creates a top notch experience and we're committed to sharing that experience with you. It's something we call "Sweet Home Chicago" and we hope you carry it back with you to where ever you call home! :)

You can find us hanging by the lake, catching a game at Wrigley, grabbing a drink in Wicker Park, enjoying the many concerts going on on any given night, or at any of the amazing local coffee shops across the city.

name: Amazing 2-Story Home ★High Ceilings ★Lincoln Park
summary: Enjoy this modern space with friends or family. Mid-century modern design meets “fun & cozy” in this professionally designed 2 story coach house. And with the CTA being only a SHORT walk away you can be anywhere in the city in under 15 minutes. *Enjoy the perfect place for a Family & Friends gathering in the spacious living area along with a private parking lot behind the home enough for 2 vehicles. Amazing Natural Light pours from the sky lights in the living area and is a joy to wake up in!
space: This is a professionally run listing. Giving you a comfortable Airbnb experience, without the worry of a bad listing. TRAIN INFO: I lived in this listing and even though it's beside the tracks it has never been an issue. It was always comforting and made me feel right in the heart of Old Town. You will be able to hear it, however, it will not interrupt your conversation inside and you won't have to turn up the TV. Outside you do have to stop talking for 5 seconds but it won't affect your experience.  The property is a blend of modern design and warm sophistication. The high ceilings and open concept living areas make you feel comfortable regardless of the number of guests.  Lastly, this is the type of home that will enhance your Chicago experience, because not only will you enjoy what Chicago has to offer but you'll also love coming home.

notes: Please remember that you're staying in a house, not a hotel. Please treat the space with respect. If any problems arise, we will do our best to take action ASAP, however, there is no one living on-site 24/7. PARKING: 2 free parking spots on premise. Street parking a couple blocks away.  TRANSIT: Subway (Red Line) across the street. Less than 30 seconds to get to. It will take you anywhere in town.

access: Entire space plus building amenities are included in this rental. Please, make yourself at home.
interaction: I am here for you during your stay, but our level of interaction is up to you. I'm only a phone call or message away. You will be able to self-check-in upon arrival.
house_rules: 1. Quite hour is 10 pm. Any Noise complaints will result in a $50 charge.  2. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 3. We do not allow smoking inside; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 4. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. It may be possible to obtain permission to host a party; contact our team to learn more. 5. If a location is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $40 for every extra hour of cleaning required. 6. Guests are not allowed to book a stay in their city of residence. 7. Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises or its facilities. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises. Guest
host_about:
I am a young entrepreneur that has lived in Windsor my entire life. I come from a big family with 4 brothers and 4 sisters. I love trying new things and going to new places, but who doesn't right?! 

Windsor is home and Illinois is my playground. Which is why I am so excited to share my listing with you!

If you decide to rent one of my properties - not only will you get a unique property in a great neighborhood - but I'll be happy to give you the insider's scoop on Chicago’s  best restaurants, cafes, bars, clubs, shopping, and services.

neighborhood_overview: Woodlawn is in a blossoming area of Chicago. It is just a stones throw away from Hyde Park and The University of Chicago. It is also about a 20 (30 depending on traffic )minute Uber Drive from Downtown. And about a 20 min Metra ride(we recommend using the Metra). We are not in the suburbs, nor do we live downtown. We are fairly close to downtown, especially if you decide to take the Metra. Please ask us about travel downtown, if you are booking to visit downtown. Our location is prime for those vising UofC, and Jackson Park. If you are coming from overseas, please be sure to get a plan where you have access to the internet. It will be crucial to your stay while out and about. You will find awesome neighborhood eats, shopping and some nightlife in Hyde Park.  The ambiance of the corner cafe is very nice, try the quiche!
notes: Great space, great neighborhood,  great condo, street parking is available. Sometimes, we cook dinner and you are more than welcome to join.  We have to ask that check in be kept to after 7pm or before 7am during the week.. We do have a lock box however during the winter it has a tendancy to be frozen. If checking in on the weekend, we have more flexibility.
transit: The Metra  is a few blocks from the door step, and will take you directly into downtown(Van Buren Stop). From there, the Red Line is your friend or Uber/Lyft  it to downtown. It is 20 - 30 minutes away depending on traffic. Be sure to ask your Uber/Lyft driver to take Lake Shore downtown, take in the magnificent view. We are not in the suburbs, nor do we live downtown. We do, however, live in the city of Chicago. We are fairly close to downtown, especially if you decide to take the Metra. Please ask us about travel downtown, if you are booking to visit downtown*(again we recommend using the Metra). Our location is prime for those vising UofC, and Jackson Park. If you are coming from overseas, please be sure to get a plan where you have access to the internet. It will be crucial to your visit while out and about.
access: kitchen, open to families, patio, LGBT friendly,  cafe near by, a block and a half from the  Metra, close to the University of Chicago, close to the lake,  FREE wifi,  FREE washer and dryer(please bring your own detergent), cabinet and fridge space.Netflix, , Hulu, Amazon Instant prime.
interaction: We are respectful of guests space and will make the key drop as easy as possible.
house_rules: - No smoking in the house - No loud music after 10 on weeknights -Please clean up after yourself (bathroom, kitchen,etc) - No parties  - Please remove your shoes upon entering - Ask us  anything  -Enjoy your stay
host_about:
We are a friendly, down to earth, semi-active couple. We love to catch Broadway in Chicago shows, walk by the lake, sit out on the deck, and use Groupon to take downtown adventures.  We are also minor foodies and love to indulge in new restaurants.

We love to meet new people from all walks of life and from around the world. We have a great deal of respect for other cultures and love to watch documentaries concerning such.

- Take the high road in life, it will get you everywhere -

summary: Our place is your home away from home! Our neighborhood is great, conveniently located and we pride ourselves in being the best hosts possible by providing you with all the information you need to make your stay in Chicago great. See full description
space: Quaint neighborhood right outside of busy downtown close to the United center, with lounges and bars within walking distance. Directly down the street from Navy Pier on Grand Ave. A few blocks from Harpo studios Bottom Lounge music venue. Free wifi, and a rare find in Chicago - free street parking!(when available, which is usually often.) More about the space and the area: A converted storefront, Blush Lounge is located in the west loop area, in one of the most entertaining neighborhoods in Chicago, close to all the sights, where there is always something to do. This private bedroom is located downstairs. It  has a big, comfy full size bed and TV monitor and a DVD player, sorry no cable. I have a few DVDs but I would suggest stopping by a Redbox before you come. Entertainment Within walking distance of Mahoney's Irish Pub, Grandbar which is a great lounge, Output, Beauty bar, and Union park which is host to many different music festivals and events including Pitchfork and North Coast,

host_about: Hi everyone!  Tracy and Josue here. :) We've been living in Chicago for quite some time now. Beautiful city to travel to! A little bit about us. I (Tracy) used to be a photographer but decided to change careers and become a Mortician.  Josue is a Socialite, Traveller, Humanitarian, Activist, Producer and Investor. We love everything we do and hosting for Airbnb is definitely one of them.  When our guests are happy we are happy. We will do everything we can to make your stay as comfortable and amazing as possible. Josue is great with directions, places to check out, things to do, events and nightlife. He knows how to make an awesome drink as well! I love to cook and try new recipes. We both like to go out and experience nightlife, love being foodies and trying out new restaurants when the time permits. Love to travel as well, but Chicago is our Home for now! We are happy to share the experience!

space: A cozy garden unit with its separate entrance so you can come as go as you like. The apartment is completely private and it is intended to be your home during your stay. Note: for anyone over 6ft there is ductwork that runs between the living room and the kitchen area( I’m 6ft and it’s not a problem) please consider this when booking.

Free street parking is available as well as permit parking( 1day parking permits will by available on the desk) The orange line is a 10 minute walk (4blocks) and will get you downtown in 20-25 minutes. ChinaTown is a 15 minute ride also on the orange line.  One way fare is $3 with one transfer to CTA bus or train within 2hours of purchasing fare. You can pay  cash or card. EASY check-in with our lock box. There is a permanent tenant in the apartment above y
notes: EASY check-in with our lock box. There is a permanent tenant in the apartment above you and may hear them walking upstairs. This may be an issue if your a very light sleeper. Security cameras are placed outside the home for everyone’s safety.  The guests will have full control of the temperature. Air conditioning by a portable air conditioner.  Being a garden unit, the floors can get a bit chilly in the winter. We suggest bringing a pair of slippers if traveling in colder months.  We love children and welcome yours, but we do not provided a crib however a playpen is available. Also the apartment is not baby proofed. There is potential for some furniture to tip if climbed on. We do provided children’s cups, plates, flatware and a Linen for playpen. An inflatable bed will be provided with the stay of a 4th guest. Our house is professional cleaned between guests. The bus stop is right outside the door and there is free parking. Easy access to I-90, Metra and Blue Line. Very close to O'hare and not far from downtown. Grocery stores and restaurants within walking distance. Drop me a line if you have any questions.

name: Hip, Lake Side,  Spacious 2 Bedroom Condo
summary: Our condo is spacious and in a wonderful location. We are close to everything Chicago has to offer, and in a small neighborhood where you can live like a local. Our condo is large enough to accommodate up to 5 quests comfortably.  Welcome to the Windy City!
space: The style is hip and inviting. The living room offers you a navy velvet sectional that you can lounge and enjoy a movie or endless episodes on Netflix. You can eat and enjoy the custom barn dining table and can easily accommodate 8-10 guests. The bedrooms are warm and inviting. Chose to stay in the spacious master bedroom with pink accents. Or travel to Paris in our bright, blue-and-gold guest bedroom.  Bon Voyage! Lastly, in the warmer months there is a outdoor patio that is beautifully manicured for outdoor dinners or rose.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is called Buena Park - it is lake side between Lakeview (to the south) and Uptown (to the north). In Lakeview, are the sub-neighborhoods of Boystown (the "Goy-borhood" and Wrigleyville (home of Wrigley field). In Uptown is lots of good good and the Aragon Ballroom.  Less than minute walk away is the Lake Shore Path, which runs parallel to Lake Michigan and has bike and running/walking paths. Its a great option to explore the city and see the picturesque skyline shots of the city.
notes: We have a dog that lives with us, but will not be present during your stay :)
transit: We are less than a 2 minute walk to the nearest bus lines which takes you downtown.  We are a 10-12 minute walk to the Red Line L-train, which can connect you to the entire city. On the end of our block is a Divy bike station where you can rent a bike for the day. Also - ubers/lyfts are also readily available in our city, too.
access: You'll have access to the entire space mentioned in the listing. There will be some closets that will be locked; please respect privacy and stay out of those spaces. Thank you!
interaction: I will be available via text for any questions or curiosities that come up during your stay. I will also have contacts nearby in case of emergency or the need for a face-to-face interaction.
house_rules: *shoes off when entering house *property has security cameras *this is also our home; please respect our belongings and privacy with locked doors/closets.  *our blue sofa is our baby! Please treat it like you would a small, delicate child. Please - no overnight guests on blue sofa. We can leave an air mattress  out for you if you need a place to crash extra from the two bedrooms.  *clean dishes before you leave  *sort recyclables :) ♻️

name: $1210/MO❤️ Specials Spacious Clean Comfy Studio
summary: A fully furnished home for your longer stay, complete with WiFi and everything you need to live. AFFORDABLE MONTHLY RATES ARE AVAILABLE!!! APRIL- $1210 MAY - $1520 Cubs fans, deep-dish fans, and history fans unite! Chicago is a fabulous getaway city for any interest, and our spacious studio apartment is the ideal place to stay while you’re here. Featuring modern decor, a full kitchen, and access to a 24/7 gym, your time in Chi-Town will be comfortable and convenient.
space: In the heart of trendy Uptown Chicago, our sophisticated studio apartment is the perfect launchpad for Windy City adventures or clinching that important business deal. Whatever brings you to town, you’ll rest easy in our charming, quiet neighborhood with easy access to the Red Line train to take you south to Downtown or north to Loyola and Evanston. Illuminated by sunny natural light, our studio feature a sofa bed, premium linens, and plenty of closet space so you can unpack and forget about your suitcase for a while. Enjoy the privacy of your own room, with doors that close and independently controlled air-conditioning units.  The apartment includes one full bathroom, with a shower, sink, and toilet. We’re all about helping you look (and smell) your best, so we provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in addition to hand soap and fluffy towels. Trust us when we say there’s no better way to warm up after a Windy City walk than a hot shower! There’s ample space for everyone to relax

Illuminated by sunny natural light, our studio feature a sofa bed, premium linens, and plenty of closet space so you can unpack and forget about your suitcase for a while. Enjo
neighborhood_overview: If you’re searching for Chicago history and culture, but you also want to get a good night’s sleep without the non-stop noise of Downtown, Uptown is your ‘hood. Uptown is slightly north of Downtown, and just a mile west of Montrose Beach and Lake Shore Drive. It’s safe, a little historic, a little trendy, and a perfect home base for any Chi-Town getaway. Our apartment is within walking distance of coffee shops (including a Starbucks), banks, and grocery stores. This hip neighborhood features old-school Chicago gems like the famed Riviera Theatre, the much-loved Fat Cat Restaurant & Bar, and easy access to Wrigley Field and Downtown via the Red Line from Lawrence Station. With plenty of good restaurants, vibrant bars, and exciting venues, you might find yourself not even wanting to venture downtown! Some of our favorite nearby restaurants include Fat Cat, where you can indulge in tasty pub grub over a game of pool, and Demera, an Ethiopian restaurant serving top-notch coffee shareable s
notes: ***WIFI service is an open connection  provided by the building management and is in the works of upgrading it. Outages may be experienced from time to time while the upgrade is on going. As of this moment, the service is NOT SUITABLE for remote work and can only cater mobile/portable devices. We highly recommend keeping your key fob in a safe place, because if you lose it, you’ll lose access to the entire building. Not fun. It takes time to replace it, which means you might be locked out of the building and the apartment for a while, and any fob replacement will incur a fee of $300. That’s probably not what you have in mind for a “memorable” trip to Chicago, so let’s just keep track of the fob. Our apartment includes lots of awesome amenities, but it does NOT include a parking space. If you need to park a vehicle, there is some metered street parking nearby. We recommend using the Spot Hero app to claim a street parking space. The city is easily accessible with public transit and ride
transit: Unless you’re really into parallel parking or overpriced meters, we recommend using public transportation to explore Chi-town. Our place is just a 5-minute walk to both the Argyle and Lawrence stations, where you can catch the Red Line. The Red Line will take you straight to Wrigley Field (7 minutes), or keep on riding for about 15 more minutes to access the best of Downtown. Grant/State Station is most convenient to the tasty restaurants of River North, and Lake Station puts you just 3 blocks from the Bean. P.S. Locals call the subway the “L.” Public transit is also an easy way to get to our place from O’Hare Airport, especially during rush hour. Hop on the Blue Line at the airport, and switch to the #51 bus at the Jefferson Park Transit Center. You’ll go from baggage claim to beautiful condo in only an hour! If ridesharing is more your style, Uber and Lyft are available throughout the Chicago metro. Keep in mind that traffic can pile up Downtown during major events or rush hour, whic
access: Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours.  But that’s not all! You’ll also have access to the building’s gym (open 24/7 and stocked with cardio machines and weights) and lobby lounge area. The building’s common spaces and your unit are accessible via elevator.
interaction: We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.
house_rules: - - *HOUSE RULES* Please read carefully to avoid any Cancellation of Reservation. or fines. - -No shoes. Please remove shoes upon arrival. - -No smoking. If you smoke inside the unit or property, we will cancel your reservation and we will fine you for $200 for damages. - -No Drugs (including Marijuana). - -Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property. - -No Parties or events, No outside visitors, and No overnight guests without previous approval from your host. - -Any approved additional overnight guests must pay the extra person fee outlined on our AirBnB profile. - -No pets, except Dogs & Cats are allowed. -Bathroom is meant for Shower Use Only. - -All food items should be stored in designated food areas and not left out, to avoid pests. - -Use kitchen freely but clean up any mess that is created, including dishes, counters, stove, microwave; no dirty dishes should be left in the sink overnight. - -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange
host_about:
Hostly was established in 2017 to help hosts and property owners navigate the wonderful world of Airbnb and vacation rentals. 

Our team of expert hosts are here to ensure your guests’ — and your — experience is awesome, and take the hassle out of your Airbnb or other short-term property rental management.

The team at Hostly is made up of talented local and international staff with extensive property management and hosting experience and will create a customized plan that incorporates your objectives, goals, and budget with utmost  transparency and clarity to grow a mutual partnership.

As metro Chicago's premier property management company with its strong local connections, Hostly offers a full line of services to create the best vacation rental experience.

Our services include: marketing, booking and payments, guest vetting, enhanced pricing model, guest support, on-site staffing coordination, cleaning service, and key delivery and checking in and out. We also offer value add-ons such as design and staging, creating your listing, and basically sharing our industry knowledge with you.

Today, Hostly stands out in the crowded property management field as the boutique vacation rental and BnB super hosts because of our consistent track record, our team and our focus on impeccable service as reflected in its online reputation and reviews.

access: We enjoy offering flexible check-in and check-out times, however, if you wish to check-in before 2 pm, please note we cannot always guarantee a clean bed will be immediately available due to the time it takes to clean and put on fresh linens. You are welcome to use the other rooms in the house or drop off your belongings until your bed is ready. Likewise, if you wish to check out after 11 am, we will need to move your belongings out of the bedroom at that time so we can clean, change the sheets and all rooms in the home. • Please, lock the door with your present code, upon my arrival I will be change code and go through the check-out list.  You'll have access to the dining room, living room, ROKU Cable Prime Account - HDMI Capability for Streaming Apps./Movies. The kitchen with fixin's for a great cuppa tea, your guest room with a firm, cozy queen size bed, and a private bathroom. There is also a privacy exit door between your area and the main exit door to the back of the house. Botto

host_about:
I've been self-employed for 20+ years from Real Estate Broker to a Restaurateur and now back as a Real Estate Broker. I specialize in locating that Dream house for that inspiring Family to the best Hospitality home for Air B-N-B Guests , so I'm definitely a people person. 
        Quoting my Mentor, " Allende has a unique kindness that is not understood by society.... Very professional and kind. ...Juan Mendez ..  
      On the social level,  I been a Chairman of numerous non-profit organizations and still involved in a number of neighborhood organizations . I'm also a Advocate for a Youth program mentoring  groups of male youths. 
    I like to read, attend church  workout, go to live events , enjoy as much as this beautiful City has to offer and visit as many restaurants as time permits.

name: North Woods/Mid-Century Inspired Pad in Bucktown/Wicker Park
summary: Play albums on a turntable and let music fill a generously proportioned space with high ceilings in the Wisconsin inspired mid-century space. Admire a collection of artwork and practice mixology skills at the bar. Prepare meals in a chef's kitchen and serve guests at an expansive dining table. Unwind by grilling and dining alfresco at the additional table and lounge in the secluded outdoor patio.
space: Located in a former brewery from the 1890's with 13 ft.+ ceilings, this huge Wisconsin/Mid-Century designed apartment was recently renovated and painstakingly outfitted with a massive vintage record collection, high-end and custom furniture, plush luxury mattresses with designer bedding, and period and Wisco inspired outfittings. The apartment is fully amenitized for our guests, and includes the following: *Self check-in with Electronic Keypads and Locks *Abundant Free Street Parking immediately adjacent to apartment *Air Conditioned with large fans in main areas and fans in both bedrooms *Two King Beds in Large Bedrooms, with luxury mattresses and pads. Pullout couch for third bed is in the main lounge. *Vintage Pendleton Throws, LL Bean Blankets, Ralph Lauren bedding and Genuine Wisco Deer Hides for cold winter nights *Complimentary Toiletries (Shampoo, Conditioner, Body Wash, etc.) and Towels Provided  *Pack n' Play, High Chair, Baby Bath, Toys, Children's Cutlery and More for the L

Admire a collection of artwork and practice mixology skills at the bar. Prepare meals in a chef's kitchen and serve guests at an expansive dining table. Unwind by grilling and dining alfresco at the additional table and lounge in the secluded outdoor patio.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in the trendy Bucktown neighborhood just a short ride outside of Chicago's CBD. Walk to numerous restaurants, bars, breweries, the 606 Trail and the Western Blue Line, with direct service to O'Hare. The surrounding neighborhoods of Wicker Park and Logan Square offer some of the most diverse restaurants, bars, boutique shops and cultural attractions in the entire city.
transit: Ample Free Street Parking without Permit immediately adjacent to apartment 5 min walk to CTA Western Blue Line Stop Immediate access to bus lines on Western Ave and Armitage Ave ZipCar directly across the street Less than 1 mile to Metra Clybourn Commuter Rail Stop 0.5 mile access to Interstate 90/94
access: The apartment is completely dedicated for guests with no personal effects. Additionally, the back gated patio area on the ground floor is also dedicated for guests. Patio furniture and a grill are available from Spring to Autumn.
interaction: We have lived together in Bucktown for over ten years, and now call it home with our little one. We take great pride in the neighborhood, particularly due to ancestral connections dating back to the 1800's, and want to ensure our guests not only have the most wonderful time in our AirBnb, but also in Bucktown and the surrounding neighborhoods of Chicago. We live right around the corner from the apartment, and one or both of us will be available at all times to respond to your requests or questions, and have never been know to turn down a drink if available. If you need any recommendations, from low-brow to high, kid friendly, or advanced age, we have you covered.

name: Coach House in the heart of Gold Coast
summary: Coach House in the heart of Gold Coast
space: You need to be able to walk up a flight of stairs.
description: Coach House in the heart of Gold Coast You need to be able to walk up a flight of stairs. Always available with any questions or concerns you may have. Gold Coast, bordering Lake Michigan, is an affluent, mostly residential neighborhood defined by its stately homes and high-rise apartment buildings. Upscale shopping and dining options can be found along tree-lined North Rush, North Clark and East Oak streets. Man-made Oak Street Beach offers seasonal open-air restaurants and city views. The International Museum of Surgical Science is housed in a 1917 mansion. Walk Score is 100!  Red line is 3 minute walk.  Michigan Ave is 5 minute walk. Oak Street beach is 15 minute walk.

house_rules: Chris's Top 10! :) 1) No shoes in the house please 2) No additional guests on premise unless requested 3) Common areas such as kitchen, living room, and dining room are closed by 11 PM.  4) This is shared house so please be conscientious of your noise (music, conversations, walking, etc) 5) Please be very careful with your suite cases not to dent floors or scratch walls (especially those staying in rooms upstairs) 6) Do not leave dishes or cups around the house, please leave them in the dishwasher 7) Be thoughtful of the planet and the energy bill! Turn off lights when you leave the room or go to bed. Turn off heat and AC when you leave the house. 8) Please always close the front door completely shut (it will lock automatically) so everyone's belongings remain safe inside. If you use a back door to in the yard make sure you manually lock the door when coming back inside.  9) If you have a question or an issue PLEASE tell me immediately so I can try to help you or fix it instead of wait

neighborhood_overview: Located in West Loop, this furnished rental invites you to explore the edges of downtown Chicago. From endless dining and bar options to art galleries and stylish shops, West Loop has emerged with so much to offer daily. During weekends, residents savor trips to the Chicago French Market and the vibrant strip of Randolph Street. The latter is known as “Restaurant Row” and is lined with some of the city’s best eateries. Fulton Market, one of the hippest and fastest-growing neighborhoods, is ideal for dinner and drinks. Union Station is only a 5 to 10 minute walk away.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

summary: Welcome to the Ravenswood neighborhood - a true gem of Chicago's north side! A stay at SWEETGUM gives you the best of a true neighborhood experience without the noise and prices of downtown! Enjoy an in-unit washer/dryer, indoor rooftop lounge, and an outdoor rooftop terrace with gas grills in this home away from home!  Centrally located to award-winning restaurants, local boutiques, breweries, plenty of entertainment options, and easy street parking. Live like a local in this beautiful spot!
space: * Please note: these are BRAND NEW LISTINGS and we're so excited to host you! Professional photos of the sleek California boho-inspired design and decor coming soon! * Located right off the CTA brown line means a quick trip to Wrigley Field, downtown, and other excellent small neighborhoods all with their own unique flair. It's a super quick trip to the famous jazz clubs and concert venues in Uptown (The Aragon, The Riviera, and the Green Mill!) and other small unique areas of Lincoln Square, Andersonville, and North Center. Your home away from home is equipped with everything you need to relax, work, or play in the city whether it's for a quiet night in or exploring the exciting nightlife that the city has to offer!

notes: Check In / Check Out Check in after 4pm CT Check out is 11am CT We do not offer early Check In or late Check Out.  Luggage Hold If your travel arrangements have you arriving earlier or leaving later than our designated check in / check out times, we recommend using a luggage holding and transport company called Wait Here Chicago. We have a partnership with them and they can offer you discounted rates on their luggage hold options throughout the city. The home is equipped with Wifi for your enjoyment and the television is set up with a ROKU where you can sign into your own Netflix or Hulu accounts during your stay.  The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pans, utensils, silverware, plates, bowls, cups, knives, a cutting board, salt and pepper, olive oil, black tea and honey. There are great markets nearby if you feel some culinary inspiration! We also provide coffee, cream, and sugar to start your morning off right!  Pets This is a dog-friendly building with a 2 dog maximum per guest.
transit: Whether you got a set a wheels, using public transportation, or you're just old fashioned walking, the neighborhood works for any transportation needs. There is easily accessible "Pay to Park" street parking and some free side-street parking. Additionally, there is loads of public transportation! Just a few steps from the CTA brown line and several different bus routes to take you anywhere you want to go. The neighborhood is also very walkable for anything you can possibly need on the fly.
access: The entire home is yours to enjoy. The only shared spaces are the rooftop lounge and rooftop terrace.
interaction: We are off-site but available when needed. The best way to reach us is by sending a message through the app!  In case of maintenance emergency, the in-unit home guide will detail phone numbers of who to call immediately.
house_rules: General Rules -Please treat the home as if it is your own. -Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property. -If you accidentally damage anything during your stay, please contact the host for your safety and the future safety of the next guest. -Please remember to sign out of any ROKU apps you utilized via your personal accounts before departing.  -This is a dog-friendly building with a 2 dog limit per reservation. Quiet Hours Quiet hours are between 10p-8a. This is a residential building and ask that for the respect of permanent tenants basic courtesies of being mindful of your noise levels and not congregating in hallways outside of the unit be observed.  Receiving a noise complaint from the building can result in the forfeiture of your stay and a $1000 fine.  No Smoking The home (and entire building including outdoor common areas) is designated as a strictly smoke-free community. There will be a $500 fee imposed if you choose to smoke in the building. space: Classic Glamour Meets Modern Sophistication Originally constructed in 1924 to eventually become a renowned hotel, The Seneca is a fifteen-story historic building reimagined into a community of modern, boutique apartments. Here, a stately European-style façade combines with fresh, contemporary finishes that give the space a sense of romanticism and sophistication. Fusing a distinguished Gold Coast lifestyle with the charm of a vintage landmark, this community is ideal for those seeking an upscale living experience in the heart of a vibrant Chicago neighborhood.    The studio, one and two bedroom apartments for rent exude metropolitan elegance with interior finishes such as dark hardwood-style flooring, stainless steel appliances and crown molding. Glamorous community amenities, including on-site dry cleaning, a state-of-the-art fitness center, a coffee bar and a spacious sundeck add quality to your lifestyle. name: Very clean & pet-positive in a great neighborhood!
summary: This bright & clean garden apartment opens out to a wonderful neighborhood - it is easy to access off I-90, a block from Chicago's Blue Line of the "El" train, and halfway between O'Hare Airport & The Loop.  This family-oriented ‘hood is friendly, safe and walkable at all hours.  We are a 10-minute walk to our favorite coffee spots, and an easy Divvy bike ride to the heart of Logan Square.  Wrigley Field is due east with easy access by bus or shuttle.  Also, free street parking!
space: This quiet apartment is a cozy refuge in the heart of this bustling city.   It has just what you need for a comfortable stay - a clean and efficient kitchen, sizable living room, and quiet bedroom.  Large windows throughout open to views of a neighborhood park and brick walk-ups. There is  extra fee for your dog or cat - we welcome responsible pet parents.

neighborhood_overview: Irving Park is a hidden gem in the middle of Chicago's bustle!  It's very pedestrian-friendly, with Divvy bikes one block away as well as the Blue Line train to the airport and downtown.  Our neighborhood has everything you need: grocery stores, coffee spots, a wide range of restaurants.
notes: We welcome well-behaved dogs & cats.  This is super dog-friendly neighborhood, with a Park right across the street.
transit: The Blue Line is your key to accessing the entire city, and it's just a three-minute walk.  Bus #152 takes you right down Addison to Wrigley Field.  And you can bike the city with Divvy bikes, rentable by the hour or day.  There is also free on-street parking outside the building.
interaction: We are happy to help with neighborhood information and recommendations, but also strive to respect your privacy.  We want you to have a great time in Chicago!

name: Cozy Noble Square getaway
summary: Unwind and enjoy the city in this cozy and clean Guest Suite!  I’m super excited to host guests in this recently furnished guest space.  I live in the main, separable part of the property and I’m excited for you to use this space as a home base where you can decompress after exploring the city!
space: The room is a lovely space, with a queen size bed, and a big door and window overlooking your private entrance. There is a private en suite bathroom, and I’ll provide towels, shampoo and conditioner, and a hair dryer. The small kitchenette area has a mini fridge, microwave, Keurig coffee machine, and electric kettle. I’ll provide dishes, bowls, mugs, and silverware, as well as some bottled water, coffee pods, and tea. A desk and chair will allow you to work on a laptop (or write a postcard, if you’re old-fashioned like I am), and you’ll have access to free wi-fi. There’s a large closet for storing clothes and suitcases, and an iron and ironing board.

There’s a large closet for storing clothes and suitcases, and an iron and ironing board. You will have complete access to your room an
neighborhood_overview: Noble Square is a dynamic neighborhood in the greater West Town neighborhood of Chicago, situated between Wicker Park and Ukrainian Village. Your suite is just off of a quiet, tree-lined street, and a quick walk away from some of the best shopping and nightlife the city has to offer. Walk to Chicago Avenue (Ukrainian Village) - 5 minutes Walk to Division - 10 minutes Walk to Milwaukee Avenue (Wicker Park) - 20 minutes There are great bars, restaurants, grocers, shopping, and parks all within walking distance (check my guide for some of my favorites), and you’re only about 10-15 minutes from either the Chicago or Division Blue Line stops (quick ride downtown, or to O’Hare). As an 11-year resident of Chicago, I can vouch that you’ll appreciate the peace and quiet you can come home to after spending the day or night in the livelier areas of the neighborhood, while enjoying the close proximity to all of the action!
notes: You’ll be using a self check in link provided in the Airbnb app, so be sure to install the app or have the check in directions printed out beforehand! Communicating with me is easiest through the chat feature, as I can see the alerts pop up, even when I’m at work.
transit: You’re a 10-15 minute walk to either the Chicago or Division Blue Line. There are Divvy bikes, and electric scooters available for rent at various locations throughout the neighborhood. An Uber or Lyft is easy to come by, and can get you into the Loop, or any of the other great Chicago neighborhoods, quickly.
access: You will have complete access to your room and private bathroom, through a separate private entrance.
interaction: I’m available at nearly any time through the chat feature on the Airbnb app. I live in a separate area, but I’m available if you need me. Just let me know!
host_about:
Stay where it counts. When you book a Loftium, you're contributing to the local community. Each Loftium is home to a local resident who hosts and lives right on-site, making sure your experience is a delightful one. All spaces are designed with your comfort in mind! We've made check-in and communication a breeze, and each home provides a beautiful and cozy place to rest your head during your travels. Every Loftium home and host is unique, and you'll always get a true neighborhood experience during your stay.

Visit a new community and book a Loftium in any of our cities: Seattle, Portland, Denver, San Diego, Phoenix, Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas, Charlotte, or Orlando. We can't wait for you to visit!

name: Retro Style High Rise Condo with Lake View Balcony
summary: Gaze out across the city from this well-appointed home. The residence features an open-plan layout, an eclectic mix of vintage-inspired furnishings and decor, and access to a shared sauna, gym, BBQ patio area, outdoor race track, and a rooftop pool. Our pool is outdoor and is open seasonally from Memorial Day to Labor Day (weather permitting). You must be 25 or older to book this space. Parking is not included in the cost of your stay. There is parking in the garage on the bottom floor but guests are responsible for the cost. A parking pass will need to be purchased.
space: Enjoy all that the Windy City has to offer when you stay at this two-bedroom Chicago getaway! It’s wonderfully appointed complete with a private balcony, views of Lake Michigan, and top-notch community amenities including an outdoor pool, a running track, a fitness center, and more. Located on the 32nd floor of the Grand Plaza, you’ll be at the intersection of Grand Avenue and State Street in the River North neighborhood. Michigan Avenue's Magnificent Mile is just three blocks away while the Chicago River is just four blocks from your door.  Inside, the space is air-conditioned and comfortable, with a private washer/dryer, a nicely designed full kitchen, and free WiFi throughout. This suite also has access to 50,000 square feet of shared recreational space, so you can spend the day lounging by the swimming pool, doing laps at the track, or even preparing a steak in the outdoor grilling area. You’ll never run out of things to do! Start making your plans today and book this elegant Chica

house_rules: - The responsible renter must be at least 25 years of age to book. Guests under 25 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian for the duration of the reservation. - No dog(s) are welcome in this home. No other animals are allowed without specific Vacasa approval. - The property shall not be used by more than the number of adults and children listed in your reservation. - All guests shall abide by Vacasa’s good neighbor policy and shall not engage in illegal activity. Quiet hours are from 10 p.m. to 8 a.m. - If early check-in is available for your reservation, you will be notified by 9am on the morning of your arrival by email. Late check-out is offered whenever possible for a small fee. - No smoking of any kind is permitted anywhere on the premises. - No commercial photography or filming is permitted on the property. Tents or other structures may not be erected. - Renter is liable for any damage to the property and agrees to accept charges to the card on file should damage occur
host_about: Hi, we’re Vacasa, North America’s largest vacation rental management company. Owners of vacation homes around the world trust us to deliver exceptional service throughout your entire vacation. Professional housekeepers clean and stock each home, and our customer care team is available around the clock—with a local property manager ready to show up and help out. We like to think we offer the best of both worlds: you can enjoy a one-of-a-kind vacation experience in a unique property, without compromising on service and convenience. Check out our listings, and get in touch if you have any questions. Your vacation is our full-time job, and we'd love to help you plan your perfect getaway.

summary: Experience top quality in a spacious 3 bed 1 bath apartment during your next visit to Chicago. We are located in West Ridge, on the far North side of Chicago. During the visit, guests have the entire apartment to themselves and feel at home with much space and privacy. The unit is best suited for couples, families with children, business travelers, and large groups up to 6-8 guests.

name: Home away from home private room
summary: Modest, traditional Chicago style apartment built in 1902. Located at the western end of the Tri-Taylor neighborhood. It is walking distance to UIC, Rush, County, and Mount Sinai Medical centers- and situated between Taylor and Roosevelt. This makes it Easy to drive into the city (2 miles to Willis tower) or hop onto CTA bus (stops in front of the building). Also there are a number of bars and restaurants along both streets that are easily walkable to, w/the first bar across the street from here
space: Great place for any budget traveler, medical school student, resident physician, or other medical personnel in need of an all-bills-included-furnished apartment for a few weeks up to a couple of months.  I understand the struggle of completing away rotations and the logistical hardship it places on us. My aim is to provide a fully furnished and functioning apartment at a reasonable price.   Please keep in mind that the living room, kitchen, and bathroom are shared spaces between myself and any guest I may have (with in reason).

name: Spacious Clean Chicago Three Bedroom w/Parking
summary: You’ll love my place because of the enormous size, cleanliness, and the accommodating host.  My place is close to Fatso's Last Stand, Mariano's, Dunkin Donuts, and Dark Matter Coffee.  We are a short walk to transportation - ten minutes from downtown attractions.  My place is good for couples, families (with kids), and big groups.  Easy free parking included!
space: The apartment is a second floor massive three bedroom two bathroom with hard wood floors throughout the unit.  We keep the unit stocked with coffee, tea, oatmeal, cookware, etc.   The apartment also has in unit washer/dryer with detergent for extended stays.  We try to think of everything you would need for a vacation or business travel (iron, hairdryer, towels, soap, shampoo, cable TV, etc).  If you arrive and something is missing just let us know and we'll do our best to accommodate.

notes: PLEASE NOTE: This apartment is located in an historic building - it serves as the home to Chicago's first funeral parlor built in 1906.  Although the building is now seldom used outside of day to day business operations some guests may feel uncomfortable with this information.

If there is anything we can do to ensure your comfortable and having a great time during your stay please don't hesitate to ask!

description: Single modern bedroom apartment, newly remodeled, wooden floors (with the exception of bathroom), new appliances, working heaters (more like steamers), 5-8 min. walk from the train station, and 4 blocks from Loyola Park/Beach (Lake Michigan). Laundry room (quarterbacked). Rogers Park is the largest and most diverse district in Chicago. The apartment is at a perfect location: 15-20 mins to Evanston and 25-30 mins to Downtown and the Loop. Store recommendations: Morse SuperMarket, Heartland Café and Jb Alberto's Pizza. Loyola University is also very close (10-15 minute walk). You may find Mexican restaurants if you walk in opposition to Loyola Beach, quite affordable and amazing. Local bars are also at a close distant as well as the Leather Museum (by Loyola). Overall, great location with lots do to. Enjoy your stay. Red Line: 5 minute walk to station, also only line that runs 24 hrs. Takes you to Downtown, Boystown, the Loop, and major tourist areas.

name: Windy City Piggy - A One of a Kind Stay
summary: Come enjoy a beautifully furnished guest room and apartment with a truly unique roommate. Franklin is an American Miniature piglet hamming it Chicago. He loves meeting new guests and sharing his space.  In addition to the best flat mate you'll ever have, the apartment is within walking distance to Wrigley Field, two El Stops, FREE street parking, restaurants, bars and shops. Perfect for a couple of travelers, a business trip, or piggy lover!  See more photos of Franklin on insta @windycitypiggy
space: Located on the top floor of a 3-flat, this apartment has lots of natural light and great views of the neighborhood. The back porch has chairs for relaxing outside. Large and fully equipped kitchen ready to be enjoyed.

neighborhood_overview: Lakeview is a fun and vibrant area with beautiful town homes and tree lined streets. There is a great bar on the corner...the kind where everybody knows you're name and will make you feel right at home. While you are within walking distance of shops, restaurants, and bars, the apartment is peaceful and quiet.
notes: What to expect staying with a pig: Franklin is house trained and resides in the kitchen.  He has a baby gate to keep him cozy in his area but he is allowed to wander freely through the apartment.  He oinks around happily (as pigs do), always looking for nibbles. Pigs are curious and love getting into things. You're welcome to let him come in your room or shut the door to keep your space piggy-free.  Franklin goes to bed nightly at 9:30pm and wakes up around 6:30am. Noise is minimal, but he is always excited for morning breakfast and may give a few more oinks and grunts than usual.
transit: Getting around is so easy! The apartment is with a 7 minute walk from both the Belmont and Wellington El stops offering a 10 minute train ride right into the city and Michigan Ave. Wrigley Field is a 15 minute walk away. There is free street parking available. No need for a permit.
access: 1 private bedroom with very comfortable queen bed, closet, side table and reading chair. There is 1 full bathroom in the apartment, shared between myself & guests. We make coffee every morning and guests are always free to make use of the kitchen & appliances as well as the living room.
interaction: I am always available by call or test to answer any questions you have.   I am a self-proclaimed foodie and know all the best spots in the city.  I understand that most guests will have their own itinerary, but if you need any suggestions about what to do or where to eat, I'd love to help!
house_rules: 1. Enjoy yourself and don't be afraid to interact with Franklin 2. Don't feed the pig unless the host says you can. (He can be very convincing with his cute snout). 3. Keep bathroom and bedroom doors closed when you leave (pigs are curious and likes to get into things) 4. Smoking is permitted on the back outdoor patio
host_about:
Hi, I'm Kim- lover of life and great experiences! I am a full-time Airbnb Consultant and Superhost.  I help people list their spaces on Airbnb while delighting travelers with personalized experiences. I am an avid traveler and used to live in Paris.  I wish AirBnB had been around when I was traveling Europe as it would have offered me a much more affordable way to travel.  Having wished it for myself, I like the idea of offering people a beautiful place to stay and great tips for enjoying this incredible city.  I am a self-proclaimed foodie and pride myself on knowing the best places to try in Chicago.  
My friends nicknamed me Martha Stewart years ago for my hosting skills, decorating, and cooking abilities.  I love hosting people and have even considered the idea of opening a B&B some day.

name: Easy access to Downtown in a safe neighborhood
summary: A cozy, private bedroom with a full size bed in the hippest neighborhood of Chicago conveniently located right by the blue line train that will take you everywhere you want to go! Location, location, location!   -1/2 block to the "606" walking trail -Logan Square restaurants, shops, and nightlife -10 min walk to the "el" with direct transportation to: - O'hare airport - Millenium Park - Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum & Planetarium - The Willis/Sears Tower Skydeck - Art Institute - Mag Mile
space: You'll get a private bedroom. The bedroom is small, but has everything you need for a good night's sleep. Each bedroom has a lock with a key to keep your belongings secure.  The main living areas and bathroom may be shared with other guests who are staying in one of the other bedrooms.

neighborhood_overview: LOGAN SQUARE — Described as the "Midwest headquarters of hip," Logan Square has been named one of the 15 "hottest urban retail markets across North America." RESTAURANTS: - Revolution Brewing (lively, chef-driven pub fair)  -Boiler Room (hippest pizza place in town with lots of craft beer, and a great beer garden)  -Lula Cafe (Inventive, market-driven food in a casual, funky space that hosts an especially popular brunch) -Reno (Wood-fired pizza, bagels & pasta in a casual, loftlike space with a bar for pastries & alcohol)  -Longman and Eagle (modern farm-to-table fine dining with a great whiskey/cocktail selection) -Donkey Table Stick (upscale comfort fare and drinks in a rustic setting)  -The Radler (wursts and hearty German eats, plus plenty of beers, in a brick walled space covered in street art)  -Cozy Corner (classic diner serving up hearty breakfast/lunch right next to the train stop) - 0.4 -Margies Candies (Open for more than 90 years, this vintage candy and ice cream shop alleg
notes: -The common areas, including the bathroom, may be shared with other guests. -We keep the cost low because of teamwork. We will ask you to make the bed before leaving. -The bedroom is small and cozy, but has everything you need for a good night's sleep. You should stay here if: -you think meeting new people is cool -you get that you’ll be sharing the common areas with other guests(cool new people) - you believe in teamwork: making the bed -you’re on a budget  -you don’t need much space You should NOT stay here if: -you’re looking for a five star hotel with room service and a mini bar -you need housekeeping on standby 24-hours per day -you’re  not a fan of teamwork, you prefer to be waited on
transit: This apartment is perfectly located between the Western and California Blue Line train station stops.  The Blue Line is the only train in Chicago that connects O'hare Airport to downtown directly.   It is a very short, nice walk of 0.5 miles (0.8km) to either train station stop.
access: Make yourself at home!  You're free to use our kitchen, fridge, washer, dryer, ironing board, WiFi, and any of the guitars and other instruments lying around!
house_rules: -Guests must read and understand the detailed welcome message and self check in instructions on the Airbnb app.  -Leave the apartment at least as nice as it was when you arrived.  As the boyscouts say, "try to leave this world a little better than you found it."  This is a more self sufficient Airbnb than many (which is why it is so affordable!) so teamwork is required.  You are expected to clean up after yourself and help contribute to keeping the place clean.   -Please make the bed with the clean sheets provided before you check out.  Leave your sheets and towels in the hamper.   -Default check in is 3pm, checkout at 12pm noon.  We are flexible and can easily accommodate early check in and late checkout upon request. -Shoes off at the door -Make sure all dishes are washed and put away before checkout -No unregistered guests are allowed on the property without approval (and obviously no parties!) -No eating or drinking within the bedrooms.  -Smoking is not allowed in the property. name: Cozy Hideout in Art Filled Chicago Neighborhood
summary: Spend the weekend in a private suite filled with ample natural light and steps to music venues, galleries, breweries, vintage shops and top rated restaurants. This private and newly renovated space features an en suite with a roomy shower / soaking tub and access to a lovely patio terrace.
space: Your private guest suite is newly renovated. You will have a private room with your own  keypad entrance, thermostat and bathroom, T.V. with internet access, mini fridge, serving ware, coffee maker, fruit and yogurt in the fridge! We also have a toaster oven in case you want to warm up leftovers.
description: Spend the weekend in a private suite filled with ample natural light and steps to music venues, galleries, breweries, vintage shops and top rated restaurants. This private and newly renovated space features an en suite with a roomy shower / soaking tub and access to a lovely patio terrace.
neighborhood_overview: The Pilsen neighborhood got voted one of the 12 coolest neighborhoods in the world in 2018, according to Forbes magazine. There’s venues, studios, and bars booming with more culture all only blocks away.
transit: Uber / Lyft is a great way to get anywhere quick - usually a 15 min ride to downtown.  Public transit options are the CTA El Train (Pink Line 18th stop is 0.7 mile walk from our house) or CTA Bus (18th & Racine stop is a block away). Once you’re at the transit stop both options take about a 20 - 30 minute to downtown. There are other bus lines nearby that take you other places (i.e. McCormick Place) - feel free to ask us for help when you arrive. Street parking is free in certain areas for those who are driving. Please message us and we’ll direct you where to park. We are a 20 minute cab ride from Midway International Airport and 40 minutes from O'Hare without heavy traffic, double these estimates if traffic is heavy (rush hour, accidents, etc).
access: You will only have access to your room, which is comparable to a short term stay hotel room, but way cooler.
interaction: send a text or message me and I'll respond as soon as I can

name: Bohemian Gem in Humboldt Park
summary: Enjoy this Bohemian Gem in historic Humboldt Park. Relax in this recently renovated artsy home and sit in the cozy porch to experience the quiet yet vibrant neighborhood. Located minutes away from Chicago amazing Humboldt Park. Head two blocks north and hop on the 606 Chicago’s 2.7 mile elevated pedestrian path that weaves through Logan Square,Wicker Park and more. This is a family friendly space on a multi-ethnic block in historically Puerto Rican neighborhood.
space: The house is 1915 sqft two flors total of 5 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms . You will have access to entire house except basement. There is plenty to do around. My favorites are Humboldt Park for a nice morning or evening walk, there is always events in the park life music, festivals, kids entertainment and beach! 606 for a bike ride, cafe, restaurant and stores. The house is close to a very hip Chicago neighborhoods. 20 min drive to the beach, 20 min drive to forest preserve.  Enjoy your stay in Bohemian Gem in Humboldt Park.
description: Enjoy this Bohemian Gem in historic Humboldt Park. Relax in this recently renovated artsy home and sit in the cozy porch to experience the quiet yet vibrant neighborhood. Located minutes away from Chicago amazing Humboldt Park. Head two blocks north and hop on the 606 Chicago’s 2.7 mile elevated pedestrian path that weaves through Logan Square,Wicker Park and more. This is a family friendly space on a multi-ethnic block in historically Puerto Rican neighborhood. The house is 1915 sqft two flors total of 5 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms . You will have access to entire house except basement. There is plenty to do around. My favorites are Humboldt Park for a nice morning or evening walk, there is always events in the park life music, festivals, kids entertainment and beach! 606 for a bike ride, cafe, restaurant and stores. The house is close to a very hip Chicago neighborhoods. 20 min drive to the beach, 20 min drive to forest preserve.  Enjoy your stay in Bohemian Gem in Humboldt Park. You wi
neighborhood_overview: Humboldt Park is amazing!!! I would not exchange it for anything! At this time and space reality is mostly Hispanic but is changing now, this is the best time to visit before it will change. I have been in the neighborhood sine 2006 and have only good things to say about it.  The music is everywhere in summer months, yet the street itself is calm, family oriented, really nice and friendly neighbors. Street food is delicious always with Latin flavor, delicious!! My 12 year old neighbor ask me to mention on Ice-cream truck that drives by every evening. Twist swirl $1.50  I also listed my Toyota Sienna mini van on Turo in case you my be interested. Enjoy your stay in Bohemian Gem in Humboldt Park.
notes: There is a permit parking on the street in front of the house, inside you will find permit sticker that you can use. In case you ran out of the stickers the is no permit on the crossing street, 30 seconds walk. I don’t mind you celebrating your life while staying in the house, but I ask not to throw a big party’s. Enjoy your stay in Bohemian Gem in Humboldt Park
transit: You can rent my car on Turo if interested. More info available. I have 3 bikes for you to use, and one 2 seat trailer for children, also there is a pilot seat attached to one of the bike. Busses, trains, Uber, lyft, taxi are easily accessible. Enjoy your stay in Bohemian Gem in Humboldt Park.
access: You will have access to all the necessities that a house can offer, equipped kitchen, laundry and drying machine, bbq in the back, central air, bikes.
interaction: You can contact me anytime via phone or email, I will get by to you at my earliest convenience. Fast! I will be at the property sometimes but you will not see me, i will respect your privacy. Enjoy your stay in Bohemian Gem in Humboldt Park.
house_rules: Treat the house like is yours, with that said I mean keep it clean, no shoes in the house,

name: Spacious Condo, Fully Equipped Kitchen, Near CTA
summary: This condo is home to our family of four and we list it only while we are away on vacation. Because we love food and cooking, our kitchen has all the essential equipment that you need to cook just about anything. There is only one bed (king size) but the couch can comfortably sleep a third person. Street parking only, but a CTA redline station is a 500 yard walk away. We also have WiFi and in-unit washer and dryer. Three blocks from the beach!
space: We've got a lot of space but not a lot of beds. We're happy to accommodate additional guests if you'd like to bring extra bedding arrangements (cots, sleeping bags, etc.), but otherwise you'll have access just to a king-size hide-a-bed in our family room.

host_about: I'm an English teacher at Wright College, one of Chicago City Colleges. I love students and like to help them  adapt to a new culture. I also love to travel. I've been in Europe 4 times. I delight in learning from them, about their culture, their traditions, if they so wish to share. I want them to feel at home while they are here. They are free to use the kitchen if they like to cook something from their countries. I try to give them healthy food with lots of fruits and vegetables. "Love thy neighbor as yourself", I try to abide by that motto.

This location is perfect for a high school student looking into Loyola University Chicago, or anyone looking to rest on the city's quieter side.  For +21 year olds, Bulldog Ale House is one block away south, and for children (or children at heart) the New 400 Theater is one block north. (optional) tall twin XL air mattress

neighborhood_overview: It's quiet and safe for a Chicago neighborhood.  My guest have never had any problems in the neighborhood and they walk to the train.  I would advise ladies to take Uber after midnight. My neighborhood is not close to downtown, but it is easy and quick to get downtown via public transportation.  If you are a very light sleeper there is a freight train that comes occasionally behind my house, only very light sleepers are bothered by it.
notes: Please see pictures and room description for Quiet Room also in my home for more information and pictures about my home.

I love sharing my home with visitors because I enjoy meeting new people!  The other person in the picture is Alden my house manager!  If I’m not around, he’ll be there to take excellent care of you.

name: Casa Piccolo Sogno, Chicago, Little Italy/UCI
summary: Welcome to Casa Piccolo Sogno, a remodeled 4 bedroom 2 bathroom 1st floor apartment located in the heart of Chicago’s Little Italy, in close proximity to Downtown, West Loop, Greek Town, The Medical District and University of Illinois at Chicago Campuses.  You will have no trouble reaching the hottest destinations in Chicago via foot, bike, Uber, cab, or train.  Come be our guest!!!
space: Everything is new in this modern, bright and spacious 4 bedroom – 2 bathroom 1st floor apartment, the entire apartment has been renovated but still has the charm of an older home with modern conveniences. 11” high ceilings, majestic windows, hardwood floors, central air and heat. notes: -	This listing is in a multi unit property, this means you must be aware of the noise you are making -	We have tenants in the garden unit and 2nd and 3rd floors - 	There are about 7 steps from the street level to the unit, if you have mobility issues, please factor that into your decision on where to stay -	Outdoor property surveillance on site  We want to make sure that your stay exceeds your expectations.  When making a request, please tell us about yourselves, your interest in our home and indicate that you have read the full listing and house rules, thank you!!!

name: Harper House - Hyde Park
summary: Victorian cottage house, located in Chicago's famed Hyde Park neighborhood. Our 2-bedroom home is within walking distance to the University of Chicago, the Museum of Science & Industry, and the Midway Plaisance (home of the 1893 World's Fair). Convenient train transportation to downtown Chicago within minutes. Free street parking typically available.
space: Built in 1888, this is an old, Victorian house. Modern furnishings, appliances, and eclectic artwork and decorations bring warmth to this single-family home. Due to the home's age, there are a few quirks to get used to, but most guests seem to like the charm, decor, and location of our home. The large front porch features a porch swing and seating for playing cards or people watching. The small back porch offers an intimate setting for family meals or cocktails after work.

neighborhood_overview: Hyde Park is a well-known Chicago neighborhood. The Midway Plaisance was home to the 1893 World's Columbian Exposition. One of the remaining structures from this World's Fair is now the famous Museum of Science & Industry. The University of Chicago is a world-renowned research institution integrated throughout the Hyde Park neighborhood. My family loves taking walks or bike rides around the Main Quad on campus. Residents and visitors enjoy swimming at the 57th Street Beach along Lake Shore Drive and bicycling or jogging at Promontory Point along the shores of Lake Michigan. The Point, as it is known by locals, is a great place to take photographs of Chicago and Lake Michigan. The Obamas' house is located at the northern edge of our neighborhood and Barack Obama has been sighted occasionally at the famous Medici Restaurant and Bakery located on 57th Street. Two famous bookstores -- Powell's Books and 57th Street Books -- are also located within walking distance of our house. A selection
notes: Free street parking is available most days. However, guests should be aware of temporary signage that sometimes indicates parking is not permitted (this only occurs a few days each year, typically due to street cleaning schedules).
transit: Our home is located one block from the Metra Electric train line, which offers convenient transportation to downtown Chicago, McCormick Place, Museum Campus, and Millennium Park. Train passes can be purchased at vending machines in the 57th Street Metra Station. For cyclists, Hyde Park also offers direct access to the Chicago Lakefront Trail, which extends north to Promontory Point, McCormick Place, Museum Campus, Soldier Field, Maggie Daley Park (this is a "must" for kids), and Downtown Chicago.
access: Guests have access to 2 bedrooms, 1.5 bathrooms, a full kitchen, dining room, living room, and both front and back porches.
interaction: Guests are always welcome to contact us through the Airbnb app or by phone or text messages.
house_rules: 1. Please be respectful of neighbors in this quiet, residential neighborhood. 2. Please remove any full trash bags, placing them in the black bin near driveway. 3. Please wash and put away any dishes and silverware used during your stay. 4. Any dirty linens can be left on the beds or placed on the bathroom floor. 5. Please turn off lights and all appliances before checking out. 6. Parties or causing loud noises are not allowed. 7. Safe travels! Come back and stay with us again soon!
host_about: I'm a business owner from Chicago and travel frequently for business and leisure. My wife, daughter, and I live in Chicago and enjoy spreading goodwill.

neighborhood_overview: Chicago's premier downtown Streeterville neighborhood grants immediate access to one of the most complete retail, dining and hospitality destinations in the world. Museum buff, theater-goer, night owl, foodie, outdoor adventurer — whatever your passion — explore it within steps of your residence. You are a short stroll from major Chicago landmarks: Michigan Avenue, the Loop, River North, the Gold Coast, Navy Pier, Lake Michigan, the Chicago River and Millennium Park. Designer brands, trendy boutiques and high-end department stores line the famous Magnificent Mile, allowing you to immerse yourself in world-class shopping a mere block from your address. Dine at the finest-rated classic restaurants or try a chic, new, cutting-edge spot. With 275 restaurants, bars and entertainment establishments sprinkled throughout the neighborhood, there is a taste to satisfy every appetite.

name: Bachelor Pad in the heart of a great neighborhood!
summary: Rustic and very cozy, I don’t like leaving my apartment and I’m sure you’ll love staying here too. The neighborhood is busy but not packed. There are plenty of cool bars and restaurants within walking distance. A gym across the street (that offers a free week to anyone FYI) and there is so much sunlight! The apartment is sunny all day (granted the clouds aren’t ruining the daylight). A great spot to spend a weekend or a month
space: I have a large desk, WiFi and a printer if you need to work. There’s laundry in the building and a laundromat a block away if needed. The couch and big screen tv are all yours to relax with.. or hook up to the Bose and enjoy some music. The memory foam mattress is amazing at the end of a long day. It’s an enjoyable place to stay no matter where you’re from or why you’re here.

neighborhood_overview: You’ll find a diverse group of neighbors. There’s several cool bars and restaurants you could walk to. A large grocery store that’s 3/4 of a mile down the road. A gym is across the street as well as a very good thrift store I often frequent. There’s a classic Chicago drive or walk up 24/7 hot dog restaurant 2 blocks away. Less than a mile from a Metra and CTA train stop.
notes: There is a window AC unit in the bedroom along with ceiling fans in every room :)
transit: There’s plenty of parking. If you  feel comfortable you can use my bike. There are always Uber/ Lyft drivers nearby and I’m close to a Metra and CTA train stop. With little or no traffic you can get downtown in 12-15 minutes driving.
access: Lockbox or potentially in person
interaction: I’ll leave you a list of places I would recommend.

summary: Our three bedroom Penthouse apartment has a cozy guest room with private bathroom. It fits two and is centrally located on a quiet street near Du Paul University. Enjoy a gourmet kitchen, roof access and easy access to major subway lines, coffee shops, restaurants and movie theater are all in walking distance
space: Please come enjoy a stay in our beautiful, comfortable condo in a quiet residential area. Our unit is located on the 4th floor of a walk-up building housing approximately 9 condo units. It is a 3 bedroom, 2 1/2 bathrooms unit with 20+ ft ceilings nestled in the heart of Chicago’s historic Lincoln Park community. You will have access to a private room with private bathroom in a uniquely different & beautiful 3 bedroom and 2 bathroom penthouse unit.  This is not your typical 3 bedroom layout. All the vintage charm like exposed brick, wide hallways, oversized windows, hardware floors mixed with todays modern necessities. Living room with great lofted ceilings leads to chef's kitchen.  Incredible rooftop deck with entry from unit. Best location, very close to red line, brown line, bookstores, restaurants, cafes, movie theater and Du Paul University. name: Great Remote Office or Shelter In Place Pad
summary: Now hosting long-stays of 7 nights or more! Spot Hero parking behind the building! Enjoy a classic Chicago neighborhood vacation with this comfortable 2 bedroom apartment. We've got all of your basic amenities and are surrounded by neighborhood dining, shopping, and entertainment! Magnificent mile is only a 10 minute bus ride away!
space: We designed this second-floor apartment as a bright and cozy retreat for friends and family visiting from the coasts, and we're delighted to make it available to travelers from around the world.  When writing, please tell us about your visit and who will be traveling with you. Here is what you can expect for your stay:  • Thoughtful, artistic furnishings blending chic, modern and eclectic design.  • Crisp linens and plush pillows with comforters in every room: - MASTER BEDROOM - Queen bed with extensive closet - GUEST BEDROOM - 2 Twin bunk beds.  • Full Bathroom with shower/tub combo, plush towels, shampoo, conditioner and body wash, and a hairdryer for your convenience. • Large, well-equipped kitchen stocked with coffee, tea, spices and cooking essentials.  • Breakfast bar for eating, working, etc. • Spacious living room with a TV and a Roku player for streaming your favorite apps. • High speed wifi. • Washer and dryer. • Central heat and air conditioning.  • Huge windows overlooking
