neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park and West Town are just amazing. You'd practically never have to leave walking distance to experience the entire spectrum of Chicago. Though, for the sake of time and adventure, if you venture N,S,E or W...you'll run into plenty of buzzing activities and neighborhoods to explore.
notes: No microwave. No cable.
transit: Chicago's elevated train (the “L" or "El") and bus network is expansive and services city neighborhoods and some surrounding suburbs. Ticket prices start at $2.50 per train ride and $2.25 per bus ride.  • Nearest Train: Chicago Blue Line Stop — 5-minute bus ride.   • Nearest Bus (North/South): #50 Damen Bus — 1-minute walk  • Nearest Bus (East/West): #66 Chicago Bus — 2-minute walk  • Nearest Metra Station: Ogilvie Transportation Center — 10-minute cab. Metra travels from downtown Chicago (Ogilvie Transportation Center) to Kenosha, Wisconsin, and stops at Ravinia, a popular outdoor summer concert/picnic venue. Other transportation options: • Divvy Bike: Nearest bike station — 2-minute walk Divvy is Chicago's bike sharing system with 4,760 bikes and 476 stations across the city, available for use 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. Divvy bikes can be rented from and returned to any station in the system.  • Taxi/Uber: Request a range of different drivers, including taxis, to your location
access: Guests will have private access to the unit. Please be respectful of the other tenants in the building when passing through the common areas. The building does not permit Airbnb guests to hang out in common areas. Furthermore, only one washer is allowed to be used at a time.
interaction: Please be respectful of the other tenants in the building when passing through the common areas. The building does not permit Airbnb guests to hang out in common areas. Furthermore, only one washer is allowed to be used at a time.
house_rules: My building requires a simple signed lease form for each Airbnb tenant.  After booking, you will be sent a link to this form which you will be asked to complete, sign and email back to me.  The completed and signed lease form must be returned no less than 7 days prior to your arrival date. Dear guests, it is important you know that the building is VERY quiet. Please make sure you are ok with taking your shoes off while home, not playing loud music or TV and no parties before considering this property. Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure
host_about:
When Im not spending time in the city working as a classic model with Ford Chicago, you can find me on our farm in the country where I raise honeybees and grow Lavender for my handcrafted skin care products. I love having the best of both worlds and am so happy to share our space with travelers!!!

Things that I can't live without: My reading glasses, a strong cup of coffee, being woken up by the sound of birds singing, the smell of lavender,  garden tomatoes, being barefoot in the grass and snuggling my son.
 
Favorite book: Cabin Porn
Favorite movie: Wasteland
Favorite show: The New Yorker
Favorite food: Anything fresh from our garden....and...well... french fries :)
Favorite lyrics: "Im an alligator. Im a mama papa coming for you"-David Bowie

name: Basement Studio w/Free St. Parking, Humboldt Park
summary: Located in Humboldt Park, 6 miles from downtown, this basement studio is perfect for a stay in Chicago. We are located on a strip with approximately 11 houses and no houses across. There is a lot of Park area. At night it's a quiet neighborhood. We are located half a block away from the bus to Navy Pier, approx. 45 minutes to get to Navy Pier. There is free street parking available with NO parking permit required. There is a pool (only in summer) and park access half a block away.
space: Our lovely basement is fully equipped with everything you may need. From a kitchen where you can prepare all your meals to a comfy bed with linens included for a good night sleep. Feel free to peak inside the closet and the vanity in the bathroom, you will find some useful toiletries you forgot back at home.  The building is 3 stories. The Basement, 1st Floor and 2nd Floor. Both the Basement and the 1st floor are rented out thru airbnb. Because this house is more than 100 years old and the wooden floors are the original floors, the footsteps, tv, talking, etc. from the floors above can be heard downstairs in the basement. If you are a light sleeper I don't recommend staying here even though we do provide ear plugs just in case. IMPORTANT: You can hear the walking from upstairs, when people shower or move stuff across the floor. Some guests aren't picky about this but others are so please be aware.  I believe that what makes us different are the small details. We can guarantee a comfy,

Both the Basement and the 1st floor are rented out thru airbnb. Because this house is more than 100 years old and the wooden floors are t
neighborhood_overview: Please take a minute to look at all the pictures. There you will find pictures of the neighborhood, Humboldt Park. During the day it's lovely to walk around but at night it's a quiet residential strip of 12 houses.  It's located 6 miles (9km) from downtown.
notes: PLEASE READ CAREFULLY A lot of guests book without noting where they are booking because of the price. However we are located on a quiet Boulevard of only 11 houses. At night there is no night life on the street. Some guests have reported that upon taking taxis or Uber, the drivers have suggested that this is not a safe area. That however is not true. We have lived in this Boulevard for over 13 years and never have had any bad experiences. We encourage you to take a walk up Division Street and experience for yourself this wonderful neighborhood and all that it has to offer. Little by little Humboldt Park is changing it's reputation and we are proud to be part of it.  As proof that you have read this, when writing please start out with the word "Pancho". IMPORTANT: You can hear the walking from upstairs, when people shower or move stuff across the floor. Some guests aren't picky about this but others are so please be aware.
transit: The CTA bus stop, both for bus #65 that drops you off right in front of Navy Pier and bus #66 that drops you off right on the Magnificent Mile, are only half a block away. Now there are bike stations all around the town. Only a block away you will find a bike station, which is an excellent option if you want to bike to downtown. It's about $10 for the whole day and you have to return the bike every half hour at the nearest station. The bus on Grand Avenue or Chicago Avenue take you in 15 minutes to the Blue line stop which you can also use to get around.
access: There is a public pool just half a block away open during the summer. If you love to relax, the house is located right on Humboldt Park so you can go for a jog, a walk or a picnic.
interaction: Nancy, my mother, is the one who will greet you and help you throughout your stay. She works during the day but in the evenings is more than willing to help you out with whatever you need. She knows how Airbnb works and is eager to host you! ;-) Hablamos Español también!
house_rules: **Please note the location. A lot of guests book because of the price and do not look at the location to then check-out and leave a 1 star location review, which of course makes us sad because we can't pick up our house and move it to downtown.  **We don't have CableTV, only a smartTV with Netflix, YouTube, etc. 1. Please do let us know your approx. check-in and check-out times this way we can coordinate our cleaning schedule. 2. The floors above the basement are more than 100 years old so while we definitely want to replace them so they don't squeak so much, it's not something we can afford right now. Therefore, YES you can hear the walking and the other airbnb guests from the floor above. Sometimes it may be quiet but sometimes if they arrive late, you will clearly hear the foot steps on the wood.  Again, IMPORTANT: You can hear the walking from upstairs, when people shower or move stuff across the floor. Some guests aren't picky about this but others are so please be aware.  3. Smok
host_about:
Hola! Thank you so much for taking the time to read a bit about myself. I will start out by saying that to me there's nothing like a good conversation. I love talking about geography, different cultures and even finances. 

My true passion is hosting. I would love to dedicate to it full time sooner rather than later. After having studied abroad for 3 years, more than taking myself around the world, I want to show Puerto Rico and Chicago to the world. If you're curious, I was born and raised in paradise: Puerto Rico!

I know how much guests value when a host personally welcomes them, however due to work and being between Puerto Rico and Chicago, unfortunately I'm not available to greet each guest personally. Regardless, I can guarantee that all my places will make you feel like at home. I have put a lot of effort and love into getting them setup. Each one of our listings ("our" because my mom is the big helper) has been available for hosting after both my mom and I have stayed at each one and have approved them. We will say we are quite into the details; if you are too, I'm sure you'll notice.  

About me, I can't live without traveling, those deep conversations that by the end have made you question yourself and of course I most definitely can't live without Pancho! Pancho is my son (well, my dog) whom I just spoil too much. I rescued him from the streets of Puerto Rico and ever since we have been partners in crime. 

FOOD! Almost forgot about that one. Can't live without it! I love trying new dishes so if I'm around and you feel like cooking and exchanging recipes, let's do it! 

I love hosting guests that have positive vibes, are relaxed and know how to make the most out of every moment.

My favorite two board games are Mancala and Rummikub so if you think you can take a challenge, I'm more than willing to play! ;-)

Favorite quote: "If you judge a fish by it's ability to climb a tree, it will live it's whole life thinking it's stupid." A.Einstein

name: Penthouse with a View
summary: This centrally located, penthouse level, fully furnished space is true luxury living.  The 1 bedroom/1 bathroom unit includes modern amenities such as WiFi, A/C and heater, a chef's kitchen, a dishwasher, and an in-unit washer and dryer (laundry facility also on site). The unit also features the comforts of home, such as a queen size Nectar bed (with all the bells and whistles!), a spa shower, ample linens and towels, books, office supplies, and a 24/7 doorperson.
space: Seeking a serious, responsible, respectful guest. Guest will be asked to take excellent care of the unit and live respectfully within this community without loud noises or parties.

name: COMPACT, CENTRAL WEST LOOP ROOM WITH PARKING
summary: Centrally located private room with FREE PARKING. You will have your own door code and may arrive at ANY time you would like starting 3 p.m. and as late as you wish, no-hassle check-in guaranteed. I provide FREE PARKING. I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like.  The neighborhood is extremely safe even at night :)
space: Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 6 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!) The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock the door.  > Comfortable mattress! > GREAT location! > LATER check-out! 1 pm! > Free parking provided: park BEFORE your check-in and stay parked AFTER your check-out if you would like > Restaurants and bars are 5 MIN away walking distance  > 5 MIN walk to PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION/METRO  > No security deposit > Cancel up to 24 hours in advance to get a full refund > Last minute reservations are welcome! You will be given a door code to access the apartment and a key to lock your private room. You may arrive as late as you would like with my c

neighborhood_overview: 100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.
notes: I will also be providing a binder full of local recommendations to eat and go out, you will find the binder on the bed in your room :)
transit: "UIC Halsted" blue line is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking).  Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted" About 5 minutes to downtown. O'Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 40 minutes to O’Hare. Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 45 minutes to Midway. Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about
access: You will have access to the following: > Free WiFi, central air conditioning & heating. > Private room includes: single-sized bed, night stand, fresh bed linens, fresh towels, closet with hangers, iron & ironing board, hair dryer, lock on the door with a key. > Kitchen includes: refrigerator, table, microwave, stove, fridge, dishes, and pots. > Living room includes: Sofas, chairs, coffee tables. > Bathroom includes: bathtub/shower, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, hand soap, toilet paper > Closet to store your baggage before your check-in and after your check-out
host_about:
Hello! My name is Marina, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an auditor downtown.  

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

name: Guest Bedroom at White Walls
summary: This is the spot. You'll enjoy a cozy experience within a charming modern furnished apartment in Chicago's West Town. Share this space with knowledgeable host - and feel free to scratch together some eggs and (name another tasty food here). The key is waiting for you. Head next door to Nini’s for a Cuban espresso. Tell Juan that Hunter sent you.
space: It's spacious, clean and ready to be lived in! The firm bed in the private guest bedroom comfortably fits one person. If you are a party of 2 or 3 looking to save some cash, message me as this is an option (though the space is tight). I could open up space for these reservations as there is an air mattress and super comfy down sofa in the living room that you have access to. There is a table in the common space — if you need to focus on work. Wifi IS available (it’s the 21st Century yo!).  There is no TV (contrary to some of the photos — I’ve gotten rid of it). There is no iron (there is a steamer). There is no hair dryer or straightening iron (sorry y’all). There is not a coffee maker (but there is coffee and a French press and Chemex). The doors are creeky (it’s not brand new). The space has been rearranged some since the photos — and a lot of new art is hanging on the walls. The art is all for sale through contemporary art gallery Good Weather. (please do not touch the art)

neighborhood_overview: It's central to everything. A walk, bus, Lyft, train or bike ride away. The best places in the neighborhood (in order of proximity — within 1 mile walk/ride unless otherwise noted):      FOO (Website hidden by Airbnb) Nini’s Deli (next door — Juan is the best host (Website hidden by Airbnb) Green Grocer (closest grocery and beer/wine/liquor (Website hidden by Airbnb) Flo’s (for breakfast (Website hidden by Airbnb) Bar (Website hidden by Airbnb) Maillard Taver (Website hidden by Airbnb) The Dawso (Website hidden by Airbnb) Publican Meats (1.1 miles)      DRINK (Website hidden by Airbnb) Chipp In (Website hidden by Airbnb) Matchbo (Website hidden by Airbnb) Aberdeen Ta (Website hidden by Airbnb) Richard’s Ba (Website hidden by Airbnb) The Aviary      INSTITUTION (Website hidden by Airbnb) 1709 W. Chicago (4 art galleries (Website hidden by Airbnb) MICKEY (a contemporary art gallery (Website hidden by Airbnb) United Center (1.3 miles (Website hidden by Airbnb) MCA Chicago (2.2 miles — tak
notes: The building door is finicky. You’ll have to turn the key left and jiggle to find the “spot”. If you have any issues, call me.  You will have a private bedroom. I am in the other bedroom. The guest bedroom has a single bed. However, if you are a party of 2, I’ve left this option open as there is an air mattress and sofa in the living room that you have access to. To be clear: the single bed can comfortably fit only one person. If you are a party of 3+, feel free to message me and I can see if accommodating your party is possible in the common space — if you don’t mind a competitive bathroom or little privacy. I’ve hosted 6 people total (7 including me) before — all of whom were friends and sleeping on cots, sofas, air mattresses and floors wasn’t an inconvenience.
transit: Free parking on the street. 10 min walk to the L (Chicago, Blue Line stop). If coming from O’Hare — take the Blue Line to the Chicago stop. If coming from Midway — take the Orange to Blue Line to the Chicago stop. Or it’s affordable to take a Lyft Line from the airport direct. If driving in, there is free parking on the street or at the school next door (on weekends). Pay attention to any impromptu construction or street cleaning signs.
access: Feel free to cook, clean and do laundry. My home is your home. Cereal and granola in the cabinets next to the fridge. Milk, yogurt, juice, eggs and bacon in the fridge.
interaction: I will welcome you, provide you with quick lay of the land (you'll want to know where the cereal is), suggest a few neighborhood haunts and then be out of your hair unless you have any questions or would like to hang out. If no one is home when you arrive at 1355 W. Ohio, I will send directions to you via the Airbnb App to the hidden key. If you have issues, call me at (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN). The apartment is the first one on the left. Refreshment in the fridge. Fresh towels under the sink.
house_rules: Lock the door behind you. Clean up after yourself. If wet or muddy shoes, please remove at door. Upon leaving, turn AC to 78 or off. Leave sheets and towels in the washer. Leave dirty dishes in the dishwasher. Leave keys on kitchen counter.
host_about:
Arkansan living in Chicago building Schlep - a service to take care of your heavy lifting and local logistical needs.

Love traveling, exploring the outdoors and people.

name: HIP Logan Sq SPACIOUS & CLEAN 2 bed top floor apt!
summary: Spacious, clean, & quiet top floor 2 bed apt in new renovated home in hip Logan Square. Charming modern mid century decor w/ incredible zen like backyard! 10 min walk to Blue Line stop if you need to go anywhere else in the city, but this A+ location will allow you to walk to all the best coffee shops, restaurants, & bars in the city! There's a very popular farmers market on the weekend & street festivals all year long! We have an online map of all our favorite places that I will pass along!
space: All basic amenities are included; extremely clean and comfy beds including a nice king size bed in one of the rooms, queen in the other- both with memory foam mattresses. Two large living rooms with a  couch in one and a futon couch in another for additional sleeping.  There is a huge eat kitchen with dining table . and fully equipped with all the necessities (pots, pans, dishes, cutlery)  if you choose to eat in.  There is a large flat screen TV with basic cable, wifi, clean towels and linens, 2 AC window units. There is also a queen air mattress, if needed upon request with extra linens. Washer/dryer with detergent provided if need be. Parking is free on the street where the house is located and usually very easy to find. If you'd like us to set up the couch and/or the air mattress, please let us know and we are happy to do so. If not, you are also welcome to set it up yourself, there is bedding and linens in the hall closet.

There is a large flat screen TV with basic cable, wifi, clean towels and linens, 2 A
neighborhood_overview: The house is in Logan Square, voted one of the nation's coolest neighborhoods, filled with bars, cafes, and mom-and-pop shops. Feel at home on a peaceful, tree-lined street with friendly neighbors. An ever-popular farmers' market is close by. Keep in mind, this apartment is located on the 2nd floor of this home.
notes: Please note that check-in is at 3 PM and check out is at noon. We may be able to accommodate early or late, but you must ask us or you may intrude on another guest's stay. Also, please do not bring any extra guests that are not originally noted in your reservation. If something happens and you must, please let us know and we can work something out; we're very accommodating. However if you do not let us know, we will withhold the security deposit. Thanks!
transit: Public Transportation CTA Blue Line Uber or Lyft in mins Or by foot! Tons to walk to!!
access: Full private access to the entire full floor of the apartment, gorgeous landscaped backyard with zen garden including some herbs and veggies (if they are available), and laundry in the basement. Only hypoallergenic dogs are allowed (Logan Square is extremely dog friendly) and have access to the enclosed backyard, but any pet waste must be cleaned up immediately. Please also respect our neighbors by picking up pet waste in the neighborhood. Also, no smoking in the home but you can smoke in the backyard away from the home but please do not litter in our gorgeous yard! We would also like to know if you are bringing a pet, so please include that in your messages to us.
interaction: As much or as little as you prefer. Let us know if you need any suggestions or directions, happy to help! We can let you do your thing or even plan a weekend for you, just let us know. I will have a book provided for you when you arrive that will list all the top places to go to in the area as my personal favorite hot spots as well as other basics of transportation, shopping, grocery, etc.
house_rules: - Please no loud music after 10pm to respect the neighbors. - Please no shoes in the home to keep clean as well as respect neighbors below. - Keep smoking outside only away from the house IN THE BACK YARD ONLY and dispose of cigarette butts in trash or ashtray that is provided. No smoking in the front of the house to disturb neighbors - Only hypoallergenic dogs allowed and you must pick up after your dog whether it be in the yard or walking. - Please turn off air conditioner (when necessary) and lights when leaving. -Please be considerate of the neighbors and throw any trash away

name: Newly Remodeled Coach House on Oakley
summary: Perfect spot for summer festivals! Enjoy all that Little Italy has to offer, in the heart of the UIC Medical district. We are about 20 mins. from downtown Chicago. Enjoy staying on a quiet tree lined street just minutes from everything. This is a very unique area of the city!! Take a quick walk to get Italian ice or gelato right in Chicago's "Little Italy" section located on Taylor & Morgan,  or hop on the subway, bus, or Uber and be in Millennium Park in 20 minutes time.
space: This charming and historic workman's Coach House (built around 1890) has 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom. Stay in a piece of Chicago history while enjoying all the modern amenities which include: -Self-check in system: Key code Lockbox - Free high-speed Wi-Fi access - 42" TV w/Amazon Firestick to Access your Netflix, Youtube & Hulu accounts - Central air/heat -A fully stocked kitchen with  Stainless Steel Fridge, Toaster Oven, and Microwave  - Please ask for a Blender if you might need one - Keurig  Coffee Maker (for single serve coffee) with complimentary Starbucks coffee -Tea Kettle with complimentary Tea  -Brita Water Pitcher inside the Fridge -Bathroom is stocked with Shampoo, Conditioner, Body Wash, Lotion and Fresh Towels -Washer/Dryer on premises for small fee -Hair dryer, iron and ironing board - Lawn chairs & small patio table to enjoy the outside deck

neighborhood_overview: Awesome location 5.3 miles from The Bean @ Millennium Park; 10 mins from West Loop, Taylor street Restaurants. Walking distance to the United Center. 15 mins away in Taxi from Wicker Park and Buck town. Quiet family neighborhood close to the UIC Medical District.
notes: - There is free parking on Polk street; and during the summer all around the elementary school premises.  -If traveling by car, be sure to note the parking restrictions in front of the house; as it is a permit parking only zone. - I offer 2 complimentary permits; but if you need more... (there's a small fee since I have to get them from City Hall)
transit: CTA Blue Line on Western, Pink Line on Paulina & Polk, 157 Streeterville Bus on Taylor & Oakley Corner.  UIC Bus stop on Taylor. Next to I-290, 5 minutes to 90-94 Kennedy expressway. Major intersections nearby Western, Damen & Ogden streets.
access: Also, I do have a dog who likes to run up the steps and chase the cats, but she is VERY Friendly! You will have private access to the whole apartment. You will also have access to laundry room, and patio.  This will be done in the next few weeks (8/15) in between Reservations.
interaction: I will be available for any questions prior and during your stay! Chicago Little Italy and West Loop are my neighborhoods ... so I am more than happy to make recommendations on local favorite spots!
host_about: I'm an IT professional by day, Landlord and Kids chauffeur after work. I like to travel and I like to be a great host. I consider myself somewhat of an entrepreneur in the making ... up and coming! :-)

name: Cozy Garden Studio on Damen
summary: Cozy garden unit studio in the perfect location - Wicker Park. Walk a couple blocks north to Division St. and experience an array of eclectic shops, authentic cuisine, and dive bars. Or go south to Chicago Ave for great drinks and music. This space is great for 1-2 people looking to experience the best Wicker Park has to offer.  Whether business or play: this location offers easy access to both the loop and the airport. Just a 10 minute walk will get you to the Blue Line and on your journey.
space: Queen bed, sofa, dining table. Coffee maker, kitchen appliances, and kitchenware are for your use.  Main fridge for leftovers, etc, and a mini fridge with drinks for you to help yourself.

neighborhood_overview: This updated apartment is nestled right in the heart of Edgewater Glen - With Plenty of tree-lined streets, Edgewater Glen is blocks from Lake Michigan, 2 'L' stations, a few bus lines, Loyola University, Andersonville, restaurants, parks, and shopping. Easy access to downtown, Lake Shore Drive and Evanston too!
notes: Street parking is abundant in the neighborhood. There are 2 large built-in window air conditioning units - one toward the front of the  house and one at the back. When both are running, they cool the apartment very efficiently. On warm nights, it may be necessary to keep the doors to the bedrooms open in order that they stay cool while sleeping. There is a couch and room for a blow up mattress so if you have more than 4 people and are still interested in our apartment, we might be able to work with you. Just ask :)
transit: Walk around the neighborhood to experience Chicago like a local. Hop an express bus from Edgewater Glen and be on Michigan Avenue in 20 minutes! Need to get to the Loop? Hop on the Red Line "L" and be there in 30 mins.
access: There is plenty of space for you to unpack for a long stay with closets and dressers.  Combo Washer/Dryer and Dishwaher in Unit. We also provide a steamer for clothes. Iron, Vaccuum cleaner, 12-cup coffee machine, microwave.  The Full Dining Room adjacent to fully appointed kitchen makes hosting a dinner party easy! As far as technology goes, the apartment has Wi-Fi, 50" flat screen TV (no cable) and wireless speakers in a few of the rooms.
house_rules: No smoking inside the apartment. No pets.  This is a small building and the neighbors are close... Please be courteous! We encourage a good time but please no large parties and keep noise and music down as there are neighbors downstairs.  If you spill or drop food on the floor, we expect you'll wipe it up. If you break it, scratch it or ruin it, we expect you will fix it :) I have check-in set as 'flexible' — Preferred check-in time is 5PM but I can work with you if need be.
host_about: I am a graphic designer who takes pride in his home. I look forward to sharing my home with people in need of a clean, comfortable and convenient apartment - close to the lake, public transportation, Loyola, Andersonville and tons of great shopping and restaurants!

summary: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this sophisticated River North furnished one-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and exquisite living room with great high floor views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Chicago has to offer! (#CHI85)
space: As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this one-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Chicago vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in River North, Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood. The bridges combined with the riverwalk offer incredible views. Nearby on Michigan Avenue is the city’s premier shopping area. One of the neighborhood’s biggest assets is the walk-to-work appeal. Young professionals, who live and work in the area, can quickly get to the office in the morning and just as easily enjoy an after-work drink, as the area is considered a premier entertainment center. Don’t miss a stroll on Kinzie and Hubbard streets. Merchandise Mart, the iconic building with showrooms, shops, and office space, is only a 5 minute walk. The Loop is just across the bridge and is about 5 minute walk.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $275 monthly fee. Parking offered may be on or off-site, and may be covered or open. Spaces are designed for compact vehicles. Please provide us with your car details min. 1 business day in advance to avoid the chance of erroneous towing - Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance - Please contact us for details
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

Bronzeville is a magnet for young urban professionals and  entrepreneurs who are leading the revitalization of the area and the restoration of its historic landmarks. neighborhood_overview: Bronzeville is a magnet for young urban professionals and  entrepreneurs who are leading the revitalization of the area and the restoration of its historic landmarks. The history of the area has made it something of a tourist attraction, and the neighborhood has many new businesses, including cafes, coffeehouses, and quaint shops. The demographic trends young, but there are many families with children in this tight-knit community.
transit: Bronzeville is convenient to the city’s business district with easy access to anywhere in town, with plenty of public transportation options. The Chicago Transit Authority operates the Red and Green rail lines which serve the Bronzeville neighborhood, as does the Metra Electric District Main Line. Several bus routes run through the area, and the major artery of the Dan Ryan Expressway is just a few minutes’ drive away. Anywhere in the city of Chicago can be reached quickly and easily by public transit or by car.
access: The guests will have access to the entire basement apartment which includes a private entrance, bathroom, one bedroom with a full size bed. The living area is fully furnished with a sofa, tv, microwave, and refrigerator.

host_about:
I am a mother of 5 and grandmother of 8 currently living in the woods and hills of Georgia and occasionally the hustle and bustle of Chicago.  I like to cook, to paint, to read mystery novels , explore neighborhoods and restaurants, riding my bike and spending my time with family and friends.  
Diversity in life is what drives me and living in Rogers Park has put me in the midst of people from all over the world.   I love to travel and when I do, I prefer to stay off the beaten path; experiencing every day life with local folk.  I'm not a fan of luxury resort/hotel chains  so Airbnb is perfect.  My building is now a century old and takes me back in time with its Chicago vintage charm.

neighborhood_overview: Located in the heart of Wicker Park.  • a 2 minutes walk to Milwaukee Ave to enjoy amazing dining, bars, and entertainment.  • Easy walk to enjoy   - Jeni’s ice cream   - Bongo Room,    - Reckless Records   - Emporium Arcade Bar   - Myopic Books    - Comedy Clubhouse,     - trendy thrift stores    - bars wiChicago character  Enjoy a quiet home in an energetic neighborhood!
notes: PARKING INFORMATION  Beach street requires a permit and they do ticket. I’ve always found parking on Blackhawk East of Ashland or Ada just south of Blackhawk.  Sometimes they have street cleaning so check for temporary signs.  About 1/2 The streets east of Ashland don’t require a permit.  Also there is free overnight parking closer to the apartment on Paulina south of Beach, but it is paid parking starting early in the morning through the day so you’d need to watch for that.  There is free street parking during the day from 6am to 6pm 2 blocks north of the apartment on on Pierce.   There’s a lot of options but you need to heed the parking signs as the City seems to check nightly for violators.  The apartment is in a very walkable location and is a short walk to the CTA Subway Blue line that goes into downtown. Also it’s a quick rideshare to almost anywhere you want to go.
transit: Five minute walk to Division or Damen blue line CTA “L” stop. Divy bikes are available at the end of the block. There is free overnight street parking about a 10 minute walk away.
access: The entire apartment is available for use except the rear porch (except in an emergency).
interaction: We are available via the AirBNB app and we strive to respond timely to all your requests.
house_rules: Please clean dishes and leave trash in the backyard when checking out.
host_about: My goal is for you to enjoy your trip. I live in the area and I am available if you should need anything.

name: Discounted Rates! OHC Gorgeous Studio by Blue Line
summary: *Please note the increased health and safety measures being taken in the "Other things to note" section of our listing.  Welcome to OHC Studio! Part of the Open House Contemporary family of art gallery airbnbs, this huge 1000 sq ft studio apartment is the perfect place to call home base while you explore Chicago. Featured in Architectural Digest (Aug. 2018) and as one of Bobby Berk's (Queer Eye's designer extraordinaire) top 10 Airbnbs in Condé Nast Traveler (Sept. 2018).
space: Come experience the thrill of living with amazing contemporary art in my beautiful apartment. Designer furniture and custom built-ins furnish this 1000 sq ft apartment. I provide plenty of towels, soap, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, makeup removing wipes and there is a CVS located across the street if you forgot anything! The apartment features a state of the art Sony 48" Smart TV hooked up to an Apple TV, queen size bed and a massive leather couch that converts into a second bed if needed! Designer, artist, gallerist, and builder I've made this home into a beautiful place that you will love to stay in. Do you need recommendations? A passionate lover of food, music, and the arts, I am happy to provide countless recommendations on what to see, where to eat, and how best to easily get there from my amazingly convenient home.

The apartment features a state of the art Sony 48" Smart TV hooked up to an Apple TV, queen size bed and a massive leather couch that converts into a second bed if needed! Designer, artist, gall
neighborhood_overview: Located in one of the most desirable locations in the city, the River West neighborhood is full of great restaurants and nightlife and just minutes away from uber-hip neighborhoods such as Wicker Park, Logan Square, Ukrainian Village, the West Loop, and only a mile and a half from the lakefront and the Magnificent Mile!
notes: There is no higher priority for us than the health and safety of our guests, staff and co-hosts. During this unique time in travel Open House Hospitality is taking extra precautions to prevent the spread of the Covid 19 virus. We want you to feel confident when inhabiting one of our properties. As a result, we have enhanced some of our cleaning procedures in the interest of everyone's health and safety. In conjunction with the director of our cleaning team we've come up with the following additional measures beyond our standard cleaning to help ensure the safety of everyone who enters our properties. All surfaces are being wiped down with disinfectant after each guest with special attention being paid to door handles, pulls, remote controls and other often touched surfaces, all linens and towels are being washed with both detergent and bleach and we are misting the entire home with Lysol disinfecting spray in between each group of guests to help mitigate any airborne pathogens. Even wi
transit: Seriously it is tough to find a more convenient location to call home base during your stay. The Chicago Avenue Blue Line stop (subway) is half a block away. Fly into O'hare and take the Blue Line straight to your front door in only 30 minutes. Once here hop back on the Blue Line and in just a couple stops be in the heart of Wicker Park or head downtown and be in "the loop" in just 2 stops... Hop on the Chicago Avenue bus (the stop is only half a block away!) and head straight down to the Museum of Contemporary Art, Water Tower Place, or any number of fantastic shops or restaurants located on the Magnificent Mile! Are you driving to Chicago or maybe you want to rent a car? No problem. Free street parking is easy to find on the adjacent streets in the evening. There is also private indoor parking in our main building's garage ($20 per night) and the highway couldn't be closer! Depending on traffic you could be parked in your garage in 25 minutes after leaving O'hare. Going out for drink
access: The whole apartment is yours to use! Private entrance on a safe well lit street!
interaction: Self check-in is super easy with our state of the art August home locks. While you are in Chicago I am available on an as needed basis, just a quick message, text or call away if anything comes up or if you need a tip on the best place to grab brunch, see a show, or the best way to get from here to there.
house_rules: Please treat the space and the neighborhood with respect, the same way you would want me to be if I was staying in your home! OHC Studio House Rules: 1.	Check in is at 4 p.m. Check out is at 11 a.m. Early check-in or late check out may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated check out time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses. 2.	Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you are booking within your city.  3.	Just like in any gallery or museum please do not touch the art. Damaged artwork is subject to a conservation fee based on the extent of damage and cost to repair. If artwork is damaged beyond repair guest is responsible for paying the list price of the artwork. Price lists are provided in unit. 4.	Smoking and vaping are not allowed on the property, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean,
host_about: Artist, Designer, Gallerist, Contractor... I have a passion for making spaces come alive.  I love to travel and I love travelers... Come stay at one my places and I will use that as an excuse to get out of town and see some other part of the world.   A passionate lover of food, art, and music, I love to see, taste, and experience new things. I've tried to make my home an exciting destination to come home to every evening and I am excited about the opportunity to share it with you.

Expand your own cultural universe when you stay in this eclectic neighborhood, home to Frank Lloyd Wright’s Robie House, theaters, parks, and plenty of culinary destinations both seasoned (get it?) and new. Your unit includes two bedrooms, a full kitchen, and expansive entertainment options.

neighborhood_overview: Jefferson Park has long been one of Chicago's transportation hubs, earning the neighborhood the nickname as "The Gateway to Chicago". The neighborhood is served by a Blue Line station in the median of the Kennedy Expressway at the intersection of Milwaukee and Gale Street, less than three blocks away from the Copernicus Center and the historic Jefferson Park Congregational Church. The Union Pacific / Northwest Line also provides service to Jefferson Park.

house_rules: 1. CHECK-IN time - after 4pm. CHECK-OUT time before 11 am.  No last minute changes will be accepted, sorry. 2. NO SMOKING anywhere inside the building. You may smoke outside ONLY.  If there is evidence of smoking indoors you will loose your deposit  and will be charged for professional odor removal. No marijuana, no hookah, no drugs. 3. QUIET HOURS  between 10pm-7am.  Please use caution when entering late at night so other guests will not be disturbed. That includes late TV sessions. 4. NO SHOES in the house, please. We're taking pride in keeping it extremely clean; vacuumed and mopped before each visit. 5. NO PARTIES, events or gatherings. Only guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. host_about:
We are a couple who love to travel and have fun together discovering new cultures and meeting people from all over the world. Angelika is a psychologist and a psychotherapist, and Zibi is an engineer with artistic ambitions. We love architecture and design, music, art, film and food. 

Coming to Chicago we were astonished by all the diversity and city’s cultural offerings. Airbnb is our way to connect with people and to make each guest experience this amazing city to the fullest. 

Thank you for checking out our place. We look forward to welcoming you and ensuring your stay with us is everything you could wish for.
Molon labe!

summary: Indulge in this sprawling 3,690 square foot Modern 6 bedroom 4 bath Penthouse. Comprised of two adjoining apartments in an elevator building set in River West at the gateway to River North & West Loop. Enjoy complete privacy from the top floor of a brand new construction River West building. Perfect for large groups or families.  Two Indoor garage Parking spaces included. When nothing will do except the very best, Cirro by The Cloud9 Experience awaits.
space: Dual adjoining modern apartments with luxe amenities serves as your own tranquil retreat. 6 Bedrooms, 4 bathrooms, 2 living rooms and 2 chef kitchens.  Marvel at Chicago’s skyline views from the expansive windows or a private 437 sq ft deck completed in Porcelain. Take in the crystalline scene from the chic living room with space for six or eight if need be. Enjoy high tech of todays highest standards such as 65 inch living room TV and surround multiple speaker sound provided by Sonos as well as seriously fast internet thanks to 1GB speeds. Gather in the integrated Chef’s kitchens from Archisesto featuring Liebherr/Miele Appliances outfitted with Le Crueset Cookware, Zwilling J.A. Henckels silverware and Chef’s knives, Schott Zwiesel wine glasses, Frieling french press and much more. Or head to the bedroom to luxuriate in the impossibly soft linens of your pillow top Memory Foam bed.  Here, there’s no detail too fine—and no standard too high.  Welcome home.

name: Al Capone's Hideout
summary: We won't make you learn the secret knock, but this speakeasy themed apartment is sure to make your visit to Chicago so enjoyable.  The decor says 1920's, but the amenities are all brand new!  Designed by renowned local designer, Jules Gathman, you'll be delighted by our attention to detail.  What a great location.  Within 100 feet of the front door are a number of places to eat, drink, and socialize.  Located in the hot "California Corridor" neighborhood, we are 2 blocks from a 209 acre Park!
space: As you can tell from the pictures, we decorated our apartment to look like a 1920's prohibition era speakeasy.  We looked high and far for authentic decor to match our theme! And although the theme is 1920's, we have all new modern amenities.  Brand new appliances in the kitchen, a full cable package and netflix, a Klipsch sound bar that can connect to any of your devices over bluetooth, and a Nest thermostat are all there to make your stay comfortable!  We also have smart locks, and we'll give you a personal code so that you don't need to worry about carrying around a key!

neighborhood_overview: Located in the "California Corridor" we have a number of things to do right outside the front door.  We are right next to a wine bar, across the street from a burger bar, kiddy corner from a french breakfast/lunch spot, 3 doors down from a soda fountain and coffee shop, and about 100 feet from one of the best jazz clubs in the city.  However, it's very quiet at night.  2 blocks away is a 209 acre park that is full of paths for biking, running, walking.  It has tennis courts, a fishing pond, and Chicago's only in land swimming beach.  Plus it has a number of playgrounds for the youngsters.
notes: Please note that there are tenants that live in the same building. After 10 PM please respect their peace by not being too loud. Please note that there is an additional cleaning charge of $25 for leaving dirty dishes behind for the cleaning crew. Also, if you do not follow the 11AM checkout rule and the cleaning crew has to wait for you to vacate there will be a $25 fee. If there is a prenegotiated late check out this will not apply.
access: The apartment is 2 bedrooms with a king bed in one room and a queen bed in the other.  The couch can be converted to a sleeper, and we have an air mattress as well.
interaction: It's our goal to make sure that you have the best visit to Chicago.  I live a few blocks away, so I can easily run over if you need anything.  And we are always here for great advice on what to do in this amazing city.  But we definitely leave you alone to enjoy your trip however you please.

neighborhood_overview: The Ridgeland is located at 6729 S. Ridgeland Avenue, Chicago, IL  60649.  Adjacent to Jackson Park Golf Course, the lakefront, next to Hyde Park and the University of Chicago. It's close to everything without the high prices of downtown. We hope you will take a long walk through the miles of park, beach, meadowland and golf courses a half a block from your door.  Walk a few minutes further to Hyde Park and you're in a little city within the big city.  A beautiful mix of cool people. It's just the way the world should be. My family and I love living here!
notes: Cannabis Consumption Policy The Spark Clubs promotes wellness through Cannabis.  Translation: NO TOBACCO, CIGARS, CIGARETTES, BLUNTS OR CIGAR WRAPPERS due to the chemicals and carcinogens they contain.   We will keep your security deposit to pay for cleanup is this rule is not adhered to.  In order to maintain optimal air quality, we have specific areas for consumption.  Simply slide open the window in the rear and turn on the extraction fan and all cannabis smoke will extract.  It doesn’t work with tobacco because of the chemicals contained in those products.  We can always tell if there is tobacco smoke.  When booking with us, you give us the right to determine if there was a smoking violation and authorizing us to keep the security deposit for the cleanup costs. Guests can smoke tobacco outside on the rear porch.  No smoking in bedrooms or building common areas. Vaping, dab rigs, bongs, hookahs as well as regular rolling papers, are fine. Reservations Please carefully read all reser
transit: Chicago is a very bicycle friendly town.  The city has one of the most expansive bicycle sharing networks in the country with over 5,800 bikes for rental  at 580 locations spread throughout the city. Take scenic Lake Shore Drive to downtown in 10 to 15 minutes, depending on traffic.  Less than fifteen minutes to the Museum Campus.  Divvy bike rental a block away, public transportation three blocks away and off street parking available for rental cars. Driving: 5 min to Hyde Park, University of Chicago, Lakefront, Parks & Beach. Uber:  $8-$10 10 min to McCormick Place Convention Center, White Sox Park & IIT.  Uber: $20 15 min to Downtown, Museum Campus, Navy Pier, Northwestern & Grant Park. Uber:$15 20 min to Lincoln Park Zoo.  Uber: $20 25 min to Wrigley Field. Uber: $24 30+ min to Evanston, Northwestern Main Campus. However, there are HD cameras that monitor/record the building common areas (e.g. stairways, exteriors).   We are on site regularly and have staff nearby in case of any issues and WE MONITOR THE PROPERTY. Early Check-In & Late Check-Out upgrades can be purchased based upon availability.

host_about:
Hello, Travelers!  Welcome to your temporary home in Chicago!  We love our location near Hyde Park, the University of Chicago, the Lake and the Parks and just over 10 minutes to downtown Chicago via the Lake.  

Our family of four takes full advantage of the walking and bike trails in the area. We also frequent nearby Hyde Park, for its distinctive and unique offerings and to hopefully, run into a friend or two.

We still love road trips but, our favorite trips are with our extended family.  Recently, 20+ family members descended upon San Pedro, Belize and again in Costa Rica.  This year less exotic Washington, DC is on the list.

Because I have Lupus and Rheumatoid Arthritis I am an licensed Illinois Medical Cannabis patient.  I live a healthy lifestyle which includes living gluten-free and I encourage others to incorporate health into their lives.

The Spark Clubs is based on a wellness concept.   We do not allow tobacco because it is a known carcinogen and the chemicals affect the air quality of everyone in the building.  The smoke smell lays on the walls and soft goods, linens and curtains.  We have to spend extra money to clean that off when folks violate our rules. That is why we have a security deposit now to encourage good behavior.

When people use cannabis alone, there tends to be significantly less smell and it does not linger. With the ventilation methods we employ, any smoke can be quickly evacuated from the room.  As a result, our rooms stay fresh.  

As far as linens are concerned, we shopped for high-quality bedding to provide you with the best sleep experience you can find.  Our beds have toppers and pads and down comforters and feather pillows and percale sheets... all designed to make your sleep experience exceptional.  In order to maintain our investment in our linens, we ask that people refrain from smoking, eating or drinking in the bedrooms.  Each bed has around $420 in linens on it, this is why we ask for a deposit.  Typically the only damage we've had is smoke and linens.

The unit smells pleasant and you will sleep on high quality, freshly laundered linens.  

We all love to read and take books with us on vacation.  Sometimes we wing it, just start driving and book from the road with a last-minute hotel app.  Sometimes we plan a year in advance.

I'm a Super Host because I love hosting!  I am so into creating a great experience for people, I am looking forward to each and every guest.  I'm very friendly and talkative, however, I intend to disappear so guests can create their own memories.

One of my many mottos:  Eat dessert first.

summary: Discover the best of Chicago, with this one-bedroom The Loop apartment with high floor views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this lavishly Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, pretty living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (#CHI230)

And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is situated in the most dynamic and convenient place to live in Chicago, The Loop. With its endless shopping, fine dining, stunning park, river and lake views, and entertainment opportunities, everything is possible at a moment’s notice. The area is a cultural getaway for professionals and students, who can combine work with pleasure. Discover landmark buildings like the Willis Tower and The Art Institute of Chicago. Millenium Park, near Lake Michigan, is always worth a visit. The Loop is within reach of accessible transportation, offering non-stop public transit, buses, and taxis. Union Station is approximately a 10 minute train ride.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Sophisticated & updated, walking distance to Lake!
summary: Location, location, location! Clean & Comfortable! Recently updated with all you could need!
space: Completely upgraded one bedroom in the Gold Coast, Chicago just blocks from the lake! This high-end unit is completely furnished down to all your kitchenware, towels, and everything you could possibly need, also all your utilities are included so you will have no additional bills.  Features include granite counter tops, stainless appliances, wall to wall hardwood flooring, nice size living and sleeping square footage with beautiful professionally organized closet.  All of this in one of Chicago's most exquisite neighborhoods! Featuring leasing staff seven days a week, friendly door staff, on site maintenance, fitness center, incredible outdoor sun deck with lake views and gas grills, as well as laundry and bike storage. Please feel free to search 14 West Elm to check out our website for more information!.

neighborhood_overview: Just north of downtown Chicago, and nestled against the Lake Michigan shoreline, is the Gold Coast. As the name would imply, the area is one of the country's most affluent neighborhoods. With streets that are lined with historic mansions and specialty boutiques, the Gold Coast is an intensely popular area for residents and visitors. Branching off of The Magnificent Mile is Oak Street, an upscale shopper's dream. The retail revelry includes internationally recognized stores, swanky boutiques and rare, designer fashions. If carrying around loaded shopping bags makes you hungry, you can stop at one of the district's many celebrated restaurants, including Michelin-starred winners and classic Chicago steakhouses. A day of shopping becomes a night of revelry on the neighborhood's fabled Rush Street. Amongst the prestigious hotels and celebrated eateries, you will find a trove of booming nightlife hot spots and high-energy events. Treat yourself to the Gold Coast, you deserve it.
notes: For the safety of the building, we run a quick criminal background check when you arrive.
transit: Red Line stop one block away and bus stops right across the street!
access: Guests will have access to fitness center, laundry, and an incredible rooftop deck!
interaction: We will try and communicate as much as needed, although if you need anything please do not hesitate to let us know! This apartment is managed by the on-site leasing office, therefore we are easily available!
house_rules: -> To insure the safety of building & its residents, we require a quick background check before check in. You will need identification (Passport, Drivers License, VISA), as well as, answer a couple questions for us.  -> Please be respectful of the building and your neighbors. 14 West Elm is in a great location, although we are near many bars and restaurants therefore that can get a little crazy. Please be safe!  -> Smoking is allowed outside or on the roof deck only.  -> Unfortunately, we do not allow pets to ensure the unit is allergy free!  -> The unit is not set up for children or infants in terms of safety precautions. Although, we are happy to accommodate and do our best to make it comfortable for all! -> If something gets broken or needs repair, please let us know immediately and our on-site maintenance will take care of it.  We hope you enjoy and feel at home at 14 West Elm!

name: Sonder | Essex on the Park | Premier 1BR + View
summary: We want everyone to have a comfortable place to stay. Our digital check-in and the ability to manage your stay from our app, means you won't need to interact with anyone in person. Our staff has been trained in proper disinfection techniques and will deep clean your Sonder before and after your stay. We're here for you during this time of uncertainty and can be reached 24/7 via text or call. Named the most innovative travel company of 2019 by Fast Company, Sonder has hosted a million guests in 5,000+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.   - 24/7 support via text, email, or phone   - Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided   - Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive   - Self check-in

Spend the day exploring the countless museums, or journey to the top of the 108-story Willis Tower for breathtaking views of the city.

name: The Paris Room in Logan Square
summary: FREE PRIVATE PARKING INCLUDED!! Welcome to the Paris Room located in Logan Square, one of Chicago's most popular neighborhoods! Your private bedroom and bathroom is located in one of the most convenient parts of town. Access downtown Chicago in minutes as well as enjoy some of the finest restaurants, bars, and coffee shops that Illinois has to offer. Logan Square is considered one of the most artistic Chicago neighborhoods and is sure to be a great destination for any visitor.
space: Your room is one bedroom of four total bedrooms in the apartment. There will be two other bedrooms being rented in tandem with this bedroom as well as your hosts bedroom. The Paris bedroom is the only rented bedroom located on the basement level and has plenty of privacy including it's own private bathroom and semi-private entrance.  Guests are welcome to shared use of the entire apartment including the kitchen, living room, fitness area, balcony, and laundry room (laundry use is free). FREE PRIVATE PARKING INCLUDED

neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is one of the friendliest and booming neighborhoods in Chicago with plenty of nightlife options on every corner. The Brown Room is within a few blocks of Revolution Brewery, Logan Bar, Cole's, The Boiler Room, Las Estrellas Negros and a host of other hot spots (and for mornings - 3 blocks south is the much loved Cozy Corner Diner for pancakes, skillets, bacon and eggs). Vegetarians & Vegans will enjoy the highlylauded Chicago Diner, right around the corner from the house. I'm just a few blocks from The Logan Theater, a restored vintage movie theater and comedy showcase room with it's own bar , and on the corner from the theater there's no "banker with a motorcar", but you will see an actual barber shop called Penny Lane : ) Also just a block away is the local cannabis dispensary.
notes: Please note that this is a private bedroom and bathroom only in a shared apartment. It is possible there will be other guests also staying at this apartment during your visit. All rooms all completely private and have interior locks for your peace of mind and security.
transit: Public trans (Blue Line train and street buses) are within two blocks. You can get downtown within 20 minutes and the blue line train will get you out to O'Hare International Airport within 35 minutes.

name: Urban Terrace @ Fulton House!
summary: Our 3 bedroom condo is ideal for traveling groups - 4 beds means it can comfortably sleep 8, and there's an air bed to sleep 10! You'll love playing our Silver Strike Bowling arcade game! On the top floor and close to Garfield Park Conservatory and the Green Line. It's a 15 minute train ride to the Loop, there's parking in the back, and we're centrally located - ideal for any Chicago adventure you have in mind.
space: You enter our condo into one of two living rooms, which has overhead a large skylight. To your right is the second living room, with a TV, and the front bedroom. To your left is a dining area and the second bedroom. Down the hallway is the bathroom, and the third bedroom, which has two queen sized beds in it. At the rear of the condo is a spacious kitchen.

I put a lot of work into getting my spaces ready, and I know you will enjoy your stay with me! Welcome to Chicago!

name: Re-energize in Private Room in new Logan Square Townhouse
summary: Explore Chicago like a local, with access to the 606 Trail joining 4 of its fastest-growing neighborhoods. The bright, well-appointed bedroom features elegant equine pictures, while a shared rooftop deck affords some great views of downtown.
space: Walk along the 606 and discover great dining and nightlife options.  The trail is an elevated railroad track that has been converted into a 2.7 mile park.  Also great restaurants like Sink Swim, Parsons, and Giant are within walking distance.  Want to enjoy a great cocktail?  Head over to Scofflaw for some of the cities best.
description: Explore Chicago like a local, with access to the 606 Trail joining 4 of its fastest-growing neighborhoods. The bright, well-appointed bedroom features elegant equine pictures, while a shared rooftop deck affords some great views of downtown.
neighborhood_overview: One of the most diverse districts in Chicago, the Logan Square Humboldt park area is mostly made up of Ukrainian, Puerto Rican, and Mexican communities, plus millennials and young families. Unsurprisingly, there's a great range of restaurants.
notes: Please no smoking anywhere in the townhouse or on rooftop deck and fenced in areas. Security cameras are installed in common areas.
transit: Located between O´Hare airport and downtown Chicago along the Blue line train and bus services.  Street parking is available and garage parking may be an option with advance notice.  Uber and Lyft are excellent ways of getting around as is the bike path on the 606 trail.
access: Guests have access to the entire house, including a rooftop deck with great views of the park and a full kitchen, dining, and living area.  The shared spaces are areas for you to meet fellow travelers and hopefully make new friends.
interaction: I’m available to answer any questions about the accommodations and my adopted home, Chicago.
house_rules: Kitchen is available for guest use, but please clean after use. Respect other guests and keep noise down. Absolutely no smoking in property or in rooftop deck or within fenced area. No guests allowed that are not on the reservation. No more than two guests per room. Common area curfew is midnight. No parties or illegal activities allowed.
host_about: New Yorker in Chicago.  Glad to share my knowledge of food and drink in town.

name: 'Secret Garden' Apartment in Wrigleyville
summary: Small garden unit in the heart of Wrigleyville. Steps from both Wrigley and Boystown. The apartment has a queen bed and air mattresses can be set up in the living area.  In addition, the apartment has mini fridge, microwave, coffee machine w/ pods, and small dining table. There is no kitchen; fortunately Chicago has a multitude of amazing restaurants to choose from! Includes full bathroom with shower and linens.
space: The apartment is in an excellent Wrigleyville/Boystown/Lakeview location with a multitude of restaurants and nightlife nearby!
description: Small garden unit in the heart of Wrigleyville. Steps from both Wrigley and Boystown. The apartment has a queen bed and air mattresses can be set up in the living area.  In addition, the apartment has mini fridge, microwave, coffee machine w/ pods, and small dining table. There is no kitchen; fortunately Chicago has a multitude of amazing restaurants to choose from! Includes full bathroom with shower and linens. The apartment is in an excellent Wrigleyville/Boystown/Lakeview location with a multitude of restaurants and nightlife nearby! The apartment is a fully self-contained garden apartment with a private entrance with electronic keypad lock, so you can come and go as you please without disturbing the building residents. Host lives in the building, so I'll be happy to give you suggestions for the area. In addition, I'll always be available by phone or text for whatever you need during your stay! The apartment is right on the border of Wrigleyville and Boystown, so each provides its o
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is right on the border of Wrigleyville and Boystown, so each provides its own unique nightlife. Apartment is also a mere 10 minute walk from Wrigley Stadium, so a great location for an evening game! The apartment is a short walk from Belmont Harbor and the lake, a short bus ride from Lincoln Park Zoo, and about 20 minute train ride from the Loop! The options while staying are endless!
notes: The apartment does not have AC, but the location keeps the apartment plenty cool, even in summer. The apartment does have baseboard heating for the other 11.5 months of the year! In addition, the apartment is underneath the rear bedroom of one of the building residents, who has a dog.  The dog isn't noisy, but it enjoys running around, which you can hear overhead during the day, but I've never been awoken by it, and there's definitely nothing during the night when the dog is sleeping.  I do provide earplugs in the apartment for those who are light sleepers and would like to sleep late - this is useful both for dogs and Cub fans during the baseball season!
transit: Apartment is very near a number of CTA bus stops and just under 0.5 miles from the Addison Red/Purple Line station and just over 0.5 miles from the Belmont Red/Brown/Purple station. Street parking is readily available in the area, and a guest pass will be provided on request, although driving in Chicago is not suggested.
access: The apartment is a fully self-contained garden apartment with a private entrance with electronic keypad lock, so you can come and go as you please without disturbing the building residents.
interaction: Host lives in the building, so I'll be happy to give you suggestions for the area. In addition, I'll always be available by phone or text for whatever you need during your stay!
house_rules: - Small dogs permitted on request
host_about:
I'm a recent (re-) arrival to Chicago, after having lived all across Europe (Eastern and Western) for the past 10 years.  I've always considered myself a local, so I'm definitely enjoying rediscovering the city and everything it has to offer.

I've always been a last minute traveler, so I've had my fair share of same-day AirBnB bookings in any number of countries across Europe, so I'm always happy to accommodate people with a last-minute need for a bed and shower for the night!

name: Trendy Logan Square! Park free & EZ, walk to EL!
summary: Our gorgeous 3 bedroom home is the perfect place for your trip to Chicago. It’s bright, spacious, and comfortable, with a newly remodeled kitchen, 1 updated full bathroom, a large dining room, and a private balcony.  Located in Logan Square, one of the city's trendiest neighborhoods, and home to some of Chicago's best restaurants, bars, and unique shops. A 10-15 minute walk to the blue line makes this an ideal starting point for hopping around the city.
space: The unit is on the second floor of a three-flat on a charming, tree-lined street in Logan Square.  The decor is an attractive mix of vintage (wood trim and hardwood floors) with a fun, modern flair.  High ceilings and large windows allow natural light to bathe the living room, dining room, and kitchen, while blackout curtains in the bedrooms allow for a good night's sleep. The unit has 3 bedrooms, two with 1 queen bed each, and one with 2 twin beds. There is a bright, spacious kitchen with granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, and all the necessities for cooking a wonderful meal. In the beautiful dining room there is a table that seats 8 and a buffet table. The fun living room has a large TV set up with cable streaming and a Roku so you can access your Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime, or other accounts.  Other amenities: -WiFi -Central HVAC -Blu-ray player and movies -Board games for children and adults -Adult & children's books -Chicago travel guides -Fresh linens & towels -Ext

neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is considered one of the trendiest neighborhoods in Chicago.  It's food and bar scene is outstanding, and it's full of unique boutiques and artsy shops.
notes: Please be mindful of our tenants living on the third floor.
transit: Logan Square is very walkable and there is a ton to do and see right in the neighborhood, but if you want to explore the rest of the city, you're only a 10-15 minute walk from the Logan Square Blue Line stop.  Parking around our property is free and easy to find on the street.  It's also always easy to use Uber or Lyft anywhere in the city.
access: Guests have access to the entire apartment (including its balcony) and its contents, except one closet that is locked which stores cleaning supplies. Guests also have access to the backyard which is shared with two other units.  Our dog, Bradley, is often in the backyard; he is very friendly!
interaction: We live on the first floor of the property, so we are available if and when guests have questions or need us.  However, we understand that guests value their privacy during trips, so we will leave you to enjoy the space as you wish.  We are just a text or phone call away when needed. Lesly habla español.
house_rules: •	No smoking •	No pets •	No parties or events •	No outside visitors or overnight guests without prior approval by the host. •	Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property. •	If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. •	Do not leave out any food, as this can attract uninvited pests. •	Quiet hours are in place on weeknights starting at 10 PM and on weekends starting at 1 AM.
host_about:
Hi! My name is Lesly! I’m 29 years old and live with my fiancé, Shane, and our very friendly dog, Bradley (named after Bradley University where Shane and I both attended undergrad). I work as a school psychologist at an elementary school, and Shane works as a clinical researcher.

Shane and I grew up in the northwest suburbs of Chicago, but both moved into the city just as soon as we could. I think Shane has lived in just about every Chicago neighborhood there is (from Pilsen to the South Loop to Wicker Park...)!  In the end we settled in our home in Logan Square. We love the atmosphere of this neighborhood! The people are incredibly warm and friendly, there is always something to do, like going to the farmer’s market on Sundays or checking out a concert in the square, and we can’t forget about the FOOD! Shane and I are both foodies. We love trying new restaurants. I also love to cook and he loves using his smoker and grill in the summer. 

Other interests:
Traveling
Reading
Museums
Taking Bradley to the dog park
Wine
Chicago Blackhawks
Selección de fútbol de Argentina

name: $2150 May Sale! Clean & Elegant 2BR | Logan Sq ❤️
summary: A fully furnished home for your longer stay, complete with WiFi and everything you need to live. AFFORDABLE MONTHLY RATES ARE AVAILABLE!!! MAY - $2150 JUNE - $2400 This lovely 2 BR/1BA apartment is located at the center of Chicago. You will find the best restaurants, shopping stores nearby! Popular tourists destinations are just a walk away! Walking distance from hip Armitage Street where you can find a wide array selection of trendiest restaurants and bars in Chicago.
space: The apartment includes one full bathroom, with a shower, sink, and toilet. We’re all about helping you look (and smell) your best, so we provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in addition to hand soap and fluffy towels. Trust us when we say there’s no better way to warm up after a Windy City walk than a hot shower! There’s ample space for guests to relax on the sofa and watch on a large flat-screen TV. Like the rest of the unit, you’ll live it up in luxury among hardwood floors and contemporary decor. The entire place has free, fast WiFi and Chicago sunshine streaming in through the windows. Whether you’re craving a home-cooked meal or just somewhere to put the box of deep-dish, our kitchen is fully stocked with cookware, dishes, utensils, and has swanky granite countertops. Appliances include a full-sized fridge and freezer, gas stove, oven, microwave, toaster, and coffee maker. The only things missing are your favorite farmer’s market finds!!
