neighborhood_overview: Make sure to wear stretchy pants and spoil yourself with Logan Square’s myriad selection of drinks and grub! For Asian comfort food, Fat Rice has a great menu of comfort food from the far east. If you want something fresh from the farm to the table, Lulu’s Café is a local favorite. Satisfy your sweet tooth with pies from Bang Bang Pie Shop and candies plus hot choco at Katherine Ann Confections. If you’re looking to explore our bustling nightlife after a day of visiting our many art hubs, drop by Slippery Slope or Logan Arcade to chug a good mug of beer.
notes: -All guests need to be attentive to the house rules during their stay as there are other tenants at the property. -Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay -Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request. -We have duvet covers on our bedding (no top sheets). -If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away. -Security Deposit maybe required on the following bookings: 1) Last minute bookings 2) Short weekend stays 3) Large groups  4) Guests with no reviews 5) Guests with incomplete profile 6) Instant Bookings  7) Some properties may not allow locals for short term reservations COVID-19 Safety Concerns As always, the health and safety of our guests is our top priority. We would like to make you aware of the precautions and preventative practices our team are implementing in response to the current challenges of COVID-
transit: Being a walkable enclave, you’re sure to find something great at Logan Square whatever tickles your fancy. The Red Line is also accessible from the property in case you want to step your Chicago tour up a notch.
access: Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours.
interaction: We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.
house_rules: HOUSE RULES Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking: -No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250). -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. - The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am. -Lost key fee - $300 -Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc. -Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc. -Smoking - $300 -Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300 **-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat, an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.
host_about:
We are a young couple, both seniors at DePaul University and we love traveling around the world.

We very much enjoy meeting new people and making friends as we travel and love helping guests get the most out of their stay as we have been on our own travels.

Our apartments are very special homes that offer comfort and convenient locations. 

We hope to welcome you here!

name: Apartment w/ Cool Kitchen for 8 on the North Side
summary: My apartment has 3 bedrooms and enough room for 8 people to hang out.  The newly renovated kitchen has ample space to whip up quick breakfasts or a tasty lunch before going to explore the city.
description: My apartment has 3 bedrooms and enough room for 8 people to hang out.  The newly renovated kitchen has ample space to whip up quick breakfasts or a tasty lunch before going to explore the city. Guests will have private access to the entire apartment.  There is also a shared backyard for guests on the property. Stress Free 24 Hour Check-In!  Extra free street parking is available in the neighborhood as well as some metered parking. The history of Irving Park and Logan Square is probably the first thing that stands out to me. Noted by many for its historic homes, I love strolling the streets of Irving Park/Logan Square to admire its architecture. As a lover of bungalow-style houses and all things historic, I have a soft spot for Irving Park.  The area also has loads of transportation, which makes it easy to come here for the day or commute in/out if you make this your home. I love the peaceful tree lined streets, and also the easy access to every restaurant and bar in Chicago.  Great acc
neighborhood_overview: The history of Irving Park and Logan Square is probably the first thing that stands out to me. Noted by many for its historic homes, I love strolling the streets of Irving Park/Logan Square to admire its architecture. As a lover of bungalow-style houses and all things historic, I have a soft spot for Irving Park.  The area also has loads of transportation, which makes it easy to come here for the day or commute in/out if you make this your home. I love the peaceful tree lined streets, and also the easy access to every restaurant and bar in Chicago.  Great access to Wrigley Field and all that Chicago has to offer! Check out the Kilbourn Park Organic Greenhouse! The first-ever public fruit tree orchard in a major metropolitan city was planted in Kilbourn Park at the Greenhouse in fall 2008!  It is a wonderful resource for the community and visitors alike.
notes: Please note - that while the home is beautifully situated for indoor use - we have strict guidelines regarding noise, in accordance with City of Chicago and neighborhood laws. We respect our neighbors greatly, and simply ask that you do the same. We do penalize aggressively for violations of this - including reporting by neighbors or ticketing by police.
transit: Free street parking is available along with some metered parking. Also, Chicago has a citywide, year round BIKE sharing system called 'Divvy'. There is a Divvy Bike Station 2 blocks away!  This is a great way to explore the neighborhoods of Chicago and you can drop bikes off at any other Stations! Home to Belmont Blue Line Station (0.9 Miles) Belmont Blue Line to/from O'hare Airport (16 min) The #77 Bus takes you straight across Belmont to the Station and back home! #56 Bus 2 blocks away on Milwaukee Ave will bring you into Logan Square, Wicker Park, Bucktown, and River West in Minutes! Easy to Grab Uber/Lyft...about 15 Minutes to the Loop! 15 Minutes to O'hare Airport Via Car! Also, Chicago has a citywide, year round bike share system called 'Divvy'. There is a Divvy Bike Station 2 blocks away!
access: Guests will have private access to the entire apartment.  There is also a shared backyard for guests on the property. Stress Free 24 Hour Check-In!  Extra free street parking is available in the neighborhood as well as some metered parking.
house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty. 3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance. 4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.
host_about: Hi I'm Lara, and I am very proud to be an Airbnb Superhost! I am a Chicago native, and studied hospitality management at Boston University, and decided to follow my passion in trying to provide an amazing travel experience through AirBnB!  My husband and I love trying new places to eat, and have a real passion for traveling to exciting parts of the world.  I put a lot of work into getting my spaces ready, and I know you will enjoy your stay with me! Welcome to Chicago!

name: ENTIRE APARTMENT 5 MIN TO DOWNTOWN + FREE PARKING!
summary: Quiet, clean 1-bedroom apartment in the heart of Chicago with FREE PARKING. Very safe Italian-style neighborhood, "Little Italy". You will have your own personalized door code and may go in and out using a secure smart lock. Flexible check-in and check-out times. Nobody else will access your apartment during your stay there- unless you need something, and I have your permission.
space: Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 6 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing a free parking spot. The apartment will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. neighborhood_overview: 100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.
transit: "Racine" is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking).  -Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 5 minutes to downtown. -O’Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 40 minutes to O’Hare. -Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 45 minutes to Midway. -Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)
host_about:
Hello! My name is Marina, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an auditor downtown.  

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

name: Luxurious & Newly Designed Studio $1750 MAY
summary: A fully furnished home for your longer stay, complete with WiFi and everything you need to live. AFFORDABLE MONTHLY RATES ARE AVAILABLE!!! MAY - $1750 Welcome to Chicago, home of the World Series Champs, the Cubs. Our Studio condo is a perfect place to stay on any Chicago getaway, whether business or vacation. It is professionally designed with a full kitchen, living room, and modern decor.
space: In the heart of trendy Boystown Chicago, our sophisticated studio apartment is the perfect launchpad for Windy City adventures or clinching that important business deal. Whatever brings you to town, you’ll rest easy in our charming, quiet neighborhood with easy access to the Red Line train to take you south to Downtown or north to Loyola and Evanston. Illuminated by sunny natural light, our studio features Queen-size bed, premium linens, and plenty of closet space so you can unpack and forget about your suitcase for a while. Enjoy the privacy of your own room, with doors that close and independently controlled air-conditioning units. The apartment includes one full bathroom, with a shower, sink, and toilet. We’re all about helping you look (and smell) your best, so we provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in addition to hand soap and fluffy towels. Trust us when we say there’s no better way to warm up after a Windy City walk than a hot shower! There’s ample space for guests to re

neighborhood_overview: What’s better than staying in the heart of Downtown Chicago? How about an apartment that gives you the best of both worlds: minutes from the most exciting attractions of the Magnificent Mile and Navy Pier, but far enough away that you can get a taste of authentic Chi-Town life like a local. Our place is a 10-minute walk from the Wellington L Station which can take you straight into Downtown. Our neighborhood itself, though, is best explored foot, so you can meander through the quaint boutiques and tasty eateries while enjoying the lush trees that line the streets. Walk just 10 minutes east and you’ll stumble upon the spectacular Lakefront Trail, which offers panoramic views of Lake Michigan and is a fantastic place to run, walk, and people watch. You’ll never go hungry in this ‘hood. Some of our favorite places to eat include Crisp, known for Korean-style fried chicken, Chilam Balam for Mexican small plates, and the delicious Mediterranean fare at Troy. When you’re craving something sw
notes: -There are many units inside this building. -All guest need to be attentive with the house rules during their stay as there are other tenants at the property. -Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay -Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request. -We have duvet covers on our bedding  (no top sheets). -Security Deposit maybe required on the following bookings: 1) Last minute bookings 2) Short weekend stays 3) Large groups  4) Guests with no reviews 5) Guests with incomplete profile 6) Instant Bookings  7) Some properties may not allow locals for short term reservations. -Please be aware that if you lose the key and/or entry fob which is your access to the unit, it cannot be replaced for you immediately and you may lose access to the apartment and all amenities until another one can be made. There is a $200 fee for lost keys. -If there's an issue during your sta
transit: Why break the bank with a pricey rental car when you can take advantage of Chicago’s top-notch public transportation system? Our place is just a 10-minute walk from Wellington Station, where you can catch the Brown Line and the Purple/Red Line. Any line will take you to Downtown Chicago in just about 15 minutes, or you can head north to Uptown or Evanston on the Red Line, which later turns into the Purple Line. Flying into Chicago? We’re a 25-minute drive from O’Hare when there is no traffic, but if there is traffic you may be better off taking public transit (and saving some $$ on the taxi or Uber fare). Take the Blue Line from O’Hare to Clark/Lake, then transfer to the Brown Line to Wellington Station. Or, transfer from the Blue Line to the bus, depending on what time of day you’re traveling. In addition to public transit, ridesharing (Uber or Lyft) is also a great way to get around the Chicago metro. When you’re heading out with a group or want that extra little bit of luxury, just
access: Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours.
interaction: We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.
house_rules: HOUSE RULES Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking: -No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250). -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. - The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am. -Lost key fee - $300 -Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc. -Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc. -Smoking - $300 -Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300 Only cats are allowed in the building with corresponding pet fee
host_about:
Hostly was established in 2017 to help hosts and property owners navigate the wonderful world of Airbnb and vacation rentals. 

Our team of expert hosts are here to ensure your guests’ — and your — experience is awesome, and take the hassle out of your Airbnb or other short-term property rental management.

The team at Hostly is made up of talented local and international staff with extensive property management and hosting experience and will create a customized plan that incorporates your objectives, goals, and budget with utmost  transparency and clarity to grow a mutual partnership.

As metro Chicago's premier property management company with its strong local connections, Hostly offers a full line of services to create the best vacation rental experience.

Our services include: marketing, booking and payments, guest vetting, enhanced pricing model, guest support, on-site staffing coordination, cleaning service, and key delivery and checking in and out. We also offer value add-ons such as design and staging, creating your listing, and basically sharing our industry knowledge with you.

Today, Hostly stands out in the crowded property management field as the boutique vacation rental and BnB super hosts because of our consistent track record, our team and our focus on impeccable service as reflected in its online reputation and reviews.

name: Stylish & Convenient Wrigleyville 3 Bedroom
summary: My place is right next to Wrigley Field - and a great place to stay in the off-season, too! With 3 Queen-sized bedrooms, & spacious & bright common areas, you'll love staying here for whatever brings you to town. Getting downtown is a breeze, since there are 2 Red Line stops within a 10 min walk, & the Lake is just a 20 min walk east! It's right next to the vibrant Southport Corridor, so you won't run out of things to do nearby!
space: When you walk in, the kitchen is off to the right, and the living room to your left. The dining room is between them. There are 3 bedrooms, each with Queen-sized beds, and a full bathroom.
description: My place is right next to Wrigley Field - and a great place to stay in the off-season, too! With 3 Queen-sized bedrooms, & spacious & bright common areas, you'll love staying here for whatever brings you to town. Getting downtown is a breeze, since there are 2 Red Line stops within a 10 min walk, & the Lake is just a 20 min walk east! It's right next to the vibrant Southport Corridor, so you won't run out of things to do nearby! When you walk in, the kitchen is off to the right, and the living room to your left. The dining room is between them. There are 3 bedrooms, each with Queen-sized beds, and a full bathroom. You'll have full access to my 3 bedroom, 1 bath home. Wrigleyville is the lively little pocket in the Lakeview neighborhood that sits in the shadows of historic Wrigley Field, the second oldest stadium in baseball and home to the beloved Chicago Cubs. It has become a magnet for sports fans and young professionals alike, and particularly singles who hop from bar to bar along C
neighborhood_overview: Wrigleyville is the lively little pocket in the Lakeview neighborhood that sits in the shadows of historic Wrigley Field, the second oldest stadium in baseball and home to the beloved Chicago Cubs. It has become a magnet for sports fans and young professionals alike, and particularly singles who hop from bar to bar along Clark, Addison and Sheffield Avenues.
notes: In addition to easy access to and from the Loop - including Union Station and Ogilvie Station, we're also steps away from both Wrigley Field and the vibrant Southport Cooridor. All within a few minutes' walking are places like the Music Box Theatre, the Metro, and the Vic Theatre. Improv abounds around here too! The Laugh Factory is a little over a mile away, and tons of smaller comedy theatres are even closer. Belmont Harbor and the lake are about a mile east as well. It's a 10 minute drive south to DePaul, and a 15 minute drive north to Loyola. And, since we're so close to Boystown,  you'll find plenty of nightlife.
transit: My place is 10 minutes' walk away from the Addison or Sheridan Red line train stations, and equally convenient to the 22 / Clark bus (there's a stop just a block east) - it's almost more convenient to not have a car here! If you do bring your car, however, it's pretty easy to find street parking around the apartment.
access: You'll have full access to my 3 bedroom, 1 bath home.
house_rules: House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 5.) Pets are not allowed at the property. 6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per key fee.
host_about: Hey! I'm Mike. Chicago's great, glad you came. While you're here, I think you shouldn't miss a walk by the lake (frozen or thawed, it's a sight to behold), the Chicago Cultural Center, and the Music Box Theatre.

name: master BR in modern Ukr Vlg gem w/ full breakfast
summary: Come hang out in Ukrainian Village - a trendy, fun, unique, vibrant & perfectly located Chicago neighborhood - where you'll find ample space, travel friendly amenities, cleanliness, landscaped yards & more. There is a full kitchen, plenty of personal space, other interesting travelers as well as a clean, private & comfortable bedroom to recharge. As you step out to explore Ukr Vlg & beyond, you will be met w abundant foot traffic, CTA transit, shops, architecture, food/drinks, nightlife & parks.
space: The whole property is gated so guests are encouraged to use both yards to relax & enjoy the outdoors in privacy. In the front, the bike room has plenty of space for coats, shoes etc which is also where you fill find items such as the iron, shoehorn & umbrellas. The dining & TV rooms are spacious and for guest use - the gigabit WiFi is fast, stable & rangy while all the Smart TVs have HD channels as well as YoutubeTV/Netflix/HBO. There are magazine subscriptions, a local newspaper & books for your pleasure and the bathroom cabinet has toiletry extras for your use. The full kitchen has everything you need to make a meal and clean up after. The breakfast included is a combo of bananas, eggs, bread, cereal, yogurt, oatmeal, butter, milk, tea, coffee, bagels, peanut butter and jelly which you will find in the refridgerator. The right hand cabinet has more tea, coffee and other essentials like sugar & spices that are free to guests while above the stove is where you will find oil, vinegar an

There are magazine subscriptions, a local newspaper & books for yo
neighborhood_overview: RedFin has recently named Ukrainian Village the hottest neighborhood in the United States. As you walk out of the apartment, you will instantly feel like you are in a big city. There will be lots of foot traffic, highly rated food/drink places, beautiful parks, coffee shops, gyms, abundant architecture and a variety of transport options. The lake & the loop are each only 3 miles away and other popular Chicago neighborhoods & attractions are close by and easily accessed from Ukrainian Village.
notes: You will periodically see both of my neighbors enjoying their respective backyards so dont be shy and say hello!! I recommend Split Rail & Shokolad as two neighbor owned eateries. I recommend Rich's Deli and Farmer's Produce for grocery stores and Tryzub for a Ukrainian dinner. Feel free to turn on the front & back deck lights anytime at night but pls turn them off after sunrise. Please keep all doors closed and locked, especially when leaving.
transit: There are two 24 hr bus lines within a block & CTA trains are a mile away (blue, green lines). Ubers are everywhere & city rental bikes/scooters are close by. Street parking is possible with a combination of permit & free spots surrounding the property.
access: You can check yourself in anytime between 1pm - 9pm. If you would like to check in early or late, pls reach out to me and I will do my best to accommodate you. Please remember to shut/lock all doors & gates. If you need to wash your clothes - the washer & drier are in the basement. When checking out, please leave the keys in the lockbox, turn the dial away from the code and close the dial.
interaction: I live in the garden apartment of this building with my 2 yr old shepherd, Athena. She is well behaved & has great reviews but your apartment is dog free. I am always around to help or give recommendations and you will always have your space & privacy.  The rest of the apartment consists of other AirBnB guests so be sure to all say hi to each other. Please make yourself comfortable and at home.
house_rules: - pls close & lock all doors behind you - pls use thermostat, amenities & utilities responsibly - pls clean up after yourself in common areas (kitchen, bathroom, living room) - pls ask before using (free) laundry - notify host of all unregistered guests - all additional requests like luggage holds, early/late checkouts, garage etc will be met with a small charge.
host_about: born in Ukraine - raised in Chicago - speak ~ 5 languages

name: Study oasis with private 1/2 bath
summary: This is a beautiful and large one bedroom in the heart of downtown Hyde Park. Bedroom is located within a three bedroom townhouse that belonged to a University of Chicago nuclear chemist.  Family has preserved all books, furniture, and paintings which makes for a very historical experience in Hyde Park.  Steps away from the lake, beach, University of Chicago, and President Obama's house. Location is superb.
space: This is a beautiful and large bedroom located within a historical town house in the heart of Hyde Park. Town house has a front and back entrance along with sufficient street parking. Bedroom is located on 1st floor and is equipped with all essentials.  Kitchen is equipped with all essentials and then some. Home is located two block walking distance from President Obama's home, 15 minute walking distance from the well-known Harper Court and Harper Movie Theatre, 15 minute walking distance to Promontory point and 57th street Beach, and a ten minute walk main University of Chicago campus.

Everything you need is at hand, grocery stores, vintage bookstores, ice cream shops, movie theatre, and a local farmer’s market.
interaction: I will meet you upon arrival to show you the home and local community. I am currently a student and also take care of my two young daughters every other day and will also be reachable by phone for any questions or concerns.

Hello everyone bienvenido!
I am currently a student at a local college in Chicago studying the biological sciences.  Greatly enjoy traveling and connecting with other individuals.

name: The Lincoln Room in Bridgeport
summary: An affordable escape to Chicago! Located in the historic and up and coming Bridgeport neighborhood just South of Chinatown, Pilsen and Downtown Chicago. Come experience world class attractions in a safe, clean, and affordable space while avoiding the traffic and parking hassles of downtown. I used to host in Springfield, IL, the home of Abe Lincoln, so the room is decorated in Lincoln artwork and comes with a library of Lincoln literature. City of Chicago registration #R (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
space: The room is cozy and comfy. You have your own 55" TV with Amazon Fire Stick and local channels, and a library of Lincoln History and art. Enjoy access to a full kitchen with free keurig coffee, Darts, laundry, living and dining room, etc. In the living room there is a Wii, PS4, VHS, plenty of board games, puzzles and more. Make yourself at home!

neighborhood_overview: A diverse and safe neighborhood a few miles South of Downtown. Bridgeport has become a neighborhood full of the arts with two renowned art centers, some nice bars, breweries, and restaurants. Very close to Chinatown, and Pilsen home of the best Mexican bakeries and restaurants around. Very police friendly neighborhood ensures it remains safe and secure. Close to White Sox stadium and McCormick place, easy access to downtown and the lakefront.
notes: I live in the second floor of a two-flat. You will have to climb one flight of stairs. The apartment is on a main street and you will hear traffic noise.
transit: 1 Mile to El train. Bus stops right outside, Divvy (Bikeshare) station across the street, Uber, Lyft. Free street parking.
access: Private bedroom, shared bathroom, shared living room, shared dining room, shared kitchen. Back deck with grill and Backyard with fire pit.
interaction: I keep very busy with work and school, so there's a high chance we won't run into eachother. Let me know if you'd like more interaction with me and I can likely arrange for it. I can certainly give local recommendations for anything you are looking for. I would love to make your stay as local feeling as possible!
host_about: I finished my military service a few years ago and now manage at a local factory. I've traveled extensively in the U.S. and have branched out more internationally over the past few years. I love minimalist travel, staying at hostels or Airbnbs, eating local food, and learning local culture and history. I have been to countless zoos all over the world and would love to have a conversation about your favorite zoo. Can't wait to meet you!

summary: This is a friendly and welcoming home. The room is comfortable & the House has been remodeled with a beautiful kitchen, dining room and living room area available to guests.  There is a private Bathroom next to the bedroom.  Internet, Heat & AC are available. Great location with access to the brown line  & metro to downtown and suburbs. Access to washer and dryer for a fee.  Please be respectful & thoughtful in this house because there is family living in the house! We own a cat!
space: Guests are welcome to use the common area space on the main floor, in addition to the bedroom and bathroom. neighborhood_overview: Close to downtown , and conveniently located near the Empty Bottle and Subterranean music venues. It's a 10 minute walk each to St Mary and St Elizabeth Hospital campuses, and a 20 minute drive to Lincoln Park, Logan Square, and a 20 minute drive to the Loop. And, since we're so close to Ukrainian Village, you'll find plenty of Ukrainian cultural monuments, including the Ukrainian Institute of Modern Art, several churches, and countless restaurants.
notes: Potential for noise - Other tenants live in the building and the building is located on a busy avenue. Normal street and building noise is to be expected. Must climb stairs -No elevators in building. Security Deposit required  Not safe or suitable for infants (under 2 years) and pets - Children and infants are welcome, however, cribs or special sleeping arrangements are not provided by host. The unit is also not child proof. No smoking, parties, or events Noise is to be kept to a minimum after 10pm as there are other tenants in the building. Absolutely no parties. Please respect the neighbors. For best visual of the space, all pictures are taken with a wide angle lens which may make rooms appear larger than they are. Surveillance on property: Ring security doorbell front entrance of the house/Security camera in the backyard pointing at the garage.
transit: The Western Blue Line stop is about a mile north and - easily accessible on the 49/Western bus, which has a stop just across Western Ave! The Damen Blue Line stop is a mile northeast as well, though not as easily accessible via bus line, and the 70/Division bus is nearby too, so it's easy to get around here without a car. If you do bring a car, however, street parking available in the neighborhood or a garage space upon request (need 24 hours notice).
access: A lockbox to the unit will be provided. I am available for assistance and inquiries. You will have access to the 2BR, 1 Bath apartment, back patio/backyard.

neighborhood_overview: - THE WEST LOOP! The definition of industrial chic, this neighborhood has exploded as the city’s trendiest neighborhood! Converted factories and warehouses have transformed into hip restaurants and unique drinking spaces.  - RANDOLPH STREET, the center of Chicago’s food scene and home to world-renowned spots such as Girl and the Goat, Next, and Au Cheval, is just a short walk! The FULTON MARKET district is a just a bit further, or a quick Uber! - Five minutes from the nearest BLUE LINE L stop, ILLINOIS MEDICAL DISTRICT. Get downtown in 11 minutes! Or continue out to O'Hare, direct, in 49 minutes.  - Closest place to stay to the UNITED CENTER, period. Three blocks away, you can the UC from the front door! - Short walk from the UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS AT CHICAGO (UIC), Chicago’s only public research university, as well as the surrounding LITTLE ITALY neighborhood. - Two blocks directly north of RUSH UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL. Short walk from UIC HOSPITAL and STROGER HOSPITAL. With so many choic

If you live near Chicago and would like to book a stay, please send us a message with a little more information about your plans. Immediately after booking, we will send you a few questions about your arrival time, contact info, number of guests/visitors, and to name our favorite restaurant, which is listed at the bottom of the house rules. SELFIE SPOTS - Millennium Park, the Bean (Cloud Gate), Maggie Daley Park: 22 min - Riverwalk: 19 min - Sears Tower / Willis Tower (Skydeck Chicago): 18 min  - Magnificent Mile / Michigan Avenue shopping, Hancock Center (360 Chicago), Water Tower: 33 min - Lake Michigan, Oak Street Beach (terrific skyline view): 36 min WORLD-CLASS CULTURAL INSTITUTIONS - Art Institute of Chicago: 26 min - Grant Park, Buckingham Fountain, Chicago Marathon start: 26 min - Museum
access: The entire condo is yours during your stay! You will not share this condo with anyone outside of your own group! The roof deck, the gym, the garage, and the lobby are shared spaces and you should be respectful of that.   Guests may drop off their bags as early as 12PM (noon), after which time we ask that you leave the condo until 4PM to let the cleaners finish cleaning. It's hard to wash the sheets with someone taking a nap! After 4PM, the place is all yours!
interaction: I love my guests! I am available to my guests! I text my guests most of what they need! I need a number to reach you at! Please confirm your phone number and email address. IF YOU WILL NOT HAVE A US PHONE NUMBER, please download the (Hidden by Airbnb) phone texting app! I also have (Hidden by Airbnb) - please provide your ID!
house_rules: 1) Smoking and vaping are only allowed on your private balcony with the balcony door shut. The rest of the property is smoke and vapor free. We have marijuana and tobacco chemical sensors on the property. They know it's not cooking smoke, They react to airborne particulate, not the smell on your clothes. The PolySens® technology works, so exit the building if you want to smoke/vape or you'll be fined $1000 and asked to leave. 2) Your reservation has paid for a specific number of guests on it. Anyone over this number, whether visiting or sleeping, you must have written permission from us. We have a hallway camera to verify. We're going to be totally fine with 95% of requests, but we do require you to clear it with us first. 3) Quiet hours are 10PM-8AM. Noise should not be heard coming from your apartment. This is a quiet residential building. 95% of our guests have no issues, and never hear from us. We will be sure to send you at least 2 warnings prior to asking anyone to leave, but one
host_about:
Rent Local Homes.  Real Homes; made for living with great kitchens, big living rooms, in awesome neighborhoods! We are Chicago locals with a passion for elevating the guest experience.

Everything you need is already stocked.  Cream and sweeteners for your coffee,  body wash and shampoo for the shower, and the right type of detergent for dishwashers and washing machines; we think of and stock ahead of time everything you need so you don’t have to.

A team of professionals are at your service before, during, and after your stay; we are always here if you have any questions.  Read our reviews.   Browse our photos.  Rent a local home with us.

Central air conditioning at nights and weekends in the Summer. 24 hrs (thermostat) central heat in the Winter. Duplex home with kitchen and living room on the 1st floor. Back yard with wood deck equipped with bbq. You will have a private bedroom. Private bathroom. * 3 blocks to Green Line and Red Line. Half a block to bus #4 from downtown. A few blocks to bus #3 to Water Tower, and #29 to Navy Pier. * 15 blocks to McCormick Place convention center. Taxi should cost less than $10. Or take bus #3. Or nice long walk in Summer. * 3-block w
house_rules: Light cooking only. (No heavy cooking with oil. No fried. No strong cooking smell. Please.) We provide bed linen, pillow, and blanket.  For long term booking,  price doesn't include cleaning services inside private bedroom or private bathroom. "Free" street parking is very easy to find at the front of the house. I always find a spot for myself within 1 block. Free gated parming pad in backyard available upin request. No smoking. No pet. Cancellation and refund through airbnb only.
host_about:

Originally from Thailand but have lived in Chicago for over 20 years. In my free time, i enjoy gardening, biking, hiking, and exploring new restaurants. It is always my pleasure to recommend my local-favorite spots that are not in travel guide books, or to provide info on transportations, shopping, etc.

name: Palmer Treehouse or Oasis - entire apartment
summary: Get ready to stay in a Victorian Chicago greystone! Charming, cozy, and rustic. Artist’s home and sometimes studio. Full of plants, art, and vintage charm, this apartment feels like home. The beds are great quality mattresses, and the couch and/or sofa bed are great for when you have more than 4. This listing includes the Palmer Oasis. Treehouse has a cozy cabin in the woods feel, the other is a little more minimalist and spacious, with an extra bathroom. Both are 2 bedrooms. Build in 1871

host_about:
I have been hosting on Airbnb for nearly a decade, and I love the opportunities to meet and connect with new people it brings. I travel frequently for work, but have enjoyed calling Chicago my home base for most of my life.  My roots in the neighborhood (Logan sq) go back generations; great grandparents on both sides (as well as one great-great grandmother!) lived and raised their families here, so the neighborhood history and its many changes and configurations are a personally fascinating subject to me. Sharing my favorite things about this uniquely down to earth and culturally diverse city is a passion of mine! 
I’m grateful that Airbnb allows me the privilege of connecting with other interesting/ interested travelers.

neighborhood_overview: 100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.
transit: "UIC Halsted" is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking).  -Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 5 minutes to downtown. -O’Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 40 minutes to O’Hare. -Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC-Halsted." About 45 minutes to Midway. -Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)
house_rules: Please read the check-in instructions carefully
host_about:
Hello! My name is Marina, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an auditor downtown.  

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

name: Magnificent Mile Hotel Queen Bed - Prime Area
summary: Parking is $60 per car/per day due at Check in.  Home of the neon sign visitors and locals know so well, the historic Inn of Chicago Magnificent Mile hotel first opened in 1928 hosting celebs like Bob Hope, Judy Garland, Roy Rogers and showgirls from the Chez Paree supper club. Queen Bed room room, flat-screen TV and luxurious bath products.  Please note that a facility fee of $17.88 will be collected by the hotel upon check-in. Parking and breakfast not included in room rate.
space: The hotel offers comfortably modern rooms in a spot-on location for exploring Chicago’s museums, lakefront and parks. Plus the world-famous Magnificent Mile is right outside your door. Unwind after a day of conquering the sights with a cocktail in the lobby INNbar. Or if the weather’s cooperating, head up the the 22nd floor Skyline Terrace for enviable city views. Your room will include: WiFi Flat-screen TV Bath amenities Hairdryer The space offers: INNbar 22nd floor Skyline Terrace Fitness center Concierge services Valet Parking Available for $59/night Breakfast Available for an additional cost

name: Cozy DePaul 2BDR | Near Train, University and CUBS
summary: Welcome to our cozy, classic 2 bedroom apartment just steps to DePaul University and the L! We are looking for long term guests only at this time. Please inquire to find out about great discounts on our furnished rentals. It comes with a fully stocked kitchen and comfy memory foam beds ready for you to relax! -Flexible terms and rates! -No move-in fee! -Landlord pays water/trash. Tenants pays electric and gas. -Background/credit check required -Application required. $40/person
space: **Need to stay long term? Inquire for great discounts by messaging us!** This space is a classic Chicago 2 bedroom, located in an apartment building shared with long term tenants.  The living room features a brick fireplace, a pullout couch for larger groups, and a Smart TV that grants access to all your favorite streaming services.  Our kitchen is small but very practical. We've stocked it with all the basic cooking utensils and cookware so you can share a meal at our dining room table. It would be tough to make a grand feast but we find that guests like to be able to make a meal at home to save their money for more fun Chicago activities. :)  The larger bedroom has a memory foam queen sized bed and the smaller bedroom has a full-sized mattress. Both bedrooms have full closets so that guests can fully unpack and feel at home.

neighborhood_overview: Chicago's DePaul neighborhood is situated halfway between downtown and Wrigley Field, which makes it great for summer travelers looking to see a lot of the city.  We are also just 3 stops away from Chicago's Vic Theatre which is a great place to catch a concert! If open water is what you desire, you can go just 10 minutes to the east and see Lincoln Park Conservatory and Zoo before heading down to North Ave beach.
notes: Please provide an accurate guest count prior to booking. Rates vary throughout the week and season and by number of guests. It's important that your guest count is accurate so we can be sure the home is adequately prepared and stocked for your stay.
transit: The Fullerton "L" station is just about a 5 minute walk away. From there, you can go practically anywhere in the city. If you want to get off the beaten path a little bit more, you can always catch a city bus just about a block away. Overnight parking in our area can sometimes be tough, so you may want to check out one of the parking spot apps in the city such as SpotHero.
access: Guests will have access to our entire apartment, and no spaces are shared with other tenants.
interaction: We have self check-in so you may come and go as you please. If you need to get in touch, we are always just a message away!
house_rules: PLEASE NOTE THAT WE CHARGE PER GUEST AFTER A SET NUMBER. PLEASE PROVIDE THE ENTIRE GROUP COUNT IN YOUR RESERVATION REQUEST. IF AN UPDATE TO THE GROUP COUNT IS NEEDED AFTER CONFIRMING THE RESERVATION, THE RESERVATION COST MAY INCREASE. - Quiet hours between 10pm - 7am - Smoking Penalty: $500 + damages - Pet Penalty: $500 + damages - Late Check Out Fee: $25/half hour
host_about:
Hi, Thanks for taking a look at our special homes.

My name is Noah. A few years ago, my family and I got together to create an amazing experience for tourists and guests like you.

We are Chicagoans who love sharing our city with the world and strive to make your stay as comfortable as possible so you can enjoy the city like a local. 

We're passionate about travel. As experienced travelers, we've learned what creates a top notch experience and we're committed to sharing that experience with you. It's something we call "Sweet Home Chicago" and we hope you carry it back with you to where ever you call home! :)

You can find us hanging by the lake, catching a game at Wrigley, grabbing a drink in Wicker Park, enjoying the many concerts going on on any given night, or at any of the amazing local coffee shops across the city.

name: The Urban Bungalow, a Lovely Chicago Oasis
summary: Welcome to our cozy neighborhood oasis! Tucked off a lush, tree lined neighborhood street, our Bungalow is the perfect urban getaway. Stroll two minutes to the heart of Chicago’s Ukrainian Village,  where you can find charming shops, lively bars, and some of the city’s most sought after restaurants. If you want to roam a little further, downtown Chicago is just a 15-minute Uber ride away. Clean, modern, and comfortable – come make our Bungalow your home away from home
space: The Urban Bungalow is a charming, open concept apartment space in the quiet Ukrainian Village neighborhood of Chicago. Hang on the comfy couches in our living room, where you can play boardgames or watch Netflix on our flat screen TV (Gig speed Internet included). Cook yourself something delicious in our kitchen – it is stocked with all the cookware essentials. And enjoy a warm cup of joe on us at our complimentary coffee bar. If the weather is right, may we recommend you take that dinner or coffee out onto the Bungalow’s large patio space? Hang at the table under our hanging lights, stir up a drink at the outside bar, or recline in one of our hanging hammocks. 2 bedrooms, each with a Queen bed + 1 Queen pull-out Crate & Barrel couch in the living room. Iron and ironing board available for your convenience. Washer and dryer available at no additional cost. Leave your toiletries behind! We will have all-natural shampoo, conditioner, and body wash ready and waiting for you upon your arri

Stroll two minutes to the heart of Chicago’s Ukrainian Village,  where you can find charming shops, lively bars, and some of the city’s most sought after restaurants. If you want to roam a little further, downtown Chicago is just a 15-minute Uber ride away. Clean, modern, and comfortable – come make our Bungalow your home away from home The Urban Bungalow is a charming, open concept apartment space in the quiet Ukrainian Village neighborhood of Chicago. Cook yourself something delicious in our kitchen – it is stocked with all the cookware essentials. And enjoy a warm cup of joe on us at our complimentary coffee bar. If the weather is right, may we recommend you take that dinner or coffee out onto the Bungalow’s
neighborhood_overview: Bask in the youthful, creative energy of West Town. You’ll pass colorful galleries and museums, independent theater companies, small-scale music venues and retail boutiques touting lines from local designers. The Bungalow is minutes away from some of the cities gratest restaurants and most delicious bars. Enjoy unbelievable French food at Café Mare Jeanne, Live music 7 nights a week at The California Clipper, artisanal coffee and quiet work space at C.C Ferns, and a farm to table dining experience at Rootstock Wine Bar. All mentioned are within a 5 minutes walk from The Bungalow.  Explore numerous farmers markets (West Humboldt Park, Logan Square, Wicker Park), all just a short bike ride away. Take off for an afternoon of exploring in the city’s most beautiful park, Humboldt Park, which features 207 acres of lakes, gardens, wildlife preserves, bike and running paths, and unobstructed green space.
transit: Explore the neighborhood by taking full advantage of the newly arrived Bird scooters conveniently located at various locations around the neighborhood. Furthermore, find Divvy bikes located within a 5-minute walk from The Bungalow (corner of Cortez and California St.) PARKING Complimentary street parking is offered directly in front of The Bungalow. Find your overnight parking pass in the kitchen underneath the coffee maker in the drawer all the way to the left. You will have a separate pass for each night you stay. GETTING IN Retrieve the key for your stay located in the lock box to the right of the front door. This key will gain you access to the front door and is not to leave the lock box. The 4 digit code to unlock The Bungalow will be sent to you separately. The Bungalow is the first door on the left as soon as you walk into the building. Please make sure the back-sliding door remains locked when it is not in use. CHECK-OUT Please leave the place how you found it. This is our home
access: The entire apartment and back patio is yours, enjoy!
interaction: We will be available throughout your stay to recommend the wonderful local attractions, dining, nightlife or any other fun things to do while you're in Chicago.

name: Kasa | Chicago | Luxury South Loop 1BD/1BA Plus Den Apartment
summary: Come relax in this stylish 1BR/1BA Plus Den, professionally managed by Kasa. In the middle of all Chicago has to offer - near large companies and a short distance to Grant Park and delicious local restaurants, bars, and shopping. Less than 2mi to McCormick Place.  Key features include:  *Relax in the luxurious king-sized bed with memory foam mattress *Den room has a twin bed with memory foam mattress * Sofa Sleeper in living room *Cook and enjoy wonderful cuisine with the modern high-end kitchen  *Browse the web and stream HD video with ultra high-speed internet  *Work out in the upscale fitness center
description: Come relax in this stylish 1BR/1BA Plus Den, professionally managed by Kasa. In the middle of all Chicago has to offer - near large companies and a short distance to Grant Park and delicious local restaurants, bars, and shopping. Less than 2mi to McCormick Place. house_rules: We created Kasa to be your home on the road. We’re committed to being great neighbors, and we strictly enforce these rules to ensure the comfort and safety of our community. •NO Smoking: Smoking of any kind (including tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes, vape pens, and hookahs) is never allowed at this property.  This applies to the entire apartment, including the balcony or patio, as well as all common and outdoor areas of the building. Kasa apartments may be monitored with marijuana and tobacco sensors. •Noise: At all times, Kasa guests may not disturb their neighbors’ quiet enjoyment.  In addition, guests must observe quiet hours from 9 p.m. to 8 a.m. Parties and large gatherings are prohibited. Kasa apartments are proactively monitored with decibel sensors for compliance with this noise policy. •Occupancy: Each Kasa has a maximum occupancy limit.  There can be no more than the specified number of guests on the premises at any given time. Large gatherings are not permitted. •Lost and F
host_about: We are the team behind Kasa Living, a national flexible living brand that offers a dependable, high-quality living experience at a great value. We manage Kasas in modern buildings with the amenities and comforts that you want out of your own home. We aim to unleash the potential of livable space by giving you access to places that feel like your home on the road. Kasa Living is available in cities across the United States, with new locations opening frequently. We hope you enjoy your stay with us, and know that Kasa is your home on the road!

name: Boystown Experience: Two Bedroom Apartment!
summary: Two bedroom apartment located right in the heart of Boystown!
space: When I travel I like to make my place to a fellow travelers in the airbnb community to get the best experience of being in the Boystown lakeview neighborhood.  The master bedroom features a king sized highest rated mattress on the internet (Alexander Select by Nest Bedding) and the in the second bedroom there is a queen Serta Pillowtop Mattress which is also delightful to sleep on. The kitchen features extra counter space with a kitchen nook which is great for eating in.  You don't have to leave with dirty clothes!  There is also a washer and dryer available for your use!

name: Spacious 1B/1B on Lake Michigan
summary: Spacious 1 bed/1 bath w/private balcony on lakefront in Uptown. Bus stop to downtown is right outside, Wrigley field is 6 blocks away, Boystown is 4 blocks away, short walk to lakefront trail and Lake Michigan. The red line into downtown is only 5 blocks away. Lots of restaurants, nightlife, and shopping close by.
space: Very spacious apartment with great views of Lake Michigan. You can see the Navy Pier fireworks from my apartment (Wednesday and Saturday nights in the summer). Huge private balcony to enjoy the view. Large kitchen available with access to all cooking supplies. Very relaxing and inviting space but very close to public transportation and all the fun Chicago has to offer.

Lots of restaurants, nightlife, and shopping close by. Very spacious apartment with great views of Lake Michigan. I do allow children to stay in my place, however, it is not child-proofed. So, if you are ok with that, children are more than welcome.

Great shopping and restaurants  Wrigley field blocks away  Brown line 2 min walk Bonus room off kitchen to private deck  First floor walk-up Your own personal apartment I’m a phone call away When people generally think of Chicago's Lakeview neighborhood, two images come immediately to mind: the Chicago Cubs' Wrigley Field and the fantastically flamboyant area known as Boystown. But there's so much more, particularly a vibrant little section called the Southport Corridor. Within the last several
neighborhood_overview: When people generally think of Chicago's Lakeview neighborhood, two images come immediately to mind: the Chicago Cubs' Wrigley Field and the fantastically flamboyant area known as Boystown. But there's so much more, particularly a vibrant little section called the Southport Corridor. Within the last several years, the area's gained momentum as a trendy shopping district, offering a nice mix of popular chains as well as independently owned specialty shops and boutiques. The corridor, of course, gives out-of-town shoppers a chance to stray away from the Mag Mile shopping district and into a real Chicago neighborhood.
notes: The Southport brown line runs next to the buildin (Website hidden by Airbnb) So there is noise when the train goes by-   The brown line stops services around midnight and resumes around 5am    If you have animals,  and they are skittish,  they won’t enjoy there stay! If you want piece and quiet , maybe it’s not for you,!   It’s the city, urban living ! Check out my other listing in Michigan for that !
transit: Addison and Belmont  also has a fairly regular bus line running in both directions, making it easy to get to the Blue line (O'Hare), or the lake front. Getting to Midway (Orange line) you need to take brown line and  transfer downtown to the orange line. Taxis, Uber/Lyft, or other private modes of transportation are easily/readily available. Divvy Bike Rental - Southport and Waveland, Southport and Roscoe. SOUTHPORT BROWN LINE IS 3min walk.

interaction: I’m a phone call away

name: Haddon Hideaway, a cozy room in a Landmark Cottage
summary: Cool cozy guest room on a quiet street in a happening neighborhood. Refurbished original redbrick worker's cottage home with Landmark status, just 4 blocks away from both Damen and Division Blue Line stops (takes you O'Hare, the Loop and beyond). We have two gardens, a sunny deck and friendly animals (dog, cat, and cockatiel) kept separate but available for pets!
space: Our home was built in 1889 by W.D. Kerfoot soon after the Great Chicago Fire and has Chicago Landmark status.  It has been refurbished with modern amenities, we have central air, ceiling fans and plenty of extra blankets.
description: Cool cozy guest room on a quiet street in a happening neighborhood. Refurbished original redbrick worker's cottage home with Landmark status, just 4 blocks away from both Damen and Division Blue Line stops (takes you O'Hare, the Loop and beyond). We have two gardens, a sunny deck and friendly animals (dog, cat, and cockatiel) kept separate but available for pets! Our home was built in 1889 by W.D. Kerfoot soon after the Great Chicago Fire and has Chicago Landmark status.  It has been refurbished with modern amenities, we have central air, ceiling fans and plenty of extra blankets. We have a front and back garden area, sunny deck, and shady back porch.  Feel free to use the common areas like the living and dinning room.  We also have 2 bathrooms, upstairs has an antique claw foot tub (with an assortment of bubble baths) and downstairs has a walk in shower. I am happy to socialize with guests and will do everything I can to make your stay a pleasant experience. We are in the Wicker Park/
neighborhood_overview: We are in the Wicker Park/Ukrainian Village area and walking distance to Bucktown, West Town, East Village and Humboldt Park. There are beautiful public parks and public pools. There is something here for everyone from historic homes and community gardens to excellent live music venues (The Empty Bottle and Subterranean) to boutiques, galleries and vintage shops. We have dive bars, sports bars, cocktail bars and speakeasies.  Coffee and Kava too.  This is a great area for food, there are some excellent cheap eats and fine dining. I'm happy to make recommendations, there are too many to fit here!
transit: This is a very pedestrian and bike friendly neighborhood. We are walking distance from the Blue Line and major bus lines that can take you Downtown, the beach, or any other neighborhood easily. There are many Divvy bike stations and we're 6 blocks away from the 606 elevated trail.
access: We have a front and back garden area, sunny deck, and shady back porch.  Feel free to use the common areas like the living and dinning room.  We also have 2 bathrooms, upstairs has an antique claw foot tub (with an assortment of bubble baths) and downstairs has a walk in shower.
interaction: I am happy to socialize with guests and will do everything I can to make your stay a pleasant experience.
house_rules: - Please locks all locks, security first - No eating in the room, please use kitchen or dining room - No candles or incense in the room
host_about: My roots run deep in Chicago, I grew up in the Back of the Yards and have been living in the Ukrainian Village  neighborhood since the early 80's.  I'm a long time community activist and 34 year Chicago Public Schools veteran, currently adjunct faculty at National Louis University. I love live music, dancing, dining and dive bars.  I'm proud of my daughters, my pets and my gardens.

name: Room close to downtown Chicago
summary: This private room has a comfortable full bed,  closet, dresser and tv. The room is small, it is great for one or two persons (please look at the pictures and be sure you want to book for two guests, since the bed is against the wall).   The apartment is located in a nice and calm neighborhood (Noble Square/West Town). You will find bars, restaurants, nail salons/spa and grocery stores in a walking distance.  Downtown 15 to 20 minutes on bus or train. O'hare 45 to 1 hour on blue line train.
space: The apartment is cozy and clean. Living room, dinning and kitchen are in an open area.  What I loved most about the apartment is the natural light that comes through the windows.  Bedrooms are a little darker though.

neighborhood_overview: The South Loop is such a dynamic mix of attractions and histories that the neighborhood tends to be seen as many different things to many different people. Consider the assorted areas that comprise the South Loop: Much of its eastern edge is encompassed by the Museum Campus, an impressive collection of cultural treasures that includes the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium. This campus sits on scenic lakefront parklands that are an extension of Grant Park. With 319 acres of green space and recreational fields, Grant Park is known as "Chicago's front yard" to locals and also plays host to major city events such as Taste of Chicago, Chicago Blues Festival and Lollapalooza.  Jutting out further into Lake Michigan is Northerly Island, a peninsula sought out by nature lovers, while along the southern edge the sports fans know Soldier Field as the stadium for the beloved Chicago Bears football team. Meeting attendees are most familiar with McCormick Place, the largest convent

host_about:
Hi and welcome! My name is JW, and Pasión Group is a family-owned vacation rental management and consulting firm. We've created our homes to share with you because our guests tell us they love feeling like they are part of an authentic travel experience. We couple this with high-touch service to give you the best stay(s) around!

We look forward to sharing our homes and community with you. 

In Chicago - Lake Michigan, the food, the architecture, the museum's...there is much to love about Chicago. Whether you are looking to find the local dives, the little-known coffee shops, or the best restaurants in a certain neighborhood.

name: Peaceful Room in Boho Artist Home
summary: Welcome to my home. I offer a clean place to rest your head, and bathe, in an alternative to a sterile expensive hotel. There are three guest rooms total. You get a Private Room in a renovated Victorian 2 flat. Trees and gardens surround this urban diverse neighborhood. Free parking, CTA bus at the front door. Real bed, shared full bath, individual air con unit, or heat unit as well as central heat. West of downtown by 10 minutes drive, 3 miles, or 20 min by public transit. By United Center.
space: The building stands alone with community gardens all around. Light comes in from all directions here on the second floor. I have the whole floor! Warm homey Victorian 2 flat, dark wood floors and clean new fixtures. Free parking. I have two other guest rooms. Fair warning: this room has the furnace for the house behind a closet door, so you hear the furnace come on, but it's not bad.  I mentioned "smoking allowed" but only outdoors please, the apartment is smoke free.
description: Welcome to my home. I offer a clean place to rest your head, and bathe, in an alternative to a sterile expensive hotel. There are three guest rooms total. You get a Private Room in a renovated Victorian 2 flat. Trees and gardens surround this urban diverse neighborhood. Free parking, CTA bus at the front door. Real bed, shared full bath, individual air con unit, or heat unit as well as central heat. West of downtown by 10 minutes drive, 3 miles, or 20 min by public transit. By United Center. The building stands alone with community gardens all around. Light comes in from all directions here on the second floor. I have the whole floor! Warm homey Victorian 2 flat, dark wood floors and clean new fixtures. Free parking. I have two other guest rooms. Fair warning: this room has the furnace for the house behind a closet door, so you hear the furnace come on, but it's not bad.  I mentioned "smoking allowed" but only outdoors please, the apartment is smoke free. First of all, Welcome! Feel fr
neighborhood_overview: When choosing and rating my location, please understand this about my neighborhood: it is not an upscale neighborhood, but my street is very nice with a few run down looking places in the mix. I see myself as part of the solution. I love it here because it is not crowded, and it is so close to downtown. I walk around at night, but I am sensible about it. The train station is crummy looking, let's admit it. Don't judge me or my street by that! most train stations are a little run down. My area is adjacent to so much. Garfield Park Conservatory is near, United Center, Humboldt Park, Ukrainian Village are about a mile or so away. There are great spots to eat all along Chicago Avenue, California and Division both have lots of neighborhood eateries and bars, funky boutiques. Logan Square is a short ride away, with all it's hot spots. And of course access to downtown with all it's high end shopping, attractions, and the Lake! is just east of me easily accessible by train. Save your parking m
notes: Our neighborhood is on the edge of what used to be an industrial corridor, now transitioning to being used for artsy offices and band practice lofts, breweries and artsy places to have weddings and such. Houses up and down the street are being cleaned up fixed up daily. Whereas it is not a POSH upscale neighborhood, a new private school across the street a couple years ago gave the whole area an upswing, but we can still park free!
transit: CTA Route 94 South California stops at the front door.  To the south 2 stops, it goes right to the Green Line train, at the California station.  To the north 2 stops, it connects to Route 66 Chicago Ave bus and the 52 North California bus route. Very easy.  Uber and Lyft both come here happily, and I have a good relationship with the drivers that I get often.  There is a bike rental (Divvy) right by the California train stop, and a block north of me at a green center. I have my own bike so I haven't used Divvy, but there are racks all over the city to rent it or return it. You can also take a bike on the bus, loaded on the front rack, or on the train if it is not rush hour.
access: First of all, Welcome! Feel free to use the living room. Coffee or tea anytime, self serve. I have hair dryer, shampoo, razors and tooth brushes if you need. Use the kitchen if you like,  but tidy up after. PLEASE DON'T COOK MEAT HERE.
interaction: I can help you find stuff if you like, navigate transportation if needed. We can chat or not, whatever your style is.
house_rules: Smoking section is out on the porch.  Responsible enjoyment of alcohol. No other pets please.  Please lock the doors behind you when entering and exiting. If I am not home when you check out, you may leave the keys in the mailbox on the front gate. Do not leave the air conditioning on in your room when you are not home. Please respect our neighbors and keep it down some.  Do not cook meat here. Eat it if you want but cook it elsewhere. Please leave things tidy. If your shoes are wet or muddy please take them off. Otherwise, do as you would at home.
host_about:
I am an artist in textile, costume, theater and fashion. I do much of my work at home;  in my studio.
 I spend as much time out on the porch as possible, doing writing and some stitching, tending flowers and a veggie garden out in the surrounding yards. I have my own little happy zone right here in the middle of a major metropolitan city, including friendly neighbors.
My little rat terrier Mayzee is my constant companion. 
Things I like to do...  Indie Films usually turn out to be my faves.  I go to some live theater, as well as help make it here in town. Books, got to have books always. And Bike Riding!.  I probably would love yoga if I would think to do it more Ha! 
Veggie food for me, sometimes I like to cook. Former foodie, did my time in the restaurant biz. 
If you would stay over here with me, you are welcome to make yourself at home.  Have your privacy or hang out, I leave it to you. My dog may like to have a cuddle, if you are up for that. You might want to hang by the electric fireplace heh, very mod, and toasty. I have lots of books to peruse for such an evening.
I know in traveling I look for the food of the people! I can tell you my spots or help you find what you might be looking for. Or bring take out, eat in the living room, or back porch if you like al fresco. 
But maybe you just want to  crash someplace tidy and less sterile than a hotel, that's cool. The building is old, maybe a hundred years? but it has all new plumbing and such, so I feel it is the best of both worlds. 
I don't know that I have a life motto, but I firmly believe in doing what makes me happy!
I look forward to meeting interesting people on their travels; feeds the brain!

The space is great for overnight and extended in-town stays for work or leisure. Nearby attractions include the Museum of Science and Industry, Hyde Park casual and fine restaurants, the South Shore Golf Course and easy-access to Lake Michigan.

If you are a longer -term guest and need to take the trash out, the trash is outside, use the gate on the right side of the garage and the trash bins are to the right. Put recycling in the blue bins and trash in the black bins. Recycling should be loose and not bagged.  4. Toilet use: Please DO NOT flush anything down the toilet except for toilet paper.  Do not flush paper towels, floss, face wipes, make-up wipes, Kleenex, tampons applicators or anything else besides toilet paper.  Putting these items in the toilet can cause the toilet to back up. 5. Please do not play loud music or play the TV too loud, be respectful of the other neighbors. 6. No large parties or gatherings are allowed inside or outside.  7. Please do not put cutting kn
host_about:
I am from a small town outside of Chicago originally.  I went to school in Boston and then moved back to Chicago.  I have been in Chicago for almost 8 years now and love it! I love playing beach volleyball in the summer, and exploring the different neighborhoods, festivals and restaurants. I work in real estate and buy, sell, rent and manage properties for my job.  I also love to travel!  I have been to over 35 countries in 6 continents.  Some of my favorite stops were New Zealand, Ecuador, Philippines, South Africa, and Switzerland.  
I am excited to host on airbnb to meet people from all over!

name: Garden Retreat in a Tranquil Location in West Lakeview
summary: Relax in the cozy living area on the Room & Board couch in front of the electric fireplace. Drift to restful sleep in the peaceful bedroom. This garden apartment features a Queen bed supplemented by the Queen Plus (wide) pullout couch. There is a gorgeous marble shower, well-stocked kitchen, radiant floor heating, generous windows, and well-designed lighting.
space: This is a new apartment in a well-maintained vintage 3-flat. It is tastefully decorated and spotless. We're in a quiet pocket of the West Lakeview neighborhood within walking distance of hip restaurants, two craft breweries (the south end of Chicago's Malt Row), boutique shopping, groceries, and public transportation. We're also a quick walk to traditional yoga, cross-fit, Pilates, and massage. It's a bit further (20 minutes) to Core Power, Pure Barre, and Wrigley Field. You'll probably want a cab or Lyft to fun music and dance venues like Metro, Beat Kitchen, and Smart Bar. A Divvy bike rental station is a few minutes away and will set you up for a memorable bike ride along Lake Michigan to John Hancock Center, Navy Pier, and the Field Museum. There's a Queen bed in the bedroom with luxury linens. The second bed is an Olympic Queen platform sofa sleeper (NOT the old fashioned wire & springs type) in the living room. A beautiful electric fireplace and flat screen HD TV make it fun to h

This garden apartment features a Queen bed supplemented by the Queen Plus (wide) pullout couch. There is a gorgeous marble shower, well-stocked kitchen, radiant floor heating, generous windows, and well-designed lighting.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in a quiet pocket of the West Lakeview neighborhood where free street parking is plentiful. It’s within walking distance of popular restaurants, craft breweries, shops, groceries, and public transport. The Irving Park Brown Line Stop is a 10-minute walk away.
notes: Our friendly, senior Weimariner lives upstairs with us. There are security cameras around the exterior of the property. There is a city playlot nearby, with swings and such for younger children.
transit: Street parking is free and usually plentiful. There are parking restrictions only when the Cubs have a night game. When there's a night game, you can still find a spot on our street, but we'll need to give you a guest parking pass. We're a 7 minute walk from the Irving Park Brown Line Stop and the Addison Brown Line Stop. Also a 2 minute walk to the Ashland Avenue bus and a 4 minute walk to the Irving Park Road bus.  The Irving Park Road bus will take you quickly to the Kennedy Blue Line stop which will transport you to O'Hare Airport. Midway Airport is also easily accessed by taking the Brown Line to connect with the Pink Line.
access: Your own entrances mean you come and go as you wish. There is a full sized fridge, coffee maker, and microwave. The well equipped kitchen has dinnerware, glasses, coffee cups, silverware, pots & pans, and utensils. Have fun cooking or easily walk to nearby restaurants and bars. High Def TV, free Wi-Fi, and free laundry.
interaction: We live upstairs and can meet you upon arrival, then be available as much as you need or not. We've lived here for almost 20 years and love it.
host_about: Yoga and meditation teacher and Thai massage therapist.  My husband is also a full time yoga and meditation teacher.  We are very fortunate to love what we do!

The kitchen is bright and has all the amenities that you would expect and more.  The living room is spacious and includes a separate space that has a futon and this space can be used as a private room once the curtains are pulled. Guest have access to entire apartment including bedrooms, kitchen, bathroom, and living room. Guest are free to call or text message host at anytime with questions or concerns. Our neighborhood was designated a National Monument by President Obama in 2015.  There are many historic homes and buildings throughout the neighborhood.  You can visit the National Monument visitors center located a few blocks from our home. We are located less than 5 minutes from the expressway and 20 minutes from downtown Ch
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood was designated a National Monument by President Obama in 2015.  There are many historic homes and buildings throughout the neighborhood.  You can visit the National Monument visitors center located a few blocks from our home.
notes: We are located less than 5 minutes from the expressway and 20 minutes from downtown Chicago via car.  We are also within a 10 minute walk to the Metra train which gets you to downtown Chicago in about 30 minutes. Walmart is located within a 5 minute drive.  There are quite a few local restaurants and cafes i.e Pullman Cafe, One Eleven food hall, Cal-Harbor Restaurant, Potbelly’s and McDonalds.
transit: We are located less than 5 minutes from the expressway and 20 minutes from downtown Chicago via car.  We are also within a 10 minute walk to the Metra train which gets you to downtown Chicago in about 30 minutes.

name: Private Bedroom/Bathroom Lakeview E
summary: Visiting Chicago? Stay in true Windy City style by joining us in our historic 3-flat in the Lakeview neighborhood on Chicago's North Side within walking distance of Wrigley Field and the popular Southport Corridor of restaurants, bars and shops.
space: You are staying in a historic building constructed in 1893 at the time of the World's Columbian Exposition held in Chicago. We completed a complete gut rehabilitation of the property in 2007 but preserved the period look and feel of the building with state of the art electrical, plumbing, HVAC, internet and sound systems. This private Bedroom and private Bathroom across the hall are located on the 3rd floor of our historic home.  Both bedroom and bathroom have privacy latches.  The bedroom has an integrated USB port in the outlet near the bed so there is no need for a converter.  You have access to a shared free laundry and our fully equipped Kitchen with refrigerator, stove, cooktop, microwaves, toaster oven, coffee maker, dishwashers and complete dinnerware, glassware, silverware, utensils and cookware.   Our kitchen opens to a balcony overlooking the fully landscaped brick and stone patio and lighted pergola outfitted with tables and chairs, a fire pit, hammock, wall fountain and se
