neighborhood_overview: Lakeview is a historic part of Chicago, having developed outside the city limits and being annexed to the city in the late 1800's. Our immediate neighborhood was developed on land originally owned by Graceland Cemetery, which is our neighbor to the East. It is a worthwhile walking trip and contains the graves of many of Chicago's founding fathers and commercial elite. Immediately South of us is Southport Avenue which contains a diverse group of restaurants, bars, shops, the Mercury live theater and The Music Box cinema theater. It is a pleasant walk on your way to or from our other historic landmark - Wrigley Field - home of the Chicago Cubs baseball club. We are also walking distance to the Black Ensemble Theater to our North which produces live musical shows centered on diverse musicians. We are a longer walk to Lincoln Avenue and the historic Old Town School of Folk Music with its regular classes and concert venues. Further East on Broadway is the classic Chicago speakeasy The Green
notes: Our other private bedroom and private bathroom listing is adjacent to this one so there is the possibility of other guests during your stay.  However, both listings have private bedrooms and their own private bath and do not share facilities except for the hallway between them.
transit: Getting Around Our neighborhood is served by the Chicago Transit Authority's Brown Line located at Irving Park Road and Ravenswood Avenue, a short walk West. The CTA's Red Line is located at Sheridan Road South of Irving Park Road, a short walk East. The #22 Clark Street bus is located at Belle Plaine and Clark Street at the end of the block East and goes both North and South. The #9 Ashland bus turns around right behind the house on Southport and goes South on Ashland Avenue for the length of the city limits. Check (website hidden) for more information.
access: Guest Access The Bedroom and Bathroom contains a Queen size adjustable bed with full linens and multiple pillows, bedside table, overhead light, dresser, walk-in closet with hanging space, luggage rack, skylight with room darkening shade, USB outlets and electrical outlets. The Bathroom which is across the hall contains a shower/tub combination which is a whirpool tub as well, marble countered single bowl basin and commode, with plush body, hand and face towels and wash cloths, electric hair dryer and radiant heated floors. A basket of toilitries, including shampoo/conditioner and body wash are provided with other common items.  The Bedroom and Bathroom are located on our third floor.  You have ready access to our Kitchen and living areas on the 2nd floor.  The Laundry is also located on the 3rd floor.  Guests have access to the Kitchen and living areas of the 2nd floor with the exception of our home office.  French doors off the Kitchen lead to the balcony overlooking the fully outfit
interaction: One of us is generally available during your stay to assist you with navigation, transportation planning and other help. We have a supply of local travel books for your use during your stay. Please check out our local attractions list in our Guidebook. They include theater, music, cultural venues, restaurants, bars, shopping and leisure activities within easy walking distance of your guest suite.
house_rules: No Smoking: We have a strict no smoking policy during your stay. Our family has allergies to cigarettes and they are prohibited.  Only Registered Guests:  Your stay with us is for you and you alone.  Family, children and friends are not permitted.  For liability reasons, guests may not bring any visitors or any others to our home at any time, for any length of time. Only registered guests, whose full names have been provided in advance and who have been paid for in advance, may enter the premises.  Weather:  In case of rain or snow please leave your outside shoes in the trays provided near the door.  Thank you. Windows:  If you open a window or skylight please close it when you leave. Pool Table: You are welcome to use the pool table in the common area. Please put the cover back on, store the balls in the pockets and return the cues to the wall rack when finished with your game.  Washer-Dryer: Use is free. The lint trap on the dryer on the top right hand side should be cleaned after ev
host_about: We've lived in our historic 1893 Chicago three-flat since 1979, raised our children here and now offer our Garden level and bedroom/bathrooms to AirBNB guests after our own highly successful AirBNB experiences in New York, London, Ireland, Ontario, Venice, Barcelona, Lisbon and Madrid.  My wife Barbara and I love to travel and love to share the Chicago experience with people around the world.  Come join us.

host_about:
We are a married couple from Europe. I`m from Lithuania and my husband is from the United Kingdom. We moved to Chicago from Utah in 2013 and we just love it.
Chicago has a lot to offer. Music, theater, shows, outdoors activities you name it. Plus we have the best food in the USA :-)
I do photography for a living, and Chicago offers a lot of places to take my clients. So, when you are staying with us, don't forget to ask me, maybe I will take some professional pictures of you :-)
We have a new puppy which is short hair, non- shedding Boston Terrier causing little risk for allergies. Her name is Pinot :-)
Also if you like to sail, and see Chicago firework from the lake, let us know, and we can arrange that for you.

neighborhood_overview: One of Chicago's creative epicenters lies just west of downtown Chicago in Wicker Park and Bucktown. These synonymous neighborhoods are famous for unparalleled boutique shopping, esoteric book stores and their countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails and an affinity for independent clothing designers, there's no better area to sip and shop in the country. The area has recently become a prevailing influence on Chicago's Michelin-rated dining scene, boasting some of city's most sought after restaurants, including Takashi and Big Star. Wicker Park and Bucktown are also known for their palate pleasing nightcaps, like renowned brewery Piece and mixology tour de force Violet Hour. The neighborhood's most enduring quality is its shopping. Along North, Milwaukee and Damen Avenue, you will find an unbelievable mix of vintage shops amid independently-owned boutiques touting fashions for both men and women. On the
transit: Just a 3 min walk to the Division blue line 'L' stop and a block from the Division bus (#70 - travels E/W straight to gold coast) and Milwaukee bus (#56 - travels NW/SE to downtown) You can also pick up a bike at one of the nearby Divvy stations - Chicago's bike sharing program, which is a great way for getting around the city.

FREE PERKS INCLUDE: - FREE pickup from 87th & Jeffrey  (From 10p.m.- midnight).; NO SHUTTLE if weather is below 35 degrees) - FREE TRIP TO HORSESHOE CASINO (Fri-Sun) - FREE Parking - FREE Wifi Internet - FREE Coffee, Tea and more - FREE Linen & Towels
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a quiet residential area.  I am 10 minutes by car from the beach; less than 5 miles from University of Chicago and 10 minutes from the Horseshoe Casino; 30 minutes by bus to Jackson Park Hospital.
transit: NEARBY TRANSIT LOCATION: You have a couple of options to reach my home to downtown:  Option 1 -   The '87th Street' bus stop is located at the corner of my block.  This bus will connect you to the Jeffrey bus.  The Jeffrey bus will arrive to downtown within 35 minutes.  From downtown you can catch the Jeffrey bus on Michigan Avenue.  Option 2 - Take the 87th bus to the Red line train. Option 3 - The metra train is a 10 min walk away.  It will bring you to the loop in 20 minutes. DISTANCE TO CITY CENTER/DOWNTOWN LOOP. My home is located approximately 11 miles from downtown/Loop area. It is a 45 minute ride to downtown loop by bus; or a 20 minutes drive by car.   I am less than 5 miles away from President Obama's Home and the University of Chicago.
access: A key code will be given prior to arrival for flexible entry time (even tho your beds will not be available until after 6 pm.)  Please review your airbnb confirmation page for instructions, directions and more.
interaction: Arrivals Monday - Friday - Checkin is officially after 6 p.m.  However, you may arrive as earlier and wait in the lower level.  The lower level is NOT where you will be staying and therefore there are no photos listed to reflect this area.  This is a WAITING AREA ONLY.  I will have someone to meet up with you.  Please let me know at least the day before approximately what time you will be arriving.
host_about: Hi Airbnb Community.  My name is Ms. Vee.  I am very excited to become a part of the Airbnb family.  I love travelers, meet new people, experience different cultural foods and bargain hunting.   This is all new to me but I am eager to help make your stay a memorable one.

name: Sonder | The Plymouth | Vibrant 2BR + Rooftop
summary: We want everyone to have a comfortable place to stay. Our digital check-in and the ability to manage your stay from our app, means you won't need to interact with anyone in person. Our staff has been trained in proper disinfection techniques and will deep clean your Sonder before and after your stay. We're here for you during this time of uncertainty and can be reached 24/7 via text or call. Named the most innovative travel company of 2019 by Fast Company, Sonder has hosted a million guests in 5,000+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.   - 24/7 support via text, email, or phone   - Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided   - Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive   - Self check-in

name: Charming Top Floor Apt - 20 minutes to Downtown!
summary: Our modern apartment is in the heart of Humboldt Park, and has all the comforts of home on a quiet parkside street. It's within walking distance to the Wicker Park & Logan Square neighborhoods - minutes away from iconic Chicago nightlife! - and 20 mins by car/taxi from the Loop. Plus, right around the corner from the historic park and all it has to offer - book today!
space: You'll walk into a gated yard, and then into a shared foyer. Once you walk up the stairs and to our unit, you'll be in a spacious, open living room / dining room / kitchen that overlooks the street. Off the living room is the bedroom with a Queen-sized bed. At the rear of the apartment is the bathroom with a dual-vanity sink, and shower/tub.
description: Our modern apartment is in the heart of Humboldt Park, and has all the comforts of home on a quiet parkside street. It's within walking distance to the Wicker Park & Logan Square neighborhoods - minutes away from iconic Chicago nightlife! - and 20 mins by car/taxi from the Loop. Plus, right around the corner from the historic park and all it has to offer - book today! You'll walk into a gated yard, and then into a shared foyer. Once you walk up the stairs and to our unit, you'll be in a spacious, open living room / dining room / kitchen that overlooks the street. Off the living room is the bedroom with a Queen-sized bed. At the rear of the apartment is the bathroom with a dual-vanity sink, and shower/tub. Built around one of Chicago's best parks, Humboldt Park is home to great bars, restaurants, shops and more. Known for its large Puerto Rican population and the lovely green space from which its name is derived, Humboldt Park is a West Side neighborhood with no shortage of attractions
neighborhood_overview: Built around one of Chicago's best parks, Humboldt Park is home to great bars, restaurants, shops and more. Known for its large Puerto Rican population and the lovely green space from which its name is derived, Humboldt Park is a West Side neighborhood with no shortage of attractions - including streets that are decorated in vibrant murals and air that smells of carne guisada.
transit: The Damen Blue Line stop is about a mile and a half east - easily accessible on the 72/North Ave bus, which has a stop just a couple blocks north! The 82/Homan Ave bus is nearby too, so it's easy to get around here without a car. If you do bring a car, however, there's plenty of street parking in the neighborhood.
house_rules: House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.   1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.  2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee.  3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.
host_about:
Hello, Thanks for your interest in my Airbnb.

My wife and I are both young professionals who recently moved to chicago because we love the city and everything it has to offer. We travel all the time, and are always on the road, so Airbnb was a good way for us to share our space with fellow travelers. I try to offer a space that has all the modern conveniences you would expect from a big chain hotel stay (i.e. toiletries, fresh linens, etc.) but with the look and feel of being at home. If you want to experience Chicago living this is the way to do it. My home is close to all the things Chicago locals enjoy, such as night life, music, festivals, and food. We hope you enjoy our space as much as we do.

notes: I am also providing a booklet full of recommendations for restaurants, nightlife and places to visit from the local, it will be on your bed upon arrival :)
transit: "Racine" blue line is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking).  Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 5 minutes to downtown. O'Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 40 minutes to O’Hare. Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 45 minutes to Midway. Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)
access: You will have access to the following: > Free WiFi, central air conditioning & heating. > Private room includes: queen-sized bed with ALOE & GREEN TEA MEMORY FOAM mattress, 2 night stands, fresh linens, fresh towels, lock on the door with a key, iron & ironing board, hair dryer, desk, chair, full-sized mirror > Kitchen includes: table, microwave, stove, fridge, dishes, silverware > Living room includes: sofas, chairs, coffee tables. > Bathroom includes: shampoo, conditioner, body wash, hand soap, toilet paper > Closet to store your baggage before your check-in and after your check-out

host_about:
Hello! My name is Marina, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an auditor downtown.  

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

name: NEW Merch Mart 1br/1ba + balcony and roof hot tub
summary: Situated in the vibrant River North are, this new condo is perfect for those who want to experience how it feels to live in Chicago.  Steps to fancy restaurants, or just great hole-in-the-wall Thai food spots...this place has a great range of all Chicago has to offer. Close proximity to shopping, and a lot of beautiful architecture. When you tire yourself, relax in the rooftop hot tub, watch the sun set over the city...and wait for the lights to come on all over the city.  30 day min please!

name: Beautiful industrial LOFT by the lake
summary: Beautiful, spacious, modern loft with soaring ceiling and lots of light in east Rogers Park. Enjoy artistically, mindfully crafted space.   3 min from the CTA Red Line (30 min to downtown), couple blocks away from a grocery store,  less than a mile to Loyola University, 3.5 miles to Northwestern University.  Enjoy your time on the  beautiful Lake Michigan beach and park located just one block away.
space: Private master bedroom with attached bathroom.   Relax in the hammock in an open,  spacious living room  and use fully stacked chef's kitchen to prepare your meals. You can also crawl into a cozy nook to read your favorite book.   In-unit laundry.  Gym on the floor.  Secure elevator building. Check in and check out is flexible.

interaction: I usually come work late and give my guest plenty of privacy.  However, I'm available as needed but I'm always open to a nice chat.
host_about:
I'm a vibrant professional approaching life with joy and a sense of adventure.  I value meaningful connections and love meeting new people from all walks of life. I like sharing good times over delicious meal, concerts, improv shows, theatre play, or just simply chilling by the lake.  You can also find me  swinging in my indoor hammock daydreaming about my next trip.  I'm originally from Poland but I have lived in different parts of the world and currently Chicago is my second home.   I relax by spending time in nature, doing yoga or going on a long bike rides. 

Would love to have you as my guest! I am a gracious host and will make your stay comfortable and pleasant.

space: Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this studio apartment. neighborhood_overview: Located in West Loop, this furnished rental invites you to explore the edges of downtown Chicago. From endless dining and bar options to art galleries and stylish shops, West Loop has emerged with so much to offer daily. During weekends, residents savor trips to the Chicago French Market and the vibrant strip of Randolph Street. The latter is known as “Restaurant Row” and is lined with some of the city’s best eateries. Fulton Market, one of the hippest and fastest-growing neighborhoods, is ideal for dinner and drinks. Union Station is only a 5 to 10 minute walk away.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $250 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

host_about:
We love Chicago, the most-visited city in the Midwest, for its towering skyscrapers, the Magnificent Mile, world-class dining, music, attractions, and entertainment.

One can enjoy the great outdoors on a trip to Chicago with a sightseeing tour on the river boats, a play date with the animals at the zoo or a relaxing lunch on an outdoor patio.

We always wanted a place of our own in Chicago that gave us access to all this but at the same time secluded us from the hassles of the bigh city. This house allows us to enjoy all this with our family and friends just within a few minutes drive.

summary: I invite you and your friends to stay in my spacious, convenient 1500 square foot, 2 bedroom, 2 bath, 2 balcony condo situated in the South Loop. Parking can be costly and annoying in Chicago. Thankfully, this listing also provides FREE gated parking to those who stay. My home is minutes from downtown, Millenium Park, McCormick Place, Chinatown, Soldier Field, craft breweries, 3 major expressways, Sox Park, Reggie's Rock Club, the lake front bike paths, public transportation, great food & more!

notes: Close to everything!

Once you're here, you can either walk to popular destinations like Chinatown and McCormick Place, walk a short bit to take a bus or train to your destinations, or you can take a cheap uber to nearly anywhere in the city!

name: F4-Close to Downtown & Chicago BlueLine Train-Room
summary: If you want a place in a safe in a quiet neighborhood but very close to Downtown Chicago with great public transportation this is the spot!Chicago Blue Line is just 9min far by walk that will take you to the heart of downtown (Grant Park) and to O’hare Airport! Downtown sightings are between 10-15min by car and around 25 min by public transportation! 6-8min by car to United Center and 15min to McCormick Place! To know about amenities provided, the place and the neighborhood please keep reading!
space: This is a shared apartment with other Airbnb guests but if you want an entire place we may have other options that we can share!  You will have 1 comfortable Full Size Bed in 1 private rooms! We want you feel very safe so your room is going to have its own lock and key and there are cameras in common areas.  This is a private room in a shared place with other Airbnb guests and because of that we expect to keep the house very quiet all the time but specially after 9pm. There are 4 rooms in the house and 2 bathrooms!  There is few free parking on the street, and there is also an app that helps you to find paid parking anywhere in the city called spot hero!.  *I only accept payments through Airbnb platform*

This is a private room in a shared place with other Airbnb guests and because of that we expect to keep the house very quiet all the time but specially after 9pm. There are 4 rooms in the ho
neighborhood_overview: This place is very close to Downtown Chicago, it’s also a quiet  and nice neighborhood where you can even walk by night and feel safe (right in between West Town and West Loop Chicago) ) you can find  great restaurants, good bars and if you think there is not a better place to take a coffee and work as an Starbucks we have one just 2 blocks away!  The style of everything inside the house is modern, cozy and minimalist but we have to say that the house is old! It’s a great place if you want to be in a great neighborhood but our rooms are small and also common areas are.. We have full size bed in each room and we selected a kind of frame where you can put your luggage under it if you want to have more space in your room. Also our rooms has a small portable organizer, a tiny table, an stool and a table lamp.
notes: The rooms are  private but you will share common areas ( kitchen , living room, and the bathroom/s) with other Airbnb guests. Usually none of this get crowd because most of Airbnb guests are most of the time outside the house knowing the city, in concerts, interviews, etc, and they don’t spend much time in the house. A private studio in the area usually cost over 150$ p/night plus taxes and fees which is in total almost 200$ p/night ! If you want save some money and being close to downtown, surrounding great public transportation and with free street parking this could be a great option for you!  This  room is downstairs in the basement, if you are taller than 5’8’’ it may be uncomfortable becase ceiling is low. Each room has one full size bed. If you are a big group you can ask if we have available the other three rooms where you can accommodate until 8 people!  We have cameras ON in common areas. We don’t have any camera / devices in private spaces as bedrooms or bathrooms.  Is forbi
transit: This is a safe and night life neighborhood so you can walk around it but without forget it that you are in Chicago so don’t leave belongings at sight in your car. Parking is such a tough situation in Chicago although there are few streets where you can Free park around the house (Elizabeth street, Ada  Street) you can’t park in front of the airbnb , Parking is usually easy before 5pm, after 5pm is hard to find a free spot but not impossible. Just make sure 1) you read all signs posted in the street/ trees or fences that says information about street cleaning , reparation, disabilities parking, school days, permit parking, etc) also you are not over the crosswalk, near a hydrant, or wrong way. Chicago Blue Line is just 9 min walk and also  bus 66, 65. Ashland Pink and Green Line are 15 min walk. United Center is 6min far by car/28min by public transportation. McCormick Place is 16min far by car/37min by public transportation. RushHospital  is 8min by car/21min by public transportation.
access: You can use the microwave and  toaster but not the Stove neither the oven. We have, plates, coffee maker, silverware, etc! You can use living room, hair dryer, iron. You will have WiFi, clean towels (1 p/person) sheets and comforter (1 per mattress)  , Shampoo (2in1), hand’s soap, body’s soap, toilet paper.
interaction: we are a team working to support our guests needs so just text me through airbnb app so we can follow all the details about your reservation and we can help you faster !
house_rules: 1. Prohibited: Video Shooting, bring people that is not in the reservation to visit you or to stay over, Small gatherings, family reunions, birthdays parties or any kind of celebrations.  2. No smoke inside the house or building (any kind)  3. Respect other Airbnb guests, belongings, food and other rooms. 4. Be quiet in the house and in the building anytime but specially after 9pm. You can listen music / movies with earphones, don’t talk / yell / scream / cry /laugh laud. Don’t make any sounds that could be uncomfortable to other guests. 5. Checkout from your room is by 10am and our checkout is firm because our team schedule. Checkout from your room after this time will end in extra 30$. Checkout after 11am will end in extra 60$. Checkout after 12pm will end in an open  file in airbnb plus 60$ fee (2 hours paid for management team) and your belongings would have to be removed since another guest will be checking in. 6. You can’t use stove or oven ! You can just use microwave, toaster,

My goal is to have all my guests have a comfortable stay here in my apartments.  I've traveled quite a bit and still love to when the opportunity presents itself. These days though, I seem to do a lot more hosting than traveling. We design spaces and host corporate clients. 

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

neighborhood_overview: The perfect location for a weekend getaway or business trip. River North is a stylish urban neighborhood that borders the Magnificent Mile and is just across the bridge from the Loop, Millennium Park, and the downtown theater district. It is the go-to neighborhood for those who appreciate fine art and design, but is also a little quieter than being right in the middle of downtown. For those who appreciate fine dining and drinks, you can find everything from knockout noodles and Spanish small plates to high-end steakhouses and famed pizzerias. Just about every type of cuisine is covered in this mix of award-winning restaurants and local favorites. And for a fun evening out, slip into any of the sleek new clubs, upscale wine bars and craft cocktail lounges, many of which are walking distance from the home.
notes: Check In / Check Out Check in starts at 4 PM CT Check out time is 11 AM CT We do not offer early Check In or late Check Out.  Luggage Hold  If your travel arrangements have you arriving earlier or leaving later than our designated check in / check out times, we recommend using Wait Here Chicago. We have a partnership with them and can offer you discounted rates on their luggage hold options throughout the city. Pets There is a $25/pet per booking fee.  We know that all dogs are good dogs but the building's breed restrictions are listed below. There are no weight restrictions, but if your buddy falls under one of these categories unfortunately we wouldn't be able to host them: Pit Bull, American Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier, Shaffordshire Bull Terrier, Rottweiler, Doberman Pinscher, Chow Chow, Akita, Presa Canario and /or Wolf Hybrids. While we trust that your pet plays well with others, we know that accidents happen. In the event of an issue involving your pet, you
transit: There is no dedicated parking space for the home. We recommend using apps like SpotHero to locate discounted street or garage spots nearby.  The home is a short walk from the CTA brown line train at the "Chicago" stop. This train line will take you all over the city, including into the neighborhoods further north and south for exploring or down into the loop to catch a show or transfer to another train line.
access: The entire home as well as all building amenities are for you to enjoy!
interaction: We are off-site but available when needed. The best way to reach us is by emailing (Email hidden by Airbnb)  In case of maintenance emergency, the in-unit home guide will detail phone numbers of who to call immediately.
house_rules: General Rules -Please treat the home as if it is your own. -Please respect our guest limit capacity of 8 people. -Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property. -If you accidentally damage anything during your stay, please contact the host for your safety and the future safety of the next guest. -We pride ourselves on being green and would appreciate you turning off the TV and lights when you check-out. -Please remember to sign out of any ROKU apps you utilized via your personal accounts before departing. Quiet Hours Quiet hours are between 10p-8a. This is a residential building and ask that for the respect of permanent tenants basic courtesies of being mindful of your noise levels and not congregating in hallways outside of the unit be observed. Please be advised that this home is equipped with NoiseAware. NoiseAware works like a smoke detector, but for noise. The sensor tracks the decibel levels in this home, evaluates other risk factors and will send an alert if there
host_about: Hello! Thanks for checking out our homes in beautiful Chicago! Livly Short Stay has a few hosts that will be communicating with you and we can’t wait to get to know you and welcome you to the city. Hosting as a team makes communicating with us even faster and we're looking forward to taking care of curating a perfect stay for you. Talk to you soon!

name: Spacious Room in Andersonville
summary: Our spacious and comfortable third-floor apartment is perfect if you're looking for a Chicago home away from home. A 5-minute walk to public transportation, we are located in Andersonville, a neighborhood full of craft beer, trendy bars and restaurants, and a famous feminist bookstore. My husband, my baby, and I would be thrilled to welcome you into our home!
description: Our spacious and comfortable third-floor apartment is perfect if you're looking for a Chicago home away from home. A 5-minute walk to public transportation, we are located in Andersonville, a neighborhood full of craft beer, trendy bars and restaurants, and a famous feminist bookstore. My husband, my baby, and I would be thrilled to welcome you into our home! You will have access to your bedroom, which is equipped with a desk and a closet for you to hang your clothes. You can also hang out in our living room, kitchen with a breakfast bar, or the TV room.  Feel free to use any of the amenities in the bathroom including the hairdryer, shampoo, and conditioner. We also provide you with fresh towels and washcloths. You will be sharing the apartment with my husband Igor, my baby Ivan, and me! We absolutely love meeting new people!  I like cooking for our guests and tasting new foods and drinks, and I swear my husband Igor can talk to you about anything from trucks to Tajikistan. But don't w
neighborhood_overview: Andersonville is like a cozy little neighborhood inside the big city of Chicago. Originally a Swedish area, Clark Street is peppered with trendy bars filled with craft beer, new restaurants with a variety of different foods, and lots of little shops with local artists. If you walk out of our house in the other direction, you'll find Asia on Argyle, also known as Little Vietnam. Stop over to try the best pho soup you've ever had!
notes: We’re on the third floor, but don’t worry - we’ll be happy to help you with your bags!
transit: We are a 5-minute walk to the Argyle Red Line stop which is in a safe area (I used to take to and from work every day). It takes about 40 minutes to get downtown, and the trains come every 2 minutes during rush hour, every 5-10 minutes during non-peak hours.  There is free street parking and usually a spot or two available right outside our apartment building.  You can also get around on the Broadway or the Clark Street buses, which come fairly frequently.
access: You will have access to your bedroom, which is equipped with a desk and a closet for you to hang your clothes. You can also hang out in our living room, kitchen with a breakfast bar, or the TV room.  Feel free to use any of the amenities in the bathroom including the hairdryer, shampoo, and conditioner. We also provide you with fresh towels and washcloths.
interaction: You will be sharing the apartment with my husband Igor, my baby Ivan, and me! We absolutely love meeting new people!  I like cooking for our guests and tasting new foods and drinks, and I swear my husband Igor can talk to you about anything from trucks to Tajikistan. But don't worry, we will leave you alone when we see you need your space! ^_^
house_rules: When you're here, you're part of the family, so please treat our house as you would like your own to be treated. Here are some extra rules: -Communicate freely and openly about any questions or concerns.  -Wash your dishes.  -Bring your food - I often work late and may not be available to make dinner, so please be prepared to eat your own food. There are grocery stores nearby, and we will have a shelf in the fridge and pantry for you.  -Be quiet and respectful in the common areas.  -If you come back late, don't be too loud.  -Don't use the shower before 8am. I leave for work early and will need to get in there!  Pretty intuitive, right? :)
host_about:
Hello! I'm Miranda and the handsome guys in the picture are my husband Igor and my son Ivan. I’m a French enthusiast and I love baking and making beautiful meals for friends, family, and guests like you! Igor is a Mr. Fix It who loves road trips and can beat anyone at a round of US History trivia. Ivan is 4 months old; his passions are smiling at strangers, drooling on momma’s shirts, and rolling onto his tummy! Together we speak five languages (English, French, Russian, Spanish, and German) and have traveled quite a bit. 
We love hosting people from around the country or the world and hearing their stories of what brings them to our little neighborhood.

We all spend a lot of time outside the house, but when I'm home, I love to cook dinner, snacks, or cookies for guests. 

If you’re more into exploring the neighborhood, Igor has lived in the area for almost 9 years so he gives the best recommendations on where to get the perfect cold craft beer, or richest cup of coffee, or the tastiest late morning brunch.

If you have any questions about us or the listing, feel free to message us. We can't wait to meet you! ^_^

name: Hotel Perks - Private Bedroom | Private Bathroom
summary: Freehand Hotel is great for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. Experience the comfortable and casual vibe designed by Roman & Williams in River North Chicago, just two blocks from the Magnificent Mile. Walking distance to public transportation, Navy Pier, and more.  $8 nightly resort fee plus tax paid at the property For long term stays, guests must move rooms about every 30 days.
space: The private queen rooms are like traditional hotel rooms—private with an en-suite bathroom, TV, and phone. They all have walk-in showers, most of them have a desk area, and some have the bed pushed up against the wall.
description: Freehand Hotel is great for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. Experience the comfortable and casual vibe designed by Roman & Williams in River North Chicago, just two blocks from the Magnificent Mile. Walking distance to public transportation, Navy Pier, and more.  $8 nightly resort fee plus tax paid at the property For long term stays, guests must move rooms about every 30 days. The private queen rooms are like traditional hotel rooms—private with an en-suite bathroom, TV, and phone. They all have walk-in showers, most of them have a desk area, and some have the bed pushed up against the wall. Besides your private bedroom, you will have access to all public spaces and amenities at the hotel including the Broken Shaker cocktail bar. Coin-operated and valet laundry are available. Our front desk is staffed 24-hours per day for check-in, check-out, and to assist you with other requests. The Freehand Chicago is near the corner of Ohio and State st. It is downtown in the he
neighborhood_overview: The Freehand Chicago is near the corner of Ohio and State st. It is downtown in the heart of River North, 1 block from the Magnificent Mile, 1 block across the River from The Loop, and a quick walk, bus, train, or taxi to anywhere you need to go.  We are also conveniently located across the street from Jewel, a major grocery store chain.
notes: To check-in, the hotel requires guests must be 18 or older with a government-issued photo ID. Your room and tax will be prepaid through Airbnb, but the hotel requires a $50 deposit for incidentals on a card at check-in per room, per stay. We do not accept gift cards, prepaid cards, or cash for incidentals. The deposit will be released back to your card at checkout provided you do not charge anything to your room. It takes most banks 3-7 business days to process the release. $8 nightly resort fee plus tax paid at the property For long term stays, guests must move rooms about every 30 days.
transit: The hotel offers parking to guests for $39 / night with free in and out privileges at a garage 1 block south of the hotel called The Grand Plaza. The address of the entrance is 18 W Grand Ave. If you park there, please just stop at the front desk for an exit ticket any time you'd like to take the car out.
access: Besides your private bedroom, you will have access to all public spaces and amenities at the hotel including the Broken Shaker cocktail bar. Coin-operated and valet laundry are available.
interaction: Our front desk is staffed 24-hours per day for check-in, check-out, and to assist you with other requests.
house_rules: Freehand offers a mix of Private Rooms and Shared Rooms. Minimum Check-In Age is 18 years old (Adult). Guests 17 & under are welcome to stay in our Private Rooms while accompanied by an Adult - If you are traveling with a minor, please make sure to book a Private Queen, Private King, or Private Quad as you must be 18+ to stay in our Shared Rooms (single beds with roommates/hostel style). Chicago Residents are not allowed to stay in our Shared Rooms (single beds with roommates/hostel style); however, we welcome you to book a Private Room!
host_about:
Freehand Chicago is housed in a 1927 building in Chicago’s vibrant River North neighborhood – home to some of the city’s best art galleries, boutiques and restaurants.

Freehand is a collection of hotels that combine the social culture of a hostel with innovative design, award-winning food and beverage, and a community-driven atmosphere. Each Freehand takes its cues from the surrounding neighborhood, with spaces that are a microcosm of the best each city has to offer.

name: ❤️$1400 MAY Rates! Sparkling Clean & Cozy Studio
summary: A fully furnished home for your longer stay, complete with WiFi and everything you need to live. AFFORDABLE MONTHLY RATES ARE AVAILABLE!!! APRIL - $1120 MAY - $1400 Cubs fans, deep-dish fans, and history fans unite! Chicago is a fabulous getaway city for any interest, and our spacious 1-bedroom apartment is the ideal place to stay while you’re here. Featuring modern decor, a full kitchen, and access to a 24/7 gym, your time in Chi-Town will be comfortable and convenient.
space: In the heart of trendy Uptown Chicago, our sophisticated 2-bedroom apartment is the perfect launchpad for Windy City adventures or clinching that important business deal. Whatever brings you to town, you’ll rest easy in our charming, quiet neighborhood with easy access to the Red Line train to take you south to Downtown or north to Loyola and Evanston. Illuminated by sunny natural light, our two bedrooms feature Queen-size beds, premium linens, and plenty of closet space so you can unpack and forget about your suitcase for a while. Enjoy the privacy of your own room, with doors that close and independently controlled air-conditioning units. In the living room, our couch unfolds into a Queen-size sofa bed - though it’s a lot more comfortable than your average pull-out! The apartment includes one full bathroom, with a shower/tub combo, sink, and toilet. We’re all about helping you look (and smell) your best, so we provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in addition to hand soap and f
description: A fully furnished home for your longer stay, complete with WiFi and everything you need to live. AFFORDABLE MONTHLY RATES ARE AVAILABLE!!! APRIL - $1120 MAY - $1400 Cubs fans, deep-dish fans, and history fans unite! Chicago is a fabulous getaway city for any interest, and our spacious 1-bedroom apartment is the ideal place to stay while you’re here. Featuring modern decor, a full kitchen, and access to a 24/7 gym, your time in Chi-Town will be comfortable and convenient. In the heart of trendy Uptown Chicago, our sophisticated 2-bedroom apartment is the perfect launchpad for Windy City adventures or clinching that important business deal. Whatever brings you to town, you’ll rest easy in our charming, quiet neighborhood with easy access to the Red Line train to take you south to Downtown or north to Loyola and Evanston. Illuminated by sunny natural light, our two bedrooms feature Queen-size beds, premium linens, and plenty of closet space so you can unpack and forget about your suitcase
neighborhood_overview: If you’re searching for Chicago history and culture, but you also want to get a good night’s sleep without the non-stop noise of Downtown, Uptown is your ‘hood. Uptown is slightly north of Downtown, and just a mile west of Montrose Beach and Lake Shore Drive. It’s safe, a little historic, a little trendy, and a perfect home base for any Chi-Town getaway. Our apartment is within walking distance of coffee shops (including a Starbucks), banks, and grocery stores. More information This hip neighborhood features old-school Chicago gems like the famed Riviera Theatre, the much-loved Fat Cat Restaurant & Bar, and easy access to Wrigley Field and Downtown via the Red Line from Lawrence Station. With plenty of good restaurants, vibrant bars, and exciting venues, you might find yourself not even wanting to venture downtown! Some of our favorite nearby restaurants include Fat Cat, where you can indulge in tasty pub grub over a game of pool, and Demera, an Ethiopian restaurant serving top-notch c
notes: WIFI service is an open connection  provided by the building management and is in the works of upgrading it. Outages may be experienced from time to time while the upgrade is on going. As of this moment, the service is NOT SUITABLE for remote work and can only cater mobile/portable devices. We highly recommend keeping your key fob in a safe place, because if you lose it, you’ll lose access to the entire building. Not fun. It takes time to replace it, which means you might be locked out of the building and the apartment for a while, and any fob replacement will incur a fee of $300. That’s probably not what you have in mind for a “memorable” trip to Chicago, so let’s just keep track of the fob. Our apartment includes lots of awesome amenities, but it does NOT include a parking space. If you need to park a vehicle, there is some metered street parking nearby. We recommend using the Spot Hero app to claim a street parking space. The city is easily accessible with public transit and ride sh
transit: Unless you’re really into parallel parking or overpriced meters, we recommend using public transportation to explore Chi-town. Our place is just a 5-minute walk to both the Argyle and Lawrence stations, where you can catch the Red Line. The Red Line will take you straight to Wrigley Field (7 minutes), or keep on riding for about 15 more minutes to access the best of Downtown. Grant/State Station is most convenient to the tasty restaurants of River North, and Lake Station puts you just 3 blocks from the Bean. P.S. Locals call the subway the “L.” Public transit is also an easy way to get to our place from O’Hare Airport, especially during rush hour. Hop on the Blue Line at the airport, and switch to the #51 bus at the Jefferson Park Transit Center. You’ll go from baggage claim to beautiful condo in only an hour! If ridesharing is more your style, Uber and Lyft are available throughout the Chicago metro. Keep in mind that traffic can pile up Downtown during major events or rush hour, whic
access: Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours.  But that’s not all! You’ll also have access to the building’s gym (open 24/7 and stocked with cardio machines and weights) and lobby lounge area. The building’s common spaces and your unit are accessible via elevator.
interaction: We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.
house_rules: HOUSE RULES Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking: -No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250). -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. - The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am. -Lost key fee - $300 -Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc. -Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc. -Smoking - $300 -Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300 **-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat,  an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.
host_about: Sonia & Syed are Chicago Natives. We can give you recommendations for food and fun! Mother to my beautiful baby Sofia

I will help you as you need, but also respect your space!  I LOVE THE CITY! I am more than happy to assist
neighborhood_overview: Residential--  near CTA transit station & stops, restaurants for dine-in or take-out & shopping! Target, grocery stores, family style breakfast & lunch restaurant below,  24 hour family style restaurant a block away.
notes: PLEASE Note: There are 2 flights of stairs to climb, and you will interact with Myself & other guests at times. My home is peaceful, fun, and cozy. :) On a major intersection, near the airport, CTA train, highway, and path to 3 hospitals.  There is potential for noise. It's Chicago :) I have a strict  NO DRUGS, NO SMOKING policy. My landlord is a police officer and is on premises most days. NO pets  NO unauthorized guests not on your reservation.  I would love to host your stay!

house_rules: I like to keep a very peaceful home atmosphere.  Please respect people living here, as well as the neighbors & other guets. No smoking, NO drugs policy.  Absolutely NO outside guests or friends allowed inside that are not on your reservation.  Thank you! This is for everyone's safety.  This is a shared apartment.  You will interact with other guests & myself.  Please be mindful of your belongings  as you are responsible for them.  3rd floor walk-up unit. You will climb 2 flights of stairs.  Please tidy up after yourself & keep your space, Kitchen, Bathroom, and Common Areas clean.  18 & over, please.  Please keep the back door locked at ALL times, whether you're inside or leaving the apartement. Safety & Securtiy is important for EVERYONE. :)  Kitchen usage is allowed for light use & food prep. I request no frying/deep frying (dangerous)  or cooking of strong smells ex. Seafood, spiced foods, or other smells that will linger, out of respect for everyone. No Oven use, and please clean u
host_about:
Hello, my name is Kay! I've been in  hospitality for almost 20 years, and love every day of it. It would be my pleasure to be your hostess.

I am a Realtor in Illinois,  so if you are transitioning to Chicago, I will be your home-finding expert! Apartment, condo, townhome, 1-4 unit building, or single family home. We can find you the perfect place to call home! Moving out of state? Let me find a Realtor professional to help you. 

I am a Superhost with Airbnb, and I dedicate myself to making your stay wonderful. I decided to become an Airbnb hostess because I feel Chicago is such a beautiful city, but it's shame that hotels are so expensive. Since lodging is the weight of most trips' cost, this is a wonderful way to help each other. I am a Chicago native, born and raised, and know the city very well.

The atmosphere of my home is peaceful, pleasant, and fun.  I enjoy music, film, sight-seeing, dining, travel, photography, yoga, and nature. Help yourself to the coffee bar bananas & OJ.  You are more than welcome to bring and store your own food for extended stay. I have mini fridges in the rooms for you to use & store your food. 

A sweet cat lives in unit--16 yrs young! He's very friendly , but if you're allergic to pets, please be aware. I Do Not allow other pets to join you, I apologize in advance. I also Do Not allow other guests without prior approval on the reservation. 

I have some ground rules for my BnB home: BE courteous, BE friendly, BE honest, BE open. If you have ANY questions or concerns, feel free to ask any time. BE Yourself:) I am a very reasonable, down-to-earth person. I'm here to help you have a wonderful trip! Keep your space clean, free from food, and excess garbage. Keep all common spaces free of your items.

I also have a NO DRUGS,  NO SMOKING inside policy, as my Landlord is a police officer, and is on premises most days.  I do not allow any unregistered guest into my Home, at ANY time. If they are not verified through Airbnb & not on your reservation I cannot allow them into my home. This protects everyone. 

I can offer bag drop case-by-case. Please message me with any questions. 

I look forward to hosting your stay! Reach out wirh any questions!

name: Private Luxury Spacious Living near Wrigley Field
summary: We love to host people from all around the world. The space is extremely clean and very comfortable. You’ll love my place because of the neighborhood and the lovely decor.  My empty-nesting mother lives on the top floor. She's very sweet and easy-going.  She teaches pilates and summers up in Lake Geneva, Wisconsin. If you are in for an extended stay she may even invite you to join her up at her cottage for a weekend. It works very well for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
space: The lower level space (~1000 square feet) has its own private entrance  exit. As you enter you'll find a full bathroom (pictured) as well as a full-size laundry room. Down the hall opens to the workout equipment, big screen TV with surround sound, and the living room lounge. There's also an outdoor private patio on back. Tucked back on the opposite side as patio are french doors that lead into the bedroom. In the bedroom we have a queen size bed, a hanging closet, side table with reading light, dresser, work desk with chair, and a smart TV on the wall (Website hidden by Airbnb) The kitchen and dining room and powder room are on the first floor.

name: A little Italy For Everyone
summary: If you’re looking for a family neighborhood that has it all? Then look no further, I think you’ve found it. ENTIRE APARTMENT in one of the hottest neighborhoods in Chicago, Little Italy.   Free street parking and EARLY check is available (12 pm!). 8-minute drive to the Chicago Bulls Stadium, 1 Mile west of the “Loop” Chicago Downtown. Known for its Italian restaurants and community, there is plenty to do and see within blocks of your stay.  Transportation is convenient with commuter rail nearby, local bus routes and public bike rentals
notes: In most cases I will meet you to let you in the unit and show you around.  In the event that i cannot meet you directions will be given for lock-box access. Also note - Street parking is available, however you will need a parking permit that will be provided to you.  You will need to display the permit in your car window during your stay.
interaction: I am available during the day to assist with check-in and to provide local information and tourist tips
host_about:
After spending eight years in the military I wondered what other ways I could serve others in a meaningful and impactful way.    

Today I am a Chicago business professional and credit repair specialist who has been changing lives  by educating people on managing debt & credit.  My clients have went on to owning homes, buying their first new car and  even securing bank loans for their entrepreneurial dreams.  My success comes from treating people with the utmost respect and integrity.  I believe that your word will always be your greatest and most powerful form of currency.

neighborhood_overview: This cultural melting pot is known for its eclectic, artsy vibe. It’s one of the city’s up-and-coming hot spots, where you can uncover laidback taprooms, unique museums, old-school vintage shops, and tons of cool art — both in the galleries and on the streets. Insider tips Over the past century, West Town has seen waves of immigrants from all over the world. These global influences have shaped the neighborhood into the funky, creative enclave it is today. This is where you can find an Old-World pierogi joint, a nature-inspired brewery, and a contemporary omakase spot — all on the same street. West Town encompasses the historic Ukrainian Village area, which brings tons of Eastern European heritage to the area. The Ukrainian National Museum, founded in 1952, houses an unparalleled collection of folk art, instruments, and artifacts that showcase Ukrainian history. Nearby, the Ukrainian Institute of Modern Art presents works by internationally recognized  artists from around the globe. If
house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty. 3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance. 4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.
host_about:
Friendly positive person who enjoys great food and most outdoor events. Graduated from Lewis University with a background in Distribution and Logistics.
I currently work in the same field and love what I do. Thanks for stopping by

name: Holiday Rental -Spacious 2 BR, quick to downtown
summary: Huge 2 BR (2000 sq ft), bright and open with classic touches.  1 block from blue line Division stop and just 10 min to downtown.  Easy access to O'hare and Midway (O'hare is on the blue line).  Dozens of great restaurants and bars within a 10 min walking distance. Master BR nice Queen Bed.  Other BR has high quality 24" queen air mattress.  Parking on the street is not difficult to find (I do it).  High Speed Wifi, Netflix, HBO, Amazon Prime, 50" TV, in-unit laundry.
description: Huge 2 BR (2000 sq ft), bright and open with classic touches.  1 block from blue line Division stop and just 10 min to downtown.  Easy access to O'hare and Midway (O'hare is on the blue line).  Dozens of great restaurants and bars within a 10 min walking distance. Master BR nice Queen Bed.  Other BR has high quality 24" queen air mattress.  Parking on the street is not difficult to find (I do it).  High Speed Wifi, Netflix, HBO, Amazon Prime, 50" TV, in-unit laundry. Fully equipped kitchen which guests have full access to.  Large common area with TV. Awesome neighborhood.  Wicker Park area has great restaurants and bars and is also very quick to downtown. Street parking is fairly easy and the train is a block away.  3 stops and you're downtown! The front bedroom faces Ashland, which is a loud street.  If you are a light sleeper, ear plugs or white noise might be warranted.  I have a white noise machine I can provide.

If you're going to have late night conversations, etc, that you hang out in your bedroom rather than the common areas.  No TV after 1130 pm.  Full access to the kitchen, but that does not including eating the food or drinking the booze.  Please turn off the A/C and all lights when you leave.  You can leave the keys on the desk in the room and just turn the handle to lock the door when you leave the last time, unless otherwise arranged.

name: Darling Damen Dwelling (with bike if you like)
summary: Stay in the guest room of a vintage 2br, 1 bath apartment in the walkable heart of Chicago's North Center neighborhood: trees, yards, families, great restaurants and shops, safe day and night, and close to public transportation. More like a small town than the big city! All kind guests are welcome; you will find a cozy space in my quirky home. You will share the apartment (including bathroom) with me and my small dog Clarence (a poodle mix) and the multiple piles/projects I always have going on!
space: ATTENTION GUESTS: PLEASE READ ALL information, descriptions, messages, Airbnb POLICIES, and HOUSE RULES when you receive them; every Airbnb listing is different. You are responsible for knowing before you book.  *Update March 2020: I urge guests to purchase travel insurance, and please do not travel if sick.* This vintage second-floor apartment in a three-flat house built in 1907 is a short walk to two CTA Brown Line el stations, grocery stores, coffee shops, boutiques, breweries (Chicago's "Malt Row"), restaurants featuring many cuisines, a large regional public library, public parks, and more. It is a lovely neighborhood for walking. We have a summer farmer's market two blocks south, a Jewel supermarket just one block away, and Trader Joe's, Aldi, and another large grocery store are all 15-minute walks from my door. My place is a shoes-off-at-the-door apartment. Slippers are provided! The guest room is cozy and quiet with one queen-sized (very comfortable) bed. You will find fresh li
description: Stay in the guest room of a vintage 2br, 1 bath apartment in the walkable heart of Chicago's North Center neighborhood: trees, yards, families, great restaurants and shops, safe day and night, and close to public transportation. More like a small town than the big city! All kind guests are welcome; you will find a cozy space in my quirky home. You will share the apartment (including bathroom) with me and my small dog Clarence (a poodle mix) and the multiple piles/projects I always have going on! ATTENTION GUESTS: PLEASE READ ALL information, descriptions, messages, Airbnb POLICIES, and HOUSE RULES when you receive them; every Airbnb listing is different. You are responsible for knowing before you book.  *Update March 2020: I urge guests to purchase travel insurance, and please do not travel if sick.* This vintage second-floor apartment in a three-flat house built in 1907 is a short walk to two CTA Brown Line el stations, grocery stores, coffee shops, boutiques, breweries (Chicago's "Ma
neighborhood_overview: I've lived in this neighborhood, a charming, tree-lined, residential one with very closeby commercial amenities, for more than 15 years, and I love hosting and "showing off" this fantastic city and my charming north side neighborhood called North Center - I think you'll enjoy yourself here! Feel free to ask any questions.
notes: Please let me know your arrival and departure details (time and mode) at the time of your reservation. Sometimes I can be flexible on check-in times, but we MUST arrange specific times in advance. If there is a chance that you will be EARLY for your arrival time, PLEASE communicate this to me ASAP, and know that you may have to wait to check in. Late checkouts after 12 noon must be arranged prior to booking. Per Airbnb’s rules, you may be charged a late check-out fee. I expect guests to clean up after themselves, including dishes, be quiet and kind to me, my dog, and my neighbors, replace or pay for things they break or damage, and to not bring anyone into my home.  BICYCLE: If you'd like to use the guest bike (a vintage Schwinn suburban), please let me know when you book! Chicago is a great place to get around by bike. The Schwinn is a comfortable upright cruiser with a step-through frame, and fenders that will fit riders from approximately 5'4" to 6'. Chicago also has Divvy, our publ
transit: In addition to the train stations, we are steps from the #50 Damen Ave. bus (a direct route to both the Andersonville and the Wicker Park/Bucktown shopping/dining/nightlife areas) and short walks to two other east-west bus routes (#78 Montrose, #80 Irving Park). This is also a bike-friendly area, and you may request my loaner bicycle to use during your stay - please let me know *when you are booking.* The apartment is also a 15-to-20-minute walk to the Lawrence Ave. Metra commuter train station - this train goes to the northern suburbs and south to downtown.  If you drive, you may park your car on the street, permit-free, and spots are usually available right in front. I do not recommend driving into downtown from here.
access: The guest room includes light use of kitchen, bathroom, living room, lovely porch, and back yard with garden. Bedding and towels, robe and slippers, use of my electric kettle and french press or coffee maker are provided. Feel free to store your own food in the pantry, refrigerator and freezer as space allows, and cook light meals during your visit! Dishes and cookware is hand wash. Laundry is available in the basement, but please ask if you will need to use that.
interaction: Although I can be gone or busy working or studying from home during your stay, I live here with my sweet little dog  Clarence who is almost always home. Please keep him out of your room by keeping the gate in place, do not feed him, or let him out.  Please let me know right away if you have any feedback or concerns during your stay! I'm happy to communicate with you via this app or website during or prior to your visit.
house_rules: • You MUST be a dog-lover. Clarence is imperfect, attention-seeking, he barks, and he has free reign in the apartment (except your room). • Absolutely no smoking (of anything) in or near the apartment/porch/etc. • No guests! No sleepovers - only registered Airbnb guests in the apartment at all. • Please do not keep food in the guest room. • Please do not feed or let the dog out of his crates or the apartment. • Courtesy regarding noise and cleanliness in shared spaces is expected (do your dishes, use coasters, generally clean up the areas you use.) • Please leave bathroom door OPEN when you are not using it • PLEASE let me know when you book if you use any skin, hair, or intimate products that could damage my bed linens or towels.  Great communication is required for a great stay. Contact me right away with any specific questions or concerns - shared expectations is key. Thanks for looking, and enjoy your trip to Chicago!
host_about:
Welcome! I'm a nonprofit freelancer and TESOL graduate student living in (and loving) Chicago with my small but mighty dog Clarence. Live music, films, and art of all kinds are my favorite things, next to bicycles, dogs, and world peace.

I enjoy solo travel (and love to stay in interesting Airbnb homes!), cooking, organizing projects, gardening, and meeting new people, and I hope you fall for this great city and its neighborhoods during your visit with me. My place is always a work in progress - very homey, humble, and (I hope!) comfortable, and just a short train ride to downtown.

name: Great for Longer Stays, Highly Rated
summary: We are doing our part to help Airbnb guests stay safe by cleaning and disinfecting all frequently touched surfaces before you check in.   Gorgeous, historic building renovated to host your next extended stay. From the charming brick exterior to the tailored flooring, cheerful color scheme, and eat-in kitchen, this is urban living at its best. Located a block from bustling Division Street. We have stocked kitchen with when you need for cooking and baking. The Washer & Dryer is a nice bonus!
space: Well-styled living!  This is an apartment in the Lincoln Street Bathhouse - an original piece of Chicago's history!  Walk into a newly renovated, urban oasis made magical by unique FLOR tiles.  The surround is color and vintage rock posters along with an edited selection of local photographers. Live like locals and enjoy Wicker Park/Buck Town & Ukranian Village! The kitchen is modern, spacious and ideal for making magic happen!  It is equipped with the basics and a large pantry accommodates needs for a longer stay.  We provide:  Keurig & pods, washer/dryer, full sets of pans, plates and silverware, full-size refrigerator, toaster, toaster oven, dish washer Both bedrooms are large.  The master is en suite with a huge master closet (it'll make your home closet envious!)  The second bedroom and bath are just as large, but across the hall from one another.

neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park is one of the liveliest neighborhoods in Chicago. Close to the city center, it offers a vast selection of fashionable shops and eclectic restaurants. There is also easy access to The Loop for ultimate convenience.
notes: We have pets in our, separate unit upstairs.  There have never been pets living this apartment that you would rent. Please remove your shoes when entering the apartment. Please remove shoes at all times when in the house.  Please notify me of any additional guests so I can provide you with the proper amount of linens and towels.  There is a charge for additional guests over 4.  Make yourself at home and enjoy!
host_about:
I'm an avid traveler who loves to explore and get as close to culture as possible.  I live in the city of Chicago, work in the business of building brands and love sharing time relaxing with my superstar husband.

We enjoy seeing live music, seeking out the most amazing food, and walking through new neighborhoods. 

We believe in leaving things as we find them - better in some cases!   Our travels with Airbnb have taken us far and wide from SFO to Barcelona, Iceland, Berlin, Mexico - we can't wait to see and experience more of the world!

You will be just steps from Rush street and one of the most vibrant neighborhoods in Chicago, and just a 10 min walk to Lake Michigan and to Magnificent Mile. Here you'll find all the comforts of home: a full kitchen, custom artwork, and furnishings curated to reflect the beauty of the Windy City.
space: This is a serviced apartment in a residential high-rise. Respect your neighbors and enjoy your stay! For stays over 30 days, we require additional personal information and a signed License Agreement in order to accommodate the stay. All guests will be required to verify their information which includes a 3rd-party background check. This is to ensure your safety as well as the safety and well being of our neighbors and our homes. name: Private Bedroom & Bathroom in Bronzeville
summary: This is a cozy private bedroom with a private bathroom in Chicago’s historical Bronzeville neighborhood. Perfect for young professionals, tourists, or creatively-oriented folks. Located in a building with large windows, original flooring and wood-work, our apartment is a mix of old and new—a touch of mid-century and contemporary details, with many plants and art by local and international artists giving the apartment that irresistible eclectic note.  Welcome!
space: Access to the shared areas and a washer/drier (in the unit), with understanding that this is our home we are welcoming you into it.  We recently installed shades in the bedroom and touched up our back patio, where guests can lounge surrounded by a variety of lush plants.
description: This is a cozy private bedroom with a private bathroom in Chicago’s historical Bronzeville neighborhood. Perfect for young professionals, tourists, or creatively-oriented folks. Located in a building with large windows, original flooring and wood-work, our apartment is a mix of old and new—a touch of mid-century and contemporary details, with many plants and art by local and international artists giving the apartment that irresistible eclectic note.  Welcome! Access to the shared areas and a washer/drier (in the unit), with understanding that this is our home we are welcoming you into it.  We recently installed shades in the bedroom and touched up our back patio, where guests can lounge surrounded by a variety of lush plants. The apartment is a work-and-live space that my partner and I share. We are LGBTQ friendly, artistically oriented couple who loves their home, art, and life. As we work from home and we are mostly around we are open to answer to any questions you might have as well
neighborhood_overview: There is a cute sandwich place, a relaxing coffee shop, and a convenience store located just around the corner. Walking distance to the famous Chicago’s Home of Chicken and Waffle.  Bronzeville is located on the South Side of Chicago known for its rich history. In the early 20th century, Bronzeville was known as the "Black Metropolis", one of the nation's most significant concentrations of  Black owned businesses. The apartment is located a couple of blocks from the 47th street, the hub of the Bronzeville, with restaurants, galleries, and a variety of shops.  Short commute to University of Chicago and Hyde Park—where the Obama house is located and the soon to come Obama Library. You can also visit the Hyde Park Art Center or other friendly and diverse businesses that cater to audiences from all around the world.
transit: A 5 min walk to the city train (Green and rush hour Express Red Lines) or multiple bus lines, with a quick 20 minutes ride to the Loop/Chicago downtown area and its tourist destinations, including the Art Institute, Millennium Park and the famous Bean sculpture, Chicago Cultural Center, Magnificent Mile, the Museum of Contemporary Art (MCA), and others.  Plenty of parking in street if you are coming by car.
interaction: The apartment is a work-and-live space that my partner and I share. We are LGBTQ friendly, artistically oriented couple who loves their home, art, and life. As we work from home and we are mostly around we are open to answer to any questions you might have as well as provide advice and suggestions for getting around Chicago.
house_rules: - Quiet hours after 10pm
host_about: I’m a PhD candidate at Northwestern University originally from Croatia and my partner Charles is an artist and works in social justice field.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is situated in the most dynamic and convenient place to live in Chicago, The Loop. With its endless shopping, fine dining, stunning park, river and lake views, and entertainment opportunities, everything is possible at a moment’s notice. The area is a cultural getaway for professionals and students, who can combine work with pleasure. Discover landmark buildings like the Willis Tower and The Art Institute of Chicago. Millenium Park, near Lake Michigan, is always worth a visit. The Loop is within reach of accessible transportation, offering non-stop public transit, buses, and taxis. Union Station is approximately a 10 minute train ride.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $300 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Sonder | Coeval | Sleek 2BR + Fitness Room
summary: We want everyone to have a comfortable place to stay. Our digital check-in and the ability to manage your stay from our app, means you won't need to interact with anyone in person. Our staff has been trained in proper disinfection techniques and will deep clean your Sonder before and after your stay. We're here for you during this time of uncertainty and can be reached 24/7 via text or call. Named the most innovative travel company of 2019 by Fast Company, Sonder has hosted a million guests in 5,000+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.   - 24/7 support via text, email, or phone   - Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided   - Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive   - Self check-in

name: Lincoln Park Charm
summary: Beautiful large (1300 square foot) one bed-room plus den vintage condo on 3rd floor of walk up building one block from Lincoln Park and quite near lake, public transportation, shops, etc.
space: This large airy space with a lot of character and light has both North and South exposure, although South faces a single family home. (We are higher than the building so we look over its roof in the study and then in the dining room, we face the brick, city style. The Northern exposure looks out onto the courtyard with trees and birds. The kitchen has soapstone countertops with a beautiful green finish and white wood cabinets. The furnishings are a combination of antiques and transitional pieces. The rooms are: large bedroom, large eat in dining room and study. Renovated kitchen and partly renovated bathroom. Many many upgrades large and small over the years including washer dryer, new lighting fixtures and wiring. Building was built in 1930 and is typical of the yellow brick style in Chicago.
