name: Logan Square Apartment, Great Area!
summary: Professionally cleaned & sanitized! You will more than likely have the whole place to yourself. This is the master bedroom on the top level of a duplex apartment. I have moved out so I won't be there, and my roommate has been stuck in New York since the quarantine started. It's unlikely he'll be back anytime soon. Free parking space included. Great location - Blue Line 3 blocks away to take you to/from Ohare or the Loop in 20 min.
space: Queen size bed in the master bedroom on the garden level. Full kitchen is on the upstairs/main level and is shared with roommates, but it has everything you need for basic cooking. Living room with couches and TV with access to Netflix, Hulu, and HBOgo. Private back deck if you're a smoker, but please don't loiter or make too much noise outside (I have neighbors). Oh and the shower has great water pressure, which is important.

Private back deck if you're a smoker, but please don't loiter or make too much noise outside (I have neighbors). Oh and the shower has great water pressure, which is important. I'm available if there's anything you need! I'll give you your privacy and I won't bother you unless you need something. "Next to down
neighborhood_overview: "Next to downtown this is the best neighborhood in Chicago! It has diversity, character, green space and some of the best bars and restaurants in Chicago. It's got beautiful boulevards, a fantastic farmers market and stately old homes." "If you are into bar crawling with hipstery types, than this is a neighborhood you want to visit. Take an uber to circle in the middle of the neighborhood, and you can hop your way back north. There are also some great restaurants along the way, and don't miss Revolution Brewing."
notes: I live here and so do my neighbors :), so please no partying or loud music! Also please keep the volume down when entering and exiting the building. Just be respectful of the space, but make yourself at home!
transit: Free, dedicated parking spot included, directly behind the apartment. Once you park I would recommend taking the blue line or an uber to get around the city. For easy access to/from Ohare airport or downtown, I recommend the Blue Line "L" (CTA train). The California blue line stop is only a 5 minute walk from the apartment! It will take you to/from Ohare or downtown in 25-30 minutes.
interaction: I'm available if there's anything you need! I'll give you your privacy and I won't bother you unless you need something.
host_about: Hello! My name is Dave. I'm 31 years old, I grew up in the Chicago suburbs, and I've lived in the city for 7 years. I work as the Director of Marketing for a startup downtown - fun fact, we were on Shark Tank :). I love live music, good beer and wine, and being a tourist in my own city. I've lived in this location for 3 years, and I've been hosting on Airbnb for 4 years. Hosting lets me meet new, interesting people from around the world and I love doing it. I'm more than happy to play tour guide and recommend cool, unique things to do around Chicago while you're here. Send me a message if you have any questions at all. I look forward to hosting you!

name: Private home with Master bedroom suite. 2 parkings
summary: Entire rowhouse duplex.
space: Duplex Chicago rowhouse. Backyard with wood deck equipped with bbq. You will have a private home with 4 bedroom 3 bathrooms.  1st floor: Kitchen, dinning/study room, living room, and one bedroom 1 bathromm 2nd floor: One hige master bedroom with an ensuite bathroom, and additional 2 bedrooms 1 bathroom. Include all utilities. FREE use of washer/Dryer. FREE WIFI. 15 minutes drive to downtown. 15 minutes on Redline or Greenline train (only 2 stops to reach downtown). Also many buses to downtown. Central air conditioning and heat. (You can control.thermostat.) Includes 2 parking pads in gated backyard. Street parking at the front is free and easy to find. * 3 blocks to Green Line and Red Line. Half a block to bus #4 from downtown. A few blocks to bus #3 to Water Tower, and #29 to Navy Pier. * 15 blocks to McCormick Place convention center. Taxi should cost less than $10. Or take bus #3. Or nice long walk in Summer. * 3-block walk to Illinois Institute of Technology (IIT), 35th street camp

Not include cleaning services -- We provide dish soap, and basic household cleaning tools.  FREE BIKE & BIKE LOCK: Please inquire in advance. Asking $150 deposit per.bike, which is refundable when you return the bike. (Bring your own helmet.)
house_rules: No Shoes in the house. No greasy oil fried or deep fried cooking.
host_about:
Hi! I am a friendly and easy-going host. My background is in graphic design,  interior design, and computer programming. My goal is make sure you enjoy the stay as much as i can. We are courteous, well-organized, responsive to your requests, and clean.  

Originally from Thailand but have lived in Chicago for over 20 years. In my free time, i enjoy gardening, biking, hiking, and exploring new restaurants. It is always my pleasure to recommend my local-favorite spots that are not in travel guide books, or to provide info on transportations, shopping, etc.  

I travel often. I usually pick up new tips from other airbnb hosts to enhance my guest experiences. I greatly appreciate your support. You may expect that i will go extra miles to ensure that you enjoy your stay.

name: 3 Level Lincoln Park Townhouse with 4 Beds!
summary: Comfortable and eclectic 3-story townhouse in Lincoln Park in the heart of DePaul's campus, set back in a neighborly courtyard. Our private patio is the perfect spot to spend a warm-weather afternoon! Plus, we're in an ideal location to see some of Lincoln Park's best sights, including Lake Michigan, the Conservatory, & world-famous music venues - & it's just 20 minutes on the Red Line to the Loop, 10 minutes to Wrigley Field. Book today!
space: You enter our place from a courtyard shared by neighbors onto the main level - all common space, a kitchen, dining room, and living room with a smart TV. The living room has sliding glass doors that lead to a private patio. For convenience there's a half-bath on this level too. Upstairs are two bedrooms, each with Queen beds, and a bathroom with a soaker tub and showerhead. On the lower level is an additional bedroom with two Queen beds, a full bathroom with a shower and tub, and the laundry room.

neighborhood_overview: In Lincoln Park, Chicago's motto urbs in horto—or "City in a Garden"—truly comes to life. Historic churches and handsome brick row houses nestled within landmark districts sit next to peaceful parks, while quiet, tree-lined residential areas give way to bustling business corridors.
transit: We're a 2 minute walk to the Fullerton Red/Brown/Purple line station - so close to the train that it goes right by the house! - and just steps to the Fullerton and Halsted buses, so you won't have any trouble getting around town without a car from here! If you do bring your car, however, there is street parking in the neighborhood.
host_about: Chicago native, enjoying everything that the amazing Chicago has to offer

name: Rogers Park/Loyola beach townhouse - free parking!
summary: Whether to build snowmen, run the lakefront trail, swim or sunbathe at the beach, or to visit friends/family, you will enjoy the location and tranquility of this airbnb.  Bright and spacious townhouse is just 1 minute or a door away (40 steps!) from parks and sandy beaches, short walking distance to Loyola University and many local restaurant gems, and a short 'L' or CTA ride to Northwestern University. Public transportation accessible - Red 'L' (train), bus stops/routes and bike sharing sites.
space: Guests love the space for its location, coziness, tranquility and proximity to the beach! Set your alarm clock early, grab a cup of coffee from the kitchen, and walk 1 min to catch the sunrise at the beach. Head back and prepare breakfast, or walk to the end of the block to a trendy local brunch spot.  The space is a two-bedroom townhouse with living room and dining room/kitchenette. There is a king-size bed, and two twin beds. All linens are included, as well as shower basics (soap, shampoo, and conditioner).  In the kitchen, there is a Keurig with complimentary pods - variety of coffee/tea, a microwave, and a small fridge.  Wifi and Netflix are included.

There is a king-size bed, and two twin beds. All linens are included, as well as shower basics (soap, shampoo, an
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Rogers Park, a wonderful, welcoming, vibrant and diverse neighborhood, home to over 120 restaurants, The Chicago Comedy Film Festival, The New 400 theaters, and to a community of artists and academics. There are bars, coffee shops, a local movie theater, stage productions for both kids and adults, as well as numerous summer festivals all within a short walk or train ride. Rogers Park is a tree-lined residential neighborhood, accessible by public transportation and very walkable. Convenience stores are within a couple blocks of the townhouse, and Morse Fresh Market is a 7 min walk, about 4 blocks away.
notes: Bring a sweater and sunglasses!  Also beach essentials if you fancy dipping into Lake Michigan. Please bring your own beach towels to the beach.  Chicago is the windy city, and our place is right by the beach. It tends to be cooler, be prepared as you’d want to take a walk through the park and enjoy magnificent views of Lake Michigan. There is no laundry on-site but Sudz Laundry is a short 3 min drive or 8 min walk (1425 W Morse Ave, Chicago, IL 60626). The front patio is also a walkway for our neighbors, please be mindful not to block or leave your personal belongings unattended.
transit: Free street parking and a reserved spot off alley (available on first come, first serve basis), CTA bus stop is a short block away and ‘L’ Morse stop is short 6 min walk.
access: The unit is completely private with it's own entrance. Only you and your fellow travelers will have access to the whole townhouse during your stay! You are steps away, only one minute walk through the walkway to Chicago Parks and sandy beaches.
interaction: Happy to help with anything you need, just give me a call or text.
house_rules: - Quiet Hours Daily 8 PM to 8 AM (Chicago City Noise Ordinance) - Keep all doors and windows closed when air conditioning or heat is running. - Trash cans must be emptied and trash bags must be deposited in cans in the alley.  - All furniture must be left in original position and location at check-out. - No wet swimsuits or clothes on any furniture. - No outside shoes to be worn in the house. - No food or drinks outside living and dining area(s). - Full check-out requirement list provided at time of booking. - Absolutely no pets or other animals allowed in our home or on our property. Violation will result in immediate, automatic charge of full security deposit. - Please respect our neighbors. Use only the front patio, and parking space, and leave the shared walkway unobstructed. - Our home and townhouse building is smoke-free. The Chicago Clean Indoor Air Ordinance (Chapter 7-32 of the Municipal Code of Chicago) prohibits smoking and the use of e-cigarettes in enclosed public places a
host_about: We’re Jay & Lis, a neat freak who is always on an adventure quest, and a super handy champ. Together, we are blessed with a brilliant-minded son and a very determined daughter.

notes: This is a garden unit, you may occasionally hear guests upstairs.

Clean any spills or stains immediately and notify host of anything you may not know how to clean  5. Keep the place tidy like you would your own home  6. Quiet noise level after 10 p.m. Parties not allowed.  7. Sleeping surfaces must have linen on them anytime they are in use (e.g. No drooling on the couch without proper sheets) 8. Have a great stay in Chicago, and don't overpay for things, just ask me and I'll share my secrets

I love to travel, I have visited about 30 countries, Chicago is still my favorite city. 

Let me know if you have questions about Pilsen, I was born and raised here.

name: Million Dollar Views! Luxury Downtown Skyhouse!
summary: Stunning, Floor to Ceiling Panoramic Skyline Views from this Spacious 3-Bedroom, 2.5 Bath Apartment in the Sky!  Located in Chicago's most exciting neighborhood: Downtown/West Loop/Fulton Market District, this High-End Apt is on Restaurant Row (all of Chicago's best restaurants and bars, such as Girl & The Goat, Au Cheval, Sawada Coffee, etc.) and just steps from the Tourist/Business Attractions (near Willis Tower).  Walk to Whole Foods. Garage Parking included (regular sized cars only).
space: This Million Dollar View, 1,300 square foot, 3Bed/2 and 1/2 Bath Apartment is perfect for Three Business travelers, 3 couples, or it can even accommodate up to 6 guests with 3 Queen-Sized Beds and 2 Air Mattresses in the bedrooms • Perks: Attached Garage with 1 parking space included, Living Room with 50" LCD TV, Dining Room with 4-person Table, Eat-In fully equipped Chef's Kitchen with all you need to Cook a Fantastic Home Meal (Whole Foods within Walking Distance too!) • Bedroom #1: Master Suite Luxury Oasis!  Floor-to-Ceiling Wall of Windows with Skyline Views. High-End, Queen-Sized Bed and Down Comforter & Feather/Down Pillows & Luxurious 500 Thread Count Sheets, & Large Master Bath with Double Sinks, and Huge Step-in Shower • Bedroom #2: Separate 2nd Bedroom.  Floor to Ceiling Stunning Views of the Cityscape. High-End, Queen Bed and Down Comforter with Feather Pillows & Luxurious 500 Thread Count Sheets • Bedroom #3: Private 3rd Bedroom. Floor to Ceiling Wall of Windows with Skyli

Located in Chicago's most exciting neighborhood: Downtown/West Loop/Fulton Market District, this High-End Apt is on Restaurant Row (all of Chicago's best restaurants and bars, such as Girl & The Goat, Au Cheval, Sawada Coffee, etc.) and just steps from the Tourist/Business Attractions (near Willis Tower). neighborhood_overview: Chicago's West Loop is the city's newest hot spot. Many of Chicago's best restaurants (Au Cheval, Girl & The Goat, Ronero, The Lunatic The Lover & The Poet Wine Bar, RM Champagne Lounge, Bad Hunter, Maude's, Soho House, Avec, etc.) are just outside your door on Restaurant Row. Safe, easy to walk around and super close to downtown with lots of amenities, the West Loop is an ideal spot to locate yourself while visiting Chicago. Quick walk to Mariano's and Whole Foods grocery stores and Walgreens Pharmacy.
notes: Not your average AirBNB!! This apartment is a luxury oasis in the heart of Chicago's West Loop neighborhood (hottest neighborhood in Chicago).  If you're looking for space to enjoy and relax with all the comforts of home, search no further, this luxury condo is for you and your group!  Strategically located in the heart of Chicago's Downtown/West Loop neighborhood, you'll have no trouble reaching the hottest destinations in Chicago via foot, cab, uber, or bike. Kitchen is fully equipped, feel free to use anything you need (including pots & pans, toaster, dishwasher, coffee maker, tea kettle, etc.) Light groceries are also included (including coffee, tea, spices, oils, etc.) The dining area offers a beautiful table that seats 4 or feel free to share a meal at the eat-in kitchen. The bathrooms are fully stocked with all the essentials (shampoo, conditioner, soap, & fluffy clean towels and washcloths, etc.) Guests will have access to a full-size, in unit washer & dryer (don't pack deterge
transit: Apartment conveniently located near the highway with garage parking attached to the building. No oversized vehicles please! $5-7 taxi ride to Magnificent Mile. Steps away from the Halsted bus stop. 4 minute walk to Union Station. 7 minute walk to Clinton Blue line which will take you to O'Hare, Wicker Park, Bucktown, or other downtown CTA stops where you can transfer to other lines and get practically anywhere in the city. 10 minute walk to downtown CTA loop (Brown Line, Red Line, Green Line, Orange Line, etc.) or Sears tower. Divvy (public bike sharing) station just down the street.
access: Guests have Private Access to the Entire Apartment.  Parking for 1 regular-sized car is included in your reservation (mid-sized SUV or regular sized minivan is the max....OVERSIZED VEHICLES WILL NOT FIT).  If you have an oversized vehicle or extra vehicles, there is plenty of parking available for purchase in neighboring lots.  Ask your host about apps for discounted parking.
interaction: I almost always meet guests in person to give a quick tour of the home, answer any questions, and give recommendations if requested. After that, I am available on an as needed basis, just a quick phone call or text away if anything comes up or if you need a tip on the best place to have dinner, go shopping, see a game/show, or the best way to get from here to there.
house_rules: Besides asking that you to treat our lovely home as you would your own, we ask you to follow these basic house rules: • ABSOLUTELY NO PARTIES! (this means no loud music and no extra guests/visitors beyond those included in your reservation and airbnb guest count) • No smoking (of anything)...Smoking anywhere in the building or on the roof deck will result in immediate removal from the property without refund and forfeiture of security deposit. • The doorman/concierge service is for residents only. As a guest, please do not utilize the doorman's services. • Please do not mail items to the apartment.  We cannot accept packages at the building.  If you require mail service during your stay, please reach out in advance for instructions. • No Filming, Film Crews, or Professional Productions without authorization • No unauthorized guests/occupants other than those included in your airbnb guest count • No illegal substances or activities • Please report damage or problems with the home immedi
host_about: As a native Chicagoan and a seasoned traveler myself, I understand how important each vacation stay is for my guests. I like to give extra service to make their stay special. I love to travel and discover new places...but the most important things to me are family, friends, and home. What I can't live without: my passport, Italian food, French wine, and strong coffee!

name: Conservatory Gem
summary: This historic Chicago gem is located just steps from the Garfield Park Conservatory and a five minute walk to the train.  Centrally located, this house gives you quick access to all Chicago has to offer via elevated train.  This 19th century home boasts original woodwork and decor with all the updated amenities you’d  want on vacation.  Safe and welcoming, this house will make your time in Chicago a relaxing time to remember!
space: This 110 year old home boasts hardwood floors, stained glass windows, modern appliances and large fenced in yard.  With three bedrooms and a full size pull out ouch this space will easily sleep and accommodate 8 people comfortably.  Given the historical / delicate nature of this property we request there be no parties.  Any additional guests above and beyond the approved booking must be approved by host as well.  Also, now that 2020 is upon us here in Chicago, recreational marijuana is finally available, accessible, and mostly legal.  That being said we respectfully ask that you enjoy this freedom on the porch the same as tobacco and vape products.  With the recent COVID-19 (Corona Virus) we want to reassure our guests that between each guest all surfaces and dishware are thoroughly cleaned and disinfected.  Furthermore, all of our sheets and linens are laundered using only perfume and dye free detergent.

Centrally located, this house gives you quick access to all Chicago has to offer via elevated train. Also, now that 2020 is upon us here in Chicago, recreational marijuana is finally available, accessible, and mostly legal.  That being said we respectful
neighborhood_overview: The East Garfield Park neighborhood is an evolving artist community that has a rich and complex history.  Like many urban environments certain areas are better than others and warrant slightly more awareness than others.  Let there be no doubt, you are definitely in a large and diverse urban environment which can be shocking at times to those who've never experienced such an experience.  The area surrounding this home however is very safe and welcoming.  Questions regarding tooling around the neighborhood can be answered by your hosts.
notes: We are very fortunate to have such a vintage property and take great care to maintain its authentic charm.  We ask that you treat and respect the unit with care and respect.   That being said we ask that there be no parties or guests not listed in your reservation.   Also, Illinois is now a recreational marijuana state, we ask that there be smoking of any products including vape inside the unit.  Guests are free to step out front or onto the lovely back porch to partake in any smoking.  Access to the home is easiest via Uber/Lyft, cab or Green Line train.  If utilizing the Green Line exit at Central Park and enjoy a safe and beautiful walk north past the Garfield Park Conservatory.  Our home is located just 3 short blocks north of the Green Line stop at Central Park.
transit: The easiest mode of transportation into the city is the Green Line train at Central Park.  The station is only a 5 minute walk and the train ride only 10-15 additional.  This ride also affords visitors an elevated view of the beautiful city and surrounding area.
access: This three bedroom one bath unit is on the second floor and require a climb up roughly 20 stairs.  Large windows throughout the home offer ample natural light and varying views of the surrounding neighborhood.  All parts of the unit and yard are open and accessible to tenants.
interaction: We live on the first floor and are very sociable and knowledgeable about the city.  Nearly always available for bonfires or questions about the city.
house_rules: Chicago weather can be beautiful and brutal sometimes all in the same day.  Given the age and beauty of this home we ask that you avoid tracking the elements in with you.  Spaces for shoes, coats and umbrellas are available at each door for your convenience.   The yard and space are very welcoming for entertaining.  Leave the dishes and laundry to us!!  You’re here to relax let us handle the rest.
host_about: Native Chicagoan and veteran Chicago Police officer who has searched out all the known and little known nooks and crannies of this amazing, historic city.

name: 中唐【302】Chinatown

name: Walk to Little Italy from a Placid Townhouse Apartment
summary: Kick back in a comfy daybed as light from bay windows washes over the exposed brick of a decorative fireplace across the room. Featuring satin wood floors, subdued decor, and a front porch sitting area, this cozy townhouse makes for a laid-back stay.
space: - 1100 sq. ft. on the 1st Floor (access via stairs - no elevator)  - Two Bed Two Bath  - Three separate beds + air mattress available upon request. - Two separate Living Areas - Modern Kitchen with all appliances.  - High speed internet + basic cable + Netflix provided.  - Access to backyard - equipped with loungers, picnic table and gas grill.  - One covered parking spot in detached garage.
description: Kick back in a comfy daybed as light from bay windows washes over the exposed brick of a decorative fireplace across the room. Featuring satin wood floors, subdued decor, and a front porch sitting area, this cozy townhouse makes for a laid-back stay.
neighborhood_overview: This home is set along the quiet, tree-lined streets of the Tri-Taylor area with Livingston Park and Claremont Park within walking distance. Steps away are the restaurants on Taylor Street. Little Italy's eateries are six blocks away.
notes: There are other residents living in the building. So please plan on observing and respecting the quiet hours. Your neighbors below are a family with school going kids. So if you plan to stay up late and make a night of it, these may not be suitable accommodations for your needs.
transit: To get to/from Downtown Chicago, you can take the Blue Line train (the Western Blue Line train stop is a 10 min walk), or the Pink Line (Polk Stop - 15 min walk) or the 157 Bus (bus stop is 2 mins away). All these will take you right into downtown, and the Michigan Ave. area in about 30 minutes or less (total travel time including walking). Also nearby is the 12 Bus which takes you to the Little Italy and onwards to the lake and Museum Campus (Field Museum, Shedd Acquarium and Adler Planetarium are right here). This is also the south end of Chicago downtown. Of course - there is also Uber etc - it is $10 - 15 from downtown, so if you sharing a ride, then it is not that much more vis a vis the public transportation option.
access: The entire 1st floor - including the patio at the back.
interaction: I live 30 mins away - I am usually there to check you in, and available as needed.
house_rules: - Quite Hours After 11 PM
host_about: World traveler and food lover.

name: 2 Bed MCM 1 Block to Fullerton Red line L & Garage
summary: Express Red line (also Purple & Brown lines) 1 block away!  Resident manager in 4-unit brownstone built just after the great Fire. Tastefully furnished with Mid Century Modern pieces for Mad Men Vibe. . Modern granite kitchen, central  heat & AC, brick wall,  hardwood floors, wifi, cable and laundry in building..  On a quiet side street in Lincoln Park, Chicago’s premiere neighborhood  with many  bars & shops. Close to the Loop, Grant Park, the lakefront. Grill on the building's deck.
space: This apartment is charming with hardwood floors and exposed brick walls, but also modern with a granite kitchen, dishwasher and central heat and A/C. Cotton linens and towels; hair dryer; and kitchen supplies (cookware, coffee maker, dishes, etc provided. Secure high-speed wireless Internet; cable; and a 47” flat screen TV.  Shared building amenities include an equipped outdoor garage roof deck with gas grill, a small fenced-in back yard, and laundry room. The Fullerton L stop (this is a main station with Brown, Purple and Red Line service). is only a block away. In addition, we have a walk score of 95! Walk 1.5 mi North or take the Red Line 2 short stops to Wrigley Field.  The Halsted bus 3 blocks away will bring you to Greek Town and the Stadium for concerts, Blackhawks and Bulls games. The Fullerton bus on the corner will whisk you to the lakefront, Lincoln Park Zoo,. Wicker Park and Bucktown are easy to access by bus or a short cab ride. If you’ve brought a car, we will provide you

If you smoke outside, you must clean up your cigarette butts or be charged $80 per incident for management to clean.  We provide cleaning products and offer cleaning. The cleaning charge included here  is for a basic cleaning of a unit that has been regularly cleaned. You agree to keep the unit clean and further agree to pay $80 per hour for cleaning of items like food spilled in the fridge/microwave/toaster over and mold in the shower,. transit: The Red Line is one block away with express service to the Loop taking only 12 minutes.
access: Once you book, you need to send me your email address so I can email you arrival instructions. I typically send arrival instructions a day or 2 before your arrival.  We use keypads and key boxes, making check in a breeze. No need to meet with anyone - just bring your check-in information with you or access it from your phone.  We ask that guests arrive before 11pm if possible to avoid disturbing other residents in the building. Normal check in is 3pm or later. We will attempt to accommodate requests for early arrivals but if other guests left the same day, you will likely be allowed to drop off your things to allow the unit to be cleaned.  We ask that guests arrive before 11pm if possible to avoid disturbing other residents in the building. If you cannot arrive during these hours, please tell me in advance. If you are arriving in the early morning or late evening, PLEASE do so quietly - no talking in the hall - as people are likely sleeping.  Departure is by 11am. Later departures will
interaction: If live in California, but I have an onsite manager who can handle most issues during reasonable hours. If it is 2am Chicago time and you have locked yourself out of the building, please call me.  For non-emergencies, please send a message through the system or call/text. If you are contacting me, please remember that California is 2 hours behind Chicago.
house_rules: A pet fee is charged for all pets. If you have any question about this, please ask prior to booking. Otherwise, a change request will be sent to you for the pet fee. Pet fees range from $70 to 100. THERE IS A LOST KEY CHARGE OF $200. No smoking in the unit. Evidence of smoking in the building or a failure to dispose of all smoking materials for smoking outdoors will result in the SURRENDER OF YOUR SECURITY DEPOSIT TO CLEAN UP THE UNIT/BUILDING/EXTERIOR. No loud TV or music after 10pm inside the building. Chicago Noise Curfew is in effect from 11pm until 7am.  Neighbors will call the police so please be respectful. No more than 3 additional people permitted at the property at any time during your stay. If you have a pet with you, you must clean up after it.  You are responsible for your possessions and property at all times during your stay.  Please purchase traveler's insurance if you will have expensive electronics or other items with you as they are not covered by the building insura
host_about:
Travel is fun and exciting but can be hard on the wallet.  It doesn't have to be that way.  Email if you have questions, especially if your requested dates are in the near term and I will do my best to work with you!

Having spent more time than I care to remember in sterile, uninviting hotel rooms, I was initially attracted to vacation rentals as refreshing, and often more affordable, alternatives.  What I found were the same white walls and beige furniture or, even worse, cluttered rooms and Aunt Edna's donated dilapidated couch in the living room.  Well, welcome to something different.  Take a break from your busy schedule by relaxing in clean, inviting rental that that feels enough like home that you're immediately comfortable while being so special you'll look forward to your return.  Many of my guests have been back 2 or 3 times, and some have found themselves venturing across the country to check out another Red Hot Vacation Rental.  

My places are located in Chicago, Miami Beach and San Francisco. I've lived in all 3 cities and am happy to suggest hidden local gems or recommend the best nearby dry cleaner.

name: JWLVR| “That Kool Aid Suite” in the Loop
summary: That Kool Aid Suite, brings you back to childhood. The suite is just as sweet as your mother used to make it. This is a historic building that has been reimagined. Once you walk into the building you will feel like it gave you a hug and whispered in your ear “you are home now”. In fact just say “Alexa I’m home!” And instantly all the lights will come on and music will start to play. It’s completely immersive and visceral. Help us pay homage to history, and taste the sweetness! See you soon

house_rules: ABSOLUTELY NO PARTIES  Only guests included in the reservation are allowed on the premises at all times, even if they are just visiting Please Remove your shoes upon entering  Please wash any dishes used (there is a dishwasher with free pods) Please empty all trash cans at Checkout (there is a garbage chute on the same floor)  Please adhere to Check in and Check out times, if you need special provisions please request at time of booking.
host_about:
J&W L.V.R Firm is a branch of Michael Feldstein and Associates which was founded in 1918. by Solomon Janeski and his brother in law Ethan Winterberg 
and has long been a leading financial institution in Chicago, Illinois.

When the stock market crashed in 1929, sparking the Great Depression, it was Ethan Winterberg’s firm belief in personal client service, financial conservatism, and business acumen that allowed J&W L.V.R to survive the crash. To this day, these tenets remain etched into J&W L.V.R’s foundation and serve as the pillars of our business. 

Over the years, as many competing firms went out of business, the Winterbergs made many decisions with an eye towards improving client service and firm stability. These included utilizing specialized clearing firms for improved account service and safety, closing the futures brokerage division, and spinning off the trading operation. 

Today, we have expanded to include such ventures as Airbnb, starting with our first unit located a couple of blocks away for the magnificent mile, and the lake front. This unit has breath taking views of downtown Chicago, with many more units on the horizon. Our service is unparalleled, please reach out to one of our our property managers at any time, about anything during your stay. Thank you for investing in us as we invest into you!

neighborhood_overview: We're located in Lakeview, one of Chicago's safest and most popular neighborhoods. Most of the area's restaurants, bars, and shops are concentrated on Belmont Ave,  Sheffield Ave, Clark St, Broadway St, and Halsted St. There are also plenty of hidden gems and tucked-away spots to discover for those who like to wander. THINGS TO DO NEARBY ✔ Walk to Wrigleyville and catch a Cub's game. ✔ Admire the Chicago skyline from the Lakefront Trail. ✔ Catch a live show at the Vic Theatre. ✔ Choose from over 300 beers at Beermiscuous.
notes: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS 1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?” Directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. We're a short walk from the Belmont 'L' train station. Search for “Belmont Red Line station Chicago” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest. 2. “Is there parking nearby?” Parking in Chicago is often difficult and even more so in the evening and during special events. We recommend using a service called SpotHero because it allows you to reserve a nearby paid parking spot in advance so that you don’t have to worry about finding parking when you arrive. 3. When is check-in/check-out? Check-in is 3 p.m. or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room. Check-out is at 11 a.m. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11 a.m., but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up
transit: Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber. ￫ The Belmont Red/Brown Line 'L' train station is a 5-minute walk away. ￫ O'Hare is 55 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber. ￫ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.
access: Your room is your own private space and the rest of the apartment is shared.
interaction: WHY STAY WITH TROVE? ⭐ Fast Communication We’re always on call to answer your questions, typically within 30 minutes. ⭐ Experienced Hosts We’ve hosted thousands of guests over five years. ⭐ Exclusive Perks Trove Guests have access to the Metropolitan Club, located in the Willis Tower. ⭐ Easy Self-Check-In Keyless access means no keys for you manage during your stay! ⭐ Central Location You’ll never be far from local spots to check out, sights to see, and public transit.
house_rules: 1) Only the reservation holder and guests added to the reservation via Airbnb may have access to the apartment.   2) As a courtesy to any other guests who you might be sharing the apartment with, please clean up after yourself immediately in the common areas. 3) As a courtesy to your fellow guests and to your neighbors, please keep noise to a minimum, especially between 9 pm - 9 am. 4) This is a non-smoking apartment. If smoke is detected, a cleaning fee of $150 will be charged. 5) No late check-outs. Check-out is at 11 am.  In order to compensate our cleaning assistants for lost time, additional charges will be sent if they're unable to begin their job at 11 am. One hour or less - $25 Each additional hour - $40 6) Damaged/stained/missing towels, bedding, and/or furnishings will incur additional fees. The per-item fees are as follows: Bedsheet- $12 Towel - $12 Pillow - $30 Pillowcase: $10 Comforter - $50 Clothes hangers - $3 Furnishings - Dependant on item
host_about: We're excited to join the Airbnb community! Our children have been using it for years and we recently started hosting.  I'm an attorney and my wife Patricia is an accountant. We love cooking, grilling in the summer, and spending time with our children and grandchildren.

summary: Live like a Chicago local in this 2 Bedroom/2 Bath apartment in Streeterville. Make the most of your stay with new, modern amenities such as the rooftop lounge area and the fitness center. Here you’ll find all the comforts of home: full kitchen, custom artwork, and furnishings curated to reflect the beauty of the Windy City.
space: Chicago Registration Number: Pending For stays over 30 days, we require additional personal information and a signed License Agreement in order to accommodate the stay. All guests will be required to verify their information which includes a 3rd-party background check. This is to ensure your safety as well as the safety and well being of our neighbors and our homes. All information is confidential and will not be shared with anyone for any purposes outside of your reservation. Once all information is verified, we will be able to confirm your reservation. However, we reserve the right to cancel a reservation if you fail to comply or there is a failed background check. Please be aware that an additional deposit of $100 per reservation will be held during the period of your stay and released back within 7 days after check-out to cover any incidentals that may occur at the property. Please reach out to our team if there are any questions and or concerns.

host_about:
I'm an educated professional single guy, born & raised in Bombay and Chicago veteran for 22 years now. I come from a very hospitality oriented culture and family, so love hosting, entertaining, and meeting new people from all over the world and learning about them and their culture. I love traveling and make friends wherever I go.

I like good meals, dining out, craft beers, coffee, music, love cooking, dancing, culinary trips and traveling in general.  I recently took a year off to travel and covered 19 countries, which makes it 34 & counting. Occasional home brewer. My friends consider me a roaming Chicago GPS & guide to food & bar scene.

I look forward to hosting you in my humble abode.

name: Industrial Style Chicago Loft with FREE parking
summary: Enjoy Chicago in this beautifully renovated one bedroom loft with a chic, industrial vibe. Drink your morning coffee on the private outdoor deck or sleep in late on the California king sized bed. The loft’s lovely art deco ceiling, exposed brick walls and free Netflix are just some of the great features you’ll love. Free parking is included and you’ll be just a 10 minute drive from catching a game at Wrigley Field as well as a 15-20 minute drive to the airport and main downtown attractions.
space: Welcome to our brand new retreat in the city. This loft was designed and remodeled to perfection taking into consideration every detail you need to enjoy your vacation in Chicago. Featuring a private outdoor deck and an entertaining area with a smart TV. The fully equipped kitchen offers stainless steel appliances such as stovetop and oven, microwave and full-sized refrigerator as well as basic cooking tools and supplies. The dining table by the window is perfect for a couple’s breakfast. In the bedroom you will find an extremely comfortable california king sized bed with a memory foam mattress and clean sheets. The pampering bathroom features a large shower with a rainfall shower head, a hair-dryer as well as complimentary toiletries and clean towels. Additional amenities include self-controlled A/C and closet space with hangers, an iron and ironing board. This loft is very well kept, professionally cleaned and sanitized after each and every use.

neighborhood_overview: Set between South Old Irving and Kilbourn parks, the building lies in one of Chicago's most interesting historical neighborhoods. The loft is not far from Logan Square and the area features many great local restaurants and bars.
transit: The quickest and most inexpensive way to get around is via Uber or Lyft. If reaching the apartment by vehicle, you will receive a link with instructions on how to access the free parking garage after you book. Public Transportation guide to the apartment: From Chicago O'Hare Int'l Airport: Take the Blue Train line to Irving Park Station and then transfer to the CTA #53 Milwaukee bus line to reach the apartment. You can also take the Blue Train line to Jefferson Park Station and then transfer to the CTA #56 Milwaukee bus line to reach the apartment. To/From Downtown Chicago: The CTA #56 Milwaukee bus is a very convenient and direct way to reach the Downtown Chicago Loop with a station just below the apartment. To/From Wrigley Field: Easily catch a game via the 77 or 152 buses, with a station just close by the apartment. Train and bus maps can be found and downloaded here:  (Website hidden by Airbnb)
access: When booking this loft you will have full and private access to the entire unit, including a private outdoor deck you are welcome to use. For your convenience, we have arranged luggage drop-off/storage before and after your stay at the restaurant right down stairs - do note this is a courtesy. Our check-in and check-out process is automatic and seamless, once you book you will receive a private entry code ahead of your stay. You will also be provided with the access code to your free parking spot garage. Check-in any time after 3 pm as late as you'd like, check-out on or before 11 am. Due to our cleaning schedule we cannot accommodate early check-ins or late check-outs.
interaction: We want to make sure you have the most convenient and easy check-in experience possible. There is no need to meet in person in order to enter the property, access is via self check-in. Once booked, you will be e-mailed detailed instructions for your seamless check-in process and house manual. During your stay this e-mail can help with questions such as the wifi password and other general property-related FAQ. If this has not covered your questions, and you still need to reach us for any reason, we are readily available for questions or concerns via Airbnb messaging. Of course in case of emergency you can always reach us via phone call.
house_rules: If you are a smoker please smoke only on the balcony while closing the windows and door behind you to avoid smoke going into the unit. Check-in is any time after 3 pm as late as you'd like, check-out on or before 11 am. Due to the cleaning schedule we cannot accommodate early check-ins or late check-outs. If necessary, we have arranged luggage drop-off/storage before and after your stay.

name: ❤️$2250 Great Offer! Spacious Glamorous 2BR Condo
summary: A fully furnished home for your longer stay, complete with WiFi and everything you need to live. AFFORDABLE MONTHLY RATES ARE AVAILABLE!!! APRIL - $2250 MAY - $2800 Welcome to Windy City! Your next home away from home, you will absolutely love the location, the space, and the unique architecture.
space: The unit is on the 3rd floor of the building. It is two flights of stairs up from the main entrance. This 3-bedroom apartment can comfortably sleep 6, with three private bedrooms, each features a queen-size bed each. The apartment includes one full bathroom, with a shower, sink, and toilet. We’re all about helping you look (and smell) your best, so we provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in addition to hand soap and fluffy towels. Trust us when we say there’s no better way to warm up after a Windy City walk than a hot shower! There’s ample space for guests to relax on the sofa and watch on a large flat-screen TV. Like the rest of the unit, you’ll live it up in luxury among hardwood floors and contemporary decor. The entire place has free, fast WiFi and Chicago sunshine streaming in through the windows. Whether you’re craving a home-cooked meal or just somewhere to put the box of deep-dish, our kitchen is fully stocked with cookware, dishes, utensils, and has swanky granite count

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a very peaceful community and very walkable- most errands can be accomplished on. It is also near public transport.  Completely a vibrant and colorful experience as this is home to a diversified international offerings, a melting pot of culture that blend in together as a community. Devon Avenue is popular to locals and travellers alike to have that taste of Indian & Pakistani home grown delicacies and the feel of the marketplace shopping for clothing, fabrics and international grocers. The closest grocery stores are ALDI, Ted's Fresh Market and Nohadra Grocery. Nearby coffee shops include Starbucks, Starbucks and Art Zone Cafe. Nearby restaurants include Gogi, Burger Hub and Yeowoosai. The unit is also near Green Briar Park, Mather Park and Chippewa Park. You should not miss a visit to Talman West Ridge Bungalow Historic District, where local architects began experimenting with form and style to create bungalows that are unique to Chicago. Do some outdoor adventure
notes: -The owner lives in the groundfloor. -Please be aware If you lose the key and entry fob, which is your access to the entire building, it cannot be replaced for you immediately and you may lose access to the apartment unit and all amenities until another one can be made. There is a $300 fee for losing key and entry fob. -All guests need to be attentive to the house rules during their stay, as there are other tenants in the property. -All guests need to be attentive to the house rules during their stay as there are other tenants at the property. -Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay -Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request. -We have duvet covers on our bedding (no top sheets). -If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away. -Security Deposit maybe required on the following bookings: 1) Last minute bookin
transit: Unless you’re really fond of meters or parallel parking, we recommend using public transportation to explore the Chicago area. Parking is easy during the day but difficult at night. There is a metered parking one block away from the building but you have to get the car at 8am to avoid getting towed.
access: Our place is yours and only yours during your stay. We do ask that you respect our neighbors by keeping noise to a reasonable level.
interaction: This unit does NOT have a designated parking space. Street parking can be easy during the day but gets limited at night. There is a metered parking one block away from the building. Must be mindful of the street signs to avoid fines and tows.
house_rules: HOUSE RULES Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking: -No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250). -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. - The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am. -Lost key fee - $300 -Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc. -Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc. -Smoking - $300 -Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300 **-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat,  an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.

neighborhood_overview: The Lakeview neighborhood and Wrigleyville / Boystown areas have so much within walking distance, you won't want to leave! There are numerous bakeries, boutique stores, theaters, and lively bars and restaurants. If you do feel like venturing out of the neighborhood, Lakeview is very centrally located. Head south to visit Lincoln Park, River North, and the Loop, or west to visit Buck Town or Logan square. Both public transit and Uber/Lyft are great ways to get around.
notes: GUESTS Only those on the reservation are permitted in the unit/room. BEDROOM LOCKS All 3 bedrooms may be locked from the inside but do not have keys to be locked from the outside. We do provide combination locks for your bedroom closet and you'll be given the code at check-in to securely store your belongings. COURTESY  Please note this unit is on a quiet residential street. We respect our neighbors, and for that reason the building's outdoor space is not for socializing, and instead we request guests socialize indoors only. We request quiet hours from 9pm-8am. CLEANING  We expect guests to clean up after themselves in shared spaces. For example, throw away any trash, rinse coffee maker after use, wipe down bathroom sink/kitchen counter after use, etc. We also request that personal bathroom items are kept in your bedroom when not in use. This keeps the shared spaces clean for all guests.
transit: PARKING Free, public street parking is available in the area. Some streets require a permit, and others do not. We offer permits at the unit for a small fee. Please note you may have to circle the block a few times to find a spot. If you prefer paid parking with a designated spot, I recommend using Spot-Hero to find nearby options that work for you. Once you're here, public transportation and/or Uber are the easiest ways to get around the city. CLOSEST STOPS o Addison red train: .3 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o Belmont purple/brown train stop: .6 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o 77, 8, 36 bus and more to go up/downtown or east/west Stations all have machines that sell Ventra passes (name of provider). You can also purchase Ventra cards at Walgreens. You can either purchase a single ride ticket, a re-loadable Ventra card, or an unlimited pass (1, 3, or 7 days). Multiple people may share a re-loadable card and fares will be deducted for each person; however, the unlimited passes can not
access: In addition to your PRIVATE ROOM, you have use of the kitchen, living room, dining room, bathroom, and building's basement laundry room (all SHARED spaces). KEYS  There is self-entry with key pad anytime from 4pm on.  A set of keys will be in your room. CENTRAL HEAT/AC The unit has central heat/AC with a thermostat within the unit. The temperature is kept between 65-70 degrees for the comfort of all guests. (Website hidden by Airbnb) LAUNDRY The building has a washer and dryer in the basement that's shared by all apartments. Each costs $1.50 and accepts quarters. PUBLIC TRANSIT The closet train stop is the Addison red line. There are also many bus stops. We provide additional info about public transit upon booking. interaction: My goal is to ensure you have the most enjoyable and comfortable stay in Chicago. I have a detailed guest guidebook (emailed in advance and printed in unit) that includes info about the apt, neighborhood, and city to help maximize your time in the city. If you'd like additional assistance with anything, I'm more than happy to help! Depending on my work travel schedule, I may or may not be in town; however, I'm always accessible via phone or email for any questions that arise.

If it's more than what fits in the trash can, p
host_about:
I began using Airbnb as a traveler in the fall of 2013, and I'm hooked! Staying in someone's home allows you to experience the area in a truly authentic way - no more hotels for me! As of May 2014, I began hosting in Chicago and have since hosted thousands of guests from around the world. I love helping others make the most of their visits. 

As a host, I am personable, responsive, and detail-oriented. I take great pride in the comfort and cleanliness of each apartment. You can trust that when staying in any one of our properties, you will feel at home.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in the neighborhood of Lincoln Park. It is full of historic churches and brick row houses. Tree-lined residential areas give way to bustling businesses. Armitage Avenue is lined with independent boutiques and high-end retailers; Clark Street is packed with casual cafes, ethnic restaurants, and sweet shops. In addition to shopping and dining, Lincoln Park is a diverse art and entertainment destination. There is a plethora of museums, top theaters, and live music clubs to pick from. Also, there is plenty of natural beauty and outdoor scenery to enjoy. The neighborhood's namesake park is a sprawling 1,208 acres of green space with a zoo, nature museum, and conservatory. Head over to the lakefront beaches, where sand and surf are set against a backdrop of downtown skyscrapers. Being a 15 minute train ride from the Loop, Lincoln Park is a very close commute to the city’s primary business district.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $350 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Chic Home! Walk to Nightlife-Comedy-Restaurants!
summary: Stay in the heart of Chicago Old Town! This bright, cool & comfortable one bedroom & one bath is decked out in mid century modern furniture, exposed brick, new appliances & has a true city feeling! It comfortably sleeps two (3rd person can sleep on the couch), just 2 blocks to Lincoln Park, and 3 blocks to the famous Second City & stellar Old Town bars. Not to mention a quick 5 minute Uber ride to river north district (downtown Chicago)!

name: ♥Modern & Chic 3BR | Fireplace+Netflix+Parking♥
summary: This home has a modern, ultra-cool feel with the comforts of a luxury property. Plush memory foam beds, fireplace, Netflix, free parking, a ton of natural light, spa-like bathroom with super soft towels and the list goes on! If you want a comfortable and spacious spot that's walking distance to Wrigley Field, near the train, and a short 15-minute cab ride to Chicago's best landmarks, this home is for you.
space: The home is designed with every type of traveler in mind. Whether you're in Chicago on business, having fun with friends, or vacationing with family, you'll love this universal home. Business travelers can enjoy awesome high-speed internet and use the large communal table with great natural light as a work station. Groups of friends love the giant living/dining room for catching up over a drink and the full brand new kitchen to prepare a great meal. For traveling families and little ones, we have a pack 'n play along with a changing mat. We always strive to provide an exceptional experience.

neighborhood_overview: Just 5 miles from downtown, Roscoe Village is a charming, laidback “village within the city” filled with casual taverns, independent shops, and cute cafes that spill out onto the sidewalks during the warm weather months. This cozy little pocket is an eclectic mix of unique boutiques, classic frame and brick homes, and locally owned eateries. It’s a wonderfully welcoming and quirky place. Case in point: popular comfort food spot Kitsch’n on Roscoe, where you can enjoy your brunch with a side of ’70’s-style kitsch. Check out Le Sud’s rooftop patio, where you can soak in the sun and laidback vibes with some French Mediterranean dishes. Come evening, head to Constellation, where you’ll find some of the city’s most progressive jazz, contemporary classical, and improvised music, founded by local drummer and Pitchfork Music Festival’s talent buyer. Shop a vintage clothing goldmine at Shangri-La Vintage. Get a free tasting on Sundays at Lush Wine & Spirits. Enjoy seasonal small plates and an a
notes: Our team takes great pride in maintaining the highest standards of cleanliness and hygiene. We are continuously monitoring the development of COVID-19 (Coronavirus). Our number one priority is the well-being, health, and safety of our guests. As a result, we have taken additional measures developed in consultation with global and local public health authorities (including the WHO and CDC) to make our cleaning and hygiene protocols even more rigorous. This includes, but is not limited to, the following: ➜ Disinfecting every part of the home with quick-acting antibacterial spray. Our team wipes down all interior/exterior door handles, kitchen appliances, all surfaces, all moveable items like remote control, and all light switches. ➜ Washing the floor and tile with antibacterial soap. ➜ Installing an air-purifier system in the unit. Couple of things to note: ✪ This home comes with a private tandem two car parking space. ✪ Street parking is free and super easy all year round. ✪ Coin-operat
transit: By foot: *1 block to Roscoe Street’s fun bars and restaurants *0.6 miles to Chicago’s newest and largest Whole Foods *1 mile to a Cubs game and Wrigleyville's nightlife *1.7 miles to Regal Cinema theater *2.4 miles to Lake Michigan, Belmont Harbor, and  the jogging trail By train: *Paulina-Lincoln/Roscoe Brown Line: short 7-minute walk *Armitage Avenue shopping: 6 stops @ Armitage stop *River North nightlife: 9 stops @ Merchandise Mart stop *State & Michigan Avenue shopping: 10 stops @ State / Lake *Loop: 10 stops @ Washington / Wells By Uber: *15-minute ride to the Loop and Millenium Park *20-minute ride to McCormick Place
access: You have the entire home to yourself. Guests traveling in larger groups can have personal smart lock access issued to each person. This way everyone in the group can securely come in and out of the home at their convenience.
interaction: I’m always available to make sure your stay is nothing less than 5-Stars. I can be reached by text or phone, and always available to answer a question or handle an issue.
house_rules: *No parties and no drugs of any kind. We appreciate you respecting our neighbors. *Pets are subject to breed restrictions and pet fees: 1st pet: $200 per reservation for up to 2 nights and $50 per night after.  2nd pet: $150 per reservation for up to 2 nights and $50 per night after. Pets are not allowed on the couch nor beds. Any damages to home furniture or accessories are subject to fees.

name: Sonder | 943 Crosby | Beautiful 1BR
summary: We want everyone to have a comfortable place to stay. Our digital check-in and the ability to manage your stay from our app, means you won't need to interact with anyone in person. Our staff has been trained in proper disinfection techniques and will deep clean your Sonder before and after your stay. We're here for you during this time of uncertainty and can be reached 24/7 via text or call. Named the most innovative travel company of 2019 by Fast Company, Sonder has hosted a million guests in 5,000+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.   - 24/7 support via text, email, or phone   - Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided   - Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive   - Self check-in

neighborhood_overview: Known as one of Chicago’s most livable and walkable neighborhoods, Near North is the place to be for endless shopping, dining, and entertainment. Fill your day by wandering along the famous Magnificent Mile, admiring the city skyline at the Chicago River, or simply enjoying a drink on one of the many rooftops. From sun up to sun down, the lively streets of this neighborhood are bustling with people.
notes: Vacation Rental License No.: (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) There’s no cable. We’ve provided an HDMI cord for streaming.
house_rules: House Rules 1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance. 2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival. 3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses. 4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city. 5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages. 6. Commercial photography/videogr
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

name: Secret City Garden 2 Blocks 2 Train
summary: Whipple is a unique wonder. It's an artist compound in the middle of the urban west. There is a 15,000 square foot private garden. Wander through the wisteria, meditate or cook out. Picture SoHo in the 70's. Walk 2 train and be downtown in 10 minutes
space: This is such an unusual location.  312 Whipple is an artist community that has been thriving and feeding the Chicago Art Scene for 25 years.  It's a gem tucked secretly in a secure gated block with access to an unprecedented amount of outdoor space.  The gardens alone are enchanting.  Visit some authentic artist studios or catch an exhibit if you can!
description: Whipple is a unique wonder. It's an artist compound in the middle of the urban west. There is a 15,000 square foot private garden. Wander through the wisteria, meditate or cook out. Picture SoHo in the 70's. Walk 2 train and be downtown in 10 minutes This is such an unusual location.  312 Whipple is an artist community that has been thriving and feeding the Chicago Art Scene for 25 years.  It's a gem tucked secretly in a secure gated block with access to an unprecedented amount of outdoor space.  The gardens alone are enchanting.  Visit some authentic artist studios or catch an exhibit if you can! 15,000 square feet of amazing urban wild.  Grill out or just relax.  We're a quick walk to Chicago's shared bike program called DIVY.  There is free, secure, gated parking on the premises.  The Kedzie Green Line station for the CTA is a 4 minute walk and gets you downtown in 10 minutes.  Doors are on mechanical keyless keypads so check in is always easy. Whatever you need form us. neighborhood_overview: We want to under promise and over deliver.  So we want to be clear that this property is on Chicago's West side in an amazing multicultural and ethnically diverse neighborhood.  It is, for sure in the inner city.  It's full of grime and glory.  You can't walk to a coffee shop but you can make eye contact and chit chat with a total stranger. Not many places in a big city where that happens anymore.  If you're not used to big cities, do a street view to make sure it's in your comfort zone.  Or, step outside of your comfort zone and have a fantastic new experience.  Isn't that one of the best parts of travel!?
notes: We want to under promise and over deliver.  So we want to be clear that this property is on Chicago's West side in an amazing multicultural and ethnically diverse neighborhood.  It is, for sure in the inner city.  It's full of grime and glory.  You can't walk to a coffee shop but you can make eye contact and chit chat with a total stranger. Not many places in a big city where that happens anymore. It's also not a party spot.  We want you to have a blast but the unit is only suitable for gatherings that you'd invite your grandmother too.  IE... no parties please.
transit: 2 minute walk to The Metra. 6 minutes to the CTA which can have you any place in the city.  One of the biggest pluses is our proximity to public transportation.  Also a quick walk to the Chicago DIVY... our fantastic bike share program.  Bike downtown in 15 to 30 minutes depending on location and biking ability.  Uber to either airport for about $15.
access: 15,000 square feet of amazing urban wild.  Grill out or just relax.  We're a quick walk to Chicago's shared bike program called DIVY.  There is free, secure, gated parking on the premises.  The Kedzie Green Line station for the CTA is a 4 minute walk and gets you downtown in 10 minutes.  Doors are on mechanical keyless keypads so check in is always easy.
interaction: Whatever you need form us.  Support or to be left to do your own thing!
house_rules: No fire. No vomit. No anger. Number of guests in the unit must be the number of guests on the reservation.   Music played at a volume that your grandmother would tolerate.  If she is deaf or hardcore, than a level that my grandmother would tolerate.  Keep the dial in the middle or lower!!
host_about: Our quality of life depends on how well we deal with adversity!  Feel positive. Live positive.  I grew up in a small coastal town in Maine.  When I turned 19 I realized that I was a closet wanderer.  So I hit the road and covered much of the U.S. and all of Europe.  I taught skiing in the Rockies and rode my BMW R65-LS from coast to coast.  When I was in Europe I was amazed at how willing people were to open their homes to a total stranger.  I had one of my best experiences living with a family in Romania in the Carpathian Mountains.  Amazing!  I feel this is the best way possible to travel.  It's part of why I love Air B&B.  Hotel shmotel!  Live the life of the area.  That's an experience.  Now my wandering days are over.  I'm rooted in one of the coolest communities I know.  Rich with art and spirit. I have two amazing girls that help me garden, can, collect eggs and milk.  My partner is a fellow East Coast boy, avid hockey player and my right hand man. I also tour with an ABBA tribute band as well as a Pink Floyd tribute band but don't hold that against me.  I hope you like it here half as much as we do!!

name: Upscale Safe Hyde PK Uplifting Private Rm
summary: Welcome to our very large 4 bedroom apartment, your home away from home. It's close to the University of Chicago, Obama's house, and the Subway. The neighborhood is really safe. This shared room has 3 single beds and It's possible you may be sharing it with other travelers. However, we also have 2 other private rooms. The indoor and outdoor space is always clean, quiet and peaceful.  We are very friendly, helpful and committed to you feeling completely at home. Let us know how we're doing.
space: Our apartment is pretty simple, but clean, quiet and peaceful. This one is private room has three single beds inside, large and comfortable. My wife and I are very friendly and outgoing and committed to offering exceptional service at an affordable price. The apartment is located in an upscale neighborhood that's clean, quiet, peaceful and very safe; There is lots of free street parking just around the corner.  Though we are fairly new at hosting, travelers from dozens of countries have selected our place. They have all loved staying with us and have given us a 4.8 Star rating for overall satisfaction with their stay with us. I'm sure you will be happy with your stay with us too if you are open, friendly and enjoy meeting people from around the world.

notes: Check-In is between 5 and 8 pm. We are committed that you have a smooth Check-In so please let us know in advance the time you plan to arrive so we can arrange for someone to be here to greet you. We can make special check-In exceptions at times, so tell us what you need. When you arrive in Chicago, call me or my wife at least 45 minutes before you arrive to re-confirm your check-In time. When you arrive at the apartment, please call again. Please do not ring the buzzer. Thank you.
access: Our apartment has the open concept design, which means the kitchen, dining room, and living room are all one big room. In addition to your private room, you'll have access to this space and the shared bathrooms.
interaction: My wife and I both work full-time jobs and therefore only home during the evening hours, Monday through Friday. if you have an urgent matter during these times you can call or text us. On the weekends, we are also pretty busy. We look forward to connecting with you when we can.
house_rules: Providing a Quiet, Peaceful and Safe environment are benefits we want every guest to experience. Please follow these guidelines to help make it so. Communication Channel 1.  Please directly communicate with us if you have any concerns or issues in person or by text right away.  2. Please talk with us immediately if you feel you have been mistreated or you might not be able to talk kindly with others. Food, Cook Ingratiates & Drinks 1. We do not provide free food and cook Ingratiates.  2. Please do not eat other's food without permission. 3. Please do to eat food in your room just in case food slag attracts some insects. Drugs and Alcohol Please give the utmost respect to our home environment. If you think there is a chance that you might use drugs, drink heavily or come in and out during very late hours of the night while we are hosting you, then please book with another host. Thank you for understanding. Loitering Note: Our neighbors have made complaints about our guest playing loud m
host_about:
My wife and I, Jessie, are Teachers of Transcendental Meditation, TM. We have been teaching TM in urban schools around the country for 10 years. I enjoy travel, meeting new and interesting people and taking on new and challenging situations. I am a problem solver by instinct.

I am a life-long practitioner of meditation and committed to the Spiritual goal of Self-mastery and inspiring others along that same path. 

This is my first experience with Airbnb and I love the idea of it.

name: Cozy Room with Free Street Parking
summary: Perfect room with queen size bed and shared bath. This room has all you need to relax after a day of visiting family or all the wonders of Chicago. You are only a few blocks to one of Chicago’s best and cleanest train lines. It will take you right into the city and all the best that Chicago has to offer. Restaurants within blocks a grocery store across the street and free parking!

name: Barebone Space in Edgewater
summary: My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, families (with kids), big groups, and furry friends (pets). Retreat where you need space for more people? We're open to that as well! Quiet time is generally designated between 10pm - 8am in any area within 600 feet of a residential district. There is also no smoking allowed on premise.
space: It is a completely open space (we can add furniture if requested) with the following layout: - 3 large bedrooms  - formal dining room - formal living room - 2.5 bathrooms - Renovated and large kitchen with plenty of counterspace

name: Trendy Wicker Park Loft with Parking!
summary: Located in trendy Wicker Park, our modern Chicago loft boasts open-plan living, exposed brickwork and plenty of room to accommodate larger groups. Walk down popular North Ave, Milwaukee Ave and Division St to explore the many shopping, dining and nightlife options While a nearby restaurant is closed for COVID-19 we can offer a dedicated parking space! We are centrally located, close to the Blue Line (airport and downtown access) and a block away from the Kennedy (I90/94 expressway).
space: This spacious loft is newly rehabbed and designed specifically for the comfort of larger groups- plenty of room to spread out and relax! Cook a big meal in our updated and fully stocked kitchen, make yourself a drink in our BYOB lounge or have some downtime in one of our spacious bedrooms. As experienced hosts, we have taken care of every detail from comfortable bedding to ample towels and keep the space clean! Your stay will be a true Chicago experience- the loft is filled with information about Chicago and the surrounding neighborhood to ensure you get the most out of your stay.

Please no shoes inside the apartment Smoking of ANY substance is prohibited on property Please do not cook, bring into property or leave anything that will leave a lingering scent Please do not eat in the bedrooms Please use coasters on wood work Please let us know if anything is damaged, broken and not working Neighbor relations are critical. neighborhood_overview: Boasting gorgeous boulevards and a constantly expanding selection of restaurants and bars, Logan Square is one of the city's trendiest neighborhoods, balancing family-friendly amenities with a thriving nightlife. Walk along Milwaukee Avenue and you'll find cocktail bars and gastropubs as well as dive bars and late night eateries, all packed with young crowds watching local bands or playing vintage arcade games. The variety of diversions present in Logan Square attracts record lovers, musicians, pinball wizards and dining aficionados to this scenic section of Chicago.
transit: There are plenty of easy and convenient ways to get around the city from my place. I am a 15 minute walk (8 city blocks) to the Blue Line train that runs between O'Hare International Airport (25 minute train ride) and downtown Chicago (20 minute train ride). Midway Airport is a train ride away (45 minutes). I am also near the Armitage or Fullerton bus lines. Uber and Lyft (or taxi) are easy to call and you can get most places for $10-$12. There is a Divvy bike rental station 2 blocks away. If you have a car, there is free parking on our street.
access: You will have complete and private access to my condo. 24HR self check in is available via a lock box code with the keys to your unit.
house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check out. 3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises unless you are in a designated smoking area.  Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid. 6.) Lockouts will incur a $150 fee
host_about:
I am a 32 year old professional who has lived in Chicago her whole life.  I have lived in my current neighborhood for over 5 years with my long time boyfriend (native Cincinnatian) and 2 adorable kitties.  I LOVE to travel and spend the majority of my free time planning or on my next big adventure.  Some of my favorites include Turkey, the Czech Republic, Croatia, Ireland and Mexico.  I have traveled in all different types of style from back packing and hostels or luxury hotels and spas...I am an equal opportunity traveler and so long as there is something to do, eat and drink and I am not at work, I am happy as can be.

When I am not working and traveling, my boyfriend and I love exploring new restaurants and bars in Chicago.  

We love meeting new people and hope you will enjoy staying with us as much as we will enjoy having you as our guest.
