name: ❤️ 25% Discount! Clean & Fresh 2BR at Logan Square
summary: Whatever brings you to town, our bright and airy two-bedroom condo is complete with everything you need to feel at home while you’re in this side of the city: modern furniture, complete kitchen, and a 49-inch flatscreen TV with unlimited Netflix access in case you just wanna stay in and chill! The space comfortably accommodates up to five people with two queen-sized beds and a convertible sofa bed, making it the best accommodation for small groups without burning a hole on your pocket.
space: Our artsy neighbourhood of Logan Square is a walkable estate famous for fancy drinks and grub, interesting art scene, and arcade bars. Drop by the famous The 606 and to get a nice view of the city; this elevated train railway converted to a park is also a great jumpoff to other tourist spots in the city. Into the art scene? The Hairpin Arts Centre, Gallerie F, and Comfort Station are your best bets if you want to marvel at art made by Chicago locals. Experience good ol’ Logan Square fun at Logan Arcade where you can grab some cocktails and beers while playing vintage video games. Whatever you’re into, Logan Square has something for you; we suggest you ditch your cars at home and explore the city on your own to get an authentic feel of the city. In case you wish to explore Chicago further, CTA Line is just a few blocks away from the property.

neighborhood_overview: On the northwest side of Chicago, with Diversey Parkway to the north and Bloomingdale Avenue to the south, sits one of the most dynamic neighborhoods in the city: Logan Square. The community center, the actual square of Logan Square, is at the popular three-way intersection of Milwaukee Avenue, Logan Boulevard, and Kedzie Boulevard.  Here, you’ll find bungalow homes, park-like historic boulevards, grungy bars, hipster shops, historic churches, gourmet coffee, and cheap eats. This is a diverse community, yet one that is gentrifying and rapidly changing — construction and reimagined storefronts seem to be happening on the regular. When exploring, make sure you check out our list of the top things to do in this neighborhood- Shop, Explore and Dine.
notes: -There are many units inside this building. There is limited street parking. You can access the whole city through the CTA train nearby. -All guests need to be attentive to the house rules during their stay, as they are other tenants at the property. -The owner of the building has several security cameras on the Exterior of the building on the front courtyard and backyard. -Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay -Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request. -We have duvet covers on our beddings  (no top sheets). -A Security Deposit may be required on some bookings.  -If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away.
transit: The best way to get around is with the CTA train and Bus. You can Uber/Lyft.
access: Condo Access is through the front entrance or side door entrances. The apartment is on the second floor.
interaction: We are available by phone throughout your stay. You can simply call or text if you have any questions.
house_rules: HOUSE RULES Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking: -No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250). -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. - The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am. -Lost key fee - $300 -Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc. -Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc. -Smoking - $300 -Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300 **-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat,  an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.

You will love all the local restaurants, coffee shops, bars and shops at your doorstep, and easy access to transportation with a direct line to downtown and O'Hare.

neighborhood_overview: Much of the South Loop's eastern edge is encompassed by the Museum Campus, an impressive collection of cultural treasures that includes the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium. This campus sits on scenic lakefront parklands that are an extension of Grant Park. With 319 acres of green space and recreational fields, Grant Park is known as "Chicago's front yard" to locals and also plays host to major city events such as Taste of Chicago, Chicago Blues Festival and Lollapalooza. More information Just off the Lake Michigan shoreline is Northerly Island, a peninsula sought out by nature lovers, while along the southern edge the sports fans know Soldier Field as the stadium for the beloved Chicago Bears football team. Meeting attendees are most familiar with McCormick Place, the largest convention center in the country and concert goers can enjoy a night out at The Wintrust arena both places are just a 5 min car ride or short walk.
notes: -Ample paid street parking is available for short-term parking --Spot Hero parking available for approximately $8-10 per day with spots behind building if booked within 48 hours of arrival -Early check-in $35 or free bag drop-off (when available)  -Safe/walkable area near all public transportation, restaurants, grocery and other attractions.
transit: -CTA Bus and trains at front door -Metra Train nearby -CTA Green Line -CTA Red Line -Union Station -Rideshare Services inexpensive to most downtown locations Here are a few listings with exact distances in mileage from the property. name: Luxury Corner 2 Bedroom in the Heart of the Loop
summary: This stylish corner apartment is in a perfect location with fabulous city views in multiple directions. It's a bright and spacious luxury two bedroom, two bathroom apartment with an additional sofa bed, ideal for families, business travelers, or couples traveling together. The building has an amazing rooftop terrace with a hot tub and panoramic views of the skyline. This is the best location in the city!
space: Located in a secure, high-end building in the center of Chicago! Once inside, you're greeted by a light-filled apartment with windows on every wall. The views during the day are fantastic - but it's even more magical at night! Right out the window, you'll see a unique scene of diverse and historic Chicago architecture with the bustling city below.  Everything is top of line and interior design is a passion of ours - so the furnishing of the unit reflects that! There is fast internet, a smart TV with Roku, and comfortable modern furniture to lounge on.  The kitchen and living room are open. The kitchen is stocked with cookware and all the tools you need to cook a great meal. We have a 2-person bistro dining table and 3 counter stools for the granite kitchen island. Plenty of room for all guests to dine comfortably or to use as a workspace.  For each guest, the comfortable beds have crisp, clean linens and the bathrooms are stocked with fresh towels and bath products. Sleeping arrangemen

neighborhood_overview: The Loop is the heart of Chicago and the most central location in the entire city! You are surrounded by world-class architecture, shopping, theaters, parks, and other sites. You can quickly walk to Millennium Park, the lakefront, the Chicago River, the Magnificent Mile, the Art Institute, and so much more. The Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, and Soldier Field are just a 5 minute ride. Oak Street for luxury shopping and the West Loop restaurant row for world class dining are only 5 minutes away as well!
transit: Our place is surrounded by trains and buses that will take you anywhere in the city you want to go! Uber and Lyft is also available 24/7. You'll have no trouble getting around without a car. Parking is not included with our listing, but there are many nearby parking garages close to our building (within a couple blocks). We also suggest using SpotHero or ParkWhiz to find and book discounted parking. You can usually find reasonable overnight parking for $15 to $25.
access: You have complete and private access to the apartment.
interaction: We are always available to answer questions and give recommendations!
host_about: Discover Chicago with a stay at one of our distinctive neighborhood properties. Staywell's concierge team is dedicated to ensuring that you have an exceptional and memorable experience. We love hosting guests and are available for questions about the city and anything else you might need during your stay!

space: Our home is on a quiet tree-lined street in Chicago's Lakeview neighborhood where you will find dozens of restaurants within a short walk, offering food from many lands. The area is popular among young adults with its numerous comedy and other clubs as well as theaters and cinema. The Briar Street theater, home of Blue Man Group, is a 5-minute walk from our front door.

neighborhood_overview: Wide variety of restaurants (Swedish-American, Italian, Korean, Mexican, Middle Eastern, etc.) 1 block from Briar Street Theater (Blue Man Group), 8 minute jog to lakefront park with 20 miles of running and biking trails.
transit: The CTA Rapid Transit ('El') station is less than 4 minutes walk away and it gets you to the center of town in about 15 minutes. There are also three major bus routes that pass within 2 blocks of our front door. If you prefer a ride-hailing service, the neighborhood is crawling with Ubers and Lyfts.

host_about: I am a pediatrician in my 70s, as is my wife. We are both retired recently and often travel together.  None of our adult sons live in Chicago now. We both enjoy physical activity, cooking, going to (and in her case, writing) plays. We speak a few languages between us, although not too well. I work in Xi'an China a few weeks each year, teaching in a  NICU there. (My Mandarin is still pretty rudimentary.) We generally prefer interesting and unusual things to expensive things. name: Cozy Nest in Chicago's Vibrant Lincoln Square
summary: Feel as though you have never left home in this wonderful 4 bedroom duplex apartment equipped with a fireplace, dinning room, fully stocked kitchen, and game room. Catch up on work in our dedicated workspace room or play a competitive game of air hockey against your friends. Located across the street from the Brown Line train station, nothing is more than a 15min ride.
space: Plenty of space with activities galore makes this a perfect place for your family or friends getaway in the Windy City of Chicago. Gather around the large dinning room table with your home cooked meals made in our large fully stocked kitchen. Catch up on some reading or work in our dedicated sun-filled work room, get your game on with many board games or advance to the Air Hockey and Foosball tables for some interactive games, or enjoy our Roku equipped TV where you can catch up on the latest shows from Netflix and Amazon.  For the little ones, we have coloring books and for the even smaller ones we provide a pack n play.

neighborhood_overview: Lincoln Square is a charming neighborhood of Chicago. There are many restaurants and coffee shops situated all along Lincoln Square that are walking distance. Grab a cup of Coffee across the street at Oromo or just down the block at Starbucks. Get morning brunch and pastries at Selmarie or Baker Miller. Walking is a fantastic way to get around and explore what the neighborhood has to offer.
notes: Please note the CTA Brown Line train runs behind the property in the Alley. There will be some noise associated with the train.
transit: The CTA Brown Line train station is directly across the street. You can ride to many places including downtown, the Loop, Wrigleyville and other Chicago locations in about 30mins or less.
access: Feel free to use any parts of the apartment. We also have an outdoor table and grill available for the warmer months (just let us know if you plan on using it so we can ensure it is clean).

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is in the historic Gold Coast district. The area is located just north of downtown Chicago, nestled against the Lake Michigan shoreline. Considered one of the most affluent neighborhoods in the country, the Gold Coast is every upscale shopper’s dream. The retail revelry on Oak and Rush Streets includes swanky boutiques and rare, designer fashions. There are many celebrated restaurants to try, including Michelin-starred winners and classic Chicago steakhouses. Amongst the prestigious hotels and celebrated eateries, there is a trove of booming nightlife hot spots and high-energy events.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $250 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

Our staff has been trained in proper disinfection techniques and will deep clean your Sonder before and after your stay. We're here for you during this time of uncertainty and can be reached 24/7 via text or call. Named the most innovative travel company of 2019 by Fast Company, Sonder has hosted a million guests in 5,000+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses. 4. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

host_about: Hi everyone!  Tracy and Josue here. :) We've been living in Chicago for quite some time now. Beautiful city to travel to! A little bit about us. I (Tracy) used to be a photographer but decided to change careers and become a Mortician.  Josue is a Socialite, Traveller, Humanitarian, Activist, Producer and Investor. We love everything we do and hosting for Airbnb is definitely one of them.  When our guests are happy we are happy. We will do everything we can to make your stay as comfortable and amazing as possible. Josue is great with directions, places to check out, things to do, events and nightlife. He knows how to make an awesome drink as well! I love to cook and try new recipes. We both like to go out and experience nightlife, love being foodies and trying out new restaurants when the time permits. Love to travel as well, but Chicago is our Home for now! We are happy to share the experience!

summary: For Corp Groups+Special Occasion+Family+Friends. This Massive 3000sqft, Duplex, 3 bdr, 2.5 bath space is a celebration of contrasts. An eclectic style carefully gathers various periods,styles & interesting recycled elements while creating cohesiveness w/ modern design.Steps from Blue line train(10min walk)+606 Trail+ restrnts+cafes+high-end boutique/vintage shops+nightlife.20min drive: Mag Mile+Navy Pr+ Solder/ Wrigley Fld+ United Cntr+Millenium+McCormick Pl+Museums. space: Two separate floors- an ideal retreat with tons of space and privacy should you prefer to close your bedroom. Perfect for a relaxing vacation or special occasion.  MAIN LIVING FLOOR: SLEEPS 4! An unusually wide and long Chicago open floor concept.  One fold out bed converts to a queen with memory foam+ twin air mattress+ futon bed converts to twin. The entire space is bright featuring a living room, Italian travertine stone fireplace, powder room. Next, is a fully equipped chef’s kitchen + wet bar+ family room leading to your outdoor deck and rooftop garage. The rooftop garage deck is equipped w/ a Weber grill and sectional seating.  Cable TV with Netflix in the main living area+ complimentary Wi-Fi. The home is smart temperature controlled with room sensors to help manage hot+cold spots for your comfort, plus a Nest smoke+carbon monoxide detector. It tests itself, alerts your phone, and lets you silence the alarm from the Nest app. SECOND FLOOR: SLEEPS 10 adults + 1 toddler. 3 bedroom

neighborhood_overview: One of Chicago's creative epicenters lies just outside downtown Chicago in Wicker Park and Bucktown. These synonymous neighborhoods are famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries. The area has become a prevailing influence on Chicago's Michelin-rated, James Beard Award-winning dining scene, boasting some of the city's most sought-after tables. Wicker Park and Bucktown are also known for palate-pleasing nightcaps. Along North, Division, Milwaukee and Damen Avenue, you will find an unbelievable blend of vintage shops amid independently-owned boutiques touting fashions for both men and women, and luxury home goods and beauty products. On the same blocks are nationally-recognized names in fashion, and a mix of major retail chains that have also set up shop to satisfy the on-trend crowds.
transit: Conveniently located so that you can head to festivals and outdoor concerts! 10 min walking distance to a Blue-line station (Bucktown “Western” stop). 90/94 highway takes you to downtown Chicago in 15-20 min; 30-40 minute drive from O'hare/Midway airports. North Avenue has several DIVVY bike rental stations, and the #72 North Avenue CTA bus travels east directly to the lakefront’s North Avenue Beach in 30 minutes.
access: Rooftop Deck+Garage is communal (shared with guest suite below).
interaction: Self-check-in: Lockbox. I respect guests’ privacy. I’m always available via text or call.  I’m happy to make recommendations for outings and activities. I'm an avid traveler and grew up in Chicago so I can help you navigate in the city.
house_rules: Every future guest deserves a comfortable stay. PLEASE NOTE: This is a 100% SMOKE-FREE ENVIRONMENT. NO SMOKING OF ANY KIND, ANYWHERE (INSIDE, DECKS, COMMON AREAS). Sorry smokers, but 2nd & 3rd-hand smoke lingers for days, attaches to linens, towels and furniture. I am an asthma sufferer so if you have any guest in your group that smokes, please book elsewhere. Smoking will result in an automatic loss of security deposit and you will be asked to leave.  The person making the booking must be the same person checking in. Please remove your shoes inside the home.  Please respect our neighbors. Be mindful of noise levels, especially during "quiet" hours:  Rooftop use until 10 pm on Sunday-Thursday; until 11pm on Friday & Saturday. $35 p/guest, p/night beyond 16 guests. If additional guests stay at this property other than the number stated in the initial booking, the security deposit will be charged in full. The home is not meant for events or parties. No outside visitors are permitted. Ple
host_about: I've lived in Chicago for most of my life. I love to travel, especially to remote, non-cliché parts of the world. Places that are rich in cultures and histories that shape our globalized world. One of my most memorable trips has been to the country of Myanmar (formerly known as Burma). Welcome to my home. I hope you have a wonderful stay.

name: The Roscoe & Halsted (Boystown)
summary: Be close to all of the action in Chicago’s Lakeview neighborhood! You will be steps from Boystown, Wrigleyville, Lake Michigan, Belmont Theater District, Addison Station, Belmont Station, and much more.  Nightlife, retail shopping, coffee shops, and liquor stores all walking distance. This home is an excellent location for people eager to visit one of the most diverse, cultured, and popular late-night neighborhoods in Chicago.
space: Reliable and effortless check-in as the apartment is equipped with a lockbox. The apartment occupies the second floor of a historic Chicago building - as you walk up the private stairwell, you'll enter the kitchen which opens into the airy living room, to the left you'll see the large dining area. Down the hall to the right are the three bedrooms and two bathrooms and through the back door is the back porch. You will love my home because of the A+ location, amenities, and accessibility with a bus Stop right outside of the front door, Divvy Bike station directly across the street, and Belmont or Addison Red Line stops within 10 minutes walking distance.  Great for families, couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and groups. This 2nd floor property is beautifully located in the heart of Boystown’s historic nightlife. summary: Fun, vibrant residential neighborhood surrounded by bars, theaters, coffee shops, restaurants and boutiques. space: Private bedroom with queen size bed, closet, writing desk and private bath (bathroom is located in hall adjacent to bedroom).  Located in lower level of modern duplex condo.  There is a large family room (shared space)  with a sink, mini fridge, coffee maker, dishes and silverware for guests use. As you can see in the reviews, this space provides a lot of privacy.  Your bedroom/bath is downstairs and mine is upstairs.  So you'll wake up and have the downstairs to yourself.   Guests can use the private lower level rear entrance that exits to the parking area (expect litter will be on the stairs since this entrance since it is off the alley in the "windy" city). Laundry is available upon request, as well as street parking.  The location is a quiet residential community while close to local boutiques, restaurants and coffee houses.

access: Basic amenities towels, sheets, shampoo, soaps, coffee machine, light snacks (granola bars, cereal, cookies - non-perishables) mini fridge, microwave, toaster, dishes, silverware, etc.  There is a wet bar on the lower level that includes the above amenities.  I only accept guests who have a government issued ID posted.  This is a security measure intended to protect both you as a guest as well as myself, a host who is inviting people into my home.
interaction: I have a varied job schedule so I may be home during the day and usually around in the evenings.

name: Park Views-Walk to Orange Line(MDW)
summary: Two bed room apartment in a vintage 130 year old red brick two flat overlooking 70 acres of Mckinley Park in a sleepy working class neighborhood.  Ten minute 1/2 mile walk to the 35th/Archer CTA Orange line station with rapid transit service to Chicago's Loop,  Midway Airport and the many cultural attractions the city has to offer.
space: Decorated with an artists eye and a working-class budget with a focus on calm and comfortable. Sunny top floor with western facing bay windows overlooking McKinley Park.
description: Two bed room apartment in a vintage 130 year old red brick two flat overlooking 70 acres of Mckinley Park in a sleepy working class neighborhood.  Ten minute 1/2 mile walk to the 35th/Archer CTA Orange line station with rapid transit service to Chicago's Loop,  Midway Airport and the many cultural attractions the city has to offer. Decorated with an artists eye and a working-class budget with a focus on calm and comfortable. Sunny top floor with western facing bay windows overlooking McKinley Park. The entire top floor apartment is yours.  Large eat in kitchen with all the amenities for cooking.  Two bedrooms with two full beds. There is also a small cot in a "tiny house" type space off the living room that is comfortable for a child or shorter adult. You are staying in my former beloved park side home. My trusted friend Alexander lives in the downstairs garden unit and is on call for any smaller needs you may have. McKinley Park has been a working-class area throughout its long histor
neighborhood_overview: McKinley Park has been a working-class area throughout its long history. Two blocks to the south along Pershing is the historic Central Manufacturing District. It has been described as the United States' first planned industrial district and features some surprisingly decorative warehouses from the turn of the century as well as an old clock tower. The juxtaposition of a city park on one side of Pershing with old huge 10 story warehouses on the other is incredibly unique and worth scoping out. More information Keep in mind the McKinley Park neighborhood is more of a quiet refuge from night life. You'll have to venture a little further for restaurants or bars. Pilsen to the north and Bridgeport to the east are excellent options for restaurants both easily accessible by a short CTA bus ride or Divvy Bike. Chicago's China town is a quick trip down the Orange line. The nearest grocery market is Cermak Produce three blocks to the north.
notes: The building is 132 years strong. With all the vintage charm comes a few squeaky floor boards. You may hear the downstairs on occasion or pass other guests on the porch. Overall it's a very quiet building and I ask that you respect the downstairs guests and tenant.  No parties no loud music. This is a walk up second floor apartment with a total of 23 steps to the apartments door. The units share a front porch with a small private entrance vestibule. This vestibule ONLY is videotaped for the safety and protection of my home.
transit: The walk to the 35th/Archer Orange Line stop is mostly park side and through 2 family oriented city residential blocks.  The building is located between the #9 Ashland and #49 Western which operate 24 hours and cover much of the city north to south.  Street parking is available most of the time especially one block south along the park. There is Divvy bikeshare station 2 blocks south-west at Damen and Pershing.
access: The entire top floor apartment is yours.  Large eat in kitchen with all the amenities for cooking.  Two bedrooms with two full beds. There is also a small cot in a "tiny house" type space off the living room that is comfortable for a child or shorter adult.
interaction: You are staying in my former beloved park side home. My trusted friend Alexander lives in the downstairs garden unit and is on call for any smaller needs you may have.
house_rules: Back porch and stairs are for emergency use only. No tobacco. No parties. No unregistered guests. No loud music. Please observe quiet hours after 10pm.
host_about: I have been here for 7 years and have so much pride in my neighborhood and park side home that I just have to share it.  I am a designer / independent boutique owner in Logan Square.

neighborhood_overview: We're located in Lakeview, one of Chicago's safest and most popular neighborhoods. THINGS TO DO NEARBY ✔ Walk to Wrigleyville and catch a Cub's game. ✔ Admire the Chicago skyline from the Lakefront Trail. ✔ Catch a live show at the Vic Theatre.
notes: ❓FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS❓ 1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?” Directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. We're a short walk from the Belmont 'L' train station. Search for “Belmont Red Line station Chicago” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest. 2. “Is there parking nearby?” Parking in Chicago is often difficult and even more so in the evening and during special events. We recommend using a service called SpotHero because it allows you to reserve a nearby paid parking spot in advance so that you don’t have to worry about finding parking when you arrive. 3. When is check-in/check-out? Check-in: Your reservation and access to the apartment both begin at 3 p.m. As a courtesy, you can stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room. Check-out: Your reservation and access to the apartment both end at 11 a.m. on your check-out date. As a courte
transit: Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber. ￫ The Belmont Red/Brown/Purple Line 'L' train station is a 5-minute walk away. ￫ O'Hare is 55 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber. ￫ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.
access: The entire apartment is yours to use during your stay. The apartment includes: ✔ Three bedrooms with queen-size beds. ✔ One full bathroom. ✔ Sunny and spacious living room with smart TV (no cable). ✔ Fully-equipped kitchen with breakfast table.
interaction: Need more towels? Deep dish pizza recommendations? We're always on call to answer your questions.
house_rules: 1) Only the reservation holder and guests added to the reservation via Airbnb may stay overnight.   2) As a courtesy to your neighbors, please keep noise to a minimum, especially between 9 pm - 9 am. 3) This is a non-smoking apartment. If smoke is detected, a cleaning fee of $150 will be charged. 4) No late check-outs. Check-out is at 11 am.  In order to compensate our cleaning assistants for lost time, additional charges will be sent if they're unable to begin their job at 11 am. One hour or less - $25 Each additional hour - $40 5) Damaged/stained/missing towels, bedding, and/or furnishings will incur additional fees. The per-item fees are as follows: Bedsheet- $12 Towel - $12 Pillow - $30 Pillowcase: $10 Comforter - $50 Clothes hangers - $3 Furnishings - Dependant on item
host_about: We're excited to join the Airbnb community! Our children have been using it for years and we recently started hosting.  I'm an attorney and my wife Patricia is an accountant. We love cooking, grilling in the summer, and spending time with our children and grandchildren.

name: Tiny Studio Apartment 94 Walk Score
summary: A very small studio in a wonderful neighborhood.
space: This is a very small  studio apartment with a private entrance.  The apartment is located on the rear half of our first floor. It has its own entrance. It consists of a kitchen and a small bedroom with a queen sized bed (new since October 2016) and bathroom with a tub and shower.  There is a kitchen with a stove and mini fridge and sink and microwave plus a small table for two. We have a Roku Box for tv watching and excellent cable internet. The Roku has Amazon Prime, Netflix and a bunch of other channels. We have hi-speed Comcast internet  I teach an Airbnb Experience in Soapmaking upstairs in my apartment, so let me know if you want to schedule a class at your convenience while you are here! (https://www.airbnb.com/experiences/52598)

You will be provided with easy self-check in instructions. My fa
neighborhood_overview: Ukrainian Village was just named "Hottest Neighborhood in America" by Trulia. Our address has a walk score of 94 because it has an awesome combination of places to walk to, public transportation options and rental bikes all over the place.   We are in a convenient location one block away from multiple bars, restaurants, boutiques, etc. you can walk to the El from the apartment (1/2 mile) and take it straight downtown to the museums or to O'Hare airport in the other direction.  Our neighborhood is called Ukrainian Village and we are a historic district which means most of the buildings are old and the neighborhood has lots of character.  We were granted this status in part because it is an unusual neighborhood with numerous Orthodox churches and cathedrals. It is a nice place to walk around. You can walk to the Ukrainian Institute of Modern Art Museum and the Ukrainian National Museum. You can also get Ukrainian food and pastries.  The neighborhood has changed in recent years, however,
notes: We really like our neighbors and want guests to respect their space. You can't smoke in their yard, hang out on their front porch, ring their bell and ask for help, etc. Please do not bother our neighbors. They are nice people who we wish to maintain a good relationship with. And they don't have spare keys or know how to use the lock box.
transit: We are 1/2 mile away from the el train stop (blue line) and one block away from the Division Street bus stop. There are Divvy bikes to rent 3 blocks away. There are Ubers always a few moments away and  the easiest way to catch a cab is to  venture one block over onto Division Street, where it usually takes only a few minutes for one to drive by and pick you up.
access: You will be in your own private, tiny apartment. You will not see me or my family at all unless you run into us outdoors or need assistance. You will be provided with easy self-check in instructions.
interaction: My family lives in the building but we are not home 24/7. We are available to answer questions, especially via email.  Guests let themselves in with a key code and generally have total privacy from us unless they need help with anything.
house_rules: This is a tiny apartment and is only appropriate for one or two people. Check out is  flexible if no one is arriving the next day. If someone is arriving we ask you to be out at 11 am on the dot. You can come early but only if no one is there the night before and you have arranged this with us in advance. Otherwise check in is at 2 pm.
host_about: We live in Chicago. We love to travel and see the world with our two children!

name: Perfect location right between DOWNTOWN & O'HARE
summary: Hi there! Guests love staying at our place because of its absolutely ideal, couldn't-be-more-convenient LOCATION. To explore Chicago, you need to be near the "el" train.  We're blocks from the "blue line", the only train connecting O'hare airport to all the downtown tourist destinations. 30 mins from O'hare & 15 mins from downtown, you'll be perfectly situated for an easy stress-free check-in, and everything you want to experience. You'll have your own, lockable private room with a bed for two.
space: Our place is a 2 flat grey stone conveniently located on a quiet, tree-lined residential block.

neighborhood_overview: LOGAN SQUARE — Described as the "Midwest headquarters of hip," Logan Square has been named one of the 15 "hottest urban retail markets across North America." RESTAURANTS: - Revolution Brewing (lively, chef-driven pub fair) - 0.5mi -Boiler Room (hippest pizza place in town with lots of craft beer, and a great beer garden) - 0.5mi  -Lula Cafe (Inventive, market-driven food in a casual, funky space that hosts an especially popular brunch) - 0.7mi -Reno (Wood-fired pizza, bagels & pasta in a casual, loftlike space with a bar for pastries & alcohol) - 0.7mi -Longman and Eagle (modern farm-to-table fine dining with a great whiskey/cocktail selection) - 0.9mi -Donkey Table Stick (upscale comfort fare and drinks in a rustic setting) - 0.8  -The Radler (wursts and hearty German eats, plus plenty of beers, in a brick walled space covered in street art) - 0.5mi -Cozy Corner (classic diner serving up hearty breakfast/lunch right next to the train stop) - 0.4 -Margies Candies (Open for more than 90
notes: My sister is currently staying in one of the three bedrooms and she has two cats.
transit: The Blue Line "el" train is only .4 miles away giving you easy access to the entire city, especially all the hip spots which tend to be along the blue line! Plus it's a straight shot to O'hare Airport. If you have a car, street parking is free and it's typically easy.
access: Guests are free to jam on our guitars & acoustic piano! We have the fastest WiFi money can buy (Jon does web development).  We have free laundry. The place is borderline *sentient* wired up with smart devices to control everything... Use your voice to automatically control Spotify, Pandora, Netflix, Chromecast, the thermostat, and even the lights! There are tons of toys available for families with toddlers (neatly stored away when not in use). There's a nice little backyard too.
interaction: We're definitely open to socialize and show you around the town but can totally stay out of your way and give you as much space and privacy as you need too.
house_rules: -Guests must read and understand the detailed welcome message and self check in instructions on the Airbnb app.  -Leave the apartment at least as nice as it was when you arrived.  As the boyscouts say, "try to leave this world a little better than you found it."  This is a more self sufficient Airbnb than many (which is why it is so affordable!) so teamwork is required.  You are expected to clean up after yourself and help contribute to keeping the place clean.   -Please make the bed with the clean sheets provided before you check out.  Leave your sheets and towels in the hamper.   -Default check in is 3pm, checkout at 12pm noon.  We are flexible and can easily accommodate early check in and late checkout upon request. -Shoes off at the door -Make sure all dishes are washed and put away before checkout -No unregistered guests are allowed on the property without approval (and obviously no parties!) -No eating or drinking within the bedrooms.  -Smoking is not allowed in the property. space: This space is the perfect size for one or two people looking to be in the middle of all the action that wicker Park has to offer.

Wicker Park is one of Chicago's creative epicenters and lies just outside downtown and next door to Bucktown. This neighborhood is famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants, cool boutiques and countless art galleries. Everything is in walking distance in this neighborhood! Blue line at the end of the block. Minutes away from downtown, a quick train or uber ride.

name: Little Farm in the City of Chicago, the Green Room
summary: Our little farm in the city is located two blocks from the Chicago border with Oak Park; also two blocks from the Green Line, with access to downtown Chicago in 30 minutes.   We currently have 3-5 international students also living with us, who are in the country to learn English, and look forward to practicing their emerging language skills with our other guests.   We have one dog and four cats inside our house, and 5 adult goats and a growing number of baby goats.  We welcome guest animals.

We have one dog and four cats inside our house, and 5 adult goats and a growing number of baby goats.  We welcome guest animals. There are a variety of good restaurants in our area and we enjoy making recommendations based on our guests' preferences. name: Incredible views! Jr 1BR in the Heart of the Loop
summary: Get the real city experience! My junior one-bedroom in the Theatre District comfortably sleeps 3 - as soon as you step out of the building, you're surrounded by some of Chicago's greatest sights, including the famous Picasso Statue, Millennium Park, Chicago Cultural Center, and the Art Institute. Not to mention - excellent restaurants and shops, and almost every major theatre in the city. Nearly every train line is nearby, so it's convenient too - book today!
space: My place is in a friendly building full of young professionals. It's a junior one-bedroom, so the bedroom doesn't have a door, but is plenty private if someone will be staying on the sofa bed. There's a full kitchen and bathroom, too!

neighborhood_overview: As Chicago's official downtown area, the Loop is one of the most important central business districts on the globe. In addition to its dynamic architecture and buzzing atmosphere, the area has an incredible concentration of cultural institutions, urban park spaces, award-winning restaurants and a shopper's paradise on State Street.
transit: My place is a few minutes' walk away from the Washington and Washington/Wabash stations, which covers just about every line, and equally convenient to the State Street and Madison buses (among so many others) - it's almost more convenient to not have a car here! If you do bring your car, however, there are overnight garages in which to park for a fee.

No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 5.) Pets are not allowed at the property. 6.) name: Cozy Bridgeport Refuge
summary: Bridgeport Bridgeport Bridgeport. Please don't tell anyone about Bridgeport. We don't want to be "discovered." Bridgeport means quiet and zero ostentation. If you get up early you will see your neighbors doing Tai Chi in the park or tending to gardens in the back yard. A short Uber ride from the Loop. Five minutes to Thalia Hall. Two minutes from the heart of Chinatown and its world-class mix of restaurants. Great ramen is a ten-minute walk south and west, to Shinya on Halstead. Bring Fido!
space: This is a third-floor walk-up in a seasoned building. High ceilings. Shared kitchen and bath. No extra charge for the quiet or the panoramic views of Typical Chicago Neighborhood. Ample free parking on the street, usually right outside the door.  There are two locks on your door — one deadbolt with a key to take when you go out, the other a hotel-type lock that can only be opened or closed from inside the room. There is a refrigerator in your room that will be stocked with bottled water, two bottles for each day of your stay. Stay hydrated.

neighborhood_overview: Quiet quiet quiet. About three miles south of The Loop, which translates to a 15-minute Uber ride costing substantially less than ten bucks.
notes: This building is too old to be ADA compliant. Sorry. If you can’t walk up two flights of stairs this ain’t da place for you.
transit: Walking distance from the Orange Line if you’re flying into Midway. Walk to restaurants and bars (Berniece’s is on Halsted). A quick Uber ride to the Loop and Art Institute. Plenty of free parking on the street.
access: Private bedroom and shared bathroom. We provide all bedding, fluffy white towels, and Dr. Bronner's peppermint soap in the shower.
interaction: Available by text or phone, or directly, if I am home.
house_rules: Quiet from 11 pm through 6 am
host_about:
My wife and I split our time between a pied-à-terre in Chicago and a historic arts and crafts estate in rural Pennsylvania. 
I am a lawyer and my wife is a busy mom.  
Our home in Pennsylvania is on a rolling hill, within walking distance to beach and lake and romantic restaurants.
We have mainly lived in major cities around the world so the rural life is new to us but we love it. 
Our home in Pennsylvania has a big pond in the back, full of fish and frogs. We love to feed them in the evening.
The Chicago apartment is on the edge of Chinatown and minutes away from White Sox Part and The Loop.

name: 1880's Victorian Greystone Front of Lake
summary: Located in Chicago's Oakland Historic Landmark District directly across from the Lake/Beach Front in Chicago.  Minutes from the McCormick Place Only 4 minutes drive to Soldier's Field, and Museum Park: Shedd Aquarium, Adler's Planetarium.  Oakland has been preserved in Chicago's History to rebuild after the Great Chicago Fire of October 1871.  Later hosting the Columbian Exposition known as the World's Fair of 1893.  Breath-taking architectural structures and statutes throughout the area.
space: Garden Unit is comprised of 3 bdrm/2 bath with a total of 1200 sq. ft. of space with standard apartment height ceilings and plenty of windows and natural light.  Bedroom #2 located down the hall and is the 4th door to the right  door #1:  furnace room door #2:  washroom #1 door #3:  washroom #2  door #4:  bedroom #2 (this listing's room)  door #5:  bedroom #3.   Note:  Bedroom #1 is location off from the kitchen area and is not down the hallway.   The unit has central heat and 2 stand-up model 1400 btu AC's (one AC in front living room and second AC in the rear).  Each room contains a personal heater and a personal fan.  The Living Room features a sturdy olive green leather sofa sleeper with coordinating furnishings along with a breakfast nook containing a table and 4 chairs.  The bedroom #2 features a full size Ethan Allen Post bed with coordinating nightstand with blackout solid wood blinds.  Select wall art and throw rugs.  The rear storage/electrical room is not part of the unit is

neighborhood_overview: Oakland is one of Chicago's oldest historic districts featuring 1880 Architectural structures, various Statutes, water fountains and historic Landmarks throughout.  My home is a Historic Landmark and registered with the City of Chicago and the Illinois Preservation Agency.  Due to limitations and restrictions regarding this being a landmark property I am not allowed to mount on the North masonry wall.  Therefore there is no light affixed outside the gate.  I have tried several solutions but due to the trees blocking the sunlight the solar solutions are not feasible.  I leave the front and rear porch light on after dusk.  Former President Barak Obama's Home is but 10 blocks South of my home.  There is a shock absorbent track but 1/2 block south.  Mariano's is 5 blocks West (Groceries, light dining and music)  Please check online for schedules music and mixers.  Please Note:  Piano Bar within establishment.
notes: Pet Fee is $20 per/pet (Only well-trained cats/dogs no exotic pets allowed)  Please inquire regarding the prospect of securing a month-to-month stay at an even greater discount.  Month-to-month will include some of the bnb amenities like gas/electric, but will not include bed linen and towel service (negotiable for add'l $$) required every 2 week cleaning service (add'l nominal fee), cable and wifi ($$) Please DO NOT EVER turn off/or operate the dehumidifier located in the hall outside Room #3.  Please DO NOT LOCK Front Common Door.  Private Entrance into the unit is from Front secure locked gate (key access only).  No back gate key will be given.  [safety mechanism and keeps down traffic due to boarder/guests on 1st floor private entrance is from the rear side gate ONLY].   On Rainy days please remove shoes in Foyer/Mud Room.  You will thank me later.  LOL!!  Thanks
transit: Very close vicinity to downtown by South loop approximately 12 -20 minute bus ride or 7 minute Uber ride.  Even closer to the McCormick Place (to the North) and University of Chicago and Hospital (to the South) both are approx. 8 minute bus ride or a 5 minute UBER ride.  CTA bus, train and Metra are all within walking, biking and convenient distance.  Cottage Grove bus  #4 bus stop location 1 block West of my property takes you direct all the way to downtown in about 15-22 minutes.   Divvy bike docking stations are located throughout the neighborhood.  Please inquire of the Bnb Assistant or Host for any transportation guidance.  Thanks.   Nearby locations easily accessible via public transportation, driving, biking or walking: University of Chicago Columbia College Downtown at South Loop McCormick Place   IIT ( Illinois Institute of Technology ) Mercy Hospital (to North) Jackson Park Hospital (to South) Nearby downtown universities:  Roosevelt University, SAIC, Northwestern University
access: Access to front foyer area/mudd room, common living room and kitchen, private bathroom #2 (bath/shower) with toilet and vanity and of course to Bedroom #2. Back yard use is encourage but the back gate key is not disbursed therefore emptying the garbage from the front then walking to the rear along side the property to access city garbage disposal cans located in the alley is accessible by continuing along the side to the rear of the garage then alley access is to your immediate left and at the rear of garage. Who Jessie and Shujaa are being caring, happy, vigorous, simple, joyful, free and professional. We both are Transcendental Meditation (TM) teachers and believes change begins within, without integrity, nothing works. 

Jessie is a realtor while she is teaching TM. We have led TM school projects and teaching public among Bay area CA, New York, Washington DC, Chicago, IL, New Orleans, LA, and MS. 

We both love  traveling,gardening, reading and music. Our passion is to make difference in ours and others' lives towards the world peace. Our mission is to generate a peaceful, santinized , loving, diverse and affordable living environment for us and  everyone around us. 

We hope you would enjoy your time while you are staying with us and look forward to hosting you soon!

summary: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this comfortable River North furnished two-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and sophisticated living room with great balcony views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Chicago has to offer! (#CHI24)
space: Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your stylish living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this River North apartment has to offer. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in River North, Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood. The bridges combined with the riverwalk offer incredible views. Nearby on Michigan Avenue is the city’s premier shopping area. One of the neighborhood’s biggest assets is the walk-to-work appeal. Young professionals, who live and work in the area, can quickly get to the office in the morning and just as easily enjoy an after-work drink, as the area is considered a premier entertainment center. Don’t miss a stroll on Kinzie and Hubbard streets. Merchandise Mart, the iconic building with showrooms, shops, and office space, is only a 5 minute walk. The Loop is just across the bridge and is about 5 minute walk.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $275 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Large 12 Bedroom Chicago Home- Sleeps 25
summary: Large Chicago home with 12 bedrooms and 4 baths can comfortably accommodate large groups (up to 25).  Located in the Avondale Neighborhood which was recognized as one of the nation's 10 hottest, need to visit 'hoods by popular travel website Lonely Planet.  The entire city is easy to access from this home as it is walking distance to the CTA blue line (O'hare Airport, downtown, etc), a few blocks to the highway and a short walk/drive/bus ride to other popular Chicago neighborhoods and locations.
space: Formerly the home of a professional jeweler (yes, there is a two thousand pound safe still in the home), this is truly a unique space.  The home features 12 bedrooms and allows a large group (up to 25) to comfortably occupy the home and enjoy the privacy of separate bedrooms.  There are a total of 17 beds in the home-- 6 queen size, 2 full size, 4 twin size.  There is also a sofa sleeper, 3 wide couches comfortable for sleeping and an air mattress.  The home features two full size kitchens  and two additional mini-kitchens (4 refrigerators).  There are a total of four bathrooms and five showers.  Additionally, you can take advantage of the Chicago summer with a large outdoor covered patio which features plenty of seating and a grill to enjoy the Chicago summer.

name: The Authentic @ Lincoln Park (Street Parking Avl)
summary: This hidden gem offers guests an authentic Chicago experience with a modern twist that will take one's breath away the moment they arrive!  Unique unit architecture allow guests to live and feel like a true "Chicagoan" for a weekend, week, or month!  Additionally, our team understands your concerns when booking an Airbnb which is why we focus on the little things that make a home safe, loving, and meaningful!
space: A lovely and spacious two bedroom (main bedroom + den room) apartment that fits 6 people comfortably.  Located in the spacious main bedroom is a queen size bed.  The second bedroom acts as a den room with a convertible day bed (single on top with a pull out trundle).  Located in the unique loft area is a single bed with extra space to leave any luggage.  Located in the common area is a convertible futon bed. A spacious outdoor area is perfect for you morning coffee or evening wine. The kitchen is well finished and available for use for those that love to cook! This thoughtfully designed space will make your Chicago experience true and authentic!

neighborhood_overview: This Airbnb is in prime Chicago location! Lincoln park, the zoo, and the beautiful nature walk are 5 minutes walking distance.  Old Town, well known by locals for its bars, restaurants, and overall atmosphere, is also 5 minutes walking distance.  North Avenue beach, one of the most rocking places in Chicago, is easily accesible from the unit (10-15 minutes walking).  Overall, you cannot beat this location!
notes: The second bedroom is a den room with a day bed able to convert into two single beds to sleep two comfortably! Additionally there is storage space in the den room.
transit: Public transportation is easily accesible as you have multiple bus lines running North (20 mins to Wrigley Field) and South (15 minutes to Millennium Park/Financial district). Additionally, the Brown Line L (running north/south with connection to all line) stop is 5-10 minutes walking distance from the unit.
interaction: We are available to take your comments, questions, or concerns 24/7.  Always feel free to call or message us!
host_about: Hey there! I'm Luke and welcome to one of the best cities in the world!  Chicago has so much to offer with its food, music, art, parks, and of course beautiful Lake Michigan, guests are sure to have a great time here.  As a Chicago native I enjoy sharing the treasures of this city with as many people as possible, and what better way to do that than Airbnb!  As your host, I will provide you with all the knowledge you need to make Chicago feel like home. While at the same time, providing you with a simple, first class, and cost effective service.  Please do not hesitate to contact me with any questions.  I look forward to meeting you and wish you the best of times in Chicago!

house_rules: CLEANING FEE The cleaning fee is for linens and switch outs, NOT to do your DISHES! That attracts bugs + rodents so you are responsible for leaving the house clean and respectful. If you leave the house dirty/filthy you will be charged an extra fee. HOUSE RULES No Smoking or candles in any of our apartments. Quiet after 11pm weeknights and 12am weekends. No broken or damaged items. Only use the front entrance to enter the house. Side gate to get to the backyard. DO NOT use center stairwell and side door to backyard. Other than that, we are very chill landlords. Shoes off at the door. Have fun, but try and consider other renters.

We love to travel, cook, listen to music, and laugh (The boys are helping us a lot with that one.) We have put a lot of effort into creating a welcoming and inspiring space with this home, so we sincerely hope you enjoy your stay.

neighborhood_overview: East Garfield Park is an up and coming, urban area.  The neighborhood is home to the Garfield Park Conservatory, one of the largest and most impressive conservatories in the United States.  This apartment offers amazing access to the Green Line Train Station, Interstate 290, and minutes into downtown Chicago!
transit: 1 Free Outdoor parking spot with this unit. Free street parking is also widely available in the front of the property. Also, Chicago has a citywide, year round BIKE sharing system called 'Divvy'. There is a Divvy Bike Station 2 blocks away!  This is a great way to explore the neighborhoods of Chicago and you can drop bikes off at any other Stations! To DownTown: The Train: Home to Kedzie Green Line Station -- 2 minute walk! (0.1 Miles) --Kedzie Green Line to/from Downtown (16 min) Car/Cab/Uber: 12-18 Minute Drive with Traffic   United Center: 2 miles, 8 Minute Drive, 20 Minutes On Bus West Town: 1.8 miles West Loop: 2.5 miles Wicker Park: 2.9 miles Millenium Park: 5.5 miles O'Hare Airport: 25-45 Minutes(pending traffic) to O'hare Airport Via Car! 50 Minutes to O'hare Airport Via #52 Bus To California Ave Blue Line Midway Airport: 20-30 Minutes to Midway Airport Via Car! 45 Minutes to Midway Airport via Green Line to Orange Line

house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check out fee. 3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises unless you are in a designated smoking area. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid. 6.) Please keep all entrance do
host_about: Hi I'm Lara, and I am very proud to be an Airbnb Superhost! I am a Chicago native, and studied hospitality management at Boston University, and decided to follow my passion in trying to provide an amazing travel experience through AirBnB!  My husband and I love trying new places to eat, and have a real passion for traveling to exciting parts of the world.  I put a lot of work into getting my spaces ready, and I know you will enjoy your stay with me! Welcome to Chicago!

neighborhood_overview: Hyde Park is a beautiful and historic neighborhood of Chicago that is a home for the University of Chicago campus and some true architectural gems (Robie House by Frank Lloyd Wright, University of Chicago campus, Museum of Science and Industry and the Japanese Garden in Jackson Park - only 5 minutes from the apartment).  There are many restaurant and coffee-shops in the neighborhood, around campus and close to the Promontory Point on the Lake Front. In addition, the commercial heart of Hyde Park on 53rd street has numerous food venues and some of the coolest spaces in Chicago for music shows and fine dining.
transit: My place is across the street from a bus station that has express buses to downtown Chicago. It's also right behind the Metra  (train) station that stops at McCormick Place Convention Center, Chicago Museum Campus and Downtown (downtown is 13-18 minutes by train and 20-25 minutes by bus).  In Hyde Park, the apartment is less than 10 minutes walk (5 min bike ride) from University of Chicago campus; very close to the Lake Shore front and to a commercial center (Hyde Park Plaza on 55th) that has grocery store, pharmacy and restaurants; and across the street from the Museum of Science and Industry and Jackson Park.
access: Kitchen with all amenities and appliances is at your service (including stove, microwave, coffee-maker, coffee-grinder and mixer for smoothies). In the basement of the building there's a laundry unit that is operated with quarters ($1 per machine and $1 per dryer).
interaction: I will be away and will leave the keys with the house manager or with a friend.
house_rules: - Vegetarian guests preferred - or bring your own utensils to cook
host_about:
I am a doctoral student at the University of Chicago. I study sociology. 
I love Chicago and can always recommend on the many beautiful things to see in the city. I enjoy meeting new people and making new friends. 
I practice yoga and meditate. I love reading, good food, cooking, having fun, architecture, good movies, and lively open conversation. New to Airbnb. Hope it will be fun :)

name: Convenient Loop 1BR w/ Gym + Theatre Room near Grant Park by Blueground
summary: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this cozy The Loop furnished one-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and sophisticated living room with great  views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Chicago has to offer! (#CHI102)
space: Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this one-bedroom apartment. Ideally located in Chicago, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is situated in the most dynamic and convenient place to live in Chicago, The Loop. With its endless shopping, fine dining, stunning park, river and lake views, and entertainment opportunities, everything is possible at a moment’s notice. The area is a cultural getaway for professionals and students, who can combine work with pleasure. Discover landmark buildings like the Willis Tower and The Art Institute of Chicago. Millenium Park, near Lake Michigan, is always worth a visit. The Loop is within reach of accessible transportation, offering non-stop public transit, buses, and taxis. Union Station is approximately a 10 minute train ride.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the a
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Lakeview Studio steps from Boystown and Red Line
summary: A cozy studio a minute's walk to Boystown and Chicago's Gay Pride Parade Route. A four minute walk to Wrigley Field and the Addison Red Line train.  A great neighborhood to stay in while visiting friends or relatives for the holidays! Wrigleyville is the best place to party before during and after the game, no matter who’s playing. This studio feels more like a mini one-bedroom, and has all the character of a classic Chicago apartment.
space: The only space closed off to you is a storage closet, otherwise the whole place is yours!
description: A cozy studio a minute's walk to Boystown and Chicago's Gay Pride Parade Route. A four minute walk to Wrigley Field and the Addison Red Line train.  A great neighborhood to stay in while visiting friends or relatives for the holidays! Wrigleyville is the best place to party before during and after the game, no matter who’s playing. This studio feels more like a mini one-bedroom, and has all the character of a classic Chicago apartment. The only space closed off to you is a storage closet, otherwise the whole place is yours! There is laundry in the building, and a few gyms in the neighborhood. There is not a gym in the building. I’m always available by phone or text or email! Depending on my schedule the day that you get in, we may meet so I can give you your key. This apartment is 20 minutes from downtown by el train. The Addison red line is a four minute walk away! O’hare is not a far drive either. 3 minutes from bus stops, 4 minutes from the Addison red line train, easily accessible
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is 20 minutes from downtown by el train. The Addison red line is a four minute walk away! O’hare is not a far drive either.
notes: Make sure I send you a 1 minute video about walking into the building. GPS systems tend to send you to the alley of my building instead of the front door.
transit: 3 minutes from bus stops, 4 minutes from the Addison red line train, easily accessible by Uber, Lyft, or cab. Divvy bikes nearby. You’re also about 15 minutes walk from the lakefront. Great brunch locations as well! This apartment is less than a 30 minute L ride downtown, and it’s on the edge of Wrigleyville and Boystown. There’s always something to do or somewhere to go in this neighborhood!

name: Spacious 3 BR Home Is The Place For Your Group!
summary: This very spacious 3 bedroom home is the spot for your group to stay when visiting Chicago! Fully functional kitchen and a garage parking space are included. Just a half mile from the United Center, 3 miles from Millennium Park and Downtown Chicago.  World renown restaurants located on "Restaurant Row" in the West Loop are only about a mile away. Easy access to I-290.  The Western stop of the Blue Line is less than a 1/2 mile away. Pete's upscale grocery market is just two blocks away .
space: This is a duplex set up. The main level where you enter has a nicely remodeled open kitchen with stove, microwave, coffee maker, etc. This is stocked with dishes, utensils, pots & pans, etc. Coffee and Tea also provided. This floor also has a dining table as well as bar area with a couple of stools. The  living room area has a nice couch, a comfortable chair, and a Smart TV with Roku so that you can stream your Netflix, HBO, ESPN, etc.  On the same floor down the same hallway there are 3 very good sized bedrooms (all with Queen Size Mattresses) and as well as couple of full bathrooms. This is a great set up if anyone in your group has a tough time climbing stairs There is also finished basement that has a pull out sofa and there is a washer/dryer if you need to do some laundry.

notes: The house is wired with wifi/internet service. Also the television will allow you to stream your favorite channels like Netflix, HBO, Watch ESPN, etc. via Smart TV with Roku I will also provide you with towels, bed sheets & linens, pillows, hair dryer, iron, etc. *********Finally please be aware that we do have a strictly enforced No Party/No Unauthorized Visitors Policy in place and do monitor vigilantly and are in close contact with our neighbors so we know very quickly if a booking is in violation of that policy. If you book dates and hold a party, we will cancel, issue no refunds and charge for each person who entered the property, as well as any additional cleaning fees. We want you to enjoy your stay but having a party is simply not worth trying.
access: This is a 2 Unit townhouse that is separated into private units. You will have access to the first floor unit and have access to everything here. There is a back deck that is property of the neighbors upstairs that you will not be allowed to use during your stay.
interaction: Typically I like to meet my guests when they arrive to get them into the house, situated and answer any questions you may have. If I cannot meet you I do have a lock box set up with detailed instructions for you to get in which has worked well in the past with other guests. Usually you can check out on your own and just leave the keys inside.
house_rules: - 1. Check-in time is any time after 3 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance.   2. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine.   3. Parties or excessive noise are not allowed.   4. The kitchen is fully functional and has pots, pans, plates, cups, glasses etc. available for your use. If you do decide to cook while here you must return the kitchen it's original clean condition upon checking out, meaning all pots and pans, dishes, etc must be cleaned. There is a dishwasher and dishwasher detergent pods are located under the kitchen sink. If location is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $75 for every extra hour of cleaning required.   5. Guests are not allowed to book a stay in their city of residence.   6. Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premis

name: Loft apt, bus to Navy Pier, mins f United Center
summary: Loft style apartment near Humboldt Park minutes from the United Center and the Medical District, and next to bus stop that goes directly to Navy Pier. Newly renovated kitchen. Free washer and dryer on site. Additionally we also rent cars out on the Turo app, so there are cars available for rent on-site. Any rentals over 30 days will need to sign a separate, standard Chicago rental agreement as well.
space: Beautiful loft style apartment with exposed bricks and beams. Living  room window looks directly out onto Willis (Sears) Tower. Decor is industrial chic. Newly renovated kitchen. 1 block from a large park, and a playground and pool on the block. Bus stop at the corner goes direct to Navy Pier, easy to get an Uber or Lyft from here, or rent a car from us on the Turo app. Security cameras on the perimeter and common areas, none in your private apartment.

neighborhood_overview: Funky cool neighborhood with lots of cool bars and restaurants nearby. Let us know what you like and we can make recommendations! 25 minutes from Wrigley Field. 20 minutes from Soldier Field. 10 minutes from United Center. 15 minutes from the Medical District.  25 minutes from Navy Pier.  20 minutes from Museum Campus. 20 minutes from Guaranteed Rate Field (White Sox).
notes: This is a second floor apartment with stairs to access the unit. There are perimeter and common area cameras, but none in the unit.
transit: Public buses at the end of the block, Uber and Lyft readily available, and we also offer car rentals on the Turo app.  12 miles or about 30 minutes from O'Hare airport / Rosemont area (depending on traffic). 10 miles or about 30 minutes from Midway Airport.
access: You'll have the full apartment to yourself, and laundry on the back indoor porch area. The deck is closed for now. You are welcome in the backyard area, but there is currently no seating.
interaction: We live right below the unit and are as available as the guest prefers.
house_rules: Please reasonably pick up after yourself, including dishes etc. Additionally, when you leave please place all sheets and towels that have been used in the washing machine.  Any stays over 30 days may require a standard Chicago rental agreement as well. Visitors that are coming and going between midnight and 6 am will be considered overnight guests and we reserve the right to charged accordingly.
host_about: Tony and I (Sarah) are renting out the apartment above our home. We live downstairs, so we will be around if you need anything, but it is a separate apartment so you have complete privacy. Additionally we have several Turo car rentals on-site if you need a way to get around while you are visiting Chicago. I can't post the link here, but I can send it to you if you ask. We look forward to hosting you!

name: QUIET, CLEAN PLACE FOR 3 GUESTS, 5 MIN TO DOWNTOWN
summary: Cleanliness is key here! Perfect room for 3 people in the heart of Chicago with FREE parking. You will have your own door code and may arrive at ANY time you would like starting 2 p.m. and as late as you wish, EASY self check-in guaranteed.  I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like. The neighborhood is very QUIET & SAFE, even at night!
space: Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 5 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!) The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock the door.  > Fits 3 people!  > The back deck has a beautiful view of the Willis Tower > QUIET UIC/ Little Italy area > Free parking provided: park BEFORE your check-in and stay parked AFTER your check-out if you would like.
