neighborhood_overview: 100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.
transit: "Racine" blue line is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking).  -Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 5 minutes to downtown. -O'Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 40 minutes to O’Hare. -Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 45 minutes to Midway. -Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)
house_rules: Please read your check-in instructions carefully Please no overstaying past your checkout time
host_about:
Hello! My name is Natalia, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, Marina, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an investment banker in the loop. 

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

name: private room King bed (K3)
summary: Halfway between O'Hare and the Loop, private bedroom/bathroom in a sunny third floor walkup apartment, with HUGE walk-in shower, access to fully appointed kitchen, queen bed, Washer/dryer, Wi-Fi internet, premier cable TV/Netflix, all amenities. Blue Line or street parking. Please check map before booking.
space: A luxurious private queen sized bed in a spacious 3rd floor walk up (no elevator) in a huge, sunny 4 bedroom apartment with 1.5 bath. Totally gut-rehabbed in 2014.  You will have the master bedroom. You are welcome to use the fully equipped kitchen; just clean up after yourself. You will enjoy super fast Wi-Fi internet, premium cable TV/Netflix and a 50 inch smart TV. Please check the map before you book. This is great access to freeway and close to O'Hare and short drive to hot spots down town, even closer to Bucktown, Wicker Park, really close to Logan Square but NOT walking distance to much.

Guests have full access to the kitchen and living areas.   But you do not have access to t
neighborhood_overview: It's green and shaded. Located down the street from a 2.5 acre park—Mayfair. And it's really quiet with friendly neighbors. Beautiful tree lined streets with lots of kids and people walking their pets.  Many of our neighbors have lived here for over 30 years and now their children are moving back. You will see bungalows being remodeled with a second story addition, and tear-downs getting replaced with big houses. Within a few blocks there are an amazing and diverse number of churches, temples and mosques. Plenty of groceries, pharmacies, restaurants and entertainment half a mile or so away, but this is more of a residential neighborhood, not the kinetic pace of the urban/mixed use neighborhoods closer in. Four blocks from Mayfair Park.  Nearby are Independence Park (accessible on the Blue Line at Irving Park) and Portage Park (2 miles west and south from here and also on Irving Park Boulevard),  both of which run great farmer's markets on several Sundays through October. There is a gre
notes: Street parking out front. (Free, but watch for monthly street cleaning sign).   Groceries are a short drive away, about half a mile, several places—easiest is Jewel on Cicero Ave and Irving Park Road, where you will find a Sears, and several other shops in a strip mall.   I really prefer the fruit & vegetable market on Cicero Ave, between Irving Park & Montrose (it's closer than Jewel, fresher, and even has a butcher shop—but Mayfair Park is only four blocks and there are churches and temples and mosques nearby. There is a great sports bar two blocks away and several pubs and a well known Karaoke place.  And three blocks away is a famous burger stand and soft serve joint (Susie's) that's open 24 hours!  Great Middle Eastern restaurant a few blocks away. And I order pizza all the time from Saparinos.  If you really want to experience the "foodie" part of Chicago, it's a short drive or L train to Logan Square, or Armitage & Western or to North Ave & Damen, where you can find several hund
transit: Blue line: Montrose stop (6 blocks away) Bus: 78 Montrose (2 blocks south) Brown Line (over a mile away). Really easy actually. It's about a 10  minute walk, with luggage,  to the Blue Line which goes to the Loop in 25 min or outbound to O'Hare in about 20.  The Montrose bus is two blocks away and a 25 min ride to the beachfront at Lake Michigan or to the Brown Line.  The Lawrence Ave bus is a few blocks north and travels east about a mile to the Brown Line (or all the way to the lakefront, too). Brown Line goes to the Loop and stops a couple of blocks from Michigan Avenue as well, with stops along the way at DePaul or Lincoln Park or Old Town. You can transfer to the Red Line from the Brown Line at Belmont or Fullerton and go to the Apple Store Lincoln Park or keep going  and get off at Grand to walk over to North Michigan Avenue or on to State Street and all that provides. If you are traveling by car, your GPS will find us easily.
access: Guests have full access to the kitchen and living areas.   But you do not have access to the 4th bedroom/back office. I work there  on weekdays, and I will generally be gone from the rest of the flat at other times. This listing is for the master bedroom.  However, the apartment is fully furnished for a large family, with a twin daybed in one room, bunks in another for when my kids come to stay. If you want the whole place we can make it available in between their visits. It is listed on AirBnB as "Mayfair 3BR" If you want a completely separate space, I have a 2 bedroom, 1 bath garden apartment in the same building listed on AirBnb as "Mayfair 2 BR I94/90/BlueLine"
interaction: You can always call or text me. I am available for anything related to the apartment or the community. Just reach out. This is a self contained flat and you will have full access to it for your stay. I live in the building and am available if you want to chat about things to do, places to see, or how to get around.  Or you can be entirely on your own. You will find a guide to our favorite things to do and places to go inside the "book" box on the  coffee table and part of it is included in the neighobrhood description below.
house_rules: We completely renovated the nearly 100 year old building in 2014. All new plumbing, water service, mechanicals, floors, new bath rooms with huge walk in shower and fully appointed kitchen with new appliances, Kuerig coffee maker (a wide selection of k coup coffee and tea bags), toaster (we provide the bread and muffins)  etc. So everything works.   Regarding our old building: You will hear the tenants downstairs moving around and they will hear you if you have the TV or music turned up or if you have loud voices or stomp around. Please moderate your sound, including your footsteps, so that we minimize disturbing the neighbors, especially after 10pm. We welcome families with children, however we do not rent to individuals or groups under the age of 21.   No drugs, no smoking.  If you smoke, there is a $500 cleaning fee. If you do drugs? We will ask you to leave.  Pets may be allowed if we discuss it beforehand.  If you bring a pet, we require a $250 security deposit for the pet, in addi
host_about:
I am a divorced father of four. That's my three youngest kids in the scooter sidecar with me. My oldest is all grown up and just graduated from law school in Texas. 
I worked for Apple. I currently consult with companies about technology/internet/social media/marketing/branding. We own the entire building and I work and live (some of the time) on the third floor with tenants on first floor. We use AirBnB for the Garden Apartment (totally private), the second floor is a hostel style AirBnB, and upstairs on the 3rd floor we have up to three bedrooms that are available most days and every other weekend (when my kids are not staying with me).
I enjoy going on bike rides to the beach with my kids, and my girlfriend and her kids. I love to read and I am a tech geek. I am a coffee OR tea drinker and after drinking both black for almost forty years, I have started using cream in them — a habit I picked up in Nairobi, Kenya a couple years ago when I was doing some missionary work (plus my girlfriend uses cream and so I have no choice). 
If I had to pick some things I can't live without: my girlfriend (and her boys); my kids; my technology; my morning coffee; my fellowship; and my friends. And I love to watch movies. Old. New. Comedy. Mystery. Action. It doesn't matter. I like them all. 
I enjoy working out — lifting weights and riding a bike, plus I am a life-long swimmer. I also just started playing hockey! At age 52! Crazy. 
We have been hosting guests for three years now. We have over 141 reviews. We are a SuperHost. We love this. And we are really good at it.
I am a pretty laid back guy. I like things to be neat and tidy, but it's hard to do without motivation. AirBnB has been the motivation to get our place all tricked out and we are very proud of it. We hope you will enjoy staying here. All of our units are in a great neighborhood—in a great city. We have lots of suggestions for fun stuff to do, not the typical touristy stuff, but cool Chicago things that Chicagoans like to do/see.

name: Chill Like a Local- Fun Bucktown/Logan Square Spot
summary: Welcome! As long-time AirBnB users since 2013, we're pumped to open our own home to you as you explore the Chicago we've come to know and love. Our large + sunny 2 bed/1 bath apartment is perfect for solo travelers, best friends, and couples! Located on the edge of the Bucktown and Logan Square neighborhoods, you could spend your entire stay here checking out the local scene or walk 10 minutes to catch the Blue Line. Let us help make your stay unique and fun with personal recs. All are welcome!
space: Our cozy apartment is on the 3rd floor of our 4 unit building. Unfortunately, the building is not handicap accessible and you must be able to climb 2 flights of stairs since it is a pre-war building with no elevator. A fully furnished and updated kitchen is available for guests to share and/or cook with us. You'll have your own dedicated space for groceries or snacks in the cabinets, fridge, and freezer for longer stays. If you're here for a quick trip, we hope you'll help yourself to any of the free local breakfast, coffee, or tea options that are available.

neighborhood_overview: Both Logan Square and Bucktown are vibrant neighborhoods with no shortage of things to check out and do! Check out Bucktown for some great brunch or lunch spots, boutique shopping, and night clubs. Logan has historically been a haven for artists and designers alike. You'll find no shortage of local coffee shops, breweries, and street murals. The 606, an elevated 2.7 mile park and trail-way, connects both neighborhoods and is great if you want to safely walk, bike, or run through the city.
transit: If driving into the city, our place is located conveniently near I-94. Once you arrive, feel free to park in our off-street parking spot to avoid those pesky parking tickets and take the CTA Blue Line (~10 min walk) or the 74 Fullerton and 49 Western busses (<5 min walk) i
access: You'll have full access to the shared living room, kitchen, bathroom, and back patio.
interaction: As busy young professionals, we'll mostly be out of the apartment during the day. Feel free to connect with us  through the app throughout your stay when we're not home.
house_rules: Please remember to take off your shoes before entering at the front or back doorway. If cooking or using the kitchen, clean up after yourself by either washing your dishes and storing them in the drying rack or putting them in the dishwasher for us to clean later.
host_about: MD/PhD Student. Lifelong midwesterner. I enjoy exploring a city as a local, finding places that might not rise to the top of a yelp list but are total gems. Married to a fantastic partner who loves exploring with me.

summary: Come stay in our convenient and cozy apartment. You'll be close to downtown Chicago, with the benefit of a quiet, friendly neighborhood atmosphere. Do you have family or friends to visit on the north side and want to be close by? Coming for an event and don't want a downtown hotel? Our place is perfect! We have a clean cozy space waiting for you.  Please,  - No student film projects - No parties
space: Our cozy one bedroom garden unit has a queen size futon and air mattress as well. There is a full kitchen available to you to cook whatever you'd like, or walk to a dozen wonderful restaurants! There is a family who lives on the first floor of the building right above this unit so we cannot guarantee your stay will be completely silent as family life is often full of sounds during daytime hours.

summary: LARGE BEDROOM in LUXURY Lakeview APT, professionally designed & decorated CLEAN & GREAT LOCATION!  Cleanliness and anticipating guests needs are top priority. Self serve breakfast included, coffee maker and full amenity list available ALL included Shared space is large, open, clean and comfortable.
space: If you require 3 guest accommodations, the living room easily converts w king bed & large sectional sofa.  In that instance I would then be in main bedroom.  55”& 50” Samsung flat screen Smart TV’s in living room and bedroom, respectively. Living room has surround sound and there is 5G high speed WiFi throughout.  The apartment a unique layout for Chicago, (no shotgun style) and is open with a circular floor plan, allowing for private entry to bathroom from either bedroom or living room.  This affords you total privacy if desired. Previously rented entire apartment with superhost status. 4.9 rating over 2 years, w all excellent reviews. Top comments were: exceptional cleanliness, good communication and beautiful space.

Walking distance to all the major spots: Wrigley Field, Lake Michigan, Boystown &  Red Line CTA (Sheridan Stop) Highly desirable location, and neighborhood. Access to anything and everything. Apt is a refreshing retreat-style oasis from the bustle of the City
notes: Private Parking is available in the gated lot  with access only via remote opener or building key.  $35per night would be charged in addition to the nightly rate.  This is accessible through the apartments back door as opposed to front (which puts you out to Broadway Street).
transit: 10 minute walk to CTA Red Line (Sheridan Stop). Divy Bicycle rental station at the end of the block on N. Broadway and Sheridan RD. Easy curbside access w. loading zone right in front of building entrance for Uber/Lyft/Cabs to load/unload.  Chicago CTA Bus stop at end of block as well.  Gated parking available w separate entrance using back side of apt. Additional nightly fee w multiple night discounts apply.  Lake Shore Drive/US41 .25 mile from apartment via Irving Park Rd/US19.  Walking access to Lake Michigan, Sydney R. Marovitz Golf Course, & walking/biking trails along recreation drive.  Great Mexican restaurant in the building two doors down, Dunkin Donuts across the street, new Starbucks at the end of the block on East side of Broadway !  Apartment has an unbeatable location, while not facing broadway, so it is quiet at night. The building layout has this apartment very isolated, only neighbor is upstairs and they are rarely heard. Remax office below, non residential.  Afternoon
access: Gated Private-parking is available behind building which you will get the garage door opener to operate the gate . parking is not included in nightly rate.  Please let me know if you are interested or in need of parking.

name: Lovely Gold Coast Convertible w/ Terrace near the L by Blueground
summary: Discover the best of Chicago, with this one-bedroom Gold Coast apartment with balcony views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this airy Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, pretty living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (#CHI82)
space: As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this one-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Chicago vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry. Amenities Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:    - Doorman - Pet Friendly - Gym - Indoor Parking - Roof Deck - Garden - Elevator

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is in the historic Gold Coast district. The area is located just north of downtown Chicago, nestled against the Lake Michigan shoreline. Considered one of the most affluent neighborhoods in the country, the Gold Coast is every upscale shopper’s dream. The retail revelry on Oak and Rush Streets includes swanky boutiques and rare, designer fashions. There are many celebrated restaurants to try, including Michelin-starred winners and classic Chicago steakhouses. Amongst the prestigious hotels and celebrated eateries, there is a trove of booming nightlife hot spots and high-energy events.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $265 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Heart of Bucktown steps to 606 Trail
summary: This Bright 2 Bedroom Apartment in an unbeatable location is 1/2 Block to the 606 Jog-or-Bike Trail.   Blue Line to airports and Chicago Loop; International Destination in Chicago's Trendiest Hot Spot; walk to Pubs, Restaurants, Entertainment and shopping within blocks.   Bike rental on every other corner, so you can ride the 606 trail and the neighborhood.  This is the full apartment  with an East facing exposure in a 2nd floor location.   Bathroom renovated January 2018.
space: Apartment is in a 100 year building is newly renovated, very bright; has new oak floors and tile in kitchen, with 2 bedrooms.  Wifi, TV has Roku and Netflix. There is a coin laundry in the building, air conditioning, central heat, old claw foot tub with shower, and a dishwasher.  There is an large exterior deck over the top of garage.  Apt is clean, quiet and peaceful.  One cup coffee maker, high chair, hair dryer and iron in apt.

Apt is clean, quiet and peaceful.  One cup coffee maker, high chair, hair dryer and iron in apt. You will have direct access to the apartment from the street side of building up one fl
neighborhood_overview: The Bucktown community is unique as it is located between O'Hare airport and the central Business area known as the Loop; 10 minutes to the Loop and 30 minutes to O'Hare Airport.  Midway Airport is also accessible via the Blue Line, about 25 minutes.
notes: This apartment is in a 100 year old well cared for building, and if you are expecting a commercial setting like you would find in a hotel, this may not be for you.  The neighborhood is low density with street parking very easy.  You can normally park right in front of the building.  There is no parking permit required.  1 Block to Bloomingdale trail (The 606) for jogging, biking or walking on 2.7 mile unobstructed trail free from street traffic, it sits above the streets on a once-upon-a-time industrial rail line.   Unbeatable night life, dining, shopping and much more in every direction.
transit: The apartment is 4 blocks from the Blue line public transit, 1 block to a bus, and there are bicycle rental stations every couple of blocks.  There is a fantastic pub 3 blocks, The Map Room, which was rated by GQ Magazine as the Best Pint in Chicago.  There are restaurants of every variety within walking distance in any direction.  The business area of Bucktown is one block and consists of shops of a variety of choices, as well as nightly entertainment and a wide variety of restaurants.   Welcome to Chicago and Enjoy.
access: You will have direct access to the apartment from the street side of building up one flight of stairs.  The morning sun filters into the East facing apartment through the leaves of the tree outside to the East, and in the afternoon, the sun fills the kitchen.
interaction: I live across the street and am a hands-on manager; always available for your needs.  Building is in a six flat.  Neighborhood is filled with young families, babies and dogs.  Shops, restaurants and clubs in every direction and the 606 Bloomingdale Trail is 1 block from apt.
house_rules: We expect you to treat the apartment and the neighborhood as if it were your own, respecting the neighbors and maintaining the apartment in a clean condition.  We clean the apartment and linens after every booking.  We have waste baskets in the kitchen and bath.  We like to provide flowers; refreshments in the refrigerator are for your enjoyment; we have coffee and tea also.  While the couch is a pull out, we do not want you to use it because it damages the bamboo flooring; please respect this.
host_about: I am a member of the American Institute of Architects, a real estate broker, and an importer and distributor of French wines and spirits.  I manage several rental properties, one of which is now an AirBnB.  I am a private collector of rare Armagnac and Cognac in Chicago.  I live across the street from this AirBnB.  We go to Ireland every chance we get, as we are both duel citizens; born here with Foreign Citizenship there. I have been an AirBnB host for 3 years.    My wife is a paramedic with a Chicago private ambulance company.  My wife and I love Netflix and the old time movies.

name: Close to Downtown and United Center
summary: Private room & bath in a large single-family residence close to Downtown Chicago! In West Town, close walk to popular restaurants, bars, shopping! Free street parking! Amenities incl. kitchen/dining, deck, cable, hi-spd internet, laundry, towels.
space: Located in West Town neighborhood, this is a newly restored single-family residence with a clean personal space. Close to Downtown. Park for free on the street! Walk to the buses on Grand Ave (Route 65) or Chicago Ave (Route 66) to get downtown in 20 minutes!
description: Private room & bath in a large single-family residence close to Downtown Chicago! In West Town, close walk to popular restaurants, bars, shopping! Free street parking! Amenities incl. kitchen/dining, deck, cable, hi-spd internet, laundry, towels. Located in West Town neighborhood, this is a newly restored single-family residence with a clean personal space. Close to Downtown. Park for free on the street! Walk to the buses on Grand Ave (Route 65) or Chicago Ave (Route 66) to get downtown in 20 minutes! Living room, kitchen, dining room, washer/dryer, rear garage deck, personal room, personal bathroom, powder room (half bath). Feel free to ask questions about the neighborhood. name: Logan Square Apartment, Free Street Parking
summary: Live like a local and save on accommodations! We are located in a quiet, residential neighborhood on the NW side of Logan Square in Chicago. Vibrant dining, shopping and nightlife are easily accessible along Milwaukee Ave as well as several surrounding trendy neighborhoods (like Wicker Park, Bucktown and Avondale). The Blue Line train is a comfortable 15 minute walk and will take you in the direction of downtown or O'hare airport. Rental bikes are located in the park across the street!
space: Welcome to our home! Our bright and spacious basement apartment comfortably sleeps two in a full bed. We provide fresh linens and towels for each guest and offer complimentary french press coffee. We invite you to browse our large collection of art, fiction and cook books during your stay! Please keep in mind that it is very typical in older Chicago homes to hear movement from upstairs units and ours is no different. The tenants in the apartment directly above are very courteous and respectful but they do keep regular working hours and you will likely hear them moving around from time to time.  **If you are traveling with a third person we can provide an extra twin size cot. Please note the cot is comfortable but nothing fancy (think camping cot). There are no additional fees for a third guest.
description: Live like a local and save on accommodations! We are located in a quiet, residential neighborhood on the NW side of Logan Square in Chicago. Vibrant dining, shopping and nightlife are easily accessible along Milwaukee Ave as well as several surrounding trendy neighborhoods (like Wicker Park, Bucktown and Avondale). The Blue Line train is a comfortable 15 minute walk and will take you in the direction of downtown or O'hare airport. Rental bikes are located in the park across the street! Welcome to our home! Our bright and spacious basement apartment comfortably sleeps two in a full bed. We provide fresh linens and towels for each guest and offer complimentary french press coffee. We invite you to browse our large collection of art, fiction and cook books during your stay! Please keep in mind that it is very typical in older Chicago homes to hear movement from upstairs units and ours is no different. The tenants in the apartment directly above are very courteous and respectful but they d
neighborhood_overview: We are located in a residential area on the northwest side of Logan Square. The immediate area is a great community of families and young professionals. Across the street from our home is Koz Park, which has a tennis court, indoor swimming pool, playground, jogging/walking path and tons of green space. There is a great neighborhood coffee shop a block away and a handful of fun grocery stores within walking distance.  The heart of Logan Square's amazing restaurants and bars, a fantastic farmer's market on Sundays and a historic movie theater are all a 15 minute walk or quick 5 minute ride on the Diversey bus. Other popular neighborhoods like Humboldt Park, Avondale, Wicker Park, Ukrainian Village, West Town, Lincoln Park, Lakeview and of course the downtown area are all easily accessible via nearby public transit.
transit: /TRAIN/ 15 minute walk to the Logan Square Blue Line station which services O'hare airport and downtown /BUS/ Diversey, Fullerton, Milwaukee, Kimball and Pulaski are all bus lines that service large parts of the city and are all within 5 minutes of the apartment.  /DIVVY BIKES/ Pay as you go bikes are located in the park across the street and, weather permitting, this is hands down our recommended method of travel for exploring Chicago! /UBER & LYFT/ Ride shares are plentiful and easy to come by! /FOOT/ The neighborhood is very walkable and we definitely recommend exploring! /CAR/ While we can't speak for other areas in the city, free street parking in our neighborhood is easy. You may not always get something directly out front but you can certainly find something within a block from the apartment.
access: The apartment is one of three units in the building. Everything within the apartment is accessible, as well as the shared laundry room in the back of the building.
interaction: My family and I live in a separate apartment on the top floor of the building and you may see us come and go. I'm always available to answer questions or assist with anything but will otherwise leave you to enjoy your stay!
house_rules: We love a good party but ask that guests not bring it home with them! Please be courteous of our neighbors and keep noise levels reasonable.
host_about:
Hi! We are a young family living in Chicago's northwest neighborhood of Logan Square. We met shortly after moving here to attend college 12 years ago and have been busy making Chicago our home ever since. Brad is originally from Michigan and Leah is an American who grew up in southern Germany. Over the years we have gotten to know this city pretty well and are excited to be raising our family in such a culturally diverse part of the world. 

We enjoy travel, cooking, biking around the city and are eager gardeners in the making. We actively participate in neighborhood organizations and very much enjoy meeting the many wonderful people who work hard to make our community what it is. 

We are new to hosting and look forward to opening up our lovely home to fellow travelers who are looking for comfortable and cozy family friendly accommodations.

name: Cozy sailboat in urban harbor
summary: Enjoy our cozy sailboat and enjoy the skyline views. We're moored in a quiet harbor next to Chicago's Museum Campus and Soldier Field late April thru October. Ask about our pre-season booking discount for the 2018 season!
space: The boat offers a convertible main salon and two berths, a limited galley, and the deck for relaxation and lounging.  The skyline views are fantastic both day and night. The outdoor speakers will broadcast either radio or your device. The Navy Pier fireworks are in view on Wednesday and Saturday nights.
description: Enjoy our cozy sailboat and enjoy the skyline views. We're moored in a quiet harbor next to Chicago's Museum Campus and Soldier Field late April thru October. Ask about our pre-season booking discount for the 2018 season! The boat offers a convertible main salon and two berths, a limited galley, and the deck for relaxation and lounging.  The skyline views are fantastic both day and night. The outdoor speakers will broadcast either radio or your device. The Navy Pier fireworks are in view on Wednesday and Saturday nights. You have access to the whole boat and its adjacent dock. Feel free to store your perishables in the fridge. In addition to the on-board 'head', more traditional facilities, including showers and laundry, are a short walk away. If you have a vehicle, we have a parking pass for the lot just outside the dock. We will conduct in-person check ins and go over everything you need to know.  We're close by so feel free to call if you have any questions. We are a 10 minute walk
notes: It is a rather high step up to get on/off board and then down into the cabin. If you're lacking agility and can't make the step up or the small jump down then this might not be the right place for your stay.  Bottled water is provided.
transit: We are a 10 minute walk to the Field Museum where many cabs are available, a 15-20 minute walk to south Michigan Ave for several CTA bus routes, and another block further to the 'el' trains. There are also 2-3 nearby Divvy stations where bikes are available for rent.
access: You have access to the whole boat and its adjacent dock. Feel free to store your perishables in the fridge. house_rules: 1. No smoking, no exceptions. 2. The head is delicate... Do not put anything in that you haven't eaten plus 4 squares of TP at one time. 3. The stove is not available for use. 4. Please do not entertain more than 10 people, including those in your party.

name: One bedroom entire apartment by the lake!
summary: Modern and comfortable our apartment is 3 minutes walking to the red L train & just a few blocks from the lake. Our home is great if you’re passing through or want to experience Chicago like a local. There are plenty of places to eat many local restaurants & coffee shops just around the corner including Starbucks, Subway, & Dunkin’ Donuts if you want something quick. Two great little markets on our block if you prefer to make yourself breakfast. Whole Foods & Aldi’s close by. Many food options.
space: One bedroom apartment with a sofa bed and a couch both pretty comfortable...I’ve slept on both! Feel free to use the dishwasher to make your life easier. Full kitchen at your disposal.

neighborhood_overview: Several parks for kids within walking distance! Or just enjoy walking around the neighborhood people are very friendly here.
transit: L train is 3 minutes walking along with other buses that go to downtown. Uber is very easy, they can even pull into the driveway if you need to unload something quickly. If renting a car you’ll have to park on the street, usually there are spaces available not too far away and there are “Pay to Park” spaces that are free from 10pm until 8am the next morning. Shouldn’t be too difficult.

host_about: Running on coffee and sleep deprivation haha but I love to travel with my husband and son so here we are! I love Airbnb and think it's one of the most brilliant ideas of our time! I want to ensure that everyone has a good and comfortable stay hosts and guests alike.

host_about:
I am a professor, writer, and evangelist on behalf of all the arts.  That I love to travel may go without saying--but I am also as enamored of Chicago as I was the day I arrived, way back in 1986.  Let me guide you to the manifold delights of this world-class jewel of a city, sited on the shores of Lake Michigan:  its restaurants, museums, dance clubs and saloons; its parks and recreation!

Two representative quotes:

"Without music, life is a mistake."--Friedrich Nietzsche

"Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend.  Inside of a dog, it's too dark to read."--Groucho Marx

name: ❤️$1400 Low Prices! Clean Cozy Apt Full Kitchen
summary: A fully furnished home for your longer stay, complete with WiFi and everything you need to live. AFFORDABLE MONTHLY RATES ARE AVAILABLE!!! APRIL - $1100 MAY - $1400 Cubs fans, deep-dish fans, and history fans unite! Chicago is a fabulous getaway city for any interest, and our spacious studio apartment is the ideal place to stay while you’re here. Featuring modern decor, a full kitchen, and access to a 24/7 gym, your time in Chi-Town will be comfortable and convenient.
space: In the heart of trendy Uptown Chicago, our sophisticated 2-bedroom apartment is the perfect launchpad for Windy City adventures or clinching that important business deal. Whatever brings you to town, you’ll rest easy in our charming, quiet neighborhood with easy access to the Red Line train to take you south to Downtown or north to Loyola and Evanston. Illuminated by sunny natural light, our two bedrooms feature Queen-size beds, premium linens, and plenty of closet space so you can unpack and forget about your suitcase for a while. Enjoy the privacy of your own room, with doors that close and independently controlled air-conditioning units. In the living room, our couch unfolds into a Queen-size sofa bed - though it’s a lot more comfortable than your average pull-out! The apartment includes one full bathroom, with a shower/tub combo, sink, and toilet. We’re all about helping you look (and smell) your best, so we provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in addition to hand soap and f
description: A fully furnished home for your longer stay, complete with WiFi and everything you need to live. AFFORDABLE MONTHLY RATES ARE AVAILABLE!!! APRIL - $1100 MAY - $1400 Cubs fans, deep-dish fans, and history fans unite! Chicago is a fabulous getaway city for any interest, and our spacious studio apartment is the ideal place to stay while you’re here. Featuring modern decor, a full kitchen, and access to a 24/7 gym, your time in Chi-Town will be comfortable and convenient. In the heart of trendy Uptown Chicago, our sophisticated 2-bedroom apartment is the perfect launchpad for Windy City adventures or clinching that important business deal. Whatever brings you to town, you’ll rest easy in our charming, quiet neighborhood with easy access to the Red Line train to take you south to Downtown or north to Loyola and Evanston. Illuminated by sunny natural light, our two bedrooms feature Queen-size beds, premium linens, and plenty of closet space so you can unpack and forget about your suitcase fo
neighborhood_overview: If you’re searching for Chicago history and culture, but you also want to get a good night’s sleep without the non-stop noise of Downtown, Uptown is your ‘hood. Uptown is slightly north of Downtown, and just a mile west of Montrose Beach and Lake Shore Drive. It’s safe, a little historic, a little trendy, and a perfect home base for any Chi-Town getaway. Our apartment is within walking distance of coffee shops (including a Starbucks), banks, and grocery stores. More information This hip neighborhood features old-school Chicago gems like the famed Riviera Theatre, the much-loved Fat Cat Restaurant & Bar, and easy access to Wrigley Field and Downtown via the Red Line from Lawrence Station. With plenty of good restaurants, vibrant bars, and exciting venues, you might find yourself not even wanting to venture downtown! Some of our favorite nearby restaurants include Fat Cat, where you can indulge in tasty pub grub over a game of pool, and Demera, an Ethiopian restaurant serving top-notch c
notes: WIFI service is an open connection  provided by the building management and is in the works of upgrading it. Outages may be experienced from time to time while the upgrade is on going. As of this moment, the service is NOT SUITABLE for remote work and can only cater mobile/portable devices. We highly recommend keeping your key fob in a safe place, because if you lose it, you’ll lose access to the entire building. Not fun. It takes time to replace it, which means you might be locked out of the building and the apartment for a while, and any fob replacement will incur a fee of $300. That’s probably not what you have in mind for a “memorable” trip to Chicago, so let’s just keep track of the fob. Our apartment includes lots of awesome amenities, but it does NOT include a parking space. If you need to park a vehicle, there is some metered street parking nearby. We recommend using the Spot Hero app to claim a street parking space. The city is easily accessible with public transit and ridesha
transit: Unless you’re really into parallel parking or overpriced meters, we recommend using public transportation to explore Chi-town. Our place is just a 5-minute walk to both the Argyle and Lawrence stations, where you can catch the Red Line. The Red Line will take you straight to Wrigley Field (7 minutes), or keep on riding for about 15 more minutes to access the best of Downtown. Grant/State Station is most convenient to the tasty restaurants of River North, and Lake Station puts you just 3 blocks from the Bean. P.S. Locals call the subway the “L.” Public transit is also an easy way to get to our place from O’Hare Airport, especially during rush hour. Hop on the Blue Line at the airport, and switch to the #51 bus at the Jefferson Park Transit Center. You’ll go from baggage claim to beautiful condo in only an hour! If ridesharing is more your style, Uber and Lyft are available throughout the Chicago metro. Keep in mind that traffic can pile up Downtown during major events or rush hour, whic
access: Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours.  But that’s not all! You’ll also have access to the building’s gym (open 24/7 and stocked with cardio machines and weights) and lobby lounge area. The building’s common spaces and your unit are accessible via elevator.
interaction: We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.
house_rules: HOUSE RULES Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking: -No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250). -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. - The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am. -Lost key fee - $300 -Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc. -Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc. -Smoking - $300 -Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300 **-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat,  an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.
host_about: Sonia & Syed are Chicago Natives. We can give you recommendations for food and fun! Mother to my beautiful baby Sofia

name: Charming Bucktown Garden Apartment
summary: The apartment is located on a lower level of a four-story building on a lovely, treelined and quiet block in the historic Bucktown neighborhood.
space: Equipped with gourmet kitchen, high-end appliances, and Grohe fixtures. Decorated with stylish, comfortable furniture and one of a kind artwork to satisfy the eye and make for a pleasant and unique stay. The apartment is equipped with central air and heat.
description: The apartment is located on a lower level of a four-story building on a lovely, treelined and quiet block in the historic Bucktown neighborhood. Equipped with gourmet kitchen, high-end appliances, and Grohe fixtures. Decorated with stylish, comfortable furniture and one of a kind artwork to satisfy the eye and make for a pleasant and unique stay. The apartment is equipped with central air and heat. We will make your stay in our guest house a pleasant and memorable experience. Feel free to contact us with any questions. Within walking distance to blue line trains and several bus lines. Close to Chicago's famous restaurants, bars, boutiques, and galleries. Easy connection to/from O'Hare and Midway Airports, downtown, Lincoln Park Zoo and the many more attractions this great city has to offer. Enjoy running or walking the newly opened 606 trail located less than a block from the apartment.

Easy connection to/from O'Hare and Midway Airports, downtown, Lincoln Park Zoo and the many more attractions this great city has to offer. interaction: We will make your stay in our guest house a pleasant and memorable experience. Feel free to contact us with any questions.
house_rules: No outside guests Not suitable for pets due to severe allergies. Thank you for your understanding.
host_about:
We are a family of 3. Chicago has been our home for close to 20 years. Irena is a visual artist; Martin owns a frame studio. We love to travel; always looking for an inspiration and are always exited to meet new people. 

We have put a lot of dedication and hard work into remodeling of our spaces. We love to host somebody who will appreciate and treat the apartment as their own. Our space is very universal and will definitely satisfy your needs. It can serve a family, small group or as a romantic getaway.

summary: Show up and start living from day one in Chicago with this exquisite one-bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped The Loop home with stunning high floor views over the city. (#CHI238)

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is situated in the most dynamic and convenient place to live in Chicago, The Loop. With its endless shopping, fine dining, stunning park, river and lake views, and entertainment opportunities, everything is possible at a moment’s notice. The area is a cultural getaway for professionals and students, who can combine work with pleasure. Discover landmark buildings like the Willis Tower and The Art Institute of Chicago. Millenium Park, near Lake Michigan, is always worth a visit. The Loop is within reach of accessible transportation, offering non-stop public transit, buses, and taxis. Union Station is approximately a 10 minute train ride.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $300 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: 2 Bedrooms in the Best Location - Noble Square!
summary: Quick walk to the Division Blue line stop, and convenient to the highway-- However you're getting to Chicago, it's easy to navigate to! The two bedrooms are separate, ideal for friends traveling together. A combined living and dining space makes it a great to recharge between the experiences you have planned. The neighborhood itself is full of great restaurants, shops, and bars, so you'll have fun without trying to - book today!
space: You'll enter through the side of the building - to your right is the living and dining room, and to your left is the kitchen. Just ahead are the bedrooms, separated by a full bathroom. My place has an in-unit washer and dryer as well!

neighborhood_overview: Noble Square is a growing community filled with artists, musicians and young urban professionals, and urban dwellers are recently rediscovering the character of the area. It's very near Wicker Park and River North for a night out, and the neighborhood itself has many family-owned restaurants and shops that often reflect its European heritage.
transit: My place is 5 minutes' walk away from the Division Blue line train station, and equally convenient to the Division, Chicago, and Ashland buses - it's almost more convenient to not have a car here! If you do bring your car, however, it's pretty easy to find street parking around the apartment.
access: You'll have full access to my two-bedroom apartment, and shared access to the backyard and front patio.
house_rules: House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.   1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.  2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee.  3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.  6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per ke
host_about:
I live in Chicago and work in commercial real estate. I grew up in Taipei and I love to travel. I'm passionate about building and preserving communities. I am an AirBnb host and a traveler! When I do travel, at least once on every trip I go after a hard-to-reach destination. The challenge is all the fun. 
My favorite Chicago spot for drinks and music is the California Clipper. And if I'm downtown it's Cindy's rooftop bar.

name: Eclectic and Colorful Retro Apartment near Logan Square
summary: Make yourself at home in this warm, inviting space! Fun vintage furnishings, bright living areas with ceiling-height windows and colorful decor & unique art throughout. Brew coffee and relax at the breakfast table as you plan out your Chicago adventures, or prepare a full meal to enjoy in the dining room after a full day of sightseeing. Refresh with a hot shower in the retro bathroom complete with pink tiles and vintage Henry Dreyfuss designed sink. Plenty of space for everyone to relax and get a good night's rest. Close to public transit options so you can get on the move and explore Chicago!
space: Easily accessible 2-bedroom, first floor apartment on a laid back Avondale block. Keyless entry means simple check-in any time after 3PM. Queen and full-size beds in the bedrooms, and a sleeper sofa with a comfortable memory foam topper in the living room allow for up to six guests. The bedrooms have mirrors, closets, and dressers, and a full length mirror on the pantry door helps everyone get ready or get fancy.  Make breakfast in the equipped eat-in kitchen.  We have pots and pans, utensils, filtered water, a microwave, toaster, electric kettle and coffeemaker (with enough coffee to get you started). Or order Chicago style pizza and gather everyone around the dining room table.  Downtime? We have a TV with Roku, Netflix and HBO. Board games like Scrabble, Boggle and Cribbage, and a set of colorpens and drawing paper will keep everyone entertained. Please let us know in advance if you would like the sofa bed prepared for your arrival. We have a pack-and-play available for your baby if

The bedrooms have mirrors, closets, and dressers, and a full length mirror on the pantry door helps everyone get re
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is safe and residential; a short walk to restaurants and bars. A small grocery store is nearby for quick essentials. Catch a show at Sleeping Village, or sing karaoke at Alice's, then walk home. As ANYWHERE in the city, stay aware and use common sense when walking after dark. Street parking is free, and easy during the day, but can be hard at night. We recommend arriving during the day and staying parked, utilizing nearby public transportation or ride sharing services.
notes: We welcome travelers of all ethnic backgrounds and faiths as well as families with kids, and LGBTQ folks. You can stay in our home as long as you treat the space, your hosts and our neighbors with respect. There are so many terrific events happening in Chicago this year. Here is just a sampling of the great festivals, concerts, conferences, and sporting events. We are conveniently located near many of these via car, bicycle, public transit, or Uber/Lyft/taxis. If you have any questions about the specifics of getting to any of these events from our space, just send us an inquiry! Chicago Fringe Festival August 30 - September 10   World Music Festival Chicago September 8 - 24  PRINT® 17 McCormick Place South Sep 10-14, 2017 Riot Fest & Carnival September 15 - 17     AAHH! Fest by Common September 23 - 24 Chicago Marathon October 8 Chicago International Film Festival October 12 - 26    SOFA Art + Design Fair November 2 - 5  Realtors Conference & Expo McCormick Place West Nov 3-6, 2017 RSN
transit: We are conveniently located near the Interstate (90/94), and the CTA Blue Line (Belmont Stop) which is about a 10-12 minute walk from our front door. The Blue Line can get you to and from various locations like O'Hare Intn'l Airport (25-30 min) and Downtown Chicago (20 min). You can also transfer at various points to other train lines to access even more of the city. We are a 3-minute walk from two major bus routes (Belmont & Milwaukee). The Belmont (77) bus can take you east to other great neighborhoods like Roscoe Village and Lakeview, or as far as Lake Michigan and the beautiful park, zoo and beach areas along Lakeshore Drive. The Milwaukee (56) bus travels to Six Corners and Portage Park, or towards downtown to hip 'hoods like Logan Square and Wicker Park. We are also about 10 minutes from the Addison (152) bus which will drop you off right at Wrigley Field. There is a Divvy bike share station just two minutes from our doorstep. You can rent the bikes and easily ride to places such
access: Guests will have access to the entire first floor apartment with main entry via the front porch, and an emergency exit at the back of the building. Parking is easy to find during the day but can be hard at night. We recommend arriving during the day to find a parking spot. Please see our notes under "getting around" if you will have a car for your trip.
interaction: We live in the building (upstairs) in a separate unit, and someone will be available for most of the day, either on-site or via text.
house_rules: - YOUR ID MUST BE VERIFIED WITH AIRBNB. We require four verifications with an offline ID. We live upstairs with our child, and it is a matter of safety to know who is in our home. We do not see your ID, but it is kept on file with Airbnb. Please go to  https://www.airbnb.com/help/article/336/what-are-profile-verifications-and-how-do-i-get-them  and verify your profile with a government issued ID BEFORE you submit an inquiry or request. - You must have a complete profile that includes a photo of you. - You may not book the space for someone else. - You may not use our home for film/video/photo-shoots, amateur or professional. Our home is not available for location shooting. - No smoking, including on the front porch. - No candles - Remove muddy/snowy/wet footwear at the door. - No extra guests beyond what you booked for. If you have a situation where you need to add to your group, let us know right away. - No parties, events or loud music.  - No glitter. Please. - Please be mindful of o
host_about: I'm an active, creative dad whose family enjoys travel, camping, cooking, dining out, live music, street festivals and more. We like to immerse ourselves in local culture and generally avoid tourist-trap destinations on our adventures. We enjoy hosting in our home and look forward to sharing the many diverse experiences the great city of Chicago has to offer with our guests.

name: Cozy Living Room at Chicago West Loop
summary: There are 2 room dividers provide most privacy for you to sleep in the living room.  It's a 2B2B apt, so there are two other roommates. You share one bathroom with one roommate, but that roommate is not home often. Both roommates work at full-time jobs and are very friendly. Nearby: Whole Foods, Mariano's, French Market, food court, H-mart, Union Station, Blue Line, Chase. Apt building features: parking garage, bbq area, lounge. Both female and male are welcome, as long as keep apt clean.
space: The space is in the west loop at a very convenient location with good security.

name: Serene Space with King Sized Sleep Number Mattress
summary: Meticulously, and functionally, designed with guests in mind. Come and enjoy the comforts, and luxury, that this cozy space has to offer. Rest on a king-sized Sleep Number bed, shower in a marbled bathroom under a rain shower, or sip on a cup of coffee from your farmhouse-inspired chef's kitchen. Bright, airy, and inviting, this space will surely provide the escape that one would need after a long day in this great city of Chicago!
space: High end and unique, rear apartment, in a ranch style two unit home. No one living above, or below, you means you have the freedom, and peace and quiet, that you crave! *Separate Private Entrance and Luggage Space (Drop off prior to arrival can be arranged if needed) *Free Laundry Usage (on Tuesdays, Thursdays, Fridays, and Sundays ONLY) *Space is 520 square feet (48 m²) *Free Wifi (Includes Netflix) *Apple TV (iTunes is available for your convenience in case you'd like to order a movie in)  *KING sized SLEEP NUMBER Bed (What's Your Number?) *Queen sized plush top Serta Air Mattress  *Phillips Light Therapy Wake Up Light/Alarm Clock  *Nest Thermostat with built-in humidifier *Samsung Add-Wash Stackable washer and dryer. Just found that random dirty sock in your luggage, yet the wash has already started? No problem, just throw it in the add-wash compartment and continue on with your day.  *Alexa Assistant  *Free Street Parking (first come, first served) *Semi-Private Outdoor Space (perg

neighborhood_overview: Located in Dunning, a quiet northwest side neighborhood of Chicago. Live like a local by sampling great food and drink options within a 5-minute walk. Great for those looking to explore the sights in surrounding areas such as Rosemont, Park Ridge, O'Hare, and Elmwood Park.
notes: Please review the house rules prior to booking! *Host has multiple outdoor/exterior cameras on the premises in order to provide an extra layer of safety for guests and tenants.  *Unit entrance is located behind a privacy gate at the rear of the home. * Guests are only allowed to utilize the laundry services on set days of the week per the agreement with our other tenants. Please be courteous of all people who live  on the property. (Airbnb guest usage is limited to Tuesday, Thursday, Friday, and Sunday of every week) * We have wonderful tenants who live in the front unit. We ask that all parties who consider booking this AirBnb be respectful of the fact that this is their home 24/7. Noise levels should be kept at a respectful level. ABSOLUTELY NO PARTIES ALLOWED WHATSOEVER.
transit: Uber, Lyft, Convenient Public Transit, and use of the ample street parking. (PLEASE NOTE OUR HOME IS LOCATED ON THE EDGE OF CHICAGO AND ELMWOOD PARK). This neighborhood is very safe at night.  * 7 miles from O'Hare Airport, and 15 miles from Midway Airport * 5 miles from the Rosemont Convention Center and MB Financial Park. * 15 miles to downtown Chicago. If you plan to get around via bus and train please note that it is approximately an hour commute to downtown from my place. There is a blue line bus stop about a block away from the apartment for your convenience.  *1/2 block walk to Belmont Ave. Bus Stop with transfer to Belmont Blue Line train station at Belmont and Kimball Ave. (Blue Line station goes directly into downtown and also transfers over to other CTA train lines).
access: - Semi Private Outdoor Space  -Private Laundry Use (Sundays, Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays ONLY) -Entire Private Unit - Free Street Parking (there are no parking restrictions or permits needed for this block)
interaction: It is our ultimate goal at Dreams9 Airbnb that your stay is as welcoming and pleasant as possible. For that reason I, Eva, your host, in addition to my co-hosts Wanda and Hector (who live 2 blocks away from the property) are available, and at your service. We are a fun, travel loving, family. We will always strive to make your stay a great one! You have the option to access the property independently with a lockbox, or if you'd prefer, an in person check in/call we can arrange for that as well.
house_rules: - Any and all personal belongings, including food items and excessive trash, will need to be discarded by the guests upon check out. We ask that guests who are enjoying a longer stay ensure to throw out the trash at least once every few days to ensure that the unit stays fresh and smelling clean for all to enjoy.  - Please respect front unit tenants during quiet hours 11 pm - 7 am. - No parking on side drive - long term tenants have full access to the side drive, and garage space. - Guests who apply to book must be 21 years of age in order to be approved for a stay with us.  - Maximum of 28-day stay requests will be considered. -Any and all additional unintended/unannounced guests will be charged an automatic fee of $150 each. Please be sure to list everyone who will be staying, and if you are unsure about the policy please ask prior to your stay.
host_about: Airbnb Host, and mom, who is on a mission to provide, and experience amazing accommodations through this platform. - Cheers!

name: Huge, light filled Chicago loft!!
summary: The space is a true Chicago loft space and it is massive! A hotel room does not compare!! The loft is airy, light filled and very spacious!! You are in one of the best neighborhoods, West Loop/West Town -- close to public transit, bars, restaurants, coffee shops, Divvy bike stations, Great Lakes tattoo shop & minutes from downtown! It's easy to get around and experience all that Chicago has to offer. I've been a member of the Airbnb community since 2011 and l love the community of folks!
space: Please note: The loft is a huge, 1250 sq ft. space! You will get to experience a true Chicago loft in the heart of Chicago! The loft has an open air feel. The living room and kitchen are big and bright. The guest rooms are spacious with two queen size beds, plenty of closet space and a desk to get your work done. Each bedroom has its own private bathroom across from the room. During the warm months, you can enjoy the city views from the back porch.

Each bedroom has its own private bathroom across from the room. During the warm months, you can enjoy the city views from the back porch. The entire massive, loft space -- Guest bedrooms, bath
neighborhood_overview: Public transit is right outside the door to get you downtown, to the Lake front or to the airports quickly. There are fantastic restaurants, cocktail and coffee bars all around! The loft is right near Great Lakes Tattoo shop, so maybe get a memorable tattoo on your visit!
notes: Please note: The loft is on the third floor, top level. There is no elevator. If you have heavy bags, you will need to carry them up the stairs.
transit: You are staying in the West Loop/West Town area. Public transportation surrounds you! There are two nearby Blue line stops at Chicago and Grand Avenue. The Grand Avenue bus stops right in front of the apartment heading East and West. If you'd rather cycle to your destination, there's a Divvy bike station 1/2 block away! You will find that Chicago is a very walkable city, and it's the best way to really absorb all that is around!
access: The entire massive, loft space -- Guest bedrooms, bathrooms, living room and kitchen, back porch area during warm months.
interaction: Prior to staying in my home, I will communicate with guests and respond quickly to questions that you may have through Airbnb messages and also via text. During your stay, I will do my best to respond in a timely fashion to any questions or concerns. I take the time to help each guest with helpful tips and suggestions to plan their route to their destination. I hope you throughly enjoy your stay and at the end, write a great review!!
house_rules: Before accepting, I'd like to get to know a bit about you and what you will be doing while staying in my Chicago loft. (this does not need to be a novel, just brief me) Once all parties have communicated and everything is good to go, I will accept! - Please behave like respectable humans while in my home and do your best to not damage the property or anything that is within the space. - No other guests should be on the property, besides those who have booked through Airbnb. Exceptions can be made if discussed prior to your arrival.  - Extra guests can be added to the booking at the rate listed. - Please do not bring food, alcohol or wine into the guest room. I keep it as clean as possible for guests and prefer that it remains free of crumbs and spills, which can attract unwanted critters! You are welcome to eat in the kitchen and use the dish and silver ware. - Do not eat or drink on the wood coffee table, use the kitchen counter. People have placed hot/wet beverages on the coffee tabl
host_about: Chicago native now living in NYC with my soul mate dog. I love travel, culture, architecture, interior design, visual stimuli, music and animals! I thrive on discussing good ideas and being surrounded by those that care about the world and all living things that inhabit it. I take coffee seriously and find it hard to go a day without good espresso! I recycle and do what I can to take care of the earth. I enjoy fine craft cocktails and food that nourishes the body. I welcome travelers from all over the globe to spend some time exploring all the great things that both Chicago and New York City have to offer!

name: Updated Logan Square 2BR near California Stop
summary: Top floor, beautiful light, recently rehabbed kitchen and plenty of common space for your group to spread out. There's room for 6 to sleep, and it's just off Milwaukee Ave in Logan Square- where all of the neighborhood's excitement is happening! Plus, it's right around the corner from the California Blue line station, so it's easy to get to from O'Hare, and a quick ride to the Loop. Book today!
space: My place has a dining table with seating for 6, a spacious living room with a bay window (and sofa bed!), large and newly renovated kitchen with bistro seating, and two bedrooms with Queen-sized beds, a full-sized bathroom, and an in-unit washer and dryer.
description: Top floor, beautiful light, recently rehabbed kitchen and plenty of common space for your group to spread out. There's room for 6 to sleep, and it's just off Milwaukee Ave in Logan Square- where all of the neighborhood's excitement is happening! Plus, it's right around the corner from the California Blue line station, so it's easy to get to from O'Hare, and a quick ride to the Loop. Book today! My place has a dining table with seating for 6, a spacious living room with a bay window (and sofa bed!), large and newly renovated kitchen with bistro seating, and two bedrooms with Queen-sized beds, a full-sized bathroom, and an in-unit washer and dryer. You'll have full access to my two-bedroom apartment. In Logan Square, the strong neighborly connection is evident all around, from active preservation groups to community gardens and a locally-run farmers market. "Local" being the key word when describing many aspects of the scene: ingredients are sourced locally at their buzz-worthy restauran
neighborhood_overview: In Logan Square, the strong neighborly connection is evident all around, from active preservation groups to community gardens and a locally-run farmers market. "Local" being the key word when describing many aspects of the scene: ingredients are sourced locally at their buzz-worthy restaurants; corner taps tout local, craft brews; galleries showcase local artists; and concerts and street fests promote local, upstart bands.
transit: My place is just steps from the California Blue line stop, Fullerton Ave and California Ave bus lines - it's probably easier to get around without a car here than having one! If you drive, however, there's street parking in the neighborhood.
access: You'll have full access to my two-bedroom apartment.
house_rules: - House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.   1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.  2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee.  3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.  6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per
host_about:
I come from the land of 10,000 lakes.  Avid traveler, foodie, music fan and love the authenticity Chicago has to offer.  

Visitors to Chicago shouldn't miss: Revolution Brewery, Parson's Chicken and Fish, a  visit to Lake Michigan and of course one of the many lives music venues.

name: Purple Room
summary: We are located by the I-290 and a 3 minute walk to the CTA. Enjoy your stay in our home. You will have a private room with a queen sized bed. Storage space in the dressers. 55 inch smart TV with Netflix in the shared Living Room.  Plenty of free street parking available with security monitored parking. The Registration number R (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) .
space: -Located on the 2nd floor. - There are approximately 15 steps to the top of the stairs.  Queen Sized Bed comfortably sleeps two. Can provide extra towels and blankets. -Hardwood flooring throughout house.  -Bathroom stocked with shampoo/conditioner, towels, toilet paper, and hair dryer.  -Kitchen has stove, microwave, fridge, and cooking utensils. All accessible to you at any time.  -Fully functional washer and dryer with detergent and fabric softener available. -Large back area for smoking. - All the guest share common areas; kitchen, bathroom, living room, dining room. Your room is your private space and each room has a key to lockup your things when you are not there.

neighborhood_overview: 10 minutes from Logan square 18 minute drive to Sears Tower 5 min walk to the Garfield Park Conservatory  Close to public transportation (82 bus, and green line)  8 minuets from United Center 24 minuets to Navy Pier 23 minutes to Oak Street Beach 25 minuets to The free Lincoln Park Zoo 19 minuets from Millennium Park/Grant park 24 minuets to Shed Aquarium, the field museum and the Adler planetarium.
transit: We recommend to use Uber/Lyft for easy access to the city.  The green line is also very close and will take you into downtown. 3 min walk to CTA and train!
access: The front door  has an automatic lock keypad. You will be provided with a code prior to arrival. Please lock doors when arriving and departing.  Security systems throughout the house for guest safety. Cameras inside and outside with and alarm system that sets after 11 pm. You must disarm if you come or leave after this time.
interaction: Usually we are never home but if you need help with anything our co-host lives across the street in a different Airbnb home . If We are not around you may text or call us any time with any questions or concerns.
house_rules: Each guest is required to clean up after using the kitchen. We don't have a maid on premise.
host_about: Great guy, big heart!

name: West Town Modern Private Bed & Bath Parking/CTA
summary: Our home is a new construction, modern, sunny 3 bedrooms 3 full bath, 2 stories duplex in Chicago’s West Town neighborhood right off Division St. Walking distance to Wicker Park, Humboldt Park, Bucktown, CTA transit, and restaurants.  Enjoy a private bedroom and private full bathroom in a friendly and welcoming environment ideal for young professionals visiting Chicago. We have all you need to feel at home, relax and unwind after a busy day in the Windy City.
space: Our place is a new construction, modern, sunny 3 bedrooms 3 full bath, 2 stories duplex in Chicago’s West Town neighborhood near the corner of N. Western Ave & W. Division St., Chicago, IL 60622.   Walk Score: 94 - Walker's Paradise;  Transit Score: 70 - Excellent Transit;  Bike Score: 88 - Very Bikeable.   The rental includes a furnished bedroom with Queen size bed, 800tc linens, dresser, nightstand, closet with shelves, hangers and storage, a private full bath, plush bath towels, bathroom paper supplies, cleaning and laundry supplies for your use, high speed Wi-Fi internet with whole home coverage, and an in bedroom 32” HDTV with cable TV, Apple TV with Netflix, HBO Go, Hulu.  You will have access to the open kitchen, and all its utensils and supplies for cooking and baking. The modern kitchen is fully equipped with a KitchenAid gas stove/convection oven, Ninja blender, KitchenAid electric mixer, cook and bake wear, toaster, Keurig coffee machine, and full set of pots and pans.  Acce

neighborhood_overview: Centrally located! Safe, clean, friendly neighborhood. Great restaurants in Humboldt Park and Wicker Park walking distance near by, and the city at your beck and call with a short public transit ride into "The Loop". Groceries, dry cleaners, gas stations, fast food, restaurants, and banks all less than a one mile radius.
notes: You should be cat friendly. Zeus is very social and will be your study buddy if you need one. The area is safe, mostly family's and working people, but this is a big city so of course, always be aware of your surroundings.  If you drive here, we also have free street parking!  Consider us for weekend getaways to lengthier stays! We have hosted 25 medical students for away rotations at hospitals/clinics in the immediate vicinity for the last 4 years, as well as other young professionals in Chicago for short and long term stays. We've had many previous guests who have referred and recommended their family and friends to stay with us. We love referrals!
transit: Commute easily downtown in ~20 min with CTA Bus 70 stop directly in front, ~8 minute bus ride to CTA’s Blue Line Division Station; direct access to train transfer stations 3 stops away (Clark and Lake). I commute in every morning for work and can help you navigate the transit system.
access: We are in secure building and you will have a set of keys for access. We invite you to enjoy the shared common spaces during your stay.  If you enjoy cooking, you will love our kitchen! Feel free to make some yummy meals, use our pots, pans, cook and bakeware, but please do be tidy and clean up after yourself. We are very inviting and easy going so if I missed something, please just ask.
interaction: We are at work or school full time. We are happy to give you a run down on the Chicago experience and are available for outings periodically. LGBT friendly.
house_rules: No shoes in the home. Please clean up after yourself.

name: OneEleven RIVER VIEW FURNISHED JR 1 BED POOL (12)
summary: OneEleven - Loop.  Enjoy stunning views of the Chicago River from your apartment before walking to work from this centrally located loop apartment.  In your free time enjoy Michigan Avenue for shopping, as well as museums, restaurants and nightlife at your doorstep. The train, taxis, and buses are all accessible on the same block for even more convenience.
space: Modern. Clean. All-Inclusive.  Enjoy stunning city and Chicago River views from floor to ceiling windows while having the luxury of premiere shopping, dining, and big city attractions at your doorstep. This spacious apartment includes a designer kitchen with quartz countertops, King Bed and Queen Pull-Out Sofa, white marble mosaic tile backsplash, stainless steel appliances, custom wood-plank flooring, polished natural stone vanities and tri-view medicine cabinets, custom closets with organizers, in-unit washer and dryer and controlled heating/air.
