neighborhood_overview: As Chicago's official downtown area, the Loop is one of the most important central business districts on the globe. In addition to its dynamic architecture and buzzing atmosphere, the area has an incredible concentration of cultural institutions, urban park spaces, award-winning restaurants and a shopper's paradise on State Street. Famous for its striking architecture, the Loop vaunts signature buildings by Ludwig Mies van der Rohe and Louis Henri Sullivan, as well as Aqua by modern day prodigy Jeanne Gang. The area hangout, Millennium Park, complements its surrounding with stunning architectural marvels of its own. The park's crown jewels include a Frank Gehry-designed amphitheater and Cloud Gate, the landmark "Bean" that's become an iconic symbol of Chicago. Nearby Maggie Daley Park and the Chicago Riverwalk are two new engaging outdoor spaces that embrace design — and fun! In addition to architectural marvels, Chicago's cultural attractions also have a prevailing presence in the dow

The Logan square farmers market on Sunday’s during the spring summer and fall·  It’s a filled with hip · artsy types. Amazing local businesses. notes: 1. To unlock the front door with the smart lock code put in the code and turn the deadbolt to unlock. Sometimes but rarely you’ll need to pull the door handle towards you and put in the code again if doesn’t open right away.  2. To lock the door just enter the code and turn the deadbolt to lock when exiting. Be sure to test the door to make sure it’s locked when exiting.

We will try our best to accommodate early check-in requests however I must add because of the cleaning schedule we may not be able to accommodate your request.
interaction: Feel free to message us for any issues or for recommendations for places to go in walking distance through Airbnb and my co-host and I will do our best to help.
house_rules: No shoes in the house please. No loud PARTIES or bashes. Dinner parties, bachelor, bachelorette outings, can be ok just please contact me to let me know the details before you book. :) Some of my neighbors have family’s with children so we like to be considerate of them. No extra guests. No smoking inside of the house or front area please. Please do not use the front entrance of the property to gather or socialize to be mindful of our neighbors. Use the back yard area and deck for those purposes. Please clean up trash. No eating in the bedrooms. Turn Lights off in unused spaces to help conserve energy. No extra guests. Quiet hours Sunday thru Thursday 11 PM to 9:00 AM. Weekends 12:30 AM to 9:00 AM. Please wash the dishes you use, put trash in the trash and recycle cans or extra cleaning fees will be applied. Please remove linens from the beds that were used and leave on the floor. Please try to leave the place the way you received it. Check-in 3 PM, Check-out 11 AM Thank you.
host_about: Hello, my girlfriend and co-host Shauna and I are lifelong Chicagoans and want to share our wonderful home with our Airbnb community.

summary: This apartment is most comfortable for students . If you're looking for a home base for a stay in Chicago it will be great for you. It's not in a walkable or touristy neighborhood, but it's very close to downtown and there is a bus right outside my door that runs right into the west loop and downtown. There is a large grocery store on my intersection so your necessities can be taken care of easily.  Close to hospitals for medical students and rotations.
space: This is a 3 bedroom and 2 bathroom apartment. All rooms are subject to Airbnb. 2 bedrooms are standard Chicago size with closets, and they share a  bathroom that is located near the kitchen. The middle room is a master bedroom, and it has its own bathroom inside.  All guests are welcome to use the kitchen and living room mindfully. Be mindful of your own cleaningness in the common areas as this is something I am unable to control on an hourly basis or daily basis. You will have to do your own dishes as the condo does not have a dishwasher.

neighborhood_overview: The Near West Side , one of the 77 community areas of Chicago, is on the West Side, west of the Chicago River and adjacent to the Loop and West Loop. The history of the Near West Side of Chicago includes the founding of Hull House, a prominent settlement house. The Great Chicago Fire started in the Near West Side. The area is home to the University of Illinois at Chicago (UIC), the United Center and the Illinois Medical (URL HIDDEN) not a very walkable neighborhood, but bigger streets such as Madison and Western are more interesting to walk through.
notes: Please keep it clean in the common areas.  Personal belongings should be kept in your room and not left on common sofas, dining tables etc.
transit: My listings are very close to public transportation. The bus stop is right on the intersection and my house is 5th from a major intersection with 2 buses.  The way chicago works is that each bus goes in a straight line. Madison bus goes to downtown, loop, Sears (Willis) tower and Millennium Park, and Western bus goes to different neighborhoods such as Bucktown and Wicker Park.  Blue line is about 8 minute walk, and also goes to downtown, loop and the airport.  Also if you get Uber and use UberPool, its only about $2.50-3$ to get around which is not that much different from public transportation prices ($2-$2.25).
access: You are able to use the kitchen and living room. Laundry room  is located through the back door and stairs on the first floor near the garage.
interaction: I am available to help most of the time and I tend to respond quickly if I am not in a mid flight.
house_rules: - Please do not wear shoes in the house. - Please do your own dishes. - Please lock the doors after getting in the house, and leaving the house. Locking only the bottom lock is fine.  - Please volunteer to take the trash out if its too full in the kitchen.  - Only booked guests are allowed on the property unless you’ve agreed with me otherwise. - Please keep your belongings in your room and not spread around  in the common areas. - Please if you are a smoker, find a container/jar for your cigarette butts and keep it outside where you routinely go smoke(front of the building or the back of the building). Please do not attempt to smoke from your bedroom window.  - Please respect another guests privacy.. (don't go knocking on their door) *Thanks for reading!
host_about:
I love to travel, so I am home very little. Hopefully it stays this way:)
I am originally from Lithuania, but moved to the states in 1998. I usually keep to myself and mind my own business in the apartment. 

Thanks for reading:)

summary: 850 sq ft Apartment in Northwest Chicago close to O'Hare. 30 min from downtown, or 1 hour by public transportation. We provide FREE per stay: Make yourself organic coffee w/organic cream, organic eggs, non-GMO bread and organic steel cut oats.
space: This is a private apartment in the basement of my single family home. You'll have your own private entrance. Once you enter thru the side door, there is a common hallway and then a private door down to the basement apartment. It has 2 bedrooms, a Living Room, a full kitchen and a full bathroom. We call this a, "Do It Yourself" Bed and Breakfast. We are huge fans of the slow food movement and want to help you eat Organic, Non-GMO and as home cooked as possible. This will save you money and help you feel better during travel. Per stay we provide free organic eggs, organic or non-GMO bread for toast, as well as organic coffee and organic cream. And organic steel-cut gluten free oats.   We have a queen mattress in one bedroom, and two extra long twin mattresses in the other. A futon is in the Living Room (which can be treated as a BR since we put on a privacy door knob). We provide in Bathroom: clean towels, soap, shampoo, blow dryer. neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is close to O' Hare Airport. It's one of the safest neighborhoods in Chicago and is home to many Police Officers and Fireman and other city workers like Chicago Public School teachers and Chicago Park District managers. We are extremly close to a beautiful 5 acre park. Walking distance to a couple coffe shops, a well established Italian deli and a library.
notes: My wife and I with our 3 kids live upstairs. We have 2 floors not including your apartment and try our best so as not to disturb you. We have no pets, and do not allow pets to stay here. (Sorry we love animals, but allergies and asthma are a real struggle in our family).
transit: We are very close to the CTA Addison bus (and Belmont bus) line that will take you to Wrigley Field for $2.50. The same bus will connect you to the Blue Line el Train which runs 24/7 from O'Hare to Downtown. We can help recommend the cheapest and most efficient way of travel.
access: Guests enter through the side door of my single family home. Once entered there is a small shared hallway. The door to the basement apartment is to your left, and stairs appear as soon as you open the door. You will have 24/7 access to the private apartment that locks.
interaction: We are extremely friendly and helpful, but desire to give ample space for comfort. So if you initiate, we'll respond warmly.
house_rules: I need to know of every person who will stay the night, and also a heads up on guests visiting. This is for security and safety of our family and yours. -No Smoking in apartment -Please Recycle -Guest are allowed, but no parties -As long  as we are not charging you a cleaning fee, we ask the apartment is left in condition as close as possible to how it was when you arrived.

notes: I live in one of the bedrooms, but I'm typically out of the apartment on weekdays from 8am to about 7pm due to work. This listing is for the second bedroom in the apartment. The third bedroom may or may not be booked with another Airbnb guest at the time of your stay.
transit: There's a bus stop a block away from the apartment. There's a divvy station (bike sharing service) in the park in front the apartment. The blue line to the loop or the airport is a 10-15 min walk away. There's also a metro train station within a 10 minute walk of the apartment.
access: Guest will have access to all parts of the apartment (kitchen, bathroom, living room, and backyard), besides the other two bedrooms.

name: Prairie Smoke - Studio in Uptown by Short Stay
summary: Welcome to PRARIE SMOKE in the historic Uptown neighborhood, where jazz is king! With an eclectic feel and radiant vibe, Uptown is filled with music, nightlife and truly unique multi-cultural cuisine! Less than two blocks to the lake, this home is a stunner in every season! This comfy studio is perfect for business or pleasure. Whether you're looking for a night in with your sweetheart, or a night out with your friends, Uptown has endless romance, culture, and entertainment.
space: The Space Sleeping Arrangements  This studio apartment features one queen bed & a convertible sleeper sofa (queen).  Kitchen   The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pants, utensils, silverware, plates, bowls, cups, knives, a cutting board, salt and pepper, a coffee maker, and cream and sugar – for however you take it.     Cleaning Supplies   You’re supplied with dish soap, a sponge, dish detergent and paper towels. Washer/Dryer  There is a washer/dryer in unit. We provide you with detergent for your stay! TV The Roku guide is posted next to the TV. There is also a digital antenna for local channels. Please remember to sign out of any of any Roku apps you’ve utilize duringyour stay.  Non-Smoking  The home and entire building is designated as a smoke-free community. There will be a $500 fee imposed if you choose to smoke in unit or the building. Please respect our policy and step outside. Parking There is no dedicated parking space for the home. We recommend using apps like SpotHero t

Cleaning Supplies   You’re supplied with dish soap, a sponge, dish detergent and paper towels. Washer/Dryer  There is a washer/dryer in unit. We provide you with detergent for your stay! TV The
neighborhood_overview: For live music and nightlife, sit back for some jazz at the Green Mill, a 100-year-old classic where the swanky atmosphere harkens back to prohibition's heyday. Or for a lively mix, go for either indie rock, salsa concerts, world-class boxing or colorful wrestling matches at the Riviera or Aragon. More information Historical landmarks districts in Uptown Square are just some of the architectural highlights. Immerse yourself in the present while experiencing history, just have a sample of the ethnic cuisines that have found a home in the neighborhood. On Argyle Street and the surrounding blocks, you can take a tour of Asia with destination restaurants serving up Beijing duck, sushi, traditional Chinese dim sum and Vietnamese specialties like banh mi and pho. Adding to the variety are ethnic grocers mixed among Ethiopian, Lebanese, Indian cuisine and SO much more.
notes: Check In / Check Out Check in starts at 4 PM CT Check out time is 11 AM CT We do not offer early Check In or late Check Out.   Luggage Hold  If your travel arrangements have you arriving earlier or leaving later than our designated check in / check out times, we recommend using Wait Here Chicago. We have a partnership with them and can offer you discounted rates on their luggage hold options throughout the city. Pets There is a $25/pet per booking fee.  We know that all dogs are good dogs but the building's breed restrictions are listed below. There are no weight restrictions, but if your buddy falls under one of these categories unfortunately we wouldn't be able to host them. Pit Bull, American Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier, Shaffordshire Bull Terrier, Rottweiler, Doberman Pinscher, Chow Chow, Akita, Presa Canario and /or Wolf Hybrids. While we trust that your pet plays well with others, we know that accidents happen. In the event of an issue involving your pet, you
transit: Whether you got a set a wheels, using public transportation or you're just old fashioned walking, the neighborhood works for any transportation needs. There is easily accessible "Pay to Park" street parking. Additionally, there is loads of public transportation! Just a few blocks from the red line for getting in and out of the loop/downtown. There are also buses on every street corner. The neighborhood is all completely walkable for anything you can possibly need on the fly.
access: The entire home is yours to enjoy for the duration of your stay.
interaction: We are off-site but available when needed. The best way to reach us is by emailing (Email hidden by Airbnb)  In case of maintenance emergency, the in-unit home guide will detail phone numbers of who to call immediately.
house_rules: General Rules -Please treat the home as if it is your own. -Please respect our guest limit capacity of 4 people. -Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property. -If you accidentally damage anything during your stay, please contact the host for your safety and the future safety of the next guest. -We pride ourselves on being green and would appreciate you turning off the TV and lights when you check-out. -Please remember to sign out of any ROKU apps you utilized via your personal accounts before departing. Quiet Hours Quiet hours are between 10p-8a. This is a residential building and ask that for the respect of permanent tenants basic courtesies of being mindful of your noise levels and not congregating in hallways outside of the unit be observed. Receiving a noise complaint from the building or the device can result in the forfeiture of your stay and a $1000 fine. No Smoking The home (and entire building) is designated as a strictly smoke-free community. There will be a
host_about: Hello! Thanks for checking out our homes in beautiful Chicago! Livly Short Stay has a few hosts that will be communicating with you and we can’t wait to get to know you and welcome you to the city. Hosting as a team makes communicating with us even faster and we're looking forward to taking care of curating a perfect stay for you. Talk to you soon!

neighborhood_overview: Tree-lined Lincoln Park offers diverse nightlife, dining and entertainment. North Lincoln Avenue features cocktail lounges, dive bars and concert venues such as Lincoln Hall. The revered Steppenwolf Theatre Company is on Halstead Street. Comedy clubs Up and Second City sit on the border with Old Town. Within the shoreline park are North Avenue Beach, the Chicago History Museum and the free-admission Lincoln Park Zoo.
notes: We meet our guests.
transit: Closest public transportation is the Brown Line 'L' train, specifically the Armitage Stop. Second closest are the Red, Brown and Purple Lines in the Fullerton Stop 3 blocks North of the property's location. These trains take you throughout the city and also to Albany Square, and Evanston. Check maps on the train stations for specific maps and connections. Bicycle rentals are available throughout the city. Ubers and Lyfts are also available to take all throughout the city, including to and from both O'hare and Midway airports.

space: This is an apartment in our building we keep available for family and friends to stay when they are in Chicago.  When we don't have family or friends staying, we offer this on Airbnb. Sleek and Modern this newly remodeled Garden Unit has: Heated Floors made of stained polished concrete. Marble Counters Undercounter Fridge/Freezer Drawer Dishwasher Washer and Dryer Marble Baths Open Floor Plan and Plenty of room to relax Coffee Maker Hair Dryers in both bathrooms It's a modern open plan, both bedrooms have their own bathroom so it is perfect for two couples who want some privacy.  Portable Crib available on request Wrigley field is 1.7 miles away. When we go to a game we just walk but you can also take the bus or train.
description: Our Sleek, Modern and Bright Garden Apartment is available for your stay in Chicago.  This gorgeous 2 Bedroom apartment has 2 en suite bathrooms.  Heated Floors, Modern Kitchen, Gas Fireplace with exposed Brick.  4 Blocks to the El or the Metra. neighborhood_overview: Lincoln Square is the friendliest neighborhood in Chicago.  Known for its German festivals, Restaurants, Coffee Shops  and family friendly vibe it is close to everything and an easy El (elevated subway) or Metra train to downtown. There are 4 coffee shops within a few blocks and dozens of amazing restaurants and bars. If you walk west 3 blocks you get to Lincoln Ave with tons of great bars restaurants and a large park.
notes: Minimum 3 Night Stay $75 Cleaning Fee
transit: El (elevated subway, brown line) 3 blocks, this takes you to all of downtown in about 20 minutes. Metra Train 6 Blocks, this takes you downtown or to the Ravinia Festival Damen Bus 1/2 a block Montrose Bus 1/2 a block Divvy Bikes 1/2 a Block From ohare airport You can take the blue line to downtown then transfer to the brown line north and get off at Montrose and walk 3 blocks Or Take the blue line to Montrose and take the bus to Damen Or Taxis is about $35 From midway airport You can take the orange line and transfer to the brown line downtown and get off at Montrose and walk 3 blocks Or  Taxi is about $35
access: Entrance off Damen ave through the front gate Large front yard Entrance directly into apartment on lower level
interaction: Private Entrance We will provide a code for the digital lock a few days before you arrive.  We live upstairs if you need us.
house_rules: No Smoking No Parties
host_about: We are Mark and Collette Witteveen.  We love to renovate old buildings and travel around the world.  Our favorite place to stay is on a sailboat for an extended sailing vacation.
